translated: Or the phrase “gone to the end of the world” should be construed with the phrase “to be developed” , for it is by the power of development that the world’s end is reached, since the world is ended for one who has reached the world’s end.

original: samugghātako hotīti. Sacchikātabbabhāvena anuttarabhāvo yojetabbo. Sacchikiriyānibbattito
analyzed: samugghātakaḥ hoti iti sacchikātabba bhāvena anuttara bhāvaḥ yojetabbaḥ sacchikiriyā nibbattitaḥ
translated: “He is the one who uproots” : the unsurpassedness should be construed as the state of being to be realized. For it is unsurpassed because it is not to be surpassed by any other, since it is the source of realization.

original: hi tatuttarikaraṇīyābhāvato anaññasādhāraṇatāya anuttaroti. Tathā “bhāvetvā”ti etena
analyzed: hi tat uttari karaṇīya abhāvataḥ anañña sādhāraṇa tāya tathā bhāvetvā iti etena
translated: And by “having developed”

original: saha pubbabhāgasīlādīhi sekkhā sīlasamādhipaññākkhandhā dassitā honti. “Sacchikatvā”ti
analyzed: saha pubbabhāga sīla ādīhi sekkhā sīla samādhi paññā kkhandhāḥ dassitāḥ honti sacchikatvā ati
translated: the aggregates of virtue, concentration, and understanding of the disciples together with the prior stage are shown. By “having realized”

original: etena saha asaṅkhatāya dhātuyā asekkhā sīlasamādhipaññākkhandhā dassitā hontīti.
analyzed: etena saha asaṅkhatāya dhātuyā asekkhā sīla samādhi paññā kkhandhāḥ dassitāḥ honti iti
translated: the aggregates of virtue, concentration, and understanding of the adepts together with the unformed element are shown.

original: 3. Evaṃ saṅkhepeneva sabbadhammaguṇehi saddhammaṃ abhitthavitvā idāni ariyasaṅghaṃ🔽thometuṃ “sugatassā”tiādimāha. Tattha sugatassāti sambandhaniddeso. Tassa “puttāna”nti
analyzed: evam saṅkhepena iva sabba dhamma guṇehi saddhammam abhitthavitvā idāni ariya saṅgham  thometum sugatassa atiādim āha tattha sugatassa ati sambandha niddesaḥ tassa puttānam ti
translated: Having thus extolled the True Idea in brief by all its special qualities, he now said “Sugata’s”🔽in order to extol the Noble Community. Herein, “Sugata’s” is a description of the relation. The relation of that to “sons”

original: etena sambandho. Orasānanti puttavisesanaṃ. Mārasenamathanānanti orasaputtabhāve
analyzed: etena sambandhaḥ orasānam ti putta visesanam orasa putta bhāve
translated: is shown by “sons”. “Offspring” is a specification of sons. “Who crush Mara’s army” is a description of the reason for their being sons and offspring.

original: kāraṇaniddeso. Tena kilesapahānameva bhagavato orasaputtabhāve kāraṇaṃ anujānātīti
analyzed: kāraṇa niddeso tena kilesa pahānam eva bhagavataḥ orasa putta bhāve kāraṇam anujānāti iti
translated: So he allows that the Blessed One’s sonship and offspring are due only to the abandoning of defilements.

original: dasseti. Aṭṭhannanti gaṇanaparicchedaniddeso. Tena ca satipi tesaṃ sattavisesabhāvena
analyzed: dasseti tena ca sati pi tesam satta visesa bhāvena
translated: He shows that they are eight in number.🔽The word “number” is a term for a delimitation by counting. And by that he shows that, although they have the nature of seven different kinds of persons,

original: anekasahassasaṅkhābhāve imaṃ gaṇanaparicchedaṃ nātivattantīti dasseti maggaṭṭhaphalaṭṭhabhāvānativattanato.
analyzed: aneka sahassa saṅkhā bhāve imam gaṇana paricchedam na ativattanti iti dasseti magga ṭṭha phala ṭṭha bhāva an ativattanataḥ
translated: they do not exceed the number eight, because they do not exceed the path and fruition.

original: Samūhanti samudāyaniddeso. Ariyasaṅghanti guṇavisiṭṭhasaṅghātabhāvaniddeso. Tena
analyzed: samūhanti samudāya niddeso ariya saṅghanti guṇa visiṭṭha saṅghāta bhāva niddeso tena
translated: The word “group” is a term for a collection. The word “noble” is a term for the state of being a collection of those distinguished by special qualities.

original: asatipi ariyapuggalānaṃ kāyasāmaggiyaṃ ariyasaṅghabhāvaṃ dasseti diṭṭhisīlasāmaññena saṃhatabhāvato.
analyzed: asati api ariya puggalānam kāya sāmaggiyam ariya saṅgha bhāvam dasseti diṭṭhi sīla sāmaññena saṃhata bhāvato
translated: By that he shows that there is a state of being a noble group even though there is no physical resemblance among the noble persons, because they are united by the resemblance of their view and virtue.

original: Tattha urasi bhavā jātā saṃbaddhā ca orasā. Yathā hi sattānaṃ orasaputtā attajātatāya🔽pitu santakassa dāyajjassa visesena bhāgino honti, evametepi ariyapuggalā sammāsambuddhassa
analyzed: tattha urasi bhavā jātā saṃbaddhā ca orasā yathā hi sattānam orasa puttāḥ atta jāta tāya  pitu santakassa dāyajjassa visesena bhāginaḥ honti evam ete pi ariya puggalā sammāsambuddhassa
translated: Herein, they are “of the breast” because they are born and bound up with the breast. For just as “breast-born sons” are born from the breast, that is, from the womb,🔽and are heirs by right of primogeniture to the estate belonging to their father, so too these noble persons are born in the Dispensation of the Supremely Enlightened

original: dhammassavanante ariyāya jātiyā jātatāya bhagavato santakassa vimuttisukhassa ariyadhammaratanassa
analyzed: ariyāya jātiyā jāta tāya bhagavato santakassa vimutti sukhassa ariya dhamma ratanassa
translated: and are heirs to the bliss of the deathless, to the noble jewel of the True Idea, which belongs to the Blessed One, because they are born in the noble generation by hearing the True Idea.

original: ca ekantabhāginoti orasā viya orasā. Atha vā bhagavato dhammadesanānubhāveneva ariyabhūmiṃ🔽okkamamānā okkantā ca ariyasāvakā bhagavato urena vāyāmajanitābhijātitāya nippariyāyena🔽orasā puttāti vattabbataṃ arahanti. Sāvakehi pavattiyamānāpi hi dhammadesanā “bhagavato🔽dhammadesanā”icceva vuccati tammūlikattā lakkhaṇādivisesābhāvato ca.🔽Yadipi ariyasāvakānaṃ ariyamaggādhigamasamaye bhagavato viya tadantarāyakaraṇatthaṃ
analyzed: ca ekanta bhāgino ti orasā viya orasā atha vā bhagavataḥ dhamma desanā anubhāvena iva ariya bhūmim  okkamamānāḥ okkantā ca ariya sāvakāḥ bhagavataḥ urena vāyāma janita abhijāti tāya nippariyāyena  orasā puttā ati vattabbatam arahanti sāvakehi pavattiyamānā api hi dhamma desanā bhagavato  vuccati tad mūlika ttā lakkhaṇa ādi visesa abhāvato ca  yadi pi ariya sāvakānam ariya magga adhigama samaye bhagavataḥ viya tat antarāya karaṇa ttham
translated: and they are the Lord’s heirs in the ultimate sense, in the absolute sense, as it were, in the sense of the ultimate , thus they are ‘ heirs in the ultimate sense ’.

original: devaputtamāro, māravāhinī vā na ekantena apasādeti, tehi pana apasādetabbatāya kāraṇe🔽vimathite tepi vimathitā eva nāma hontīti āha “mārasenamathanāna”nti. Imasmiṃ panatthe🔽“māramārasenamathanāna”nti vattabbe mārasenamathanānanti ekadesasarūpekaseso katoti
analyzed: deva putta māraḥ māra vāhinī vā na ekantena apasādeti tehi pana apasādetabba tāya kāraṇe 🔽vimathite te api vimathitāḥ eva nāma honti iti āha imasmin 🔽māra māra sena mathanānam ti vattabbe māra sena mathanānam ti ekadesa sarūpa ikaseso kato ti

original: daṭṭhabbaṃ. Atha vā khandhābhisaṅkhāramārānaṃ viya devaputtamārassapi guṇamāraṇe
analyzed: daṭṭhabbam atha vā khandha abhisaṅkhāra mārānam viya devaputta mārassa api guṇa māraṇe
translated: Or else, just as the defilements are called “enemies” because they kill off the special qualities of the supramundane path,🔽

original: sahāyabhāvūpagamanato kilesabalakāyo “senā”ti vuccati. Yathāha “kāmā te paṭhamā senā”tiādi.
analyzed: sahāya bhāva upagamanato kilesa balakāyo senā ati vuccati yathā āha kāmā te paṭhamā senā atiādi
translated: Or else, just as the defilements are called “the army” because they go along with the khandhas as their allies in the destruction of the khandhas, so too the defilements are called “the army” because they go along with the devaputtamāra as his allies in the destruction of his special qualities.

original: Sā ca tehi diyaḍḍhasahassabhedā, anantabhedā vā kilesavāhinī satidhammavicayavīriyasamathādiguṇapaharaṇehi🔽odhiso vimathitā vihatā viddhastā cāti mārasenamathanā, ariyasāvakā. Etena tesaṃ
analyzed: sā ca tehi diyaḍḍha sahassa bhedā ananta bhedā vā kilesa vāhinī sati dhamma vicaya vīriya samatha ādi guṇa apaharaṇehi  vimathitāḥ vihatāḥ ca ati māra sena mathanāḥ ariya sāvakāḥ etena tesaṃ
translated: And that army of defilements, which has a division of two thousand five hundred or an infinite number of divisions, is “crushed,” “broken,” “smashed,” and “destroyed” by the special qualities of mindfulness, investigation of states, energy, concentration, etc., which carry off the defilements and their army.

original: bhagavato anujātaputtataṃ dasseti.
analyzed: bhagavataḥ anujāta putta tam dasseti
translated: The noble disciples are called “crushers of Mara’s army” because they crush that army of defilements. By this he shows that they are the sons of the Blessed One.

original: Ārakattā kilesehi, anaye na iriyanato, aye ca iriyanato ariyā niruttinayena. Atha
analyzed: ārakattā kilesehi anaye na iriyanataḥ aye ca iriyanataḥ ariyā nirutti nayena atha
translated: They are noble because they are far from defilements, because they do not stand in the unbeneficial, and because they stand in the beneficial.

original: vā sadevakena lokena saraṇanti araṇīyato upagantabbato, upagatānañca tadatthasiddhito
analyzed: vā sa devakena lokena araṇīyataḥ upagantabbataḥ upagatānam ca tad attha siddhitaḥ
translated: Or else, they are noble because they are sought by the world with its gods, because they are worthy of being sought, and because they have accomplished their own welfare.

original: ariyā. Ariyānaṃ saṅghoti ariyasaṅgho. Ariyo ca so saṅgho cāti vā ariyasaṅgho. Bhagavato
analyzed: ariyāḥ saṅghaḥ iti ariya saṅghaḥ ariyaḥ ca saḥ saṅghaḥ ca ati vā ariya saṅghaḥ bhagavato
translated: The noble ones’ community is the community of the noble ones. Or else, it is noble and a community, thus it is the noble ones’ community.

original: aparabhāge buddhadhammaratanānampi samadhigamo saṅgharatanādhīnoti assa ariyasaṅghassa
analyzed: aparabhāge buddha dhamma ratanānam pi samadhigamaḥ saṅgha ratana adhīnaḥ ti assa ariya saṅghassa
translated: And later on, the discovery of the Buddha and the Dhamma is also dependent on the discovery of the Saṅgha.

original: bahūpakārataṃ dassetuṃ idheva “sirasā vande”ti vuttanti daṭṭhabbaṃ.
analyzed: bahu upakāra tam dassetum idha iva sirasā vandeti vuttam ti daṭṭhabbam
translated: So the words “I pay homage with my head” are said here in order to show the great service rendered by the ariyan Saṅgha.

original: Ettha ca “sugatassa orasānaṃ puttāna”nti etena ariyasaṅghassa pabhavasampadaṃ dasseti,
analyzed: ettha ca sugatassa orasānam puttānam ti etena ariya saṅghassa pabhava sampadam dasseti
translated: And here, by the words “sons of the Sugata’s breast,” he shows the Saṅgha’s excellence of origin,

original: “mārasenamathanāna”nti etena pahānasampadaṃ sakalasaṃkilesapahānadīpanato, “aṭṭhannampi
analyzed: etena pahāna sampadam sakala saṃkilesa pahāna dīpanataḥ
translated: by the words “conquerors of Mara’s army” he shows the excellence of abandonment, since this shows the abandonment of all defilements,🔽and by the words “the eight assemblies” he shows the excellence of knowledge, since this shows the state of being established in the path and fruit.

original: samūha”nti etena ñāṇasampadaṃ maggaṭṭhaphalaṭṭhabhāvadīpanato. “Ariyasaṅgha”nti etena
analyzed: samūhanti etena ñāṇa sampadam magga ṭṭha phala ṭṭha bhāva dīpanataḥ ariya saṅghanti etena
translated: By the words “the ariyan Saṅgha” he shows the excellence of origin,

original: pabhavasampadaṃ dasseti sabbasaṅghānaṃ aggabhāvadīpanato. Atha vā sugatassa orasānaṃ
analyzed: pabhava sampadam dasseti sabba saṅghānam agga bhāva dīpanato atha vā sugatassa orasānam
translated: since this shows the Saṅgha’s pre-eminence over all other Saṅghas. Or alternatively, by the words “sons of the Sugata’s breast” he shows the Saṅgha’s state of being a pure resort,

original: puttānanti ariyasaṅghassa visuddhanissayabhāvadīpanaṃ. Mārasenamathanānanti sammāujuñāyasāmīcippaṭipannabhāvadīpanaṃ.
analyzed: puttānan ti ariya saṅghassa visuddha nissaya bhāva dīpanam māra sena mathanānan ti
translated: by the words “conquerors of Mara’s army” he shows the state of being established in right knowledge and in the practice of conformity.

original: Aṭṭhannampi samūhanti āhuneyyādibhāvadīpanaṃ. Ariyasaṅghanti anuttarapuññakhettabhāvadīpanaṃ.
analyzed: samūhanti āhuneyya ādi bhāva dīpanam anuttara puñña khetta bhāva dīpanam
translated: and “noble Saṅgha” shows the state of being an unsurpassed field of merit.

original: Tathā “sugatassa orasānaṃ puttāna”nti etena ariyasaṅghassa lokuttarasaraṇagamanasabhāvaṃ
analyzed: tathā sugatassa orasānam puttānam ti etena ariya saṅghassa lokuttara saraṇa gamana sabhāvam
translated: So too, by “sons of the Sugata’s own mouth” he shows the state of being the noble Saṅgha’s supramundane refuge-going,

original: dīpeti. Lokuttarasaraṇagamanena hi te bhagavato orasaputtā jātā. “Mārasenamathanāna”nti🔽etena abhinīhārasampadāya siddhaṃ pubbabhāge sammāpaṭipattiṃ dasseti. Katābhinīhārā
analyzed: dīpeti lokuttara saraṇa gamanena hi te bhagavataḥ orasa puttāḥ jātāḥ  etena abhinīhāra sampadāya siddham pubba bhāge sammā paṭipattim dasseti kata abhinīhārā
translated: for by supramundane refuge-going they have become the Exalted One’s sons born of his breast. By “conquerors of the army of Mara”

original: hi sammāpaṭipannā māraṃ māraparisaṃ vā abhivijinanti. “Aṭṭhannampi samūha”nti etena🔽paṭividdhastavipakkhe sekkhāsekkhadhamme dasseti puggalādhiṭṭhānena maggaphaladhammānaṃ
analyzed: hi sammā paṭipannāḥ māram māra parisam vā abhivijinanti aṭṭhannam pi samūhanti etena  sekkha asekkha dhamme dasseti puggala adhiṭṭhānena magga phala dhammānam
translated: he shows the right practice in the prior period that is successful through the perfection of aspiration. For those who have made the aspiration and are practising rightly conquer Mara or Mara’s army. By “of the eight assemblies”

original: pakāsitattā. “Ariyasaṅgha”nti aggadakkhiṇeyyabhāvaṃ dasseti. Saraṇagamanañca sāvakānaṃ
analyzed: pakāsita ttā ariya saṅghanti agga dakkhiṇeyya bhāvam dasseti saraṇa gamanañca sāvakānam
translated: he shows the states of the learner and the adept that are the opposites of what has been penetrated. By “noble Saṅgha” he shows the state of being the foremost recipient of gifts, since he has revealed the states of the path and the fruits by taking the persons as the basis.

original: sabbaguṇānaṃ ādi, sapubbabhāgapaṭipadā sekkhā sīlakkhandhādayo majjhe, asekkhā sīlakkhandhādayo🔽pariyosānanti ādimajjhapariyosānakalyāṇā saṅkhepato sabbe ariyasaṅghaguṇā pakāsitā honti.
analyzed: sabba guṇānaṃ ādi sa pubbabhāga paṭipadā sekkhā sīla kkhandha ādayaḥ majjhe asekkhā sīla kkhandha ādayaḥ  pariyosānanti ādi majjha pariyosāna kalyāṇā saṅkhepato sabbe ariya saṅgha guṇā pakāsitāḥ honti
translated: and the beginning of all good qualities. The first stage of the training, the aggregates of virtue, etc., of the disciples, is the middle. The aggregates of virtue, etc., of the Arahants are the end.🔽Thus the good qualities of the whole Noble Community are shown in brief as being good in the beginning, middle, and end.

original: 4. Evaṃ gāthāttayena saṅkhepato sakalaguṇasaṃkittanamukhena ratanattayassa paṇāmaṃ
analyzed: evam saṅkhepataḥ sakala guṇa saṃkittana mukhena ratanattayassa
translated: Having thus paid homage to the Triple Gem by way of a brief description of all its good qualities in three stanzas,

original: katvā idāni taṃ nipaccakāraṃ yathādhippete payojane pariṇāmento “iti me”tiādimāha.
analyzed: katvā idāni tam nipaccakāram yathā adhippete payojane iti mā iti ādim āha
translated: he now dedicates that act of homage to the fulfilment of the purpose he has in mind, saying “Iti me,” etc.

original: Tattha ratijananaṭṭhena ratanaṃ, buddhadhammasaṅghā. Tesañhi “itipi so bhagavā”tiādinā
analyzed: tattha rati janana ṭṭhena ratanam buddha dhamma saṅghā tesam hi iti pi saḥ bhagavā iti ādinā
translated: Herein, a gem is that which generates delight . The Buddha, Dhamma, and Sangha are gems, for when one adverts to their real good qualities in the way beginning “In that the Exalted One is thus . . . ”

original: yathābhūtaguṇe āvajjentassa amatādhigamahetubhūtaṃ anappakaṃ pītipāmojjaṃ uppajjati. Yathāha –
analyzed: yathā bhūta guṇe āvajjentassa amata adhigama hetu bhūtam anappakam pīti pāmojjam uppajjati yathā āha
translated: in the recollection of the Triple Gem, immeasurable rapture and gladness arise in him as the cause for attaining the deathless. As it is said:

original: “Yasmiṃ, mahānāma, samaye ariyasāvako tathāgataṃ anussarati, nevassa tasmiṃ samaye
analyzed: yasmin mahānāma samaye ariya sāvakaḥ tathāgatam anussarati na iva assa tasmin samaye
translated: “On that occasion, Mahānāma, when a noble disciple recollects the Tathāgata,

original: rāgapariyuṭṭhitaṃ cittaṃ hoti, na dosapariyuṭṭhitaṃ cittaṃ hoti, na mohapariyuṭṭhitaṃ
analyzed: rāga pariyuṭṭhitam cittam hoti na dosa pariyuṭṭhitam cittam hoti na moha pariyuṭṭhitam
translated: His cognizance is not obsessed by greed, is not obsessed by hate, is not obsessed by delusion,

original: cittaṃ hoti, ujugatamevassa tasmiṃ samaye cittaṃ hoti tathāgataṃ ārabbha. Ujugatacitto🔽kho pana, mahānāma, ariyasāvako labhati atthavedaṃ, labhati dhammavedaṃ, labhati
analyzed: cittam hoti uju gatam eva assa tasmin samaye cittam hoti tathāgatam ārabbha uju gata cittaḥ  kho pana mahānāma ariya sāvakaḥ labhati attha vedam labhati dhamma vedam labhati
translated: his cognizance is straight on that occasion with respect to the Enlightened One. And a noble disciple who has straight cognizance

original: dhammūpasaṃhitaṃ pāmojjaṃ, pamuditassa pīti jāyatī”tiādi.
analyzed: dhamma upasaṃhitam pāmojjam pamuditassa pi iti jāyati itiādi
translated: obtains consolation, obtains gladness, obtains rapture, obtains happiness. ”🔽Or alternatively, the meaning of a treasure can be taken as the state of being a treasure in the sense of being stored in the heart,

original: Cittīkatādibhāvo vā ratanaṭṭho. Vuttañhetaṃ –
analyzed: cittīkata ādi bhāvaḥ vā rata naṭṭhaḥ vuttam ha etam
translated: for this is said:

original: “Cittīkataṃ mahagghañca, atulaṃ dullabhadassanaṃ;
analyzed: cittīkatam mahaggham ca atulam dullabha dassanam
translated: “What is stored in the heart, is costly, Is matchless, hard to see,

original: Anomasattaparibhogaṃ, ratanaṃ tena vuccatī”ti. –
analyzed: a noma satta paribhogam ratanam tena vuccati iti
translated: And is used by the peerless man: For that reason it is called a treasure. ”

original: Cittīkatabhāvādayo ca anaññasādhāraṇā buddhādīsu eva labbhantīti.
analyzed: cittīkata bhāva ādayo ca anañña sādhāraṇāḥ buddha ādīsu eva labbhanti iti
translated: And the states of being stored in the heart, etc., are found only in the Enlightened One, etc., and not in anyone else.

original: Vandanāva vandanāmayaṃ yathā “dānamayaṃ sīlamaya”nti. Vandanā cettha kāyavācācittehi
analyzed: vandanā ava vandanā mayam yathā dāna mayam sīlam ayanti vandanā ca itthā kāya vācā cittehi
translated: Or alternatively, the worship consisting in paying homage is like the giving consisting in giving gifts, the virtue consisting in observing the training precepts, and so on. And here the paying homage is the bowing of the three ,

original: tiṇṇaṃ ratanānaṃ guṇaninnatā, thomanā vā. Pujjabhavaphalanibbattanato puññaṃ, attano
analyzed: tiṇṇam ratanānam guṇa ninna tā thomanā vā pujja bhava phala nibbattanataḥ puññam attano
translated: or the praising, of the special qualities of the Three Jewels. It is merit because it is the cause for the arising of the fruit of the heavenly world and the human world. It is the supreme merit because it is the cause for the arising of the fruit of Nibbana.

original: santānaṃ punātīti vā. Suvihatantarāyoti. Suṭṭhu vihatantarāyo. Etena attano pasādasampattiyā,
analyzed: santānam punāti iti vā su vihata antarāyo ti suṭṭhu vihata antarāyo etena attano pasāda sampattiyā
translated: “With obstacles well removed”: with obstacles well removed. By this he shows that that merit is able to remove the obstacles that obstruct the proclamation of the meaning, through his own possession of confidence

original: ratanattayassa ca khettabhāvasampattiyā taṃ puññaṃ atthappakāsanassa upaghātakaupaddavānaṃ
analyzed: rata nattayassa ca khetta bhāva sampattiyā tam puññam attha ppakāsanassa upaghātaka opaddavānam
translated: and through the possession of the worthiness of the field by the Three Jewels.

original: vihanane samatthanti dasseti. Hutvāti pubbakālakiriyā. Tassa “atthaṃ pakāsayissāmī”ti
analyzed: vihanane samatthanti dasseti hutvā iti pubba kālakiriyā tassa attham pakāsayissāmi iti
translated: “Having burned up”: past-tense verbal action. The connection with the words “I will proclaim the meaning”🔽is this: “I will proclaim the meaning of that merit which is the worship of the Three Jewels.”

original: etena sambandho. Tassāti yaṃ ratanattayavandanāmayaṃ puññaṃ, tassa. Ānubhāvenāti balena.
analyzed: etena sambandhaḥ tassa ati yam ratanattaya vandanā mayam puññam tassa ānubhāvena ati balena
translated: “By the power”: by the strength.

original: 5. Evaṃ ratanattayassa nipaccakāre payojanaṃ dassetvā idāni yassā dhammadesanāya🔽atthaṃ saṃvaṇṇetukāmo, tassā tāva guṇābhitthavanavasena upaññāpanatthaṃ “saṃyuttavaggapaṭimaṇḍitassā”tiādi
analyzed: evam rata nattayassa nipacca kāre payojanam dassetvā idāni yassā dhamma desanāya  attham saṃvaṇṇetu kāmo tassā tāva guṇa abhitthavana vasena upaññāpana ttham saṃyutta vagga paṭimaṇḍitassa atiādi
translated: Having thus shown the purpose of the homage to the Three Jewels, now, in order to explain the meaning of that Dhamma teaching🔽for the sake of which he wishes to proclaim the meaning, he says “adorned with the Saṃyutta Vaggas,” etc.,

original: vuttaṃ, devatāsaṃyuttādisaṃyuttehi ceva naḷavaggādivaggehi ca vibhūsitassāti attho.
analyzed: vuttam devatā saṃyutta ādi saṃyuttehi ca iva naḷa vagga ādi vaggehi ca vibhūsitassa ati attho
translated: in order to announce it by extolling its special qualities. The meaning is: embellished with the Saṃyutta Vaggas such as the Devata Saṃyutta, and with the Vaggas such as the Naḷa Vagga.

original: Tattha “saṃyutta”nti “saṃyogo”ti ca atthato ekaṃ. Kesaṃ saṃyuttaṃ? Suttavaggānaṃ.
analyzed: tattha saṃyuttam ti saṃyogo ti ca atthataḥ ekam kesam saṃyuttam sutta vaggānam
translated: Herein, “connected” and “connectedness” are the same in meaning. With what are they connected? With the sutta-collections.

original: Yathā hi byañjanasamudāyo padaṃ, evaṃ atthesu ca katāvadhiko padasamudāyo vākyaṃ,
analyzed: yathā hi byañjana samudāyo padam evam atthesu ca katau adhikaḥ pada samudāyaḥ vākyam
translated: Just as a word is a collection of syllables, so a sentence is a collection of words limited to a certain meaning,

original: vākyasamudāyo suttaṃ, suttasamudāye vaggoti samaññā, tathā suttavaggasamudāye saṃyuttasamaññā.
analyzed: vākya samudāyaḥ suttam sutta samudāye vaggo ti samaññā tathā sutta vagga samudāye saṃyutta samaññā
translated: and a sutta is a collection of sentences, and a collection of suttas is called an “āgama,” so a collection of āgamas is called a “saṃyutta.”

original: Saṃyujjantīti ettha suttavaggāti saṃyuttaṃ. Yadipi avayavavinimutto samudāyo nāma
analyzed: saṃyujjanti iti ettha sutta vaggā ti saṃyuttam yadi api avayava vinimuttaḥ samudāyaḥ nāma
translated: Herein, “connected” is a saṃyutta in the sense of “they connect” . Although a collection as a separate entity apart from its components

original: paramatthato natthi, avayave eva taṃtaṃsannivesavisiṭṭhe upādāya padādisamaññā viya
analyzed: paramatthataḥ natthi avayave eva taṃ taṃ sannivesa visiṭṭhe upādāya pada ādi samaññā viya
translated: does not exist in the ultimate sense, just as the designation “word” , etc.,🔽is made by taking the components themselves distinguished by a particular arrangement, so the designation “sutta,” the designation “saṃyutta,” and the designation “āgama” are made by taking the components of a sutta, a saṃyutta, and an āgama respectively.

original: suttavaggasamaññā saṃyuttasamaññā āgamasamaññā ca, tathāpi paramatthato avijjamānopi🔽samudāyo buddhiparikappitarūpena vijjamāno viya gayhamāno avayavānaṃ adhiṭṭhānabhāvena
analyzed: sutta vagga samaññā saṃyutta samaññā āgama samaññā ca tathā api paramatthataḥ a vijjamānaḥ api  samudāyaḥ buddhi parikappita rūpena vijjamānaḥ viya gayhamānaḥ avayavānam adhiṭṭhāna bhāvena
translated: Although a collection does not exist in the ultimate sense,🔽it is nevertheless apprehended as if it existed in the form of a mental construction, and it is spoken of as the basis of its components,

original: voharīyati yathā “rukkhe sākhā”ti, tasmā vuttaṃ “saṃyuttavaggapaṭimaṇḍitassā”ti.
analyzed: voharīyati yathā rukkhe sākhā ati tasmā vuttam saṃyutta vagga paṭimaṇḍitassa ati
translated: just as a tree is spoken of as having branches. That is why it is said above that it is “adorned with the saṃyutta-collection.”

original: Nanu saṃyuttavaggo eva āgamo, tassa pana kehi maṇḍananti? Na codetabbametaṃ. Bhavati🔽hi abhinnepi vatthusmiṃ yathādhippetavisesāvabodhanato bhedakasamudācāro yathā “silāputtakassa🔽sarīra”nti. Āgamissanti ettha, etena, etasmā vā attatthaparatthādayoti āgamo, ādikalyāṇādiguṇasampattiyā
analyzed: nanu saṃyutta vaggaḥ eva āgamaḥ tassa pana kehi maṇḍanam ti na codetabbam etam bhavati  hi abhinne pi vatthusmim yathā adhippeta visesa avabodhanataḥ bhedaka samudācāraḥ yathā silāputtakassa  āgamissanti ettha etena etasmai vā āgamaḥ ādi kalyāṇa ādi guṇa sampattiyā
translated: Are not the Saṃyutta Nikāya itself the scriptures, and what is the meaning of ‘with what is it adorned’? — This should not be asked, because🔽there is a usage of the word ‘with’ in the sense of ‘in’ even when there is no difference in the basis, as in the expression ‘the body of the stone-infant.’🔽The scriptures are so called because they come (āgamissanti) here, by this, or from this, in the sense of one’s own benefit, the benefit of others, and so on.

original: uttamaṭṭhena taṃtaṃabhipatthitasamiddhihetutāya paṇḍitehi varitabbato varo, āgamo
analyzed: uttama aṭṭhena paṇḍitehi varitabbataḥ varaḥ āgamaḥ
translated: They are excellent (vara) because they are worthy of being chosen (varitabbata) by the wise because of their excellence in such qualities as being good in the beginning, etc., and because they are the cause for the fulfilment of the various desired aims.🔽They are the excellent scriptures (āgamavara) because they are both scriptures and excellent.

original: ca so varo cāti āgamavaro. Āgamasammatehi vā varoti āgamavaro, saṃyutto ca so āgamavaro🔽cāti saṃyuttāgamavaro, tassa. Buddhānaṃ anubuddhā buddhānubuddhā, buddhānaṃ saccapaṭivedhaṃ
analyzed: ca saḥ varo ca ati āgama varo āgama sammatehi vā āgama varo saṃyutto ca so āgama varo  tassa buddhānam anubuddhāḥ buddha anubuddhāḥ buddhānam sacca paṭivedham
translated: Or alternatively, they are excellent (vara) because they are approved (sammata) as scriptures (āgama), and they are the excellent scriptures (āgamavara).🔽The noble ones (ariyā) are the chief disciples, etc., who have penetrated the truths (paṭividdhasaccā) by following the penetration of the truths (saccapaṭivedha) of the Buddhas.

original: anugamma paṭividdhasaccā aggasāvakādayo ariyā. Tehi atthasaṃvaṇṇanāguṇasaṃvaṇṇanānaṃ
analyzed: anugamma paṭividdha saccāḥ aggasāvaka ādayaḥ ariyāḥ tehi attha saṃvaṇṇanā guṇa saṃvaṇṇanānam
translated: They are the commentaries (saṃvaṇṇanā) on the meaning and the qualities of the scriptures (atthasaṃvaṇṇanāguṇaṃsaṃvaṇṇanānaṃ)

original: vasena saṃvaṇṇitassa.
analyzed: vasena saṃvaṇṇitassa
translated: which have been commented on (saṃvaṇṇitassa).

original: Atha vā buddhā ca anubuddhā ca buddhānubuddhāti yojetabbaṃ. Sammāsambuddheneva hi
analyzed: atha vā buddhā ca anubuddhā ca buddhā anubuddhā iti yojetabbam sammāsambuddhena iva hi
translated: Or else, the Buddhas and the Buddhas’ disciples can be construed as “the Buddhas’ disciples” .

original: vinayasuttaabhidhammānaṃ pakiṇṇakadesanādivasena yo paṭhamaṃ attho vibhatto, so eva
analyzed: vinaya sutta abhidhammānam pakiṇṇaka desanā ādi vasena yaḥ paṭhamam atthaḥ vibhatto saḥ eva
translated: For the meaning that was first analyzed by the Master himself in the Vinaya, Sutta, and Abhidhamma Pitakas, in the miscellaneous desanās, etc.,🔽was later collected by the compilers in the form of commentaries on the meaning of those three Pitakas.

original: pacchā tesaṃ atthavaṇṇanāvasena saṅgītikārehi saṅgahaṃ āropitoti. Ettha ca saṃyuttānaṃ🔽vaggā samūhāti saṃyuttavaggā, sagāthāvaggādayo. Tappariyāpannatāya saṃyuttesu vaggā
analyzed: pacchā tesam attha vaṇṇanā vasena saṅgīti kārehi saṅgaham āropito ti ettha ca saṃyuttānam  vaggā saṃyutta vaggā sagāthā vagga ādayaḥ tad pariyāpanna tāya saṃyuttesu vaggā
translated: Herein, the “Saṃyutta Vaggas” are the “Saṃyutta” collections.🔽The “Saṃyutta Vaggas” are the “Saṃyutta” collections because they are included in the Saṃyutta Nikāya. The “Naḷa Vaggas” are the “Saṃyutta Vaggas” because they are the “Saṃyutta” collections.

original: saṃyuttavaggā, naḷavaggādayo. Saṃyuttāva vaggā saṃyuttavaggā. Tividhepi te ekasesanayena
analyzed: saṃyutta vaggāḥ naḷa vagga ādayaḥ vaggā saṃyutta vaggā tividhe pi te eka sesa nayena
translated: The “Saṃyutta Vaggas” are the “Saṃyutta Vaggas” because they are the “Saṃyutta” collections.

original: gahetvā vuttaṃ “saṃyuttavaggapaṭimaṇḍitassā”ti.🔽Tattha sagāthāvagge tāva ekādasa saṃyuttāni aṭṭhatiṃsa vaggā. Nidānavagge nava saṃyuttāni
analyzed: gahetvā vuttam saṃyutta vagga paṭimaṇḍitassa iti  tattha sagāthā vagge tāva ekādasa saṃyuttāni aṭṭhatiṃsa vaggāḥ nidāna vagge nava saṃyuttāni
translated: The “Saṃyutta Vaggas” are the “Saṃyutta Vaggas” because they are the “Saṃyutta” collections.

original: ekūnacattālīsa vaggā. Khandhavagge ekādasa saṃyuttāni ekūnasaṭṭhi vaggā. Saḷāyatanavagge
analyzed: ekūnacattālīsa vaggā khandha vagge ekādasa saṃyuttāni vaggā saḷāyatana vagge
translated: Herein, in the Sagāthā Vagga there are eleven Saṃyuttas and thirty-eight vaggas. In the Nidāna Vagga there are nine Saṃyuttas and forty-one vaggas. In the Khandha Vagga there are eleven Saṃyuttas and sixty-one vaggas. In the Saḷāyatana Vagga there are nine Saṃyuttas and thirty-six vaggas.

original: nava saṃyuttāni aṭṭhatiṃsa vaggā. Mahāvagge dvādasa saṃyuttāni aṭṭhacattālīsa vaggā.
analyzed: nava saṃyuttāni aṭṭhatiṃsa vaggā mahāvagge dvādasa saṃyuttāni aṭṭhacattālīsa vaggā
translated: Twelve connected with the second, forty-eight in the second chapter.

original: Idamettha saṃyuttantaravaggānaṃ parimāṇaṃ.🔽Ñāṇappabhedajananassāti paṭiccasamuppādakhandhāyatanādikathābahulatāya gambhīrañāṇacariyāvibhāvanato
analyzed: idam ettha saṃyutta antara vaggānam parimāṇam  ñāṇa ppabheda jananassa ati paṭiccasamuppāda khandha āyatana ādi kathā bahula tāya gambhīra ñāṇa cariyā vibhāvanato
translated: This is the extent of the Connected Discourses and the chapters in the Middle Length Texts.🔽For the arousing of the diversity of knowledge: for the one who arouses the diversity of knowledge, because of the development of the practice of profound knowledge by the abundance of talk about the dependent origination, the aggregates, the sense bases, and so on.

original: paññāvibhāgasamuppādakassa. Idha pana “paññāppabhedajananassā”ti svāyamāgamo thomito,
analyzed: paññā vibhāga samuppādakassa idha pana paññā appabheda jananassa ati svāyamāgamaḥ thomito
translated: Here, however, this text is abbreviated as “for the arousing of the diversity of knowledge.”

original: saṃvaṇṇanāsu cāyaṃ ācariyassa pakati, yadidaṃ taṃtaṃsaṃvaṇṇanānaṃ ādito tassa tassa🔽saṃvaṇṇetabbassa dhammassa visesaguṇakittanena thomanā. Tathā hi sumaṅgalavilāsinīpapañcasūdanīmanorathapūraṇīaṭṭhasālinīādīsu
analyzed: saṃvaṇṇanāsu ca ayam ācariyassa pakati yat idam tad tad saṃvaṇṇanānam āditas tassa tassa  saṃvaṇṇetabbassa dhammassa visesa guṇa kittanena thomanā tathā hi sumaṅgalavilāsinī papañcasūdanī manorathapūraṇī aṭṭhasālinī ādīsu
translated: This is the teacher’s usual practice in the commentaries, namely, at the beginning of each commentary🔽to praise the particular qualities of the Dhamma that is to be commented on. For in the Sumaṅgalavilāsinī, the Papañcasūdanī, the Manorathapūraṇī, the Aṭṭasālinī, and so on,

original: ca yathākkamaṃ “saddhāvahaguṇassa, paravādamathanassa, dhammakathikapuṅgavānaṃ vicittapaṭibhānajananassa,
analyzed: ca yathākkamam saddhā vaha guṇassa paravāda mathanassa dhamma kathika puṅgavānam vicitta paṭibhāna jananassa
translated: the particular qualities of the Dhamma are praised in due order as follows: “of the one who brings faith,” “of the one who crushes the doctrines of others,” “of the chief expounders of the Dhamma,” “of the one who generates manifold understanding,”

original: tassa gambhīrañāṇehi ogāḷhassa abhiṇhaso nānānayavicittassa abhidhammassā”tiādinā thomanā katā.
analyzed: tassa gambhīra ñāṇehi ogāḷhassa abhiṇhasaḥ nānā naya vicittassa abhidhammassa ati ādinā thomanā katā
translated: and it was praised by those of profound knowledge, who had entered it again and again, as the Abhidhamma, which is various in its methods and profound in its knowledge.

original: 6. Attho kathīyati etāyāti atthakathā, atthakathāva aṭṭhakathā ttha-kārassa ṭṭha-kāraṃ
analyzed: attho kathīyati etāya ati atthakathā atthakathā ava aṭṭhakathā tthakārassa ṭṭhakāram
translated: It is a commentary on the meaning, thus it is an Atthakathā. The Atthakathā itself is an Aṭṭhakathā, with the tth of ttha-kāra being changed to ṭṭha-kāra,🔽as in the expression “dukkhassa pīḷanaṭṭho” .

original: katvā yathā “dukkhassa pīḷanaṭṭho”ti. Āditoti ādimhi paṭhamasaṅgītiyaṃ. Chaḷabhiññatāya🔽paramena cittavasibhāvena samannāgatattā jhānādīsu pañcavidhavasitāsambhāvato ca
analyzed: katvā yathā dukkhassa pīḷana ṭṭho ti āditaḥ ti ādimhi paṭhama saṅgītiyam chaḍḍabhiñña tāya  paramena citta vasi bhāvena samannāgata ttā jhāna ādīsu ca
translated: At the beginning: at the first recitation.🔽The elders, who were the residents, were the elders Mahākassapa and so on, who were endowed with the six kinds of direct knowledge and with the highest mastery of mind, and who therefore had the five kinds of mastery in the jhānas and so on.

original: vasino, therā mahākassapādayo. Tesaṃ satehi pañcahi. Yāti yā aṭṭhakathā. Saṅgītāti
analyzed: vasinaḥ therāḥ mahākassapa ādayo tesam satehi pañcahi yā ati yā aṭṭhakathā saṅgītā ati
translated: Of those elders, with their five hundred: the Aṭṭhakathā that was recited by them.

original: atthaṃ kathetuṃ yuttaṭṭhāne “ayaṃ etassa attho, ayaṃ etassa attho”ti saṅgahetvā vuttā.
analyzed: attham kathetum yutta ṭṭhāne ayam etassa atthaḥ ayam etassa atthaḥ iti saṅgahetvā vuttā
translated: Recited: recited by them at the first recitation in the place suitable for the exposition of the meaning, after collecting it together thus: “This is the meaning of this, this is the meaning of that.”🔽And it was recited again by the elders Yasassin and so on at the second and third recitations afterwards.

original: Anusaṅgītā ca yasattherādīhi pacchāpi dutiyatatiyasaṅgītīsu. Iminā attano saṃvaṇṇanāya
analyzed: ca pacchā api dutiya tatiya saṅgītīsu iminā attano saṃvaṇṇanāya
translated: By this statement of his own praise,

original: āgamanavisuddhiṃ dasseti.
analyzed: āgamana visuddhim dasseti
translated: he shows the purity of his own coming.

original: 7. Sīhassa lānato gahaṇato sīhaḷo, sīhakumāro, tabbaṃsajātatāya tambapaṇṇidīpe khattiyā,
analyzed: sīhassa lānataḥ gahaṇataḥ sīhaḷaḥ sīha kumāro tad aṃsa jāta tāya tambapaṇṇidīpe khattiyā
translated: 7. The Sinhalese is so called because it was brought from the lion’s play , and because the princes in Tambapaṇṇi Island were called lion-cubs because of their lion-like nature.🔽The fact that the island of Tambapaṇṇi is called Sinhala should be understood in this way.

original: tesaṃ nivāsatāya tambapaṇṇidīpassa ca sīhaḷabhāvo veditabbo. Ābhatāti jambudīpato
analyzed: tesam nivāsa tāya tambapaṇṇi dīpassa ca sīhaḷa bhāvaḥ veditabbaḥ ābhata ati jambudīpataḥ
translated: Brought: from Jambudīpa.

original: ānītā. Athāti pacchā. Aparabhāge hi nikāyantaraladdhīhi asaṅkaratthaṃ sīhaḷabhāsāya
analyzed: ānītāḥ atha ati pacchā apara bhāge hi nikāya antara laddhīhi asaṅkarattham sīhaḷa bhāsāya
translated: Then: afterwards. For the commentaries were composed in the Sinhalese language in order to avoid confusion with the commentaries of other schools in a later period.

original: aṭṭhakathā ṭhapitāti. Tena mūlaṭṭhakathā sabbasādhāraṇā na hotīti idaṃ atthappakāsanaṃ
analyzed: aṭṭhakathā ṭhapitā ati tena mūla ṭṭhakathā sabba sādhāraṇā na hoti iti idam attha ppakāsanam
translated: Therefore the root-commentaries are not common to all. This explanation of the meaning

original: ekantena karaṇīyanti dasseti. Tenevāha “dīpavāsīnamatthāyā”ti. Ettha dīpavāsīnanti
analyzed: ekantena karaṇīyanti dasseti tena iva āha dīpa vāsīnam atthāya ati ettha dīpa vāsīnam ti
translated: shows that it is necessary to do this exclusively. Hence he said “for the sake of the inhabitants of the island.” Here

original: jambudīpavāsīnaṃ, sīhaḷadīpavāsīnaṃ vā atthāya sīhaḷabhāsāya ṭhapitāti yojanā.
analyzed: jambu dīpa vāsīnam sīhaḷa dīpa vāsīnam vā atthāya sīhaḷa bhāsāya yojanā
translated: the inhabitants of the island are the inhabitants of Jambudīpa or the inhabitants of the island of Sinhala. The commentaries were composed in the Sinhalese language for their sake.🔽. Having removed: having removed the Sinhalese language, which is like a garment.🔽From that: from the commentaries.

original: 8. Apanetvāti kañcukasadisaṃ sīhaḷabhāsaṃ apanetvā. Tatoti aṭṭhakathāto. Ahanti attānaṃ
analyzed: apanetvā iti kañcuka sadisam sīhaḷa bhāsam apanetvā tatas ti aṭṭhakathātaḥ aham ti attānam
translated: I: he points to himself.

original: niddisati. Manoramaṃ bhāsanti māgadhabhāsaṃ. Sā hi sabhāvaniruttibhūtā paṇḍitamanaṃ
analyzed: niddisati manoramam bhāsanti māgadha bhāsam sā hi sabhāva nirutti bhūtā
translated: Delightful language: the Magadha language. For that is the natural language, which delights the minds of the wise.

original: ramayati. Tenevāha “tantinayānucchavika”nti, pāḷigatiyā anulomikaṃ pāḷichāyānuvidhāyininti
analyzed: ramayati tena iva āha anulomikam
translated: It delights. Hence it is said, “In accordance with the method of the text” . It is in accordance with the method of the text, in accordance with the text’s shadow.

original: attho. Vigatadosanti asabhāvaniruttibhāsantararahitaṃ.
analyzed: atthaḥ vigata dosanti asabhāva nirutti bhāsa antara rahitam
translated: It delights. Hence he said “in conformity with the method of the text” . The meaning is: in conformity with the text’s method of teaching. Free from faults: free from the fault of being a language not generally used.

original: 9. Samayaṃ avilomentoti siddhantaṃ avirodhento. Etena atthadosābhāvamāha. Aviruddhattā🔽eva hi theravādāpi idha pakāsīyissanti. Theravaṃsadīpānanti thirehi sīlakkhandhādīhi
analyzed: samayam etena attha dosa abhāvam āha  eva hi thera vādā api idha thirehi sīla kkhandha ādīhi
translated: Not contradicting the rule: not contradicting the established doctrine. By this he shows that there is no fault in the meaning.🔽For it is because there is no contradiction that the Elders’ Tradition will be revealed here.

original: samannāgatattā therā, mahākassapādayo. Tehi āgatā ācariyaparamparā theravaṃso, tappariyāpannā🔽hutvā āgamādhigamasampannattā paññāpajjotena tassa samujjalanato theravaṃsadīpā,
analyzed: samannāgata ttāḥ therāḥ mahākassapa ādayo tehi āgatā ācariya paramparā thera vaṃso tad pariyāpannā  hutvā āgama adhigama sampanna ttā paññā pajjotena tassa samujjalanataḥ thera vaṃsa dīpā
translated: Elders: they are elders because they are endowed with the aggregate of virtue, etc., that is firm. They are the Great Elders, etc. The Elders’ Tradition is the succession of teachers handed down by them.

original: mahāvihāravāsino, tesaṃ. Vividhehi ākārehi nicchīyatīti vinicchayo, gaṇṭhiṭṭhānesu
analyzed: mahāvihāra vāsino tesam vividhehi ākārehi vinicchayaḥ gaṇṭhi ṭṭhānesu
translated: The Elders’ Tradition Illuminator is the inhabitants of the Great Monastery, who, having received the tradition from the Elders, illuminate it with the light of their own wisdom, which is perfected by their attainment of the scriptures and the higher knowledge.🔽The exposition is the discussion that occurs in the form of a pounding of the pestle on the mortar at the knotty points, a discussion that resolves the doubts.

original: khilamaddanākārena pavattā vimaticchedanī kathā. Suṭṭhunipuṇo saṇho vinicchayo etesanti
analyzed: khila maddana ākārena pavattā vimati chedanī kathā suṭṭhu nipuṇaḥ saṇhaḥ vinicchayaḥ
translated: The exposition is well-spoken, subtle, and gentle for them.

original: sunipuṇavinicchayā. Atha vā vinicchinotīti vinicchayo vuttappakāravisayaṃ ñāṇaṃ.🔽Suṭṭhu nipuṇo cheko vinicchayo etesanti yojetabbaṃ. Etena mahākassapāditheraparamparāgato,
analyzed: su nipuṇa vinicchayā atha vā vinicchinoti iti vinicchayaḥ vutta ppakāra visayam ñāṇam  suṭṭhu nipuṇaḥ chekaḥ vinicchayaḥ etesan ti yojetabbam etena mahā kassapa ādi thera paramparā gataḥ
translated: Or alternatively, it is a decision because it decides, and it is the knowledge of the kind described above that has the object.🔽It should be construed thus: “It is well-defined and subtle in its decisions.” By this he shows that it is a measure because it comes down from the Elder Mahā Kassapa and so on,

original: tato eva ca aviparīto saṇho sukhumo mahāvihāravāsīnaṃ vinicchayo, tassa pamāṇabhūtataṃ dasseti.🔽10. Sujanassa cāti ca-saddo sampiṇḍanattho. Tena “na kevalaṃ jambudīpavāsīnameva
analyzed: tatas eva ca aviparītaḥ saṇhaḥ sukhumaḥ mahāvihāra vāsīnam vinicchayo tassa dasseti  su janassa ca ati ca saddo sampiṇḍana attho tena na kevalam jambudīpa vāsīnam eva
translated: and because it is gentle and subtle, unperverted, and belonging to the inmates of the Mahāvihāra.🔽And for the good: the word “and” has the meaning of “also.” By it he shows that it is not only for the sake of those who live in the Rose-Apple Island,

original: atthāya, atha kho sādhujanatosanatthañcā”ti dasseti. Tena ca “tambapaṇṇidīpavāsīnampi
analyzed: atthāya atha kho sādhu jana tosana attham ca ati dasseti tena ca tamba paṇṇi dīpa vāsīnam pi
translated: but also for the sake of instructing the good. And by that it is established that the meaning is also for the sake of those who live in the Island of Tambapaṇṇi,

original: atthāyā”ti ayamattho siddho hoti uggahaṇādisukaratāya tesampi bahukārattā. Ciraṭṭhitatthanti
analyzed: atthāya iti ayam attho siddho hoti uggahaṇa ādi sukara tāya tesam pi bahukāra ttā cira ṭṭhita ttham ti
translated: because they are numerous there too owing to the ease of learning it, and so on. For the sake of its long continuity:

original: ciraṭṭhitiatthaṃ, cirakālappavattanāyāti attho. Idañhi atthappakāsanaṃ aviparītapadabyañjanasunikkhepassa
analyzed: cira ṭṭhiti attham cira kāla ppavattanāya ati atthaḥ idam hi attha ppakāsanam a viparīta pada byañjana su nikkhepassa
translated: for the sake of its long duration, for the sake of its continuance for a long time, is the meaning. For this teaching of the meaning, which is a good exposition of the words and syllables without perversion,

original: atthasunayassa ca upāyabhāvato saddhammassa ciraṭṭhitiyā pavattati. Vuttañhetaṃ bhagavatā
analyzed: attha su nayassa ca upāya bhāvataḥ saddhammassa cira ṭṭhitiyā pavattati vuttam ha etam bhagavatā
translated: and because it is the means for the purpose of the true Dhamma’s long preservation. For this is said by the Blessed One:

original: “dveme, bhikkhave, dhammā saddhammassa ṭhitiyā asammosāya anantaradhānāya saṃvattanti.
analyzed: dve me bhikkhave dhammā saddhammassa ṭhitiyāḥ asammosāya anantaradhānāya saṃvattanti
translated: “Bhikkhus, these two things lead to the preservation of the true Dhamma, to its non-decay and non-disappearance.

original: Katame dve? Sunikkhittañca padabyañjanaṃ attho ca sunīto”ti.
analyzed: katame dve su nikkhittam ca pada byañjanam attho ca su nītaḥ ti
translated: What two? The phrasing and the meaning are well grasped” .

original: 11-12. Yaṃ atthavaṇṇanaṃ kattukāmo, tassā mahattaṃ pariharituṃ “sāvatthipabhūtīna”ntiādi
analyzed: yam attha vaṇṇanam kattu kāmaḥ tassāḥ mahattam pariharitum sāvatthi pabhūtīnaṃ ti ādi
translated: . The words “Sāvatthī was the chief city” , etc., are said in order to avoid the fault of over-elaboration in the commentary on the meaning,

original: vuttaṃ. Tenevāha – “na idha bhiyyo vitthārakathaṃ karissāmi, na taṃ idha vicārayissāmī”ti
analyzed: vuttam tena iva āha na idha bhiyyas vitthāra katham karissāmi na tam idha vicārayissāmi iti
translated: which is why he says: “I shall not make a detailed explanation here, I shall not investigate it here” .

original: ca. Saṅgītīnaṃ dvinnanti dīghamajjhimanikāyānaṃ.🔽13. “Na idha bhiyyo vitthārakathaṃ karissāmī”ti sāmaññato vuttassa atthassa avassayaṃ dassetuṃ “suttānaṃ panā”tiādi vuttaṃ.
analyzed: ca saṅgītīnam dvinnanti dīgha majjhima nikāyānam  na idha bhiyyas vitthāra katham karissāmi iti sāmaññataḥ vuttassa atthassa avassayam dassetum suttānam pana atiādi vuttam
translated: . “The two collections” are the Digha and Majjhima collections.🔽. “I shall not make a detailed explanation here” is said in order to show the purport of the meaning stated in general terms. “But in the case of suttas” , etc., is said.

original: 14. Yaṃ aṭṭhakathaṃ kattukāmo, tadekadesabhāvena visuddhimaggo gahetabboti kathikānaṃ
analyzed: yam aṭṭhakatham kattu kāmo tad eka desa bhāvena visuddhi maggo gahetabbo ti kathikānam
translated: . The Path of Purification should be taken as a part of the commentary on the meaning, which is why he says: “The commentator” ,

original: upadesaṃ karonto tatta vicāritadhamme uddesavasena dasseti “sīlakathā”tiādinā. Tattha
analyzed: upadesam karonto tatta vicārita dhamme uddesa vasena dasseti sīla kathā ti ādinā tattha
translated: He shows the teaching by way of the headings, saying “The talk on virtue,” etc., while expounding the Dhamma that he has investigated. Herein:

original: sīlakathāti cārittavārittādivasena sīlassa vitthārakathā. Dhutadhammāti piṇḍapātikaṅgādayo🔽terasa kilesadhunanakadhammā. Kammaṭṭhānāni sabbānīti pāḷiyaṃ āgatāni aṭṭhattiṃsa,
analyzed: sīla kathā ati cāritta vāritta ādi vasena sīlassa vitthāra kathā dhuta dhammā ti piṇḍapātikaṅga ādayaḥ  terasa kilesa dhunanaka dhammā kammaṭṭhānāni sabbāni iti pāḷiyam āgatāni aṭṭhattiṃsa
translated: The talk on virtue is the detailed talk on virtue in the various ways beginning with the virtue of undertaking precepts.🔽The ascetic practices are the thirteen practices beginning with the alms-food-eater’s practice that shake off defilements.🔽All the meditation subjects: the thirty-eight meditation subjects given in the texts,

original: aṭṭhakathāyaṃ dveti niravasesāni yogakammassa bhāvanāya pavattiṭṭhānāni. Cariyāvidhānasahitoti
analyzed: aṭṭhakathā ayam dve iti niravasesāni yoga kammassa bhāvanāya pavatti ṭṭhānāni cariyā vidhāna sahitaḥ ti
translated: and the two given in the commentaries, are the bases for the occurrence of the development of the work of insight.

original: rāgacariyādīnaṃ sabhāgādividhānena sahito. Jhānāni cattāri rūpāvacarajjhānāni, samāpattiyo🔽catasso arūpasamāpattiyo. Aṭṭhapi vā paṭiladdhamattāni jhānāni, samāpajjanavasibhāvappattiyā
analyzed: rāga cariyā ādīnam sa bhāga ādi vidhānena sahitaḥ jhānāni cattāri rūpāvacara jhānāni samāpattiyaḥ  catasso arūpa samāpattiyaḥ aṭṭha pi vā paṭiladdha mattāni jhānāni samāpajjana vasi bhāva ppattiyā
translated: Together with the modes of activity: together with the modes of activity consisting in the various kinds of conduct such as that of one with lust, etc.,🔽The four jhānas are the jhānas of the fine-material sphere. The four attainments are the four immaterial attainments.🔽Or alternatively, the jhānas are the jhānas that have just been reached, and the attainments are the jhānas that have been mastered by reaching them repeatedly.

original: samāpattiyo. Jhānāni vā rūpārūpāvacarajjhānāni, samāpattiyo phalasamāpattinirodhasamāpattiyo.
analyzed: samāpattiyaḥ jhānāni vā rūpa arūpa avacara jhānāni samāpattiyaḥ phala samāpatti nirodha samāpattiyaḥ
translated: Or the jhānas are the jhānas of the fine-material and immaterial spheres, and the attainments are the attainment of fruition and the attainment of cessation.

original: 15. Lokiyalokuttarabhedā cha abhiññāyo sabbā abhiññāyo. Ñāṇavibhaṅgādīsu āgatanayena ekavidhādinā paññāya saṅkaletvā sampiṇḍetvā nicchayo paññāsaṅkalananicchayo.🔽16. Paccayadhammānaṃ hetuādīnaṃ paccayuppannadhammānaṃ hetupaccayādibhāvo paccayākāro,
analyzed: lokiya lokuttara bhedā cha abhiññāyo sabbāḥ abhiññāyo ñāṇa vibhaṅga ādīsu āgata nayena ekavidha ādinā paññāya saṅkaletvā sampiṇḍetvā nicchayo paññā saṅkalana nicchayo  paccaya dhammānam hetu ādīnam paccaya uppanna dhammānam hetu paccaya ādi bhāvaḥ paccaya ākāraḥ
translated: All the kinds of direct-knowledge are the six kinds of direct-knowledge classed as mundane and supramundane. The kind of understanding that is the outcome of the act of defining after collecting and combining by means of the understanding consisting of one kind, etc., as stated in the Ñāṇavibhaṅga and other places, is the “definition of understanding.”🔽The “mode of condition” is the state of being a root-cause condition, etc., of the conditionally arisen states, such as dhammas that are conditions.🔽The “teaching of the mode of condition” is the teaching of dependent origination.

original: tassa desanā paccayākāradesanā, paṭiccasamuppādakathāti attho. Sā pana nikāyantaraladdhisaṅkararahitatāya
analyzed: tassa desanā paccaya ākāra desanā paṭiccasamuppāda kathā ti atthaḥ sā pana nikāya antara laddhi saṅkara rahita tāya
translated: But that is “pure” because it is free from the confusion that occurs in other schools,

original: suṭṭhuparisuddhā, ghanavinibbhogassa ca sudukkaratāya nipuṇā saṇhasukhumā, ekattanayādisahitā🔽ca tattha vicāritāti āha “suparisuddhanipuṇanayā”ti. Paṭisambhidādīsu āgatanayaṃ
analyzed: suṭṭhu parisuddhā ghana vinibbhogassa ca su dukkara tāya nipuṇā saṇha sukhumā eka ttanaya ādi sahitā  ca tattha vicāritā iti āha su parisuddha nipuṇa nayā iti paṭisambhidā ādīsu āgata nayam
translated: and it is “subtle” because it is hard to penetrate, and “fine” because it is hard to discern, and it is “accompanied by the method of unity,” etc.,🔽and it has been investigated there, thus it is said: “by the method of pure subtlety.”

original: avisajjetvāva vicāritattā avimuttatantimaggā.
analyzed: a visajjetvā ava vicārita ttā a vimutta tanti maggā
translated: It is “not released from the final path” because it has been investigated without deviating from the method stated in the Paṭisambhidā, etc.

original: 17. Iti pana sabbanti iti-saddo parisamāpane, pana-saddo vacanālaṅkāre, etaṃ sabbanti attho. Idhāti imissā aṭṭhakathāya. Na taṃ vicārayissāmi punaruttibhāvatoti adhippāyo.
analyzed: iti pana sabbanti iti saddo parisamāpane pana saddo vacana alaṅkāre etam sabbanti atthaḥ idha ati imissā aṭṭhakathāya na tam vicārayissāmi punarutti bhāvato ti adhippāyaḥ
translated: But as to all: the word iti is for concluding, and the word pana is an ornament of speech. The meaning is: all this. Here: in this commentary. The intention is: I shall not discuss it again because of the occurrence of repetition.

original: 18. Idāni tasseva avicāraṇassa ekantakāraṇaṃ niddhārento “majjhe visuddhimaggo”tiādimāha.
analyzed: idāni tassa iva avicāraṇassa ekanta kāraṇam niddhārentaḥ majjhe visuddhi maggo ti ādim āha
translated: Now, in order to show the sole reason for not discussing it, he says “The Path of Purification in the middle,” etc.

original: Tattha “majjhe ṭhatvā”ti etena majjhaṭṭhabhāvadīpanena visesato catunnaṃ āgamānaṃ
analyzed: tattha majjhe ṭhatvā iti etena majjhaṭṭha bhāva dīpanena visesataḥ catunnam āgamānam
translated: Herein, by the words “standing in the middle” he shows that the Path of Purification is a commentary common to the four Āgamas,

original: sādhāraṇaṭṭhakathā visuddhimaggo, na sumaṅgalavilāsiniādayo viya asādhāraṇaṭṭhakathāti🔽dasseti. “Visesato”ti ca idaṃ vinayābhidhammānampi visuddhimaggo yathārahaṃ atthavaṇṇanā
analyzed: sādhāraṇa ṭṭhakathā visuddhi maggaḥ na sumaṅgalavilāsini ādayaḥ viya asādhāraṇa ṭṭhakathā ti  dasseti visesataḥ ti ca idam vinaya abhidhammānam pi visuddhi maggaḥ yathāraham attha vaṇṇanā
translated: and that it is not a commentary uncommon like the Sumaṅgala-vilāsini, etc.

original: hoti evāti katvā vuttaṃ.
analyzed: hoti eva ati katvā vuttam
translated: And the word “especially” is said because the Path of Purification is a commentary on the meaning of the Vinaya and the Abhidhamma as well, as appropriate.

original: 19. Iccevāti iti eva. Tampīti visuddhimaggampi. Etāyāti sāratthappakāsiniyā.
analyzed: iti ca iva ati iti eva tam pi iti visuddhi maggam pi etāya āti sārattha ppakāsiniyā
translated: Thus indeed: iti eva. That too: the Path of Purification. By this: by the Sāratthapakāsinī.

original: Ettha ca “sīhaḷadīpaṃ ābhatā”tiādinā aṭṭhakathākaraṇassa nimittaṃ dasseti, “dīpavāsīnamatthāya
analyzed: ettha ca sīhaḷa dīpam ābhata ati ādinā aṭṭhakathā karaṇassa nimittam dasseti dīpa vāsīnam atthāya
translated: The purpose is shown by the words “for the sake of the people of the island,

original: sujanassa ca tuṭṭhatthaṃ ciraṭṭhitatthañca dhammassā”ti etehi payojanaṃ, “saṃyuttāgamavarassa
analyzed: su janassa ca tuṭṭha ttham cira ṭṭhita ttham ca dhammassa ati etehi payojanam saṃyutta āgama varassa
translated: for the satisfaction of good people, and for the long-lasting of the Dhamma.” The general meaning is shown by the words “I will explain the meaning of the excellent Saṃyutta Nikāya.”

original: atthaṃ pakāsayissāmī”ti etena piṇḍatthaṃ, “apanetvāna tatohaṃ sīhaḷabhāsa”ntiādinā
analyzed: attham pakāsayissāmi iti etena piṇḍa attham apanetvāna tatas ham sīhaḷabhāsanti ādinā
translated: The method of composition is shown by the words “having removed it from there, from the Sinhala language” and so on,

original: “sāvatthipabhūtīna”ntiādinā “sīlakathā”tiādinā ca karaṇappakāraṃ. Heṭṭhimanikāyesu
analyzed: sāvatthi pabhūtīnam ti ādinā sīla kathā ati ādinā ca karaṇa ppakāram heṭṭhima nikāyesu
translated: and by the words “for the sake of the people of Savatthi” and so on, and by the words “the discourse on virtue” and so on.

original: visuddhimagge ca vicāritānaṃ atthānaṃ avicāraṇampi hi idha karaṇappakāro evāti.
analyzed: visuddhi magge ca vicāritānam atthānam a vicāraṇam pi hi idha karaṇa ppakāraḥ eva ati
translated: The failure to consider meanings already considered in the Visuddhimagga is also a method of composition here.

original: Ganthārambhakathāvaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: gantha ārambha kathā vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: The explanation of the introduction to the text is finished.

original: 1. Devatāsaṃyuttaṃ
analyzed: devatā saṃyuttam
translated: The Connected Discourses with Deities

original: 1. Naḷavaggo
analyzed: naḷa vaggaḥ
translated: The Chapter with Nala

original: 1. Oghataraṇasuttavaṇṇanā
analyzed: oghataraṇa sutta vaṇṇanā
translated: The Explanation of the Discourse on Crossing Over the Floods

original: Vibhāgavantānaṃ sabhāvavibhāvanaṃ vibhāgadassanavaseneva hotīti paṭhamaṃ tāva saṃyuttavaggasuttādivasena
analyzed: vibhāgavantānam sabhāva vibhāvanam vibhāga dassana vasena iva hoti iti paṭhamam tāva saṃyutta vagga sutta ādi vasena
translated: The analysis of those who have analysis can only be by way of showing the individual essences of those who have analysis, by way of showing the analysis. Therefore, first, by way of the discourses in the Connected Discourses Collection and so on,

original: saṃyuttāgamassa vibhāgaṃ dassetuṃ “tattha saṃyuttāgamo nāmā”tiādimāha. Tattha tatthāti
analyzed: saṃyutta āgamassa vibhāgam dassetum tattha saṃyutta āgamaḥ nāma ati ādim āha tattha tattha iti
translated: He says “Herein, the Collection of Discourses called” in order to show the division of the Collection of Discourses. Herein, here is

original: yaṃ vuttaṃ – “saṃyuttāgamavarassa atthaṃ pakāsayissāmī”ti, tasmiṃ vacane. Tatthāti
analyzed: yam vuttam saṃyutta āgama varassa attham pakāsayissāmi iti tasmim vacane tattha ati
translated: in the words “I shall make clear the meaning of the Collection of Discourses, the best of collections” . Herein is

original: vā “etāya aṭṭhakathāya vijānātha saṃyuttanissitaṃ attha”nti ettha yaṃ saṃyuttaggahaṇaṃ
analyzed: vā etāya aṭṭhakathāya vijānātha saṃyutta nissitam atthanti ettha yam saṃyutta ggahaṇam
translated: in the words “Understand the meaning based on the Connected Discourses in this commentary” . There is

original: kataṃ, tattha. Pañca vaggā etassāti pañcavaggo. Avayavena viggaho, samudāyo samāsattho.🔽Idāni taṃ ādito paṭṭhāya saṃvaṇṇetukāmo attano saṃvaṇṇanāya tassa paṭhamamahāsaṅgītiyaṃ
analyzed: katam tattha pañca vaggāḥ etassa ati pañca vaggaḥ avayavena viggahaḥ samudāyaḥ samāsa tthaḥ  idāni tam āditas paṭṭhāya saṃvaṇṇetu kāmo attanaḥ saṃvaṇṇanāya tassa paṭhama mahā saṅgītiyam
translated: in the words “It has five sections” . The five sections are its, thus it is of five sections. The analysis is by means of a part. The meaning of the compound is a collection.

original: nikkhittānukkameneva pavattabhāvaṃ dassetuṃ, “tassa vaggesu sagāthāvaggo ādī”tiādi🔽vuttaṃ. Tattha yathāpaccayaṃ tattha tattha desitattā paññattattā ca vippakiṇṇānaṃ
analyzed: nikkhitta anukkamena iva pavatta bhāvam dassetum tassa vaggesu sa gāthā vaggaḥ ādi itiādi  vuttam tattha yathāpaccayam tattha tattha desita ttā paññatta ttā ca vippakiṇṇānam
translated: Now, wanting to comment on it from the beginning, he says “In the sections, the Section of Verses is first” in order to show that the order of its occurrence is in accordance with the order in which it was placed at the First Great Rehearsal.

original: dhammavinayānaṃ saṅgahetvā gāyanaṃ kathanaṃ saṅgīti, mahāvisayattā pūjaniyattā ca
analyzed: dhamma vinayānam saṅgahetvā gāyanam kathanam saṅgīti mahā visaya tā pūja niyat tā ca
translated: Herein, the Dhamma and Discipline, which are taught and laid down here and there, are collected together and sung and spoken of as a collection because they are scattered about, and because they are conditions in accordance with what is appropriate. It is great in scope and it is worthy of worship.

original: mahatī saṅgīti mahāsaṅgīti. Paṭhamā mahāsaṅgīti paṭhamamahāsaṅgīti, tassā pavattitakālo
analyzed: mahatī saṅgī iti mahā saṅgī iti paṭhamā mahā saṅgī iti paṭhama mahā saṅgī iti tassā pavatti ta kālo
translated: The great recitation is the Great Recital. The first great recital is the First Great Recital. The time of its occurrence is

original: paṭhamamahāsaṅgītikālo, tasmiṃ paṭhamamahāsaṅgītikāle.
analyzed: tasmin paṭhama mahā saṅgīti kāle
translated: the time of the First Great Recital. In that time of the First Great Recital.

original: Nidadāti desanaṃ desakālādivasena aviditaṃ viditaṃ katvā nidassetīti nidānaṃ. Yo
analyzed: nidadāti desanam desa kāla ādi vasena aviditam viditam katvā nidasseti iti nidānam yaḥ
translated: It is a source because it is a source that makes known what was not known by means of the teaching, the time, etc.

original: loke ganthassa upogghātoti vuccati, svāyamettha “evaṃ me suta”nti-ādiko gantho veditabbo,
analyzed: loke ganthassa upogghātaḥ ti vuccati svāyam ettha evam me su tanti ādikaḥ gantho veditabbo
translated: The text that is called the “source” here should be understood as the text beginning, “Thus I heard,”

original: na pana “sanidānāhaṃ, bhikkhave, dhammaṃ desemī”tiādīsu viya attajjhāsayādidesanuppattihetu.
analyzed: na pana sa nidānā aham bhikkhave dhammam desemi iti ādīsu viya atta jhāsaya ādi desanā uppatti hetu
translated: and not as the reason for the occurrence of the teaching, such as one’s own inclination, etc., as in the passage, “Bhikkhus, I teach the Dhamma having realized it for myself” .

original: Tenevāha – “evaṃ me sutanti-ādikaṃ āyasmatā ānandena paṭhamamahāsaṅgītikāle vuttaṃ
analyzed: tena iva āha evam me sutanti ādikam āyasmatā ānandena paṭhama mahā saṅgīti kāle vuttam
translated: Hence it is said: “The text beginning, ‘Thus I heard,’ was spoken by the venerable Ānanda at the time of the First Great Recital.

original: nidānamādī”ti. Kāmañcettha yassaṃ paṭhamamahāsaṅgītiyaṃ nikkhittānukkamena saṃvaṇṇanaṃ
analyzed: nidānam ādi iti kāmañca ittha paṭhama mahā saṅgītiyam nikkhitta anukkamena saṃvaṇṇanam
translated: This is the source.” If one wishes to comment on a sutta in the same order in which it is given in the First Great Recital,

original: kattukāmo, sā vitthārato vattabbā, sumaṅgalavilāsiniyaṃ pana attanā vitthāritattā
analyzed: kattu kāmaḥ sā vitthārataḥ vattabbā sumaṅgalavilāsiniyam pana attanā vitthārita ttā
translated: then that sutta should be commented on in detail. But since it has been commented on in detail in the Sumaṅgala Vilāsinī,

original: tattheva gahetabbāti imissā saṃvaṇṇanāya mahattaṃ pariharanto “sā panesā”tiādimāha.
analyzed: tattha iva gahetabbā ti imissā saṃvaṇṇanāya mahattam pariharantaḥ sā pana isā iti ādim āha
translated: He says “But this” in order to avoid the fault of over-praising the commentary by saying that it should be taken there.

original: 1. Evaṃ bāhiranidāne vattabbaṃ atidisitvā idāni abbhantaranidānaṃ ādito paṭṭhāya🔽saṃvaṇṇetuṃ “yaṃ paneta”ntiādi vuttaṃ. Tattha yasmā saṃvaṇṇanaṃ karontena saṃvaṇṇetabbe
analyzed: evam bāhira nidāne vattabbam atidisitvā idāni abbhantara nidānam āditas paṭṭhāya  saṃvaṇṇetum yam pana itantiādi vuttam tattha yasmā saṃvaṇṇanam karontena saṃvaṇṇetabbe
translated: Having thus shown what should be said about the external source, he now says “But this” in order to comment on the internal source from the beginning.🔽Herein, since one who is commenting on the Dhamma to be commented on

original: dhamme padavibhāgaṃ padatthañca dassetvā tato paraṃ piṇḍatthādidassanavasena saṃvaṇṇanā
analyzed: dhamme pada vibhāgam padattham ca dassetvā tato param piṇḍa ttha ādi dassana vasena saṃvaṇṇanā
translated: must first show the analysis of the words and the meaning of the words and then afterwards the commentary

original: kātabbā, tasmā padāni tāva dassento “evanti nipātapada”nti-ādimāha. Tattha padavibhāgoti
analyzed: kātabbā tasmā padāni tāva dassentaḥ evam ti nipāta pada nti ādim āha tattha pada vibhāgaḥ ti
translated: must be undertaken by showing the meaning of the text as a whole and so on, he therefore begins by showing the words, saying “Evam is a particle word” and so on. Herein, the analysis of the words

original: padānaṃ viseso, na padaviggaho. Atha vā padāni ca padavibhāgo ca padavibhāgo. Padaviggaho
analyzed: padānam visesaḥ na pada viggahaḥ atha vā padāni ca pada vibhāgaḥ ca pada vibhāgaḥ pada viggahaḥ
translated: is the distinction of the words, not the analysis of the words. Or alternatively, the words and the analysis of the words are the analysis of the words. And the analysis of the words

original: ca padavibhāgo ca padavibhāgoti vā ekasesavasena padapadaviggahā padavibhāgasaddena

analyzed: upadesaḥ evā ti vuttam evam tepe upadese ti tathā evam etam bhagavā evam etam  sugata ati ettha ca bhagavatā yathāvuttam attham aviparītataḥ jānantehi katam tattha

original: saṃvijjamānaguṇānaṃ pakārehi haṃsanaṃ udaggatākaraṇaṃ sampahaṃsanaṃ. Yo tattha sampahaṃsanākāroti yojetabbaṃ.
analyzed: saṃvijjamāna guṇānam pakārehi haṃsanam udak gatā karaṇam sampahaṃsanam yaḥ tattha sampahaṃsana ākāraḥ iti yojetabbam
translated: the rejoicing there is the manifestation of the qualities found there by the means of the enumeration of the qualities, the making of them outstanding, the rejoicing. The form of the rejoicing there should be connected.

original: Evamevaṃ panāyanti ettha garahaṇākāroti yojetabbaṃ, so ca garahaṇākāro vasalīti-ādikhuṃsanasaddasannidhānato🔽idha evaṃ-saddena pakāsitoti viññāyati. Yathā cettha, evaṃ upamākārādayopi upamādivasena
analyzed: evam evam pana āyanti ettha garahaṇa ākāro ti yojetabbam saḥ ca garahaṇa ākāraḥ  idha evaṃsaddena pakāsito ti viññāyati yathā ca ittha evam upamā kāra ādayaḥ api upamā ādi vasena
translated: “Just so, Lord” is to be construed as “the manner of taking up.” And that manner of taking up is known to be shown by the word “thus” because of the proximity of the word “contemptible” in the phrase “contemptible, low-born.”

original: vuttānaṃ puppharāsiādisaddānaṃ sannidhānatoti daṭṭhabbaṃ. Evaṃ, bhanteti pana dhammassa
analyzed: vuttānam puppha rāsi ādi saddānam sannidhānato ti daṭṭhabbam evam bhante iti pana dhammassa
translated: And just as here, so also the manner of the simile, etc., should be regarded as shown by the word “thus” because of the proximity of the words “a heap of flowers,” etc., in the phrase “like a heap of flowers.”

original: sādhukaṃ savanamanasikāre sanniyojitehi bhikkhūhi attano tattha ṭhitabhāvassa paṭijānanavasena
analyzed: sādhukam savana manasikāre sanniyojitehi bhikkhūhi attanaḥ tattha ṭhita bhāvassa paṭijānana vasena
translated: “Just so, Lord” is said by the monks who are being directed to give their attention to listening well to the Dhamma, in order to acknowledge their presence there.

original: vuttattā ettha evaṃ-saddo “vacanasampaṭicchanattho”ti vutto. Tena evaṃ, bhanteti
analyzed: vutta ttā ettha evaṃsaddaḥ vacana sampaṭicchana atthaḥ ti vuttaḥ tena evam bhante iti
translated: Therefore the word “thus” is said to have the meaning of “acknowledgment of the statement.”🔽By that, “just so, Lord” is said, “good, Lord,” “well, Lord.”

original: sādhu, bhante, suṭṭhu, bhanteti vuttaṃ hoti. Evañca vadehīti yathāhaṃ vadāmi, evaṃ
analyzed: sādhu bhante suṭṭhu bhante iti vuttam hoti evam ca vadehi iti yathā aham vadāmi evam
translated: “Speak thus” is to be construed as “speak in the manner that I am speaking.”

original: samaṇaṃ ānandaṃ vadehīti yo evaṃ vadanākāro idāni vattabbo, so evaṃ-saddena nidassīyatīti
analyzed: samaṇam ānandam vadehi iti yaḥ evam vadana ākāraḥ idāni vattabbo saḥ evaṃsaddena nidassīyati iti
translated: The manner of speaking that is to be spoken now is shown by the word “thus.”

original: “nidassanattho”ti vuttoti. Evaṃ noti etthāpi nesaṃ yathāvuttadhammānaṃ ahitadukkhāvahabhāve
analyzed: nidassana atthaḥ ti vuttaḥ ti evam no ti ettha api nesam yathā vutta dhammānam ahita dukkha āvaha bhāve
translated: So too here, in order to generate the ascertainment of the nature of those states as bringing about what is unprofitable and painful,

original: sanniṭṭhānajananatthaṃ anumatigahaṇavasena “saṃvattanti vā no vā, kathaṃ vo ettha
analyzed: sanniṭṭhāna janana attham anumati gahaṇa vasena saṃvattanti vā no vā katham vaḥ ettha
translated: the question is asked: “Do they lead to what is profitable and to what is unprofitable? How is it with you here?

original: hotī”ti pucchāya katāya “evaṃ no ettha hotī”ti vuttattā tadākārasanniṭṭhānaṃ evaṃ-saddena
analyzed: hoti iti pucchāya katāya evam no ettha hoti iti vutta ttā tad ākāra sanniṭṭhānam evaṃsaddena
translated: ” When it is said: “So it is with us here,” the ascertainment in that mode is indicated by the word “so.”

original: vibhāvitanti viññāyati. So pana tesaṃ dhammānaṃ ahitāya dukkhāya saṃvattanākāro niyamiyamāno
analyzed: vibhāvitanti viññāyati so pana tesam dhammānam ahitāya dukkhāya saṃvattana ākāraḥ niyamiyamānaḥ

translated: the meaning of definition is what is intended. That is why it is said: “In such passages as ‘So it is with us here’ the word ‘so’ has the meaning of definition.”

original: Vividhapāṭihāriyanti ettha pāṭihāriyapadassa vacanatthaṃ “paṭipakkhaharaṇato rāgādikilesāpanayanato
analyzed: vividha pāṭihāriyanti ettha pāṭihāriya padassa vacana attham paṭipakkha haraṇataḥ rāga ādi kilesa apanayanataḥ
translated: As regards the words “various kinds of miracles” , the word “miracle” is explained as follows: “Because it removes opposition , because it removes defilements such as lust,

original: pāṭihāriya”nti vadanti. Bhagavato pana paṭipakkhā rāgādayo na santi ye haritabbā,
analyzed: pāṭihāriyanti vadanti bhagavataḥ pana paṭipakkhāḥ rāga ādayaḥ na santi ye haritabbā
translated: it is a miracle” . But the Blessed One has no lust, etc., as opposition to remove;

original: puthujjanānampi vigatūpakkilese aṭṭhaguṇasamannāgate citte hatapaṭipakkhe iddhividhaṃ
analyzed: puthujjanānam pi vigata upakkilese aṭṭha guṇa samannāgate citte hata paṭipakkhe iddhi vidham
translated: and in the case of the ordinary man, too, the supernormal powers occur in a mind that is free from defilements and endowed with the eight factors, and the opposition has already been removed.

original: pavattati, tasmā tattha pavattavohārena ca na sakkā idha “pāṭihāriya”nti vattuṃ.
analyzed: pavattati tasmā tattha pavatta vohārena ca na sakkā idha vattum
translated: Therefore it is not possible to use the word “miracle” here in the sense of “removing opposition” .

original: Sace pana mahākāruṇikassa bhagavato veneyyagatā ca kilesā paṭipakkhā, tesaṃ haraṇato
analyzed: sace pana mahā kāruṇikassa bhagavataḥ veneyya gatā ca kilesā paṭipakkhā tesam haraṇato
translated: But if the defilements in the disciples of the Blessed One, who is of great compassion, are the opposition, and the word “miracle” is used because they are removed,

original: “pāṭihāriya”nti vuttaṃ, evaṃ sati yuttametaṃ. Atha vā bhagavato ca sāsanassa ca paṭipakkhā
analyzed: pāṭihāriyanti vuttam evam sati yuttam etam atha vā bhagavataḥ ca sāsanassa ca paṭipakkhā
translated: then it is appropriate to use it in this way. Or else the sectarians are the opposition to the Blessed One and his Dispensation;

original: titthiyā, tesaṃ haraṇato pāṭihāriyaṃ. Te hi diṭṭhiharaṇavasena diṭṭhippakāsane asamatthabhāvena
analyzed: titthiyā tesam haraṇato pāṭihāriyam te hi diṭṭhi haraṇa vasena diṭṭhi ppakāsane asamattha bhāvena
translated: the word “miracle” is used because they are removed. For they are removed by the removal of their views and by the inability of the sectarians to shine with their views.

original: ca iddhiādesanānusāsanīhi haritā apanītā hontīti. Paṭīti vā ayaṃ saddo “pacchā”ti
analyzed: ca iddhi ādesana anusāsanīhi haritāḥ apanītāḥ honti iti vā ayam saddo pacchā ati
translated: and the demonstration of psychic power, the reading of the mind, and the giving of a decisive statement are removed and taken away.

original: etassa atthaṃ bodheti “tasmiṃ paṭipaviṭṭhamhi, añño āgañchi brāhmaṇo”tiādīsu viya,🔽tasmā samāhite citte vigatūpakkilese katakiccena pacchāharitabbaṃ pavattetabbanti🔽paṭihāriyaṃ, attano vā upakkilesesu catutthajjhānamaggehi haritesu pacchā haraṇaṃ
analyzed: etassa attham bodheti tasmin paṭipaviṭṭhamhi aññaḥ āgañchi brāhmaṇa uti ādīsu viya  tasmā samāhite citte vigata upakkilese kata kiccena pacchāharitabbam pavattetabbam ti  paṭihāriyam attanaḥ vā upakkilesesu catuttha jhāna maggehi haritesu pacchā haraṇam
translated: Or alternatively, this word paṭihāriya is a synonym for pacchā,

original: paṭihāriyaṃ, iddhiādesanānusāsaniyo ca vigatūpakkilesena katakiccena ca sattahitatthaṃ🔽puna pavattetabbā, haritesu ca attano upattilesesu parasattānaṃ upakkilesaharaṇāni🔽hontīti paṭihāriyāni bhavanti, paṭihāriyameva pāṭihāriyaṃ. Paṭihāriye vā iddhiādesanānusāsanisamudāye🔽bhavaṃ ekekaṃ pāṭihāriyanti vuccati. Paṭihāriyaṃ vā catutthajjhānaṃ maggo ca paṭipakkhaharaṇato,
analyzed: paṭihāriyam iddhi ādesanā anusāsaniyo ca vigata upakkilesena kata kiccena ca satta hitattham 🔽puna pavattetabbāḥ haritesu ca attanaḥ upatti lesesu para sattānam upakkilesa haraṇāni 🔽honti iti paṭihāriyāni bhavanti paṭihāriyam eva pāṭihāriyam paṭihāriye vā iddhi ādesanā anusāsani samudāye 🔽bhavam ekekam pāṭihāriyanti vuccati paṭihāriyam vā catuttha jhānam maggo ca paṭipakkha haraṇato
