original: tattha jātaṃ, tasmiṃ vā nimittabhūte, tato vā āgatanti pāṭihāriyaṃ. Tassa pana iddhiādibhedena
analyzed: tattha jātam tasmin vā nimitta bhūte tatas vā āgatanti pāṭihāriyam tassa pana iddhi ādi bhedena
translated: Herein, what is marvellous is what is born there, or what is in that which is the sign, or what comes from that.🔽And since it is of many kinds, being classed according to the kinds of supernormal power, etc.,

original: visayabhedena ca bahuvidhassa bhagavato desanāyaṃ labbhamānattā āha “vividhapāṭihāriya”nti.🔽Na aññathāti bhagavato sammukhā sutākārato na aññathāti attho, na pana bhagavato🔽desitākārato. Acinteyyānubhāvā hi bhagavato desanā. Evañca katvā “sabbappakārena🔽ko samattho viññātu”nti idaṃ vacanaṃ samatthitaṃ bhavati, dhāraṇabaladassanañca na🔽virujjhati sutākāraavirajjhanassa adhippetattā. Na hettha atthantaratāparihāro dvinnampi
analyzed: visaya bhedena ca bahuvidhassa bhagavataḥ desanā ayam āha vividha pāṭihāriyanti  na aññathā ti bhagavataḥ sammukhā suta ākārato na aññathā ti atthaḥ na pana bhagavataḥ  desita ākārataḥ acinteyya anubhāvā hi bhagavataḥ desanā evañca katvā sabba ppakārena  kaḥ samatthaḥ viññātun ti idam vacanam samatthitam bhavati dhāraṇa bala dassanam ca na  virujjhati suta ākāra a virajjhanassa adhippeta ttā na ha ittha atthantara tā parihāraḥ dvinnam pi
translated: and according to the different kinds of object, it is said, “The many kinds of marvels.”

original: atthānaṃ ekavisayattā. Itarathā thero bhagavato desanāya sabbathā paṭiggahaṇe samattho🔽asamattho cāti āpajjeyyāti.
analyzed: atthānam eka visaya ttā itarathā theraḥ bhagavataḥ desanāya sabbathā paṭiggahaṇe samatthaḥ 🔽asamatthaḥ ca ati āpajjeyya ati
translated: “Not otherwise”: the meaning is that it is not otherwise than as heard from the Blessed One face to face. But it is not that it is as heard from the Blessed One. For the Blessed One’s teaching is inconceivable in its power. And when it is put like this, the words, “Who is able to understand in all its modes,” are justified, and the demonstration of the power of memory is not contradicted, since what is intended is that it is not otherwise than as heard. And there is no need to find another meaning for the words, since both meanings have the same reference. Otherwise it would follow that the Elder was able and unable to receive the Blessed One’s teaching in all its modes.

original: “Yo paro na hoti, so attā”ti evaṃ vuttāya niyakajjhattasaṅkhātāya sasantatiyā vattanato
analyzed: yaḥ paraḥ na hoti saḥ attā ati evam vuttāya niyaka jjhatta saṅkhātāya sa santatiyā vattanato
translated: “The other is not self” — thus, in the sense of the internal continuity called “one’s own,” he acts.

original: tividhopi me-saddo kiñcāpi ekasmiṃ eva atthe dissati, karaṇasampadānasāminiddesavasena
analyzed: tividhaḥ pi me saddaḥ kiñca api ekasmin eva atthe dissati karaṇa sampadāna sāmi niddesa vasena
translated: Although the word “me” is seen in the same meaning, by way of the instrument, the benefìciary, and the possessor,

original: pana vijjamānaṃ bhedaṃ sandhāyāha, “me-saddo tīsu atthesu dissatī”ti.
analyzed: pana vijjamānam bhedam sandhāya āha me saddaḥ tīsu atthesu dissati iti
translated: however, he says, “The word ‘me’ is seen in three meanings,” referring to the difference that exists.

original: Kiñcāpi upasaggo kiriyaṃ viseseti, jotakabhāvato pana satipi tasmiṃ suta-saddo eva🔽taṃ taṃ attaṃ vadatīti anupasaggassa suta-saddassa atthuddhāre saupasaggassa gahaṇaṃ
analyzed: kiñca api upasaggo kiriyam viseseti jotaka bhāvataḥ pana tasmin suta saddaḥ eva  tam tam attam vadati iti anupasaggassa suta saddassa attha uddhāre sa upasaggassa gahaṇam
translated: Although the prefix distinguishes the action, by way of the state of being the light, however, although it exists, the word “heard”🔽alone expresses that self. Therefore, showing that the inclusion of the prefix in the determination of the meaning of the word “heard,” which is without a prefix,

original: na virujjhatīti dassento “saupasaggo anupasaggo cā”tiādimāha. Assāti suta-saddassa.
analyzed: na virujjhati iti dassento sa upasaggaḥ anupasaggaḥ ca ati ādim āha assa ati suta saddassa
translated: is not contradictory, he says, “with and without a prefix.” “Assa” is of the word “heard.”

original: Kammabhāvasādhanāni idha sutasadde sambhavantīti vuttaṃ “upadhāritanti vā upadhāraṇanti
analyzed: kamma bhāva sādhanāni idha suta sadde sambhavanti iti vuttam upadhāritanti vā upadhāraṇanti
translated: The means of accomplishment of the action exist here in the word “heard.” Therefore, it is said, “The meaning is ‘having been remembered’ or ‘the act of remembering.’“

original: vā attho”ti. Mayāti atthe satīti yadā me-saddassa kattuvasena karaṇaniddeso, tadāti
analyzed: vā attho ti mayā ati atthe sati iti yadā me saddassa kattu vasena karaṇa niddeso tadā iti
translated: When there is the meaning of “mine,” then the word “me” is the instrument or the benefìciary.

original: attho. Mamāti atthe satīti yadā sambandhavasena sāminiddeso, tadā.
analyzed: atthaḥ mama ati atthe sati iti yadā sambandha vasena tadā
translated: ‘Meaning’ is the object. ‘When there is’ is the genitive of relationship.

original: Suta-saddasannidhāne payuttena evaṃ-saddena savanakiriyājotakena bhavitabbanti vuttaṃ
analyzed: suta sadda sannidhāne payuttena evaṃsaddena savana kiriyā jotakena bhavitabban ti vuttam
translated: Since the word ‘thus’ is used in the proximity of the word ‘heard’, it must be a sign of the act of hearing.

original: “evanti sotaviññāṇādiviññāṇakiccanidassana”nti. Ādi-saddena sampaṭicchanādīnaṃ pañcadvārikaviññāṇānaṃ
analyzed: evam ti sota viññāṇa ādi viññāṇa kicca nidassanam ti ādi saddena sampaṭicchanā ādīnam pañca dvārika viññāṇānam
translated: ‘Thus’ shows the function of the consciousnesses beginning with ear-consciousness. By the word ‘beginning’ should be understood the five-door consciousnesses of receiving, etc.,

original: tadabhinīhaṭānañca manodvārikaviññāṇānaṃ gahaṇaṃ veditabbaṃ. Sabbesampi vākyānaṃ
analyzed: tad abhinīhaṭānam ca manodvārika viññāṇānam gahaṇam veditabbam sabbesam pi vākyānam
translated: and the mind-door consciousnesses that are instigated by them. Or else, since all the sentences

original: evakāratthasahitattā “suta”nti etassa sutamevāti ayamattho labbhatīti āha “assavanabhāvapaṭikkhepato”ti.
analyzed: evakāra attha sahita ttā sutanti etassa sutam eva ati ayam atthaḥ labbhati iti āha assavana bhāva paṭikkhepato ti
translated: have the meaning of the word ‘thus’ included in them, the meaning ‘heard’ is obtained as ‘just heard’. Therefore it is said: ‘In order to exclude the state of not hearing’.

original: Etena avadhāraṇena nirāsaṅkataṃ dasseti. Yathā ca sutaṃ sutamevāti niyametabbaṃ,
analyzed: etena avadhāraṇena nirāsaṅkatam dasseti yathā ca sutam sutam eva ati niyametabbam
translated: By this specification he shows that he is free from doubt. And just as it must be limited that ‘what is heard is just heard’,

original: taṃ sammā sutaṃ hotīti āha “anūnānadhikāviparītaggahaṇanidassana”nti. Atha vā saddantaratthāpohanavasena
analyzed: tam sammā sutam hoti iti āha anūna anadhika aviparīta ggahaṇa nidassanan ti atha vā
translated: it is rightly heard. Therefore it is said: ‘It shows the apprehension of what is not deficient, not excessive, and not erroneous’. Or else,🔽by the exclusion of what is between the sounds,

original: saddo atthaṃ vadatīti sutanti asutaṃ na hotīti ayametassa atthoti vuttaṃ “assavanabhāvapaṭikkhepato”ti.
analyzed: saddaḥ attham vadati iti sutam ti a sutam na hoti iti ayam etassa atthaḥ ti vuttam a ssavana bhāva paṭikkhepato ti
translated: The sound speaks the meaning, so it is not that what is heard is not heard. This is what is meant by “in order to preclude the state of not hearing.”

original: Iminā diṭṭhādivinivattanaṃ karoti.
analyzed: iminā diṭṭha ādi vinivattanam karoti
translated: By this he makes it clear that he is not saying that he has seen and so on.

original: Idaṃ vuttaṃ hoti – na idaṃ mayā diṭṭhaṃ, na sayambhūñāṇena sacchikataṃ, atha kho
analyzed: idam vuttam hoti na idam mayā diṭṭham na sayambhu ñāṇena sacchikatam atha kho
translated: What is meant is this: “This was not seen by me, nor was it realized by my own discernment. Rather,

original: sutaṃ, tañca kho sammadevāti. Tenevāha “anūnānadhikāviparītaggahaṇanidassana”nti.
analyzed: sutam tat ca kho sammat eva ati tena iva āha anūna anadhika aviparīta ggahaṇa nidassanam ti
translated: it was heard by me, and that too in the proper way.” Hence he says, “in order to show that the statement is not deficient, excessive, or erroneous.”

original: Avadhāraṇatthe vā evaṃ-sadde ayamatthayojanā karīyatīti tadapekkhassa suta-saddassa
analyzed: avadhāraṇa atthe vā evaṃsadde ayam attha yojanā tad apekkhassa suta saddassa
translated: Or else, the word eva is for the purpose of restriction. The meaning of the phrase “what was heard by me” should be interpreted in this way.

original: ayamattho vutto “assavanabhāvapaṭikkhepato”ti. Tenevāha “anūnānadhikāviparītaggahaṇanidassana”nti.
analyzed: ayam atthaḥ vuttaḥ assavana bhāva paṭikkhepato ti tena iva āha anūna anadhika aviparīta ggahaṇa nidassananti
translated: This meaning is stated by the words “in order to preclude the state of not hearing.” Hence he says, “in order to show that the statement is not deficient, excessive, or erroneous.”

original: Savanasaddo cettha kammattho veditabbo “suyyatī”ti.
analyzed: savana saddaḥ ca ittha kammatthaḥ veditabbo
translated: The word suta should be understood here in the sense of the act of hearing, “suyyati.”

original: Evaṃ savanahetusavanavisesavasena padattayassa ekena pakārena atthayojanaṃ dassetvā
analyzed: evam savana hetu savana visesa vasena pada ttayassa ekena pakārena attha yojanam dassetvā
translated: Having thus shown the interpretation of the meaning of the three terms in one way, namely, by way of the cause of hearing and the distinction in hearing,

original: idāni pakārantarehi taṃ dassetuṃ “tathā eva”ntiādi vuttaṃ. Tattha tassāti yā sā bhagavato🔽sammukhā dhammassavanākārena pavattā manodvāraviññāṇavīthi, tassā. Sā hi nānappakārena🔽ārammaṇe pavattetuṃ samatthā. Tathā ca vuttaṃ “sotadvārānusārenā”ti. Nānappakārenāti🔽vakkhamānānaṃ anekavihitānaṃ byañjanatthaggahaṇānaṃ nānākārena. Etena imissā yojanāya
analyzed: idāni pakāra antarehi tam dassetum tathā eva ntiādi vuttam tattha tassa ti yā sā bhagavato  sammukhā dhamma ssavana ākārena pavattā manaḥ dvāra viññāṇa vīthi tassā sā hi nānappakārena  ārammaṇe pavattetum samatthā tathā ca vuttam sota dvāra anusārena ati nānappakārena ati  vakkhamānānam aneka vihitānam byañjana attha ggahaṇānam nānā ākārena etena imissā yojanāya
translated: Now, in order to show it by other words, “In the same way” is said. Herein, of that means of the mind-door adverting consciousness that occurred in the way of listening to the Dhamma face to face with the Blessed One. For that is able to occur with respect to an object in various ways. And that is said thus: “By following the ear door” . In various ways means in various ways of the many kinds of grasping of the syllables that are going to be spoken of. By this it is shown that this interpretation is not a mere invention of the author’s own mind.

original: ākārattho evaṃ-saddo gahitoti dīpeti. Pavattibhāvappakāsananti pavattiyā atthitāpakāsanaṃ.🔽Sutanti dhammappakāsananti yasmiṃ ārammaṇe vuttappakārā viññāṇavīthi nānappakārena🔽pavattā, tassa dhammattā vuttaṃ, na suta-saddassa dhammatthattā. Vuttassevatthassa
analyzed: ākāra atthaḥ evaṃsaddaḥ gahitaḥ iti dīpeti pavatti bhāva pakāsanam ti pavattiyāḥ atthi tā apakāsanam 🔽sutam ti dhamma ppakāsanam ti yasmin ārammaṇe vutta ppakārā viññāṇa vīthi nānā ppakārena 🔽pavattā tassa dhamma ttā vuttam na suta saddassa dhamma ttha ttā
translated: Now, in order to show that by other means, it is said, “In the same way, etc.” Herein, of that is of that process of door-consciousness of the mind that occurs in the mode of listening to the True Idea in the Blessed One’s presence. For that is capable of occurring with respect to an object in various modes, and that is why it is said, “By following the ear door” . In various modes is in various modes of the many kinds of grasping of the letter-sounds that are about to be mentioned. By this he shows that in this interpretation the word eva is taken in the sense of mode. 10 The word “showing” is a locution for the state of occurrence.11 The word “heard” is a locution for the True Idea.12 The meaning is that since the process of consciousness that occurs in the way stated with respect to that object is a True Idea, it is said to be so, not because the word “heard” is a locution for a True Idea.13 The meaning stated is this:

original: pākaṭīkaraṇaṃ “ayaṃ hetthā”tiādi. Tattha viññāṇavīthiyāti karaṇatthe karaṇavacanaṃ, mayāti kattuatthe.
analyzed: pākaṭīkaraṇam ayam hettha atiādi tattha viññāṇa vīthiyā iti karaṇa atthe karaṇa vacanam mayā iti kattu atthe
translated: The demonstration is “this is below” and so on. Herein, “in the consciousness sequence” is a locative in the sense of instrumentality, while “mine” is a locative in the sense of agency.

original: Evanti niddisitabbappakāsananti nidassanatthamevaṃ saddaṃ gahetvā vuttaṃ nidassetabbassa
analyzed: evam ti niddisitabba ppakāsanam ti nidassana attham evam saddam gahetvā vuttam nidassetabbassa
translated: “Thus” is a demonstrative particle. The word “thus” is used in order to demonstrate.🔽Because there is no demonstration of what is to be demonstrated,

original: niddisitabbattābhāvābhāvato. Tena evaṃ-saddena sakalampi suttaṃ paccāmaṭṭhanti dasseti.
analyzed: niddisitabba ttā bhāva abhāvataḥ tena evaṃsaddena sakalam pi suttam paccāmaṭṭhanti dasseti
translated: by the word “thus” the whole sutta is referred to.

original: Suta-saddassa kiriyāsaddattā savanakiriyāya ca sādhāraṇaviññāṇappabandhapaṭibaddhattā🔽tattha ca puggalavohāroti vuttaṃ “sutanti puggalakiccappakāsana”nti. Na hi puggalavohārarahite
analyzed: suta saddassa kiriyā sadda ttā savana kiriyāya ca sādhāraṇa viññāṇa ppabandha paṭibaddha ttā  tattha ca puggala vohāraḥ ti vuttam sutam ti puggala kicca ppakāsanam ti na hi puggala vohāra rahite
translated: Because the word “heard” is a verbal noun, and because the act of hearing is related to a continuity of consciousness that is shared,🔽and because the continuity of consciousness is related to a person, it is said, “Heard is the act of a person.”

original: dhammappabandhe savanakiriyā labbhatīti.🔽Yassa cittasantānassātiādipi ākāratthameva evaṃ-saddaṃ gahetvā purimayojanāya aññathā
analyzed: dhammappabandhe savana kiriyā labbhati iti  yassa citta santānassa ati ādi pi ākāra attham eva evaṃsaddam gahetvā purima yojanāya aññathā
translated: For the act of hearing is not possible in a continuity of states devoid of the designation of a person.

original: atthayojanaṃ dassetuṃ vuttaṃ. Tattha ākārapaññattīti upādāpaññatti eva dhammānaṃ
analyzed: attha yojanam dassetum vuttam tattha ākāra paññatti iti upādā paññatti eva dhammānam
translated: “In the case of a continuity of consciousness” and so on is said in order to show the interpretation of the meaning in a way different from the previous interpretation by taking the word “thus” in the sense of mode. Herein, “mode” is the designation by way of the aggregates.

original: pavattiākārupādānavasena tathā vuttā. Sutanti visayaniddesoti sotabbabhūto dhammo
analyzed: pavatti ākāra upādāna vasena tathā vuttā sutam nti visaya niddesaḥ ti sotabba bhūtaḥ dhammo
translated: It is so called because of the mode of occurrence and the object of clinging. “Heard” is the designation of the object.

original: savanakiriyākattupuggalassa savanakiriyāvasena pavattiṭṭhānanti katvā vuttaṃ. Cittasantānavinimuttassa
analyzed: savana kiriyā kattu puggalassa savana kiriyā vasena pavatti ṭṭhānam ti katvā vuttam citta santāna vinimuttassa
translated: The object of the sound is the state of the sound as the object of the act of hearing.🔽Although there is no real doer apart from the mental continuum,

original: paramatthato kassaci kattu abhāvepi saddavohārena buddhiparikappitabhedavacanicchāya
analyzed: paramatthataḥ kassaci abhāve pi sadda vohārena buddhi parikappita bheda vacanicchāya
translated: still, by way of the conventional expression of the sound, and by way of the desire to speak of the distinction that is imagined by the intellect,

original: cittasantānato aññaṃ viya taṃsamaṅgiṃ katvā vuttaṃ “cittasantānena taṃsamaṅgīno”ti.🔽Savanakiriyāvisayopi sotabbadhammo savanakiriyāvasena pavattacittasantānassa idha
analyzed: citta santānataḥ aññam viya taṃsamaṅgim katvā vuttam citta santānena taṃsamaṅgīno ti  savana kiriyā visayaḥ api sotabba dhammo savana kiriyā vasena pavatta citta santānassa idha
translated: it is said as if it were different from the mental continuum, “by the mental continuum, which is a part of that.”🔽The object of the act of hearing is the state of the sound as the object of the act of hearing.🔽Although the mental continuum that occurs by way of the act of hearing is the real doer here,

original: paramatthato kattubhāvato, savanavasena cittappavattiyā eva vā savanakiriyābhāvato🔽taṃkiriyākattu ca visayo hotīti vuttaṃ “taṃsamaṅgīno kattuvisaye”ti. Sutākārassa
analyzed: paramatthataḥ kattu bhāvataḥ savana vasena citta ppavattiyāḥ eva vā savana kiriyā bhāvataḥ  ca visayaḥ hoti iti vuttam suta ākārassa
translated: still, because the act of hearing is the occurrence of consciousness by way of hearing,🔽it is said, “the object of the doer of that act,” as if it were the object of the act of hearing.🔽And because the Elder, who is the mode of hearing, is rightly considered,

original: ca therassa sammānicchitabhāvato āha “gahaṇasanniṭṭhāna”nti. Etena vā avadhāraṇatthaṃ
analyzed: ca therassa sammā nicchita bhāvataḥ āha gahaṇa sanniṭṭhānam ti etena vā avadhāraṇa attham
translated: it is said, “the determination of grasping.” Or this is said for the purpose of restriction.

original: evaṃ-saddaṃ gahetvā ayamatthayojanā katāti daṭṭhabbaṃ.
analyzed: evaṃsaddam gahetvā ayam attha yojanā katā iti daṭṭhabbam
translated: and this interpretation of the meaning should be seen as being based on that.

original: Pubbe sutānaṃ nānāvihitānaṃ suttasaṅkhātānaṃ atthabyañjanānaṃ upadhāritarūpassa ākārassa
analyzed: pubbe sutānam nānā vihitānam sutta saṅkhātānam attha byañjanānam upadhārita rūpassa ākārassa
translated: The nature of the manifestation, or the determination, of the form of the recollection of the various kinds of meanings and phrasing called “discourses” that have been heard previously,

original: nidassanassa, avadhāraṇassa vā pakāsanasabhāvo evaṃ-saddoti tadākārādiupadhāraṇassa
analyzed: nidassanassa avadhāraṇassa vā pakāsana sabhāvaḥ evaṃsaddaḥ ti tad ākāra ādi upadhāraṇassa
translated: is the word “thus.” The word “thus” is the nature of the manifestation of the form of the recollection of that, etc.

original: puggalapaññattiyā upādānabhūtadhammappabandhabyāpāratāya vuttaṃ “evanti puggalakiccaniddeso”ti.
analyzed: puggala paññattiyāḥ upādāna bhūta dhamma ppabandha byāpāra tāya vuttam evam ti puggala kicca niddesaḥ ti
translated: Because of the scope of the collection of states that are the basis for the designation of a person, it is said: “Thus is the designation of the function of a person.”

original: Savanakiriyā pana puggalavādinopi viññāṇanirapekkhā natthīti visesato viññāṇabyāpāroti
analyzed: savana kiriyā pana puggala vādino pi viññāṇa nirapekkhā natthi iti visesataḥ viññāṇa byāpāraḥ ti
translated: But the act of hearing is not independent of consciousness even for one who holds the doctrine of the person. Therefore, the act of consciousness is particularly mentioned:

original: āha “sutanti viññāṇakiccaniddeso”ti. Meti saddappavattiyā ekanteneva sattavisayattā
analyzed: āha sutam ti viññāṇa kicca niddeso ti mā iti sadda ppavattiyāḥ ekantena iva satta visaya ttā
translated: “Heard” is the designation of the function of consciousness. Because the occurrence of the word “mine” is exclusively the domain of the person,

original: viññāṇakiccassa ca tattheva samodahitabbato “meti ubhayakiccayuttapuggalaniddeso”ti
analyzed: viññāṇa kiccassa ca tattha iva samodahitabbataḥ mā iti ubhaya kicca yutta puggala niddeso ti
translated: and because the function of consciousness is included right there, it is said: “Mine is the designation of the person connected with both functions.”

original: vuttaṃ. Avijjamānapaññattivijjamānapaññattisabhāvā yathākkamaṃ evaṃ-saddasuta-saddānaṃ
analyzed: vuttam avijjamāna paññatti vijjamāna paññatti sabhāvāḥ yathākkamam evaṃsadda suta saddānam
translated: The nature of the word “thus” and the word “heard” is, respectively, the designation of what is not and the designation of what is.

original: atthāti te tathārūpa-paññatti-upādānabhūta-dhammappabandhabyāpārabhāvena dassento🔽āha – “evanti puggalakiccaniddeso, sutanti viññāṇakiccaniddeso”ti. Ettha ca karaṇakiriyākattukamma-visesappakāsanavasena🔽puggalabyāpāravisaya-puggalabyāpāranidassanavasena gahaṇākāragāhakatabbisayavisesaniddesavasena
analyzed: attha iti te tathārūpa paññatti upādāna bhūta dhamma ppabandha byāpāra bhāvena dassento  āha evam ti puggala kicca niddeso sutanti viññāṇa kicca niddeso ti ettha ca karaṇa kiriyā kattu kamma visesa pakāsana vasena
translated: showing the meaning of that as the state of being the bond of the dhammas that are the objective field of the apprehension of description in that way,🔽he said: “Thus is the description of the function of the person, and so on.” And here the four other interpretations of the meaning should be regarded as shown by the way of the manifestation of the distinction of the instrument, the action, the doer, and the effect,🔽by the way of the manifestation of the objective field and the function of the person, by the way of the description of the distinction of the object of the mode of apprehension and the mode of apprehension,

original: kattukaraṇabyāpāra-kattuniddesavasena ca dutiyādayo catasso atthayojanā dassitāti daṭṭhabbaṃ.
analyzed: kattu karaṇa byāpāra kattu niddesa vasena ca dutiya ādayo catasso attha yojanā dassitā iti daṭṭhabbam
translated: and by the way of the description of the function of the instrument and the action.

original: Sabbassapi saddādhigamanīyassa atthassa paññattimukheneva paṭipajjitabbattā sabbapaññattīnañca🔽vijjamānādivasena chasu paññattibhedesu antogadhattā tesu “eva”ntiādīnaṃ paññattīnaṃ
analyzed: sabbassa api sadda adhigamanīyassa atthassa paññatti mukhena iva paṭipajjitabba ttā sabba paññattīnam ca  vijjamāna ādi vasena chasu paññatti bhedesu tesu eva nti ādīnam paññattīnam
translated: Because all the meaning that can be understood from the words should be undertaken by way of description only, and because all descriptions are included among the six kinds of description🔽as existent, and so on, he said: “Thus is the description of the function of the person, and so on,” showing the individual essences of the descriptions beginning with “thus.”

original: sarūpaṃ niddhārento āha “evanti ca meti cā”tiādi. Tattha evanti ca meti ca vuccamānassa
analyzed: sarūpam niddhārentaḥ āha evam iti ca mā iti ca atiādi tattha evam iti ca mā iti ca vuccamānassa
translated: Herein, the words “thus” and “by me” are said to be

original: atthassa ākārādino dhammānaṃ asalakkhaṇabhāvato avijjamānapaññattibhāvoti āha “saccikaṭṭhaparamatthavasena
analyzed: atthassa ākāra ādinaḥ dhammānam asalakkhaṇa bhāvataḥ avijjamāna paññatti bhāvaḥ ti āha saccikaṭṭha paramattha vasena
translated: since the mode of state of dhammas such as the meaning, etc., is not a characteristic of the individual essence, it is non-existent as description. Hence he said, “in the sense of the real individual essence and the ultimate meaning.”

original: avijjamānapaññattī”ti. Tattha saccikaṭṭhaparamatthavasenāti bhūtatthauttamatthavasena.
analyzed: a vijjamāna paññatti iti tattha saccikaṭṭha paramattha vasena ati bhūtattha auttamattha vasena
translated: Herein, in the sense of the real individual essence and the ultimate meaning: in the sense of the true meaning and the supreme meaning.

original: Idaṃ vuttaṃ hoti – yo māyāmarīciādayo viya abhūtattho, anussavādīhi gahetabbo viya
analyzed: idam vuttam hoti yaḥ māyā marīci ādayaḥ viya abhūta atthaḥ anussava ādīhi gahetabbaḥ viya
translated: What is meant is this. That which is not a meaning that is not true, like a magical creation, a mirage, etc., and which is not a meaning that is not supreme, like what is to be apprehended by the traditionalists,

original: anuttamattho ca na hoti, so rūpasaddādisabhāvo, ruppanānubhavanādisabhāvo vā attho
analyzed: anuttama atthaḥ ca na hoti saḥ rūpa sadda ādi sabhāvaḥ ruppana anubhavana ādi sabhāvaḥ vā attho
translated: is called the real individual essence and the ultimate meaning, since it is the meaning that is the individual essence of visible form, sound, etc., or the individual essence of the act of seeing, the act of hearing, etc.

original: saccikaṭṭho paramattho cāti vuccati, na tathā evaṃ meti padānaṃ atthoti. Etamevatthaṃ🔽pākaṭataraṃ kātuṃ “kiñhetthata”ntiādi vuttaṃ. Sutanti pana saddāyatanaṃ sandhāyāha
analyzed: saccikaṭṭhaḥ paramattho ca ati vuccati na tathā evam mā iti padānam attho ti etam eva attham  pākaṭataram kātum kiñha itthatanti ādi vuttam sutanti pana sadda āyatanam sandhāya āha
translated: The meaning of the words “it is thus with me” is not like that. In order to make this meaning clear, he said, “What is meant here?”🔽But he said, “existent as description” with reference to the sound base,

original: “vijjamānapaññattī”ti. Teneva hi “yañhi taṃ ettha sotena upaladdha”nti vuttaṃ. Sotadvārānusārena
analyzed: vijjamāna paññattī iti tena iva hi yat hi tam ettha sotena upaladdhan ti vuttam sota dvāra anusārena
translated: for it is said, “What is apprehended here by the ear” .

original: upaladdhanti pana vutte atthabyañjanādi sabbaṃ labbhatīti. Taṃ taṃ upādāya vattabbatoti
analyzed: upaladdhanti pana vutte attha byañjana ādi sabbam labbhati iti tam tam upādāya vattabbato ti
translated: The meaning is that it is to be spoken of by taking that and that,

original: sotapathamāgate dhamme upādāya tesaṃ upadhāritākārādino paccāmasanavasena evanti,
analyzed: sota pathama āgate dhamme upādāya tesam upadhārita ākāra ādino pacca āmasana vasena evanti
translated: that is, by way of the recollection of the aspect of apprehending them, etc., when the ideas come into the hearing path,🔽and by way of the “mine” when the aggregates included in one’s own continuity are taken.

original: sasantatipariyāpanne khandhe upādāya meti vattabbattāti attho. Diṭṭhādisabhāvarahite
analyzed: sa santati pariyāpanne khandhe upādāya mā iti vattabba ttā ti atthaḥ diṭṭha ādi sabhāva rahite
translated: The meaning is that it is to be spoken of by taking the seen, etc.,

original: saddāyatane pavattamānopi sutavohāro “dutiyaṃ tatiya”ntiādiko viya paṭhamādīni diṭṭhamutaviññāte
analyzed: sadda āyatane pavattamānaḥ api suta vohāraḥ dutiyam tatiya nti ādikaḥ viya paṭhama ādīni diṭṭha muta viññāte
translated: as a basis, though the heard mode of expression, which occurs in the sound object, is like the “second,” “third,” etc.,🔽which occur in dependence on the seen, heard, sensed, and cognized.

original: apekkhitvā pavattoti āha “diṭṭhādīni upanidhāya vattabbato”ti. Asutaṃ na hotīti hi
analyzed: apekkhitvā pavattaḥ ti āha diṭṭha ādīni upanidhāya vattabbato ti asutam na hoti iti hi
translated: The meaning of “heard” is made clear by the words “it is not unheard.”

original: sutanti pakāsitoyamatthoti.🔽Attanā paṭividdhā suttassa pakāravisesā evanti therena paccāmaṭṭhāti āha “asammohaṃ
analyzed: sutanti pakāsitaḥ yam attho ti  attanā paṭividdhā suttassa pakāra visesā evanti therena paccāmaṭṭhā ti āha asammohaṃ
translated: The meaning is that the heard is made clear.🔽The meaning is that the heard is made clear by the Elder, who recollects the phrasing of the text as he has penetrated it.🔽The meaning is that the Elder makes clear his own non-confusion.

original: dīpetī”ti. Nānappakārapaṭivedhasamattho hotīti etena vakkhamānassa suttassa nānappakārataṃ
analyzed: dīpeti iti nānā pakāra paṭivedha samatthaḥ hoti iti etena vakkhamānassa suttassa nānā ppakāra taṃ
translated: By this phrase he shows that he is able to penetrate the text in various ways.

original: duppaṭivijjhatañca dasseti. Sutassa asammosaṃ dīpetīti sutākārassa yāthāvato dassiyamānattā
analyzed: duppaṭivijjhatam ca dasseti sutassa asammosam dīpeti iti suta ākārassa yāthāvataḥ dassiyamāna ttā
translated: and he shows that it is hard to penetrate. He illustrates the non-forgetting of what is heard: because the mode of what is heard is shown as it actually is,

original: vuttaṃ. Asammohenāti sammohābhāvena, paññāya eva vā savanakālasambhūtāya taduttarakālapaññāsiddhi.
analyzed: vuttam asammohena ati sammoha abhāvena paññāya eva vā savana kāla sambhūtāya tad uttara kāla paññā siddhi
translated: it is said. By non-delusion: by the absence of delusion, or else by the understanding that arose at the time of hearing, and by the success of the understanding that comes after that.

original: Evaṃ asammosenāti etthāpi vattabbaṃ. Byañjanānaṃ paṭivijjhitabbo ākāro nātigambhīro
analyzed: evam a sammosena ati ettha api vattabbam byañjanānam paṭivijjhitabbaḥ ākāraḥ na ati gambhīraḥ
translated: So too in the case of non-forgetting. The mode of the phrasing that has to be penetrated is not too deep,

original: yathāsutadhāraṇameva tattha karaṇīyanti satiyā byāpāro adhiko, paññā tattha guṇībhūtāti
analyzed: yathā suta dhāraṇam eva tattha karaṇīyanti satiyāḥ byāpāraḥ adhikaḥ paññā tattha guṇībhūtā ati
translated: and the function there is that of mindfulness, which is the more prominent factor, while understanding is the subordinate factor,

original: vuttaṃ “paññāpubbaṅgamāyā”tiādi paññāya pubbaṅgamāti katvā. Pubbaṅgamatā cettha padhānatā
analyzed: vuttam paññā pubbaṅgamāya ātiādi paññāya pubbaṅgamā ati katvā pubbaṅgama tā ca ittha padhāna tā
translated: so it is said, “With understanding as the forerunner,” etc., making understanding the forerunner by taking it as the forerunner. And here the meaning of “fore- runner” is the meaning of “predominant”

original: “manopubbaṅgamā”tiādīsu viya. Pubbaṅgamatāya vā cakkhuviññāṇādīsu āvajjanādīnaṃ viya
analyzed: manaḥ pubbaṅgamā ti ādīsu viya pubbaṅgama tāya vā cakkhu viññāṇa ādīsu āvajjana ādīnam viya
translated: as in such passages as “Mind precedes phenomena” . Or alternatively, just as in the case of eye-consciousness, etc., attention, etc., are subordinate to the eye, etc.,

original: appadhānatte paññā pubbaṅgamā etissāti ayampi attho yujjati, evaṃ sati pubbaṅgamāyāti
analyzed: appadhāna tte paññā pubbaṅgamā etissa ati ayam pi atthaḥ yujjati evam sati pubbaṅgamāya ati
translated: so too understanding is the forerunner in the sense that it is subordinate to mindfulness in the sense of “fore-runner.” This meaning is also appropriate. When that is so, then the words “with understanding as the forerunner”

original: etthāpi vuttavipariyāyena yathāsambhavaṃ attho veditabbo. Atthabyañjanasampannassāti🔽atthabyañjanaparipuṇṇassa, saṅkāsana-pakāsana-vivaraṇa-vibhajana-uttānīkaraṇapaññattivasena
analyzed: ettha api vutta vipariyāyena yathāsambhavam atthaḥ veditabbaḥ attha byañjana sampannassa ati  attha byañjana paripuṇṇassa saṅkāsana pakāsana vivaraṇa vibhajana auttānīkaraṇa paññatti vasena
translated: Here too the meaning should be understood according to the opposite of what has been said above. Possessing the meaning and the letter:🔽endowed with the six meanings of the text, namely, the meaning of the text as a whole, the meaning of the words, the meaning of the phrases, the meaning of the syllables, the meaning of the arrangement, and the meaning of the teaching,

original: chahi atthapadehi, akkharapadabyañjanākāraniruttiniddesavasena chahi byañjanapadehi
analyzed: chahi attha padehi akkhara pada byañjana ākāra nirutti niddesa vasena chahi byañjana padehi
translated: and with the six letters of the text, namely, the letter as sound, the letter as word, the letter as phrase, the letter as reason, the letter as definition, and the letter as explanation.

original: ca samannāgatassāti vā attho daṭṭhabbo.
analyzed: ca samannāgatassa ati vā atthaḥ daṭṭhabbo
translated: Or the meaning should be understood as follows: The word “thus” indicates proper attention,

original: Yoniso manasikāraṃ dīpeti evaṃ-saddena vuccamānānaṃ ākāranidassanāvadhāraṇatthānaṃ🔽aviparītasaddhammavisayattāti adhippāyo. Avikkhepaṃ dīpetīti “oghataraṇasuttaṃ kattha🔽bhāsita”ntiādipucchāvasena pakaraṇappavattassa vakkhamānassa suttassa savanaṃ samādhānamantarena
analyzed: yonisaḥ manasikāram dīpeti evaṃsaddena vuccamānānam ākāra nidassana avadhāraṇa tthānam  aviparīta saddhamma visaya ttā ti adhippāyaḥ avikkhepam dīpeti iti oghataraṇa suttam kattha  bhāsita nti ādi pucchā vasena pakaraṇa ppavattassa vakkhamānassa suttassa savanam samādhānam antarena
translated: because it is the means of determining the mode of the teaching of the Dhamma. The word “thus” indicates non-distraction,🔽because it is impossible to listen to the sutta that is being expounded in the text by way of the questions beginning, “Where was the sutta on crossing the flood spoken?” without concentration.

original: na sambhavatīti katvā vuttaṃ. Vikkhittacittassātiādi tassevatthassa samatthanavasena
analyzed: na sambhavati iti katvā vuttam vikkhitta cittassa atiādi tassa iva atthassa samatthana vasena
translated: The words “with a distracted mind” and so forth

original: vuttaṃ. Sabbasampattiyāti atthabyañjanadesaka-payojanādisampattiyā. Aviparītasaddhammavisayehi
analyzed: vuttam sabba sampattiyā ti attha byañjana desaka payojana ādi sampattiyā aviparīta saddhamma visayehi
translated: “The Blessed One has said this. ‘In every way’: in the sense of the perfection of meaning and of phrasing, of teaching, of purpose, and so on.

original: viya ākāranidassanāvadhāraṇatthehi yonisomanasikārassa, saddhammassavanena viya ca🔽avikkhepassa yathā yonisomanasikārena phalabhūtena attasammāpaṇidhipubbekatapuññatānaṃ
analyzed: viya ākāra nidassana avadhāraṇa atthehi yonisoma nasikārassa saddhamma ssavanena ca  avikkhepassa yathā yoniso manasikārena phala bhūtena atta sammāpaṇidhi pubbekata puñña tānam
translated: Just as the perfection of the listening is shown by the words ‘with right mental activity’ and ‘with right attention’ in the sense of defining the mode of the perfection of the listening,🔽so the perfection of the non-distraction is shown by the words ‘with right attention’ and ‘with right concentration’ in the sense of defining the mode of the perfection of the non-distraction.

original: siddhi vuttā tadavinābhāvato, evaṃ avikkhepeneva phalabhūtena kāraṇabhūtānaṃ saddhammassavanasappurisūpanissayānaṃ
analyzed: siddhi vuttā tad avinābhāvataḥ evam avikkhepena iva phala bhūtena kāraṇa bhūtānam saddhamma ssavana sappurisa upanissayānam
translated: Just as the success of the right disposition of self and of previous wholesome roots is stated by the perfection of right attention as its fruit, so the success of the listening to the true Dhamma and of the reliance on good people as its causes is shown by the non-distraction as its fruit.

original: siddhi dassetabbā siyā assutavato sappurisūpanissayarahitassa ca tadabhāvato. “Na🔽hi vikkhittacitto”tiādinā samatthanavacanena pana avikkhepena kāraṇabhūtena sappurisūpanissayena
analyzed: siddhi dassetabbā siyā assutavataḥ sappurisa upanissaya rahitassa ca tad abhāvataḥ na  hi vikkhitta citta iti ādinā samatthana vacanena pana avikkhepena kāraṇa bhūtena sappurisa upanissayena
translated: For without the non-distraction there is no success of the listening to the true Dhamma and of the reliance on good people.🔽But the success of the listening to the true Dhamma as the fruit of the reliance on good people and of the non-distraction as its cause is shown by the words ‘For one whose mind is distracted’ and so on, which are words of proof.

original: ca phalabhūtassa saddhammassavanassa siddhi dassitā. Ayaṃ panettha adhippāyo yutto
analyzed: ca phala bhūtassa saddhamma ssavanassa siddhi dassitā ayam pana ittha adhippāyaḥ yuttaḥ
translated: This is the proper interpretation here.

original: siyā, saddhammassavanasappurisūpanissayā na ekantena avikkhepassa kāraṇaṃ bāhiraṅgattā.🔽Avikkhepo pana sappurisūpanissayo viya saddhammassavanassa ekantakāraṇanti, evampi
analyzed: siyā saddhamma ssavana sappurisa upanissayāḥ na ekantena avikkhepassa kāraṇam bāhiraṅga ttā  avikkhepaḥ pana sappurisa upanissayaḥ viya saddhamma ssavanassa ekanta kāraṇan ti evam pi
translated: and listening to the True Idea and the companionship of good persons are not the sole cause of non-distraction, because they are external factors.🔽But non-distraction is the sole cause of listening to the True Idea, as the companionship of good persons is.

original: avikkhepena sappurisūpanissayasiddhijotanā na samatthitāva, no na samatthitā vikkhittacittānaṃ
analyzed: avikkhepena sappurisa upanissaya siddhi jotanā na samatthitā ava no na samatthitā vikkhitta cittānam
translated: So in this way too the demonstration of the establishment of the companionship of good persons by non-distraction is not only, but also not not, because the state of not attending on good persons is established by the meaning.

original: sappurisapayirūpāsanābhāvassa atthasiddhito. Ettha ca purimaṃ phalena kāraṇassa siddhidassanaṃ
analyzed: attha siddhitaḥ ettha ca purimam phalena kāraṇassa siddhi dassanam
translated: And here the first is a demonstration of the establishment of the cause by the fruit,

original: nadīpūrena viya upari vuṭṭhisabbhāvassa. Dutiyaṃ kāraṇena phalassa siddhidassanaṃ
analyzed: nadīpūrena viya upari vuṭṭhi sabbhāvassa dutiyam kāraṇena phalassa siddhi dassanam
translated: like the demonstration of the state of raining above by the filling of the river. The second is a demonstration of the establishment of the fruit by the cause,

original: daṭṭhabbaṃ ekantavassinā viya meghavuṭṭhānena vuṭṭhippavattiyā.
analyzed: daṭṭhabbam ekantavassinā viya megha vuṭṭhānena vuṭṭhi ppavattiyā
translated: like the demonstration of the state of raining by the cloud’s raining down, which is seen by one who is standing on the bank.

original: Bhagavato vacanassa atthabyañjanapabheda-paricchedavasena sakalasāsanasampatti-ogāhanākāro
analyzed: bhagavato vacanassa attha byañjana pabheda pariccheda vasena sakala sāsana sampatti ogāhana ākāraḥ
translated: The way of entering into the whole of the True Idea, which is called ‘ the Blessed One’s word ‘ , by means of the delimitation of the analysis of the meaning and the phrasing,🔽is the cause of the fulfilment of the whole of the True Idea without remainder. That is why it is said ‘ So excellent is the way ‘ .

original: niravasesaparahita-pāripūrikāraṇanti vuttaṃ “evaṃ bhaddako ākāro”ti. Yasmā na hotīti
analyzed: niravasesa para hita pāripūri kāraṇanti vuttam evam bhaddakaḥ ākāro ti yasmā na hoti iti
translated: Since it is not so,

original: sambandho. Pacchimacakkadvayasampattinti attasammāpaṇidhi-pubbekatapuññatā-saṅkhātaṃ
analyzed: sambandhaḥ pacchima cakka dvaya sampattinti atta sammāpaṇidhi pubbekata puñña tā saṅkhātam
translated: and the connection. The attainment of the two latter wheels is the two qualities called right aspiration and merit made in the past.

original: guṇadvayaṃ. Aparāparavuttiyā cettha cakkabhāvo, caranti etehi sattā, sampattibhavesūti
analyzed: guṇa dvayam apara apara vuttiyā ca ittha cakka bhāvaḥ caranti etehi sattā sampatti bhavesu iti
translated: Herein, the state of being a wheel is the occurrence of these two wheels in the other and the other existence, or else beings go by means of these in the existences of success.

original: vā. Ye sandhāya vuttaṃ “cattārimāni, bhikkhave, cakkāni, yehi samannāgatānaṃ devamanussānaṃ
analyzed: vā ye sandhāya vuttam cattāri imāni bhikkhave cakkāni yehi samannāgatānam deva manussānam
translated: It is with reference to these that it is said, “Bhikkhus, there are these four wheels. Possessed of these four wheels, gods and humans …

original: catucakkaṃ vattatī”tiādi. Purimapacchimabhāvo cettha desanakkamavasena daṭṭhabbo.🔽Pacchimacakkadvayasiddhiyāti pacchimacakkadvayassa ca atthitāya. Sammāpaṇihitatto
analyzed: catu cakkam vattati itiādi purima pacchima bhāvo ca ittha desana kkama vasena daṭṭhabbo  pacchima cakka dvaya siddhiyā ti pacchima cakka dvayassa ca atthitāya sammā paṇihita tto
translated: the wheel turns” , and so on. And here the state of being prior and subsequent should be regarded as being due to the order in which the teaching is given.

original: pubbe ca katapuñño suddhāsayo hoti tadasuddhihetūnaṃ kilesānaṃ dūrībhāvatoti āha
analyzed: pubbe ca kata puññaḥ suddha āsayaḥ hoti tad asuddhi hetūnam kilesānam dūrībhāvato ti āha
translated: The establishment of the two latter wheels is the existence of the two latter wheels. He is one whose intention is right aspiration and one who has made merit in the past. He is one whose faith is purified because of the remoteness of the defilements that are the cause of its lack of purification. Hence it is said:🔽“The purification of his faith is established.” For this is said:

original: “āsayasuddhi siddhā hotī”ti. Tathā hi vuttaṃ – “sammāpaṇihitaṃ cittaṃ, seyyaso naṃ
analyzed: āsaya suddhi siddhā hoti iti tathā hi vuttam sammāpaṇihitam cittam
translated: “The mind that is rightly directed,🔽he makes to be still more excellent.

original: tato kare”ti “katapuññosi, tvaṃ ānanda, padhānamanuyuñja, khippaṃ hohisi anāsavo”ti
analyzed: tatas kara iti kata puññaḥ asi tvam ānanda padhānam anuyuñja khippam hohisi anāsavaḥ ti
translated: “You have made merit, Ānanda, devote yourself to jhāna, soon you will be free from the corruptions” .

original: ca. Tenevāha “āsayasuddhiyā adhigamabyattisiddhī”ti. Payogasuddhiyāti yonisomanasikārapubbaṅgamassa🔽dhammassavanapayogassa visadabhāvena. Tathā cāha “āgamabyattisiddhī”ti, sabbassa
analyzed: ca tena iva āha āsaya suddhiyā adhigama byatti siddhi iti payoga suddhiyā iti yoniso manasikāra pubbaṅgamassa  dhamma ssavana payogassa visada bhāvena tathā ca āha āgama byatti siddhi iti sabbassa
translated: Hence he said: “The success of the penetration of the attainment is through the purification of the basis.”🔽Through the purification of the practice: through the clarity of the practice of listening to the Dhamma, which is preceded by right reflection.

original: vā kāyavacīpayogassa niddosabhāvena. Parisuddhakāyavacīpayogo hi vippaṭisārābhāvato
analyzed: vā kāya vacī payogassa niddosa bhāvena parisuddha kāya vacī payogaḥ hi vippaṭisāra abhāvato
translated: Thus he said: “The success of the penetration of the scriptures is through the purification of the practice.” Or else, through the harmlessness of all the practice of body and speech.

original: avikkhittacitto pariyattiyaṃ visārado hotīti.🔽Nānappakārapaṭivedhadīpakenātiādinā atthabyañjanesu therassa evaṃ-saddasuta-saddānaṃ🔽asammohāsammosadīpanato catupaṭisambhidāvasena atthayojanaṃ dasseti. Tattha sotabbabhedapaṭivedhadīpakenāti
analyzed: a vikkhitta cittaḥ pariyattiyam visāradaḥ hoti iti  nānā pakāra paṭivedha dīpakena ati ādinā attha byañjanesu therassa evaṃsadda suta saddānam  asammoha asammosa dīpanataḥ catu paṭisambhidā vasena attha yojanam dasseti tattha sotabba bheda paṭivedha dīpakena ati
translated: For one whose practice of body and speech is pure is free from remorse, and so his mind is not distracted. He is confident in the scriptures.🔽Through the illumination of the penetration of the various kinds of meaning, etc.: by this he shows the interpretation of the meaning and the phrasing by way of the four discriminations, in order to show that the elder is not confused or bewildered about the words “evaṃ me sutaṃ” .

original: etena ayaṃ suta-saddo evaṃ-saddasannidhānato, vakkhamānāpekkhāya vā sāmaññeneva sotabbadhammavisesaṃ
analyzed: etena ayam suta saddaḥ evaṃsadda sannidhānataḥ vakkhamāna apekkhāya vā sāmaññena iva sotabba dhamma visesam
translated: Herein, through the illumination of the penetration of the classification of what is to be heard: by this he shows that the word “sutaṃ” in “evaṃ me sutaṃ” is applied to a particular kind of thing to be heard, either because of the proximity of the word “evaṃ” or because of the expectation of what is to be said.

original: āmasatīti dīpeti. Manodiṭṭhīhi pariyattidhammānaṃ anupekkhanasuppaṭivedhā visesato
analyzed: āmasati iti dīpeti manaḥ diṭṭhīhi pariyatti dhammānam anupekkhana suppaṭivedhāḥ visesataḥ
translated: Through the illumination of the penetration of the classification of the scriptures: through the penetration of the classification of the scriptures, which is the best kind of reflection by the mind.

original: manasikārapaṭibaddhāti te vuttanayena yonisomanasikāradīpakena evaṃ saddena yojetvā,🔽savanadhāraṇavacīparicayā pariyattidhammānaṃ visesena sotāvadhānapaṭibaddhāti te
analyzed: manasikāra paṭibaddhā ati te vutta nayena yoniso manasikāra dīpakena evam saddena yojetvā  savana dhāraṇa vacī paricayā pariyatti dhammānam visesena sotā avadhāna paṭibaddhā ati te
translated: “Dependent on attention”: he combines the word “attention” with the word “heard” in the way already stated, that is, by the word “heard” as the light for right reflection, etc.

original: vuttanayena avikkhepadīpakena suta-saddena yojetvā dassento sāsanasampattiyā dhammassavane
analyzed: vutta nayena avikkhepa dīpakena suta saddena yojetvā dassento sāsana sampattiyā dhammassavane
translated: “Dependent on ear and sound”: he combines the word “heard” as the light for non-distraction in the way already stated, that is, by the word “heard” as the light for giving attention to the sound of the scriptures, for remembering it, for verbal recitation, and for the special qualities of the scriptures.

original: ussāhaṃ janeti. Tattha dhammāti pariyattidhammā. Manasā anupekkhitāti “idha sīlaṃ🔽kathitaṃ, idha samādhi, idha paññā, ettakā ettha anusandhiyo”tiādinā nayena manasā
analyzed: ussāham janeti tattha dhammā ati pariyatti dhammā manasā anupekkhitā idha sīlam  kathitam idha samādhi idha paññā ettakā ettha nayena manasā
translated: He generates enthusiasm for listening to the Dhamma with the excellence of the Dispensation. Herein, the Dhamma is the scriptures.

original: anupekkhitā. Diṭṭhiyā suppaṭividdhāti nijjhānakkhanti bhūtāya, ñātapariññāsaṅkhātāya🔽vā diṭṭhiyā tattha tattha vuttarūpārūpadhamme “iti rūpaṃ, ettakaṃ rūpa”ntiādinā suṭṭhu
analyzed: an upekkhitā diṭṭhiyā suppaṭividdhā ati nijjhāna kkhanti bhūtāya ñāta pariññā saṅkhātāya  vā diṭṭhiyā tattha tattha vutta rūpa arūpa dhamme iti rūpam ettakam rūpa nti ādinā suṭṭhu
translated: “Not looked over with the mind”: not looked over with the mind in the way beginning, “Here virtue is taught, here concentration, here wisdom” , etc., and not looked over with the mind in the way beginning, “Here are the links, here the order of the suttas” , etc.🔽“Well penetrated with insight”: well penetrated by insight consisting in the acceptance of what is seen, or by insight consisting in full understanding of what is known.

original: vavatthapetvā paṭividdhā.
analyzed: vavatthapetvā paṭividdhā
translated: “Well defined”: well defined by defining the visible-form element, etc., as “visible form,” “so far visible form,” etc.

original: Sakalena vacanenāti pubbe tīhi padehi visuṃ visuṃ yojitattā vuttaṃ. Attano adahantoti
analyzed: sakalena vacanena ati pubbe tīhi padehi visum visum yojita ttā vuttam attanaḥ a dahantaḥ ti
translated: “By the whole statement” is said because the three terms have been applied separately in the preceding three paragraphs. “Not making it his own”:

original: “mameda”nti attani aṭṭhapento. Bhummatthe cetaṃ sāmivacanaṃ. Asappurisabhūminti akataññutaṃ.
analyzed: mama idam ti attani aṭṭhapentaḥ bhumma tthe ca itam sāmi vacanam a sappurisa bhūminti a kataññutam
translated: not establishing it in himself as “mine.” This is a possessive genitive in the sense of “place.” “The plane of the unrighteous”: ingratitude.

original: “Idhekacco pāpabhikkhu tathāgatappaveditaṃ dhammavinayaṃ pariyāpuṇitvā attano dahatī”ti
analyzed: idha ekaccaḥ pāpa bhikkhu tathāgata ppaveditam dhamma vinayam pariyāpuṇitvā attanaḥ dahati iti
translated: “Herein, a certain evil bhikkhu, having learned the Dhamma and Discipline proclaimed by the Tathagata, makes it his own” .

original: evaṃ vuttaṃ anariyavohārāvatthaṃ, sā eva anariyavohārāvatthā asaddhammo. Nanu ca🔽ānandattherassa “mamedaṃ vacana”nti adhimānassa, mahākassapattherādīnañca tadāsaṅkāya
analyzed: evam vuttam anariya vohāra avattham sā eva anariya vohāra avatthā asat dhammaḥ nanu ca  ānanda ttherassa mama idam vacana nti adhimānassa mahākassapa tthera ādīnam ca tad āsaṅkāya
translated: This is the passage quoted in the commentary as the plane of the unrighteous. That same plane of the unrighteous is the unrighteous doctrine.

original: abhāvato asappurisabhūmi-samatikkamādivacanaṃ niratthakanti? Nayidamevaṃ. “Evaṃ me🔽suta”nti vadantena ayampi attho vibhāvitoti dassanato. Keci pana “devatānaṃ parivitakkāpekkhaṃ
analyzed: abhāvataḥ asappurisa bhūmi samatikkama ādi vacanam niratthakanti evam me  sutam ti vadantena ayam pi atthaḥ vibhāvito ti dassanato keci pana devatānam parivitakka apekkham
translated: But didn’t the venerable Ananda make it his own when he said, “This is my word,” and didn’t the venerable Maha Kassapa and the others go beyond the plane of the unrighteous when they had no such misgiving?🔽No, it is not so. It is in order to show that the meaning is also implied when he says, “Thus have I heard,”🔽Some, however, say that the statement is not open to such criticism, since it is made with the expectation of the devatas’ reflection.

original: tathāvacananti edisī codanā anavakāsā”ti vadanti. Tasmiṃ kira khaṇe ekaccānaṃ devatānaṃ
analyzed: edisī codanā vadanti tasmin kira khaṇe devatānam
translated: For at that moment, it seems, some devatas were thinking thus:

original: evaṃ cetaso parivitakko udapādi “bhagavā ca parinibbuto, ayañca āyasmā desanākusalo
analyzed: evam cetasaḥ parivitakkaḥ udapādi bhagavā ca parinibbutaḥ ayam ca āyasmā desanā kusalo
translated: Such a thought arose in his mind: “The Blessed One has attained final Nibbāna, and this venerable one is skilled in teaching.

original: idāni dhammaṃ deseti, sakyakulappasuto tathāgatassa bhātā cūḷapituputto. Kiṃ nu kho
analyzed: idāni dhammam deseti sakya kula ppasutaḥ tathāgatassa bhātā cūḷa pitu putto kim nu kho
translated: Now he is teaching the Dhamma. He is a clansman of the Sakyans, the Tathāgata’s brother, his younger brother. What if

original: sayaṃ sacchikataṃ dhammaṃ deseti? Udāhu bhagavato eva vacanaṃ yathāsuta”nti, evaṃ
analyzed: sayam sacchikatam dhammam deseti udāhu bhagavataḥ eva vacanam evam
translated: he is teaching the Dhamma that he himself has experienced? Or is he teaching the Blessed One’s words as he has heard them?”

original: tadāsaṅkitappakārato asappurisabhūmisamokkamādito atikkamādi vibhāvitanti. Appetīti
analyzed: tad āsaṅkita ppakārataḥ asappurisa bhūmi samokkama āditaḥ atikkama ādi vibhāvitanti appeti iti
translated: Thus he reflected in this way on that occasion, and he discerned the transcending of the plane of the worthless man. “He has no desire” :

original: nidasseti. Diṭṭhadhammika-samparāyika-paramatthesu yathārahaṃ satte netīti netti,
analyzed: nidasseti diṭṭhadhammika samparāyika paramatthesu yathāraham satte
translated: he shows. He leads beings to the highest good in this life and in the life to come as is fitting. Thus he is a leader .

original: dhammo eva netti dhammanetti.🔽Daḷhataraniviṭṭhā vicikicchā kaṅkhā, nātisaṃsappanā matibhedamattā vimati. Assaddhiyaṃ
analyzed: dhammaḥ eva netti dhamma netti  daḷhatara niviṭṭhā vicikicchā kaṅkhā na ati saṃsappanā mati bheda mattā vimati
translated: The Dhamma itself is the leader ; thus it is the Dhamma-leader .🔽Doubt is firmly rooted hesitation, uncertainty, lack of conviction, lack of decision, mere wavering of mind.

original: vināsetīti bhagavatā bhāsitattā sammukhāvassa paṭiggahitattā khalitaduruttādigahaṇadosābhāvato
analyzed: vināseti iti bhagavatā bhāsita ttā sammukhāvassa paṭiggahita ttā khalita durutta ādi gahaṇa dosa abhāvato
translated: He destroys lack of faith : because it was spoken by the Blessed One, because it was accepted by him face to face, because it is free from the faults of faltering, mispronunciation, and so on,

original: ca. Ettha ca paṭhamādayo tisso atthayojanā ākārādiatthesu aggahitavisesameva evaṃ-saddaṃ🔽gahetvā dassitā, tato parā catasso ākāratthameva evaṃ-saddaṃ gahetvā vibhāvitā. Pacchimā
analyzed: ca ettha ca paṭhama ādayaḥ tissaḥ attha yojanāḥ ākāra ādi atthesu agga hita visesam eva evaṃsaddam  gahetvā dassitā tatas parā catassaḥ ākāra attham eva evaṃsaddam gahetvā vibhāvitā pacchimā
translated: And here the first three illustrations of the meaning of “thus” are shown by taking the word “thus” as not distinguishing the mode, etc., from the meaning, etc.;🔽the next four are demonstrated by taking the word “thus” as distinguishing the mode, etc., from the meaning, etc.;🔽and the last four🔽

original: pana tisso yathākkamaṃ ākāratthaṃ nidassanatthaṃ avadhāraṇatthañca evaṃ-saddaṃ gahetvā🔽yojitāti daṭṭhabbaṃ.🔽Eka-saddo aññaseṭṭhaasahāyasaṅkhayādīsu dissati. Tathā hesa “sassato attā ca loko
analyzed: pana tissaḥ yathākkamam ākāra attham nidassana ttham avadhāraṇa attham ca evaṃsaddam gahetvā  yojitā iti daṭṭhabbam  eka saddaḥ añña seṭṭha asahāya saṅkhaya ādīsu dissati tathā ha isa sassataḥ attā ca loko
translated: And here the first three interpretations of the word eva are shown by taking it to mean “in the sense of first, etc.,” without any distinction of mode, etc.; the next four are shown by taking it to mean “in the sense of mode,” and the last three by taking it to mean “in the sense of mode, illustration, and definition” respectively.

original: ca, idameva saccaṃ moghamaññanti ittheke abhivadantī”tiādīsu aññatthe dissati. “Cetaso🔽ekodibhāva”ntiādīsu seṭṭhe, “eko vūpakaṭṭho”tiādīsu asahāye, “ekova kho, bhikkhave,
analyzed: ca idam eva saccam mogham aññanti itthā ike abhivadanti iti ādīsu aññatthe dissati cetasaḥ  eka udi bhāvanti ādīsu seṭṭhe ekaḥ vūpakaṭṭhaḥ ti ādīsu asahāye ekaḥ uva kho bhikkhave
translated: The word eka is found in the sense of “other,” “best,” “without a companion,” “destruction,” and so on. Thus it is found in the sense of “other” in such passages as “The self and the world are eternal—this alone is the truth, and (all) else is foolish” ,🔽in the sense of “best” in such passages as “Unification of mind” ,🔽in the sense of “without a companion” in such passages as “Alone, secluded” ,

original: khaṇo ca samayo ca brahmacariyavāsāyā”tiādīsu saṅkhayāyaṃ. Idhāpi saṅkhayāyanti dassento
analyzed: khaṇo ca samayo ca brahmacariya vāsāya ati ādīsu idha api saṅkhayāyanti dassento
translated: and in the sense of “destruction” in such passages as “Monks, there is only one time for living the holy life” . Here the Exalted One shows the word eka in the sense of “destruction” by saying:

original: āha “ekanti gaṇanaparicchedaniddeso”ti. Kālañca samayañcāti yuttakālañca paccayasāmaggiñca.
analyzed: āha ekam ti gaṇana pariccheda niddeso ti kālañca samayañca ati yutta kālañca paccaya sāmaggiñca
translated: “Time and occasion”: suitable time and the coming together of conditions.

original: Khaṇoti okāso. Tathāgatuppādādiko hi maggabrahmacariyassa okāso tappaccayassa paṭilābhahetuttā.
analyzed: okāsaḥ tathāgata uppāda ādikaḥ hi magga brahmacariyassa okāsaḥ tad paccayassa paṭilābha hetu ttā
translated: “Moment”: opportunity. For the opportunity for the path and the life of purity is the moment, since it is the cause for the acquisition of its condition.

original: Khaṇo eva ca samayo, yo khaṇoti ca samayoti ca vuccati, so eko evāti hi attho. Mahāsamayoti
analyzed: khaṇaḥ eva ca samayaḥ yaḥ khaṇo ti ca samayo ti ca vuccati saḥ ekaḥ evā ati hi atthaḥ mahāsamayo ti
translated: And the moment itself is the occasion, which is called “moment” and “occasion.” So the meaning is: “the one that is called moment and occasion.”🔽“Great occasion”: a great multitude.🔽“Occasion” is also a cause for fulfilling the training precepts.

original: mahāsamūho. Samayopi khoti sikkhāpadapūraṇassa hetupi. Samayappavādaketi diṭṭhippavādake.
analyzed: mahā samūhaḥ samayaḥ api kho ti sikkhāpada pūraṇassa hetu pi samaya ppavādake iti diṭṭhi ppavādake
translated: “Occasion-proclaimers”: proclaimers of views.

original: Tattha hi nisinnā titthiyā attano attano samayaṃ pavadanti. Atthābhisamayāti hitapaṭilābhā.
analyzed: tattha hi nisinnā titthiyāḥ attanaḥ attanaḥ samayam pavadanti attha abhisamayā ati hita paṭilābhā
translated: For the sectarians sit there proclaiming their own occasions.🔽“Attainment of welfare”: acquisition of benefit.

original: Abhisametabboti abhisamayo, abhisamayo attho abhisamayatthoti pīḷanādīni abhisametabbabhāvena
analyzed: abhisametabbaḥ ti abhisamayaḥ abhisamayaḥ atthaḥ abhisamaya tthaḥ ti pīḍana ādīni abhisametabba bhāvena
translated: “Attainment” is what is to be attained; the meaning of attainment is the meaning of what is to be attained.🔽The afflictions, etc., are stated as being unified in the sense of being what is to be attained.

original: ekībhāvaṃ upanetvā vuttāni. Abhisamayassa vā paṭivedhassa visayabhūto attho abhisamayatthoti
analyzed: ekībhāvam upanetvā vuttāni abhisamayassa vā paṭivedhassa visaya bhūtaḥ atthaḥ abhisamaya tthaḥ ti
translated: Or the meaning that is the domain of the penetration of the attainment is the meaning of the attainment.

original: tāneva tathā ekattena vuttāni. Tattha pīḷanaṃ dukkhasaccassa taṃsamaṅgino hiṃsanaṃ
analyzed: tāni eva tathā ekattena vuttāni tattha pīḷanam dukkha saccassa tad samaṅginaḥ hiṃsanam
translated: and they are called “one” in the sense of being one in the way already stated. Herein, “oppression” is the afflicting of what is of the same continuity as pain.

original: avipphārikatākaraṇaṃ, santāpo dukkhadukkhatādivasena santāpanaṃ paridahanaṃ.
analyzed: a vipphārika tā karaṇam santāpaḥ dukkha dukkha tā ādi vasena santāpanam paridahanam
translated: “Non-diffusion” is the prevention of diffusion. “Heating” is the burning by the suffering of pain, etc.

original: Tattha sahakārikāraṇaṃ sannijjhaṃ sameti samavetīti samayo, samavāyo. Sameti samāgacchati🔽ettha maggabrahmacariyaṃ tadādhārapuggalehīti samayo, khaṇo. Sameti ettha, etena🔽vā saṃgacchati satto, sabhāvadhammo vā sahajātādīhi, uppādādīhi vāti samayo, kālo.🔽Dhammappavattimattatāya atthato abhūtopi hi kālo dhammappavattiyā adhikaraṇaṃ karaṇaṃ🔽viya ca parikappanāmattasiddhena rūpena voharīyatīti. Samaṃ, saha vā avayavānaṃ ayanaṃ
analyzed: tattha sahakāri kāraṇam sannijjham sameti samaveti iti samayaḥ samavāyaḥ sameti samāgacchati  ettha magga brahmacariyam tad ādhāra puggalehi iti samayaḥ khaṇo sameti ettha etena  vā saṃgacchati sattaḥ sa bhāva dhammaḥ vā sahajāta ādīhi uppāda ādīhi vā ati samayaḥ kālaḥ  dhamma ppavatti matta tāya atthataḥ abhūtaḥ api hi kālaḥ dhamma ppavattiyāḥ adhikaraṇam karaṇam  ca parikappanā matta siddhena rūpena voharīyati iti samam saha vai avayavānam ayanam
translated: Herein, the condition that is a co-operating cause is a conjunction, and it is conjoined, thus it is a conjunction. It is conjoined, thus it is a conjunction.

analyzed: pavatti avaṭṭhānanti samayaḥ samūhaḥ yathā samudāyaḥ iti avayava saha avaṭṭhānam eva hi
