original: samūhoti. Avasesapaccayānaṃ samāgame eti phalaṃ etasmā uppajjati pavattati cāti samayo,
analyzed: samūhaḥ ti avasesa paccayānam samāgame eti phalam etasmai uppajjati pavattati ca ati samayaḥ
translated: “Conjunction” is the fruit that arises, occurs, in the meeting together of the remaining conditions.🔽“Cause” is the origination, as it is said, “Origination is a cause” .

original: hetu yathā “samudayo”ti. Sameti saṃyojanabhāvato sambandho eti attano visaye pavattati,
analyzed: hetu yathā sameti saṃyojana bhāvato sambandhaḥ eti attanaḥ visaye pavattati
translated: “Conjunction” is the connection that occurs in the object by the state of being bound up,

original: daḷhaggahaṇabhāvato vā saṃyuttā ayanti pavattanti sattā yathābhinivesaṃ etenāti samayo,
analyzed: daḷha ggahaṇa bhāvataḥ vā saṃyuttāḥ ayanti pavattanti sattāḥ yathā abhinivesam etena ati samayaḥ
translated: or beings are bound up with it and occur, go, according to the way in which they are resolved upon, thus it is a conjunction .🔽“View” is the meeting together, the coming together, the concurrence of the conditions for the arising of the defilements,

original: diṭṭhi. Diṭṭhisaṃyojanena hi sattā ativiya bajjhantīti. Samiti saṃgati samodhānanti
analyzed: diṭṭhi diṭṭhi saṃyojanena hi sattāḥ ativiya bajjhanti iti samiti saṃgati samodhāna nti
translated: for beings are very much entangled by the fetter of views.🔽“Conjunction” is the obtaining,

original: samayo, paṭilābho. Samassa nirodhassa yānaṃ, sammā vā yānaṃ apagamo apavatti samayo,🔽pahānaṃ. Abhimukhaṃ ñāṇena sammā etabbo adhigantabboti abhisamayo, dhammānaṃ aviparīto
analyzed: samayaḥ paṭilābhaḥ samassa nirodhassa yānam sammā vā yānam apagamaḥ apavatti samayaḥ  pahānam abhimukham ñāṇena sammā etabbaḥ adhigantabbaḥ ti abhisamayaḥ dhammānam aviparīto
translated: “disjunction” is the going away, the non-occurrence, of the conjunction, that is, the abandoning of it.🔽“Clear vision” is that which is to be reached, to be attained, by right knowledge face to face,🔽the unperverted real nature of things.

original: sabhāvo. Abhimukhabhāvena sammā eti gacchati bujjhatīti abhisamayo, dhammānaṃ aviparītasabhāvāvabodho.
analyzed: sabhāvaḥ abhimukha bhāvena sammā eti gacchati bujjhati iti abhisamayaḥ dhammānam a viparīta sabhāva avabodhaḥ
translated: “Clear vision” is the unperverted understanding of the real nature of things, which occurs, goes, by way of the face-to-face state.

original: Evaṃ tasmiṃ tasmiṃ atthe samayasaddappavatti veditabbā. Samayasaddassa atthuddhāre🔽abhisamayasaddassa udāharaṇaṃ vuttanayeneva veditabbaṃ. Assāti samayasaddassa. Kālo
analyzed: evam tasmin tasmin atthe samaya sadda ppavatti veditabbā samaya saddassa attha uddhāre  abhisamaya saddassa udāharaṇam vutta nayena iva veditabbam assa ati samaya saddassa kālo
translated: This is how the word “occasion” should be understood to be used in the various senses.🔽The word “realization” is an instance of the word “occasion” in the sense of “time” .

original: attho samavāyādīnaṃ atthānaṃ idha asambhavato desadesakaparisānaṃ viya suttassa nidānabhāvena🔽kālassa apadisitabbato ca.
analyzed: atthaḥ samavāya ādīnam atthānam idha asambhavataḥ desa desaka parisānam viya suttassa nidāna bhāvena  kālassa ca
translated: “Time” is the meaning of the word “occasion” here, because the meanings of “coalescence” , etc., are impossible here, and because time is to be mentioned as the source of the sutta, like the place, the town, etc., and the assembly.🔽But why is time mentioned here only in the unrestricted sense of “time” and not in the restricted sense of “season,” “year,” etc.?🔽He says, “Here, although it is not stated in the restricted sense of ‘season,’ ‘year,’ etc.,” etc.

original: Kasmā panettha aniyamitavaseneva kālo niddiṭṭho? Na utusaṃvaccharādivasena niyamitoti🔽āha “tattha kiñcāpī”tiādi. Utusaṃvaccharādivasena niyamaṃ akatvā samayasaddassa vacane🔽ayampi guṇo laddho hotīti dassento “ye vā ime”tiādimāha. Sāmaññajotanā hi visese
analyzed: kasmā pana ittha aniyamita vasena iva kālaḥ niddiṭṭhaḥ na utu saṃvacchara ādi vasena niyamitā uti  āha tattha kiñcāpi itiādi utu saṃvacchara ādi vasena niyamam a katvā samaya saddassa vacane  ayam pi guṇaḥ laddhaḥ hoti iti dassentaḥ ye vā ime iti ādim āha sāmañña jotanā hi visese
translated: By stating the word “occasion” without restricting it to “season,” “year,” etc.,🔽this advantage is gained: it shows that the word “occasion” is used in the sense of “time” in the restricted sense of “season,” “year,” etc., as well as in the unrestricted sense of “time.”🔽The word “occasion” is used in the restricted sense of “season,” “year,” etc., as well as in the unrestricted sense of “time.”🔽The word “occasion” is used in the restricted sense of “season,” “year,” etc., as well as in the unrestricted sense of “time.”

original: avatiṭṭhatīti. Tattha diṭṭhadhammasukhavihārasamayo devasikaṃ jhānaphalasamāpattīhi
analyzed: avatiṭṭhati iti tattha diṭṭhadhamma sukha vihāra samayaḥ devasikam jhāna phala samāpattīhi
translated: The word “occasion” is used in the restricted sense of “season,” “year,” etc., as well as in the unrestricted sense of “time.”🔽The word “occasion” is used in the restricted sense of “season,” “year,” etc., as well as in the unrestricted sense of “time.”🔽The word “occasion” is used in the restricted sense of “season,” “year,” etc., as well as in the unrestricted sense of “time.”🔽The word “occasion” is used in the restricted sense of “season,” “year,” etc., as well as in the unrestricted sense of “time.”🔽The word “occasion” is used in the restricted sense of “season,” “year,” etc., as well as in the unrestricted sense of “time.”🔽The word “occasion” is used in the restricted sense of “season,” “year,” etc., as well as in the unrestricted sense of “time.”🔽The word “occasion” is used in the restricted sense of “season,” “year,” etc., as well as in the unrestricted sense

original: vītināmanakālo, visesato sattasattāhāni. Suppakāsāti dasasahassilokadhātupakampana-obhāsapātubhāvādīhi🔽pākaṭā. Yathāvuttappabhedesu eva samayesu ekadesaṃ pakārantarehi saṅgahetvā dassetuṃ
analyzed: vīti nāmana kālaḥ visesataḥ satta satta ahāni dasa sahassi lokadhātu pakampana obhāsa pātubhāva ādīhi  pākaṭāḥ yathāvutta ppabhedesu eva samayesu eka desam pakāra antarehi saṅgahetvā dassetum
translated: The time of fulfilment is especially the seven weeks. It is well proclaimed: it is evident through the quaking and lighting up of the ten-thousand world-element, etc.,

original: “yo cāya”ntiādimāha. Tathā hi ñāṇakiccasamayo, attahitapaṭipattisamayo ca abhisambodhisamayo,
analyzed: yaḥ ca ayanti ādim āha tathā hi ñāṇa kicca samayaḥ atta hita paṭipatti samayaḥ ca abhisambodhi samayaḥ
translated: and so on. In order to show that in the various occasions mentioned above a part is included in another he said, “And the occasion of the act of knowing” and so on. For the occasion of the act of knowing and the occasion of the practice of what is beneficial to oneself are the occasion of enlightenment,

original: ariyatuṇhībhāvasamayo, diṭṭhadhammasukhavihārasamayo, karuṇākiccaparahitapaṭipattidhammīkathāsamayā, desanāsamayo eva.🔽Karaṇavacanena niddeso katoti sambandho. Tatthāti abhidhammatadaññasuttapadavinayesu.🔽Tathāti bhummakaraṇehi. Adhikaraṇattho ādhārattho. Bhāvo nāma kiriyā, tāya kiriyantaralakkhaṇaṃ
analyzed: ariya tuṇhībhāva samayaḥ diṭṭhadhamma sukha vihāra samayaḥ karuṇā kicca para hita paṭipatti dhammīkathā samayāḥ desanā samayaḥ eva  karaṇa vacanena niddeso kataḥ iti sambandho tattha ati abhidhamma tad añña sutta pada vinayesu  tathā ati bhumma karaṇehi adhikaraṇa atthaḥ ādhāra atthaḥ bhāvaḥ nāma kiriyā tāya kiriya antara lakkhaṇam
translated: the occasion of the Noble Silence, the occasion of abiding in bliss here and now, the occasion of the practice of what is beneficial to others through the act of compassion, and the occasion of the preaching of the Dhamma.🔽The construction is: the indication is made by the instrumental case. Therein: in the Abhidhamma, the Sutta, and the Vinaya.🔽Thus: by the instrumental cases. The meaning of the locative case is the meaning of the basis. The state is the action; the characteristic of the other action by that action is

original: bhāvenabhāvalakkhaṇaṃ. Tattha yathā kālo sabhāvadhammaparicchinno sayaṃ paramatthato
analyzed: bhāvenabhāva lakkhaṇam tattha yathā kālaḥ sa bhāva dhamma paricchinnaḥ sayam paramatthato
translated: the characteristic of the state by the state. Therein, just as time, which is a natural phenomenon, is limited by itself in the ultimate sense,

original: avijjamānopi ādhārabhāvena paññāto taṅkhaṇappavattānaṃ tato pubbe parato ca abhāvato
analyzed: a vijjamānaḥ api ādhāra bhāvena paññātaḥ tad khaṇa ppavattānam tatas pubbe paratas ca abhāvato
translated: Though not existing, it is known as the basis for the states occurring at that moment, since there is nothing prior to or subsequent to them.

original: “pubbaṇhe jāto, sāyanhe gacchatī”ti ca ādīsu, samūho ca avayavavinimutto visuṃ avijjamānopi
analyzed: pubbaṇhe jātaḥ sāyanhe gacchati iti ca ādīsu samūhaḥ ca avayava vinimuttaḥ visum a vijjamānaḥ api
translated: And in such passages as “He was born in the morning and died in the evening” , a collection is not found separately from its components, though it does not exist.

original: kappanāmattasiddho avayavānaṃ ādhārabhāvena paññāpīyati yathā “rukkhe sākhā, yavarāsiyaṃ
analyzed: kappanā matta siddhaḥ avayavānam ādhāra bhāvena paññāpīyati yathā rukkhe sākhā yavarāsiyam
translated: But it is designated as the basis for the components by the mere assumption of a name, as in such passages as “The branch is in the tree” , “The leaf is in the shoot” .

original: sambhūto”tiādīsu, evaṃ idhāpīti dassento āha “adhikaraṇañhi…pe… dhammāna”nti. Yasmiṃ
analyzed: sambhūtaḥ iti ādīsu evam idha api iti dassentaḥ āha yasmin
translated: So too here. Showing this, he said, “For a legal question is … in the ideas” .

original: kāle, dhammapuñje vā kāmāvacaraṃ kusalaṃ cittaṃ uppannaṃ hoti, tasmiṃ eva kāle dhammapuñje🔽ca phassādayopi hontīti ayaṃ hi tattha attho. Yathā ca “gāvīsu duyhamānāsu gato,
analyzed: kāle dhamma puñje vā kāmāvacaram kusalam cittam uppannam hoti tasmin eva kāle dhamma puñje  ca phassa ādayaḥ api honti iti ayam hi tattha atthaḥ yathā ca gāvīsu duyhamānāsu gataḥ
translated: At the time when a profitable consciousness of the sense sphere has arisen in a heap of ideas, at that same time in that heap of ideas contact, etc., are also. This is the meaning here.

original: duddhāsu āgato”ti dohanakiriyāya gamanakiriyā lakkhīyati, evaṃ idhāpi yasmiṃ samaye,
analyzed: duddhāsu āgataḥ ti dohana kiriyāya gamana kiriyā lakkhīyati evam idha api yasmin samaye
translated: And just as the act of going is implied by the act of milking in the passage, “He went when the cows were being milked, he came when they were milked” ,🔽so too here the act of consciousness is implied by the act of seeing.

original: tasmiṃ samayeti ca vutte “satī”ti ayamattho viññāyamāno eva hoti padatthassa sattāvirahābhāvatoti
analyzed: tasmin samaya iti ca vutte sati iti ayam atthaḥ viññāyamānaḥ eva hoti padatthassa sattā viraha abhāvato ti
translated: and when “at a time” is said, the meaning of “existing” is understood, because the word-meaning is not devoid of existence.

original: samayassa sattākiriyāya cittassa uppādakiriyā phassādibhavanakiriyā ca lakkhīyati.
analyzed: samayassa sattā kiriyāya cittassa uppāda kiriyā phassa ādi bhavana kiriyā ca lakkhīyati
translated: So the characteristic of the time is the occurrence of the consciousness and the occurrence of the arising of contact, etc., in the existence of the time.🔽“In which time”: in which ninth instant, in which cause consisting of right reflection, etc.,

original: Yasmiṃ samayeti yasmiṃ navame khaṇe, yasmiṃ yonisomanasikārādihetumhi, paccayasamavāye
analyzed: yasmin samaye iti yasmin navame khaṇe yasmin yoni soma nasikāra ādi hetumhi paccaya samavāye
translated: or in which concurrence of conditions,

original: vā sati kāmāvacaraṃ kusalaṃ cittaṃ uppannaṃ hoti, tasmiṃyeva khaṇe, hetumhi, paccayasamavāye
analyzed: vā sati kāmāvacaram kusalam cittam uppannam hoti tasmin yeva khaṇe hetumhi paccaya samavāye
translated: when a sense-sphere profitable consciousness has arisen, in that same instant, in that cause, in that concurrence of conditions,

original: vā phassādayopi hontīti ubhayattha samayasadde bhummaniddeso kato lakkhaṇabhūtabhāvayuttoti
analyzed: vā phassa ādayaḥ api honti iti ubhayattha samaya sadde bhumma niddeso kataḥ lakkhaṇa bhūta bhāva yutto ti
translated: contact, etc., are also present. So the demonstration of the plane in both instances by the word “time” is made with reference to the characteristic of the state of being a condition.

original: dassento āha “khaṇa…pe… lakkhīyatī”ti.
analyzed: dassentaḥ āha khaṇape lakkhīyati iti
translated: Showing this, he said “The instant … is characterized.”

original: Hetuattho karaṇattho ca sambhavati “annena vasati, vijjāya vasati, pharasunā chindati,
analyzed: hetu attho karaṇa attho ca sambhavati annena vasati vijjāya vasati pharasunā chindati
translated: The meaning of cause and the meaning of instrument are applicable, as in such passages as “He lives by alms” , “He lives by knowledge” , “He cuts with an axe” ,

original: kudālena khaṇatī”tiādīsu viya. Vītikkamañhi sutvā bhikkhusaṅghaṃ sannipātāpetvā otiṇṇavatthukaṃ
analyzed: kudālena khaṇati iti ādīsu viya vītikkaman hi sutvā bhikkhu saṅgham sannipātāpetvā otiṇṇa vatthukam
translated: “He digs with a spade” . For after hearing of the transgression, he assembled the Order of bhikkhus and

original: puggalaṃ paṭipucchitvā vigarahitvā ca taṃ taṃ vatthuotiṇṇakālaṃ anatikkamitvā teneva
analyzed: puggalam paṭipucchitvā vigarahitvā ca tam tam vatthu otiṇṇa kālam an atikkamitvā tena iva
translated: and after rebuking him, he laid down training rules, not letting the time when the offence was committed go by,

original: kālena sikkhāpadāni paññapento bhagavā viharati sikkhāpadapaññattihetuñca apekkhamāno
analyzed: kālena sikkhāpadāni paññapentaḥ bhagavā viharati sikkhāpada paññatti hetuñca apekkhamāno
translated: and he lived with regard to the cause for laying down training rules,

original: tatiyapārājikādīsu viya.🔽Accantameva ārambhato paṭṭhāya yāva desanāniṭṭhānaṃ. Parahitapaṭipattisaṅkhātena
analyzed: tatiya pārājika ādīsu  accantam eva ārambhataḥ paṭṭhāya yāva desanā niṭṭhānam para hita paṭipatti saṅkhātena
translated: as in the case of the third offence entailing expulsion, etc.🔽From the very beginning until the end of the teaching. With a dwelling in compassion,

original: karuṇāvihārena. Tadatthajotanatthanti accantasaṃyogatthajotanatthaṃ. Upayoganiddeso🔽kato yathā “māsaṃ sajjhāyatī”ti. Porāṇāti aṭṭhakathācariyā. Abhilāpamattabhedoti
analyzed: karuṇā vihārena tad attha jotana ttham ti upayoga niddeso  kataḥ yathā māsam sajjhāyati iti aṭṭhakathā cariyā
translated: which is called “the practice of benefitting others.” “For the purpose of showing the meaning of ‘absolute connection’:” for the purpose of showing the meaning of ‘connection at all times.’ The expression

original: vacanamattena viseso. Tena suttavinayesu vibhattibyattayo katoti dasseti.
analyzed: vacana mattena viseso tena sutta vinayesu vibhatti byattayaḥ kato ti dasseti
translated: ‘to study for a month’ is given as an example. ‘The ancients’: the teachers of the commentaries. ‘The difference is merely verbal’: the difference is merely in the words. He shows that the analysis and the formation of the declensions are done in the Suttas and the Vinaya.

original: Seṭṭhanti seṭṭhavācakaṃ vacanaṃ “seṭṭha”nti vuttaṃ seṭṭhaguṇasahacaraṇato, tathā
analyzed: seṭṭham ti seṭṭha vācakam vacanam seṭṭham iti vuttam seṭṭha guṇa sahacaraṇato tathā
translated: ‘Best’: the word ‘best’ is said to be a word expressing the best, because it is associated with the best qualities. Likewise,

original: “uttama”nti etthāpi. Gāravayuttoti garubhāvayutto garuguṇayogato, garukaraṇārahatāya
analyzed: ettha api gārava yutto ti garu bhāva yuttaḥ garu guṇa yogataḥ
translated: ‘highest’ here also. ‘With the addition of respect’: with the addition of the state of being weighty, because of the association with the quality of being weighty, because of the state of being worthy of being made weighty.

original: vā gāravayutto. Vuttoyeva, na pana idha vattabbo visuddhimaggassa imissā aṭṭhakathāya
analyzed: vā gārava yuttaḥ vuttaḥ yā iva na pana idha vattabbaḥ visuddhi maggassa imissā aṭṭhakathāya
translated: or he is full of respect. He is spoken of, but it is not necessary to say it here, because of the partial nature of this commentary on the path of purification.

original: ekadesabhāvatoti adhippāyo.
analyzed: eka desa bhāvato ti adhippāyo
translated: This is the meaning intended.

original: Aparo nayo – bhāgavāti bhagavā, bhatavāti bhagavā, bhāge vanīti bhagavā, bhage vanīti bhagavā, bhattavāti bhagavā, bhage vamīti bhagavā, bhāge vamīti bhagavā.
analyzed: aparaḥ nayaḥ bhāgavāti bhagavān bhatavāti bhagavān bhāge vanīti bhagavān bhage vanīti bhagavān bhattavāti bhagavān bhage vamīti bhagavān bhāge vamīti bhagavān
translated: Another method: the Blessed One is the possessor of parts, the Blessed One is the possessor of what is eaten, the Blessed One is the possessor of a portion, the Blessed One is the possessor of a portion, the Blessed One is the possessor of what is eaten, the Blessed One is the possessor of a vomit, the Blessed One is the possessor of a portion, the Blessed One is the possessor of a vomit.

original: “Bhāgavā bhatavā bhāge, bhage ca vani bhattavā;
analyzed: bhāgavā bhatavā bhāge bhage ca vani bhattavā
translated: “The possessor of parts, the possessor of what is eaten, the possessor of a portion,

original: Bhage vami tathā bhāge, vamīti bhagavā jino”.
analyzed: bhage tathā bhāge vami iti bhagavā jinaḥ
translated: The possessor of a portion, the possessor of a vomit, and likewise the possessor of a portion, the possessor of a vomit—the Blessed One, the Victor.”

original: Tattha kathaṃ bhāgavāti bhagavā? Ye te sīlādayo dhammakkhandhā guṇabhāgā guṇakoṭṭhāsā,
analyzed: tattha katham bhāgavā ati bhagavā ye te sīla ādayaḥ dhamma kkhandhāḥ guṇa bhāgāḥ guṇa koṭṭhāsā
translated: Herein, how is the Blessed One the possessor of parts? Those aggregates of states beginning with virtue, which are parts of worth, portions of worth,

original: te anaññasādhāraṇā niratisayā tathāgate atthi upalabbhanti. Tathā hissa sīlaṃ samādhi
analyzed: te anañña sādhāraṇāḥ niratisayā tathāgate atthi upalabbhanti tathā hissa sīlam samādhi
translated: are found in the Perfect One without being shared by others and are unsurpassed. For his virtue, concentration,

original: paññā vimutti vimuttiñāṇadassanaṃ, hirī ottappaṃ, saddhā vīriyaṃ, sati sampajaññaṃ,
analyzed: paññā vimutti vimutti ñāṇa dassanam hirī ottappam saddhā vīriyam sati sampajaññam
translated: understanding, deliverance, knowledge and vision of deliverance, conscience, shame, faith, energy, mindfulness, full awareness,

original: sīlavisuddhi diṭṭhivisuddhi, samatho vipassanā, tīṇi kusalamūlāni, tīṇi sucaritāni,
analyzed: sīla visuddhi diṭṭhi visuddhi samathaḥ vipassanā tīṇi kusala mūlāni tīṇi su caritāni
translated: Purification of virtue, purification of view, serenity, insight, the three wholesome roots, the three kinds of good conduct,

original: tayo sammāvitakkā, tisso anavajjasaññā, tisso dhātuyo, cattāro satipaṭṭhānā, cattāro
analyzed: tayo sammāvitakkā tisso anavajja saññā tisso dhātuyo cattāro sati paṭṭhānā cattāro
translated: the three right efforts, the three wholesome thoughts, the three perceptions free from blame, the three elements, the four foundations of mindfulness, the four

original: sammappadhānā, cattāro iddhipādā, cattāro ariyamaggā, cattāri ariyaphalāni, catasso
analyzed: sammappadhānā cattāro iddhipādā cattāro ariya maggā cattāri ariya phalāni catasso
translated: right endeavours, the four bases of spiritual success, the four noble paths, the four noble fruits, the four

original: paṭisambhidā, catuyoniparicchedakañāṇāni, cattāro ariyavaṃsā, cattāri vesārajjañāṇāni,
analyzed: paṭisambhidā catu yoni paricchedaka ñāṇāni cattāro ariya vaṃsā cattāri vesārajja ñāṇāni
translated: kinds of analytical knowledge, the four kinds of knowledge of the kinds of discrimination, the four noble traditions, the four kinds of knowledge of confidences,

original: pañca padhāniyaṅgāni, pañcaṅgiko sammāsamādhi, pañcañāṇiko sammāsamādhi, pañcindriyāni,
analyzed: pañca padhāniyaṅgāni pañcaṅgikaḥ sammāsamādhi pañcañāṇikaḥ sammāsamādhi pañca indriyāni
translated: the five factors of endeavour, right concentration with five factors, right concentration with five kinds of knowledge, the five faculties,

original: pañca balāni, pañca nissāraṇīyā dhātuyo, pañca vimuttāyatanañāṇāni, pañca vimuttiparipācanīyā🔽saññā, cha anussatiṭṭhānāni, cha gāravā, cha nissāraṇīyā dhātuyo, cha satatavihārā,
analyzed: pañca balāni pañca nissāraṇīyāḥ dhātuyaḥ pañca vimutta āyatana ñāṇāni pañca vimutti paripācanīyā  saññā cha anussati ṭṭhānāni cha gāravā cha nissāraṇīyāḥ dhātuyo cha satata vihārā
translated: the five powers, the five elements of escape, the five kinds of knowledge of the bases of spiritual success, the five perceptions that mature in deliverance,🔽the six objects of recollection, the six kinds of respect, the six elements of escape, the six kinds of constant abiding,

original: cha anuttariyāni, cha nibbedhabhāgiyā saññā, cha abhiññā, cha asādhāraṇañāṇāni, satta
analyzed: cha anuttariyāni cha nibbedha bhāgiyā saññā cha abhiññā cha asādhāraṇa ñāṇāni satta
translated: the six unsurpassed states, the six perceptions pertaining to penetration, the six kinds of direct knowledge, the six kinds of knowledge not held in common, the seven

original: aparihāniyā dhammā, satta ariyadhammā, satta ariyadhanāni, satta bojjhaṅgā, satta🔽sappurisadhammā, satta nijjaravatthūni, satta saññā, sattadakkhiṇeyyapuggaladesanā,
analyzed: aparihāniyāḥ dhammāḥ satta ariya dhammāḥ satta ariya dhanāni satta bojjhaṅgāḥ satta  sappurisa dhammā satta nijjara vatthūni satta saññā satta dakkhiṇeyya puggala desanā
translated: the things that are not subject to loss, the seven noble treasures, the seven factors of Awakening, the seven🔽qualities of a true person, the seven grounds for decline, the seven perceptions, the teaching on the seven persons worthy to receive gifts,

original: sattakhīṇāsavabaladesanā, aṭṭhapaññāpaṭilābhahetudesanā aṭṭha sammattāni, aṭṭhalokadhammātikkamo,
analyzed: satta khīṇāsava bala desanā aṭṭha paññā paṭilābha hetu desanā aṭṭha sammattāni aṭṭha loka dhamma atikkamo
translated: the teaching on the seven powers of one whose effluents are ended, the teaching on the seven bases for the attainment of knowledge, the eight right ways, the surmounting of the eight worldly conditions,

original: aṭṭha ārambhavatthūni, aṭṭhaakkhaṇadesanā, aṭṭha mahāpurisavitakkā, aṭṭhaabhibhāyatanadesanā,
analyzed: aṭṭha ārambha vatthūni aṭṭha akkhaṇa desanā aṭṭha mahāpurisa vitakkā aṭṭha abhibha āyatana desanā
translated: the eight grounds for giving rise to energy, the teaching on the eight inopportune times, the eight thoughts of a great man, the teaching on the eight dimensions of mastery,

original: aṭṭha vimokkhā, nava yonisomanasikāramūlakā dhammā, nava pārisuddhipadhāniyaṅgāni,
analyzed: aṭṭha vimokkhā nava yonisoma nasikāra mūlakā dhammā nava pārisuddhi padhāniyaṅgāni
translated: the eight liberations, the nine things that are one’s own, the nine constituents of a true person,

original: navasattāvāsadesanā, nava āghātapaṭivinayā, nava saññā, navanānattā, nava anupubbavihārā,
analyzed: nava sattāvāsa desanāḥ nava āghāta paṭivinayāḥ nava saññāḥ nava nānattāḥ nava anupubbavihārā
translated: the teaching on the nine dwellings of beings, the nine ways of overcoming resentment, the nine perceptions, the nine kinds of variety, the nine step-by-step dwellings,

original: dasa nāthakaraṇā dhammā, dasa kasiṇāyatanāni, dasa kusalakammapathā, dasa sammattāni,
analyzed: dasa nātha karaṇāḥ dhammāḥ dasa kasiṇa āyatanāni dasa kusala kamma pathāḥ dasa sammattāni
translated: the ten qualities that are on the side of enlightenment, the ten universal bases, the ten courses of wholesome kamma, the ten right ways,

original: dasa ariyavāsā, dasa asekkhadhammā, dasa tathāgatabalāni, ekādasa mettānisaṃsā, dvādasa
analyzed: dasa ariya vāsāḥ dasa asekkha dhammāḥ dasa tathāgata balāni ekādasa mettā nisaṃsāḥ dvādasa
translated: the ten abodes of the Noble Ones, the ten states of the adept, the ten powers of the Tathāgata, the eleven benefits of loving-kindness, the twelve

original: dhammācakkākārā, terasa dhutaguṇā, cuddasa buddhañāṇāni, pañcadasa vimuttiparipācanīyā
analyzed: dhammācakkākārā terasa dhuta guṇā cuddasa buddha ñāṇāni pañcadasa vimutti paripācanīyā
translated: aspects of the Wheel of the True Idea, the thirteen ascetic qualities, the fourteen kinds of knowledge of a Buddha, the fifteen ideas that ripen in freedom,

original: dhammā, soḷasavidhā ānāpānassati, soḷasa aparantapanīyā dhammā, aṭṭhārasa buddhadhammā,
analyzed: dhammā soḷasavidhā āna apāna sati soḷasa aparantapanīyāḥ dhammāḥ aṭṭhārasa buddha dhammā
translated: the sixteen kinds of mindfulness of in-breaths and out-breaths, the sixteen ideas that lead to a sure end, the eighteen principal insights,

original: ekūnavīsati paccavekkhaṇañāṇāni, catucattālīsa ñāṇavatthūni, paññāsa udayabbayañāṇāni,
analyzed: ekūnavīsati paccavekkhaṇa ñāṇāni catucattālīsa ñāṇa vatthūni paññāsa udayabbayañāṇāni
translated: the nineteen kinds of knowledge of reviewing, the forty-four instances of knowledge, the fifty kinds of knowledge of rise and subsidence,

original: paropaññāsa kusalā dhammā, sattasattati ñāṇavatthūni, catuvīsatikoṭisatasahassasaṅkhasamāpattisañcārimahāvajirañāṇaṃ,🔽anantanayasamantapaṭṭhāna-pavicaya-paccavekkhaṇadesanāñāṇāni, tathā anantāsu lokadhātūsu
analyzed: paropaññāsa kusalāḥ dhammā sattasattati ñāṇa vatthūni catuvīsati koṭi sata sahassa saṅkha samāpatti sañcāri mahā vajira ñāṇam  ananta naya samanta paṭṭhāna pavicaya paccavekkhaṇa desanā ñāṇāni tathā anantāsu lokadhātūsu
translated: the sixty-five profitable ideas, the seventy-seven instances of knowledge, the great knowledge of the wielder of the great supernormal power that travels through the eighty-four hundred thousand koṭis of attainments,🔽the knowledge of teaching, reviewing, investigating, and establishing in the infinite methods, and likewise the knowledge of distinguishing the dispositions, etc., of the infinite beings in the infinite world-spheres,

original: anantānaṃ sattānaṃ āsayādivibhāvanañāṇāni cāti evamādayo anantāparimāṇabhedā anaññasādhāraṇā
analyzed: anantānam sattānam āsaya ādi vibhāvana ñāṇāni ca ati evamādayaḥ ananta aparimāṇa bhedāḥ anañña sādhāraṇāḥ
translated: are all of them, being not shared by others,

original: niratisayā guṇabhāgā guṇakoṭṭhāsā saṃvijjanti upalabbhanti, tasmā yathāvuttavibhāgā
analyzed: niratisayāḥ guṇa bhāgāḥ guṇa koṭṭhāsā saṃvijjanti upalabbhanti tasmai yathā vutta vibhāgā
translated: the incomparable qualities, the parts of the qualities, are found, are met with, therefore, of the kind of division stated,

original: guṇabhāgā assa atthīti “bhāgavā”ti vattabbe ākārassa rassattaṃ katvā “bhagavā”ti
analyzed: guṇa bhāgā assa atthi iti bhāgavā ati vattabbe ākārassa rassa ttam katvā bhagavā ati
translated: The Blessed One is so called because of the possession of the special qualities, the special parts, the special factors, the special categories, of which there are thirty in all, as follows:🔽The ten perfections, namely, the perfection of giving, the perfection of virtue, the perfection of renunciation, the perfection of wisdom, the perfection of energy, the perfection of patience, the perfection of truthfulness, the perfection of determination, the perfection of loving- kindness, and the perfection of equanimity;🔽the ten higher perfections, namely, the higher perfection of giving, the higher perfection of virtue, the higher perfection of renunciation, the higher perfection of wisdom, the higher perfection of energy, the higher perfection of patience, the higher perfection of truthfulness, the higher perfection of determination, the higher perfection of loving- kindness, and the higher perfection of equanimity;🔽the ten ultimate perfections, namely, the ultimate perfection of giving, the ultimate perfection of virtue, the ultimate perfection of renunciation, the ultimate perfection of wisdom, the ultimate perfection of energy, the ultimate perfection of patience, the ultimate perfection of truthfulness, the ultimate perfection of determination, the ultimate perfection of loving-kindness, and the ultimate perfection of equanimity.

original: vutto. Evaṃ tāva bhāgavāti bhagavā.
analyzed: vuttaḥ evam tāva bhāgavā ati bhagavā
translated: The Blessed One is so called because of the possession of these thirty special qualities, these special parts, these special factors, these special categories.🔽“Because all special qualities,

original: “Yasmā sīlādayo sabbe, guṇabhāgā asesato;
analyzed: sīla ādayaḥ sabbe guṇa bhāgāḥ asesato
translated: All special parts, without exception,🔽Are found in the Happy One,

original: Vijjanti sugate tasmā, bhagavāti pavuccati”.🔽Kathaṃ bhatavāti bhagavā? Ye te sabbalokahitāya ussukkamāpannehi manussattādike aṭṭha
analyzed: vijjanti sugate tasmai bhagavā ati pavuccati  katham bhatavā ati bhagavā ye te sabba loka hitāya ussukkam āpannehi manussa tta ādike aṭṭha
translated: Therefore he is called the Blessed One.”

original: dhamme samodhānetvā sammāsambodhiyā katamahābhinīhārehi mahābodhisattehi paripūritabbā🔽dānapāramī, sīla, nekkhamma, paññā, vīriya, khanti, sacca, adhiṭṭhāna, mettā, upekkhāpāramīti🔽dasa pāramiyo, dasa upapāramiyo, dasa paramatthapāramiyoti samatiṃsa pāramiyo, dānādīni
analyzed: dhamme samodhānetvā sammāsambodhiyā kata mahā abhinīhārehi mahā bodhisattehi paripūritabbā 🔽dānapāramī sīla nekkhamma paññā vīriya khanti sacca adhiṭṭhāna mettā upekkhāpāramī ti 🔽dasa pāramiyaḥ dasa upapāramiyaḥ dasa paramattha pāramiyaḥ ti pāramiyaḥ dāna ādīni
translated: How is it that the Blessed One is so called because of the possession of what has been fully purified? The Blessed One is so called because of the possession of the following ten things that have been fully purified: the bases of psychic power, the faculties, the powers, the factors of enlightenment, and the factors of the path.

original: cattāri saṅgahavatthūni, saccādīni cattāri adhiṭṭhānāni, aṅgapariccāgo, jīvita, rajja,🔽putta, dārapariccāgoti pañca mahāpariccāgā, pubbayogo, pubbacariyā, dhammakkhānaṃ,🔽ñātatthacariyā, lokatthacariyā, buddhicariyāti evamādayo, saṅkhepato vā sabbe puññañāṇasambhārā
analyzed: cattāri saṅgaha vatthūni sacca ādīni cattāri adhiṭṭhānāni aṅga pariccāgaḥ jīvita rajja  putta dāra pariccāgaḥ ti pañca mahā pariccāgā pubba yogaḥ pubba cariyā dhamma kkhānaṃ  ñāta ttha cariyā loka ttha cariyā buddhi cariyā ati evamādayo saṅkhepataḥ vā sabbe puñña ñāṇa sambhārā
translated: The four bases of beneficence, the four foundations of mindfulness, the four exertions, the four bases of success, the five spiritual faculties, the five spiritual powers, the seven factors of enlightenment, the Noble Eightfold Path, the four paths, the four fruits, and nibbāna, are the Dhamma.🔽The four kinds of intrepidity, the six kinds of direct knowledge, the four discriminations, the four analytical knowledges, the eighteen distinctive qualities of a Buddha, and the ten powers of a Tathāgata, are the Dhamma.🔽The four kinds of intrepidity, the six kinds of direct knowledge, the four discriminations, the four analytical knowledges, the eighteen distinctive qualities of a Buddha, and the ten powers of a Tathāgata, are the Dhamma.

original: buddhakaradhammā, te mahābhinīhārato paṭṭhāya kappānaṃ satasahassādhikāni cattāri🔽asaṅkhyeyyāni yathā hānabhāgiyā saṃkilesabhāgiyā ṭhitibhāgiyā vā na honti, atha kho
analyzed: buddha kara dhammā te mahā abhinīhārato paṭṭhāya kappānam sata sahassa adhikāni cattāri  asaṅkhyeyyāni yathā hāna bhāgiyā saṃkilesa bhāgiyā ṭhiti bhāgiyāḥ vā na honti atha kho
translated: The four kinds of intrepidity, the six kinds of direct knowledge, the four discriminations, the four analytical knowledges, the eighteen distinctive qualities of a Buddha, and the ten powers of a Tathāgata, are the Dhamma.🔽The four kinds of intrepidity, the six kinds of direct knowledge, the four discriminations, the four analytical knowledges, the eighteen distinctive qualities of a Buddha, and the ten powers of a Tathāgata, are the Dhamma.🔽The four kinds of intrepidity, the six kinds of direct knowledge, the four discriminations, the four analytical knowledges, the eighteen distinctive qualities of a Buddha, and the ten powers of a Tathāgata, are the Dhamma.🔽The four kinds of intrepidity, the six kinds of direct knowledge, the four discriminations, the four analytical knowledges, the eighteen distinctive qualities of a Buddha, and the ten powers of a Tathāgata, are the Dhamma.

original: uttaruttari visesabhāgiyāva honti, evaṃ sakkaccaṃ nirantaraṃ anavasesato bhatā sambhatā🔽assa atthīti “bhatavā”ti vattabbe “bhagavā”ti vutto niruttinayena ta-kārassa ga-kāraṃ
analyzed: uttaruttari visesa bhāgiyāḥ ava honti evam sakkaccam nirantaram anavasesataḥ bhatā sambhatā  assa atthi iti bhatavā ti vattabbe bhagavā ati vuttaḥ nirutti nayena takārassa gakāram
translated: The four kinds of intrepidity, the six kinds of direct knowledge, the four discriminations, the four analytical knowledges, the eighteen distinctive qualities of a Buddha, and the ten powers of a Tathāgata, are the Dhamma.

original: katvā. Atha vā bhatavāti teyeva yathāvutte buddhakaradhamme vuttanayeneva bhari,
analyzed: katvā atha vā yathā vutte buddha kara dhamme vutta nayena iva
translated: The four kinds of intrepidity, the six kinds of direct knowledge, the four discriminations, the four analytical knowledges, the eighteen distinctive qualities of a Buddha, and the ten powers of a Tathāgata, are the Dhamma.🔽The four kinds of intrepidity, the six kinds of direct knowledge, the four discriminations, the four analytical knowledges, the eighteen distinctive qualities of a Buddha, and the ten powers of a Tathāgata, are the Dhamma

original: sambhari, paripūresīti attho. Evampi bhatavāti bhagavā.
analyzed: paripūresi iti evam pi bhatavā ti bhagavā
translated: “Bhatavā” means “he has fulfilled, he has completed.”🔽“He has fulfilled all the requisites,

original: “Sammāsambodhiyā sabbe, dānapāramiādike;
analyzed: sammāsambodhiyā sabbe dāna pārami ādike
translated: The requisites of giving, virtue, etc., for the supreme enlightenment;

original: Sambhāre bhatavā nātho, tasmāpi bhagavā mato”.
analyzed: sambhāre bhatavā nātho tasmā api bhagavā mataḥ
translated: Therefore he is called the Blessed One.”

original: Kathaṃ bhāge vanīti bhagavā? Ye te catuvīsatikoṭisatasahassasaṅkhā devasikaṃ vaḷañjanakasamāpattibhāgā,🔽te anavasesato lokahitatthaṃ attano ca diṭṭhadhammasukhavihāratthaṃ niccakappaṃ vani,
analyzed: katham bhāge vani iti bhagavā ye te catuvīsati koṭi sata sahassa saṅkhāḥ devasikam vaḷañjanaka samāpatti bhāgāḥ  te anavasesataḥ loka hita attham attano ca diṭṭhadhamma sukha vihāra attham nicca kappam
translated: How is it that the Blessed One is so called in the sense of one who has enjoyed? He has enjoyed without remainder the enjoyments consisting of the twenty-four factors of the divine-life-in-succession jhāna,

original: bhaji, sevi, bahulamakāsīti bhāge vanīti bhagavā. Atha vā abhiññeyyadhammesu kusalādīsu
analyzed: bhaji sevi bahulam akāsi iti bhāge vani iti bhagavā atha vā abhiññeyya dhammesu kusala ādīsu
translated: for the welfare of the world and for the purpose of his own abiding in bliss here and now. He has enjoyed, has used, has experienced, has had much of, these enjoyments consisting of the factors of the divine life.🔽Or alternatively, the factors of the direct-knowledge of profitable states, etc.,

original: khandhādīsu ca ye te pariññeyyādivasena saṅkhepato vā catubbidhā abhisamayabhāgā,🔽vitthārato pana “cakkhu pariññeyyaṃ sotaṃ…pe… jarāmaraṇaṃ pariññeyya”ntiādinā aneke
analyzed: khandha ādīsu ca ye te pariññeyya ādi vasena saṅkhepataḥ vā catubbidhāḥ abhisamaya bhāgā  vitthārato pana cakkhu pariññeyyam sotaṃpe jarā maraṇam pariññeyya nti ādinā aneke
translated: and of the aggregates, etc., are fourfold as objects of complete understanding, etc., in brief,🔽but in detail they are of many kinds as objects of complete understanding, etc., according to the texts beginning with “The eye is to be completely understood” and “The ear … The mind is to be completely understood; visible objects … mental objects are to be completely understood” ,

original: pariññeyyabhāgā, “cakkhussa samudayo pahātabbo…pe… jarāmaraṇassa samudayo pahātabbo”tiādinā
analyzed: pariññeyya bhāgā cakkhussa samudayo pahātabbo upe jarā maraṇassa samudayo pahātabbo ti ādinā
translated: and according to the texts beginning with “The origin of the eye is to be abandoned” and “The origin of the ear … The origin of the mind is to be abandoned; the origin of visible objects … the origin of mental objects is to be abandoned” ,

original: pahātabbabhāgā, “cakkhussa nirodho…pe… jarāmaraṇassa nirodho sacchikātabbo”tiādinā
analyzed: pahātabba bhāgā cakkhussa nirodha upe jarā maraṇassa nirodho sacchikātabbaḥ ti ādinā
translated: The part to be abandoned is the four noble truths, beginning with “The cessation of the eye is to be realized.”

original: sacchikātabbabhāgā, “cakkhunirodhagāminīpaṭipadā”tiādinā, “cattāro satipaṭṭhānā”tiādinā🔽ca anekabhedā bhāvetabbabhāgā ca dhammā, te sabbe vani, bhaji, yathārahaṃ gocarabhāvanāsevanānaṃ🔽vasena sevi. Evampi bhāge vanīti bhagavā. Atha vā “ye ime sīlādayo dhammakkhandhā🔽sāvakehi sādhāraṇā guṇakoṭṭhāsā guṇabhāgā, kinti nu kho te vineyyasantānesu patiṭṭhapeyya”nti🔽mahākaruṇāya vani abhipatthayi, sā cassa abhipatthanā yathādhippetaphalāvahā ahosi.🔽Evampi bhāge vanīti bhagavā.
analyzed: sacchikātabba bhāgā cakkhu nirodha gāminī paṭipadā iti ādinā cattāro sati paṭṭhāna ati ādinā  ca aneka bhedā bhāvetabba bhāgā ca dhammā te sabbe yathāraham gocara bhāvanā sevanānam  vasena bhāge atha vā ye ime sīla ādayo dhamma kkhandhā  sāvakehi sādhāraṇāḥ guṇa koṭṭhāsāḥ guṇa bhāgāḥ kinti nu kho te vineyya santānesu patiṭṭhapeyyanti  mahākaruṇāya vani abhipatthayi sā ca ssa abhipatthanā yathā adhippeta phala āvahā ahosi  bhāge bhagavā
translated: The part to be realized is the four noble truths, beginning with “The cessation of the eye is to be realized,” and the part to be developed is the four foundations of mindfulness, etc., which are of many kinds.

original: “Yasmā ñeyyasamāpatti-guṇabhāge tathāgato;🔽Bhaji patthayi sattānaṃ, hitāya bhagavā tato”.
analyzed: yasmai ñeyya samāpatti guṇa bhāge tathāgataḥ 🔽bhaji patthayi sattānam hitāya bhagavā tatas

original: Kathaṃ bhage vanīti bhagavā? Samāsato tāva katapuññehi payogasampannehi yathāvibhavaṃ
analyzed: katham bhage vani iti bhagavā samāsatas tāva kata puññehi payoga sampannehi yathāvibhavam
translated: Translation: Kathaṃ bhage vānīti bhagavā? Samāsato tāva katapuññena payogasampannena yathāvibhavaṃ

original: bhajīyantīti bhagā, lokiyalokuttarasampattiyo. Tattha lokiye tāva tathāgato sammāsambodhito
analyzed: bhajīyanti iti bhagāḥ lokiya lokuttara sampattiyaḥ tattha lokiye tāva tathāgato sammāsambodhito
translated: bhajīyantīti bhagā lokiyalokuttarasampattiyo | Tattha lokiye tāva tathāgato sammāsambodhito

original: pubbe bodhisattabhūto paramukkaṃsagate, vani, bhaji, sevi, yattha patiṭṭhāya niravasesato
analyzed: pubbe bodhisatta bhūto paramukkaṃsa gate vani bhaji sevi yattha patiṭṭhāya niravasesato
translated: pubbe bodhisattabhūto paramukkaṃsagate, vānī, bhaji, sevī, yattha patiṭṭhāya niravasesato

original: buddhakaradhamme samannānento buddhadhamme paripācesi, buddhabhūto pana te niravajjesu
analyzed: buddha kara dhamme samannānentaḥ buddha dhamme paripācesi buddha bhūtaḥ pana te niravajjesu
translated: buddhakaradhamme samannānento buddhadhamme paripācesi, buddhabhūto pana te niravajjesu

original: upasaṃhite anaññasādhāraṇe lokuttarepi, vani, bhaji, sevi, vitthārato pana padesarajja-issariyacakkavattisampatti-devarajjasampattiādivasena🔽jhāna-vimokkha-samādhisamāpatti-ñāṇadassana-maggabhāvanā-phalasacchi-kiriyādi-uttarimanussadhammavasena🔽ca anekavihite anaññasādhāraṇe, bhage, vani, bhaji, sevi. Evampi bhage vanīti bhagavā.
analyzed: upasaṃhite anañña sādhāraṇe lokuttare pi vani bhaji sevi vitthārato pana 🔽jhāna vimokkha samādhi samāpatti ñāṇa dassana magga bhāvanā phala sacchikiriyā ādi uttari manussa dhamma vasena 🔽ca aneka vihite anañña sādhāraṇe bhage vani bhaji sevi evam pi bhage vani iti bhagavā
translated: upasaṃhite anaññasādhāraṇesu lokuttarepi, vānī, bhaji, sevī | Vitthārato pana padesarajja-issariyacakkavattisampatti-

original: “Yā tā sampattiyo loke, yā ca lokuttarā puthu;
analyzed: yāḥ tā sampattiyaḥ loke yā ca lokuttarā puthu
translated: “Whatever perfections there are in the world, and whatever perfections there are beyond the world,

original: Sabbā tā bhaji sambuddho, tasmāpi bhagavā mato”.
analyzed: sabbā tā bhaji sambuddhaḥ tasmā api bhagavā mataḥ
translated: The Enlightened One has enjoyed them all: for this reason he is called the Blessed One.”

original: Kathaṃ sattavāti bhagavā? Bhattā daḷhabhattikā assa bahū atthīti bhattavā. Tathāgato
analyzed: katham sattavā ati bhagavā bhattā daḷha bhattikāḥ assa bahū atthi iti bhattavā tathāgataḥ
translated: How is he the Blessed One? He is the Blessed One because he is the Blessed One who has many strong supporters.

original: hi mahākaruṇāsabbaññutaññāṇādi-aparimitanirupamappabhāva-guṇavisesasamaṅgibhāvato
analyzed: hi mahā karuṇā sabbaññu taññāṇa ādi aparimita nirupama ppabhāva guṇa visesa samaṅgi bhāvataḥ
translated: For the Realised One, by reason of being endowed with the special qualities of great compassion, omniscient knowledge, and so on, of immeasurable, incomparable, excellent power,

original: sabbasattuttamo, sabbānatthaparihārapubbaṅgamāya niravasesahitasukhavidhānatapparāya🔽niratisayāya payogasampattiyā sadevamanussāya pajāya accantupakāritāya dvattiṃsamahāpurisalakkhaṇaasīti
analyzed: sabba sattuttamaḥ sabba anattha parihāra pubbaṅgamāya niravasesa hita sukha vidhāna tapparāya  niratisayāya payoga sampattiyā sa deva manussāya pajāya accantu pakāritāya dvattiṃsa mahāpurisa lakkhaṇa asi iti
translated: is the most excellent of all beings, and by reason of the accomplishment of his activity, which is preeminent in the avoidance of all misfortune, and is devoted to the provision of the highest, most excellent, incomparable happiness,

original: anubyañjanabyāmappabhādi anaññasādhāraṇavisesapaṭimaṇḍitarūpakāyatāya yathābhuccaguṇādhigatena
analyzed: anubyañjana byāma ppabhā ādi anañña sādhāraṇa visesa paṭimaṇḍita rūpa kāya tāya yathābhucca guṇa adhigatena
translated: he is the most helpful of all to the world with its gods and men, by reason of his physical body, which is adorned with the thirty-two marks of a Great Man, the eighty minor characteristics, the radiance which emanates from his body, and so on, which are not shared by others,

original: “itipi so bhagavā”tiādinayappavattena lokattayabyāpinā suvipulena suvisuddhena ca
analyzed: iti pi saḥ bhagavā ati ādi naya ppavattena lokattaya byāpinā su vipulena su visuddhena ca
translated: and by reason of his attainment of his true qualities, which are proclaimed in the words, “Thus indeed is the Blessed One,” and so on, and which are very extensive and very pure, and which pervade the three worlds,

original: thutighosena samannāgatattā ukkaṃsapāramippattāsu appicchatāsantuṭṭhiādīsu suppatiṭṭhitabhāvato
analyzed: thuti ghosena samannāgata ttā ukkaṃsa pārami ppattāsu appiccha tā santuṭṭhi ādīsu suppatiṭṭhita bhāvato
translated: because of the sound of praise, and because of the state of being well-established in fewness of wishes, contentment, etc. which have reached the highest point,

original: dasabalacatuvesārajjādi-niratisayaguṇavisesa-samaṅgībhāvato ca rūpappamāṇo rūpappasanno,
analyzed: ca rūpa ppamāṇaḥ rūpa ppasannaḥ
translated: and because of being endowed with the special qualities of the ten powers, the four forms of fearlessness, etc. which are beyond compare, he is “one who is greatly loved and revered by gods and men.”

original: ghosappamāṇo ghosappasanno, lūkhappamāṇo lūkhappasanno, dhammappamāṇo dhammappasannoti
analyzed: ghosa ppamāṇaḥ ghosa ppasannaḥ lūkha ppamāṇaḥ lūkha ppasannaḥ dhamma ppamāṇaḥ dhamma ppasannaḥ iti
translated: He is greatly loved and revered by gods and men because of the four kinds of confidence: confidence in the physical form, confidence in the voice, confidence in the mind, and confidence in the Teaching.

original: evaṃ catuppamāṇike lokasannivāse sabbathāpi pasādāvahabhāvena samantapāsādikattā
analyzed: evam catu pamāṇike loka sannivāse sabbathā api pasāda āvaha bhāvena samantapāsādika ttā
translated: Thus, in the fourfold world of beings, he is lovely in every way,

original: aparimāṇānaṃ sattānaṃ sadevamanussānaṃ ādarabahumānagāravāyatanatāya paramapemasambhattiṭṭhānaṃ.
analyzed: aparimāṇānam sattānam sa deva manussānam ādara bahu māna gārava āyatana tāya parama pema sambhatti ṭhānam
translated: and he is the supreme object of faith and reverence for the immeasurable beings, gods and men, because he is the field of merit.

original: Ye tassa ovāde patiṭṭhitā aveccappasādena samannāgatā honti, kenaci asaṃhāriyā tesaṃ
analyzed: ye tassa ovāde patiṭṭhitāḥ avecca ppasādena samannāgatāḥ honti kenaci asaṃhāriyā tesam
translated: Those who are established in his advice and are endowed with perfect confidence cannot be led away from it by anyone,

original: pasādabhatti samaṇena vā brāhmaṇena vā devena vā mārena vā brahmunā vā. Tathā hi
analyzed: samaṇena vā brāhmaṇena vā devena vā mārena vā brahmunā vā tathā hi
translated: whether by a recluse or a brahmin, by a god, a Māra, or a Brahmā. For

original: te attano jīvitapariccāgepi tattha pasādaṃ na pariccajanti, tassa vā āṇaṃ daḷhabhattibhāvato.
analyzed: te attanaḥ jīvita pariccāge pi tattha pasādam na pariccajanti tassa vā āṇam daḷha bhatti bhāvato
translated: and they do not abandon their confidence in him even at the cost of their lives, or his command because of their great devotion to him.

original: Tenevāha –
analyzed: tena iva āha
translated: Hence it is said:

original: “Yo ve kataññū katavedi dhīro;
analyzed: yaḥ ve kataññū kata vedi dhīraḥ
translated: “The wise man who is grateful and thankful

original: Kalyāṇamitto daḷhabhatti ca hotī”ti. ;
analyzed: kalyāṇa mittaḥ daḷha bhatti ca hoti iti
translated: Has a good friend, a firm friend.”

original: “Seyyathāpi, bhikkhave, mahāsamuddo ṭhitadhammo velaṃ nātivattati, evameva kho, bhikkhave,
analyzed: seyyathā api bhikkhave mahā samuddaḥ ṭhita dhammaḥ velam na ativattati evam eva kho bhikkhave
translated: “Bhikkhus, just as the great ocean is a still expanse, not casting up (its dead), so too in my dispensation

original: yaṃ mayā sāvakānaṃ sikkhāpadaṃ paññattaṃ, taṃ mama sāvakā jīvitahetupi nātikkamantī”ti ca. –
analyzed: yam mayā sāvakānam sikkhāpadam paññattam tam mama sāvakāḥ jīvita hetu pi na atikkamanti iti ca
translated: my disciples do not transgress the training rule even for the sake of life.”

original: Evaṃ bhattavāti bhagavā niruttinayena ekassa ta-kārassa lopaṃ katvā itarassa ga-kāraṃ katvā.
analyzed: evam bhattavā ati bhagavā nirutti nayena ekassa takārassa lopam katvā itarassa gakāram katvā
translated: So the Blessed One is “Bhagavā” in the sense of “one who has expelled (evil)” by dropping the first “ta” and taking the second “ga” in the Pali word “niggahīta” .🔽“Because he is endowed with special qualities,

original: “Guṇātisayayuttassa, yasmā lokahitesino;
analyzed: guṇa atisaya yuttassa yasmā loka hita īsinaḥ
translated: And because he is the world’s benefactor,🔽The Teacher has many sambhāras,

original: Sambhattā bahavo satthu, bhagavā tena vuccatī”ti.
analyzed: sambhattā bahavaḥ satthu bhagavā tena vuccati iti
translated: Therefore he is called Bhagavā.”

original: Kathaṃ bhage vamīti bhagavā? Yasmā tathāgato bodhisattabhūtopi aparimāṇāsu jātīsu
analyzed: katham bhage vamīti bhagavā yasmai tathāgataḥ bodhisatta bhūtaḥ api aparimāṇāsu jātīsu
translated: How is he “Bhagavā” in the sense of “one who vomits (evil)”? Because the Tathāgata, even as a Bodhisatta, in immeasurable births,

original: pāramiyo paripūrento bhagasaṅkhātaṃ siriṃ issariyaṃ yasañca vami uggiri, kheḷapiṇḍaṃ
analyzed: paripūrentaḥ bhaga saṅkhātam sirim issariyam yasam ca vami uggiri kheḷapiṇḍam
translated: As he fulfilled the pāramīs, he vomited out, emitted, the glory, sovereignty, and fame called “the portion of a Buddha,”

original: viya anapekkho chaḍḍayi, carimattabhāvepi hatthagataṃ cakkavattisiriṃ devalokādhipaccasadisaṃ
analyzed: viya anapekkhaḥ hattha gatam cakka vatti sirim deva loka adhipacca sadisam
translated: and abandoned them without a second thought, as if they were a lump of phlegm. Even in his last existence, he abandoned without a second thought, as if they were a blade of grass, the glory of a universal monarch,

original: catudīpissariyaṃ cakkavattisampattisannissayaṃ sattaratanasamujjalaṃ yasañca tiṇāyapi
analyzed: catu dīpi ssariyam cakkavatti sampatti sannissayam satta ratana samujjalam yasam ca
translated: and the fame of the sovereignty of the four continents, which was resplendent with the seven treasures and the requisites of a universal monarch,

original: amaññamāno nirapekkho pahāya abhinikkhamitvā sammāsambodhiṃ abhisambuddho, tasmā
analyzed: a maññamānaḥ nirapekkhaḥ pahāya abhinikkhamitvā sammāsambodhim abhisambuddhaḥ tasmai
translated: and went forth into homelessness. He then attained supreme enlightenment. Therefore,🔽he is called the Blessed One because he vomited out these portions, such as glory.

original: ime sirīādike bhage vamīti bhagavā. Atha vā bhāni nāma nakkhattāni, tehi samaṃ gacchanti🔽pavattantīti bhagā, sineruyugandharauttarakuruhimavantādibhājanalokavisesasannissayā
analyzed: ime sirī ādike bhage vamīti bhagavā atha vā bhāni nāma nakkhattāni tehi samam gacchanti  pavattanti iti bhagā sineru yugandhara uttarakuru himavanta ādi bhājana loka visesa sannissayā
translated: Or alternatively, bhagā are the stars; they move along, proceed,🔽with them. The Blessed One is so called because he vomited out, abandoned, the stars, i.e., the distinctions of the world of physical objects, such as Sineru, Yugandhara, Uttarakuru, and Himālaya,

original: sobhā kappaṭṭhiyabhāvato, tepi bhagavā vami tannivāsisattāvāsasamatikkamato tappaṭibaddhachandarāgappahānena
analyzed: sobhā kappaṭṭhiya bhāvato te pi bhagavā tad paṭibaddha chanda rāga ppahānena
translated: which are the bases for the beauty that lasts for an eon. He is also called the Blessed One because he vomited out, abandoned, the craving for them and the desire bound up with them by transcending the world of beings that dwells in them.

original: pajahīti. Evampi bhage vamīti bhagavā.
analyzed: pajahi iti evam pi bhage vami iti bhagavā
translated: Thus too he is called the Blessed One because he vomited out the portions.

original: “Cakkavattisiriṃ yasmā, yasaṃ issariyaṃ sukhaṃ;
analyzed: cakkavatti sirim yasmai yasam issariyam sukham
translated: His fame, his sovereignty, and his happiness, and also the world’s esteem,

original: Pahāsi lokacittañca, sugato bhagavā tato”.
analyzed: pahāsi loka cittam ca sugataḥ bhagavā tatas
translated: The Blessed One is called the Blessed One.”

original: Kathaṃ bhāge vamīti bhagavā? Bhāgā nāma sabhāgadhammakoṭṭhāsā, te khandhāyatanadhātādivasena,
analyzed: katham bhāge vamīti bhagavā bhāgāḥ nāma sa bhāga dhamma koṭṭhāsā te khandha āyatana dhātā ādi vasena
translated: “In what way is he the Blessed One?” The “parts” are the categories of homogeneous phenomena, such as the aggregates, bases, elements, etc.

original: tatthāpi rūpavedanādivasena pathaviyādivasena atītādivasena ca anekavidhā, te ca
analyzed: rūpa vedanā ādi vasena atīta ādi vasena ca anekavidhā te ca
translated: These are of many kinds, such as form, feeling, etc., earth, water, etc., past, etc.

original: bhagavā sabbaṃ papañcaṃ sabbaṃ yogaṃ sabbaṃ ganthaṃ sabbaṃ saṃyojanaṃ samucchinditvā
analyzed: bhagavā sabbam papañcam sabbam yogam sabbam gantham sabbam saṃyojanam samucchinditvā
translated: The Blessed One, having severed all proliferation, all bondage, all fetters, all fettering,

original: amatadhātuṃ samadhigacchanto vami uggiri, anapekkho chaḍḍayi na paccāvami. Tathā
analyzed: amata dhātum samadhigacchantaḥ anapekkhaḥ chaḍḍayi na paccāvami tathā
translated: and having attained the deathless element, vomited out, ejected, and abandoned without regard, and did not vomit back.🔽Thus he is “the Blessed One” in every respect with regard to earth, water, fire, and air,

original: hesa “sabbatthakameva pathaviṃ āpaṃ tejaṃ vāyaṃ, cakkhuṃ sotaṃ ghānaṃ jivhaṃ kāyaṃ
analyzed: ha isa sabbatthakam eva pathavim āpam tejam vāyam cakkhum sotam ghānam jivham kāyam
translated: eye, ear, nose, tongue, body,🔽and mind, with regard to visible forms, sounds, odors, tastes, tactile objects, and mental phenomena,

original: manaṃ, rūpe sadde gandhe rase phoṭṭhabbe dhamme, cakkhuviññāṇaṃ…pe… manoviññāṇaṃ,
analyzed: manam rūpe sadde gandhe rase phoṭṭhabbe dhamme cakkhu viññāṇaṃ pe manaḥ viññāṇaṃ
translated: with regard to eye-consciousness …🔽and mind-consciousness,🔽with regard to eye contact …🔽and mind contact, with regard to the feelings born of eye contact …

original: cakkhusamphassaṃ…pe… manosamphassaṃ, cakkhusamphassajaṃ vedanaṃ…pe… manosamphassajaṃ
analyzed: cakkhu samphassam pe manaḥ samphassam cakkhu samphassa jam vedanam pe manaḥ samphassa jam
translated: and the feelings born of mind contact,

original: vedanaṃ, cakkhusamphassajaṃ saññaṃ…pe… manosamphassajaṃ saññaṃ, cakkhusamphassajaṃ🔽cetanaṃ…pe… manosamphassajaṃ cetanaṃ, rūpataṇhaṃ…pe… dhammataṇhaṃ, rūpavitakkaṃ…pe…🔽dhammavitakkaṃ, rūpavicāraṃ…pe… dhammavicāra”ntiādinā anupadadhammavibhāgavasenapi
analyzed: vedanam cakkhu samphassa jam saññam pe manas samphassa jam saññam cakkhu samphassa jam  cetanam pe manaḥ samphassa jam cetanam rūpa taṇham pe dhamma taṇham rūpa vitakkam pe dhamma vitakkam dhamma vicāra nti ādinā an upada dhamma vibhāga vasena api
translated: feeling born of eye-contact … perception … volition …🔽craving … thought … applied thought … sustained thought born of mind-contact.”🔽🔽And in the Vibhanga, in the section on the unfixed aggregates, it is said: “What is feeling? There is this feeling: feeling born of eye-contact … feeling born of mind-contact.”

original: sabbeva dhammakoṭṭhāse anavasesato vami uggiri, anapekkhapariccāgena chaḍḍayi. Vuttañhetaṃ🔽“yaṃ taṃ, ānanda, cattaṃ vantaṃ muttaṃ pahīnaṃ paṭinissaṭṭhaṃ, taṃ tathāgato puna
analyzed: sabbe eva dhammakoṭṭhāse anavasesataḥ vami anapekkha pariccāgena chaḍḍayi vuttam ha etam  yam tam ānanda cattam vantam muttam pahīnam paṭinissaṭṭham tam tathāgataḥ puna
translated: He vomited up, he brought out, he brought forth, he gave up, he relinquished, he let go of, he did not hold back all the categories of states without exception, by way of the analysis of states that are not clung to, as follows: “Feeling born of eye-contact … … perception … volition … consciousness born of mind-contact … craving for forms … craving for mind-objects … applied thought about forms … … applied thought about mind-objects … sustained thought about forms … … sustained thought about mind-objects.” For this is said:🔽“What has been cut off, cut down, pulled out, and demolished, and which has been given up and rejected so that it is no longer, Ānanda, that the Tathāgata will vomit it up again—that possibility does not exist.”

original: paccāvamissatīti netaṃ ṭhānaṃ vijjatī”ti. Evampi bhāge vamīti bhagavā. Atha vā bhāge
analyzed: paccāvamissati iti na etam ṭhānam vijjati iti evam pi bhāge vamīti bhagavā atha vā bhāge
translated: Thus the Blessed One vomited up in the sense of giving up the parts.

original: vamīti sabbepi kusalākusale sāvajjānavajje hīnapaṇīte kaṇhasukkasappaṭibhāge dhamme
analyzed: sabbe pi kusala akusale sāvajja anavajje hīna paṇīte kaṇha sukka sappaṭibhāge dhamme
translated: Or alternatively, he vomited up in the sense of giving up all profitable and unprofitable, blameable and blameless, inferior and refined, dark and bright states with their counterparts,

original: ariyamaggañāṇamukhena vami uggiri, anapekkho pariccaji pajahi, paresañca tathattāya
analyzed: ariya magga ñāṇa mukhena anapekkhaḥ pariccaji pajahi paresam ca tathattāya
translated: by vomiting up, bringing out, giving up, relinquishing, not holding back, and rejecting them, by way of the knowledge of the noble path, and he advised others to do likewise.

original: dhammaṃ desesi. Vuttampi cetaṃ “dhammāpi vo, bhikkhave, pahātabbā, pageva adhammā.
analyzed: dhammam desesi vuttam pi ca itam dhammā api vaḥ bhikkhave pahātabbā pagā iva adhammā
translated: and he taught the Dhamma. And this is said: “Ideas, bhikkhus, are to be given up, let alone bad ideas.

original: Kullūpamaṃ vo, bhikkhave, dhammaṃ desessāmi nittharaṇatthāya, no gahaṇatthāyā”tiādi.
analyzed: kullūpamam vaḥ bhikkhave dhammam desessāmi nittharaṇa tthāya no gahaṇa tthāya atiādi
translated: I shall teach you a Dhamma simile for crossing over the round, not for grasping” .

original: Evampi bhāge vamīti bhagavā.
analyzed: bhāge vamīti bhagavā
translated: So the Blessed One vomited out the portions.🔽The Great Sage vomited out the portions of ideas,

original: “Khandhāyatanadhātādi-dhammabhāgā-mahesinā;🔽Kaṇhasukkā yato vantā, tatopi bhagavā mato”.
analyzed: khandha āyatana dhātā ādi dhamma bhāgā mahesinā  kaṇhasukkāḥ yatas vantā tatas api bhagavā mataḥ
translated: The aggregates, bases, elements, etc., and also the dark and bright,

original: Tena vuttaṃ –
analyzed: tena vuttam
translated: Therefore he is called the Blessed One.🔽He vomited out the portions, he vomited out the portions of the portions,

original: “Bhāgavā bhatavā bhāge, bhage ca vani bhattavā;
analyzed: bhāgavā bhatavā bhāge bhage ca vani bhattavā
translated: He vomited out the portions, he vomited out the portions of the portions,

original: Bhage vami tathā bhāge, vamīti bhagavā jino”ti.
analyzed: bhage tathā bhāge vami iti bhagavā jinoti
translated: Therefore he is called the Victor, the Blessed One.🔽He makes the Dhamma-body manifest: the Blessed One is called the Dhamma’s Master because of the words “The Dhamma and Discipline, Ananda, that have been taught by me and laid down by me” ,

original: Dhammasarīraṃ paccakkhaṃ karotīti “yo vo, ānanda, mayā dhammo ca vinayo ca desito
analyzed: dhamma sarīram paccakkham karoti iti yaḥ vaḥ ānanda mayā dhammo ca vinayaḥ ca desito
translated: and because of the words “The Dhamma and Discipline, Ananda, which have been taught by me and laid down by me,

original: paññatto, so vo mamaccayena satthā”ti vacanato dhammassa satthubhāvapariyāyo vijjatīti
analyzed: paññattaḥ saḥ vaḥ mamaccayena satthā ati vacanataḥ dhammassa satthu bhāva pariyāyaḥ vijjati iti
translated: and which I now have, will, after I am gone, be your Master” .

original: katvā vuttaṃ. Vajirasaṅghātasamānakāyo parehi abhejjasarīrattā. Na hi bhagavato rūpakāye
analyzed: katvā vuttam vajira saṅghāta samāna kāyaḥ parehi abhejja sarīra ttā na hi bhagavataḥ rūpa kāye
translated: He has a body like a diamond, because his body is indestructible by others.

original: kenaci sakkā antarāyaṃ kātunti. Desanāsampattiṃ niddisati vakkhamānassa sakalassa🔽suttassa “eva”nti nidassanato. Sāvakasampattiṃ niddisati paṭisambhidāppattena pañcasu🔽ṭhānesu bhagavatā etadagge ṭhapitena mayā mahāsāvakena sutaṃ, tañca kho mayāva sutaṃ,🔽na anussutaṃ na paraṃparābhatanti imassatthassa dīpanato. Kālasampattiṃ niddisati
analyzed: kenaci sakkā antarāyam kātun ti desanā sampattim niddisati vakkhamānassa sakalassa  suttassa eva nti nidassanataḥ sāvaka sampattim niddisati paṭisambhidā appattena pañcasu  ṭhānesu bhagavatā etad agge ṭhapitena mayā mahāsāvakena sutam tat ca kho mayā ava sutam  na anussutam na imassa atthassa dīpanataḥ kāla sampattim niddisati
translated: “By anyone” : he shows the excellence of the teacher, for the whole of the sutta is shown by the word “thus” .🔽“By me” : he shows the excellence of the disciple, for it is shown that he has attained the analytical knowledges and has been placed by the Exalted One at the head of those possessing the five superknowledges.🔽“What was heard by me” : he shows the excellence of the time, for it is shown that what was heard by him was not heard by hearsay but was heard by himself.🔽“I heard thus” : he shows the excellence of the time, for it is shown that what was heard by him was not heard by hearsay but was heard by himself.

original: bhagavāsaddasannidhāne payuttassa samayasaddassa buddhuppādapaṭimaṇḍitabhāvadīpanato.🔽Buddhuppādaparamā hi kālasampadā. Tenetaṃ vuccati –🔽“Kappakasāye kaliyuge, buddhuppādo aho mahacchariyaṃ;🔽Hutāvahamajjhe jātaṃ, samuditamakarandamaravinda”nti.🔽Bhagavāti desakasampattiṃ niddisati guṇavisiṭṭhasattuttamabhāvadīpanato garugāravādhivacanabhāvato.
analyzed: bhagavā sadda sannidhāne payuttassa samaya saddassa buddhuppāda paṭimaṇḍita bhāva dīpanato 🔽buddha uppāda paramā hi kāla sampadā tena itam vuccati 🔽kappa kasāye kali yuge buddhuppādaḥ aho mahat śariyam 🔽hutāvaha majjhe jātam samudita makarandam aravindanti 🔽desaka sampattim niddisati guṇa visiṭṭha sattu uttama bhāva dīpanataḥ garu gārava adhivacana bhāvataḥ

He shows the excellence of the hearer by the word “I heard” as the introduction to the sutta, which is about to be expounded. original: Avisesenāti na visesena, vihārabhāvasāmaññenāti attho. Iriyāpatha…pe… vihāresūti
analyzed: avisesena ati na visesena vihāra bhāva sāmaññena ati attho iriyāpatha pe vihāresu
translated: Not in particular: the meaning is, by the mere fact of their being abodes. In postures, etc., in abodes:

original: iriyāpathavihāro, dibbavihāro, brahmavihāro, ariyavihāroti etesu catūsu vihāresu.
analyzed: iriyāpatha vihāraḥ dibba vihāraḥ brahma vihāraḥ ariya vihāro ti etesu catūsu vihāresu
translated: in the four kinds of abodes, that is to say, the posture abode, the divine abode, the noble one’s abode, and the bhikkhu’s abode.

original: Samaṅgīparidīpananti samaṅgībhāvaparidīpanaṃ. Etanti “viharatī”ti etaṃ padaṃ. Tathā
analyzed: samaṅgī paridīpanam iti samaṅgī bhāva paridīpanam etat iti viharati iti etam padam tathā
translated: The demonstration of equality: the demonstration of the state of equality. That: the word “dwells.”

original: hi taṃ “idhekacco gihīhi saṃsaṭṭho viharati sahanandī sahasokī”tiādīsu iriyāpathavihāre
analyzed: hi tam idha ekaccaḥ gihīhi saṃsaṭṭhaḥ viharati saha nandī saha sokī iti ādīsu iriyāpatha vihāre
translated: For that word occurs in the posture abode thus, “Here someone dwells together with householders, enjoying their companionship” , and so on .

original: āgataṃ. “Yasmiṃ, bhikkhave, samaye bhikkhu vivicceva kāmehi…pe… paṭhamaṃ jhānaṃ upasampajja
analyzed: āgatam yasmin bhikkhave samaye bhikkhu vivicca iva paṭhamam jhānam upasampajja
translated: It occurs in the divine abode thus, “Bhikkhus, when a bhikkhu enters upon the first jhāna … he dwells in the divine abodes” .

original: viharatī”ti ettha dibbavihāre. “So mettāsahagatena cetasā ekaṃ disaṃ pharitvā viharatī”tiādīsu
analyzed: viharati iti ettha dibba vihāre saḥ mettā sahagatena cetasā ekam disam pharitvā viharati itiādīsu
translated: It occurs in the noble one’s abode thus, “He abides pervading one quarter with a mind imbued with loving-kindness, likewise the second, likewise the third, likewise the fourth” , and so on.

original: brahmavihāre. “So kho ahaṃ, aggivessana, tassāyeva kathāya pariyosāne tasmiṃ eva
analyzed: brahmavihāre saḥ kho aham aggivessana tassāya iva kathāya pariyosāne tasmin eva
translated: It occurs in the bhikkhu’s abode thus, “Then, Aggivessana, at the end of that talk I dismissed the bhikkhus, saying, ‘Bhikkhus, you may go.🔽I will visit the brahmin student Jotipala today.’ And I went to the brahmin student Jotipala’s hermitage and I stayed there in the forest grove.

original: purimasmiṃ samādhinimitte ajjhattameva cittaṃ saṇṭhapemi sannisādemi ekodiṃ karomi
analyzed: purimasmin samādhi nimitte ajjhattam eva cittam saṇṭhapemi sannisādemi ekodim karomi
translated: Then, Aggivessana, in the first watch of the night I concentrated my mind on the divisibility of the elements. I saw the four great elements and the beings who are their substrate, and I understood that they are inconstant, formed, dependently arisen, subject to destruction, subject to fall, subject to fading away, subject to cessation.

original: samādahāmi, yena sudaṃ niccakappaṃ viharāmī”tiādīsu ariyavihāre.
analyzed: samādahāmi yena sudam nicca kappam viharāmi itiādīsu ariya vihāre
translated: in the sense of the noble one’s abiding in the passage: “I have abandoned that by which I might abide in the world, and I abide by that whereby I do not abide in the world” , and so on.

original: Tattha iriyanaṃ vattanaṃ iriyā, kāyappayogo. Tassā pavattanupāyabhāvato ṭhānādi iriyāpatho.🔽Ṭhānasamaṅgī vā hi kāyena kiñci kareyya gamanādīsu aññatarasamaṅgī vā. Atha vā iriyati
analyzed: tattha iriyanam vattanam iriyā kāya ppayogo tassā pavattana upāya bhāvataḥ ṭhāna ādi iriyāpathaḥ  ṭhāna samaṅgī vā hi kāyena kiñci kareyya gamana ādīsu aññatara samaṅgī vā atha vā iriyati
translated: Herein, the going is the occurrence, the bodily activity. Standing, etc., are the postures because they are the means for its occurrence.🔽For one who is standing might do some bodily activity among those beginning with going, or one who is sitting or lying down might do some bodily activity among those beginning with standing. Or alternatively, the body is gone by means of this,

original: pavattati etena attabhāvo kāyakiccaṃ vāti iriyā, tassā pavattiupāyabhāvato iriyā🔽ca so patho cāti iriyāpatho, ṭhānādi eva. So ca atthato gatinivattiādiākārena pavatto
analyzed: pavattati etena atta bhāvaḥ kāya kiccam vāti iriyā tassā pavatti upāya bhāvataḥ iriyā  ca saḥ pathaḥ ca ati iriyāpathaḥ ṭhāna ādi eva so ca atthataḥ gati nivatti ādi ākārena pavatto
translated: or the bodily activity occurs, thus it is posture ;🔽and that is a path , thus it is posture-path . And that is only standing, etc.,🔽which is a continuity of four-aggregate materiality occurring in the mode of going, stopping, etc.,🔽or it is the bodily activity itself. Or alternatively, one abides by means of this, thus it is abiding ;

original: catusantatirūpapabandho eva. Viharaṇaṃ, viharati etenāti vā vihāro, iriyāpatho eva🔽vihāro iriyāpathavihāro. Divi bhavo dibbo, tattha bahulappavattiyā brahmapārisajjādidevaloke
analyzed: eva viharaṇam viharati etena ati vā vihāraḥ iriyāpathaḥ eva  vihāraḥ iriyāpatha vihāro divi bhavaḥ dibbaḥ tattha bahula ppavattiyā brahma pārisajja ādi deva loke
translated: and that is a posture, thus it is posture-abiding .🔽It is divine because it is in the heavens, or it is divine because it is much used by Brahmā, and so on, and it is abiding because it is existence in the divine world of the Brahmā retinue, and so on.

original: bhavoti attho. Tattha yo dibbānubhāvo, tadatthāya saṃvattatīti vā dibbo, abhiññābhinīhāravasena
analyzed: bhavaḥ ti attho tattha yaḥ dibba anubhāvo tad atthāya saṃvattati iti vā dibbaḥ abhiññā abhinīhāra vasena
translated: Herein, the divine power is divine, or it is divine because it is the means to that. And it is abiding because it is existence in the divine world of the Brahmā retinue, and so on, by the exercise of direct-knowledge.

original: mahāgatikattā vā dibbo, dibbo ca so vihāro cāti dibbavihāro, catasso rūpāvacarasamāpattiyo.🔽Āruppasamāpattiyopi ettheva saṅgahaṃ gacchanti. Brahmūnaṃ, brahmāno vā vihārā brahmavihārā,
analyzed: mahāgatika ttā vā dibbaḥ dibbaḥ ca so vihāro ca ati dibbavihāro catasso rūpāvacara samāpattiyaḥ  āruppa samāpattiyaḥ pi etthā iva saṅgaham gacchanti brahmūnam brahmānaḥ vā vihārāḥ brahmavihārā
translated: Or alternatively, it is divine because it has great range, and it is a divine abiding because it is an abiding of the divine, that is, of the deities, thus it is a divine abiding . It is the four jhānas of the fine-material sphere.

original: catasso appamaññāyo. Ariyānaṃ, ariyā vā vihārā ariyavihārā, cattāri sāmaññaphalāni.🔽So hi ekaṃ iriyāpathabādhanantiādi yadipi bhagavā ekenapi iriyāpathena cirataraṃ
analyzed: catasso appamaññāyaḥ ariyānam ariyāḥ vā vihārāḥ ariya vihārā cattāri sāmañña phalāni  saḥ hi ekam iriyāpatha bādhana ntiādi yadi pi bhagavā ekena api iriyāpathena cirataram
translated: The immaterial attainments are also included here. It is a divine abiding because it is an abiding of Brahmā, or because it is an abiding in the way beginning with Brahmā, thus it is a divine abiding . It is the four divine abidings. It is a divine abiding because it is an abiding of the Noble Ones, or because it is an abiding in the way beginning with the Noble Ones, thus it is a divine abiding . It is the four paths and fruits.🔽Although the Blessed One is able to continue his existence for a long time with any one posture, still he spoke thus in order to show that this is the nature of one who has taken up a vital process, saying, “One posture for one day and night.”🔽Or alternatively, the Blessed One spoke thus in order to show that this is the nature of one who has taken up a vital process, saying, “One posture for one day and night.”

original: kālaṃ attabhāvaṃ pavattetuṃ sakkoti, tathāpi upādinnakasarīrassa nāma ayaṃ sabhāvoti🔽dassetuṃ vuttaṃ. Yasmā vā bhagavā yattha katthaci vasanto vineyyānaṃ dhammaṃ desento,
analyzed: kālam atta bhāvam pavattetum sakkoti tathā api upādinnaka sarīrassa nāma ayam sabhāvaḥ ti  dassetum vuttam yasmai vā bhagavā yattha katthaci vasantaḥ vineyyānam dhammaṃ desentaḥ
translated: Or alternatively, the Blessed One spoke thus in order to show that this is the nature of one who has taken up a vital process, saying, “One posture for one day and night.”🔽Or alternatively, the Blessed One spoke thus in order to show that this is the nature of one who has taken up a vital process, saying, “One posture for one day and night.”🔽Or alternatively, the Blessed One spoke thus in order to show that this is the nature of one who has taken up a vital process, saying, “One posture for one day and night.”🔽Or alternatively, the Blessed One spoke thus in order to show that this is the nature of one who has taken up a vital process, saying, “One posture for one day and night.”🔽Or alternatively, the Blessed One spoke thus in order to show that this is the nature of one who has taken up a vital process, saying, “One posture for one day and night.”🔽Or alternatively, the Blessed One spoke thus in order to show that this is the nature of one who has taken up a vital process, saying, “One posture for one day and night.”

original: nānāsamāpattīhi ca kālaṃ vītināmento vasatīti sattānaṃ attano ca vividhaṃ hitasukhaṃ🔽harati upaneti uppādeti, tasmā vividhaṃ haratīti evamettha attho veditabbo.
analyzed: nānā samāpattīhi ca kālam vasati iti sattānam attano ca vividham hita sukham 🔽harati upaneti uppādeti tasmai vividham harati iti evam ettha atthaḥ veditabbo
translated: Or alternatively, the Blessed One spoke thus in order to show that this is the nature of one who has taken up a vital process, saying, “

original: Paccatthike jinātīti jeto. Jeta-saddo hi sota-saddo viya kattusādhanopi atthīti.
analyzed: paccatthike jināti iti jetaḥ jeta saddaḥ hi sota saddaḥ viya kattu sādhanaḥ api atthi iti
translated: He is a conqueror of his adversaries, thus he is a victor . For the word jeta is a verbal noun derived from the root jī.

original: Rañño vā paccatthikānaṃ jitakāle jātattā jeto. Rañño hi attano jayaṃ tattha āropetvā🔽jitavāti jetoti kumāro vutto. Maṅgalakāmatāya vā jetotissa nāmaṃ kataṃ, tasmā “jeyyo”ti
analyzed: raññaḥ vā paccatthikānam jita kāle jāta ttā jeto raññaḥ hi attanaḥ jayam tattha āropetvā  jitavā ati jetoti kumāraḥ vuttaḥ maṅgala kāmatāya vā jetotissa nāmam katam tasmā jeyyaḥ ti
translated: Or alternatively, he was born at the time of the king’s victory over his adversaries, thus he is a victor . For the king, having transferred his victory to that place,🔽said, “It is conquered ,” thus the boy was called Jeta. Or his name was given as Jeta out of a desire for an auspicious sign. Therefore it should be regarded as said in the sense of “conquerable ”

original: etasmiṃ atthe “jeto”ti vuttanti daṭṭhabbaṃ. Tassa jetassa rājakumārassa. Vanetiādito
analyzed: etasmin atthe jetoti vuttanti daṭṭhabbam tassa jetassa rāja kumārassa vana itiāditaḥ
translated: in the sense of “jeto.” Of that Prince Jeta. In the wood, etc.

original: paṭṭhāyeva taṃ tassa santakanti dassetuṃ “taṃ hī”tiādi vuttaṃ. Sabbakāmasamiddhitāya
analyzed: paṭṭhāya iva tam tassa santakam ti dassetum tam hi itiādi vuttam sabba kāma samiddhitāya
translated: In order to show that it was his property from the beginning, “It was given by him” is said. Because it was endowed with all desirable things,

original: vigatamalamaccheratāya karuṇādiguṇasamaṅgitāya ca niccakālaṃ upaṭṭhapito anāthānaṃ🔽piṇḍo etassa atthīti anāthapiṇḍiko, tassa anāthapiṇḍikassa. Yadi jetavanaṃ, kathaṃ
analyzed: vigata malama cheratāya karuṇā ādi guṇa samaṅgi tāya ca nicca kālam upaṭṭhapitaḥ an āthānam  piṇḍaḥ etassa atthi iti anāthapiṇḍikaḥ tassa anāthapiṇḍikassa yadi jetavanam katham
translated: because it was free from the stain of avarice, and because it was endowed with the special qualities of compassion, etc., he was always attended by those who had no protector🔽and who had a share in the alms given by him, thus he was Anāthapiṇḍika. Of that Anāthapiṇḍika. If it was Jeta’s Wood,

original: anāthapiṇḍikassa ārāmoti āha “anāthapiṇḍikenā”tiādi. Pañcavidhasenāsanaṅgasampattiyā
analyzed: anāthapiṇḍikassa ārāmaḥ ti āha anāthapiṇḍikena atiādi pañcavidha senāsana aṅga sampattiyā
translated: how was it called Anāthapiṇḍika’s Park? He said, “Anāthapiṇḍika bought it,” etc. Because it was endowed with the five requisite conditions for a resting place,

original: āramanti ettha pabbajitāti ārāmo, tasmiṃ ārāme. Yadipi so bhūmibhāgo koṭisantharena
analyzed: āramanti ettha pabbajitā ti ārāmaḥ tasmin ārāme yadi api saḥ bhūmi bhāgaḥ koṭi santharena
translated: A monastery is where those who have gone forth are supported; in that monastery. Although that piece of land is connected with a koṭisanthara,

original: mahāseṭṭhinā kīto, rukkhā pana jetena na vikkītāti taṃ “jetavana”nti vattabbataṃ
analyzed: mahāseṭṭhinā kītaḥ rukkhā pana jetena na vikkītā ati tam jetavanam ti
translated: ‘A pleasure grove’ is a place where those gone forth resort; in that pleasure grove. Though that site was bought by the great merchant Koṭṭhita, the trees were not bought by Jēta, they say, so it is proper to call it ‘Jēta’s Wood.’

original: labhatīti vadanti. Ubhinnampi vā tattha pariccāgavisesakittanatthaṃ ubhayavacanaṃ,
analyzed: labhati iti vadanti ubhinnam pi vā tattha ubhaya vacanam
translated: Or else, the mention of both is for the purpose of extolling the excellence of the gift of both by them,

original: jetenapi hi bhūmibhāgavikkayena laddhadhanaṃ tattha dvārakoṭṭhakakaraṇavasena viniyuttaṃ.🔽Sāvatthijetavanānaṃ bhūmibhāgavasena bhinnattā vuttaṃ “na hi sakkā ubhayattha ekaṃ
analyzed: jetena api hi bhūmi bhāga vikkayena laddha dhanam tattha dvāra koṭṭhaka karaṇa vasena viniyuttam  sāvatthi jetavanānam bhūmi bhāga vasena bhinna ttā vuttam na hi sakkā ubhayattha ekam
translated: for Jēta also spent the money he had received from the sale of the site on the building of the gateway and the surrounding wall.

original: samayaṃ viharitu”nti.
analyzed: samayam viharitum ti
translated: Since Sāvatthī and Jētavana are different sites, it is said that ‘it is not possible to live at both places at the same time.’

original: Apākaṭāti sakko suyāmotiādinā anabhiññātā. Abhiññātānampi aññatarasaddo dissateva
analyzed: apākaṭā ati sakko suyāmā iti ādinā anabhiññātā abhiññātānam pi aññatara saddo dissatā iva
translated: ‘Not well known’ means not well known by such names as ‘Sakka,’ ‘Suyāma,’ etc. The word ‘one’ is seen even in the case of well-known persons,

original: ekasadisāyattattāti dassetuṃ “abhijānāti no”tiādi vuttaṃ. Ahunā idāneva. Sādhāraṇavacanaṃ
analyzed: eka sadisa āyatta ttā ti dassetum abhijānāti no tiādi vuttam ahunā idānā iva sādhāraṇa vacanam
translated: in order to show that they are similar to others. ‘Does he remember?’ etc. is said. ‘Recently’ means now. The word ‘together’

original: dibbataṃ antonītaṃ katvā. Devo eva devatā purisepi vattanato. Tenevāha “imasmiṃ panatthe”tiādi.
analyzed: dibbatam antonītam katvā devaḥ eva devatā purise pi vattanato tena iva āha imasmin pana attha itiādi
translated: and the divine state is brought to the end. The word ‘god’ is used for men because of their conduct. That is why he said ‘In this case’ and so on.

original: Nanu ca rūpāvacarasattānaṃ purisindriyaṃ natthi, yena te purisāti vucceyyuṃ? Yadipi🔽purisindriyaṃ natthi, purisasaṇṭhānassa pana purisavesassa ca vasena purisapuggalātveva
analyzed: nanu ca rūpāvacara sattānam purisa indriyam na atthi yena te purisā ti vucceyyum yadi pi  purisa indriyam na atthi purisa saṇṭhānassa pana purisa vesassa ca vasena
translated: But surely the human faculty is absent in the beings of the fine-material sphere, so how can they be called men?

original: vuccanti purisapakatibhāvato.🔽Abhikkantāti atikkantā, vigatāti atthoti āha “khaye dissatī”ti. Teneva hi “nikkhanto🔽paṭhamo yāmo”ti upari vuttaṃ. Abhikkantataroti ativiya kantataro. Tādiso ca sundaro
analyzed: vuccanti purisa pakati bhāvato  abhikkantā ati atikkantā vigatā ati attho ti āha khaye dissati iti tena iva hi nikkhantaḥ  paṭhamaḥ yāmaḥ ti upari vuttam abhikkantataro ti ativiya kantataro tādiso ca sundaro
translated: Though the human faculty is absent, they are nevertheless called ‘men’ because of the shape of their bodies and because of their sex.

original: bhaddako nāma hotīti āha “sundare dissatī”ti. Koti devanāgayakkhagandhabbādīsu ko
analyzed: bhaddakaḥ nāma hoti iti āha sundare dissati iti ko ti deva nāga yakkha gandhabba ādīsu ko
translated: ‘Gone beyond’: passed beyond. ‘Gone forth’: gone out. ‘Gone to the end’: disappeared. That is why he said ‘Disappears in destruction.’ That is why it was said above ‘The first watch of the night has passed’ . ‘Gone further’: gone further beyond. And such a one is called ‘beautiful’ and ‘excellent.’ That is why he said ‘Disappears in the beautiful’ . ‘Which’: which of the gods, nāgas, supaṇṇas, etc.;🔽‘what’: what kind of;🔽‘my’: my;🔽‘feet’: feet;🔽‘by psychic power’: by such psychic power as this;

original: katamo? Meti mama. Pādānīti pāde. Iddhiyāti imāya evarūpāya deviddhiyā. Yasasāti
analyzed: katamaḥ mā iti mama pādāni iti pāde iddhiyā ati imāya evarūpāya deviddhiyā yasasā ati
translated: ‘glory’:

original: iminā edisena parivārena paricchadena ca. Jalanti vijjotamāno. Abhikkantenāti ativiya
analyzed: iminā edisena parivārena paricchadena ca jalanti vijjotamānaḥ abhikkantena ati
translated: Shining, radiant,🔽with surpassing beauty: with surpassing beauty, with loveliness, with a comely appearance.

original: kantena kamaniyena abhirūpena. Vaṇṇenāti chavivaṇṇena sarīravaṇṇanibhāya. Sabbā obhāsayaṃ
analyzed: kantena kamaniyena abhirūpena vaṇṇena ati chavi vaṇṇena sarīra vaṇṇa nibhāya sabbāḥ obhāsayam
translated: With his radiance: with his radiance, with the complexion of his body’s appearance.

original: disāti sabbāpi disā pabhāsento cando viya sūriyo viya ca ekobhāsaṃ ekālokaṃ karontoti
analyzed: disā ti sabbā api disā pabhāsento candaḥ viya sūriyaḥ viya ca ekobhāsam ekālokam karonto ti
translated: Illuminating all quarters: illuminating all quarters, making a single flare of light, a single flare of radiance, like the moon and like the sun.🔽This is the meaning of the verse.
