analyzed: paṭicchannam katvā desanā upāyaḥ māna niggaṇhana vasena tassā devatāya sacca abhisamaya kāraṇa bhāvato  patiṭṭhāna āyūhana paṭikkhepa upadesena catur ogha nirattharaṇatthikehi anta dvaya rahitā
translated: The method of teaching is by way of concealing. Because of the reason for the manifestation of the truth for that deity by way of the removal of pride,

original: majjhimā paṭipatti paṭipajjitabbāti ayamettha bhagavato āṇattīti ayaṃ desanāhāro.
analyzed: majjhimā paṭipatti paṭipajjitabbā ti ayam ettha bhagavataḥ āṇatti iti ayam desanā āhāraḥ
translated: the Blessed One’s advice is this: “The middle way should be practised, which is free from the two extremes, for the sake of those who seek the fourfold flood-crossing without a ford.” This is the nourishment of the teaching.

original: Parasaṃsayapakkhandanatāya ñātukāmatāya ca kathaṃ nūti pucchāvasena vuttaṃ? Abhimukhabhāvato
analyzed: para saṃsaya pakkhandana tāya ñātu kāma tāya ca katham nu ti pucchā vasena vuttam abhimukha bhāvato
translated: Why is it said by way of the question “How?” because of the desire to know and the inclination to doubt of others?

original: ekapuggalabhāvato ca “tva”nti vuttaṃ. Paramukkaṃsagatassa garubhāvassa anaññayogyassa🔽saddhammadhurassa paridīpanato sādhūti marisasīlādiguṇatāya “mārisā”ti vuttaṃ. Avahananato
analyzed: eka puggala bhāvataḥ ca tvan ti vuttam param ukkaṃsa gatassa garu bhāvassa anañña yogyassa  saddhamma dhurassa paridīpanato sādhu iti marisa sīla ādi guṇa tāya mārisa ati vuttam avahananato
translated: It is said “you” because of the state of being face to face and the state of being one person.🔽Because of the manifestation of the one who is worthy of the heavy burden of the supreme teaching,🔽it is said “good friend” because of the qualities of the friend such as the practice of good conduct. Because of the state of being carried away and the state of being a heap,

original: rāsibhāvato ca “ogha”nti vuttaṃ. Ñātuṃ icchitassa atthassa katattā pariyosāpitattā
analyzed: rāsi bhāvataḥ ca oghanti vuttam ñātum icchitassa atthassa kata ttā pariyosāpita ttā
translated: it is said “flood.” Because of the state of being desired to be known, because of the state of being completed,

original: “itī”ti vuttaṃ. Saṃsīdanalakkhaṇassa patiṭṭhānassa akātabbato sabbaso ca akatattā.
analyzed: iti iti vuttam saṃsīdana lakkhaṇassa patiṭṭhānassa a kātabbataḥ sabbaso ca a kata ttā
translated: it is said “thus.” Because of the state of being not done and the state of being not done at all of the footing which has the characteristic of sinking.

original: “Appatiṭṭha”nti vuttaṃ. Tayidaṃ akaraṇaṃ ekaṃsikanti khoti avadhāraṇavasena vuttaṃ.
analyzed: appatiṭṭhanti vuttam tayidam akaraṇam ekaṃsikam ti kho ti avadhāraṇa vasena vuttam
translated: “No footing” is said. And this non-doing is “one-pointed” in the sense of being exclusive.

original: Tassa ca appatiṭṭhānassa sasantatigatattā “tva”nti ca pucchitattā “aha”nti vuttaṃ.
analyzed: tassa ca appatiṭṭhānassa sa santati gata ttā tvanti ca pucchita ttā aham ti vuttam
translated: And because of the continuity of that non-footing, and because of the question “I?” it is said “I”.

original: Devatāya sambodhanato piyālapanato ca, “āvuso”ti vuttaṃ. Nibbuyhanalakkhaṇassa āyūhanassa
analyzed: devatāya sambodhanato piya ālapanato ca āvuso ti vuttam nibbuyhana lakkhaṇassa āyūhanassa
translated: And because of the deity’s address and the use of the familiar form “friend”, it is said “friend”.🔽Because of the non-doing of the characteristic of “taking up” which is the condition for rebirth,🔽and because of the non-doing of it in every way, it is said “I have no taking up”.

original: akātabbato sabbaso ca akatattā anāyūhanti vuttaṃ. Tiṇṇākārassa oghānaṃ anicchitabhāvato
analyzed: a kātabbataḥ sabbasas ca a kata ttā an āyūhanti vuttam tiṇṇa ākārassa oghānam an icchita bhāvato
translated: Because of the non-choice of the three-formed flood,

original: eva tattha saṃsayassa anapagatattā oghataraṇassa ca avisesattā “yathā kathaṃ panā”ti🔽vuttaṃ. Tathā saṃsīdanalakkhaṇaṃ patiṭṭhānaṃ saṃsāre ca saṇṭhānanti anatthantarattā
analyzed: eva tattha saṃsayassa an apagata ttā ogha taraṇassa ca avisesa ttā yathā katham pana ati  vuttam tathā saṃsīdana lakkhaṇam patiṭṭhānam saṃsāre ca saṇṭhānan ti anatthantara ttā
translated: and because of the non-departure of doubt there, and because of the non-distinction of the crossing of the flood, it is said “But how, friend?”🔽So too, the footing, which has the characteristic of “sinking”, and the “settling down” in the round of rebirths, are not different in meaning,

original: abhinnakālikaṃ. Tathā nibbuyhanalakkhaṇaṃ āyūhanaṃ sammāpaṭipattiyā ativattananti
analyzed: abhinna kālikam tathā nibbuyhana lakkhaṇam āyūhanam sammāpaṭipattiyāḥ ativattananti
translated: and so they are said to be of the same time. So too, the “taking up”, which has the characteristic of “taking up”, and the right practice, which is the opposite of that,🔽are not different in meaning, and so it is said “When I … friend, then I shall take up” .

original: anatthantarattā abhinnakālikanti vuttaṃ “yadā svāhaṃ…pe… tadāssu nibbuyhāmī”ti. Tadubhayassa
analyzed: anatthantara ttā abhinna kālikam ti vuttam yadā tadā assu nibbuyhāmi iti tad ubhayassa
translated: And both of these,

original: paṭipakkhabhāvato paṭibāhanato ca oghātiṇṇāti vuttaṃ “evaṃ khvāhaṃ…pe… oghamatari”nti.🔽Ekabuddhantarantarikattā sudūrakālikatāya “cirassa”nti vuttaṃ. Antarā adiṭṭhapubbatāya
analyzed: paṭipakkha bhāvato paṭibāhanato ca oghātiṇṇā ti vuttam evam khvā aham pe ogham atarin ti  eka buddha antarantarika ttā su dūra kālika tāya cirassanti vuttam antarā a diṭṭha pubba tāya
translated: and because he has crossed the flood by opposing it and by warding it off, it is said: “Thus, indeed, I have crossed the flood, difficult to cross, in a short time. ”🔽Because of the long interval between the Buddhas, and because of the difficulty of crossing over, it is said: “In a long time. ” Because of the non-appearance of a Buddha in the interval,

original: vimhayanīyatāya ca “vatā”ti vuttaṃ. Tadā upalabbhamānatāya attapaccakkhatāya ca “passāmī”ti
analyzed: vimhayanīya tāya ca vatā iti vuttam tadā upalabbhamāna tāya atta paccakkha tāya ca passāmi iti
translated: and because of the difficulty of finding faith, it is said: “I see a Tathagata, arisen in the world, an Arahant, a Perfectly Enlightened One. ”

original: vuttaṃ. Bāhitapāpato brahmassa ca ariyamaggassa aṇanato paṭivijjhanato “brāhmaṇa”nti
analyzed: vuttam bāhitapāpataḥ brahmassa ca ariya maggassa aṇanataḥ paṭivijjhanataḥ brāhmaṇa nti
translated: Because of the removal of evil, and because of the penetration of the noble Brahma-faring, which is subtle, it is said: “I see a Brahma-faring, O Brahmins. ”

original: vuttaṃ. Kilesasantāpavūpasamanato dukkhasantāpavūpasamanato ca sabbaso nibbutattā🔽“parinibbuta”nti vuttaṃ. Taraṇapayogassa nibbattitattā upari taritabbābhāvato ca
analyzed: vuttam kilesa santāpa vūpasamanataḥ dukkha santāpa vūpasamanataḥ ca sabbasas nibbuta ttā  parinibbutanti vuttam taraṇa payogassa nibbattita ttā upari taritabba abhāvato ca
translated: Because of the complete extinction of the suffering of the defilements and of suffering, it is said: “I see one who has attained complete extinction. ”

original: “tiṇṇa”nti vuttaṃ. Ñāṇacakkhunā oloketabbato lujjanato palujjanato ca “loke”ti vuttaṃ.
analyzed: tiṇṇan ti vuttam ñāṇa cakkhunā oloketabbataḥ lujjanataḥ palujjanataḥ ca loketi vuttam
translated: Because of the arising of the effort to cross over, and because of the absence of what is to be crossed over above, it is said: “I see one who has crossed over. ” Because of the looking on with the eye of knowledge, and because of the breaking up and the falling away , it is said: “I see the world. ”

original: Visayesu sañjanato jātabhāvato “visattika”nti vuttaṃ. Ñāṇassa paccakkhabhāvato nigamanato
analyzed: visayesu sañjanataḥ jāta bhāvataḥ visattikanti vuttam ñāṇassa paccakkha bhāvataḥ nigamanato
translated: Because of the arising of craving in the objects of sense desire, and because of the arising of birth, it is said: “I see the world with its objects of sense desire. ” Because of the direct knowledge of knowledge, and because of the conclusion ,

original: ca “ida”nti vuttaṃ. Bhāsitattā parisamattattā ca “avocā”ti vuttaṃ. Paṭhamaṃ gahitattā
analyzed: ca idam ti vuttam bhāsita ttā parisamatta ttā ca avoca iti vuttam paṭhamam gahita ttā
translated: and so it is said “this”. And because it was spoken and because it was spoken to the assembly, it is said “he spoke”. Because it was spoken first,

original: paccāmasanato ca “sā devatā”ti vuttaṃ. Paṭikkhepassa abhāvato atthassa anumoditabbato
analyzed: paccāmasanato ca sā devatā iti vuttam paṭikkhepassa abhāvataḥ atthassa anumoditabbato
translated: and because of the absence of a reply, it is said “that deity”. Because there was no refusal, and because the meaning was to be rejoiced in,

original: “samanuñño”ti vuttaṃ. Vineyyānaṃ sāsanato paramatthasampattito ca “satthā”ti vuttaṃ.
analyzed: samanuññaḥ iti vuttam vineyyānam sāsanato paramattha sampattitaḥ ca satthā iti vuttam
translated: it is said “he assented”. Because of the teaching of those to be trained, and because of the fulfilment of the highest meaning,

original: Cakkhupathātikkamena tirobhāvūpagamanato “antaradhāyī”ti vuttanti ayaṃ anupadavicayato vicayahāro.
analyzed: cakkhu patha atikkamena tirobhāva upagamanataḥ antaradhāyi iti vuttan ti ayam anupada vicayataḥ vicaya hāro
translated: it is said “the Teacher”. Because of the disappearance by passing beyond the range of sight, it is said “he vanished”. This is the mode of Conveying a Conversion by Investigation into the order of the words.

original: Appatiṭṭhānānāyūhanehi oghataraṇaṃ yujjati kilesābhisaṅkhāravijahanena pārasampattisamijjhanato.
analyzed: ogha taraṇam yujjati kilesa abhisaṅkhāra vijahanena pāra sampatti samijjhanataḥ
translated: The crossing of the flood is appropriate by means of non-clinging and non-grasping because of the success in reaching the further shore by means of the casting off of defilements and determinations.

original: Sabbakilesa-taṇhādiṭṭhi-taṇhāyatana-sassatādivasena santiṭṭhato saṃsāre saṃsīdanaṃ
analyzed: sabba kilesa taṇhā diṭṭhi taṇhā āyatana sassata ādi vasena santiṭṭhato saṃsāre saṃsīdanam
translated: The sinking in the round of rebirths is appropriate for one who stands fast in the round of rebirths by means of all defilements, craving, views, craving for the sense-bases, and eternity, etc.,

original: hotīti yujjati kāraṇassa suppatiṭṭhitabhāvato. Abhisaṅkharaṇakicce kilesābhisaṅkhāre
analyzed: hoti iti yujjati kāraṇassa suppatiṭṭhita bhāvataḥ abhisaṅkharaṇa kicce kilesa abhisaṅkhāre
translated: because of the well-established state of the reason. The casting off of determinations is appropriate for one who has crossed the flood by means of non-clinging and non-grasping because of the success in reaching the further shore by means of the casting off of defilements and determinations.

original: vijjamāne sabbadiṭṭhābhinivesa-atidhāvanābhinivesādīnaṃ vasena āyūhantassa saṃsāramahoghena🔽nibbuyhanaṃ hotīti yujjati sammāpaṭipattiyā ativattanato. Brahmassa ariyamaggassa
analyzed: vijjamāne sabba diṭṭha abhinivesa atidhāvana abhinivesa ādīnam vasena āyūhantassa saṃsāra mahoghena  nibbuyhanam hoti iti yujjati sammāpaṭipattiyāḥ ativattanataḥ brahmassa ariya maggassa
translated: and it is proper that there should be escape from the great flood of the round of rebirths for one who is crossing over by right practice in the way stated.

original: aṇanato paṭivijjhanato brāhmaṇabhāvo yujjjati bāhitapāpattā. Sammadeva santadhammasamadhigamato
analyzed: paṭivijjhanataḥ brāhmaṇa bhāvaḥ yujjati sammat eva santa dhamma samadhigamato
translated: The state of being a brahmin is proper because of the elimination of evil through the noble path of the brahmin,

original: parinibbutabhāvo yujjati sabbaso savāsanapahīnakilesattā. Tathā ca visattikāya tiṇṇabhāvo
analyzed: parinibbuta bhāvaḥ yujjati sabbaso sa vāsanā pahīna kilesa ttā tathā ca visattikāya tiṇṇa bhāvo
translated: and the state of being fully quenched is proper because of the complete abandonment of defilements together with their underlying tendencies through the attainment of the state of peace.

original: yujjati yathā yāya lesopi na dissati, evaṃ aggamaggena tassā samucchinnattāti ayaṃ yuttihāro.🔽Kilesavaṭṭavasena patiṭṭhānaṃ visesato kammavaṭṭassa padaṭṭhānaṃ. Abhisaṅkhāravasena
analyzed: yujjati yathā yāya lesaḥ api na dissati evam aggamaggena ayam yutti hāro  kilesa vaṭṭa vasena patiṭṭhānam visesataḥ kamma vaṭṭassa padaṭṭhānam abhisaṅkhāra vasena
translated: And the state of being one who has crossed over to the far shore is proper in the sense that no trace of it is seen, since it has been completely eradicated by the supreme path. This is the Mode of Conveying a Proper Relation.🔽The basis for the round of kamma is the round of defilements, and the basis for the round of kamma-result is the volition that accumulates kamma.

original: āyūhanañca vipākavaṭṭassa padaṭṭhānaṃ. Appatiṭṭhānānāyūhanāni oghataraṇassa padaṭṭhānaṃ,
analyzed: āyūhanañca vipāka vaṭṭassa padaṭṭhānam appatiṭṭhāna anāyūhanāni ogha taraṇassa padaṭṭhānam
translated: The basis for crossing the flood is the non-basis for kamma and the non-accumulation of kamma.

original: oghataraṇaṃ anupādisesanibbānassa. Taṇhāvasena patiṭṭhānassa assādānupassitā padaṭṭhānaṃ.
analyzed: ogha taraṇam anupādisesa nibbānassa taṇhā vasena patiṭṭhānassa assāda anupassi tā padaṭṭhānam
translated: The contemplation of gratification is the proximate cause for the establishment by craving.

original: Tenāha bhagavā – “saṃyojaniyesu, bhikkhave, dhammesu assādānupassino taṇhā pavaḍḍhatī”ti.
analyzed: tena āha bhagavā saṃyojaniyesu bhikkhave dhammesu assāda anupassinaḥ taṇhā pavaḍḍhati iti
translated: Hence the Blessed One said: “Bhikkhus, it is by taking no delight in, by not rejoicing in, this and that state that craving for it ceases. With the cessation of craving comes cessation of clinging” .

original: Khandhāvijjā-phassa-saññā-vitakkāyonisomanasikāra-pāpamittaparatoghosā diṭṭhivasena
analyzed: khandha avijjā phassa saññā vitakka yoni soma nasikāra pāpa mitta paratas ghosāḥ diṭṭhi vasena
translated: The proximate cause for the establishment by views is the aggregates, ignorance, contact, perception, applied thought, unwise reflection, bad friends, and hearing wrong views,🔽as it is said: “The aggregates are a footing for views, ignorance is a footing for views” .🔽The proximate cause for the accumulation by craving and views is the delighting in craving and views and the other defilements and the formations,

original: patiṭṭhānassa padaṭṭhānaṃ. Yathāha – paṭisambhidāmagge “khandhāpi diṭṭhiṭṭhānaṃ,🔽avijjāpi diṭṭhiṭṭhāna”ntiādi. Taṇhādiṭṭhābhinandanaavasesakilesābhisaṅkhāravasena🔽āyūhanassa padaṭṭhānaṃ. Iminā nayena yathārahaṃ taṇhādiṭṭhādivasena patiṭṭhānāyūhanānaṃ🔽padaṭṭhānabhāvo vattabbo. Sesamettha pāḷito eva suniddhāriyaṃ. Ayaṃ padaṭṭhānahāro.
analyzed: patiṭṭhānassa padaṭṭhānam yathā āha paṭisambhidā magge khandhāḥ api diṭṭhi ṭṭhānam  avijjā api diṭṭhiṭṭhāna nti ādi taṇhā diṭṭha abhinandana avasesa kilesa abhisaṅkhāra vasena  āyūhanassa padaṭṭhānam iminā nayena yathāraham taṇhā diṭṭha ādi vasena patiṭṭhāna āyūhanānam  padaṭṭhāna bhāvaḥ vattabbo sesam ettha pāḷitaḥ eva su niddhāriyam ayam padaṭṭhāna hāro
translated: as it is said: “Craving is a footing for clinging, clinging is a footing for becoming” .🔽The meaning of the establishment and the accumulation should be construed in this way according to craving, views, etc., as appropriate. The rest here can be discerned in the text itself. This is the Mode of Conveying Footings.

original: Appatiṭṭhaṃ anāyūhanti patiṭṭhānāyūhanapaṭikkhepena vissajjentena niyyānāvahā sammāpaṭipatti
analyzed: appatiṭṭham an āyūhanti patiṭṭhāna āyūhana paṭikkhepena vissajjentena niyyāna āvahā sammāpaṭipatti
translated: “Without establishment, without accumulation”: by this he shows the escape from establishment and accumulation. The right way is the escape.

original: gahitā ekantato oghanittharaṇūpāyabhāvato. Taggahaṇena ca sabbepi sattatiṃsa bodhipakkhiyadhammā
analyzed: gahitāḥ ekantataḥ ogha nittharaṇa upāya bhāvato tad gahaṇena ca sabbe pi sattatiṃsa bodhi pakkhiya dhammā
translated: and the latter is the means of crossing the flood. And by the mention of the latter all the thirty-seven states partaking of enlightenment are included,

original: gahitā honti niyyānalakkhaṇena ekalakkhaṇattāti ayaṃ lakkhaṇahāro.
analyzed: gahitāḥ honti niyyāna lakkhaṇena eka lakkhaṇa ttā ati ayam lakkhaṇahāro
translated: because they have the same characteristic in having the characteristic of leading to the escape from the flood. This is the Mode of Conveying Characteristics.

original: Nidānamassā devatāya oghataraṇākārassa yāthāvato anavabodhoti vuttovāyamattho. Aññepi
analyzed: nidānam assāḥ devatāya ogha taraṇa ākārassa yāthāvataḥ anavabodhaḥ ti vuttaḥ uva ayam atthaḥ aññe pi
translated: The meaning stated is that the source of this Thread is the deity’s failure to understand the way of crossing the flood as it is in fact. But others too

original: ye imaṃ desanaṃ nissāya oghataraṇūpāyaṃ paṭivijjhanti, tepi imissā desanāya nidānanti🔽daṭṭhabbā. “Kathaṃ nu kho imaṃ desanaṃ nissāya sammadeva paṭivijjhantā catubbidhampi
analyzed: ye imam desanam nissāya ogha taraṇa upāyam paṭivijjhanti te api imissā desanāya nidānanti  daṭṭhabbā katham nu kho imam desanam nissāya sammat eva paṭivijjhantā catubbidham pi
translated: who penetrate the way of crossing the flood by means of this teaching should be regarded as the source of this teaching.

original: oghaṃ tarantā sakalasaṃsāramahoghato nitthareyyuṃ, pare ca tattha patiṭṭhapeyyu”nti
analyzed: ogham tarantā sakala saṃsāra mahā oghataḥ nitthareyyum pare ca tattha patiṭṭhapeyyunti
translated: “ How, by means of this teaching, should those who penetrate it rightly cross the fourfold flood and escape from the great flood of the round of rebirths and establish others in it too?”

original: ayamettha bhagavato adhippāyo. Padanibbacanaṃ niruttaṃ, taṃ “eva”ntiādinidānapadānaṃ
analyzed: ayam ettha bhagavataḥ adhippāyaḥ pada nibbacanam niruttam tam eva nti ādi nidāna padānam
translated: This is the Blessed One’s purport here. The word-by-word explanation is the commentary. The commentary is good. The meaning of the words “eva” , etc.,

original: “katha”ntiādipāḷipadānañca aṭṭhakathāya tassā līnatthavaṇṇanāya ca vuttanayānusārena
analyzed: kathaṃ ti ādi pāḷi padānam ca aṭṭhakathāya tassāḥ līna ttha vaṇṇanāya ca vutta naya anusārena
translated: and of the words “katha” , etc., and of the condensed meaning of the commentary are given in the way stated in the commentary.

original: sukarattā ativitthārabhayena na vitthārayimha.
analyzed: su karattāḥ ativitthāra bhayena na vitthārayimha
translated: and we have not done so here for fear of being too prolix.

original: Pada-padattha-desanā-nikkhepa-suttasandhi-vasena pañcavidhā sandhi. Tattha padassa
analyzed: pada padattha desanā nikkhepa sutta sandhi vasena pañcavidhā sandhi tattha padassa
translated: The connexion is fivefold, as consisting in the word, in the meaning, in the teaching, in the introduction, and in the Thread. Herein,

original: padantarena sambandho padasandhi. Tathā padatthassa padatthantarena sambandho padatthasandhi,
analyzed: pada antarena sambandhaḥ pada sandhi tathā padatthassa padattha antarena sambandhaḥ padattha sandhi
translated: the connexion of a word with another word is the word-connexion. Likewise the connexion of a meaning with another meaning is the meaning-connexion,

original: yo “kiriyākārakasambandho”ti vutto. Nānānusandhikassa taṃtaṃanusandhīti sambandho,
analyzed: yaḥ kiriyā kāraka sambandho ti vuttaḥ nānā anusandhikassa taṃ taṃ anusandhi iti sambandhaḥ
translated: which is called the “ connexion of action with what acts “ . The connexion of what has several consequences with each of them is the consequence-connexion,

original: ekānusandhikassa pana pubbāparasambandho desanāsandhi, yā aṭṭhakathāyaṃ “pucchānusandhi
analyzed: eka anusandhikassa pana pubba apara sambandhaḥ desanā sandhi yā aṭṭhakathā ayam puccha anusandhi
translated: but the connexion of what has a single consequence is the teaching-connexion, which is threefold as divided in the Commentary into the question-consequence,

original: ajjhāsayānusandhi yathānusandhī”ti tidhā vibhattā. Ajjhāsayo cettha attajjhāsayo🔽parajjhāsayoti dvidhā veditabbo. Nikkhepasandhi catunnaṃ suttanikkhepānaṃ vasena
analyzed: yathā anusandhi iti tidhā vibhattā ajjhāsayaḥ ca ittha  dvidhā veditabbaḥ nikkhepa sandhi catunnam sutta nikkhepānam vasena
translated: the intention-consequence, and the as-consequence. Herein, the intention is twofold as one’s own and another’s.

original: veditabbā. Yaṃ panettha vattabbaṃ, taṃ papañcasūdanīṭīkāyaṃ vuttanayena gahetabbaṃ.
analyzed: veditabbā yam pana ittha vattabbam tam papañcasūdanī ṭīkāyam vutta nayena gahetabbam
translated: The introduction-connexion should be understood as consisting in the four kinds of introduction to a Thread. But what is to be said here can be understood from the method stated in the Papañcasūdanī Commentary.

original: Suttasandhi idha paṭhamanikkhepavasena veditabbā.
analyzed: idha paṭhama nikkhepa vasena veditabbā
translated: The Thread-connexion should be understood here as the first introduction.

original: “Kasmā panettha oghataraṇasuttameva paṭhamaṃ nikkhitta”nti nāyamanuyogo katthaci
analyzed: kasmā pana ittha ogha taraṇa suttam eva paṭhamam nikkhittanti na ayam anuyogo katthaci
translated: “But why is the Discourse on Crossing the Flood placed first here?”—This question does not arise, for it is not found anywhere else.🔽Moreover, the first discourse is placed here because it shows the Middle Way by way of the avoidance of the two extremes, by way of the rejection of the extremes of attachment and of non-attachment,

original: na pavattati? Apica “appatiṭṭhaṃ anāyūhaṃ oghamatari”nti patiṭṭhānāyūhanapaṭikkhepavasena
analyzed: na pavattati apica appatiṭṭham anāyūham ogham atarin ti patiṭṭhāna āyūhana paṭikkhepa vasena
translated: as stated in the words: “Without attachment he crossed over the flood, difficult to cross, having no ground to stand on, and no foothold” .

original: antadvayavivajjanamukhena vā majjhimāya paṭipadāya vibhāvanato sabbapaṭhamamidaṃ🔽suttaṃ idha nikkhittaṃ. Antadvayaṃ anupagamma majjhimāya paṭipattiyā saṅkāsanaparañhi🔽buddhānaṃ sāsananti. Yaṃ pana ekissā desanāya desanantarena saddhiṃ saṃsandanaṃ,
analyzed: anta dvaya vivajjana mukhena vā majjhimāya paṭipadāya vibhāvanato sabba paṭhamam idam  suttam idha nikkhittam anta dvayam an upagamma majjhimāya paṭipattiyā saṅkāsana parañhi  buddhānam sāsanam ti yam pana ekissā desanāya desana ntarena saddhim saṃsandanam
translated: For the Dispensation of the Buddhas is intended to lead one away from the two extremes and to establish one in the Middle Way.

original: ayampi desanāsandhi. Sā idha evaṃ veditabbā –
analyzed: ayam pi desanā sandhi sā idha evam veditabbā
translated: The connection of one discourse with another is also a mode of teaching. This should be understood here as follows:

original: “Appatiṭṭhaṃ…pe… anāyūhaṃ oghamatari”nti ayaṃ desanā –
analyzed: anāyūham ayam desanā
translated: The discourse beginning with the words: “Without attachment he crossed over the flood, difficult to cross, having no ground to stand on, and no foothold” ,🔽is connected with the following discourse:

original: “Sabbadā sīlasampanno, paññavā susamāhito;
analyzed: sabbadā sīla sampannaḥ paññavā su samāhitaḥ
translated: “Always endowed with virtue, possessed of wisdom, well concentrated,

original: Āraddhavīriyo pahitatto, oghaṃ tarati duttaraṃ.
analyzed: āraddha vīriyaḥ ogham tarati duttaram
translated: with energy aroused, and intent on the goal, he crosses the flood so hard to cross.

original: “Virato kāmasaññāya, rūpasaṃyojanātigo;
analyzed: virataḥ kāma saññāya rūpa saṃyojana atigo
translated: “He who is free from sensual perception, who has overcome the fetter of form,

original: Nandīrāgaparikkhīṇo, so gambhīre na sīdati; ;
analyzed: nandī rāga parikkhīṇo so gambhīre na sīdati
translated: who has destroyed the delight in becoming, he does not sink in the deep.

original: Saddhāya tarati oghaṃ, appamādena aṇṇavaṃ. ;
analyzed: saddhāya tarati ogham appamādena
translated: By faith one crosses the flood, By energy the deep .

original: “Pañca chinde pañca jahe, pañca cuttari bhāvaye;
analyzed: pañca chinde pañca jahe pañca cuttari bhāvaye
translated: “Five to cut, five to abandon, Five to surmount, five to develop,

original: Pañcasaṅgātigo bhikkhu, oghatiṇṇoti vuccati. ;
analyzed: pañca saṅga atigaḥ bhikkhu ogha tiṇṇaḥ ti vuccati
translated: The bhikkhu who has overcome the five Hindrances is said to have crossed the flood.

original: “Tasmā jantu sadā sato, kāmāni parivajjaye;
analyzed: tasmai jantu sadā sataḥ kāmāni parivajjaye
translated: “Therefore a man should ever be mindful, And shun the objects of sensual pleasure;

original: Te pahāya tare oghaṃ, nāvaṃ sitvāva pāragū. ;
analyzed: te pahāya tare ogham nāvam sitvā ava pāragū
translated: Having abandoned them, he crosses the flood, Like one who, having built a boat, crosses.

original: “Ekāyanaṃ jātikhayantadassī, maggaṃ pajānāti hitānukampī;
analyzed: ekāyanam jāti khayanta dassī maggam pajānāti hita anukampī
translated: “The one who sees the destruction of birth, the path to which is the only way, The compassionate one understands the path;

original: Etena maggena tariṃsu pubbe, tarissanti ye ca taranti ogha”nti. –
analyzed: etena maggena tariṃsu pubbe tarissanti ye ca taranti
translated: By this path have crossed, and those who have crossed, and those who will cross the flood.”

original: Evamādīhi desanāhi saṃsandatīti ayaṃ catubyūho hāro.🔽Appatiṭṭhaṃ anāyūhanti ettha saṃkilesavasena patiṭṭhānaṃ āyūhanañca. Tena ayonisomanasikāro🔽dīpito, santakilesavasena anāyūhanena yonisomanasikāro. Tattha ayonisomanasikaroto
analyzed: evamādīhi saṃsandati iti ayam catu byūhaḥ hāraḥ  appatiṭṭham an āyūhanti ettha saṃkilesa vasena patiṭṭhānam āyūhanam ca tena a yoniso manasikāro  dīpito santa kilesa vasena anāyūhanena yonisoma nasikāro tattha
translated: This is the fourfold Mode of Conveying a Teaching that is called “Conveying by Conversion.”

original: taṇhāvijjā pavaḍḍhati. Tesu taṇhāgahaṇena ca taṇhāmūlakā dhammā āvattanti. Avijjāgahaṇena
analyzed: taṇhā vijjā pavaḍḍhati tesu taṇhā gahaṇena ca taṇhā mūlakāḥ dhammāḥ āvattanti avijjā gahaṇena
translated: “Without ground, without root”: here ground is the state of being grounded, and root is the state of being rooted, in corruption. So it is wrong mental approach that is shown by “without ground, without root.” And right mental approach is shown by “without ground, without root” in the sense of non-rootedness in corruption. Herein, when there is wrong mental approach, craving and ignorance increase. And by the mention of craving, states rooted in craving are included. And by the mention of ignorance, states rooted in ignorance are included.

original: avijjāmūlakaṃ sabbaṃ bhavacakkaṃ āvattati. Yonisomanasikāraggahaṇena ca yonisomanasikāramūlakā
analyzed: avijjā mūlakam sabbam bhava cakkam āvattati yoni soma nasikāra ggahaṇena ca yoni soma nasikāra mūlakā
translated: The whole wheel of existence revolves with ignorance as its root. And with the words “right reflection”

original: dhammā āvattanti catubbidhañca sampatticakkaṃ. Patiṭṭhānāyūhanapaṭikkhepena pana
analyzed: dhammā āvattanti catubbidham ca sampatti cakkam patiṭṭhāna āyūhana paṭikkhepena pana
translated: the things that have right reflection as their root revolve, and the fourfold wheel of success.🔽But with the words “the abandoning of the basis and the storing up”

original: sammāpaṭipatti dīpitā, sā ca saṅkhepato sīlādisaṅgahā. Tattha sīlaggahaṇena ekādasa🔽sīlānisaṃsā āvattanti, samādhiggahaṇena pañcaṅgiko sammāsamādhi pañcaññāṇiko sammāsamādhi
analyzed: sammā paṭipatti dīpitā sā ca saṅkhepato sīla ādi saṅgahā tattha sīla ggahaṇena ekādasa  sīla anisaṃsāḥ āvattanti samādhi ggahaṇena pañcaṅgikaḥ sammāsamādhi pañcaññāṇikaḥ sammāsamādhi
translated: right practice is shown, and that in brief is comprised by virtue, etc. Herein, with the words “virtue” the eleven🔽virtues as benefits revolve, and with the words “concentration” the five-factored right concentration and the five-factored right concentration with the divine abidings, and the requisites of concentration revolve.

original: samādhiparikkhārā ca āvattanti. Paññāgahaṇena paññā ca sammādiṭṭhīti sammādiṭṭhisudassanā
analyzed: samādhi parikkhārā ca āvattanti paññā gahaṇena paññā ca sammādiṭṭhī iti sammādiṭṭhi su dassanā
translated: And with the words “understanding” understanding and right view and the right view that is the seeing of things as they are,

original: sabbepi ariyamaggadhammā āvattantīti ayaṃ āvatto hāro.🔽Patiṭṭhānaṃ kilesādivasena sattavidhaṃ. Āyūhanaṃ abhisaṅkhārādivasena sattavidhaṃ.🔽Tathā tappaṭipakkhato appatiṭṭhānaṃ anāyūhanañca. Ayamettha dhammavibhatti. Padaṭṭhānabhūmivibhattiyo
analyzed: sabbe pi ariya magga dhammā āvattanti iti ayam āvattaḥ hāro 🔽patiṭṭhānam kilesa ādi vasena sattavidham āyūhanam abhisaṅkhāra ādi vasena sattavidham 🔽tathā tad paṭipakkhataḥ appatiṭṭhānam anāyūhanam ca ayam ettha dhamma vibhatti padaṭṭhāna bhūmi vibhattiyaḥ
translated: and all the things that are ideas of the Noble Path revolve. This is the Mode of Conveying a Reversal.

original: pana heṭṭhā vuttanayānusārena veditabbā. Ayaṃ vibhattihāro.
analyzed: pana heṭṭhā vutta naya anusārena veditabbā ayam vibhatti hāro
translated: but it should be understood by the method stated below. This is the Mode of Conveying an Analysis.

original: Pubbabhāgappaṭipadaṃ sammadeva sampādetvā samathavipassanaṃ yuganaddhaṃ katvā bhāvanaṃ🔽ussakkento kilesādīnaṃ dūrīkaraṇato tesaṃ vasena asaṃsīdanto anibbuyhanto appatiṭṭhaṃ
analyzed: pubbabhāga paṭipadam sammad eva sampādetvā samatha vipassanam yuga naddham katvā bhāvanam  ussakkentaḥ kilesa ādīnam dūrīkaraṇataḥ tesam vasena a saṃsīdantaḥ a nibbuyhantaḥ appatiṭṭham
translated: Having perfected the practice of the earlier stage, he makes his development of serenity and insight yoked evenly,🔽and he crosses the flood without hesitation, without misgiving, without standing on dry land,

original: anāyūhaṃ oghaṃ tarati. Kilesādīnaṃ vasena pana saṃsīdanto nibbuyhanto saṃsāre patiṭṭhānato
analyzed: anāyūham ogham tarati kilesa ādīnam vasena pana saṃsīdantaḥ nibbuyhantaḥ saṃsāre patiṭṭhānato
translated: without grasping, because he has sent out his rays to the defilements, etc., and has thus made them remote. But he who hesitates, misgives, stands on dry land,

original: āyatiṃ punabbhavābhinibbattiyā āyūhanato oghaṃ na taratīti ayaṃ parivatto hāro.🔽Appatiṭṭhaṃ asantiṭṭhanto asaṃsīdanto anibbisaṃ anavinibbisanti pariyāyavacanaṃ,
analyzed: āyatim punabbhava abhinibbattiyāḥ āyūhanataḥ ogham na tarati iti ayam parivattaḥ hāraḥ  appatiṭṭham a santiṭṭhantaḥ a saṃsīdantaḥ anibbisam an avinibbisanti pariyāya vacanam
translated: grasps, and accumulates fresh kamma for rebirth in the future, because of the defilements, etc., does not cross the flood. This is the Mode of Conveying a Reversal.🔽“Without hesitation, without misgiving, without standing on dry land, without grasping, without accumulating” is a pericope;

original: anāyūhaṃ anibbuyhanto acetento apakappentoti pariyāyavacanaṃ, oghaṃ kilesasamuddanti🔽pariyāyavacanaṃ, atari atikkami accavāyīti pariyāyavacanaṃ. Iminā nayena sesapadesupi
analyzed: an āyūham a nibbuyhantaḥ a cetentaḥ apakappentaḥ iti pariyāya vacanam ogham 🔽pariyāya vacanam atari atikkami accavāyi iti pariyāya vacanam iminā nayena sesa padesu pi
translated: “he crosses the flood, the defilement-ocean” is a pericope; “he crosses over, he crosses beyond, he crosses to the far shore” is a pericope. In this way,

original: pariyāyavacanaṃ veditabbanti ayaṃ vevacano hāro.🔽Appatiṭṭhaṃ anāyūhanti ettha patiṭṭhaṃ āyūhanti kilesānaṃ kiccakaraṇapaññatti. Pariyuṭṭhānānaṃ🔽vibhāvanapaññatti. Abhisaṅkhārānaṃ viruhanapaññatti. Taṇhāya assādapaññatti. Diṭṭhiyā
analyzed: pariyāya vacanam veditabbanti ayam vevacanaḥ hāro  appatiṭṭham an āyūhanti ettha patiṭṭham āyūhanti kilesānam kicca karaṇa paññatti pariyuṭṭhānānam  vibhāvana paññatti abhisaṅkhārānam viruhana paññatti taṇhāya assāda paññatti diṭṭhiyā
translated: This is the Mode of Conveying Synonyms.

original: parinipphandanapaññatti. Bhavadiṭṭhiyā bhavābhinivesapaññatti. Vibhavadiṭṭhiyā vipallāsapaññatti.
analyzed: parinipphandana paññatti bhava diṭṭhiyā bhava abhinivesa paññatti vibhava diṭṭhiyā vipallāsa paññatti
translated: “Unestablished, unpropped”: here the establishment and propping of defilements is the description of their functioning. The description of their being laid hold of is the description of their being laid hold of. The description of their being resolved is the description of their being resolved. The description of their being relished is the description of their being relished. The description of their being displayed is the description of their being displayed. The description of the manifestation of the view of becoming is the description of the manifestation of the view of becoming. The description of the manifestation of the view of non-becoming is the description of the manifestation of the view of non-becoming.

original: Kāmasukhānuyogassa kāmesu anugijjhanapaññatti. Attakilamathānuyogassa attaparitāpanapaññatti.🔽Appatiṭṭhaṃ anāyūhanti pana abhiññeyyadhammānaṃ abhiññāpaññatti. Pariññeyyadhammānaṃ
analyzed: kāma sukha anuyogassa kāmesu anugijjhana paññatti atta kilamatha anuyogassa atta paritāpana paññatti  appatiṭṭham an āyūhanti pana abhiññeyya dhammānam abhiññā paññatti pariññeyya dhammānam
translated: The description of the pursuit of sensual pleasure is the description of the pursuit of sensual pleasure. The description of the pursuit of self-mortification is the description of the pursuit of self-mortification.

original: pariññāpaññatti. Oghamatarinti pahātabbadhammānaṃ pahānapaññatti. Maggassa bhāvanāpaññatti.
analyzed: pariññā paññatti pahātabba dhammānam pahāna paññatti maggassa bhāvanā paññatti
translated: “Unestablished, unpropped”: the description of the direct-knowledge of ideas that are to be directly known is the description of the direct-knowledge of ideas that are to be directly known. The description of the full understanding of ideas that are to be fully understood is the description of the full understanding of ideas that are to be fully understood. The description of the abandoning of ideas that are to be abandoned is the description of the abandoning of ideas that are to be abandoned. The description of the development of the path is the description of the development of the path.

original: Nirodhassa sacchikiriyāpaññattīti ayaṃ paññattihāro.
analyzed: nirodhassa sacchikiriyā paññatti iti ayam paññatti hāro
translated: The description of the realization of cessation is the description of the realization of cessation. This is the Mode of Conveying Descriptions.

original: Appatiṭṭhaṃ anāyūhanti ettha patiṭṭhānāyūhanaggahaṇena oghaggahaṇena ca samudayasaccaṃ🔽gahitaṃ. Appatiṭṭhaṃ anāyūhaṃ atarinti pana padattayena maggasaccaṃ gahitaṃ, hetugahaṇena
analyzed: appatiṭṭham an āyūhanti ettha patiṭṭhā an āyūhana ggahaṇena ogha ggahaṇena ca samudaya saccam  gahitam appatiṭṭham anāyūham pana magga saccam gahitam hetu gahaṇena
translated: “Without foundation, not to be built up” : here the truth of origin is included by the words “foundation” and “building up” and by the word “flood.”🔽“Without foundation, not to be built up, he crossed over” : here the truth of the path is included by the three words “crossed over,” “cause,” and “means.”

original: ca hetumato gahaṇaṃ siddhamevāti dukkhanirodhasaccāni atthato gahitānevāti ayaṃ saccehi
analyzed: ca hetumataḥ gahaṇam siddham evā ati dukkha nirodha saccāni atthataḥ gahitāni evā ati ayam saccehi
translated: “Without support, not to be grasped at” : here the truth of the origin is grasped by the terms “support” and “grasping,” and by the term “flood.” “Without support, not to be grasped at, he crosses over” : here the truth of the path is grasped by the three terms “without support,” etc. And by the term “cause” the truth of the cause is grasped. Thus the truths of suffering and cessation are implicitly grasped. This is the method of entering into the truths.

original: otaraṇā. Tattha ye lokiyā pañcakkhandhā, yesaṃ vasena patiṭṭhānāyūhanasiddhi. Ye
analyzed: tattha ye lokiyā pañca kkhandhāḥ yesam vasena ye
translated: Herein, the five aggregates of the mundane type, by means of which the establishment and grasping come about,

original: lokuttarā cattāro khandhā, yesaṃ vasena oghataraṇasiddhi. Ayaṃ khandhamukhena otaraṇā.🔽Ye eva pañcakkhandhā dvādasāyatanāni aṭṭhārasa dhātuyo, te cattāro khandhā dvāyatanāni
analyzed: lokuttarā cattāro khandhāḥ yesam vasena ogha taraṇa siddhi ayam khandha mukhena  ye eva pañca khandhāḥ dvādasa āyatanāni aṭṭhārasa dhātuyaḥ te cattāro khandhāḥ dva āyatanāni
translated: and the four supramundane aggregates, by means of which the crossing over of the flood comes about, are the aggregates. This is the method of entering into the aggregates.

original: dve dhātuyoti ayaṃ āyatanamukhena dhātumukhena ca otaraṇā. Tathā appatiṭṭhaṃ anāyūhanti
analyzed: dve āyatana mukhena dhātu mukhena ca tathā
translated: The five aggregates themselves are the twelve bases and the eighteen elements. The four aggregates are two bases and two elements. This is the method of entering into the bases and elements.

original: ettha patiṭṭhānāyūhanaggahaṇena kilesābhisaṅkhārādīnaṃ gahaṇaṃ. Kilesābhisaṅkhārādayo
analyzed: ettha patiṭṭhāna āyūhana ggahaṇena kilesa abhisaṅkhāra ādīnam gahaṇam kilesa abhisaṅkhāra ādayaḥ
translated: “Without support, not to be grasped at” : here the defilements, the formations, etc., are grasped by the terms “support” and “grasping.” The defilements, the formations, etc.,

original: oghā ca saṅkhārakkhandhā dhammāyatanaṃ dhammadhātu ca, appatiṭṭhānānāyūhanaggahaṇena
analyzed: oghā ca saṅkhāra kkhandhā dhammāyatanam dhammadhātu ca appatiṭṭhāna anāyūhana ggahaṇena
translated: And the aggregates of formations, the idea base, and the idea element are the floods.

original: oghataraṇavacanena ca saha vipassanāya maggo kathito. Evañca saṅkhārakkhandho dhammāyatanaṃ
analyzed: ogha taraṇa vacanena ca saha vipassanāya maggo kathito evam ca saṅkhāra kkhandho dhamma āyatanam
translated: The path is stated with insight by the words “crossing the floods” and “the not-so-how” .

original: dhammadhātu ca gahitāti evampi khandhamukhena āyatanamukhena dhātumukhena otaraṇā.🔽Vipassanā ce aniccānupassanā, animittamukhena vimokkhamukhaṃ, dukkhānupassanā ce,
analyzed: dhammadhātu ca gahitā ati evam pi khandha mukhena āyatana mukhena dhātu mukhena otaraṇā  vipassanā ce anicca anupassanā animitta mukhena vimokkha mukham dukkha anupassanā ce
translated: And thus the aggregates of formations, the idea base, and the idea element are included. So in this way too there is the “descent” by way of the aggregates, by way of the bases, and by way of the elements.

original: appaṇihitavimokkhamukhaṃ, anattānupassanā ce, suññatavimokkhamukhanti evaṃ vimokkhamukhena
analyzed: appaṇihita vimokkha mukham anatta anupassanā ce suññata vimokkha mukham ti evam vimokkha mukhena
translated: And insight is the contemplation of impermanence, which is the door to the liberation by the signless, and the contemplation of pain, which is the door to the liberation by the desireless, and the contemplation of not-self, which is the door to the liberation by voidness.🔽So in this way too there is the “descent” by way of the doors to liberation.

original: otaraṇaṃ. Magge sekkhā sīlakkhandhādayo dhammāyatanadhammadhātū anāsavā ca evampi
analyzed: otaraṇam magge sekkhā sīla kkhandha ādayaḥ dhamma āyatana dhammadhātū anāsavā ca evam pi
translated: And in the path the aggregates of virtue, etc., the idea base, and the idea element are without cankers. So in this way too there is the “descent” by way of the aggregates, etc.

original: kho khandhādimukhena otaraṇāti ayaṃ otaraṇo hāro.
analyzed: kho khandha ādi mukhena ayam otaraṇaḥ hāro
translated: This is the Mode of Conveying a Descant.

original: Appatiṭṭhanti ārambho. Anāyūhanti padasuddhi, no ārambhasuddhi, tathā oghanti. Atarinti pana padasuddhi ceva ārambhasuddhi cāti ayaṃ sodhano hāro.
analyzed: ārambhaḥ pada suddhi no ārambha suddhi tathā pana pada suddhi ca iva ārambha suddhi ca ati ayam sodhanaḥ hāro
translated: “Not grounded” is the beginning. “Not brought about” is purification of phrasing, not purification of beginning. So too with “flood.” But “crossed over” is both purification of phrasing and purification of beginning. This is the Mode of Conveying a Search.

original: Appatiṭṭhaṃ anāyūhanti sāmaññato adhiṭṭhānaṃ taṇhādiṭṭhiādivasena patiṭṭhānāyūhanānaṃ
analyzed: appatiṭṭham an āyūhanti sāmaññataḥ adhiṭṭhānam taṇhā diṭṭhi ādi vasena patiṭṭhāna āyūhanānam
translated: “Not grounded, not brought about”: the establishment is in general terms. The grounding and bringing about are by craving, views, etc.,

original: sādhāraṇato paṭikkhepacodanāti katvā oghamatarinti taṃ vikappetvā visesavacanaṃ.
analyzed: sādhāraṇataḥ paṭikkhepa codanā ti katvā ogham atarin ti tam vikappetvā visesa vacanam
translated: and the prohibition is a general one. But “crossed over the flood” is a particular statement made by distinguishing it.

original: Oghataraṇañhi cattāro ariyamaggā. Tattha paṭhamadutiyamaggā avisesena diṭṭhoghataraṇaṃ,
analyzed: ogha taraṇam hi cattāro ariya maggā tattha paṭhama dutiya maggāḥ avisesena diṭṭha ogha taraṇam
translated: For the crossing of the flood is the four noble paths. Herein, the first and second paths are the crossing of the flood of views without distinction;

original: tatiyamaggo kāmoghataraṇaṃ, aggamaggo sesoghataraṇanti ayaṃ adhiṭṭhāno hāro.🔽Kilesavasena patiṭṭhānassa ayonisomanasikāro hetu. Abhisaṅkhāravasena āyūhanassa
analyzed: tatiya maggo kāma ogha taraṇam agga maggo sesa ogha taraṇam ti ayam adhiṭṭhānaḥ hāro  kilesa vasena patiṭṭhānassa ayoniso manasikāraḥ hetu abhisaṅkhāra vasena āyūhanassa
translated: the third path is the crossing of the flood of existence; and the fourth path is the crossing of the remaining floods. This is the Mode of Conveying a Directive.🔽The cause of the grounding by defilement is unwise attention. The cause of the bringing about by determinations is defilement.

original: kilesā hetū. Appatiṭṭhānānāyūhanānaṃ pana yathākkamaṃ yonisomanasikārapahānāni hetū.
analyzed: kilesāḥ hetū pana yathākkamam yoni soma nasikāra pahānāni hetū
translated: But the cause of the non-grounding and the non-bringing about is wise attention and abandoning, respectively.

original: Saṃyojaniyesu dhammesu assādānupassanā taṇhāvasena yathārahaṃ tassa hetū. Tenāha
analyzed: saṃyojaniyesu dhammesu assāda anupassanā taṇhā vasena yathāraham tassa hetū tena āha
translated: The contemplation of gratification in things productive of fetters is craving, and the rest are its causes as appropriate.

original: bhagavā – “saṃyojaniyesu, bhikkhave, dhammesu assādānupassino taṇhā pavaḍḍhatī”ti.🔽Khandhāvijjāphassasaññāvitakkāyonisomanasikārapāpamittaparatoghosā diṭṭhivasena patiṭṭhānassa
analyzed: bhagavā saṃyojaniyesu bhikkhave dhammesu assāda anupassinaḥ taṇhā pavaḍḍhati iti  khandha avijjā phassa saññā vitakka yoni so manasikāra pāpa mitta paratas ghosāḥ diṭṭhi vasena patiṭṭhānassa
translated: And the cause of the establishment is the seeing of gratification in things that breed attachment, according to circumstances, by means of craving. Hence it is said: “Bhikkhus, it is by seeing the gratification in things that breed attachment that craving increases” .

original: hetū. Tenāha – paṭisambhidāmagge “khandhāpi diṭṭhiṭṭhānaṃ, avijjāpi diṭṭhiṭṭhāna”ntiādi.🔽Taṇhābhinandanā avasesakilesābhisaṅkhāravasena āyūhanassa hetū. Iminā nayena yathārahaṃ
analyzed: hetū tena āha paṭisambhidā magge khandhā api diṭṭhi ṭhānam avijjā api diṭṭhi ṭṭhāna ntiādi  taṇhā abhinandanā avasesa kilesa abhisaṅkhāra vasena āyūhanassa hetū iminā nayena yathāraham
translated: And the cause of the accumulation is the aggregates, ignorance, contact, perception, applied thought, unwise reflection, bad friends, hearing wrong doctrine, and views, according to circumstances, by means of craving and views. Hence it is said in the Paṭisambhidā: “The aggregates are a footing for views, ignorance is a footing for views” , and so on.

original: taṇhādiṭṭhivasena patiṭṭhānāyūhanānaṃ hetuvibhāgo niddhāretabbo, tabbipariyāyena🔽appatiṭṭhānānāyūhanānaṃ. Kilesuppādane hi sammadeva ādīnavadassanaṃ appatiṭṭhānassa
analyzed: taṇhā diṭṭhi vasena patiṭṭhānā yūhanānam hetu vibhāgaḥ niddhāretabbaḥ tad vipariyāyena  kilesa uppādane hi sammad eva ādīnava dassanam appatiṭṭhānassa
translated: And the cause of the occurrence is the delighting in craving and the other defilements and the formation of the kamma that is associated with them, according to circumstances, by means of craving and views. The exposition of the cause of the establishment and the accumulation should be understood in this way, according to circumstances, by means of craving and views.🔽The opposite of the establishment and the accumulation is the non-establishment and the non-accumulation.🔽For the cause of the non-establishment is the seeing of danger in the occurrence of the defilements,

original: hetū, abhisaṅkharaṇe ādīnavadassanaṃ anāyūhanassa hetū, vipassanāya ussukkāpanaṃ
analyzed: hetū abhisaṅkharaṇe ādīnava dassanam anāyūhanassa hetū vipassanāya ussukkāpanam
translated: and the cause of the non-accumulation is the seeing of danger in the formation of kamma. The cause of the non-occurrence is the arousing of insight.

original: oghataraṇassa hetūti ayaṃ parikkhāro hāro.🔽Yathāvuttavibhāgehi patiṭṭhānāyūhanehi catubbidhassapi oghassa parisuddhi. Appatiṭṭhānānāyūhanehi
analyzed: ogha taraṇassa hetu uti ayam parikkhāraḥ hāro  yathā vutta vibhāgehi patiṭṭhāna āyūhanehi catubbidhassa api oghassa parisuddhi appatiṭṭhāna ānāyūhanehi
translated: This is the Mode of Conveying Requisites.🔽The purification of the four floods by means of the four kinds of footing and the four kinds of uprooting is the Mode of Conveying a Conversion.

original: pana sotānaṃ saṃvaro sabbaso pidhānañcāti catubbidhassapi oghassa visesato pidhānaṃ🔽appavattikaraṇaṃ. Ariyamaggassa bhāvanāya hi kilesavasena patiṭṭhānaṃ abhisaṅkhāravasena
analyzed: pana sotānam saṃvaraḥ sabbaso pidhānam ca ati catubbidhassa api oghassa visesataḥ pidhānam  appavatti karaṇam ariya maggassa bhāvanāya hi kilesa vasena patiṭṭhānam abhisaṅkhāra vasena
translated: But the restraint of the four floods by means of the four kinds of non-footing and the four kinds of non-uprooting is the Mode of Conveying a Conversion in Detail.

original: āyūhanaṃ upacchinnaṃ, tassa sabbepi oghā tiṇṇā sammatiṇṇā pahīnā hontīti ayaṃ samāropano hāro.
analyzed: āyūhanam upacchinnam tassa sabbe pi oghā tiṇṇā sammatiṇṇā pahīnāḥ honti iti ayam samāropanaḥ hāro
translated: For when the four floods are crossed, well crossed, abandoned, by the development of the Noble Path, then the footing by means of defilement and the uprooting by means of determinations are interrupted, and all the floods are crossed, well crossed, abandoned. This is the Mode of Conveying a Coordination.

original: Appatiṭṭhaṃ anāyūhanti ettha patiṭṭhāgahaṇena taṇhāvijjā gahitā. Tāsaṃ hi vasena🔽satto tattha tattha bhave patiṭṭhāti. Āyūhanaggahaṇena tappaccayā abhisaṅkhāradhammā
analyzed: ettha patiṭṭhā gahaṇena taṇhā vijjā gahitā tāsam hi vasena  satto tattha tattha bhave patiṭṭhāti āyūhana ggahaṇena tad paccayāḥ abhisaṅkhāra dhammāḥ
translated: As to ‘without footing and without uprooting ‘, footing is included by craving and ignorance,

original: gahitā. Tattha taṇhāya visesato rūpadhammā adhiṭṭhānaṃ, avijjāya arūpadhammā. Tesaṃ
analyzed: gahitā tattha taṇhāya visesato rūpa dhammā adhiṭṭhānam avijjāya arūpa dhammā tesam
translated: for it is by means of these that a being is established here and there in becoming. Uprooting is included by determinations that are a condition for that . Herein, determinations are the footing for form, and ignorance is the footing for the formless.

original: yathākkamaṃ samatho ca vipassanā ca paṭipakkhā, te “appatiṭṭhaṃ anāyūhaṃ oghamatari”nti
analyzed: yathākkamam samathaḥ ca vipassanā ca paṭipakkhā te appatiṭṭham anāyūham ogham atarinti
translated: Calm and insight are the opposites of these. They are shown by the words “he crossed the flood not caring for roots and shoots.”

original: padehi pakāsitā honti, tesu samathassa cetovimutti phalaṃ, vipassanāya paññāvimutti.
analyzed: padehi pakāsitāḥ honti tesu samathassa cetaḥ vimutti phalam vipassanāya paññā vimutti
translated: Of these, the fruit of calm is deliverance of mind, and the fruit of insight is deliverance by understanding.

original: Tathā hi sā “rāgavirāgā avijjāvirāgā”ti visesetvā vuccati. Tattha taṇhāvijjā abhisaṅkhāro🔽ca samudayasaccaṃ, tesaṃ adhiṭṭhānabhūtā rūpārūpadhammā dukkhasaccaṃ, tesaṃ appavatti
analyzed: tathā hi sā rāga virāgā avijjā avirāgā ti visesetvā vuccati tattha taṇhā vijjā abhisaṅkhāro  ca samudaya saccam tesam adhiṭṭhāna bhūtāḥ rūpa arūpa dhammāḥ dukkha saccam tesam appavatti
translated: For it is said with specific reference to them: “With fading away of lust there is deliverance of mind, with the cessation of ignorance there is deliverance by understanding” . Herein, craving and ignorance and determinations🔽are the truth of the origin. The states consisting of form and formlessness that are the footing for these are the truth of suffering. The non- occurrence of these is the truth of cessation. The understanding of cessation is the truth of the path, which is called “crossing the flood” by way of simile.

original: nirodhasaccaṃ, nirodhapajānanā paṭipadā oghataraṇapariyāyena vuttā maggasaccaṃ. Taṇhāgahaṇena🔽cettha māyā-sāṭheyyamānātimāna-madappamāda-pāpicchatā-pāpamittatā-ahirikānottappādivasena
analyzed: nirodha saccam nirodha pajānanā paṭipadā ogha taraṇa pariyāyena vuttā magga saccam taṇhā gahaṇena  ca ittha māyā sāṭheyya māna atimāna mada ppamāda pāpiccha tā pāpamitta tā ahirika anottappa ādi vasena
translated: And here the unprofitable side should be understood as included by the mention of craving,

original: akusalapakkho netabbo. Avijjāgahaṇena viparītamanasikāra-kodhūpanāha-makkhapaḷāsa-issāmacchariya-sārambha-
analyzed: akusala pakkhaḥ netabbaḥ avijjā gahaṇena viparīta manasikāra kodhū panāha makkha paḷāsa
translated: and the unprofitable side is the five hindrances, namely, lust, ill will, stiffness and torpor, agitation and worry, and uncertainty. And the unprofitable side should also be understood as included by the mention of ignorance, and the unprofitable side is wrong direction of thought, anger and annoyance, contempt and domineering, envy and avarice, and perverseness, deceit, craft, conceit, obstinacy, presumption, vanity, negligence, evilness of wishes, evil companionship, lack of conscience, and lack of shame.

original: dovacassatā-bhavadiṭṭhiādivasena akusalapakkho netabbo. Vuttavipariyāyena amāyāasāṭheyyādiaviparītamanasikārādivasena.
analyzed: dovacassatā bhava diṭṭhi ādi vasena akusala pakkhaḥ netabbaḥ vutta vipariyāyena amāyā asāṭheyya ādi aviparīta manasikāra ādi vasena
translated: The unprofitable side should be construed as dissimulation, craft, etc., and as the view of becoming, etc. The opposite of what has been said should be construed as non-dissimulation, non-craft, etc., and as the right direction of endeavour, etc.

original: Tathā samathapakkhiyānaṃ saddhindriyānaṃ vipassanāpakkhiyānaṃ aniccasaññādīnañca
analyzed: tathā samatha pakkhiyānam saddhi indriyānam vipassanā pakkhiyānam anicca saññā ādīnam ca
translated: And likewise the side of serenity should be construed as the faith faculties, etc., and the side of insight as the perception of impermanence, and so on.

original: vasena vodānapakkho netabboti ayaṃ nandiyāvattassa nayassa bhūmi.🔽Tathā vuttanayena gahitesu taṇhāvijjātappakkhiyadhammesu taṇhā lobho, avijjā moho,
analyzed: vasena vodāna pakkhaḥ netabbo ti ayam nandiyāvattassa nayassa bhūmi  tathā vutta nayena gahitesu taṇhā vijjā tappakkhiya dhammesu taṇhā lobhaḥ avijjā moho
translated: This is the plane of the method of the “going by way of joy” .🔽And likewise, when craving and ignorance are included among the things stated in the way already described, then craving is greed, and ignorance is delusion.

original: avijjāya sampayutto lohite sati pubbo viya taṇhāya sati sijjhamāno āghāto doso iti
analyzed: avijjāya sampayuttaḥ lohite sati pubbaḥ viya taṇhāya sati sijjhamānaḥ āghātaḥ dosaḥ iti
translated: And when there is craving, anger is generated like pus in blood, so anger is hate.

original: tīhi akusalamūlehi gahitehi, tappaṭipakkhato “appatiṭṭha”ntiādivacanehi ca tīṇi akusalamūlāni
analyzed: tīhi akusala mūlehi gahitehi tad paṭipakkhataḥ ca tīṇi akusala mūlāni
translated: So when the three unprofitable roots are included, the three profitable roots are established too by the opposite of them, and by the words “unfixed” , etc.,

original: tīṇi kusalamūlāni ca siddhāni eva honti. Idhāpi lobho sabbāni sāsavakusalamūlāni
analyzed: tīṇi kusala mūlāni ca siddhāni eva honti idha api lobho sabbāni sa āsava kusala mūlāni
translated: Herein, greed is all the profitable roots,

original: āyūhanadhammā ca samudayasaccaṃ, tannibbattā tesaṃ adhiṭṭhānagocarabhūtā ca upādānakkhandhā
analyzed: āyūhana dhammā ca samudaya saccam tad nibbattā tesam adhiṭṭhāna gocara bhūtā ca upādāna kkhandhā
translated: and the states that accumulate are the truth of the origin. The aggregates affected by the latter and the field of the latter’s resolution are

original: dukkhasaccantiādinā saccayojanā yojetabbā. Phalaṃ panettha vimokkhattayavasena niddhāretabbaṃ,
analyzed: dukkha sacca nti ādinā sacca yojanā yojetabbā phalam pana ittha vimokkha ttaya vasena niddhāretabbam
translated: and so on. The fruit should be defined here as the three liberations.

original: tīhi akusalamūlehi tividhaduccarita-saṃkilesamalavisamaakusalasaññā-vitakkādivasena
analyzed: tīhi akusala mūlehi tividha duccarita saṃkilesa mala visama akusala saññā vitakka ādi vasena
translated: The unprofitable side should be interpreted as the three roots of unprofit, the three kinds of misconduct, the defilement of ignorance, the stain of ignorance, the unevenness of unprofitable cognizance, and so on.

original: akusalapakkho netabbo, tathā tīhi kusalamūlehi tividhasucarita-samakusalasaññā-vitakka-samādhi-vimokkhamukhādivasena🔽vodānapakkho netabboti ayaṃ tipukkhalassa nayassa bhūmi.🔽Tathā vuttanayena gahitesu taṇhāvijjātappakkhiyadhammesu visesato taṇhādiṭṭhīnaṃ
analyzed: akusala pakkhaḥ netabbaḥ tathā tīhi kusala mūlehi tividha su carita sama kusala saññā vitakka samādhi vimokkha mukha ādi vasena  vodāna pakkhaḥ netabbaḥ iti ayam tipukkhalassa nayassa bhūmi  tathā vutta nayena gahitesu taṇhā vijjāta pakkhiya dhammesu visesataḥ taṇhā diṭṭhīnam
translated: And the purified side should be interpreted as the three roots of profit, the three kinds of good conduct, the evenness of profitable cognizance, and so on. This is the plane of the three-rooted method.

original: vasena asubhe “subha”nti, dukkhe “sukha”nti ca vipallāsā, avijjādiṭṭhīnaṃ vasena
analyzed: vasena asubhe subhanti dukkhe sukhanti ca vipallāsāḥ avijjā diṭṭhīnam vasena
translated: And when the ideas belonging to the unprofitable and purified sides have been included in this way, the perversions should be understood as follows. The perversions of “beautiful in the foul” and “pleasant in the painful” are due to craving and views respectively.🔽The perversions of “permanent in the impermanent” and “self in the not-self” are due to ignorance and views respectively.

original: “anicce nicca”nti anattani “attā”ti vipallāsā veditabbā. Tesaṃ paṭipakkhato “appatiṭṭha”ntiādivacanehi
analyzed: anicce niccanti anattani attā ti vipallāsā veditabbā tesam paṭipakkhataḥ appatiṭṭhanti ādi vacanehi
translated: The words “unfixed” , etc., are the opposites of these perversions.

original: ca laddhehi sativīriyasamādhipaññindriyehi cattāri satipaṭṭhānāni siddhāneva honti.🔽Tattha catūhi indriyehi cattāro puggalā niddisitabbā. Kathaṃ? Duvidho hi taṇhācarito
analyzed: ca laddhehi sati vīriya samādhi paññindriyehi cattāri sati paṭṭhānāni siddhāna iva honti  tattha catūhi indriyehi cattāraḥ puggalāḥ niddisitabbā katham duvidhaḥ hi taṇhā caritaḥ
translated: and the four foundations of mindfulness are accomplished by means of the faculties of faith, energy, mindfulness, concentration, and understanding that have been obtained.

original: mudindriyo tikkhindriyoti, tathā diṭṭhicarito. Tesu paṭhamo asubhe “subha”nti vipariyesaggāhī
analyzed: tikkhindriyo ti tathā diṭṭhi carito tesu paṭhamaḥ asubhe vipariyesa gāhī
translated: Herein, four kinds of persons should be demonstrated by means of the four faculties. How? For the person of lustful temperament is of two kinds: one of sluggish temperament and one of quick temperament. So too the person of speculative-temperament. Herein, the first, who misapprehends what is not foul as foul,

original: satibalena yathābhūtaṃ kāyasabhāvaṃ sallakkhento bhāvanābalena taṃ vipallāsaṃ samugghātetvā
analyzed: sati balena yathābhūtam kāya sabhāvam sallakkhentaḥ bhāvanā balena tam vipallāsam samugghātetvā
translated: by means of the strength of mindfulness observes the true state of the nature of the body, and by means of the strength of development he eradicates that perversion

original: sammattaniyāmaṃ okkamati. Dutiyo asukhe “sukha”nti vipariyesaggāhī “uppannaṃ kāmavitakkaṃ
analyzed: sammatta niyāmam okkamati dutiyaḥ asukhe sukhanti vipariyesa gāhī uppannam kāma vitakkam
translated: and enters upon the certainty of rightness. The second, who misapprehends what is not pleasant as pleasant,

original: nādhivāsetī”tiādinā vuttena vīriyasaṃvarabhūtena vīriyabalena paṭipakkhaṃ vinodento
analyzed: na adhivāseti iti ādinā vuttena vīriya saṃvara bhūtena vīriya balena paṭipakkham vinodento
translated: by means of the strength of energy, which is the restraint consisting in the energy to abandon arisen evil states, etc., removes the opposite qualities,

original: bhāvanābalena taṃ vipallāsaṃ viddhaṃsetvā sammattaniyāmaṃ okkamati. Tatiyo anicce
analyzed: bhāvanā balena tam vipallāsam viddhaṃsetvā sammatta niyāmam okkamati tatiyaḥ anicce
translated: and by means of the strength of development he smashes that perversion and enters upon the certainty of rightness. The third, who misapprehends what is impermanent as permanent,

original: “nicca”nti ayāthāvaggāhī samathabalena samāhitacitto saṅkhārānaṃ taṅkhaṇikabhāvaṃ
analyzed: samatha balena samāhita cittaḥ
translated: by means of the strength of serenity, with mind attained to concentration, observes the momentary nature of formations,

original: sallakkhento bhāvanābalena taṃ vipallāsaṃ samugghātetvā sammattaniyāmaṃ okkamati.🔽Catuttho santati-samūha-kiccārammaṇa-ghanavañcitatāya phassādidhammapuñjamatte anattani🔽“attā”ti micchābhinivesī catukoṭikasuññatāmanasikārena taṃ micchābhinivesaṃ viddhaṃsetvā
analyzed: sallakkhentaḥ bhāvanā balena tam vipallāsam samugghātetvā sammatta niyāmam okkamati                                       attā ati micchā abhinivesī catu koṭika suñña tā manasikārena tam micchā abhinivesam viddhaṃsetvā
translated: and by the power of his development he eradicates that perversion and enters upon the certainty of rightness.🔽The fourth kind of person, by the perversion consisting in apprehending as a unity what is a multiplicity of aggregates, elements, sense bases, and faculties, and by the perversion consisting in apprehending as compact what is actually a mass of pores, and by the perversion consisting in apprehending as self what is mere formations consisting of the groups of phenomena beginning with contact, and by the perversion consisting in apprehending as pleasant what is actually suffering,

original: sāmaññaphalaṃ sacchikaroti. Subhasaññāsukhasaññādīhi catūhi vā vipallāsehi samudayasaccaṃ,
analyzed: sāmañña phalam sacchikaroti subha saññā asukha saññā ādīhi catūhi vā vipallāsehi samudaya saccam
translated: and by the perversion consisting in apprehending as permanent what is actually impermanent, misapprehends the five aggregates as self and as what belongs to self. He eradicates that misapprehension by giving attention to the fourfold voidness, and he realizes the fruit of true knowledge and deliverance.

original: tesamadhiṭṭhānārammaṇabhūtā pañcupādānakkhandhā dukkhasaccantiādinā saccayojanā veditabbā.
analyzed: tesam adhiṭṭhāna ārammaṇa bhūtā pañca upādāna kkhandhā dukkha sacca nti ādinā sacca yojanā veditabbā
translated: The four noble truths should be understood to be illustrated by the four perversions in the following way. The four perversions are the truth of suffering. The four perversions’ condition, namely, the five aggregates as objects of clinging, is the truth of the origin. The eradication of the four perversions is the truth of cessation. The supramundane path that occurs as the means to that eradication is the truth of the path.

original: Phalaṃ panettha cattāri sāmaññaphalāni, catūhi cettha vipallāsehi caturāsavoghayoga-kāyagantha-agati-taṇhuppādupādāna-sattaviññāṇaṭṭhiti-apariññādivasena
analyzed: phalam pana ittha cattāri sāmañña phalāni catūhi ca ittha vipallāsehi catur āsava ogha yoga kāya gantha agati taṇhuppāda upādāna satta viññāṇa ṭṭhiti apariññā ādi vasena
translated: The fruit here is the four fruits of asceticism. The four perversions are the four taints, the four yokes, the four knots, the four floods, the four clingings, the four on-edges, the four perversions, the four shackles, the four bonds, the four underlying tendencies, the four clingings, the seven underlying tendencies, the seven latent tendencies, the seven standpoints, the seven underlying tendencies, the seven abodes of consciousness, the seven grounds for consciousness, the seven underlying tendencies, the eight worldly ideas, the eight underlying tendencies, the eight grounds for consciousness, the nine abodes of beings, the nine underlying tendencies, the ten courses of kamma, the ten underlying tendencies, and so forth.

original: akusalapakkho netabbo, tathā catūhi satipaṭṭhānehi catubbidhajhāna-vihārādhiṭṭhāna-sukhabhāgiyadhamma-appamaññāsammappadhāniddhipādādivasena🔽vodānapakkho netabboti ayaṃ sīhavikkīḷitassa nayassa bhūmi.🔽Imesaṃ pana tiṇṇaṃ atthanayānaṃ siddhiyā vohāranayadvayaṃ siddhameva hoti. Tathā
analyzed: akusala pakkhaḥ netabbaḥ tathā catūhi sati paṭṭhānehi catubbidha jhāna vihāra adhiṭṭhāna sukha bhāgiya dhamma appamaññā sammappadhā niddhipāda ādi vasena  vodāna pakkhaḥ netabbaḥ ti ayam sīhavikkīḷitassa nayassa bhūmi  imesam pana tiṇṇam attha nayānam siddhiyā vohāra naya dvayam siddham eva hoti tathā

original: hi atthanayānaṃ disābhūtadhammālocanaṃ disālocanaṃ, tesaṃ samānayanaṃ aṅkusoti pañcapi🔽nayā idha niyuttāti veditabbā. Idañca suttaṃ soḷasavidhe suttantapaṭṭhāne nibbedhasekkhabhāgiyaṃ🔽byatirekamukhena patiṭṭhānāyūhanāni gahitānīti saṃkilesanibbedhasekkhabhāgiyaṃ cāti🔽daṭṭhabbaṃ. Aṭṭhavīsatividhe pana suttantapaṭṭhāne lokiyalokuttaraṃ sattādhiṭṭhānaṃ
analyzed: hi atthana yānam disābhūta dhamma ālocanam disālocanam tesam samānayanam aṅkusaḥ ti 🔽nayāḥ idha niyuttā ati veditabbāḥ idam ca suttam soḷasavidhe suttanta paṭṭhāne nibbedha sekkha bhāgiyam 🔽byatireka mukhena patiṭṭhāna āyūhanāni gahitāni iti saṃkilesa nibbedha sekkha bhāgiyam ca ati 🔽daṭṭhabbam aṭṭhavīsatividhe pana suttanta paṭṭhāne lokiya lokuttaram satta adhiṭṭhānam

original: ñāṇañeyyaṃ dassanabhāvanaṃ sakavacanaṃ vissajjanīyaṃ kusalaṃ anuññātanti veditabbaṃ.
analyzed: ñāṇa ñeyyam dassana bhāvanam saka vacanam vissajjanīyam kusalam anuññātan ti veditabbam
translated: “Knowledge,” “what should be known,” “seeing,” “development,” “one’s own words,” “answer,” “skill,” and “allowance” should be understood.

original: Oghataraṇasuttavaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: oghataraṇa sutta vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: The commentary on the Oghataraṇa Sutta is finished.

original: 2. Nimokkhasuttavaṇṇanā
analyzed: nimokkha sutta vaṇṇanā
translated: The commentary on the Nimokkha Sutta

original: 2. Paṭhamamāgatanti saṃvaṇṇanāvasena paṭhamasuttādīsu paṭhamaṃ āgatapadaṃ. Uttānatthanti
analyzed: paṭhamam āgatam ti saṃvaṇṇanā vasena paṭhama sutta ādīsu paṭhamam āgata padam uttāna attham ti
translated: “First to come” means the first word in the first sutta, etc., in the sense of a commentary. “Clear meaning” means

original: pākaṭatthaṃ. Apubbaṃyeva hi duviññeyyatthañca padaṃ saṃvaṇṇetabbaṃ. Noti pucchāyaṃ
analyzed: pākaṭa attham apubbam yeva hi du viññeyya attham ca padam saṃvaṇṇetabbam no ti pucchāyam
translated: a manifest meaning. For a word with a meaning to be commented on must be either twofold or hard to understand. “No” is a particle with the same meaning as the word “nu” in a question.

original: nu-saddena samānattho nipātoti āha “jānāsi noti jānāsi nū”ti. Vaṭṭato nimuccanti🔽tena sattāti nimokkho, maggo. So ca pamuccanti tenāti pamokkho, pamuccanante pana
analyzed: nu saddena samāna atthaḥ nipātaḥ iti āha jānāsi no ti jānāsi nu ti vaṭṭataḥ nimuccanti  tena sattā ati nimokkhaḥ maggo so ca pamuccanti tena ati pamokkho pamuccanante pana
translated: “Do you know?” means “Do you know nu?” “They are freed from the round” means🔽they are freed by that, thus it is “freedom.” And that is the path. And they are freed by that, thus it is “liberation.” But the fruit is called “liberation” because it is to be reached by one who is liberated.

original: adhigantabbattāphalaṃ “pamokkho”ti vuttaṃ, yathā arahattaṃ “rāgakkhayo dosakkhayo
analyzed: adhigantabba ttā phalam pamokkhaḥ ti vuttam yathā arahattam rāga kkhayaḥ dosa kkhayo
translated: Just as arahatship is called “the destruction of lust, the destruction of hatred,

original: mohakkhayo”ti vuttaṃ. Teti sattā. Viviccatīti visuṃ asammisso hoti, vigacchatīti
analyzed: moha kkhayo ti vuttam te ti sattā viviccati iti visum asammissaḥ hoti vigacchati iti
translated: the destruction of delusion.” “They” means beings. “They are secluded” means they are separate, unmixed. “They depart” means🔽they go away.

original: attho. Viviccati dukkhaṃ etasmāti viveko. Dutiyavikappe pana sakalavaṭṭadukkhato🔽sattā nimuccanti ettha pamuccanti viviccanti cāti nimokkho pamokkho viveko, nibbānanti🔽attho veditabbo. Etthāti ca nimittatthe bhummavacanaṃ daṭṭhabbaṃ. Avadhāraṇattho
analyzed: atthaḥ viviccati dukkham etasmā ati vivekaḥ dutiya vikappe pana sakala vaṭṭa dukkhato  sattāḥ nimuccanti ettha pamuccanti viviccanti ca ati nimokkhaḥ pamokkhaḥ vivekaḥ nibbānan ti  atthaḥ veditabbaḥ ettha ati ca nimitta atthe bhumma vacanam daṭṭhabbam avadhāraṇa attho
translated: ‘It is secluded’ means ‘it is secluded from suffering’ . In the second analysis, however, the meaning should be understood as follows: ‘Beings are released, are freed, are secluded, from the whole of the round of rebirths here, thus it is release, freedom, seclusion, and the meaning of “it” should be regarded as a locative in the sense of a location . The word ‘only’ has the meaning of limitation.

original: kho-kāro “assosi kho”tiādīsu viya.
analyzed: khokāraḥ assosi khoti ādīsu viya
translated: ‘It is secluded’ means ‘it is secluded from suffering’ . In the second analysis, however, the meaning should be understood as follows: ‘Herein beings are released, are freed, are secluded from the suffering of the entire round of rebirths’ . The word ‘herein’ should be regarded as a locative in the sense of a locative of place. The word ‘only’ has the sense of limitation. The word ‘kho’ is like the word ‘kho’ in the passage ‘Assosi kho, bhikkhave, rājā pasenadi kosalo—

original: Nandīmūlako bhavo nandībhavo purimapade uttarapadalopena “sākabhakkho patthavo sākapatthavo”ti🔽yathā. Paṭhamaṃ kammavaṭṭapadhānaṃ atthaṃ vatvā puna kilesakammānaṃ vasena ubhayappadhānaṃ🔽atthaṃ vadanto “nandiyā cā”tiādimāha. Purimanayeti nandīmūlako kammabhavo nandībhavoti
analyzed: nandīmūlakaḥ bhavaḥ nandībhavaḥ purima pade uttara pada lopena sākabhakkho patthavo sākapatthavo ti  yathā paṭhamam attham vatvā puna kilesa kammānam vasena ubhaya ppadhānam  attham vadantaḥ nandiyā ca ati ādim āha purima nayā iti nandīmūlako kamma bhavaḥ nandībhavaḥ ti
translated: “Nandībhavo” is a bahubbīhi compound in which the first member is elided, like “sākabhakkho patthavo sākapatthavo” .

original: etasmiṃ pakkhe. Nandībhavenāti nandībhavapadena. Tividhakammābhisaṅkhāravasenāti
analyzed: etasmin pakkhe nandībhavena ati nandībhava padena tividha kamma abhisaṅkhāra vasena ati
translated: Having stated the meaning of the first section, which is the round of kamma, he now states the meaning of the second section, which is the round of defilement and kamma, with the words ‘and because of delight’ . ‘In the first method’ : in the case of the round of kamma, which is rooted in delight, being the round of delight . ‘In the round of delight’ : by the words ‘in the round of delight’ . ‘By the three kinds of formations’ :

original: puññābhisaṅkhārādivasena kāyasaṅkhārādivasena ca tippakārassa kammābhisaṅkhārassa🔽vasena. Saṅkhārakkhandho gahito cetanāpadhānattā saṅkhārakkhandhassa. Saññāviññāṇehīti
analyzed: puñña abhisaṅkhāra ādi vasena kāya saṅkhāra ādi vasena ca tippakārassa kamma abhisaṅkhārassa  vasena saṅkhāra kkhandho gahito cetanā apadhāna ttā saṅkhāra kkhandhassa saññā viññāṇehi iti
translated: by way of the three kinds of volitional formations, namely, those consisting in merit, etc.🔽The formation aggregate is included by the volitional formations, since volition is the principal factor in the formation aggregate.🔽By the terms “perception” and “consciousness” is meant the perception aggregate and the consciousness aggregate, as stated in the passage: “With the cessation of name-and-form comes cessation of consciousness” .

original: “saññāviññāṇasaṅkhayā”ti evaṃ vuttasaññāviññāṇapadehi. Taṃsampayuttā cāti tena yathāvuttasaṅkhārakkhandhena
analyzed: saññā viññāṇa saṅkhayā ati evam vutta saññā viññāṇa padehi tad sampayuttā ca ati tena yathā vutta saṅkhāra kkhandhena
translated: “Associated with them” means associated with the formation aggregate as just described.

original: samaṃ yuttā eva. Dve khandhāti saññāviññāṇakkhandhā.
analyzed: samam yuttāḥ eva dve khandhā ti saññā viññāṇa kkhandhā
translated: “Two aggregates” means the perception aggregate and the consciousness aggregate.

original: Nanu ettha vedanākkhandho na gahitoti? No na gahitoti dassento “tehi panā”tiādimāha.
analyzed: nanu ettha vedanā khandho na gahitoti no na gahitoti dassento tehi pana atiādim āha
translated: But isn’t the feeling aggregate also included here? No, it is not. In order to show this, the author says: “But by those three aggregates,” etc.🔽The feeling aggregate is included by the three aggregates, namely, perception, formations, and consciousness, because it is invariably conjoined with them.

original: Tīhi khandhehīti saññāsaṅkhāraviññāṇakkhandhehi. Gahitāva avinābhāvato. Na hi vedanārahito
analyzed: tīhi khandhehi iti saññā saṅkhāra viññāṇa kkhandhehi gahitā ava avinābhāvataḥ na hi vedanā rahitaḥ
translated: For there is no instance of consciousness without feeling.🔽“Unclung to” means wholesome and unwholesome.

original: koci cittuppādo atthi. Anupādiṇṇakānanti kusalākusalānaṃ. Na hettha kiriyākhandhānaṃ
analyzed: koci cittuppādaḥ atthi anupādiṇṇakānam ti kusala akusalānam na ha ittha kiriyā khandhānam
translated: Here the non-occurrence of the indeterminate aggregates is not intended.🔽“By way of non-occurrence” means by way of the state of being subject to non-arising.

original: appavatti adhippetā. Appavattivasenāti anuppattidhammatāpattivasena. Nibbattanavasena
analyzed: appavatti adhippetā appavatti vasena ati anuppatti dhamma tā āpatti vasena nibbattana vasena
translated: “By way of arising” means by way of the state of being subject to arising.

original: kammakilesehi upādīyatīti upādi, pañcakkhandhā. Upādino seso upādiseso, saha upādisesenāti
analyzed: kamma kilesehi upādīyati iti upādi pañca kkhandhāḥ upādino sesaḥ upādi sesaḥ saha upādi sesena ati
translated: “It is clung to by defilements and kamma as a result of the five aggregates, and so it is called ‘that which is clung to.’ The remainder of the aggregates that are not clung to is ‘residual,’ and so it is said ‘together with the residual.’

original: saupādisesaṃ. Nibbānaṃ kathitaṃ sakalakammakilesavūpasamatthassa jotitattā. Heṭṭhā
analyzed: sa aupādisesam nibbānam kathitam sakala kamma kilesa vūpasama atthassa jotita ttā heṭṭhā
translated: Nibbāna is called ‘with residual’ because it is the state of the complete cessation of kamma and defilements. The two terms ‘with residual’ and ‘without residual’ are used in the Suttas in the sense of the aggregates that are clung to and the aggregates that are not clung to.

original: dvīhi padehi anupādiṇṇakakkhandhā gahitāti “vedanāna”nti ettha upādiṇṇakaggahaṇaṃ
analyzed: dvīhi padehi anupādiṇṇaka khandhā gahitā ati vedanānam ti ettha upādiṇṇaka ggahaṇam
translated: The aggregates that are not clung to are included in the two terms ‘with residual’ and ‘without residual,’ and so the phrase ‘of feeling’ in the text is used to indicate the aggregates that are clung to.🔽Therefore the commentator says ‘of the clung-to feeling.’

original: yuttanti āha “upādiṇṇakavedanāna”nti. Nirodhenāti tappaṭibaddhachandarāganirodhavasena
analyzed: āha upādiṇṇaka vedanā na anti nirodhena ati tad paṭibaddha chanda rāga nirodha vasena
translated: ‘By its cessation’: by the cessation of the craving and lust bound up with it.

original: nirujjhanena. Upasamenāti accantūpasamena appavattanena. Evañca katvā ca-saddaggahaṇaṃ
analyzed: nirujjhanena upasamena ati accantu upasamena appavattanena evam ca katvā ca sadda gahaṇam
translated: ‘By its surcease’: by its complete surcease, by its non-recurrence. And in this way the word ‘and’ in the text is justified.🔽‘Of that’: of that feeling and of the three aggregates associated with it.

original: samatthitaṃ hoti. Tesanti tassā vedanāya taṃsampayuttānañca tiṇṇaṃ khandhānaṃ. Vatthārammaṇavasenāti🔽vatthubhūtānaṃ channaṃ ārammaṇabhūtānañca sabbesampi upādiṇṇakarūpadhammānaṃ vasena.
analyzed: samatthitam hoti tesanti tassā vedanāya tad sampayuttānam ca tiṇṇam khandhānam vattha ārammaṇa vasena ati 🔽vatthu bhūtānam channam ārammaṇa bhūtānam ca sabbesam pi upādiṇṇaka rūpa dhammānam vasena
translated: ‘By the severence of the residual’: by the severence of the residual aggregates that are clung to, which are the basis and object of the aggregates that are not clung to.

original: Kasmā pana heṭṭhā cattāro arūpakkhandhāyeva vuttā, rūpakkhandho na gahitoti? Visesabhāvato.🔽Saupādisesanibbānappattiyañhi upādiṇṇakarūpadhammānaṃ viya anupādiṇṇakarūpadhammānaṃ
analyzed: kasmā pana heṭṭhā cattāro arūpa kkhandhāya iva vuttāḥ rūpa kkhandho na gahitaḥ ti visesa bhāvato  sa aupādisesa nibbāna pattiyam hi upādiṇṇaka rūpa dhammānam viya anupādiṇṇaka rūpa dhammānam
translated: But why are only the four immaterial aggregates mentioned below and not the material aggregate? —Because of their special nature.🔽For just as there is no cessation of the material phenomena that are clung to in the attainment of the Nibbāna element with a residue of clinging, so too there is none of the material phenomena that are not so classed.

original: appavattiyeva natthi. Dutiyanayeti nandiyā ca bhavassa cāti etamhi pakkhe. Nandiggahaṇena🔽saṅkhārakkhandho gahito taṃsahacaraṇato. Upapattibhavasaṅkhāto rūpakkhandhoti upādiṇṇakarūpadhammameva
analyzed: appavattiyā iva natthi dutiya naye ti nandiyā ca bhavassa ca ati etamhi pakkhe nandi ggahaṇena  saṅkhāra kkhandhaḥ gahitaḥ tad sahacaraṇataḥ upapatti bhava saṅkhātaḥ rūpa kkhandhaḥ ti upādiṇṇaka rūpa dhammam eva
translated: In the second method, in the case of the phrase “with the support of craving for becoming,” the formation aggregate is included by the word “craving”🔽because it accompanies craving. The material aggregate, which is called “the becoming that consists in rebirth-linking,” is included by the word “becoming”

original: vadati. Taggahaṇeneva ca tannimittakāni utuāhārajāni, viññāṇaggahaṇena cittajānīti
analyzed: vadati tad gahaṇena iva ca tad nimittakāni utu āhāra jāni viññāṇa ggahaṇena citta jāni iti
translated: because it is the material phenomena that are clung to. And by their inclusion, the material phenomena originated by kamma, which are due to temperature and nutriment, are also included. And by the word “consciousness” the material phenomena originated by consciousness are included.

original: catusantatirūpassapettha gahitatā veditabbā. Saññādīhīti saññāviññāṇavedanāgahaṇehi
analyzed: catu santati rūpassa apa ittha gahita tā veditabbā saññā ādīhi iti saññā viññāṇa vedanā gahaṇehi
translated: Thus the fourfold continuity of materiality should be understood as included here. By the words “perception, etc.,”

original: tayo khandhā gahitā, tañca kho upādiṇṇā anupādiṇṇāti vibhāgaṃ akatvā avisesato. Avisesena
analyzed: tayaḥ khandhāḥ gahitā tat ca kho upādiṇṇā an upādiṇṇā ati vibhāgam a katvā avisesataḥ avisesena
translated: the three aggregates, namely, perception, mental formations, and consciousness, are included without distinction, that is, without making the division “clung to” and “not clung to.”

original: hi pañcannaṃ khandhānaṃ appavatti nibbānaṃ. Tenāha “evaṃ…pe… nibbānaṃ kathitaṃ hotī”ti.
analyzed: hi pañcannam khandhānam appavatti nibbānam tena āha evam pe nibbānam kathitam hoti iti
translated: for the non-occurrence of the five aggregates is Nibbāna. Hence he said: “Thus … Nibbāna is stated” .

original: “Nibbāna”nti hi idha amatamahānibbānaṃ adhippetaṃ. Imameva ca nayanti idaṃ yathāvuttaṃ
analyzed: nibbānam ti hi idha amata mahānibbānam adhippetam imam eva ca nayanti idam yathā vuttam
translated: For here the “ Nibbāna” intended is the great Nibbāna of the Deathless . And he does so in the way already stated ,

original: dutiyameva. Cattāro mahānikāye dhāretīti catunikāyiko. Bhaṇḍikanāmako thero bhaṇḍikatthero.
analyzed: dutiyam eva cattāraḥ mahā nikāye dhāreti iti catu nikāyikaḥ bhaṇḍika nāmakaḥ theraḥ bhaṇḍika tthero
translated: in the second case too. He is called “ four-aggregate-bearer” because he bears the four aggregates . The elder called Bhaṇḍa is Bhaṇḍa-thero .

original: Itīti vuttappakāraparāmasanaṃ. Nibbānavasenevāti paṭhamanaye saupādisesanibbānassa
analyzed: iti iti vutta ppakāra parāmasanam nibbāna vasena iva āti paṭhama naye saupādisesa nibbānassa
translated: Thus : in the way already stated . By way of Nibbāna : in the first case by way of Nibbāna with a residue of clinging left and by way of Nibbāna without a residue of clinging left ;

original: anupādisesanibbānassa ca, dutiye pana “amatamahānibbānassā”ti sabbathāpi nibbānasseva
analyzed: anupādisesa nibbānassa ca dutiye pana amata mahānibbānassa ati sabbathā api nibbānassa eva
translated: but in the second case by way of Nibbāna in all its aspects , by way of the great Nibbāna of the Deathless .

original: vasena bhagavā desanaṃ niṭṭhapesi samāpesīti.
analyzed: vasena bhagavā desanam niṭṭhapesi samāpesi iti
translated: The Blessed One concluded , brought to an end , the teaching.

original: Nimokkhasuttavaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.🔽3. Upanīyasuttavaṇṇanā
analyzed: nimokkha sutta vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā  upanīya sutta vaṇṇanā
translated: The commentary on the Nimokkha Sutta is ended.🔽The Upanisa Sutta

original: 3. Anekatthattā dhātusaddānaṃ upasaggavasena atthavisesavācako hotīti āha “upanīyatīti
analyzed: aneka attha ttā dhātu saddānam upasagga vasena attha visesa vācakaḥ hoti iti āha upanīyati iti
