original: 36. Tatvassāti o-kārassa va-kārādesaṃ a-kārassa ca lopaṃ katvā niddesoti āha “tato
analyzed: ta tvassa ati okārassa vakāra ādesam akārassa ca lopam katvā niddeso ti āha tatas
translated: “Tattha” : the “o” of “tato” is replaced by “va” and the “a” is elided.🔽“Tattha” is also a reading; the meaning is “because of that faith.”

original: assā”ti. “Tatassā”ti vā pāṭho, tatoti ca saddhāhetūti attho. Nānupatantīti na vattanti.
analyzed: assa ati tatassa ati vā pāṭhaḥ tatas iti ca saddhā hetū ti atthaḥ na anupatanti iti na vattanti
translated: “Do not come to it” : do not occur.🔽“They are negligent” : they are confused, the meaning is that they practice wrongly.

original: Pamādaṃ karontīti pamajjanti, micchā paṭipajjantīti attho. Lakkhaṇānīti aniccādilakkhaṇāni.
analyzed: pamādam karonti iti pamajjanti micchā paṭipajjanti iti atthaḥ lakkhaṇāni iti anicca ādi lakkhaṇāni
translated: “Characteristics” : the characteristics of impermanence, and so on.🔽“He contemplates” : he looks with the eye of knowledge, the meaning is that he observes.

original: Upanijjhāyatīti upecca ñāṇacakkhunā pekkhati, anupassatīti attho. Āgatakiccanti āhatakiccaṃ,
analyzed: upanijjhāyati iti upecca ñāṇa cakkhunā pekkhati anupassati iti attho āgata kiccam ti āhata kiccam
translated: “He has done what had to be done” : he has accomplished what had to be done.🔽This is the reading.

original: ayameva vā pāṭho. Sādhetīti asammohapaṭivedhavasena nipphādeti, tathalakkhaṇaṃ nirodhasaccaṃ
analyzed: ayam eva vā pāṭhaḥ sādheti iti asammoha paṭivedha vasena nipphādā iti tatha lakkhaṇam nirodha saccam
translated: “He contemplates” : he produces it by way of the penetration of non-delusion. The meaning of the characteristic of cessation

original: upanijjhāyatīti ayamattho maggepi vattabbo tena vinā asammohapaṭivedhassa asambhavato.
analyzed: upanijjhāyati iti ayam atthaḥ magge pi vattabbaḥ tena vinā asammoha paṭivedhassa asambhavato
translated: should also be stated in regard to the path, because without it the penetration of non-delusion is impossible.

original: Kasiṇārammaṇassāti idaṃ lakkhaṇavacanaṃ. Akasiṇārammaṇasamāpattiyopi hi santīti.
analyzed: kasiṇa ārammaṇassa ti idam lakkhaṇa vacanam akasiṇa ārammaṇa samāpattiyaḥ api hi santi iti
translated: “With the kasiṇa as object” : this is a statement of the characteristic.

original: Yathā ca kasiṇārammaṇāni aṭṭhannaṃ samāpattīnaṃ avasesānañca tadārammaṇānaṃ paccavekkhaṇavasena
analyzed: yathā ca kasiṇa ārammaṇāni aṭṭhannam samāpattīnam avasesānam ca tad ārammaṇānam paccavekkhaṇa vasena
translated: And just as the kasiṇas are the object for the eight attainments and for the rest of the kinds of consciousness that have them as their object, in the way already stated,

original: cittānaṃ, evaṃ tena tāni ārammaṇāni gahitānīti “kasiṇārammaṇassa”icceva vuttaṃ. Paramaṃ
analyzed: cittānam evam tena tāni ārammaṇāni gahitāni iti kasiṇa ārammaṇassa ecca iva vuttam paramam
translated: so too the kasiṇas are the object for the kinds of consciousness that review the kasiṇas as a means of attaining the eight attainments.

original: uttamaṃ sukhanti vattabbato paramasukhaṃ arahattaṃ.
analyzed: uttamam sukhanti vattabbataḥ parama sukham arahattam
translated: The supreme bliss is Arahantship, which is to be called “the supreme bliss” because it is the supreme bliss.

original: Saddhāsuttavaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: saddhā sutta vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: The commentary on the Saddha Sutta is finished.

original: 7. Samayasuttavaṇṇanā🔽37. Udānaṃ paṭiccāti ukkākaraññā jātisambhedaparihāranimittaṃ attano vaṃsaparisuddhaṃ
analyzed: samaya sutta vaṇṇanā  udānam paṭicca ati ukkā karaññā jāti sambheda parihāra nimittam attanaḥ vaṃsa parisuddham
translated: The Sutta on the Occasion

original: nissāya vuttaṃ pītiudāhāraṃ paṭicca gottavasena “sakkā”ti laddhanāmānaṃ. Yadi ekopi🔽janapado, kathaṃ bahuvacananti āha “ruḷhīsaddenā”ti. Akkharacintikā hi īdisesu ṭhānesu
analyzed: nissāya vuttam pīti udāhāram paṭicca gotta vasena sakkā ati laddha nāmānam yadi ekaḥ api  janapadaḥ katham bahuvacanan ti āha ruḷhī saddena ati akkhara cintikā hi īdisesu ṭhānesu
translated: “On the occasion of the utterance”: on the occasion of the utterance of the joy expressed by the king of Ukkala, who, by means of his own pure lineage, had given the reason for the avoidance of confusion of generations, namely, “I am a Sakyan,” because of his name as a Sakyan.

original: yutte viya saliṅgavacanāni icchanti, ayamettha ruḷhī yathā “avantī kurū”ti, tabbisesane
analyzed: yutte sa liṅga vacanāni icchanti ayam ettha ruḷhī yathā avantī kurūti tad visesane
translated: If it was only one country, how can the plural be used? He said “by the usage of the language” . For those who think in terms of syllables want to use words with the plural ending in such places as this, as if it were appropriate. This is the usage here, as in “Avantī and Kuru” .🔽In the explanation of that

original: pana janapadasadde jātisaddatāya ekavacanameva. Aropimeti kenaci na ropime.
analyzed: pana janapada sadde jāti sadda tāya eka vacanam eva aropima iti kenacid na ropima
translated: “I will not plant” means: I will not plant by anyone.🔽“By a dam” means: by a dike.

original: Āvaraṇenāti setunā. Bandhāpetvāti paṇḍupalāsapāsāṇamattikakhaṇḍādīhi āliṃ thiraṃ
analyzed: āvaraṇena ati setunā ālim thiram
translated: “Having had it bound” means: having had it made firm by a fence of dried leaves, stones, bricks, and so on.

original: kārāpetvā. Sassāni kārentīti jeṭṭhamāse kira ghammassa balavabhāvena himavante himaṃ
analyzed: kārāpetvā sassāni kārenti iti jeṭṭha māse kira ghammassa balava bhāvena himavante himaṃ
translated: “They are making the crops” means: in the first month of the rainy season, it seems, the snow on the Himalayas melts

original: vilīyitvā sanditvā anukkamena rohiṇiṃ nadiṃ pavisati, taṃ bandhitvā sassāni kārenti.
analyzed: vilīyitvā sanditvā anukkamena rohiṇim nadim pavisati tam bandhitvā sassāni kārenti
translated: through the power of the heat and flows down, gradually entering the Rohini River, and they bind it and make the crops.

original: “Jātiṃ ghaṭṭetvā kalahaṃ vaḍḍhayiṃsū”ti saṅkhepena vuttamatthaṃ pākaṭataraṃ kātuṃ
analyzed: jātim ghaṭṭetvā kalaham vaḍḍhayiṃsu iti saṅkhepena vuttam attham pākaṭataram kātum
translated: “Having struck the birth-place, they increased the quarrel” means: in brief, the meaning stated is to make clear.

original: “koliyakammakarā vadantī”ti āha. Niyuttaamaccānanti tasmiṃ sassaparipālanakamme niyojitamahāmattānaṃ.
analyzed: koliya kammakarāḥ vadanti iti āha tasmim sassa paripālana kamme niyojita mahā mattānam
translated: “The workers in the fields said” means: the ministers who were appointed to that work of protecting the crops.

original: Tīṇi jātakānīti “kuṭhārihattho puriso”tiādinā phandanajātakaṃ “duddubhāyati bhaddante”tiādinā
analyzed: tīṇi jātakāni iti kuṭhāri hatthaḥ purisaḥ iti ādinā phandana jātakam duddubhāyati bhaddanta iti ādinā
translated: “Three birth-stories” means: the Phandana Jātaka beginning with “A man with an axe in his hand” and the

original: duddubhajātakaṃ, “vandāmi taṃ kuñjarā”tiādinā laṭukikajātakanti imāni tīṇi jātakāni. Dve jātakānīti –
analyzed: duddubha jātakam vandāmi tam kuñja rāti ādinā laṭukika jātakam iti imāni tīṇi jātakāni dve jātakāni iti
translated: The three Birth-Stories are the Duddubha Birth-Story , the Latukikā Birth-Story beginning “ I worship him, the elephant” , and the Three-Fishes Birth-Story . The two Suttas are the Tree-Dhamma Sutta and the Sammodamāna Sutta .

original: “Sādhu sambahulā ñātī, api rukkhā araññajā;
analyzed: sādhu sambahulā ñātī api rukkhā arañña jā
translated: “How good are many kinsmen, Even trees in the forest are so;

original: Vāto vahati ekaṭṭhaṃ, brahantampi vanappati”nti. –
analyzed: vātaḥ vahati ekaṭṭham brahantam pi vanappatinti
translated: The wind blows the single tree, But not the forest’s lord” .

original: Ādinā rukkhadhammajātakaṃ.
analyzed: ādinā rukkha dhamma jātakam
translated: The Tree-Dhamma Birth-Story beginning “ How good are many kinsmen” .

original: “Sammodamānā gacchanti, jālamādāya pakkhino;
analyzed: sammodamānāḥ gacchanti jālam ādāya pakkhinaḥ
translated: “The birds go on in harmony, Carrying the net in their beaks;

original: Yadā te vivadissanti, tadā ehinti me vasa”nti. –
analyzed: yadā te vivadissanti tadā ehinti me vasanti
translated: When they quarrel, then come I” .

original: Ādinā sammodamānajātakanti imāni dve jātakāni.
analyzed: ādinā imāni dve jātakāni
translated: The Sammodamāna Birth-Story beginning “ The birds go on in harmony” .

original: “Attadaṇḍā bhayaṃ jātaṃ, janaṃ passatha medhagaṃ;
analyzed: atta daṇḍāḥ bhayam jātam janam passatha medha gam
translated: “When fear has come through self-punishment, See the people’s witless state;

original: Saṃvegaṃ kittayissāmi, yathā saṃvijitaṃ mayā”ti. –
analyzed: saṃvegam kittayissāmi yathā saṃvijitam mayā ati
translated: I will tell of the agitation That I myself have overcome” .

original: Ādinā attadaṇḍasuttaṃ.🔽Tenāti bhagavatā. Kalahakaraṇabhāvoti kalahakaraṇassa atthibhāvo. Mahāpathaviyā mahagghe
analyzed: ādinā atta daṇḍa suttam  tena ati bhagavatā kalahakaraṇa bhāvaḥ ti kalahakaraṇassa atthi bhāvaḥ mahā pathaviyā mahagghe
translated: The Self-Punishment Sutta beginning “ When fear has come through self-punishment” .🔽“Ten” : by the Blessed One. The existence of the state of quarrelling : the existence of the state of quarrelling. Why did he not do so with the great-wealthy nobles of the great earth?

original: khattiye kasmā nāsethāti dassetvā kalahaṃ vūpasametukāmo bhagavā pathaviṃ nidassanabhāvena
analyzed: khattiye kasmā na āsetha ati dassetvā kalaham vūpasametu kāmaḥ bhagavā pathavim nidassana bhāvena
translated: Having shown that, the Blessed One, who was desirous of allaying the quarrel, made the earth a sign

original: gaṇhīti dassento “pathavī nāma kiṃ agghatī”tiādimāha. Aṭṭhāneti akāraṇe. Veraṃ katvāti
analyzed: gaṇhi iti dassentaḥ pathavī nāma kim agghati itiādim āha aṭṭhāna iti akāraṇe veram katvā iti
translated: “What is the price of earth?” etc. “Aṭṭhāneti” means “without reason.” “Having made enmity” means

original: virodhaṃ uppādetvā. Taṃtaṃpalobhanakiriyāya parakkamantiyo “ukkaṇṭhantū”ti sāsanaṃ
analyzed: virodham uppādetvā taṃ taṃ palobhana kiriyāya parakkamantiyaḥ ukkaṇṭhantu iti sāsanam
translated: having created hostility. “They sent a message” means they sent a message saying, “Let them be anxious,”

original: pesenti. Kuṇāladaheti kuṇāladahatīre patiṭṭhāya. Pucchitaṃ kathesi anukkamena kuṇālasakuṇarājassa
analyzed: pesenti kuṇāla daheti kuṇāla daha tīre patiṭṭhāya pucchitam kathesi anukkamena kuṇāla sakuṇa rājassa
translated: while they themselves were preparing to attack in order to seduce the other. “Kuṇāladaha” means “the bank of the Kuṇāla river.” “He answered the question” means he answered the question in order. “In the course of the questions” means in the course of the questions of the Kuṇāla bird king.

original: pucchāpasaṅgena kuṇālajātakaṃ kathessāmīti. Anabhiratiṃ vinodesi itthīnaṃ dosadassanamukhena
analyzed: puccha apasaṅgena kuṇāla jātakam kathessāmi iti anabhiratim vinodesi itthīnam dosa dassana mukhena
translated: “I will tell the Kuṇāla Jātaka.” “He removed his dissatisfaction” means he removed his dissatisfaction by showing the faults of women

original: kāmānaṃ ādīnavokārasaṃkilesavibhāvanavasena. Purisapurisehīti kosajjaṃ viddhaṃsetvā🔽purisathāmabrūhanena uttamapurisehi no bhavituṃ vaṭṭatīti uppannacittā. Avissaṭṭhasamaṇakammantā
analyzed: kāmānam ādīnava ukāra saṃkilesa vibhāvana vasena purisa purisehi iti kosajjam viddhaṃsetvā  purisa thāma brūhanena uttama purisehi no bhavitum vaṭṭati iti uppanna cittā a vissaṭṭha samaṇa kammantā
translated: and by showing the danger and corruption of sensual pleasures. “By men and women” means by men and women who had given up laziness🔽and had developed manly strength, thinking, “It is not right for us to be like this.” “Not having neglected the duties of an ascetic” means not having neglected the duties of meditation and the practice of meditation.

original: apariccattakammaṭṭhānābhiyogāti attho. Nisīdituṃ vaṭṭatīti bhagavā cintesīti yojanā.
analyzed: a pariccatta kammaṭṭhāna abhiyogā ti atthaḥ nisīditum vaṭṭati iti bhagavā cintesi iti yojanā
translated: “It is right for him to sit down” means the Blessed One thought this.

original: Paduminiyanti padumavane. Vikasiṃsu guṇagaṇavibodhena. Ayaṃ imassa…pe… na kathesīti
analyzed: paduminiyanti paduma vane guṇa gaṇa vibodhena ayam na kathesi iti
translated: Paduminiyanti padumavana. Vikasiṃsu guṇagaṇavibodhena. Ayaṃ imassa…pe… na kathesīti

original: iminā sabbepi te bhikkhū tāvadeva paṭipāṭiyā āgatattā aññamaññassa lajjamānā attanā
analyzed: iminā sabbe pi te bhikkhū tāvat eva paṭipāṭiyā āgata ttā aññamaññassa lajjamānāḥ attanā
translated: iminā sabbepi te bhikkhū tāvadeva paṭipāṭiyā āgatattā aññamaññassa lajjamānā attanā

original: paṭiladdhavisesaṃ bhagavato nārocesunti dasseti. Khīṇāsavānantiādinā tattha kāraṇamāha.
analyzed: paṭiladdha visesam bhagavataḥ na arocesun ti dasseti khīṇāsavānanti ādinā tattha kāraṇam āha
translated: paṭiladdhavisesaṃ bhagavato nārocesunti dasseti. Khīṇāsavānantiādinā tattha kāraṇamāha.

original: Osaṭamatteti bhagavato santikaṃ upagatamatte. Ariyamaṇḍaleti ariyapuggalasamūhe.
analyzed: osaṭa matta iti bhagavato santikam upagata matte ariya maṇḍala iti ariya puggala samūhe
translated: Osaṭamatteti bhagavato santikaṃ upagatamatte. Ariyamaṇḍaleti ariyapuggalasamūhe.

original: Pācīnayugandharaparikkhepatoti yugandharapabbatassa pācīnaparikkhepato, na bāhirakehi
analyzed: pācīna yugandhara parikkhepato ti yugandhara pabbatassa pācīna parikkhepataḥ na bāhirakehi
translated: Pācīnayugandharaparikkhepatoti yugandharapabbatassa pācīnaparikkhepato, na bāhirakehi

original: vuccamānaudayapabbatato. Rāmaṇeyyakadassanatthanti buddhuppādapaṭimaṇḍitattā visesato
analyzed: vuccamāna audayapabbatataḥ rāmaṇeyyaka dassana attham ti buddhuppāda paṭimaṇḍita ttā visesato
translated: vuccamānaudayapabbatato. Rāmaṇeyyakadassanatthanti buddhuppādapaṭimaṇḍitattā visesato

original: ramaṇīyassa lokassa ramaṇīyabhāvadassanatthaṃ. Ullaṅghitvāti uṭṭhahitvā. Evarūpe
analyzed: ramaṇīyassa lokassa ramaṇīya bhāva dassana attham ullaṅghitvā ati uṭṭhahitvā evarūpe
translated: ramaṇīyassa lokassa ramaṇīyabhāvadassanatthaṃ. Ullaṅghitvāti uṭṭhahitvā. Evarūpe

original: khaṇe laye muhutteti yathāvutte candamaṇḍalassa uṭṭhitakkhaṇe uṭṭhitavelāyaṃ uṭṭhitamuhutteti
analyzed: khaṇe laye muhuttā iti yathā vutte canda maṇḍalassa uṭṭhita kkhaṇe uṭṭhita velāyam uṭṭhita muhuttā iti
translated: khaṇe laye muhutteti yathāvutte candamaṇḍalassa uṭṭhitakkhaṇe uṭṭhitavelāyaṃ uṭṭhitamuhutteti

original: uparūparikālassa vaḍḍhitabhāvadassanatthaṃ vuttaṃ.
analyzed: upari upari kālassa vaḍḍhita bhāva dassana attham vuttam
translated: The words “in the course of time” are said in order to show the increase of the time.

original: Tesaṃ bhikkhūnaṃ jātiādivasena bhagavato anurūpaparivārabhāvaṃ dassento “tatthā”tiādimāha.
analyzed: tesam bhikkhūnam jāti ādi vasena bhagavataḥ anurūpa parivāra bhāvam dassentaḥ tattha ati ādim āha
translated: In order to show the suitability of the disciples to the Master by way of birth, etc., he says “therein.”

original: Mahāsammatassa vaṃse uppannotiādi kulavaṃsasuddhidassanaṃ. Khattiyagabbhe jātoti🔽idaṃ satipi jātivisuddhiyaṃ mātāpitūnaṃ vasena avisuddhatā siyāti tesampi “avisuddhatā
analyzed: mahāsammatassa vaṃse uppannaḥ tiādi kula vaṃsa suddhi dassanam khattiya gabbhe jātaḥ ti  idam mātā pitūnam vasena avisuddha tā siyāti tesam pi avisuddha tā
translated: The words “born in the lineage of Mahāsammata” and so forth show the purity of the lineage. “Born in the womb of a Khattiya”🔽is said in order to show the purity of the mother and father, although the birth is pure. “Purity”

original: natthi imesa”nti visuddhidassanatthaṃ vuttaṃ. Satipi ca gabbhavisuddhiyaṃ katadosena
analyzed: natthi imesan ti visuddhi dassana attham vuttam sati pi ca gabbha visuddhiyam kata dosena
translated: means “there is no impurity in these.” And although the womb is pure, it is possible that there is impurity by way of the fault of the mother’s food.

original: missakattā arajjārahatāpi siyāti “tampi natthi imesa”nti dassanatthaṃ “rājapabbajitā”tiādi vuttaṃ.
analyzed: missaka ttā a rajja araha tā api siyāti tam pi natthi imesan ti dassana ttham rāja pabbajita ātiādi vuttam
translated: Therefore, in order to show that “there is none of that in these,” it is said “they are royal renunciants.”

original: Sāmantāti samīpe. Caliṃsūti uṭṭhahiṃsu. Kosamattaṃ ṭhānaṃ saddantaraṃ, “saddasavanaṭṭhānameva
analyzed: sāmanta ati samīpe caliṃsu iti uṭṭhahiṃsu kosa mattam ṭhānam saddantaram sadda savana ṭṭhānam eva
translated: “In the vicinity” means “near.” “They went forth” means “they arose.” The distance of a Kos is the distance of the sound. “The place where the sound is heard

original: saddantara”nti apare. Tikkhattuṃ tesaṭṭhiyā nagarasahassesūti jambudīpe kira ādito
analyzed: apare tikkhattum nagara sahassesu iti jambudīpe kira āditaḥ
translated: is the distance of the sound,” say others. “Three times seventy-one thousand cities” means in the Rose-Apple Island, it seems, at the beginning

original: mahantāni tesaṭṭhi nagarasahassāni uppannāni, tathā dutiyaṃ, tathā tatiyaṃ. Taṃ sandhāyāha
analyzed: mahantāni tesaṭṭhi nagara sahassāni uppannāni tathā dutiyam tathā tatiyam tam sandhāya āha
translated: There were three times seventy-one thousand great cities, and so there were three times seventy-one thousand great cities. Referring to that he said

original: “tikkhattuṃ tesaṭṭhiyā nagarasahassesū”ti. Tāni pana sampiṇḍetvā satasahassato paraṃ
analyzed: tikkhattum nagara sahassesu iti tāni pana sampiṇḍetvā sata sahassataḥ param
translated: “Three times seventy-one thousand great cities.” But adding them all together there were more than a hundred thousand,

original: navasahassādhikāni asītisahassāni. Navanavutiyā doṇamukhasatasahassesūti navasatasahassādhikesu
analyzed: nava sahassa adhikāni asīti sahassāni nava navutiyā doṇa mukha sata sahassesu uti nava sata sahassa adhikesu
translated: namely eighty-four thousand nine hundred. In ninety-nine hundred thousand doṇamukhas, that is to say, in ninety-nine hundred thousand doṇamukhas plus ten thousand.

original: navutisatasahassesu doṇamukhesu. Doṇamukhanti ca mahānagarassa āyuppattiṭṭhānabhūtaṃ🔽pādanagaraṃ vuccati. Chanavutiyā paṭṭanakoṭisatasahassesūti chakoṭisatasahassaadhikesu🔽navutikoṭisatasahassapaṭṭanesu. Tambapaṇṇidīpādichapaṇṇāsāya ratanākaresu. Evaṃ pana🔽nagara-doṇamukhapaṭṭana-ratanākarādibhāvena kathanaṃ taṃtaṃadhivatthāya vasantīnaṃ
analyzed: navuti sata sahassesu doṇamukhesu doṇamukhanti ca mahā nagarassa āyu ppatti ṭṭhāna bhūtam  pādanagaram vuccati chanavutiyā paṭṭana koṭi sata sahassesu uti cha koṭi sata sahassa adhikesu  navuti koṭi sata sahassa paṭṭanesu rata nākaresu evam pana  nagara doṇa mukha paṭṭana ratana ākara ādi bhāvena kathanam vasantīnam
translated: Doṇamukha is a name for a city that is the source of the life of a great city.

original: tāsaṃ devatānaṃ bahubhāvadassanatthaṃ. Yadi dasasahassacakkavāḷesu devatā sannipatitā.
analyzed: tāsam devatānam bahu bhāva dassana attham yadi dasa sahassa cakkavāḷesu devatā sannipatitā
translated: In ninety-nine hundred thousand doṇamukhas plus ten thousand. In ninety-nine hundred thousand doṇamukhas plus ten thousand. In ninety-nine hundred thousand doṇamukhas plus ten thousand. In ninety-nine hundred thousand doṇamukhas plus ten thousand. In ninety-nine

original: Atha kasmā pāḷiyaṃ “dasahi ca lokadhātūhī”ti? Vuttanti āha “dasasahassa…pe… adhippeta”nti.🔽Tena sahassilokadhātu idha “ekā lokadhātū”ti veditabbā.
analyzed: atha kasmā pāḷiyam dasahi ca lokadhātūhi iti vuttanti āha dasa sahassape adhippetanti  tena sahassi lokadhātu idha ekā lokadhātu uti veditabbā
translated: The ten thousand world-systems are meant.

original: Lohapāsādeti sabbapaṭhamakate lohapāsāde. Brahmaloketi heṭṭhime brahmaloke. Yadi
analyzed: loha pāsāde iti sabba paṭhama kate loha pāsāde brahma loka iti heṭṭhime brahma loke yadi
translated: In the first-made palace of iron: in the lowest Brahma-world.

original: tā devatā evaṃ nirantarā hutvā sannipatitā, pacchā āgatānaṃ okāso eva na bhaveyyāti
analyzed: tāḥ devatāḥ evam nirantarāḥ hutvā sannipatitā pacchā āgatānam okāsaḥ eva na bhaveyya iti
translated: If those deities had assembled in this way without leaving any space in between, there would be no room for those who came later.

original: codanaṃ sandhāyāha “yathā kho panā”tiādi.
analyzed: codanam sandhāya āha yathā
translated: With reference to this objection, he says, “But just as … ”

original: Suddhāvāsakāye uppannā suddhāvāsakāyikā. Tāsaṃ pana yasmā suddhāvāsabhūmi nivāsaṭṭhānaṃ,🔽tasmā vuttaṃ “suddhāvāsavāsīna”nti. Āvāsāti āvāsaṭṭhānabhūtā. Devatā pana orambhāgiyānaṃ
analyzed: suddhāvāsa kāye uppannā suddhāvāsakāyikā tāsam pana yasmā suddhāvāsa bhūmi nivāsa ṭṭhānam  tasmā vuttam suddhāvāsa vāsīnam ti āvāsā ati āvāsa ṭṭhāna bhūtā devatā pana orambhāgiyānam
translated: Those who have arisen in the Suddhāvāsa planes are the Suddhāvāsika deities. But since the Suddhāvāsa planes are their dwelling place,

original: itaresañca saṃyojanānaṃ samucchinnaṭṭhena suddho āvāso vihāro etesanti suddhāvāsā.
analyzed: itaresam ca saṃyojanānam samucchinna ṭṭhena suddhaḥ āvāsaḥ vihāraḥ etesanti suddha āvāsā
translated: it is said, “the dwellers in the Suddhāvāsa planes.” Dwelling place means the place of dwelling. But the deities are called Suddhāvāsa because their dwelling place, their abode, is pure in the sense of being free from the fetters of the lower world and the other fetters.

original: Mahāsamāgamaṃ ñatvāti mahāsamāgamaṃ gatāti ñatvā.
analyzed: mahā samāgamam ñatvā ati mahā samāgamam gatā ati ñatvā
translated: Having known the great assembly: having gone to the great assembly.

original: Puratthimacakkavāḷamukhavaṭṭiyaṃ otari aññattha okāsaṃ alabhamāno. Evaṃ sesāpi. Maṇivammanti🔽indanīlamaṇimayaṃ kavacaṃ. Buddhānaṃ abhimukhabhāgo buddhavīthi, sā yāva cakkavāḷā🔽uttarituṃ na sakkā. Mahatiyā buddhavīthiyāvāti buddhānaṃ santikaṃ upasaṅkamantehi
analyzed: puratthima cakkavāḷa mukha vaṭṭiyam otari aññattha okāsam a labhamāno evam sesā api  inda nīla maṇi mayam kavacam buddhānam abhimukha bhāgaḥ buddhavīthi sā yāva cakkavāḷā  uttaritum na sakkā mahatiyā buddha vīthiyā avāti buddhānam santikam upasaṅkamantehi
translated: and he could not find room elsewhere, he descended on the eastern rim of the world-sphere and so on. ‘Jewel armour’ is🔽sapphire armour. The ‘Buddha-path’ is the part of the world-sphere that faces the Buddhas; it cannot be crossed beyond the rim of the world-sphere.

original: tehi devabrahmehi valañjitabuddhavīthiyāva.
analyzed: tehi devabrahmehi valañjita buddha vīthiyā ava
translated: ‘As far as the great Buddha-path’ means as far as the Buddha-path that is crowded with gods and Brahmas who are approaching the Buddhas.

original: Samiti saṅgati sannipāto samayo, mahanto samayo mahāsamayoti āha “mahāsamūho”ti.
analyzed: samiti saṅgati sannipātaḥ samayaḥ mahantaḥ samayaḥ mahā samayaḥ iti āha mahā samūhaḥ iti
translated: ‘Assembly’ is a gathering, a meeting, an occasion. ‘Great occasion’ is a great assembly.

original: Pavaddhaṃ vanaṃ pavananti āha “vanasaṇḍo”ti. Devaghaṭāti devasamūhā. Samādahaṃsūti🔽samāhitaṃ lokuttarasamādhiṃ suṭṭhu appitaṃ akaṃsu. Tathā samāhitaṃ pana samādhinā
analyzed: āha  samāhitam lokuttara samādhim suṭṭhu appitam tathā samāhitam pana samādhinā
translated: ‘Forest grove’ is a great forest. ‘Divine throngs’ are multitudes of gods. ‘They lit up’🔽they well lit up the world with the light of their own bodies, which was like a great mass of fire, like a great mass of stars, like a great mass of lightning, and like a great mass of gems.🔽‘They yoked with concentration’ means they well yoked the supramundane concentration that was well concentrated. But that which is well concentrated in this way is called ‘yoked with concentration.’

original: niyojitaṃ nāma hotīti vuttaṃ “samādhinā yojesu”nti. Sabbesaṃ gomuttavaṅkādīnaṃ dūrasamussāritattā
analyzed: niyojitam nāma hoti iti vuttam samādhinā yojesuḥ ti sabbesam gomutta vaṅka ādīnam dūra samussārita ttā
translated: ‘The cow’s horn’ is the cow’s horn. ‘The cow’s horn’ is the cow’s horn. ‘The cow’s horn’ is the cow’s horn. ‘The cow’s horn’ is the cow’s horn.

original: attano…pe… akariṃsu. Vinayati asse etehīti nettāni, yottāni. Avīthipaṭipannānaṃ assānaṃ
analyzed: akariṃsu vinayati asse etehi iti nettāni yottāni a vīthi paṭipannānam assānam
translated: The horses are guided by the reins when they are on the wrong course.

original: vīthipaṭipādanaṃ rasmiggahaṇena hotīti “yottāni gahetvā acodento”ti vatvā taṃ pana
analyzed: vīthi paṭipādanam rasmiggahaṇena hoti iti yottāni gahetvā a codentaḥ iti vatvā tam pana
translated: Therefore, after saying, “Having taken the reins,” he said, “without urging them on.”

original: acodanaṃ avāraṇamevāti āha “acodento avārento”ti.
analyzed: a codanam a vāraṇam eva ati āha a codentaḥ a vārentaḥ iti
translated: But that not urging on is the same as not restraining them. Therefore he said, “without urging them on, without restraining them.”

original: Yathā khīlaṃ bhittiyaṃ, bhūmiyaṃ vā ākoṭitaṃ dunnīharaṇaṃ, yathā ca palighaṃ nagarappavesanivāraṇaṃ,
analyzed: yathā khīlam bhittiyam bhūmiyam vā ākoṭitam dunnīharaṇam yathā ca paligham nagara ppavesa nivāraṇam
translated: Just as a post driven into a wall or the ground is hard to pull out, and just as a barrier is hard to enter,

original: yathā ca indakhīlaṃ gambhīranemi sunikhātaṃ dunnīharaṇaṃ, evaṃ rāgādayo sattasantānato
analyzed: yathā ca inda khīlam gambhīra nemi su nikhātam dunnīharaṇam evam rāga ādayaḥ satta santānataḥ
translated: and just as an axle-pin is hard to pull out because it is deeply embedded and well-driven in, so too, lust, etc., are hard to pull out from the continuity of beings,

original: dunnīharaṇā nibbānanagarappavesanivāraṇā cāti te “khīlaṃ palighaṃ indakhīla”nti ca🔽vuttā. Ūhaccāti uddharitvā. Taṇhāejāya abhāvena anejā. Paramasantuṭṭhabhāvena cātuddisattā
analyzed: dunnīharaṇāḥ nibbāna nagara pavesa nivāraṇā ca ati te khīlam paligham indakhīlanti ca  vuttāḥ uddharitvā abhāvena anejā parama santuṭṭha bhāvena cātuddisattā
translated: and they prevent entry into the city of Nibbāna. Therefore they are called “post,” “barrier,” and “axle-pin.”

original: appaṭihatacārikaṃ caranti. Buddhacakkhu-dhammacakkhu-dibbacakkhu-samantacakkhu-pakaticakkhūnaṃ
analyzed: a paṭihata cārikam caranti buddha cakkhu dhamma cakkhu dibba cakkhu samanta cakkhu pakati cakkhūnam
translated: Having pulled them out, he went. He is without lust because of the absence of the dart of lust. He is without hate because of the absence of the dart of hate. He is without delusion because of the absence of the dart of delusion. He is without craving because of the absence of the dart of craving. He is without defilements because of the absence of the dart of defilements. He is without grief because of the absence of the dart of grief. He is without fever because of the absence of the dart of fever. He is without distress because of the absence of the dart of distress. He is without agitation because of the absence of the dart of agitation. He is without doubt because of the absence of the dart of doubt. He is without uncertainty because of the absence of the dart of uncertainty. He is without vacillation because of the absence of the dart of vacillation. He is without wavering because of the absence of the dart of wavering. He is without oscillation because of the absence of the dart of oscillation. He is without trembling because of the absence of the dart of trembling. He is without quaking because of the absence of the dart of quaking. He is without shaking because of the absence of the dart of shaking. He is without agitation because of the absence of the dart of agitation. He is without trembling because of the absence of the dart of trembling. He is without quaking because of the absence of the dart of quaking. He is without shaking because of the absence of the dart of shaking. He is without agitation because of the absence of the dart of agitation. He is without

original: vasena pañcahi cakkhūhi. Sudantā kutoti āha “cakkhutopī”ti. Chandādīhīti chandādīnaṃ
analyzed: vasena pañcahi cakkhūhi su dantā kuto ti āha cakkhutaḥ pi iti chanda ādīhi iti chanda ādīnam
translated: “By means of the five eyes” . “Where are the well-tamed ones?” “In the eye-faculty, etc.” . “By means of desire, etc.”

original: vasena na gacchanti na vattanti. Na āgacchanti anuppādanato. Āgunti aparādhaṃ.
analyzed: vasena na gacchanti na vattanti na āgacchanti an uppādanataḥ aparādham
translated: “By means of the five eyes” . “Where are the well-tamed ones?” “In the eye-faculty” . “By means of desire, etc.” : they do not go by means of desire, etc. They do not come by way of non-arising. “Fault” : transgression.

original: Sabbasaṃyogāti vibhattilopena niddeso, sabbe saṃyogeti attho. Visajjāti visajjitvā. Evampīti imāyapi gāthāya vasena “āguṃ na karotī”ti pade.🔽Gatāseti gatā eva. Na gamissanti pariniṭṭhitasaraṇagamanattā. Lokuttarasaraṇagamanañhettha
analyzed: sabba saṃyogā iti vibhatti lopena niddesaḥ sabbe saṃyoge iti atthaḥ visajja ati visajjitvā evam pi iti gāthāya vasena āgum na karoti iti pade  gatā ase iti gatāḥ eva na gamissanti pariniṭṭhita saraṇa gamana ttā lokuttara saraṇa gamanam ha ittha
translated: “All bonds” : the demonstrative pronoun “all” is elided; the meaning is “all bonds” . “Dismissed” : dismissed. “In this way” : by means of this stanza, with regard to the words “does not commit a fault” .

original: adhippetaṃ. Tenāha “nibbematikasaraṇagamanena gatā”ti. Te hi niyamena apāyaṃ na gamissanti,🔽devakāyañca paripūressanti. Ye pana lokiyena saraṇagamanena buddhaṃ saraṇaṃ gatā,
analyzed: adhippetam tena āha nibbematika saraṇa gamanena gatā ati te hi niyamena apāyam na gamissanti  deva kāyam ca paripūressanti ye pana lokiyena saraṇa gamanena buddham saraṇam gatāḥ
translated: “Gone to” : gone to . They will not go by way of the fixed course of the round of rebirths, because they have gone for refuge. For here the going for refuge to the supramundane is intended. Therefore it is said: “They have gone by way of the going for refuge that is a fixed course of action” . For they will not go to the states of loss by way of the fixed course of the round of rebirths.

original: na te gamissanti apāyaṃ, sati ca paccayantarasamavāye pahāya mānusaṃ dehaṃ devakāyaṃ
analyzed: na te gamissanti apāyam sati ca paccaya antara samavāye pahāya mānusam deham deva kāyam
translated: They will fill up the deva-world. But those who have gone for refuge to the Buddha by way of the mundane going for refuge will not go to the states of loss. If they possess the requisite conditions, after abandoning the human body they will fill up the deva-world.

original: paripūressantīti. Tenāha so brahmā “ye keci buddhaṃ…pe… paripūressantī”ti.
analyzed: paripūressanti iti tena āha saḥ brahmā ye keci buddhaṃpe paripūressanti iti
translated: will be fulfilled. ’ Thus he said: ‘Whatever bhikkhus … will be fulfilled. ’

original: Samayasuttavaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: samaya sutta vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: The Commentary on the Sutta of the True Idea is ended.

original: 8. Sakalikasuttavaṇṇanā🔽38. Tanti uyyānaṃ saṅkhaṃ gatanti sambandho. Dhanunā sarena gahanti pothayanti bādhentīti🔽dhanuggahā. Taṃ sampaṭicchīti tassā silāya heṭṭhābhāgena uggantvā sampaṭicchi. Satthu🔽puññānubhāvena upahatattā sayampi paripatantī vātaṃ upatthambheti. Abhihani satthārā
analyzed: sakalika sutta vaṇṇanā  uyyānam saṅkham sambandhaḥ dhanunā sarena pothayanti bādhenti iti  dhanuggahā tam sampaṭicchi iti tassā silāya heṭṭhābhāgena uggantvā sampaṭicchi satthu  puñña anubhāvena upahata ttā sayam pi paripatantī vātam upatthambheti abhihani satthārā
translated: The Sutta on the Fire-stick

original: anāvajjitattā. Tañca kho kammaphalavasenāti daṭṭhabbaṃ. Tato eva tato paṭṭhāya bhagavato🔽aphāsu jātanti etenapi upādiṇṇakasarīre nāma aniṭṭhāpi samphassakā patanti eva tathārūpena
analyzed: an āvajjita ttā tat ca kho kamma phala vasena ati daṭṭhabbam tatas eva tatas paṭṭhāya bhagavataḥ  etena api upādiṇṇaka sarīre nāma aniṭṭhā api samphassakā patanti eva tathārūpena
translated: The construction is: ‘the park called Tinduka’. They are ‘ archers ’ because they take up and shoot and afflict with a bow . He consented to it: having risen up with the lower part of the rock he consented to it. Because it was affected by the Blessed One’s merit, it also, as it was falling, steadied the wind. It struck him: because the Blessed One did not advert to it. But that should be regarded as due to the fruit of kamma. From then on the Blessed One’s

original: kammunā katokāseti dasseti. Ayaṃ vihāroti gijjhakūṭavihāro. Ujjaṅgalo na kattabbaparo.
analyzed: kammunā kata ukāsaḥ iti dasse ti ayam vihāraḥ ti gijjhakūṭa vihāraḥ ujjaṅgalaḥ na kattabba paraḥ
translated: discomfort arose. This shows that even in a body that is clung to, undesirable contacts come about in the same way as desirable ones do, in the place made ready by such kamma as there is. This abode: the Vulture Peak abode. Ujjaṅgala is not a place to be made ready.

original: Visamoti bhūmibhāgavasena visamo. Sivikākārena sajjito mañco eva mañcasivikā.
analyzed: visamaḥ iti bhūmi bhāga vasena visamaḥ sivikā ākārena sajjitaḥ mañcaḥ eva mañca sivikā
translated: Uneven: uneven as to the ground. A couch with a mattress is a couch-mattress.

original: Bhusāti daḷhā. Dukkhāti dukkhamā duttitikkhā. Kharāti kakkasā. Kaṭukāti aniṭṭhā.
analyzed: bhusā ati daḷhā dukkhā ati dukkhamā duttitikkhā kharā ati kakkasā kaṭukā ati aniṭṭhā
translated: Firm: very firm. Painful: painful, with pain hard to endure. Rough: rough, with roughness hard to endure. Bitter: disagreeable.

original: Asātāti na sātā appiyā. Na appetīti na upeti. Na appāyantīti na khamanti. Vedanādhivāsanakhantiyā
analyzed: na sātā appiyā na appeti iti na upeti na appāyanti iti na khamanti vedanā adhivāsana khantiyā
translated: Not pleasant: not pleasant, not liked. Does not approach: does not approach. Does not endure: does not endure. Because of the presence of mindfulness and full awareness,🔽which are the opposite of the kind of endurance consisting in acquiescence in feelings.

original: satisampajaññayuttattā sabbasattaṭṭhitāhārasamudayavatthujātassa ādīnavanissaraṇānaṃ
analyzed: sati sampajañña yutta ttā sabba satta ṭṭhita āhāra samudaya vatthu jātassa ādīnava nissaraṇānaṃ
translated: And because of the complete understanding of the danger and the escape in the case of all the kinds of occurrence of the origin of nutriment for the maintenance of all beings,

original: pageva suppaṭividitattā yathā samudācāro cittaṃ nābhibhavati, evaṃ sammadeva upaṭṭhāpitasatisampajaññattā🔽vuttaṃ “vedanādhivāsana…pe… hutvā”ti. Apīḷiyamānoti abādhiyamāno. Kāmaṃ aniṭṭhāya
analyzed: pagā iva suppaṭividita ttā yathā samudācāraḥ cittam na abhibhavati evam sammat eva upaṭṭhāpita sati sampajañña ttā  vuttam hutvā iti a pīḷiyamānaḥ ati a bādhiyamānaḥ kāmam a niṭṭhāya
translated: the mind is properly maintained with mindfulness and full awareness so that it is not overcome by occurrence as it was previously.🔽That is why it is said: “Having endured … feelings” .🔽Not oppressed: not afflicted. Certainly, when he is touched by an unwanted feeling, he is not unoppressed by it. But because its basis is fully understood,

original: vedanāya phuṭṭho tāya apīḷiyamāno nāma natthi, pariññātavatthukattā pana tassā vase
analyzed: vedanāya phuṭṭhaḥ tāya apīḷiyamāno nāma natthi pariññāta vatthuka ttā pana tassā vase
translated: he does not fall into the power of that feeling.

original: avattamāno “avihaññamāno”ti vutto. Tenāha “samparivattasāyitāya vedanānaṃ vasaṃ agacchanto”ti.
analyzed: a vattamānaḥ a vihaññamānaḥ iti vuttaḥ tena āha samparivatta sāyi tāya vedanānam vasam a gacchantaḥ iti
translated: “Not turning round” is said for “not being hurt.” Hence he said: “not coming under the sway of feelings that have turned round.”

original: Sīhaseyyanti ettha sayanaṃ seyyā, sīhassa viya seyyā sīhaseyyā, taṃ sīhaseyyaṃ. Atha
analyzed: sīhaseyyanti ettha sayanam seyyā sīhassa viya seyyā sīhaseyyā tam sīhaseyyam atha
translated: “Lion-like posture”: here lying down is a “posture” (seyyā); a posture like that of a lion is a “lion-posture” . That is the lion-posture.

original: vā sīhaseyyanti seṭṭhaseyyaṃ uttamaseyyaṃ. Svāyamattho aṭṭhakathāyameva āgamissati.🔽“Vāmena passena sentī”ti evaṃ vuttā kāmabhogiseyyā. Dakkhiṇapassena sayāno nāma natthi
analyzed: vā sīha seyyanti seṭṭha seyyam uttama seyyam su ayam attho aṭṭhakathā ayam eva āgamissati  vāmena passena senti iti evam vuttā kāmabhogi seyyā dakkhiṇa passena sayānaḥ nāma natthi
translated: Or alternatively, “lion-posture” is the best posture, the supreme posture. This very meaning will come in the commentary.🔽The “sensualist’s posture” is mentioned in the way beginning, “They lie on their left side” . There is no one who lies on his right side

original: dakkhiṇahatthassa sarīraggahaṇādiyogakkhamato. Purisavasena cetaṃ vuttaṃ. Ekena passena🔽sayituṃ na sakkonti dukkhuppattito. Ayaṃ sīhaseyyāti ayaṃ yathāvuttā sīhaseyyā. Tejussadattāti
analyzed: dakkhiṇa hatthassa sarīra ggahaṇa ādi yogakkhamataḥ purisa vasena ca itam vuttam ekena passena  sayitum na sakkonti dukkha uppattitaḥ ayam sīhaseyyā ati ayam yathā vuttā sīhaseyyā tejussa dattā ati
translated: because the right hand is more useful in holding the body, etc. This is said from the man’s point of view. They cannot lie on one side

original: iminā sīhassa abhītabhāvaṃ dasseti. Bhīrukajātikā hi sesamigā attano āsayaṃ pavisitvā
analyzed: iminā sīhassa abhīta bhāvam dasseti bhīruka jātikāḥ hi sesa migāḥ attanaḥ āsayam pavisitvā
translated: because pain arises. This is the “lion-posture” . This is the lion-posture as described above. “With the confidence of one fearless like a lion” : this shows the lion’s fearless state. For other deer, which are timid by nature, enter their lairs🔽and

original: utrāsabahulā santāsapubbakaṃ yathā tathā sayanti, sīho pana abhirukabhāvato satokārī
analyzed: santāsa pubbakam yathā tathā sayanti sīhaḥ pana abhiruka bhāvato
translated: He lies down with much trembling and fear. But the lion, being fearless, lies down after first making a roar.

original: bhikkhu viya satiṃ upaṭṭhapetvāva sayati. Tenāha “dve purimapāde”tiādi. Purimapādeti🔽dakkhiṇapurimapāde vāmassa purimapādassa ṭhapanavasena dve purimapāde ekasmiṃ ṭhāne
analyzed: bhikkhu viya satim upaṭṭhapetvā ava sayati tena āha dve purima pāda itiādi purima pāda iti  dakkhiṇa purima pāde vāmassa purima pādassa ṭhapana vasena dve purima pāde ekasmin ṭhāne
translated: The bhikkhu lies down after first arousing mindfulness. Hence it is said: “He lies down in the first watch of the night and in the last watch of the night after arousing mindfulness.”🔽The first posture: he lies down after placing the two feet one on top of the other, placing the right foot on top of the left thigh.🔽The second posture: he lies down after placing the two feet one on top of the other, placing the left foot on top of the right thigh.🔽The third posture: he lies down on his right side, placing one foot on top of the other.🔽The fourth posture: he lies down on his left side, placing one foot on top of the other.

original: ṭhapetvā. Pacchimapādeti dve pacchimapāde. Vuttanayeneva idhāpi ekasmiṃ ṭhāne ṭhapanaṃ
analyzed: ṭhapetvā pacchima pāda iti dve pacchima pāde vutta nayena iva idha api ekasmin ṭhāne ṭhapanam
translated: The fifth posture: he lies down on his right side, placing one foot on top of the other, and he lies in the lion’s posture, which is suitable for a lion, a bull, or a universal monarch, but not for others.🔽The sixth posture: he lies down on his left side, placing one foot on top of the other, and he lies in the lion’s posture.

original: veditabbaṃ. Ṭhitokāsasallakkhaṇaṃ abhīrukabhāveneva. Sīsaṃ pana ukkhipitvātiādinā🔽vuttasīhakiriyā anutrāsapabujjhanaṃ viya abhīrukabhāvasiddhā dhammatāvasenevāti veditabbā.🔽Sīhavijambhitavijambhanaṃ ativelaṃ ekākārena ṭhapitānaṃ sarīrāvayavānaṃ gamanādikiriyāsu
analyzed: veditabbam ṭhita ukāsa sat lakkhaṇam abhīruka bhāvena iva sīsam pana ukkhipitvā iti ādinā  vutta sīha kiriyā anutrāsa pabujjhanam viya abhīruka bhāva siddhā dhamma tā vasena iva ati veditabbā  sīha vijambhita vijambhanam ativelam eka ākārena sarīra avayavānam gamana ādi kiriyāsu
translated: The seventh posture: he lies down on his right side, placing one foot on top of the other, and he lies in the lion’s posture.🔽The eighth posture: he lies down on his left side, placing one foot on top of the other, and he lies in the lion’s posture.🔽The ninth posture: he lies down on his right side, placing one foot on top of the other, and he lies in the lion’s posture.🔽The tenth posture: he lies down on his left side, placing one foot on top of the other, and he lies in the lion’s posture.🔽The eleventh posture: he lies down on his right side, placing one foot on top of the other, and he lies in the lion’s posture.🔽The twelfth posture: he lies down on his left side, placing one foot on top of the other, and he lies in the lion’s posture.

original: yoggabhāvāpādanatthaṃ. Tikkhattuṃ sīhanādanadanaṃ appesakkhamigajātapariharaṇatthaṃ.
analyzed: yogga bhāva āpādana tham tikkhattum sīha nāda nadanam appesakkha miga jāta pariharaṇa ttham
translated: The thirteenth posture: he lies down on his right side, placing one foot on top of the other, and he lies in the lion’s posture.🔽The fourteenth posture: he lies down on his left side, placing one foot on top of the other, and he lies in the lion’s

original: Seti abyāvaṭabhāvena pavattati etthāti seyyā, catutthajjhānameva seyyā catutthajjhānaseyyā.
analyzed: sā iti abyāvaṭa bhāvena pavattati ettha ati seyyā catuttha jhānam eva seyyā catuttha jhāna seyyā
translated: It is the best because it occurs with the least disturbance of the elements, thus it is the best posture ; the fourth jhāna itself is the best posture .

original: Kiṃ panettha taṃ catutthajjhānanti? Ānāpānacatutthajjhānaṃ. Tato hi vuṭṭhahitvā vipassanaṃ
analyzed: kim pana ittha tam catuttha jhānan ti āna apāna catuttha jhānam tatas hi vuṭṭhahitvā vipassanam
translated: But what is the fourth jhāna here? It is the fourth jhāna of in-breaths and out-breaths. For it is after emerging from that that the Tathāgata, having developed insight,

original: vaḍḍhetvā anukkamena aggamaggaṃ adhigantvā tathāgato jātoti. “Tayidaṃ padaṭṭhānaṃ
analyzed: vaḍḍhetvā anukkamena agga maggam adhigantvā tathāgataḥ jātaḥ iti tayā idam padaṭṭhānaṃ
translated: attained the supreme full enlightenment. So it is the basis for that.

original: nāma, na seyyā, tathāpi yasmā ‘catutthajjhānā vuṭṭhahitvā samanantaraṃ bhagavā parinibbāyī’ti🔽mahāparinibbāne āgataṃ. Tasmā lokiyacatutthajjhānasamāpatti eva tathāgataseyyā”ti🔽keci. Evaṃ sati parinibbānakālikāva tathāgataseyyāti āpajjati; na ca tathāgato lokiyacatutthajjhānasamāpajjanabahulo
analyzed: nāma na seyyā tathā api yasmā catuttha jhānā vuṭṭhahitvā samanantaram bhagavā parinibbāyi iti  mahāparinibbāne āgatam tasmā lokiya catuttha jhāna samāpatti eva tathāgata seyyā ati  evam sati parinibbāna kālikā ava tathāgata seyyā ti āpajjati na ca tathāgataḥ lokiya catuttha jjhāna samāpajjana bahulaḥ
translated: But it is not the best posture. Nevertheless, since it is said in the Mahāparinibbāna Sutta, “The Blessed One attained final Nibbāna immediately after emerging from the fourth jhāna” ,🔽some say that the Tathāgata’s posture is the attainment of the fourth jhāna of the sense sphere. But if that were so, it would follow that the Tathāgata’s posture was the fourth jhāna of the sense sphere only at the time of attaining final Nibbāna;

original: vihāsi. Aggaphalavasena pavattaṃ panettha catutthajjhānaṃ veditabbaṃ. Tattha yathā
analyzed: vihāsi agga phala vasena pavattam pana ittha catuttha jhānam veditabbam tattha yathā
translated: and the Tathāgata did not usually dwell in the attainment of the fourth jhāna of the sense sphere. But the fourth jhāna that occurs as the highest should be understood as intended here. And in that case,

original: sattānaṃ niddupagamalakkhaṇā seyyā bhavaṅgacittavasena hoti, sā ca nesaṃ paṭhamaṃ🔽jātisamanvayā yebhuyyavuttikā, evaṃ bhagavato ariyajātisamanvayaṃ yebhuyyavuttikaṃ
analyzed: sattānam niddupagama lakkhaṇā seyyā bhavaṅga citta vasena hoti sā ca na īsam paṭhamam  jāti samanvayāḥ yebhuyya vuttikāḥ evam bhagavataḥ ariya jāti samanvayam yebhuyya vuttikam
translated: The best is the characteristic of non-disturbance of beings, and it is by means of the life-continuum consciousness. And that is the majority in the case of those who are of noble birth. So the Blessed One’s noble birth was the majority in his case.

original: aggaphalabhūtaṃ catutthajjhānaṃ tathāgataseyyāti veditabbā. Sīhaseyyā nāma seṭṭhaseyyāti
analyzed: agga phala bhūtam catuttha jhānam tathāgataseyyā ati veditabbā sīhaseyyā nāma seṭṭha seyyā ati
translated: The Blessed One’s lying down is the best in the sense of being free from annoyance to beings, and it is in the form of the life-continuum consciousness. And that is in conformity with the noble birth of the Blessed One, and it is the most usual form of his lying down. So it should be understood that the Blessed One’s lying down in the fourth jhāna, which is the foremost fruit of the life of purity, is the best. The lion’s lying down is the best lying down, it is said.

original: āha “uttamaseyyā”ti.
analyzed: āha uttamaseyyā iti
translated: “The best lying down” is said.

original: “Kālaparicchedaṃ katvā yathāparicchedaṃ uṭṭhahissāmī”ti evaṃ tadā manasikārassa akatattā
analyzed: kāla paricchedam katvā yathāparicchedam uṭṭhahissāmi iti evam tadā manasikārassa a kata ttā
translated: Because he did not give attention to it at the time in this way, “I shall get up at such a time,”

original: pāḷiyaṃ “uṭṭhānasaññaṃ manasikaritvā”ti na vuttanti āha “uṭṭhānasaññanti panettha
analyzed: pāḷiyam uṭṭhāna saññam manasikaritvā iti na vuttanti āha uṭṭhāna saññam nti pana ittha
translated: “The perception of urgency” is not mentioned in the text, he says.

original: na vutta”nti. Tattha kāraṇamāha “gilānaseyyā hesā”ti. Sā hi cirakālappavattikā hoti.
analyzed: na vuttanti tattha kāraṇam āha gilāna seyyā ha isā ati sā hi cira kāla ppavattikā hoti
translated: Here is a reason: “Because it is a sick-room lying down.” For that is prolonged.

original: Visuṃ visuṃ rāsivasena anāgantvā ekajjhaṃ puñjavasena āgatattā vuttaṃ “sabbāpi tā”ti.
analyzed: visum visum rāsi vasena an āgantvā ekajjham puñja vasena āgata ttā vuttam sabbā api tā ti
translated: “All of it” is said because it has come together as merit without coming in separate groups as retinues.

original: Tenāha “sattasatā”ti. Vikāramattampīti vedanāya asahanavasena pavattanākāramattampi.
analyzed: tena āha satta satā ati vikāra mattam pi iti vedanāya asahana vasena pavattana ākāra mattam pi
translated: “Merely a change” is merely the mode of occurrence by way of the inability to bear feeling.

original: Susammaṭṭhakañcanaṃ viyāti sammaṭṭhasusajjitasuvaṇṇaṃ viya.
analyzed: su sammaṭṭha kañcanam viyāti sammaṭṭha su sajjita suvaṇṇam viya
translated: “Like well-polished gold” is like well-polished, well-prepared, well-refined gold.

original: Dhammālapananti asaṅkhārikasamuppannasabhāvālapanaṃ. Samullapitañhi ākārasamānavacanametaṃ.
analyzed: dhamma ālapanam ti asaṅkhārika samuppanna sabhāva ālapanam samullapitam hi ākāra samāna vacanam etam
translated: “The teaching of the Dhamma” is the teaching of the nature of the unconditioned, the uncompounded. For “to teach” is a word that is similar in form to “to arise.”

original: Nāgo viya vāti pavattatīti nāgavo. Tassa bhāvo nāgavatā. Vibhattilopena hesa niddeso,
analyzed: nāgaḥ viya vāti pavattati iti nāgavaḥ tassa bhāvaḥ nāgavatā vibhatti lopena ha esa niddesaḥ
translated: “Like a nāga” is like a nāga. The state of that is nāgavatā. This is a demonstrative with elision of the case ending.🔽The meaning is: “like a great nāga elephant.”

original: mahānāgahatthisadisatāyāti attho. Byattuparicaraṇaṭṭhenāti byattaṃ uparūpari attano
analyzed: mahā nāga hatthi sadisa tāya ati atthaḥ byattu paricaraṇa ṭṭhena ati byattam upari upari
translated: “For the purpose of service” is for the purpose of service above and beyond one’s own duties.

original: kiriyācaraṇena. Ājānīyoti sammāpatitaṃ dukkhaṃ sahanto attanā kātabbakiriyaṃ dhīro
analyzed: kiriyā ācaraṇena ājānīyo ti sammāpatitam dukkham sahantaḥ attanā kātabba kiriyam dhīro
translated: “The wise one” is the one who, bearing suffering that has arisen well, is the one who, having been heroic,

original: hutvā nitthārako. Kāraṇākāraṇajānanenāti niyyānikāniyyānikakaraṇañātatāya. Tenevaṭṭhenāti
analyzed: hutvā nitthārakaḥ kāraṇa akāraṇa jānanena ati niyyānika aniyyānika karaṇa ñāta tāya tena ivaṭṭhena ati
translated: having brought it to completion, is the one who has known the reason and the non-reason.

original: appaṭisamaṭṭheneva. “Mutto moceyya”ntiādi dhuravāhaṭṭhena. Nibbisevanaṭṭhenāti rāgādivisavigatabhāvena.
analyzed: appaṭisama ṭṭhena iva muttaḥ moceyya ntiādi dhura vāha ṭṭhena nibbisevana ṭṭhena ati rāga ādi visa vigata bhāvena
translated: “For the purpose of that” is for the purpose of that which is not equal. “The one who is freed should free” and so on is for the purpose of bearing the burden. “For the purpose of enjoyment” is for the purpose of enjoyment by way of being free from the poison of lust, etc.

original: Aniyamitāṇattīti anuddesikaṃ āṇāpanaṃ. Sāmaññakatopi samādhisaddo pakaraṇato idha🔽visesatthoti āha “samādhinti arahattaphalasamādhi”nti. Paṭippassaddhivasena sabbakilesehi🔽suṭṭhu vimuttanti suvimuttaṃ. Abhinataṃ nāma ārammaṇe abhimukhabhāvena pavattiyā.
analyzed: aniyamita āṇattī iti anuddesikam āṇāpanam sāmaññakataḥ pi samādhi saddo pakaraṇataḥ idha  visesa atthaḥ ti āha samādhinti arahatta phala samādhinti paṭippassaddhi vasena sabba kilesehi  suṭṭhu vimuttanti su vimuttam abhinatam nāma ārammaṇe abhimukha bhāvena pavattiyā
translated: Unrestrictedly: without specifying. The word concentration is used here in the sense of the special kind of concentration called “concentration as a divine abiding” .🔽Well liberated: well liberated from all defilements by the cessation of the five lower fetters.🔽Bent: bent on the object by occurring with the object in the act of bending towards it.🔽Unbent: unbent by occurring in the act of unbending away from it. The meaning is: turned away from it.🔽Not attained: not attained by the mundane jhānas.🔽Not reached: not reached by insight.

original: Apanataṃ apagamanavasena pavattiyā, vimukhatāyāti attho. Lokiyajjhānacittaṃ viya🔽vipassanā viya ca sasaṅkhārena sappayogena tadaṅgappahānavikkhambhanapahānavasena
analyzed: apanatam apagamana vasena pavattiyāḥ vimukha tāya ati atthaḥ lokiya jhāna cittam viya  vipassanā viya ca sa saṅkhārena sa payogena tad aṅga ppahāna vikkhambhana pahāna vasena
translated: Not arrived at: not arrived at by the abandoning of the defilements to be abandoned by the path of stream-entry.🔽Not established: not established by the abandoning of the defilements to be abandoned by the path of once-return.🔽Not penetrated: not penetrated by the abandoning of the defilements to be abandoned by the path of non-return.

original: ca vikkhambhetvā na adhigataṃ na ṭhapitaṃ, kiñcarahi kilesānaṃ sabbaso chinnatāyāti🔽āha “chinnattā vataṃ phalasamādhinā samāhita”nti. Atikkamitabbanti ācārātikkamavasena
analyzed: ca vikkhambhetvā na adhigatam na ṭhapitam kiñcarahi kilesānam sabbaso chinna tāya ati  āha chinna ttā vatam phala samādhinā samāhitanti atikkamitabbanti ācāra atikkama vasena
translated: Not fully reached: not fully reached by the abandoning of the defilements to be abandoned by the path of Arahantship.🔽Not fully known: not fully known by the abandoning of the defilements to be abandoned by the path of Arahantship.

original: laṅghitabbaṃ. Sā pana laṅghanā āsādanā ghaṭṭanāti āha “ghaṭṭetabba”nti.
analyzed: laṅghitabbam sā pana laṅghanā āsādanā ghaṭṭanā iti āha ghaṭṭetabbam iti
translated: Not transcended: not transcended by the abandoning of the defilements to be abandoned by the path of Arahantship.

original: Pañcavedā nāma – iruvedo, yajuvedo, sāmavedo, āthabbaṇavedo, itihāso cāti evaṃ itihāsapañcamānaṃ
analyzed: pañcavedāḥ nāma iruvedaḥ yajuvedo sāmavedaḥ āthabbaṇavedaḥ itihāsaḥ ca ati evam itihāsa pañcamānam
translated: The five Vedas are the Rgveda, the Yajurveda, the Samaveda, the Atharva veda, and the Itihasa as the fifth.🔽The word “wander” is said with the reversal of the words; the meaning is “they shine.”

original: vedānaṃ. “Cara”nti vacanavipallāsena vuttanti āha “carantā”ti, tapantāti attho. Hīnattarūpāti
analyzed: vedānam caranti vacana vipallāsena vuttanti āha carantā ati tapantā ati atthaḥ hīnatta rūpā ti
translated: They are of low disposition

original: hīnādhimuttikatāya nihīnacittasabhāvā. Vimuttikatāya abhāvato nibbānaṅgamā na honti.
analyzed: hīna adhimuttika tāya nihīna citta sabhāvāḥ vimuttika tāya abhāvataḥ nibbāna aṅgamāḥ na honti
translated: because of their low resolve. They are not in the way to Nibbāna because of the absence of liberation.🔽They are fallen because they are incapable of the work of attaining arahatship.

original: Arahattādhigamakammassa abhabbatāya parihīnatthā. Ajjhotthaṭāti abhibhūtā. Tādiseheva
analyzed: arahatta adhigama kammassa abhabba tāya parihīna atthā ajjhotthaṭā ati abhibhūtā tādisehi iva
translated: They are overcome by the thought

original: sīlehīti gosīlādīhi. Baddhāti samādapetvā pavattanavasena anubaddhā. Lūkhaṃ tapanti
analyzed: sīlehi iti go sīla ādīhi baddhā ati samādapetvā pavattana vasena anubaddhāḥ lūkham tapanti
translated: “They are bound by the thought of virtue, etc., by being bound to them in the sense of being engaged in them. They shine roughly

original: attakilamathānuyogaṃ. Taṃ pana ekadesena dassento “pañcātapatāpana”ntiādimāha. “Evaṃ
analyzed: tam pana eka desena dassento evam
translated: by the practice of self-mortification. But showing that by one part, he said, “the five austerities.”

original: paṭipannassa mokkho natthi, evaṃ paṭipannassa vaṭṭato mutti atthī”ti vadantī sā attato
analyzed: paṭipannassa mokkhaḥ natthi evam paṭipannassa vaṭṭataḥ mutti atthi iti vadantī sā attataḥ
translated: “There is no deliverance for one who practices thus; there is release from the round for one who practices thus.”

original: sāsanassa niyyānabhāvo kathito nāma hotīti āha “sāsanassa niyyānikabhāvaṃ kathentī”ti. Ādinti gāthādvayaṃ.
analyzed: sāsanassa niyyāna bhāvaḥ kathitaḥ nāma hoti iti āha sāsanassa niyyānika bhāvam kathenti iti ādin ti gāthā dvayam
translated: The beginning is the two verses.

original: Sakalikasuttavaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: sakalika sutta vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: The commentary on the Sakalikasutta is finished.

original: 9. Paṭhamapajjunnadhītusuttavaṇṇanā
translated: The first commentary on the Sutta of Pajjunna’s Daughter

original: 39. Cātumahārājikassāti cātumahārājikakāyikassa. Dhammo anubuddhoti catusaccadhammo
analyzed: cātumahārājikassa ati cātumahārājika kāyikassa dhammo anubuddho ti catu sacca dhammo
translated: The four great kings’ is the four great kings’ retinue. The Dhamma is understood. The Dhamma of the four truths

original: pariññeyyādibhāvassa anurūpato buddho. Paccakkhamevāti parapattiyā ahutvā attapaccakkhameva
analyzed: pariññeyya ādi bhāvassa anurūpataḥ buddhaḥ paccakkham eva ati para pattiyāḥ a hutvā atta paccakkham eva
translated: is understood in accordance with the state of being to be fully understood, etc. He knows by his own direct knowledge, not by the direct knowledge of another.

original: katvā jānāmi. Dhammaṃ garahantā nāma saddadosavasena vā atthadosavasena vā garaheyyunti🔽taṃ dassento “hīnakkhara…pe… kotivā”ti āha. Sā pana “tesaṃ vigarahā dummedhatāya
analyzed: katvā jānāmi dhammam garahantā nāma sadda dosa vasena vā attha dosa vasena vā garaheyyunti  tam dassentaḥ hīnakkharape kotivāti āha sā pana tesam vigarahā dummedha tāya
translated: Those who blame the Dhamma would blame it either because of a fault in the letter or because of a fault in the meaning.🔽Showing that, he said, “With a low syllable … up to … a koṭi.” But that devatā, showing that “their blame is due to their stupidity

original: mahānatthāvahāvā”ti dassentī devatā āha “dummedhā upenti roruva”nti. Visuṃ hotīti
analyzed: mahānatthā avahāvā ati dassentī devatāḥ āha dummedhāḥ upenti roruvanti visum hoti iti
translated: and is of great disadvantage,” said, “The stupid ones go and wail.” It is separate means

original: avīcimahānirayato visuṃ eva hoti. Khantiyāti ñāṇakhantiyā. Upasamenāti rāgādīnaṃ
analyzed: avīci mahānirayataḥ visum eva hoti khantiyā ati ñāṇa khantiyā upasamena ati
translated: it is separate from the Avīci Great Hell. By patience means by the patience of knowledge. He is appeased means he is appeased by the abandoning of greed, etc.

original: sabbaso vūpasamena. Tenāha “ruccitvā”tiādi.
analyzed: sabbasas vūpasamena tena āha ruccitvā atiādi
translated: and with complete peace. Hence ‘having approved’ is said.

original: Paṭhamapajjunnadhītusuttavaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
translated: The commentary on the first Discourse to Pajjunna’s Daughter is ended.

original: 10. Dutiyapajjunnadhītusuttavaṇṇanā
analyzed: dutiya pajjunnadhītu sutta vaṇṇanā
translated: The commentary on the second Discourse to Pajjunna’s Daughter🔽is begun.

original: 40. Buddhañca dhammañca namassamānāti buddhasubuddhataṃ dhammasudhammatañca ñatvā
analyzed: buddhañca dhammañca buddha su buddha tam dhamma su dhamma tañca ñatvā
translated: Honouring the Enlightened One and the True Idea: having known the Enlightened One’s well-enlightenedness and the True Idea’s well-taughtness,

original: tadubhayaṃ namassamānā. Yasmā buddhe ca dhamme ca pasanno saṅghe ca pasanno eva hoti
analyzed: tat ubhayam namassamānāḥ yasmai buddhe ca dhamme ca pasannaḥ saṅghe ca pasannaḥ eva hoti
translated: he honours both of them. Since he who is confirmed in the Enlightened One and the True Idea is also confirmed in the Community,

original: tassa suppaṭipattiyā vijānanato, tasmā so attho gāthāya ca-saddasaṅgahitoti dassento
analyzed: tassa suppaṭipattiyāḥ vijānanato tasmā so attho gāthāya ca sadda saṅgahito ti dassento
translated: because he knows that the latter’s practice is well-practised, therefore that meaning is included by the word ‘and’ in the stanza.

original: “ca-saddena saṅghañcā”ti āha atthavatiyoti lokiyalokuttaraatthasaṅgahitā lokiyakusalalokuttaramaggasaṅgaṇhanato.
analyzed: ca saddena saṅghan ca iti āha atthavatiyā iti lokiya lokuttara attha saṅgahitā lokiya kusala lokuttara magga saṅgaṇhanato
translated: So showing that, he said ‘and the Community as well’ . ‘Meaningful’ is included by mundane and supramundane meaning because it includes mundane-profitable and supramundane path.

original: Yaṃ dhammaṃ sā abhāsīti yaṃ tumhākaṃ dhammaṃ paṭivijjhitvā ṭhitā, sā mahākokanadā
analyzed: yam dhammam sā abhāsi iti yam tumhākam dhammam paṭivijjhitvā ṭhitā sā mahākokanadā
translated: The True Idea that she spoke: the True Idea that she, the Great Kokanada,🔽spoke in accordance with her own strength, having penetrated it for herself,

original: attano balānurūpaṃ abhāsi. Bahunāti nānappakārena. Pariyāyenāti kāraṇena. Tādisoti
analyzed: attanaḥ bala anurūpam abhāsi bahunā ati nānappakārena pariyāyena ati kāraṇena tādisaḥ ti
translated: in many a manner: in many a kind. In many a way: by means of a reason. Such as she:

original: tathārūpo tathāpaṭividdhasacco atthadhammādīsu kusalo ekekaṃ padampi udāharaṇahetunigamanāni
analyzed: tathārūpaḥ tathā paṭividdha saccaḥ attha dhamma ādīsu kusalaḥ ekekam padam pi udāharaṇa hetu nigamanāni
translated: He is such a one, and he is one who has penetrated the truth in this way. He is skilled in the meaning, the Dhamma, etc., and he can bring out each word, its illustration, reason, and conclusion.

original: nīharanto ācikkhati deseti paññapeti paṭhapeti vivarati vibhajati uttānīkaroti. Tenāha
analyzed: nīharantaḥ ācikkhati deseti paññapeti paṭhapeti vivarati vibhajati uttānīkaroti tena āha
translated: He explains, teaches, makes known, sets forth, reveals, expounds, and explains. Therefore it is said:

original: “ayaṃ bhagavā”tiādi. Etena ativiya vitthārakkhamo sugatadhammoti dasseti. Pariyāpuṭanti🔽parivattitaṃ. Evaṃ vitthārakkhamaṃ dhammaṃ yasmā devadhītā “saṃkhittamatthaṃ lapayissāmī”ti
analyzed: ayam bhagavā atiādi etena ativiya vitthāra khamo sugata dhammo ti dasseti pariyāpuṭanti  parivattitam evam vitthāra kkhamam dhammam yasmai deva dhītā saṃkhittam attham lapayissāmi iti
translated: “This Blessed One.” By this he shows that the Dhamma of the Well-Farer is extremely extensive. “He has turned over”:🔽he has revolved. Since the devaputta said, “I will speak the meaning in brief,”

original: avoca, tasmā vuttaṃ “tassattha”ntiādi.
analyzed: avoca tasmai vuttam tassa attha ntiādi
translated: the devaputta’s question is stated thus: “The meaning of that.”

original: Dutiyapajjunnadhītusuttavaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: dutiya pajjunnadhītu sutta vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: The commentary on the second poem of the Devaputta is finished.

original: Satullapakāyikavaggavaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.🔽5. Ādittavaggo
analyzed: sa tulla pakāyika vagga vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā  ā t itta vaggaḥ
translated: The commentary on the “Chapter on the Group of Six Hundred Verses” is finished.🔽The Chapter on the Burning

original: 1. Ādittasuttavaṇṇanā
analyzed: āditta sutta vaṇṇanā
translated: The Burning Discourse

original: 41. Sīsanti desanāpadeso, desanāya aññesupi vattabbesu kassacideva sīsabhāgena apadisanaṃ.
analyzed: sīsanti desanā apadesaḥ desanāya aññesu pi vattabbesu kassacid eva sīsa bhāgena apadisanam
translated: “Head”: the place of teaching, the designation of any one of the things to be taught by the designation of the head.

original: Tenāha “rāgādīhī”tiādi. Dānenāti attano santakassa paresaṃ pariccajanena. Taṃ pana
analyzed: tena āha rāga ādīhi itiādi dānena ati attanaḥ santakassa paresam pariccajanena tam pana
translated: Therefore it is said: “With greed, etc.” “By giving”: by relinquishing one’s own to others. But that

original: pariccajanaṃ cetanāya hotīti āha “dānacetanāyā”ti dānapuññacetanāti dānamayā puññacetanā🔽dāyakasseva hoti taṃsantatipariyāpannattā. Nīhatabhaṇḍakanti ādittagehato bahi nikkhāmitaṃ🔽bhaṇḍakaṃ. Etanti “dinnaṃ hotī”tiādivacanaṃ. Adinneti dānamukhe aniyuñjite bhoge.🔽“Antenā”ti jīvitassa anto adhippetoti āha “maraṇenā”ti. Mamāti pariggahitattā pariggahā,
analyzed: pariccajanam cetanāya hoti iti āha dāna cetanāya ati dāna puñña cetanā ati dāna mayā puñña cetanā  dāyakassa iva hoti tad santati pariyāpanna ttā nīhata bhaṇḍakanti āditta gehataḥ bahi nikkhāmitam  bhaṇḍakam dinnam hoti iti ādi vacanam a dinna iti dāna mukhe a niyuñjite bhoge  antena ati jīvitassa antaḥ adhippetaḥ ti āha maraṇena ati mama ati pariggahita ttā pariggahā
translated: “The intention to give” is the intention to give a gift, the intention to give merit.🔽It is only the giver’s that is so, because it is included in his continuity. “The goods that are removed” are goods that are taken out from the house to the threshold.🔽“This” refers to the words “is given.” “When not given” means when goods are not dedicated at the giving of a gift.🔽“At the end” is intended as the end of life. That is why he says “at death.” “What is owned” is what is appropriated because it is appropriated.

original: bhogā. Tepi kenaci ākārena vināsaṃ anupagatā maraṇena pahīyanti nāmāti vuttaṃ “corādīnaṃ🔽vasena avinaṭṭhabhoge”ti. Sobhanā aggabhūtā rūpādayo etthāti saggo, taṃ saggaṃ.🔽Ādittasuttavaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.🔽2. Kiṃdadasuttavaṇṇanā🔽42. Dve tīṇi bhattāni abhutvāti dve tayo vāre bhattāni abhuñjitvā. Uṭṭhātuṃ na sakkotīti
analyzed: bhogāḥ te api kenacid ākārena vināsam anupagatāḥ maraṇena pahīyanti nāma ati vuttam cora ādīnam 🔽vasena a vinaṭṭha bhogā iti sobhanāḥ agga bhūtāḥ rūpa ādayaḥ ettha ati saggo tam saggam 🔽āditta sutta vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā 🔽kiṃdada sutta vaṇṇanā 🔽dve tīṇi bhattāni a bhutvā ati dve tayaḥ vāre bhattāni a bhuñjitvā uṭṭhātum na sakkoti iti

original: uṭṭhātumpi na sakkotī, pageva aññaṃ sarīrena kātabbakiccaṃ dubbalabhāvato. Dubbalopi
analyzed: uṭṭhātum pi na sakkoti pagā iva aññam sarīrena kātabba kiccam dubbala bhāvataḥ dubbalaḥ api
translated: Even though he is weak,

original: hutvāti bhuñjanato pubbe dubbalo hutvā balasampanno hoti. Evaṃ byatirekato anvayato
analyzed: hutvā iti bhuñjanataḥ pubbe dubbalaḥ hutvā bala sampannaḥ hoti evam byatirekataḥ anvayataḥ
translated: after eating he becomes strong. Thus the Blessed One has said that nutriment is strong in the body both in the sense of excess and in the sense of continuity.

original: ca āhārassa sarīre balavataṃ āha. Yasmā annado dāyako paṭiggāhakassa balado hoti,🔽tasmā so āyatiṃ attano sarīre balado avināsavasena balassa rakkhako ca hoti. Tenāha
analyzed: ca āhārassa sarīre balavataṃ āha yasmai anna daḥ dāyakaḥ paṭiggāhakassa bala daḥ hoti  tasmā so āyatim attano sarīre bala do avināsa vasena balassa rakkhako ca hoti tena āha
translated: Since nutriment is a giver of strength to the recipient,

original: bhagavā – “balaṃ kho pana datvā balassa bhāgī hotī”ti sesapadesupi eseva nayo. Surūpopīti
analyzed: bhagavā balam kho pana da tvā balassa bhāgī hoti iti sesa padesu pi esa iva nayaḥ surūpaḥ api iti
translated: it is also a protector of strength in the future by not destroying it in his body. Hence the Blessed One said: “Having given strength, he becomes a partaker of strength” . The same method of explanation applies in the case of the remaining terms.🔽Even though he is handsome,

original: abhirūpopi. Virūpo hotīti bībhaccharūpo kopīnassa acchannattā. Idañca yānanti sāmaññato
analyzed: abhirūpaḥ api virūpaḥ hoti iti bībhaccha rūpaḥ kopīnassa a channa ttā idam ca yānanti sāmaññato
translated: he becomes ugly. Because of the concealment of his ugliness. And this vehicle,🔽which is mentioned in a general way,🔽is shown in its individual essence as a pair of sandals.

original: vuttaṃ. Upāhanāti sarūpato dasseti. Adukkhappatto hutvā yāti vattati etenāti yānanti
analyzed: vuttam upāhanāti sarūpataḥ dasseti adukkha ppattaḥ hutvā yāti vattati etena ati yānan ti
translated: He goes, he moves about, having attained non-suffering by means of this, thus it is a vehicle .

original: chattādīnampi yānabhāvo vutto. Tenāha “yānado sukhado hotī”ti. Cakkhudo nāma hoti
analyzed: chatta ādīnam pi yāna bhāvaḥ vuttaḥ tena āha yāna daḥ sukha daḥ hoti iti cakkhudaḥ nāma hoti
translated: The state of being a vehicle is mentioned also in the case of the sunshade, etc. Hence he said: “The vehicle is a giver of pleasure” . He is called one-eyed

original: cakkhunā kātabbakicce sahakārīkāraṇabhāvato dīpassa.
analyzed: cakkhunā kātabba kicce sahakārī kāraṇa bhāvataḥ dīpassa
translated: and it is a lamp for the eye in the sense of being a condition that is a co-arisen factor in the work of seeing.

original: “Sabbesaṃyeva balādīnaṃ dāyako hotī”ti saṅkhepato vuttaṃ atthaṃ vitthārato dassetuṃ
analyzed: sabbesam yeva bala ādīnam dāyakaḥ hoti iti saṅkhepataḥ vuttam attham vitthārataḥ dassetuṃ
translated: The meaning stated in brief as “he is the bestower of all the powers, etc.,” is illustrated in detail

original: “dve tayo gāme”tiādi vuttaṃ. Nisajjādivasena patissayitabbato patissayo, vihāro.🔽Pakkhittaṃ viya hoti parissamassa vinoditattā. Bahi vicarantassāti patissayaṃ alabhitvā
analyzed: dve tayo gāmā iti ādi vuttam nisajja ādi vasena patissayitabbataḥ patissayaḥ vihāro  pakkhittam viya hoti parissamassa vinodita ttā bahis vicarantassa ati patissayam a labhitvā
translated: by “two or three villages” , etc. A resting place is a dwelling because of the resting in it by sitting, etc.🔽It is as if it were thrown out because of the removal of the disturbance.🔽“Wandering outside” means wandering outside the monastery precincts without having obtained permission to do so.

original: bahi vivaṭaṅgaṇe vicarantassa. Jhāyatīti jhāyantaṃ hoti, kilamatīti attho. Sītuṇhādivirodhipaccayavasena
analyzed: bahi vivaṭaṅgaṇe vicarantassa jhāyati iti jhāyantam hoti kilamati iti attho sītuṇha ādi virodhi paccaya vasena
translated: “He meditates” : he is meditating; the meaning is that he is exhausted.

original: sasantāne visabhāgasantati, tabbipariyāyato sabhāgasantati veditabbā. Sukhaṃ nāma
analyzed: sa santāne visabhāga santati tad vipariyāyataḥ sa bhāga santati veditabbā sukham nāma
translated: The dissimilar continuity should be understood as the opposite of the similar continuity.🔽Pleasure is due to the avoidance of the conditions of pain and to the arising of the conditions of pleasure.

original: dukkhapaccayaparihārato sukhapaccayuppannato ca hoti, tadubhayaṃ patissayavasena
analyzed: dukkha paccaya parihārataḥ sukha paccaya uppannataḥ ca hoti tat ubhayam pati ssaya vasena
translated: He obtains both of these through the resting place.🔽Showing this, he said, “When he is wandering outside, his feet” , etc.

original: labhatīti dassento “bahi vicarantassa pāde”tiādimāha. Dhammapītisukhanti dhammapaccavekkhaṇena
analyzed: labhati iti dassentaḥ bahi vicarantassa pāda iti ādim āha dhamma pīti sukham ti dhamma paccavekkhaṇena
translated: The pleasure of equanimity in the Dhamma

original: uppannapītisukhaṃ. Upasamasukhanti kilesānaṃ vūpasamena pavattasukhaṃ. Nivātaṃ pihitavātapānaṃ
analyzed: uppanna pīti sukham upasama sukhanti kilesānam vūpasamena pavatta sukham nivātam pihita vāta pānam
translated: and the happiness and rapture that arise. The happiness of peace is the happiness that occurs with the stilling of defilements.🔽When he enters the inner room and closes the door, it becomes dark.

original: patissayaṃ pavisitvā dvāraṃ pidhāya ṭhitassa andhakāro hotīti vuttaṃ “kūpe otiṇṇo
analyzed: patissayam pavisitvā dvāram pidhāya ṭhitassa andhakāraḥ hoti iti vuttam kūpe otiṇṇaḥ
translated: He is like one who has fallen into a pit.

original: viya hotī”ti. Tenāha “mañcapīṭhādīni na paññāyantī”ti. Tayidaṃ bahisamāpannaparissamadosena,
analyzed: viya hoti iti tena āha mañca pīṭha ādīni na paññāyanti iti tayidam bahi samāpanna parissama dosena
translated: This is due to the fault of the outer darkness,🔽not to the fault of the inner room.

original: na ca patissayadosena. Tenāha “muhutta”ntiādi.
analyzed: na ca pati ssaya dosena tena āha muhutta ntiādi
translated: Therefore it is said, “for a moment.”

original: Na marati etenāti amaraṇaṃ, nibbānādhigamādayo. Tassa dānaṃ dhammūpadeso, taṃ deti.
analyzed: na marati etena ati amaraṇam nibbāna adhigama ādayaḥ tassa dānam dhamma upadesaḥ tam deti
translated: The attainment of Nibbāna, etc., is called “the deathless” because one does not die through it. He gives that,

original: Tenāha “yo dhammaṃ anusāsatī”ti. Tayidaṃ dhammānusāsanaṃ kathaṃ hotīti āha “aṭṭhakatha”ntiādi.
analyzed: tena āha yaḥ dhammam anusāsati iti tayā idam dhamma anusāsanam katham hoti iti āha aṭṭhakathā ntiādi
translated: Therefore it is said, “he who teaches the Dhamma.” How does this teaching of the Dhamma come about?🔽He explains the commentary, the meaning of the text of the undiscerned reading.

original: Aṭṭhakathaṃ kathetīti avivaṭapāṭhassa pāḷiyā atthasaṃvaṇṇanaṃ karotīti attho. Anadhītino
analyzed: aṭṭhakatham katheti iti avivaṭa pāṭhassa pāḷiyā attha saṃvaṇṇanam karoti iti atthaḥ anadhītino
translated: But to one who has not learned it, he recites the text.

original: pana pāḷiṃ vāceti. Tattha tattha gataṭṭhāne pucchitapañhaṃ vissajjeti, ayaṃ tāva
analyzed: pana pāḷim vācā iti tattha tattha gata ṭṭhāne pucchita pañham vissajjeti ayam tāva
translated: He answers the question asked at each point. This, first of all, is the

original: ganthadhuro, paṭipattivāsadhure pana kammaṭṭhānaṃ ācikkhati, ubhayesampi dhammassavanaṃ
analyzed: gantha dhuraḥ paṭipatti vāsa dhure pana kammaṭṭhānam ācikkhati ubhayesam pi dhammassavanam
translated: The one who is devoted to the texts teaches the meditation subject to the one who is devoted to practice. He makes him listen to the True Idea.

original: karoti. Sabbadānanti yathāvuttaāmisadānaṃ abhayadānaṃ. Dhammadānanti dhammadesanā.
analyzed: karoti sabba dānam ti yathā vutta āmisa dānam abhaya dānam dhamma dānam ti dhamma desanā
translated: All giving: the giving of material things already mentioned, and the giving of fearlessness and the giving of the True Idea.🔽Delight in the True Idea: delight in the True Idea of serenity and insight.

original: Dhammaratīti samathavipassanādhamme abhirati. Dhammarasoti saddhammasannissayaṃ pītipāmojjaṃ.
analyzed: dhamma ratī iti samatha vipassanā dhamme abhi rati dhamma rasaḥ ti saddhamma sannissayam pīti pāmojjam
translated: The True Idea as joy: joy based on the True Idea, that is, gladness and confidence.

original: Kiṃdadasuttavaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: kiṃdada sutta vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: The commentary on the Annasutta is ended.

original: 3. Annasuttavaṇṇanā🔽43. Patthentīti pihenti. Yatthassa upagamanaṃ loke pākaṭataraṃ ahosi, te udāharaṇavasena
analyzed: anna sutta vaṇṇanā  patthenti iti pihenti yatthassa upagamanam loke pākaṭataram te udāharaṇa vasena
translated: The food-eating bhikkhu🔽Is seeking: is seeking for.🔽He shows by an example where his going was most evident: “like the Elder Cittasamyutta-Sīvali and the rest.”

original: dassento “cittagahapatisīvalittherādike viyā”ti āha. Annanti annasaññito catubbidhopi
analyzed: dassento citta gahapati sīvali tthera ādike viya āti āha annam ti anna saññito catubbidhaḥ api
translated: Food: the four kinds of nutriment, which are called “food.”

original: paccayo. Sabbepi dāyake ekajjhaṃ gahetvā sāmaññato ekavasena “dāyakamevā”ti vuttaṃ,
analyzed: paccayaḥ sabbe api dāyake ekajjham gahetvā sāmaññato eka vasena dāyakam eva ati vuttam
translated: All givers are taken together and spoken of collectively as “givers” in the way beginning, “The giver of food is the giver of life” .🔽And as he said: “What spirit is there that would not delight in food?”

original: yathā cāha “ko nāma so yakkho, yaṃ annaṃ nābhinandatī”ti? Tattha yakkhoti satto.
analyzed: yathā ca āha kaḥ nāma saḥ yakkhaḥ yam annam na abhinandati iti tattha yakkhaḥ iti satto
translated: Herein, spirit is a being.

original: Sāmaññajotanā ca nāma yasmā puthuatthavisayā, tasmā “ye naṃ dadanti saddhāya, vippasannena
analyzed: ca nāma puthuattha visayā tasmai ye nam dadanti saddhāya vippasannena
translated: The simile of the light of the True Ideal is called the “light of the True Ideal” because it is the object of each individual’s own understanding. Therefore it is said: “They who give with faith, with serene heart,

original: cetasā. Tameva annaṃ bhajatī”ti vuttaṃ. Tattha ma-kāro padasandhikaro, te evāti attho.
analyzed: cetasā tam eva annam bhajati iti vuttam tattha makāraḥ pada sandhi karaḥ te eva ati attho
translated: That very food attends them” . Here the letter m is a ligature to be known as a mere link between words, the meaning being “they and that very food” .

original: Dāyakaṃ apariccajanameva anugacchati cakkaṃ viya kubbaraṃ.
analyzed: dāyakam a pariccajanam eva anugacchati cakkam viya kubbaram
translated: It attends the giver who does not abandon it, just as a wheel follows its hub.

original: Annasuttavaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: anna sutta vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: The Commentary on the Food Discourse is finished.

original: 4. Ekamūlasuttavaṇṇanā
analyzed: eka mūla sutta vaṇṇanā
translated: The Discourse on the Single Root

original: 44. Patiṭṭhaṭṭhena avijjāsaṅkhātaṃ ekaṃ mūlaṃ etissāti ekamūlā. Taṃ ekamūlaṃ. Yathā
analyzed: patiṭṭha ṭṭhena avijjā saṅkhātam ekam mūlam etissa ati eka mūlā tat eka mūlam yathā
translated: It is “single-rooted” because it goes to a single root called ignorance in the sense of a foundation. That single root is

original: saṃyojanīyesu assādānupassanāvasena taṇhāsamuppādo, evaṃ taṇhābhibhavavasena anavabodhoti
analyzed: saṃyojanīyesu assāda anupassanā vasena taṇhā samuppādaḥ evam taṇhā abhibhava vasena anavabodhaḥ ti
translated: just as the arising of craving by means of the contemplation of gratification in the case of what is subject to the fetters, so too, non-understanding by the domination of craving.

original: avijjā taṇhāya mūlaṃ, taṇhā ca avijjāya mūlaṃ. Ayañhi nayo upanissayatāvasena vutto,
analyzed: avijjā taṇhāya mūlam taṇhā ca avijjāya mūlam ayam hi nayaḥ upanissaya tā vasena vuttaḥ
translated: Thus ignorance is the root of craving and craving is the root of ignorance. This principle is stated in terms of decisive support,

original: sahajātavasena cāyaṃ aññamaññaṃ mūlabhāvo pākaṭoyeva. Idha pana imissaṃ gāthāyaṃ
analyzed: sahajāta vasena ca ayam aññamaññam mūla bhāvo idha pana imissam
translated: but the state of being a root of each other is evident in terms of conascence. But here in this stanza

original: adhippetā “ekamūla”nti sā taṇhā. Tattha yā bhavataṇhā, sā sassatadiṭṭhivasena āvaṭṭati
analyzed: adhippetāḥ eka mūlanti sā taṇhā tattha yā bhava taṇhā sā sassata diṭṭhi vasena āvaṭṭati
translated: Craving is intended here as the one root. Herein, craving for becoming revolves and turns by way of the eternalist view,🔽and craving for non-being by way of the annihilationist view. Thus it revolves twice.

original: parivattati, vibhavataṇhā ucchedadiṭṭhivasena, evaṃ dvirāvaṭṭaṃ. Sahajātakoṭiyāti🔽sahajātakoṭiyāpi, pageva sammuyhaṃ āpannassa pana vattamānāya taṇhāya balavabhāvena
analyzed: parivattati vibhava taṇhā uccheda diṭṭhi vasena evam dvis āvaṭṭam sahajāta koṭiyā iti  sahajāta koṭiyā api pagā iva sammuyham āpannassa pana vattamānāya taṇhāya balava bhāvena
translated: By the mode of conascence:🔽by the mode of conascence, and still more so by the mode of decisive support, since the state of being overwhelmed by craving is due to the strength of the craving that has arisen.

original: malīnatā siyā. Upanissayakoṭiyāti upanissayakoṭiyāva sahajātakoṭiyā asambhavato.
analyzed: malīna tā siyā upanissaya koṭiyā ati upanissaya koṭiyā ava sahajāta koṭiyā asambhavato
translated: By the mode of decisive support: only by the mode of decisive support, since the mode of conascence is impossible.

original: Pattharaṇaṭṭhānāti vitthatā hutvā pavattiṭṭhānabhūmi. Tenāha “tesu sā pattharatī”ti.
analyzed: pattharaṇa ṭṭhānā ati vitthatā hutvā pavatti ṭṭhāna bhūmi tena āha tesu sā pattharati iti
translated: By the mode of the place of projection: by the mode of the plane of occurrence of the craving that has become extended. Hence it is said: “It projects them.”

original: Samuddanaṭṭhena samuddo. Uttarituṃ asakkuṇeyyatāya patāya alaṃ pariyattoti pātālo,
analyzed: samudda naṭṭhena samuddaḥ uttaritum a sakkuṇeyya tāya alam pariyattaḥ iti pātālaḥ
translated: The ocean is so called because of its depth. The nether world is so called because it is a place where one cannot cross over, since it is a place where one is completely submerged.

original: ayaṃ pana pātālo viyāti pātālo. Tenāha “appatiṭṭhaṭṭhenā”ti. Agādhagambhīratāyāti attho.🔽Ekamūlasuttavaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.🔽5. Anomasuttavaṇṇanā
analyzed: ayam pana pātālaḥ viyāti tena āha appatiṭṭha ṭhena āti agādha gambhīra tāya ati attho 🔽ekamūla sutta vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā 🔽anoma sutta vaṇṇanā
translated: But this nether world is like that, thus it is a nether world. Hence it is said: “By the mode of non-foundation.” The meaning is: by the mode of unfathomable depth.

original: 45. Anomanāmanti anūnanāmaṃ. Guṇanemittikāni eva hi bhagavato nāmāni. Guṇānañcassa🔽paripuṇṇatāya anūnanāmanti āha “sabbaguṇasamannāgatattā”tiādi. Apica tathā tevijjo,🔽chaḷabhiññotiādīni nāmāni anomanāmāni na honti paricchinnavisayattā, bhagavato pana
