analyzed: anoma nāmanti anūna nāmam guṇa nemittikāni eva hi bhagavataḥ nāmāni  paripuṇṇa tāya anūna nāman ti āha sabba guṇa samannāgata tta atiādi api ca tathā tevijjaḥ  nāmāni anoma nāmāni na honti paricchinna visaya ttā bhagavataḥ pana
translated: “A name that is not deficient” is a name that is not less than it should be. For the Blessed One’s names are all expressive of his special qualities.

original: satthā, sabbaññū, sammāsambuddhotiādīni nāmāni anomanāmāni nāma mahāvisayattā anūnabhāvato.🔽Tenāha “avekallanāma”nti. Khandhantarādayoti khandhavisesādike. Ñāṇena yāthāvato
analyzed: satthā sabbaññū sammāsambuddhaḥ ti ādīni nāmāni anoma nāmāni nāma mahā visaya ttā anūna bhāvato  tena āha avekalla nāmanti khandha antara ādayaḥ ti khandha visesa ādike ñāṇena yāthāvato
translated: And because his qualities are complete, his name is not deficient. That is why it is said, “Because he possesses all the special qualities” and so on. Moreover, the names “one who has the three knowledges” and “one who has the six kinds of direct knowledge” are not names that are not deficient, because they are limited in scope. But the Blessed One’s names “the Teacher,” “the Omniscient One,” “the Fully Enlightened One” are names that are not deficient because they have a wide scope and are not less than they should be.🔽That is why it is said, “a name that is not deficient.” “In the sense of a different aggregate, etc.”: in the sense of a different kind of aggregate, etc. The meaning is that it is a state to be penetrated by knowledge in accordance with reality.

original: araṇīyaṭṭhena atthe. Anvayapaññādhigamāyāti lokuttarapaññāpaṭilābhāya. Paṭipadanti
analyzed: araṇīya ṭṭhena atthe anvaya paññā adhigamāya ati lokuttara paññā paṭilābhāya paṭipadanti
translated: “For the realization of the wisdom of discernment”: for the attainment of supramundane wisdom. The “way” is the way of serenity and insight.

original: samathavipassanāpaṭipadaṃ. Kilesakāmānaṃ vasena allīyitabbaṭṭhena kāmā eva ālayo.
analyzed: samatha vipassanā paṭipadam kilesa kāmānam vasena allīyitabba ṭṭhena kāmāḥ eva ālayaḥ
translated: Sensual desires are a “clinging” in the sense of being a place of attachment because of the sensual desires that are defilements.

original: Atītakāleyeva kamanataṃ gahetvā vuttaṃ “kamamāna”nti. Na etarahi tadabhāvatoti āha
analyzed: gahetvā vuttam na etarahi tad abhāvataḥ iti āha
translated: The words “sensual desires in the past” are said by taking the state of being desired in the past. But they are not present now, because they do not exist at present. Therefore it is said:

original: “atītaṃ pana upādāya idaṃ vutta”nti. Mahānubhāvatādinā mahantānaṃ.
analyzed: atītam pana upādāya idam vuttanti mahā anubhāva tā ādinā
translated: The Great Ones are so called because of their greatness in power, etc.

original: Anomasuttavaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: anoma sutta vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: The commentary on the Anomasutta is ended.

original: 6. Accharāsuttavaṇṇanā🔽46. “Accharāgaṇasaṅghuṭṭha”nti gāthā devaputtena yenādhippāyena gāyitā, so anupubbikathāya
analyzed: accharā sutta vaṇṇanā  gāthā devaputtena yena adhippāyena gāyitā saḥ anupubbi kathāya
translated: The Discussion of the Discourse on the Celestial Musicians🔽The verse “The celestial musicians’ concert” was sung by a devaputta with a certain intention. Since that cannot be understood without a connected explanation,

original: vinā na paññāyatīti taṃ āgamanato paṭṭhāya kathento “ayaṃ kira devaputto”tiādimāha.
analyzed: vinā na paññāyati iti tam āgamanataḥ paṭṭhāya kathentaḥ ayam kira deva putto ti ādim āha
translated: the commentator, beginning with the devaputta’s arrival, says: “This devaputta … .”

original: Tattha sāsaneti imasseva satthusāsane. Kammākammanti kammavinicchayaṃ. Atthapurekkhāratāya🔽appakiccatāya ca sallahukavuttiko. Sayanassa koṭṭhāsoti divasaṃ purimayāmañca bhāvanānuyogavasena🔽kilantakāyassa samassāsanatthaṃ seyyāya upagamanabhāgo anuññāto.
analyzed: tattha sāsana iti imassa eva satthu sāsane kamma akammanti kamma vinicchayam attha purekkhāra tāya  appa kicca tāya ca sat lahuka vuttikaḥ sayanassa koṭṭhāso ti divasam purima yāmam ca bhāvanā anuyoga vasena  kilanta kāyassa samassāsana ttham seyyāya upagamana bhāgaḥ anuññātaḥ
translated: Herein, in the Dispensation means in the Dispensation of this Teacher. The legal question means the question of a legal issue.🔽Because of his concern for welfare and his simplicity, he was easy to live with. The portion of his bed means the portion of his bed that was allowed him for lying down, for the purpose of refreshing his body, which was tired from the practice of meditation during the day and the first watch of the night.

original: Abbhantareti kucchiyaṃ bhattassa parittatāya satthakavātāti tikkhabhāvena satthakā
analyzed: abbhantare ti kucchiyam bhattassa paritta tāya satthaka vātā tikkha bhāvena satthakā
translated: The inside means the belly. Because of the smallness of his food, the wind in his belly was sharp

original: viya kantanakā vātā. Dhurasmiṃyevāti kilesamārena yuddhe eva. Vimuttāyatanasīse ṭhatvā
analyzed: viya kantanakāḥ vātāḥ kilesa mārena yuddhe eva vimutta āyatana sīse
translated: as the winds of the chariot. In the yoke-straps: in the battle with the defilement-Mara. Standing at the head of the place of liberation

original: dhammaṃ desento vā. Upanissayamandatāya aparipakkañāṇatāya āsavakkhayaṃ appatto kālaṃ
analyzed: dhammam desento vā upanissaya manda tāya a paripakka ñāṇa tāya āsava kkhayam a pattaḥ kālam
translated: and teaching the Dhamma. The meaning is: because of the weakness of the condition and the unripeness of his knowledge, he did not reach the destruction of the cankers,

original: katvāti yojanā. Upari ṭhitanti parikkhārabhāvena dibbadussūpari ṭhitaṃ. Tatheva aṭṭhāsīti🔽tāhi tathā vuttepi yathā tato pubbe, tatheva aṭṭhāsi. Suvaṇṇapaṭṭanti nibbuddhe paṭijinitvā
analyzed: katvā iti yojanā upari ṭhitanti parikkhāra bhāvena dibba dussū upari ṭhitam tathā iva aṭṭhāsi iti  tāhi tathā vutte api yathā tatas pubbe tathā iva aṭṭhāsi suvaṇṇapaṭṭanti nibbuddhe paṭijinitvā
translated: and died. Standing above: standing above the divine cloth in the role of a covering. Just as before:

original: laddhabbasuvaṇṇapaṭṭaṃ. Vītikkamassa akatattā asambhinneneva sīlena. Yasmā tasmiṃ
analyzed: laddhabba suvaṇṇa paṭṭam vītikkamassa a kata ttā a sambhinnena iva sīlena yasmai tasmin
translated: even though they said that, he stood just as before. A golden cloth: a golden cloth that was given after the Buddha had accepted it. With unbroken virtue: because he had not transgressed.

original: satthu santikaṃ āgacchante tāpi tena saddhiṃ āgamaṃsu tasmā “accharāsaṅghaparivuto”ti vuttaṃ.
analyzed: satthu santikam āgacchante tā api tena saddhim āgamaṃsu tasmai accharā saṅgha parivutaḥ iti vuttam
translated: Since they came with him when he went to the Teacher, it is said, “surrounded by a group of celestial nymphs.”

original: Saṅghositanti saṅgamma ghositaṃ, tattha tattha accharānaṃ gītasaddavasena ghositaṃ.
analyzed: saṅghositanti saṅgamma ghositam tattha tattha accharānam gīta sadda vasena ghositam
translated: Announced by the Community: announced by the Community, proclaimed here and there by the sound of the celestial nymphs’ singing.

original: Pisācagaṇaṃ katvā vadati acchandarāgatāya. Niyāmacittatāyāti sammattaniyāme ninnacittatāya.
analyzed: pisāca gaṇam katvā vadati a chanda rāga tāya niyāma citta tāya ati sammatta niyāme ninna citta tāya
translated: He speaks of them as a multitude of demons, because he is without lust and greed. ‘With a mind bent on the right path’ means with a mind bent on the noble path.

original: Garubhāvenāti tāsaṃ vase avattanato garuṭṭhānabhāvena. Yātrāti nibbānaṃ pati yātrā.
analyzed: garu bhāvena ati tāsam vase avattanataḥ garu ṭṭhāna bhāvena yātrā ati nibbānam yātrā
translated: ‘With a sense of urgency’ means with a sense of urgency in the sense of not being able to control himself in the face of those states. ‘Progress’ means progress towards nibbana.

original: Taṃ pana vaṭṭato niggamanaṃ hotīti āha “kathaṃ niggamanaṃ bhavissatī”ti.
analyzed: tam pana vaṭṭataḥ niggamanam hoti iti āha katham niggamanam bhavissati iti
translated: But that is the escape from the round of rebirths, and so he says: ‘How can there be an escape?’

original: Atisallekhatevāti ativiya kilesānaṃ sallekhitavuttiko. Akatābhinivesassāti bhāvanamananuyuttassa
analyzed: ati sallekha tā iva ati ativiya kilesānam sallekhita vuttikaḥ akata abhinivesassa ati bhāvanam ananuyuttassa
translated: ‘With a very sharp knife’ means with a very sharp knife of the destruction of defilements. ‘Without making a resolve’ means without being devoted to development.

original: anāraddhavipassakassa. Kārakassāti sugatovādakārakassa sammāpaṭipajjato. Suññatāvipassananti
analyzed: anāraddha vipassakassa kārakassa ati sugata ovāda kārakassa sammā paṭipajjato suñña tā vipassanam
translated: ‘Without having begun insight’ means without having begun the path of non-return. ‘For one who is doing’ means for one who is rightly practising, who is doing what the Good Goel says. ‘Insight into voidness’

original: suññatādīpanaṃ vipassanaṃ duccaritataṇhāya dūrīkaraṇena ekavihāritāya. Eko maggo
analyzed: suñña tā dīpanam vipassanam duccarita taṇhāya dūrīkaraṇena eka vihāri tāya ekaḥ maggo
translated: means insight that illuminates voidness, because of the state of dwelling alone by keeping far away the craving for misconduct. ‘There is only one path’

original: assāti lokuttaramaggo eva assa anāgato, pubbabhāgamaggo pana kataparicayoti attho.
analyzed: assa ati lokuttara maggaḥ eva assa anāgataḥ pubbabhāga maggaḥ pana kata paricayaḥ ti attho
translated: means that only the supramundane path is in the future, but the path of the preliminary stage is already familiarized.

original: Kāyavaṅkādīnanti kāyaduccaritādīnaṃ abhāvato samucchindanena anupalabbhanato. Natthi
analyzed: kāya vaṅka ādīnam ti kāya duccarita ādīnam abhāvataḥ samucchindanena anupalabbhanataḥ natthi
translated: ‘The crookedness of the body, etc.’ means that because of the absence of bodily misconduct, etc., they are cut off, and so are unobtainable.

original: ettha bhayaṃ, asmiṃ vā adhigate puggalassa natthi bhayanti abhayaṃ nāma. Saṃsārakantāraṃ
analyzed: ettha bhayam asmin vā adhigate puggalassa natthi bhayanti abhayam nāma saṃsāra kantāram
translated: Herein, there is no fear in him when this has been reached, thus it is “fearlessness” .

original: atikkamitvā nibbānasaṅkhātaṃ khemaṃ amataṭṭhānaṃ gamane sugatasārathinā susajjitayānabhāvato🔽ratho akūjanoti aṭṭhaṅgiko maggova adhippeto. Dhammato anapetatāya aparāparuppattiyā ca dhammacakkehi.
analyzed: atikkamitvā nibbāna saṅkhātam khemam amata ṭṭhānam gamane sugata sārathinā su sajjita yāna bhāvato  rathaḥ akūjanaḥ ti aṭṭhaṅgikaḥ maggaḥ uva adhippetaḥ dhammataḥ an apeta tāya apara apara uppattiyā ca dhamma cakkehi
translated: The vehicle that is well-yoked by the Good Goer for the journey to the place of the Deathless, called “Nibbāna,” after surmounting the wilderness of the round of rebirths,🔽is the eight-factored path itself, which is called “the well-yoked vehicle that does not break up” .🔽And since it is not to be surpassed in the dispensation, it is “the unsurpassed vehicle” .🔽The wheel is the wheel of the True Idea, which is the wheel of the eight factors of the path, since it is the means of crossing over the round of rebirths.

original: Ottappampi gahitameva avinābhāvā. Apālamboti avassayo. Parivāroti parikkhāro abhisaṅkharaṇato.🔽Maggassa karaṇaṭṭhāne dhammo tappariyāpannā sammādiṭṭhi. Aniccādivasenāti aniccānupassanādivasena.
analyzed: ottappam pi gahitam eva avinābhāvā apālambo ti avassayo parivāro ti parikkhāro abhisaṅkharaṇato  maggassa karaṇa ṭhāne dhammo tad pariyāpannā sammādiṭṭhi anicca ādi vasena ati anicca anupassanā ādi vasena
translated: The wheel of the True Idea is the wheel of the eight factors of the path, since it is the means of crossing over the round of rebirths.🔽The wheel of the True Idea is the wheel of the eight factors of the path, since it is the means of crossing over the round of rebirths.🔽The wheel of the True Idea is the wheel of the eight factors of the path, since it is the means of crossing over the round of rebirths.🔽The wheel of the True Idea is the wheel of the eight factors of the path, since it is the means of crossing over the round of rebirths.

original: Sodhitesu vajjhamānesu. Bhūmiladdhavaṭṭanti bhūmiladdhasaṅkhātaṃ vaṭṭaṃ. Tattha vipassanāya
analyzed: sodhitesu vajjhamānesu bhūmi laddha vaṭṭanti bhūmi laddha saṅkhātam vaṭṭam tattha vipassanāya
translated: The wheel of the True Idea is the wheel of the eight factors of the path, since it is the means of crossing over the round of rebirths.🔽The wheel of the True Idea is the wheel of the eight factors of the path, since it is the means of crossing over the round of rebirths.

original: pavattiṭṭhānabhāvato pañcakkhandhā bhūmi nāma, vaṭṭamayakammabhāvato tattha uppajjanārahaṃ
analyzed: pavatti ṭṭhāna bhāvataḥ pañca kkhandhā bhūmi nāma vaṭṭa maya kamma bhāvato tattha uppajjana arahaṃ
translated: The wheel of the True Idea is the wheel of the eight factors of the path, since it is the means of crossing over the round of rebirths.🔽The wheel of the True Idea is the wheel of the eight factors of the path, since it is the means of crossing over the round of rebirths.🔽The wheel of the True Idea is the wheel of the eight factors of the path, since it is the means of crossing over the round of rebirths.🔽The wheel of the True Idea is the wheel of the eight factors of the path, since it is the means of crossing over the round of rebirths.🔽The wheel of the True Idea is the wheel of the eight factors of the path, since it is the means of crossing over the round

original: kilesajātaṃ bhūmiladdhavaṭṭaṃ. Parijānamānāti paricchindanavasena samatikkamavasena
analyzed: kilesa jātam bhūmi laddha vaṭṭam parijānamānā ati paricchindana vasena samatikkama vasena
translated: The defilements are the growth, and the plane is the soil.🔽“Understanding”: discerning, surmounting,

original: jānamānā paṭivijjhantī.
analyzed: jānamānā paṭivijjhantī
translated: penetrating.

original: Kasmā devaputto sotāpattiphaleyeva patiṭṭhāsi, nanu ca sā desanā bhagavatā catumaggappadhānabhāvena pavattitāti āha “yathā hī”tiādi.
analyzed: kasmā devaputto sotāpatti phalā iya iva patiṭṭhāsi nanu ca sā desanā bhagavatā catu magga ppadhāna bhāvena pavattitā ti āha yathā hi itiādi
translated: Why was the god established only in the fruit of stream-entry? Was not that teaching given by the Exalted One as the practice of the four paths?

original: Accharāsuttavaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: accharā sutta vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: The commentary on the Accariya Sutta is finished.

original: 7. Vanaropasuttavaṇṇanā
analyzed: vanaropa sutta vaṇṇanā
translated: The commentary on the Vanaropa Sutta

original: 47. Kesanti sāmivasena vuttakasaddo “dhammaṭṭhā sīlasampannā”ti ettha paccattabahuvacanavasena
analyzed: kesanti sāmi vasena vuttaka saddaḥ dhammaṭṭhā sīla sampannā iti ettha paccatta bahuvacana vasena
translated: “Kesu”: the word “kesu,” which is in the locative case, should be changed to the plural nominative case, as in the passage “dhammaṭṭhā sīlasampannā” .🔽For the locative case is changed to the nominative case according to the meaning.

original: pariṇāmetabbo. Atthavasena hi vibhattivipariṇāmo. Ke janāti ettha vā vuttakesaddo🔽sīhavilokananayena ānetvā yojetabboti āha “ke dhammaṭṭhā, ke sīlasampannā”ti? Pucchatīti
analyzed: pariṇāmetabbaḥ attha vasena hi vibhatti vipariṇāmaḥ ke janāti ettha vā vutta kesaddaḥ  sīhavilokana nayena ānetvā yojetabbaḥ iti āha ke dhammaṭṭhā ke sīla sampannā ti pucchati iti
translated: “Kesu janesu”: the word “kesu,” which is in the locative case, should be changed to the plural nominative case, as in the passage “kesu janesu” .🔽It should be construed by the method of the lion’s look.🔽“Pucchati”: by this he gives the reason there.

original: iminā tattha kāraṇamāha. Phalādisampattiyā āramanti ettha sattāti ārāmo. Ārāme ropenti
analyzed: iminā tattha kāraṇam āha phala ādi sampattiyā āramanti ettha ārāmaḥ ārāme ropenti
translated: “Ārāmo”: beings resort to it for the attainment of the fruit, etc. They plant in the pleasure garden.

original: nipphādentīti ārāmaropā. Vanīyati chāyāsampattiyā bhajīyatīti vanaṃ. Tattha yaṃ upavanalakkhaṇaṃ
analyzed: nipphādenti iti ārāma ropāḥ vanīyati chāyā sampattiyā bhajīyati iti vanam tattha yam upavana lakkhaṇam
translated: and they are called “groves” because they are resorted to, that is, frequented, by the shade.🔽Herein, what is the characteristic of a pleasure park?

original: vanaṃ, taṃ ārāmaggahaṇeneva gahitanti tapovanalakkhaṇaṃ, taṃ dassento “sīmaṃ parikkhipitvā”tiādimāha.🔽Visameti udakacikkhallena visame padese. Pānīyaṃ pivanti etthāti papā, taṃ papaṃ.
analyzed: vanam tam ārāma ggahaṇena iva gahitanti tapovana lakkhaṇam tam dassentaḥ sīmam parikkhipitvā iti ādim āha  visama iti udaka cikkhallena visame padese pānīyam pivanti ettha ati papā tam papam
translated: and they are called “pleasure groves” because they give pleasure. A grove is so called because it is frequented, i.e. shaded, by people. Herein, a grove that has the characteristic of a pleasure grove is included by the mention of “pleasure groves,” so he mentions a grove that has the characteristic of an austerity grove with the words “having enclosed a boundary.”

original: Udakaṃ pīyati etthāti vā papā. Taḷākādīti ādi-saddena mātikaṃ saṅgaṇhāti.
analyzed: udakam pīyati ettha ati vā papā taḷāka ādi iti ādi saddena mātikam saṅgaṇhāti
translated: In uneven places: in places uneven with water-mud. A tank is so called because water is drunk there, or because water is drunk in it. By the word “etc.” in “tanks, etc.” he includes a lotus-pond.

original: Imamatthaṃ sandhāyāti iminā kammappathappattaṃ paṭikkhipati. Attanā katañhi puññaṃ
analyzed: imam attham sandhāya iti iminā kammappatha ppattam paṭikkhipati attanā katam hi puññam
translated: With reference to this meaning: he rejects the attainment of the kamma-path. For when one remembers merit done by oneself

original: anussarato taṃ ārabbha bahuṃ puññaṃ pasavati, na pana yathā kataṃ puññaṃ sayameva
analyzed: anussarataḥ tam ārabbha bahum puññam pasavati na pana yathā katam puññam sayam eva
translated: one generates much merit in connection with that, but the merit done does not increase by itself

original: pavaḍḍhati. Tasmiṃ dhamme ṭhitattāti tasmiṃ ārāmaropanādidhamme patiṭṭhitattā. Tenapi
analyzed: pavaḍḍhati tasmin dhamme ṭhita ttā ati tasmin ārāma ropana ādi dhamme patiṭṭhita ttā tena api
translated: as it was done. Because of his being established in that Dhamma: because of his being established in that Dhamma of planting pleasure groves, etc.

original: sīlena sampannattāti tena yathāvuttadhamme katasīle ṭhatvā ciṇṇena tadaññenapi kāyavācasikasaṃvaralakkhaṇena
analyzed: sīlena tena yathāvutta dhamme kata sīle ṭhatvā ciṇṇena tad aññena api kāya vācasika saṃvara lakkhaṇena
translated: “Endowed with virtue”: because of being endowed with virtue, with the virtue that has been undertaken and performed in the way stated above, with virtue that has the characteristic of restraint of body and speech,

original: sīlena samannāgatattā. Dasa kusalā dhammā pūrenti duccaritaparivajjanato. Sesaṃ vuttanayameva.
analyzed: sīlena samannāgata ttā dasa kusalāḥ dhammāḥ pūrenti duccarita parivajjanataḥ sesam vutta nayam eva
translated: and with the ten wholesome courses of action that are fulfilled by avoiding evil conduct. The rest is in the same way as before.

original: Vanaropasuttavaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: vanaropa sutta vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: The commentary on the Vanaropama Sutta is finished.

original: 8. Jetavanasuttavaṇṇanā
analyzed: jetavana sutta vaṇṇanā
translated: The commentary on the Jetavananivesa Sutta

original: 48. Esitaguṇattā esiyamānaguṇattā ca isī, asekkhā sekkhakalyāṇaputhujjanā ca. Isīnaṃ saṅgho isisaṅgho. Isisaṅghena nisevitaṃ. Tenāha “bhikkhusaṅghanisevita”nti.
analyzed: esita guṇattā esiyamāna guṇattā ca isī asekkhā sekkha kalyāṇa puthujjanā ca isīnam saṅghaḥ isi saṅghaḥ isi saṅghena nisevitam tena āha bhikkhu saṅgha nisevitam ti
translated: “Seers” are those who have seen the truths, and also those who are good in training and ordinary people. The “community of seers” is the community of seers. It is “frequented” by the community of seers. Therefore it is said: “frequented by the community of bhikkhus.”

original: Taṃ kārentassa gandhakuṭipāsādakūṭāgārādivasena siniddhasandacchāyarukkhalatāvasena
analyzed: tam kārentassa gandha kuṭi pāsāda kūṭāgāra ādi vasena siniddha sanda chāya rukkha latā vasena
translated: It is delightful, not shared by anyone else, because of the smooth and even shade of the sandalwood palace, the peaked pavilion, and so on, and because of the trees and creepers,

original: bhūmibhāgasampattiyā ca anaññasādhāraṇaṃ atiramaṇīyaṃ taṃ jetavanaṃ cittaṃ toseti,
analyzed: bhūmi bhāga sampattiyā ca anañña sādhāraṇam ati ramaṇīyam tam jetavanam cittam toseti
translated: and because of the excellence of the land. That Jetavana delights the mind.

original: tathā ariyānaṃ nivāsabhāvenapīti āha “evaṃ paṭhamagāthāya jetavanassa vaṇṇaṃ kathetvā”ti.
analyzed: tathā ariyānam nivāsa bhāvena api iti āha evam paṭhama gāthāya jetavanassa vaṇṇam kathetvā ati
translated: And because it is the abode of noble ones, it delights the mind in that way. Therefore it is said: “Having described the beauty of Jetavana in the first stanza.”

original: Tenāha bhagavā – “yattha arahanto viharanti, taṃ bhūmirāmaṇeyyaka”nti. Apacayagāmicetanā
analyzed: tena āha bhagavā yattha arahantaḥ viharanti tam apacaya gāmi cetanā
translated: Hence the Blessed One said: “Wherein the Arahants dwell, that is the place of the beauty of the earth” .🔽The intention that leads to diminution of the defilements is the cause of the purification of beings, since it leads to the exhaustion of kamma.

original: sattānaṃ visuddhiṃ āvahati kammakkhayāya saṃvattanatoti āha “kammanti maggacetanā”ti.
analyzed: sattānam visuddhim āvahati kamma kkhayāya saṃvattanato ti āha kamman ti magga cetanā ti
translated: Hence it is said: “Kamma is the intention of the path.”

original: Catunnaṃ ariyasaccānaṃ viditakaraṇaṭṭhena kilesānaṃ vijjhanaṭṭhena ca vijjā. Maggapaññā
analyzed: catunnam ariya saccānam vidita karaṇa ṭhena kilesānam vijjhana ṭṭhena ca vijjā magga paññā
translated: Knowledge is the path’s understanding, in the sense of making the four noble truths known and in the sense of penetrating the defilements.🔽Hence it is said: “Knowledge is the understanding of the path.”

original: sammādiṭṭhīti āha “vijjāti maggapaññā”ti. Samādhipakkhikā dhammā sammāvāyāmasatisamādhayo.
analyzed: sammādiṭṭhi iti āha vijjā ati magga paññā ati samādhi pakkhikāḥ dhammāḥ sammāvāyāma sati samādhayaḥ
translated: Right effort, right mindfulness, and right concentration are the factors of concentration.🔽Just as knowledge is a factor of knowledge, so concentration is a factor of concentration.

original: Yathā hi vijjāpi vijjābhāgiyā, evaṃ samādhipi samādhipakkhiko. Sīlaṃ etassa atthīti
analyzed: yathā hi vijjā api vijjā bhāgiyā evam samādhi pi samādhi pakkhiko sīlam etassa atthi iti
translated: He has virtue, thus he is virtuous.🔽Hence it is said: “For one established in virtue, life is fulfilled” .

original: sīlanti āha “sīle patiṭṭhitassa jīvitaṃ uttama”nti. Diṭṭhisaṅkappāti sammādiṭṭhisaṅkappā.🔽Tattha sammāsaṅkappassa sammādiṭṭhiyā upakārabhāvena vijjābhāvo vutto. Tathā hi so
analyzed: sīlanti āha sīle patiṭṭhitassa jīvitam uttaman ti diṭṭhi saṅkappā ti sammādiṭṭhi saṅkappā  tattha sammāsaṅkappassa sammādiṭṭhiyā upakāra bhāvena vijjā bhāvaḥ vuttaḥ tathā hi so
translated: Right view and right thought are the factors of view.🔽Herein, right thought is said to be a factor of knowledge by way of its assistance to right view.🔽For it is said to be included in the category of understanding.

original: paññākkhandhasaṅgahitoti vuccati. Yathā ca sammāsaṅkappādayo paññākkhandhasaṅgahitā,
analyzed: paññā kkhandha saṅgahito ti vuccati yathā ca sammāsaṅkappa ādayo paññā kkhandha saṅgahitā
translated: And just as right thought, etc., are included in the category of understanding,

original: evaṃ vāyāmasatiyo samādhikkhandhasaṅgahitāti āha “vāyāmasatisamādhayo”ti. Dhammoti
analyzed: evam vāyāma satiyaḥ samādhi kkhandha saṅgahitā ti āha vāyāma sati samādhayaḥ ti dhammaḥ ti
translated: and the energy and mindfulness associated with it are included in the concentration aggregate. That is why he said “energy, mindfulness, and concentration.”🔽For the word “state” here signifies concentration, as in the passage, “Those Blessed Ones had such states” .

original: hi idha samādhi adhippeto “evaṃdhammā te bhagavanto ahesu”ntiādīsu viya. Vācākammantājīvāti
analyzed: hi idha samādhi adhippeto evaṃdhammā te bhagavantaḥ ahesun tiādīsu viya
translated: Speech, action, and livelihood:

original: sammāvācākammantājīvā. Maggapariyāpannā eva hete saṅgahitā. Tenāha “etena aṭṭhaṅgikamaggenā”ti.
analyzed: sammā vācā kammanta ājīvāḥ magga pariyāpannāḥ eva ha ete saṅgahitā tena āha etena aṭṭhaṅgika maggena ati
translated: right speech, right action, and right livelihood. Only those that are included in the path are intended here. That is why he said “by means of the Noble Eightfold Path.”

original: Upāyena vidhinā ariyamaggo bhāvetabbo. Tenāha “samādhipakkhiyadhamma”nti. Sammāsamādhipakkhiyaṃ
analyzed: upāyena vidhinā ariya maggaḥ bhāvetabbaḥ tena āha samādhi pakkhiya dhamman ti sammāsamādhi pakkhiyam
translated: The Noble Eightfold Path should be developed by means of the right method, the right way. That is why he said “the states that are on the side of concentration.”

original: vipassanādhammañceva maggadhammañca. “Ariyaṃ vo, bhikkhave, sammāsamādhiṃ desessāmi
analyzed: vipassanā dhammañca iva magga dhammañca ariyam vaḥ bhikkhave sammāsamādhim desessāmi
translated: The states that are on the side of right concentration, both the states of insight and the states of the path. For it is said: “Bhikkhus, I will teach you the Noble Eightfold Path,

original: saupanisaṃ saparikkhāra”nti hi vacanato sammādiṭṭhiādayo maggadhammā sammāsamādhiparikkhārā.🔽Vicineyyāti vīmaṃseyya, bhāveyyāti attho. Tatthāti hetumhi bhummavacanaṃ. Ariyamaggahetukā
analyzed: sa aupanisam sa parikkhāran ti hi vacanato sammādiṭṭhi ādayaḥ magga dhammā sammāsamādhi parikkhārā 🔽vicineyya ati vīmaṃseyya bhāveyya ati attho tattha ati hetumhi bhumma vacanam ariya magga hetukā
translated: with its supports and its requisites” . And the states of the path beginning with right view are the requisites of right concentration.

original: hi sattānaṃ visuddhi. Tenāha “tasmiṃ ariyamagge visujjhatī”ti. Pañcakkhandhadhammaṃ
analyzed: hi sattānam tena āha tasmin ariya magge visujjhati iti pañca kkhandha dhammam
translated: for the purification of beings. Hence he said “in the Noble Path it is purified.”🔽He should discern the five aggregates of the present moment: he should see them with insight.

original: vicineyyāti paccuppanne pañcakkhandhe vipasseyya. Tesu vipassiyamānesu vipassanāya
analyzed: vicineyya ati paccuppanne pañca kkhandhe vipasseyya tesu vipassiyamānesu vipassanāya
translated: When he sees them, when insight has reached the stage of the “runner,”

original: ukkaṃsagatāya yadaggena dukkhasaccaṃ pariññāpaṭivedhena paṭivijjhīyati, tadaggena
analyzed: ukkaṃsa gatāya yad aggena dukkha saccam pariññā paṭivedhena paṭivijjhīyati tad aggena
translated: then the truth of suffering is penetrated with the penetration of full understanding as abandoning.

original: samudayasaccaṃ pahānapaṭivedhena paṭivijjhīyati, nirodhasaccaṃ sacchikiriyāpaṭivedhena,
analyzed: samudaya saccam pahāna paṭivedhena paṭivijjhīyati nirodha saccam sacchikiriyā paṭivedhena
translated: Then the truth of origin is penetrated with the penetration of giving up, the truth of cessation with the penetration of realizing,

original: maggasaccaṃ bhāvanāpaṭivedhena paṭivijjhīyatīti evaṃ tesu catūsu saccesu visujjhatīti
analyzed: magga saccam bhāvanā paṭivedhena paṭivijjhīyati iti evam tesu catūsu saccesu visujjhati iti
translated: and the truth of the path with the penetration of developing. Thus he is purified in the four truths.

original: imasmiṃ pakkhe nimittatthe eva bhummaṃ, tesu saccesu paṭivijjhiyamānesūti attho.🔽Avadhāraṇavacananti vavatthāpanavacanaṃ, avadhāraṇanti attho. “Sāriputtovā”ti ca
analyzed: imasmin pakkhe nimitta atthe eva bhummam tesu saccesu paṭivijjhiyamānesu iti atthaḥ  avadhāraṇa vacanam ti vavatthāpana vacanam avadhāraṇam ti attho sāriputtaḥ uvāti ca
translated: In this section the locative case has the meaning of a locative of location, the meaning being “in those truths.”🔽The word “only” is a restrictive word, and the meaning of “only” is “exclusively.”

original: avadhāraṇaṃ sāvakesu sāriputtova seyyoti imamatthaṃ dīpeti tassevukkaṃsabhāvato.
analyzed: avadhāraṇam sāvakesu sāriputtaḥ uva seyyaḥ ti imam attham dīpeti tassa iva ukkaṃsa bhāvataḥ
translated: “Sāriputta” is a restrictive statement. It shows the meaning that among disciples Sāriputta is the best. This is because of his excellence in insight.

original: Kilesaupasamenāti iminā mahātherassa tādiso kilesavūpasamoti dasseti. Tassa sāvakavisaye
analyzed: kilesa opasamena iti iminā mahā therassa tādisaḥ kilesa vūpasamaḥ ti dasseti tassa sāvaka visaye
translated: By “with defilements quite suppressed” he shows that the Elder’s defilements were suppressed in such a way that🔽he reached the perfection of understanding in the disciple’s field.

original: paññāya pāramippatti ahosi. Yadi evaṃ “yopi pāraṅgato bhikkhu, etāvaparamo siyā”ti
analyzed: paññāya pārami ppatti ahosi yadi evam yaḥ api pāraṅgataḥ bhikkhu etau aparamaḥ siyāti
translated: If it is so, then this statement “Even one who has gone beyond, a bhikkhu, might be no more than this”

original: idaṃ tesaṃ buddhānaṃ ñāṇavisaye paññāpāramippattānaṃ vaseneva vuttanti daṭṭhabbaṃ.
analyzed: idam tesam buddhānam ñāṇa visaye paññāpārami ppattānam vasena iva vuttan ti daṭṭhabbam
translated: should be regarded as made with reference to those Buddhas who have reached the perfection of understanding in the field of their own knowledge.

original: Avadhāraṇampi vimuttiyā nānattā tīhi vimuttīhi pāraṅgate sandhāyetaṃ vuttaṃ. Tenāha🔽– “pāraṃ gatoti nibbānaṃ gato”tiādi. Na therena uttaritaro nāma atthi labbhati, labbhati
analyzed: avadhāraṇam pi vimuttiyāḥ nānattā tīhi vimuttīhi pāraṅga te sandhāya itam vuttam tena āha  pāram gataḥ ti nibbānam gataḥ itiādi na therena uttaritaraḥ nāma atthi labbhati labbhati
translated: The limitation is made with reference to those who have gone beyond by means of the three kinds of deliverance because of the diversity of deliverance. Hence it is said:

original: ce, evameva labbheyyāti adhippāyo.
analyzed: ce evam eva labbheyya ati adhippāyaḥ
translated: “Gone beyond: gone to Nibbāna” . There is no one higher than the Elder, and if there were, he would be able to do it in the same way. This is the meaning.

original: Jetavanasuttavaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: jetavana sutta vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: The commentary on the Jetavana Sutta is ended.

original: 9. Maccharisuttavaṇṇanā
translated: The Commentary on the Macchariyasutta

original: 49. Maccharinoti maccheravanto maccherasamaṅginoti āha “maccherena samannāgatā”ti.
analyzed: maccharinā iti maccheravantaḥ macchera samaṅginā iti āha maccherena samannāgatā iti
translated: “Stingy” : avaricious, possessed of avarice. He says “endowed with avarice” .

original: Maccheraṃ macchariyanti atthato ekaṃ. Na vandatīti vandanamattampi na karoti, kuto
analyzed: maccheram macchariyanti atthatas ekam na vandati iti vandana mattam pi na karoti kutas
translated: Avarice and stinginess are the same in meaning. “Does not pay homage” : does not even pay homage, much less

original: dānanti adhippāyo. Upaṭṭhānaṃ kātunti madhurapaṭisanthāraṃ karotīti yojanā. Idaṃ🔽tāva mudumacchariyaṃ na hadayaṃ viya attānaṃ dassentassa macchariyanti katvā. Kiṃ🔽tuyhaṃ pādā rujjanti nanu tuyhaṃyeva āgatagamanesu pādā rujjanti, kinte ime chindantīti🔽adhippāyo. Sāmīcimpi na karoti kuto dānanti adhippāyo. Yathākammaṃ taṃtaṃgatiyo aranti🔽upagacchantīti ariyā, sattā. Ime pana kucchitā ariyāti kadariyā, thaddhamaccharino.🔽Macchariyasadisañhi kucchitaṃ sabbahīnaṃ natthi sabbaguṇābhibhūtattā bhogasampattiādisabbasampattīnaṃ
analyzed: dānam ti adhippāyaḥ upaṭṭhānam kātum ti madhura paṭisanthāram karoti iti yojanā idam  tāva mudumat śariyam na hadayam viya attānam dassentassa mad śariyanti katvā kim  tuyham pādāḥ rujjanti nanu tuyhaṃyā iva āgata gamanesu pādāḥ rujjanti kinte ime chindanti iti  adhippāyaḥ na karoti kutas dānam ti adhippāyaḥ yathākammam taṃ taṃ gatiyaḥ aranti  upagacchanti iti ariyā sattā ime pana kucchitāḥ  macchariya sadisam hi kucchitam sabba hīnam na atthi sabba guṇa abhibhūta ttā bhoga sampatti ādi sabba sampattīnam
translated: The meaning is: “I am not stingy.” The meaning is: “I am not stingy.” The meaning is: “I am not stingy.” The meaning is: “I am not stingy.” The meaning is: “I am not stingy.” The meaning is: “I am not stingy.” The meaning is: “I am not stingy.” The meaning is: “I am not stingy.” The meaning is: “I am not stingy.” The meaning is: “I am not stingy.” The meaning is: “I am not stingy.” The meaning is: “I am not stingy.” The meaning is: “I am not stingy.” The meaning is: “I am not stingy.” The meaning is: “I am not stingy.” The meaning is: “I am not stingy.” The meaning is: “I am not stingy.” The meaning is: “I am not stingy.” The meaning is: “I am not stingy.” The meaning is: “I am not stingy.” The meaning is: “I am not stingy.” The meaning is: “I am not stingy.” The meaning is: “I am not stingy.” The meaning is: “I am not stingy.” The meaning is: “I am not stingy.” The meaning is: “I am not stingy.” The meaning is: “I am not stingy.” The meaning is: “I am not stingy.” The meaning is: “I am not stingy.” The meaning is: “I am not stingy.” The meaning is: “I am not stingy.” The meaning is: “I am not stingy.” The meaning is: “I am not stingy.” The meaning is: “I am not stingy.” The meaning is: “I am not stingy.” The meaning is: “I am not stingy.” The meaning is: “I am not stingy.” The meaning is: “I am not stingy.” The meaning is: “I am not stingy.” The meaning is: “I am not stingy.” The meaning is: “I am not stingy.” The meaning is: “I am not stingy.” The meaning is: “I am not stingy.” The meaning is: “I am not stingy.” The meaning is: “I am not stingy.” The meaning is: “I am not stingy.” The meaning is: “I

original: mūlabhūtassa dānassa nisedhato. Itiādīhi vacanehi. Attano upaghātakoti macchariyānuyogena🔽kusaladhammānaṃ gatisampattiyā ca vināsako.
analyzed: mūla bhūtassa dānassa nisedhataḥ iti ādīhi vacanehi attanaḥ upaghātako ti macchariya anuyogena 🔽kusala dhammānam gati sampattiyā ca vināsakaḥ
translated: The meaning is: “I am not stingy.” The meaning is: “I am not stingy.” The meaning is: “I am not stingy.” The meaning is: “I am not stingy.” The meaning is: “I am not stingy.” The meaning is: “I am not stingy.” The meaning is: “I am not stingy.” The meaning is: “I am not stingy.” The meaning is: “I am not stingy.” The meaning is: “I am not stingy.” The meaning is: “I am not stingy.” The meaning is: “I am not stingy.” The meaning is: “I am not stingy.” The meaning is: “I am not stingy.” The meaning is: “I am not stingy.” The meaning is: “I am not stingy.” The meaning is: “I am not stingy.” The meaning is: “I am not stingy.” The meaning is: “I am not stingy.” The meaning is: “I am not stingy.” The meaning is: “I am not stingy.” The meaning is: “I am not stingy.” The meaning is: “I am not stingy.” The meaning is: “I am not stingy.” The meaning is: “I am not stingy.” The meaning is: “I am not stingy.” The meaning is: “I am not stingy.” The meaning is: “I am not stingy.” The meaning is: “I am not stingy.” The meaning is: “I am not stingy.” The meaning is: “I am not stingy.” The meaning is: “I am not stingy.” The meaning is: “I am not stingy.” The meaning is: “I am not stingy.” The meaning is: “I am not stingy.” The meaning is: “I am not stingy.” The meaning is: “I am not stingy.” The meaning is: “I am not stingy.” The meaning is: “I am not stingy.” The meaning is: “I am not stingy.” The meaning is: “I am not stingy.” The meaning is: “I am not stingy.” The meaning is: “I am not stingy.” The meaning is: “I am not stingy.” The meaning is: “I am not stingy.” The meaning is: “I am not stingy.” The meaning is: “I

original: Puññapāpavasena samparetabbato upagantabbato samparāyo, paraloko. Kāmaguṇaratīti
analyzed: puñña pāpa vasena samparetabbato upagantabbato samparāyo para loko kāma guṇa rati iti
translated: “The other world” is so called because it is to be reached by passing over the present existence, or because it is to be reached by passing over the good and bad kamma .🔽“Delight in the strands of sensual pleasure” is the enjoyment based on the strands of sensual pleasure.

original: kāmaguṇasannissayo assādo. Khiḍḍāti kāyikakhiḍḍā vācasikakhiḍḍā cetasikakhiḍḍāti
analyzed: kāma guṇa sannissayaḥ assādaḥ khiḍḍā ati kāyika khiḍḍā vācasika khiḍḍā cetasika khiḍḍā ati
translated: “Amusements” are threefold: bodily, verbal, and mental.🔽“This is the result” is the gain of profit from cloth, etc.

original: evaṃ tividhā. Esa vipākoti coḷādīnaṃ kicchalābhoti esa evarūpo vipāko. Yamalokanti
analyzed: evam tividhā vipākaḥ iti coḷa ādīnam esaḥ evarūpaḥ vipākaḥ
translated: “The two worlds” is the other world.

original: paralokaṃ. Upapajjareti ettha iti-saddo pakārattho. Tena pāḷiyaṃ vuttaṃ nirayaṃ tiracchānayoniñca saṅgaṇhāti.
analyzed: para lokam upapajjara iti ettha iti saddo pakāra attho tena pāḷiyam vuttam nirayam tiracchāna yoniñca saṅgaṇhāti
translated: “They are reborn” : the word iti has the meaning of “thus.” Therefore the text includes hell and the animal realm.

original: Yācanti nāma ariyayācanāya. Vuttañhetaṃ “uddissa ariyā tiṭṭhanti, esā ariyāna yācanā”ti.
analyzed: yācanti nāma ariya yācanāya vuttam ha etam uddissa ariyā tiṭṭhanti esā yācanā ati
translated: “They ask” : they ask by way of noble asking. For this is said: “The noble ones stand firm, this is the noble ones’ asking.”🔽“They are generous” : they are called generous because they do what should be done after having known .

original: Ye saṃvibhajanti, te vadaññū nāma ñatvā kattabbakaraṇato. Vimānappabhāyāti nidassanamattaṃ,
analyzed: ye saṃvibhajanti te vadaññū nāma ñatvā kattabba karaṇataḥ vimāna ppabhāya ati nidassana mattam
translated: “The radiance of the mansions” is mentioned only by way of illustration;

original: uyyānakapparukkhappabhāhi devatānaṃ vatthābharaṇasarīrappabhāhipi sagge pakāsentiyeva.
analyzed: uyyāna kappa rukkha ppabhāhi devatānam vattha ābharaṇa sarīra ppabhāhi pi sagge
translated: for the gods also illuminate the heavenly worlds with the radiance of the trees in the pleasure gardens, with the radiance of their own garments and ornaments.

original: Pakāsantīti vā pākaṭā honti, na apāyaloke viya apākaṭāti attho. Parasambhatesūti🔽sayaṃ sambhataṃ anāpajjitvā pareheva sambharitesu sukhūpakaraṇesu. Tenāha pāḷiyaṃ🔽“vasavattīva modare”ti, paranimmitabhogesu vasavattī devaputtā viya sukhasamaṅgitāya
analyzed: pakāsanti iti vā pākaṭāḥ honti na apāya loke viya apākaṭā ati attho para sambhatesu iti  sayam sambhatam an āpajjitvā pareha iva sambharitesu sukha upakaraṇesu tena āha pāḷiyam  vasavattī iva mā udarā iti para nimmita bhogesu vasavattī deva puttā viya sukha samaṅgi tāya
translated: not in what is stored by themselves, but in what is stored by others. Hence it is said in the text:🔽They rejoice like those who rule in the Paranirmita gods’ realm. The meaning is that they rejoice in the possession of happiness like the sons of the gods who rule in the gods’ realm called “Created by Others” .

original: modantīti attho. Evaṃ vuttasamparāyoti ete saggāti evaṃ heṭṭhā vuttasamparāyo. Ubhinnanti🔽etesaṃ yathāvuttānaṃ ubhinnaṃ dukkaṭasukaṭakammakārīnaṃ. Tato cavitvā tato nirayasaggādito
analyzed: modanti iti atthaḥ evam vutta samparāyaḥ ti ete saggā ati evam heṭṭhā vutta samparāyaḥ ubhinnam ti  etesam yathāvuttānam ubhinnam dukkaṭa sukaṭa kamma kārīnam tatas cavitvā tatas niraya sagga āditaḥ
translated: Thus reborn in a happy destiny: thus reborn in the happy destiny described above. Both:

original: cavitvā manussesu nibbattati. Tesu yo maccharī manussesu nibbatto, so daliddo hutvā
analyzed: cavitvā manussesu nibbattati tesu yaḥ maccharī manussesu nibbatto saḥ daliddaḥ hutvā
translated: both those who have done evil and those who have done good. Having passed away from there: having passed away from there, from the happy destiny of the gods and the human world. He is reborn among human beings: he is reborn among human beings. Among them, the miserly one is reborn poor.

original: pubbacariyavasena maccharīyeva honto dārādibharaṇatthaṃ macchakacchapādīni hantvā
analyzed: pubba cariya vasena maccharīya iva hontaḥ dāra ādi bharaṇa attham maccha kacchapa ādīni hantvā
translated: Being a miser through previous practice, he kills fish, turtles, etc., for the sake of supporting his wife, etc.

original: punapi niraye nibbatto. Itaro suddhāsayo samiddho hutvā pubbacariyāvasena punapi
analyzed: puna api niraye nibbattaḥ itaraḥ suddha āsayaḥ samiddhaḥ hutvā pubba cariyā vasena puna api
translated: And he is reborn again in hell. The other, the generous one, is reborn rich. Being generous through previous practice, he gives gifts and makes merit.

original: puññāni katvā sagge nibbatteyya. Tenāha “puna samparāyepi duggatisugatiyeva hotī”ti.
analyzed: puññāni katvā sagge nibbatteyya tena āha puna samparāye pi duggati sugatiyā iva hoti iti
translated: and after doing so he would be reborn in heaven. That is why it was said above: “In the next existence too, he is reborn in a happy destiny.”

original: Maccharisuttavaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.🔽10. Ghaṭīkārasuttavaṇṇanā
analyzed: macchari sutta vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā  ghaṭīkāra sutta vaṇṇanā
translated: The commentary on the Macchariyasutta is ended.🔽The Ghaṭīkārasutta is commented on in the Paṭisambhidāmagga.

original: 50. “Upapannāse”ti se-kārāgamaṃ katvā niddeso, “upapannā”icceva atthoti āha “nibbattivasena
analyzed: upapannā sā iti sa ikāra āgamam katvā niddesaḥ attho ti āha nibbatti vasena
translated: “Upapannāse” is a demonstrative pronoun with the vowel e lengthened to ā. The meaning is “upapannā.”

original: upagatā”ti. Attano sampattito avihānato avihā, tesaṃ brahmaloko avihābrahmaloko,
analyzed: upagatā ati attanaḥ sampattitaḥ a vihānataḥ avihā tesam brahma lokaḥ avihā abrahma lokaḥ
translated: “They have come to rebirth” is said. Aviha is a place of no loss, because there is no loss of one’s own excellence. The brahma world of Aviha is the brahma world of no loss.

original: tasmiṃ. Upapattisamanantaramevāti paṭhamakoṭṭhāse eva. Arahattaphalavimuttiyāti asekkhavimuttiyā.
analyzed: tasmin upapatti samanantaram eva ati paṭhama koṭṭhāse eva arahatta phala vimuttiyā ati asekkha vimuttiyā
translated: “Immediately on arising” means in the first period of life. “By the deliverance of the fruit of arahantship” means by the deliverance of the adept.

original: Sekkhavimuttiyā pana avihūpapattito pageva vimuttā. Mānusaṃ dehaṃ samatikkamanti
analyzed: sekkha vimuttiyā pana avihūpapattitaḥ pagā iva vimuttāḥ mānusam deham samatikkamanti
translated: But they are already delivered by the deliverance of the learner, because they have no more rebirth in the human world.🔽“They transcend the human body” means that they transcend the human world.

original: cittupakkilesapahānavasenāti phalena hetudassanamidanti āha “mānusaṃ dehanti idha…pe…
analyzed: cittu pakkilesa pahāna vasena ati phalena hetu dassanam idan ti āha mānusam deham ti
translated: “Here, the human body is the human world” is said in order to show the cause by means of the fruit.🔽“The divine body” is the five aggregates called the state of a brahmā.

original: vuttānī”ti. Divi bhavaṃ dibbaṃ, brahmattabhāvasaññitaṃ khandhapañcakaṃ. Tattha saṃyojanakoti
analyzed: vuttāni iti divi bhavam dibbam brahmatta bhāva saññitam khandha pañcakam tattha saṃyojanakaḥ ti
translated: “The fetter there” is the fetter of existence.

original: vuttaṃ “dibbaṃ yoganti pañca uddhambhāgiyasaṃyojanānī”ti. Imassāti devaputtassa.
analyzed: vuttam dibbam yogam ti pañca uddhambhāgiya saṃyojanāni iti imassa ati devaputtassa
translated: “Divine union” is said to be the five higher fetters. “His” is the god’s.

original: “Hitvā mānusaṃ dehaṃ, dibbayogaṃ upaccagu”nti tesaṃ tvaṃ kusalaṃ sabbāvajjappahānena🔽anavajjataṃ bhāsatīti kusalī vadesi. Atthena saddassa abhedopacāraṃ katvā gambhīravacanaṃ
analyzed: hitvā mānusam deham dibba yogam upaccagunti tesam tvam kusalam sabbāvajja ppahānena  anavajja tam bhāsati iti kusalī vadesi atthena saddassa abheda upacāram katvā gambhīra vacanam
translated: “Having abandoned the human body, he has attained divine union” : you speak of his skill in abandoning all that is blameworthy.

original: vuttanti āha “gambhīrattha”nti atthasseva gambhīrato, na saddassa. Samucchinnakāmarāgatāya
analyzed: vuttanti āha gambhīra atthanti atthassa iva gambhīrataḥ na saddassa samucchinna kāma rāga tāya
translated: “Deep in meaning” : he says this because the meaning is deep, not because the sound is deep. By the transference of the name of the thing to the sound, he says “deep in meaning.”

original: sabbaso kāmavisayappahānena nirāmisabrahmacārī nāma anāgāmī. Nivāsanaṭṭhānabhūto
analyzed: sabbaso kāma visaya ppahānena nirāmisa brahmacārī nāma anāgāmī nivāsanaṭṭhāna bhūto
translated: The non-returner, who has cut off sensual lust, is called “one who lives the spiritual life without sensual pleasures” because he has abandoned all objects of sensual pleasure.

original: samāno eko gāmo etassāti āha “ekagāmavāsī”ti.🔽Ghaṭīkārasuttavaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: samānaḥ ekaḥ gāmaḥ etassa ati āha eka gāma vāsī iti  ghaṭīkāra sutta vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: “One who lives in a single village” : he is so called because he has a single village as his dwelling place.🔽The Commentary on the Ghaṭīkāra Sutta is finished.

original: Ādittavaggavaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.🔽6. Jarāvaggo
analyzed: āditta vagga vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā  jarā vaggo
translated: The Commentary on the Āditta Vagga is finished.🔽The Chapter on Old Age

original: 1. Jarāsuttavaṇṇanā
translated: The Discourse on Old Age

original: 51. Hitassa sādhanato sādhu, yaṃ kiñci atthajātaṃ. Taṃ pana atthakāmena labhitabbato
analyzed: hitassa sādhanataḥ sādhu yam kiñci attha jātam tam pana attha kāmena labhitabbataḥ
translated: What is good is good because it is the means to what is beneficial. Whatever is beneficial is good. But what is beneficial is to be obtained by one who desires what is beneficial.

original: upasevitabbato laddhakaṃ, kalyāṇaṭṭhena bhaddakanti vuccatīti āha “sādhūti laddhakaṃ
analyzed: upasevitabbataḥ laddhakam kalyāṇa ṭṭhena bhaddakanti vuccati iti āha sādhu iti laddhakam
translated: It is “good” in the sense of being approved, thus it is called “good” in the sense of being approved.🔽“Sādhu” is “good” in the sense of being excellent, thus it is called “good” in the sense of being excellent.

original: bhaddaka”nti. “Sīlaṃ yāva jarā sādhū”ti vuttamatthaṃ byatirekato vibhāvetuṃ “iminā
analyzed: bhaddakam ti sīlam yāva jarā sādhu iti vuttam attham byatirekataḥ vibhāvetum iminā
translated: “Sīlaṃ yāva jarā sādhū” is the meaning stated. In order to show the distinction in this, it is said: “By this he shows this.”

original: idaṃ dassetī”ti vuttaṃ. Idanti idaṃ atthajātaṃ.
analyzed: idam dasseti iti vuttam idam ti idam attha jātam
translated: “This” is this subject matter.

original: Patiṭṭhitāti cittasantāne laddhapatiṭṭhā, kenaci asaṃhāriyā. Tenāha “maggena āgatā”ti.
analyzed: patiṭṭhitā iti citta santāne laddha patiṭṭhā kenaci asaṃhāriyā tena āha maggena āgatā iti
translated: “Established” means having attained establishment in the continuum of consciousness, not to be removed by anyone. Therefore it is said: “come by the path.”

original: Cittīkataṭṭhādīhīti pūjanīyabhāvādīhi. Vuttaṃ hetaṃ porāṇaṭṭhakathāyaṃ. Cittīkatanti
analyzed: cittīkata ṭṭhā ādīhi iti pūjanīya bhāva ādīhi vuttam ha etam porāṇa aṭṭhakathā ayam cittīkatam ti
translated: “Honoured” and so on means by the states of being worshipped and so on. For this is said in the old commentary: “Honoured” means

original: ratananti idaṃ ratanaṃ nāma loke cittīkataṃ vatthūnaṃ sahassagghanatādivasena. Yepi
analyzed: ratanam ti idam ratanam nāma loke cittīkatam vatthūnam sahassagghana tā ādi vasena ye pi
translated: “Jewel” means this jewel is honoured in the world by the value of a thousand and so on of the objects. Those

original: loke cittīkatā khattiyapaṇḍita-catumahārāja-sakka-suyāma-mahābrahmādayo, tesaṃ cittīkato
analyzed: loke cittīkatā khattiya paṇḍita catu mahārāja sakka suyāma mahābrahma ādayo tesam cittīkato
translated: who are honoured in the world, such as the nobles, the wise, the four great kings, Sakka, Suyāma, Mahābrahmā, and so on, are honoured

original: tehi saraṇanti upagantabbatādivasena. Ratikaranti pītisukhāvahaṃ. Jhānaratisukhenāti
analyzed: tehi upagantabba tā ādi vasena rati karanti pīti sukha āvaham jhāna rati sukhena ati
translated: by them. “Refuge” means the state of being able to go for refuge and so on. “Giving delight” means bringing about joy and happiness. By the joy and happiness of jhāna.

original: duvidhenapi jhānaratisukhena. Tuletunti paricchindituṃ. Guṇapāraminti guṇānaṃ ukkaṃsapāramiṃ.
analyzed: duvidhena api jhāna rati sukhena paricchinditum guṇa pāramim ti ukkaṃsa pāramim
translated: The perfection of virtue: the culmination of virtue.🔽Rare: hard to find, since it cannot be found even after passing through many incalculable ages.

original: Dullabho anekāni asaṅkhyeyyāni atidhāvitvāpi laddhuṃ asakkuṇeyyattā. Anomoti anūno🔽paripuṇṇo. Tattha visesato anomasattaparibhogato tehi “sammāsambuddho bhagavā”ti
analyzed: dullabhaḥ anekāni asaṅkhyeyyāni atidhāvitvā api laddhum a sakkuṇeyya ttā anomaḥ iti anūnaḥ  paripuṇṇaḥ tattha visesataḥ anoma satta paribhogato tehi sammāsambuddhaḥ bhagavā ati
translated: Complete: not deficient.🔽Herein, it is because he is complete in virtue that he is called “the Blessed One, the Arahant, the Perfectly Enlightened One.”

original: anussaritabbatoti āha “bhagavā anomo sīlenā”tiādi.
analyzed: anussaritabbato ti āha bhagavā anomaḥ sīlena atiādi
translated: Therefore it is said: “The Blessed One is complete in virtue.”

original: Ariyamaggapaññāyeva idha adhippetāti “idha pana dullabhapātubhāvaṭṭhena paññā ‘ratana’nti
analyzed: ariya magga paññāya iva idha adhippetā ati idha pana dullabha pātubhāva ṭṭhena paññā ratananti
translated: It is wisdom that is intended here as “rare” because of the difficulty of its manifestation.

original: vutta”nti āha. Pujjaphalanibbattanato, attano santānaṃ punātīti ca puññacetanā puññaṃ,
analyzed: vuttam ti āha pujja phala nibbattanataḥ attanaḥ santānam punāti iti ca puñña cetanā puññam
translated: It is merit that is called “a treasure” because it is the cause for the arising of the fruit of worship.

original: sā pana yassa uppannā, tasseva āveṇikatāya anaññasādhāraṇattā kenacipi anāhaṭā, aṭṭhakathāyaṃ
analyzed: sā pana yassa uppannā tassa iva āveṇika tāya anañña sādhāraṇa ttā kenacipi an āhaṭā aṭṭhakathā ayam
translated: But since it is the merit that has arisen in one’s own continuity that is meant here, and since that is not shared with others, it is not mentioned by anyone in the commentary.

original: pana “arūpattā”ti vuttaṃ.
analyzed: pana arūpa ttā iti vuttam
translated: The explanation given in the commentary is that it is not mentioned because it is immaterial.

original: Jarāsuttavaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: jarā sutta vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: The commentary on the Discourse on Aging is finished.

original: 2. Ajarasāsuttavaṇṇanā
analyzed: ajarasā sutta vaṇṇanā
translated: The Discourse on the Deathless

original: 52. Ajīraṇenāti jiṇṇabhāvānāpajjanena. Lakkhaṇavacanañcetaṃ avināsappattiyā. Tenāha “avipattiyāti attho”ti. Niddhamitabboti nīharitabbo.
analyzed: a jīraṇena ati jiṇṇa bhāva an āpajjanena lakkhaṇa vacanam ca etam avināsa ppattiyā tena āha avipattiyā ati attho ti niddhamitabbaḥ ti nīharitabbaḥ
translated: By non-digestion: by the non-arrival at a state of decay. This is a statement of the characteristic of non-digestion, which is the arrival at non-decay. Hence he said: “The meaning is non-decay.” Should be expelled: should be removed.

original: Ajarasāsuttavaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: ajarasā sutta vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: The commentary on the Ajara Sutta is ended.

original: 3. Mittasuttavaṇṇanā🔽53. Saha atthena vattatīti sattho, bhaṇḍamūlaṃ gahetvā vāṇijjavasena desantarādīsu🔽vicaraṇakajanasamūho. Tenāha “saddhiṃcaro”ti, sahacaraṇakoti attho. Mittanti sinehayogena
analyzed: mitta sutta vaṇṇanā  saha atthena vattati iti satthaḥ bhaṇḍa mūlam gahetvā vāṇijja vasena desantara ādīsu  vicaraṇaka jana samūhaḥ tena āha saddhiṃcaro ti sahacaraṇako ti atthaḥ mittam ti sineha yogena
translated: The Sutta on the Friend

original: mittakiccayuttaṃ. Idhādhippetappakāraṃ dassetuṃ “roge uppanne”tiādi vuttaṃ. Tathārūpeti🔽jigucchanīye, duttikicche vā. Yathā asaṇṭhitānaṃ saṇṭhāpanavasena pavasato purisassa
analyzed: mitta kicca yuttam idha adhippeta ppakāram dassetum roge uppanna itiādi vuttam tathārūpā iti  jigucchanīye duttikicche vā yathā a saṇṭhitānam saṇṭhāpana vasena pavasataḥ purisassa
translated: A friend is one who goes with one, who goes together with one. He is a group of people who go about in different countries, etc., like a caravan, taking goods and capital. Hence he said: “A companion,” which means one who goes together. A friend is one who is fit to be a friend by the bond of affection. In order to show the kind of friend meant here, it is said: “When a disease arises.” Such a one: one who is disgusting, or one who is difficult to serve.

original: bhogabyasane nāthatā, evaṃ puttasinehavasena puttassa mātuyā antogehe nāthatāti vuttaṃ
analyzed: bhoga byasane nātha tā evam putta sineha vasena puttassa mātuyāḥ antogehe nātha tā ti vuttam
translated: Just as a man who is going about has no protector in the loss of his wealth, so a mother has no protector in her house in the loss of her son through the bond of affection for him. Hence it is said: “A mother has no protector in her house.”

original: “mātā mittaṃ sake ghare”ti. Atthajātassāti upaṭṭhitapayojanassāti atthoti āha “uppannakiccassā”ti.
analyzed: mātā mittam sake ghare ti attha jātassa āti upaṭṭhita payojanassa ati attho ti āha uppanna kiccassa āti
translated: “A mother is a friend in one’s own house.” “For one who has a purpose” : for one who has a purpose that has arisen, is what is said.

original: Samparāyahitanti samparāye hitāvahaṃ.
analyzed: samparāya hitam ti samparāye hita āvaham
translated: “For one’s welfare in the long run” : for one who brings about welfare in the long run.

original: Mittasuttavaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: mitta sutta vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: The commentary on the Friends in need is finished.

original: 4. Vatthusuttavaṇṇanā
analyzed: vatthu sutta vaṇṇanā
translated: The commentary on the Basis

original: 54. Patiṭṭhāti avassayo. Guyhassāti guhitabbassa rahassassa. Paramo sakhā nāma atipiyaṭṭhānatāya.
analyzed: patiṭṭhā ati avassayaḥ guyhassa ati guhitabbassa rahassassa paramaḥ sakhā nāma ati piya ṭṭhāna tāya
translated: “It runs” : it runs in various ways, i.e. it occurs as one wishes.

original: Vatthusuttavaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: vatthu sutta vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: The commentary on the Basis is finished.

original: 5. Paṭhamajanasuttavaṇṇanā
analyzed: paṭhama jana sutta vaṇṇanā
translated: The commentary on the First Kind of People

original: 55. Vidhāvatīti vividhaṃ rūpaṃ padhāvati, yathākāmaṃ pavattatīti attho.
analyzed: vidhāvati iti vividham rūpam padhāvati yathākāmam pavattati iti attho
translated: “It runs” : it runs in various ways, i.e. it occurs as one wishes.

original: Paṭhamajanasuttavaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: paṭhama jana sutta vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: The commentary on the First Kind of People is finished.

original: 6. Dutiyajanasuttavaṇṇanā
analyzed: dutiya jana sutta vaṇṇanā
translated: The commentary on the Second Kind of People

original: 56. Vaṭṭadukkhatoti saṃsāradukkhato. Saṃsāro hi kilesakammavipākānaṃ aparāparuppattitāya vidhāvati. Tañca dukkhaṃ dukkhamattāya nānāvidhadukkharāsibhāvato.
analyzed: vaṭṭa dukkhato ti saṃsāra dukkhato saṃsāraḥ hi kilesa kamma vipākānam apara apara uppatti tāya vidhāvati tat ca dukkham dukkhamattāya nānāvidha dukkha rāsi bhāvato
translated: “The suffering of the round” : the suffering of the round of rebirths. For the round of rebirths runs in various ways because of the successive arising of defilements, kamma, and results of kamma. And that suffering runs in various ways because it is a mass of various kinds of suffering.

original: Dutiyajanasuttavaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: dutiya jana sutta vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: The commentary on the Second Kind of People is finished.

original: 7. Tatiyajanasuttavaṇṇanā
analyzed: tatiya jana sutta vaṇṇanā
translated: The commentary on the Third Kind of People

original: 57. Nipphattīti iṭṭhāniṭṭhavipākānaṃ nipphajjanato nipphatti. Tato eva avassayo, nipphattitavipākassa avassayo adhiṭṭhānaṃ kāraṇanti attho.
analyzed: nipphatti iti iṭṭha aniṭṭha vipākānam nipphajjanataḥ nipphatti tatas eva avassayaḥ nipphattita vipākassa avassayaḥ adhiṭṭhānam kāraṇanti attho
translated: “Production” is production of desirable and undesirable results. “Support” is the same as “production” since it is the support, the basis, the cause, of the result that is produced.

original: Tatiyajanasuttavaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: tatiya jana sutta vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: The commentary on the third section for recitation is finished.

original: 8. Uppathasuttavaṇṇanā
analyzed: uppatha sutta vaṇṇanā
translated: The section for recitation on the wrong path

original: 58. Amaggoti na maggo anupāyo. Rattindivakkhayoti tattha vayakkhaṇassa pākaṭabhāvato.
analyzed: amaggaḥ ti na maggaḥ anupāyaḥ rattindiva khayaḥ ti tattha vaya khaṇassa pākaṭa bhāvataḥ
translated: “Wrong path” is not a path, not a means. “Day and night” is because the moment of decay is evident there.

original: Vuttakkhaṇopi hi sayaṃ khīyateva. Sesaṃ bāhiramalaṃ vatthasarīrādibhūtaṃ. Tathā hi
analyzed: vutta kkhaṇaḥ api hi sayam khīyate iva sesam bāhira malam vattha sarīra ādi bhūtam tathā hi
translated: For although the moment is stated, it decays by itself. The rest is external dirt, such as cloth, body, etc. For thus

original: “bhasmakhārādīhi dhovitvā sakkā sodhetu”nti vuttaṃ. Duṭṭhoti dūsito sattasantāno
analyzed: bhasma khāra ādīhi dhovitvā sakkā sodhetunti vuttam duṭṭhaḥ ti dūsitaḥ satta santāno
translated: it is said: “It can be cleansed by washing with ashes, lye, etc.” “Corrupted” is defiled. The being’s continuum

original: na sakkā suddho nāma kātuṃ abbhantaramalīnabhāvāpādanato. Itthiyanti brahmacariyassa
analyzed: na sakkā suddhaḥ nāma kātum abbhantara malīna bhāva āpādanataḥ itthiyanti brahmacariyassa
translated: cannot be made pure, because it is the cause of internal dirt. “Woman” is the same as “woman” in the first section for recitation.

original: antarāyakarāyapi. Pajāti sattakāyo sajjati saṅgaṃ karoti yāthāvato ādīnavaṃ apassanto.
analyzed: satta kāyo sajjati saṅgam karoti yāthāvataḥ ādīnavam a passanto
translated: It is a hindrance to the life of purity. “Birth” is the body of beings. It sticks, it makes attachment, not seeing the danger as it really is.

original: Indriyasaṃvarādi kilesānaṃ tāpanato tapo, tenāha “sabbāpī”tiādi.
analyzed: indriya saṃvara ādi kilesānam tāpanato tapo tena āha sabbā api itiādi
translated: “Ascetic” is austerity, because it burns defilements such as the control of the senses, etc. Therefore it is said: “all this” and so on.

original: Uppathasuttavaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: uppatha sutta vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: The commentary on the Uppatha Sutta is finished.

original: 9. Dutiyasuttavaṇṇanā
analyzed: dutiya sutta vaṇṇanā
translated: The second sutta🔽“Kissā” : the word “kissā” is a possessive form in the sense of “in what” .

original: 59. Kissāti bhummatthe sāmivacananti āha “kismiṃ abhirato”ti. Saddhā nāma anavajjasabhāvā,
analyzed: kissa iti bhumma tthe sāmi vacananti āha kismin abhirataḥ iti saddhā nāma anavajja sabhāvā
translated: Thus he says: “In what is one devoted?” “Faith” is a blameless state.

original: tasmā lokiyalokuttarahitasukhāvahāti āha “sugatiñceva nibbānañca gacchantassa dutiyikā”ti.
analyzed: tasmā lokiya lokuttara hita sukha āvahā ti āha sugatim ca iva nibbānam ca gacchantassa dutiyikā ti
translated: Therefore, it is the companion of one who goes to a good destination and to Nibbāna, which is the happiness that is free from the mundane and supramundane .

original: Anusāsati hitacariyāya pariṇāyikabhāvato.
analyzed: anusāsati hita cariyāya pariṇāyika bhāvataḥ
translated: He instructs with the practice of benefit, because of the state of being a guide.

original: Dutiyasuttavaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: dutiya sutta vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: The commentary on the second sutta is finished.

original: 10. Kavisuttavaṇṇanā
translated: The poet sutta

original: 60. Gāyattiādikoti chabbīsatiyā chandesu gāyattiādiko ukkatipariyosāno chando gāthānaṃ
analyzed: gāyatti ādikaḥ ti chabbīsatiyā chandesu gāyatti ādikaḥ ukkati pariyosāno chandaḥ gāthānam
translated: “Gāyattiādiko” : the metre beginning with gāyatti and ending with ukkati in the twenty-six metres is the nidāna , the origin, of the verses,

original: nidānaṃ samuṭṭhānaṃ “samuṭṭhahati etenā”ti katvā. Tehi pana anuṭṭhubhādiko hotīti
analyzed: nidānam samuṭṭhānam samuṭṭhahati etena ati katvā tehi pana anuṭṭhubha ādikaḥ hoti iti
translated: because of the statement: “It originates from this.” But it is the anuṭṭhubhādiko of those .

original: āha “chando gāthānaṃ nidāna”nti. Pubbapaṭṭhāpanagāthāti dhammakathāya ādito ārocanabhāvajānanatthaṃ🔽satijananaṃ viya pavattitagāthā. Akkharañhi padaṃ janetīti yasmā akkharasamudāyo
analyzed: āha chandaḥ gāthānam nidānam ti pubba paṭṭhāpana gāthā āti dhammakathāya āditas ārocana bhāva jānana attham 🔽sati jananam viya pavattita gāthā akkharan hi padam janeti iti yasmai akkhara samudāyaḥ
translated: Thus he says: “The metre is the nidāna of the verses.” “Pubbapaṭṭhānagāthā” : the verses that occur like the arousing of mindfulness for the purpose of knowing the state of announcing at the beginning of a Dhamma talk,🔽because a word generates a foot, since a collection of letters

original: padaṃ, padasamudāyo gāthā, samudāyo ca samudāyīhi byañjīyati taṃpavattanato, tasmā🔽byañjanabhāve ṭhitaṃ akkharaṃ, taṃsamudāyo padaṃ, padaṃ taṃ viyañjetā janetā viya
analyzed: padam pada samudāyaḥ gāthā samudāyaḥ ca samudāyīhi taṃ pavattanataḥ tasmā  byañjana bhāve ṭhitam akkharam padam padam tam viyañjetā janetā
translated: A word is a collection of syllables, and a collection is called a “collection” because it is a collection of what is collected.🔽So a syllable is called a “word” because it is the basis for the appearance of the collection.

original: hotīti “akkharañhi padaṃ janetī”ti vuttaṃ. Akkharaṃ hi uccāritaviddhaṃsitāya taṃtaṃkhaṇamattāvaṭṭhāyīpi
analyzed: hoti iti akkharam hi padam janeti iti vuttam akkharam hi
translated: For a syllable is what causes the word to appear, though it lasts only for the time of its utterance and is pronounced with a break between its parts.

original: parato pavattiyā manoviññāṇavīthiyā saṅkalanavasena ekajjhaṃ katvā padabhāvena gayhamānaṃ🔽yathāsaṅketamatthaṃ byañjeti. Padaṃ gāthaṃ janetīti etthāpi eseva nayo. Gāthā atthaṃ🔽pakāsetīti gāthāsaññito padasamudāyo kiriyākārakasambandhavasena sambandhito kattuadhippāyānurūpaṃ
analyzed: paratas pavattiyā manaḥ viññāṇa vīthiyā saṅkalana vasena ekajjham katvā pada bhāvena gayhamānam  yathāsaṅketam attham byañja iti padam gātham janeti iti ettha api esā iva nayaḥ gāthā attham  pakāseti iti gāthā saññitaḥ pada samudāyo kiriyā kāraka sambandha vasena sambandhitaḥ kattu adhippāya anurūpam
translated: But when it has ceased, it is included in the mind-door adverting that occurs next, and it is apprehended as a word by being classed together in the way already described.🔽Then it causes the meaning to appear according to the convention.🔽A verse is what causes a stanza to appear. A stanza is a collection of words. It reveals the meaning that is intended by the speaker and is put together by being arranged in accordance with the relation of the verb to the noun.

original: ālocitavilocitaṃ saṃhitaṃ atthaṃ vibhāveti. Samuddādipaṇṇattinissitā vohārasannissayeneva
analyzed: ālocita vilocitam saṃhitam attham vibhāveti samudda ādi paṇṇatti nissitā vohāra sannissayena iva
translated: It is like the ocean, which is a collection of waters.

original: pavattatīti katvā. Tenāha “gāthā ārabhanto”tiādi. Āsayoti avassayoti āha “patiṭṭhā”ti
analyzed: pavattati iti katvā tena āha gāthāḥ ārabhanto tiādi āsayo ti avassayo ti āha patiṭṭhā ti
translated: and so he said “who begins a verse” and so on.🔽“Basis” means “support” .

original: kavitoti vicittakathīādito.
analyzed: vicitta kathī āditaḥ
translated: “Poet” means “one who speaks variously” .

original: Kavisuttavaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: kavi sutta vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: The commentary on the Kavi Sutta is finished.

original: Jarāvaggavaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: jarā vagga vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: The commentary on the Jarāvagga is finished.

original: 7. Addhavaggo
analyzed: addha vaggo
translated: The Addhavagga

original: 1. Nāmasuttavaṇṇanā
analyzed: nāma sutta vaṇṇanā
translated: The Nāma Sutta

original: 61. Nāmanti sāmaññanāmādibhedaṃ nāmaṃ. Sabbanti sabbaṃ paññattipathaṃ sabbaṃ ñeyyapavattipathaṃ.
analyzed: nāmanti sāmañña nāma ādi bhedam nāmam sabbam iti sabbam paññatti patham sabbam ñeyya pavatti patham
translated: “Name”: the various kinds of name beginning with the general name. “All”: all the ways of construing, all the ways of occurrence of the knowable.

original: Addhabhavīti kāmaṃ pāḷiyaṃ atītakālaniddeso kato, taṃ pana lakkhaṇamattaṃ. Abhibhavati
analyzed: kāmam atīta kāla niddeso kato tam pana lakkhaṇa mattam abhibhavati
translated: “Overcomes the future”: although the past tense is used in the text, it is the mere characteristic that is meant.

original: anupatatīti etena abhibhavo anupatanaṃ pavatti evāti dasseti. Taṃ panassa abhibhavanaṃ
analyzed: anupatati iti etena abhibhavaḥ anupatanam pavatti eva ati dasseti tam panassa abhibhavanam
translated: “Overcomes” and “penetrates” show that overcoming is the occurrence of penetration.

original: appavisaye anāmasitvā mahāvisayānaṃ vasena dassento “opapātikena vā”tiādimāha. Tassa
analyzed: appa visaye an āmasitvā mahā visayānam vasena dassentaḥ opapātikena vā ti ādim āha tassa
translated: But in order to show that his overcoming is not confined to a limited field but is concerned with a great field, he said “by the non-material” and so on.

original: nāmaṃ hotīti tassa rukkhapāsāṇādikassa anāmakoicceva samaññā hoti, tathā naṃ sañjānantīti attho.
analyzed: nāmam hoti iti tassa rukkha pāsāṇa ādikassa samaññā hoti tathā nam sañjānanti iti attho
translated: “That is its name”: that tree, rock, etc., has only a name, that is to say, a general concept, and the meaning is that it is perceived as such.

original: Nāmasuttavaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: nāma sutta vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: The commentary on the Nāma Sutta is finished.

original: 2. Cittasuttavaṇṇanā
analyzed: citta sutta vaṇṇanā
translated: The Cittasutta

original: 62. Ye cittassa vasaṃ gacchantīti ye apariññātavatthukā, tesaṃyeva. Anavasesapariyādānanti
analyzed: ye cittassa vasam gacchanti iti ye a pariññāta vatthukā tesam yeva anavasesa pariyādānam ti
translated: “Those who come under the sway of mind” are those whose objects are not fully understood. “Without remainder” is the taking of them without remainder.

original: anavasesaggahaṇaṃ. Na hi pariññātakkhandhā pahīnakilesā cittassa vasaṃ gacchanti,
analyzed: anavasesa ggahaṇam na hi pariññāta kkhandhāḥ pahīna kilesāḥ cittassa vasam gacchanti
translated: For those whose aggregates are fully understood and whose defilements are abandoned do not come under the sway of mind.

original: taṃ attano vase vattenti.
analyzed: tam attanaḥ vase vattenti
translated: They bring it under their own sway.

original: Cittasuttavaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.🔽3. Taṇhāsuttavaṇṇanā
analyzed: citta sutta vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā  taṇhā sutta vaṇṇanā
translated: The Exposition of the Mind Thread is finished.🔽The Thread on Craving

original: 63. Tatiye “sabbeva vasamanvagū”ti ye taṇhāya vasaṃ gacchanti, tesaṃ eva anavasesapariyādānanti imamatthaṃ “eseva nayo”ti iminā atidissati.
analyzed: tatiye ye taṇhāya vasam gacchanti tesam eva anavasesa pariyādānam ti imam attham esa iva nayo ti iminā atidissati
translated: In the third verse, “all come under the sway” is the meaning of “those who come under the sway of craving” and “without remainder” is the meaning of “without exception” . This is the method.

original: Taṇhāsuttavaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: taṇhā sutta vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: The Exposition of the Thread on Craving is finished.

original: 4. Saṃyojanasuttavaṇṇanā
analyzed: saṃyojana sutta vaṇṇanā
translated: The Thread on Fetters

original: 64. Kiṃ su saṃyojanoti sūti nipātamattanti āha “kiṃ-saṃyojano”ti? Vicaranti etehīti vicāraṇā, pādā. Bahuvacane hi vattabbe ekavacanaṃ kataṃ. Tassāti lokassa.🔽Saṃyojanasuttavaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.🔽5. Bandhanasuttavaṇṇanā
analyzed: kim su saṃyojana uti su iti nipāta mattam iti āha kiṃsaṃyojana iti vicaranti etehi iti vicāraṇā pādāḥ bahuvacane hi vattabbe ekavacanam katam tassa ati lokassa 🔽saṃyojana sutta vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā 🔽bandhana sutta vaṇṇanā
translated: “What-fettered” is a mere particle. That is why he said “What-fettered” . “They investigate with these” is the derivation of “investigations” . For the singular is used for the plural. “His” is of the world.

original: 65. Catutthe āgataattho eva anantarepi vutto, byañjanameva nānanti āha “pañcamepi eseva nayo”ti.
analyzed: catutthe āgata atthaḥ eva anantare pi vuttaḥ byañjanam eva āha pañcame pi esā iva
translated: The meaning of the fourth is the same as that of the preceding one, only the wording is different. That is why he says, “The same method applies in the fifth” .

original: Bandhanasuttavaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: bandhana sutta vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: The commentary on the Bondage is ended.

original: 6. Attahatasuttavaṇṇanā
analyzed: attahata sutta vaṇṇanā
translated: The Discussion of the Self-Ensnared

original: 66. “Kenassubbhāhato”ti pāṭhoti adhippāyena “su-kāro nipātamatta”nti āha, “kenassabbhāhato”ti
analyzed: kenassa ubbhāhato ti pāṭhaḥ iti adhippāyena su kāraḥ nipāta mattam ti āha
translated: The reading “kenassubbhāhato” is intended. That is why he says “the su- is a mere particle.” But in the reading “kenassabbhāhato” the u- is elided in compounding.

original: pana pāṭhe u-kāralopena padasandhi. Icchādhūpāyitoti asampattavisayicchālakkhaṇāya
analyzed: pana pāṭhe ukāra lopena pada sandhi a sampatta visaya icchā lakkhaṇāya
translated: He is heated by the smoke of craving: he is scorched and burned by craving, which has the characteristic of desire for an object not yet attained.

original: taṇhāya santāpito daḍḍho. Tenāha “icchāya āditto”ti.
analyzed: taṇhāya santāpitaḥ tena āha icchāya
translated: That is why he says “inflamed by desire.”

original: Attahatasuttavaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: attahata sutta vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: The commentary on the Self-Ensnared is ended.

original: 7. Uḍḍitasuttavaṇṇanā🔽67. Ullaṅghitoti ubbandhitvā laṅghito. Saddādīsūti saddādināgadantesu sotādīni uḍḍitāni🔽taṇhārajjunā daḷhabandhanena baddhattā tadanativattanato. Lokoti āyatanaloko. Tathā
analyzed: uḍḍita sutta vaṇṇanā  ullaṅghitaḥ iti ubbandhitvā laṅghitaḥ sadda ādīsu iti sadda ādi nāga dantesu sota ādīni uḍḍitāni  taṇhā rajjunā daḷha bandhanena tad an ativattanataḥ tathā
translated: The Discussion of the Bound🔽He is bound by the bond of craving: he is bound by the bond of craving, which has the characteristic of cleaving to, as a result of which he does not go beyond the round of rebirths.🔽The world: the world of the bases. The same method of interpretation can be applied in the case of the world of the aggregates, etc.,

original: atthayojanāya katattā khandhādilokavasenapi yojanā kātabbā. Na dūraṃ anantarabhavakattā.
analyzed: attha yojanāya kata ttā khandha ādi loka vasena api yojanā kātabbā na dūram anantara bhavaka ttā
translated: because the world of the bases is intended here. It is not far: because it is the next becoming.

original: Cuticittaantaritattā ekacittantarabhavassa kammassa abujjhanaṃ, evaṃ sante kasmā
analyzed: cuti citta antarita ttā eka citta antara bhavassa kammassa evam sante kasmā
translated: If that is so, why don’t beings come to birth?

original: sattā na bujjhantīti āha “balavatiyā”tiādi.
analyzed: sattāḥ na bujjhanti iti āha balavatiyā atiādi
translated: The explanation is: “Because of the strength of the kamma.”

original: Uḍḍitasuttavaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: uḍḍita sutta vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: The commentary on the Uḍḍitasutta is finished.

original: 8. Pihitasuttavaṇṇanā
analyzed: pihita sutta vaṇṇanā
translated: The Piṭṭhisutta

original: 68. Pañhoti ñātuṃ icchito attho. Pucchitoti sattamasutte gāthāya purimaddhaṃ pacchimaddhaṃ,
analyzed: pañho ti ñātum icchito attho pucchito ti sattama sutte gāthāya purimaddham
translated: Question: a matter desired to be known. Asked: in the seventh sutta, the first half of the verse and the second half,

original: pacchimaṃ purimaṃ katvā aṭṭhamasutte devatāya pucchitattā vuttaṃ “heṭṭhupariyāyavasena
analyzed: pacchimam purimam katvā aṭṭhama sutte devatāya pucchita ttā vuttam heṭṭhu pariyāya vasena
translated: the second half and the first half, in the eighth sutta, asked by the deity. Therefore it is said: “asked by way of the lower and the higher.”

original: pucchito”ti. Pucchānurūpaṃ vissajjananti avuttampi siddhametanti anāhaṭaṃ.
analyzed: pucchito ti puccha anurūpam vissajjanam ti a vuttam pi siddham etat ti anāhaṭam
translated: Answering in accordance with the question: not asked, but it is established.

original: Pihitasuttavaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: pihita sutta vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: The commentary on the Piṭṭhisutta is finished.

original: 9. Icchāsuttavaṇṇanā
analyzed: icchā sutta vaṇṇanā
translated: The Icchāsutta

original: 69. Navame vinayāyāti vinayena. Karaṇatthe hi idaṃ sampadānavacanaṃ. Kissassūti kissa,
analyzed: navame vinayāya ati vinayena karaṇa atthe hi idam sampadāna vacanam kissassu iti kissa
translated: In the ninth sutta, by the Vinaya: for the Vinaya. For this is a word of the instrumental case in the sense of instrument. What?

original: su-kāro nipātamattaṃ. Sabbaṃ chindati bandhananti sabbaṃ dasavidhampi saṃyojanaṃ
analyzed: sukāraḥ nipāta mattam sabbam chindati bandhananti sabbam dasavidham pi saṃyojanam
translated: The su- is a mere particle. He cuts all the bonds: all the ten kinds of fetters.

original: samucchindati. Na hi taṃ kiñci kilesabandhanaṃ atthi, yaṃ asamucchinnaṃ hutvā ṭhitaṃ
analyzed: samucchindati na hi tam kiñci kilesa bandhanam atthi yam asamucchinnam hutvā ṭhitam
translated: for there is no fetter of defilement that remains uncut when craving is cut.

original: assā taṇhāya samucchinnāya. Svāyamattho suviññeyyoti āha “sabbaṃ uttānamevā”ti.
analyzed: assā taṇhāya samucchinnāya su ayam attho su viññeyyaḥ ti āha sabbam uttānam eva ati
translated: The meaning is easy to understand.

original: Icchāsuttavaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: icchā sutta vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: The commentary on the Icchā sutta is ended.

original: 10. Lokasuttavaṇṇanā
translated: The world sutta

original: 70. Kisminti kismiṃ sati? Tassa pana santabhāvo uppattivasenevāti āha “kismiṃ uppanne”ti?
analyzed: kismin ti kismin sati tassa pana santa bhāvaḥ uppatti vasena iva ati āha kismin uppanna iti
translated: “In what?” In what being? But its being is by arising, thus he said “in what arisen.”

original: Loko uppannoti vuccati anupādānattā lokasamaññāya. Chasūti etthāpi eseva nayo santhavanti🔽adhikasinehaṃ karoti adhikasinehavatthubhāvato ajjhattikāyatanānaṃ. Upādāyāti pubbakālakiriyā
analyzed: lokaḥ uppannaḥ ti vuccati an upādāna ttā loka samaññāya chasu ti ettha api esa iva nayo santhavanti  adhika sineham karoti adhika sineha vatthu bhāvataḥ ajjhattika āyatanānam upādāya ati pubba kālakiriyā
translated: The world is said to be arisen because it is not clung to, since it is called the world. In the six: here too this is the method. Contact:

original: aparakālakiriyaṃ apekkhatīti vacanasesavasena kiriyāpadaṃ gahitaṃ “pavattatī”ti.
analyzed: apara kāla kiriyam apekkhati iti vacana sesa vasena kiriyā padam gahitam pavattati iti
translated: he makes excessive affection, because the internal sense bases are the basis for excessive affection. Clung to: the state of action is taken as a verbal expression in the sense of “it occurs” because the action of the prior moment is dependent on the action of the subsequent moment.

original: Kiṃ pana pavattati? Loko, lokasamaññāti attho. Chasūti idaṃ nimittatthe bhummaṃ.
analyzed: kim pana pavattati lokaḥ loka samaññā ti attho chasu iti idam nimitta atthe bhummam
translated: But what occurs? The world, is the meaning of the expression “the world.” In the six: this is a locative of cause.

original: Chaḷāyatananimittañhi sabbadukkhaṃ. Ayanti sattaloko. Uppanno nāma hoti chaḷāyatanaṃ
analyzed: chaḷāyatana nimittam hi sabba dukkham ayanti satta lokaḥ uppannaḥ nāma hoti chaḷāyatanam
translated: The six sense bases are called “arisen” because they are the root of all suffering.🔽He makes contact with the external sense bases, especially with visible forms, etc.,

original: nāma mūlaṃ sabbadukkhānanti katvā. Bāhiresu āyatanesu santhavaṃ karoti visesato rūpādīnaṃ
analyzed: nāma mūlam sabba dukkhānam ti katvā bāhiresu āyatanesu santhavam karoti visesataḥ rūpa ādīnam
translated: because these are the bases for craving.

original: taṇhāvatthukattā. Yasmā cakkhādīnaṃ santappanavasena rūpādīnaṃ pariggahitattā lokassa
analyzed: taṇhā vatthuka ttā yasmā cakkha ādīnam santappana vasena rūpa ādīnam pariggahita ttā lokassa
translated: Since the world resorts to visible forms, etc., because of the satisfaction that arises from the eye, etc.,

original: nisevitāya saṃvattati, tasmā vuttaṃ “channaṃ…pe… vihaññatī”ti.
analyzed: nisevitāya saṃvattati tasmā vuttam vihaññati iti
translated: it is said that “the world is afflicted by the six bases.”

original: Lokasuttavaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: loka sutta vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: The commentary on the Lokasutta is finished.

original: Addhavaggavaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.🔽8. Chetvāvaggo
analyzed: addha vagga vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā  chetvā a vaggo
translated: The commentary on the Addhavagga is finished.🔽The Chetvāvagga

original: 1. Chetvāsuttavaṇṇanā
analyzed: chetvā sutta vaṇṇanā
translated: The Chetvā Sutta

original: 71. Vadhitvāti hantvā vināsetvā. Aparidayhamānattāti apīḷiyamānattā. Vinaṭṭhadomanassattā🔽na socati cetodukkhadukkhābhāvato. Visaṃ nāma dukkhaṃ aniṭṭhabhāvato, tassa mūlakāraṇaṃ
analyzed: vadhitvā iti hantvā vināsetvā a paridayhamānattā ati a pīḷiyamānattā vinaṭṭha domanassattā  na socati cetaḥ dukkha dukkha abhāvataḥ visam nāma dukkham aniṭṭha bhāvato tassa mūla kāraṇam
translated: Having killed: having slain, having destroyed. Not burning: not being tormented. Not grieving: not being sad.🔽He does not grieve because of the absence of mental suffering and sorrow. Poison is suffering because of its undesirable nature. Anger is the root of that because of its undesirable result.

original: kodho aniṭṭhaphalattāti āha “visamūlassāti dukkhavipākassā”ti. Akkuṭṭhassāti akkosāparādhassa.
