original: sampiṇḍitoti attho. Tenāha “rāsibhūto”ti. Asikkhitoti sattaṭṭhasaṃvaccharāni dhanusippena
analyzed: sampiṇḍitoti attho tena āha rāsi bhūtaḥ ti a sikkhitaḥ ti satta ṭṭha saṃvaccharāni dhanu sippena
translated: the meaning is “combined.” Therefore he said “become a heap.” “Untrained” means not trained for seven or eight years in archery,

original: sikkhito. Dhanusippaṃ sikkhitvāpi koci katahattho na hoti, ayaṃ pana asikkhito na
analyzed: sikkhitaḥ dhanu sippam sikkhitvā api koci kata hatthaḥ na hoti ayam pana a sikkhitaḥ na
translated: even though trained in archery, some are not skilled, but this one is not trained and not skilled,

original: katahattho, poṅkhānupoṅkhabhāvoyeva byāmamuṭṭhibandho. Tiṇapuñjamattikāpuñjādīsūti
analyzed: katahattho byāma muṭṭhi bandho tiṇa puñja mattikā puñja ādīsu iti
translated: only the length of the bowstring and the grip are known. “In heaps of grass, heaps of clay, etc.”

original: ādi-saddena paṃsupuñjavālukapuñjasāraphalakaayoghanādike saṅgaṇhāti. Akataparicayoti
analyzed: ādi saddena saṅgaṇhāti a kata paricayā ti
translated: and the word “etc.” includes a heap of sand, a heap of gravel, a log, a stump, and so on. He has not made friends with them:🔽he has not made friends with them in the sense of not being acquainted with them. He has not paid respect to them:🔽he has not paid respect to them by going to kings, royal ministers, and so on. He is not a frequenter of society:

original: tesaṃ santikā vijjhanaṭṭhena akataparicayo. Rājarājamahāmattādike upecca asanaṃ upāsanaṃ,
analyzed: tesam santikā vijjhana ṭṭhena a kata paricayaḥ rāja rāja mahāmatta ādike upecca asanam upāsanam
translated: he has not made a practice of going to such places. He is fearful:🔽he is fearful because of his lack of training, etc., and his body is stiff:🔽his body is stiff because of his fear. He is timid:🔽he is timid because of his fear. He is terrified:🔽he is terrified because of his fear. He is frightened:

original: na kataṃ upāsanaṃ etenāti akatūpāsano. Asikkhitatādinā bhīrubhāvena vā kāyassa chambhanaṃ
analyzed: na katam upāsanam etena ati akatūpāsanaḥ asikkhita tā ādinā bhīru bhāvena vā kāyassa chambhanam
translated: he is frightened because of his fear. He is anxious:🔽he is anxious because of his fear. He is alarmed:

original: saṅkampanaṃ uttāso etassa atthīti chambhīti āha “pavedhitakāyo”ti.🔽Dakkhiṇeyyatāya adhippetattā “arahattamaggena kāmacchando pahīno hotī”ti āha. Accantappahānassa
analyzed: saṅkampanam uttāsaḥ etassa atthi iti chambhī iti āha pavedhita kāyaḥ ti  dakkhiṇeyya tāya adhippeta ttā arahatta maggena kāmacchandaḥ pahīnaḥ hoti iti āha accanta ppahānassa
translated: he is alarmed because of his fear. He is terrified:🔽he is terrified because of his fear. He is panic-stricken:🔽he is panic-stricken because of his fear. He is trembling:🔽he is trembling because of his fear. He is shaking:🔽he is shaking because of his fear. He is quivering:🔽he is quivering because of his fear. He is sweating:🔽he is sweating because of his fear. He is trembling all over:

original: icchitattā tatiyeneva kukkuccaṃ pahīnaṃ hoti paṭighasampayogaṃ. Asekkhassa ayanti
analyzed: icchita ttā tatiyena iva kukkuccam pahīnam hoti paṭigha sampayogam asekkhassa ayanti
translated: he is trembling all over because of his fear. He is terrified and his hair is standing on end:🔽he is terrified and his hair is standing on end because of his fear. He is worthy of gifts:🔽he is worthy of gifts because of his worthiness of offerings. He is worthy of hospitality:🔽he is worthy of hospitality because of his worthiness of offerings. He is worthy of gifts and hospitality:🔽he is worthy of gifts and hospitality because of his worthiness of offerings. He is supreme:🔽he is supreme because of his being the best. He is unsurpassed:🔽he is unsurpassed because of his being the best. He is the head:🔽he is the head because of his being the best. He is the chief:🔽he is the chief because of his being the best. He is the sovereign:🔽he is the sovereign because of his being the best. He is the highest:🔽he is the highest because of his being the best. He is the most excellent:

original: asekkhaṃ, sīlakkhandho. Tayidaṃ na aggaphalaṃ sīlameva adhippetaṃ, atha kho yaṃ kiñci🔽asekkhasantāne pavattaṃ sīlaṃ, lokuttaro eva na adhippeto sikkhāya jātattā, evaṃ
analyzed: asekkham sīla kkhandho tayidam na agga phalam sīlam eva adhippetam atha kho yam kiñci 🔽asekkha santāne pavattam sīlam lokuttaraḥ eva na adhippeto sikkhāya jāta ttā evam
translated: he is the most excellent because of his being the best. He is the foremost

original: vimuttikkhandhopīti. Sekkhassa esoti vā, apariyositasikkhattā sayameva sikkhatīti
analyzed: vimutti kkhandhaḥ api iti sekkhassa esaḥ ti vā a pariyosita sikkhattā sayam eva sikkhati iti
translated: The word “learner” is used because his training is not yet finished, or because he trains himself.🔽The aggregate of virtue is found in the four paths and in the first three fruits.

original: vā sekkho, catūsu maggesu heṭṭhimesu ca tīsu phalesu sīlakkhandho. Upari sikkhitabbābhāvato🔽asekkho. Vuḍḍhippatto sekkhoti asekkho. Aggaphalabhūto sīlakkhandho vucceyya, aṭṭhakathāyaṃ
analyzed: vā sekkho catūsu maggesu heṭṭhimesu ca tīsu phalesu sīlakkhandho upari sikkhitabba abhāvato  asekkhaḥ vuḍḍhi ppatto sekkho ti asekkhaḥ agga phala bhūto sīlakkhandho vucceyya aṭṭhakathāyam
translated: The aggregate of virtue of the one beyond training is found in the fourth path and in the fourth fruit.🔽The aggregate of virtue of the one beyond training is called the “highest aggregate of virtue” because there is no virtue higher than it.

original: pana vipassakassa sīlassa adhippetattā tathā attho vutto. Sabbatthāti “asekkhenā”tiādīsu.
analyzed: pana vipassakassa sīlassa adhippeta ttā tathā atthaḥ vutto sabbattha ati asekkhena ātiādīsu
translated: But in the commentary the meaning is given as “the virtue of the one who has insight” because the commentary is concerned with the virtue of the one who has insight.

original: Ettha ca yathā sīlasamādhipaññākkhandhā missakā adhippetā, evaṃ vimuttikkhandhāpīti
analyzed: ettha ca yathā sīla samādhi paññā kkhandhāḥ missakāḥ adhippetāḥ evam vimutti kkhandhāḥ api iti
translated: And just as the aggregates of virtue, concentration, and wisdom are intended here as mixed, so too the aggregate of freedom should be understood as mixed with the aggregates of virtue, concentration, and wisdom.

original: tadaṅgavimuttiādayopi veditabbā, na paṭippassaddhivimutti eva.🔽Yena sippena issāso hoti, taṃ issattanti āha “ususippa”nti. Yassā vāyodhātuyā vasena
analyzed: tad aṅga vimutti ādayaḥ api veditabbā na paṭippassaddhi vimutti eva  yena sippena issāsaḥ hoti tam issattanti āha ususippanti yassā vāyodhātuyā vasena
translated: And the aggregate of knowledge and vision of freedom should be understood as mixed with the five aggregates.🔽The “art of archery” is the art by which one becomes an archer.

original: sarīraṃ sañjātathāmaṃ hoti, taṃ balapaccayaṃ sandhāyāha “balaṃ nāma vāyodhātū”ti.
analyzed: sarīram sañjāta thāmam hoti tam bala paccayam sandhāya āha balam nāma vāyodhātu uti
translated: The “wind element” is the element by which the body becomes light.

original: Samappavattito hi visamappavattinivārakadhātu balaṃ nāma, tena tato aññaṃ balarūpaṃ nāma natthi.
analyzed: sama pavattitaḥ hi visama ppavatti nivāraka dhātu balam nāma tena tatas aññam bala rūpam nāma natthi
translated: For the state of being a condition for the prevention of the occurrence of the unvirtuous is called “strength.” There is no material form called “strength” apart from that.

original: Yasmā arahā eva ekantato sorato, tassa bhāvo soraccanti āha “soraccanti arahatta”nti.
analyzed: yasmai arahā eva ekantataḥ sorataḥ tassa bhāvaḥ soraccanti āha soraccanti arahattanti
translated: Since only the Arahant is entirely straight, he said, “Straightness is Arahantship.”

original: Ete dveti khanti soraccanti ete dve dhammā. Pānīyaṃ pivanti etthāti papā, yo koci
analyzed: ete dve iti khanti soraccanti ete dve dhammā pānīyam pivanti ettha ati yaḥ koci
translated: These two: the two states of patience and straightness.

original: jalāsayo yaṃ kiñci pānīyaṭṭhānanti āha “caturassapokkharaṇīādīnī”ti. Udakavikūlādīsu🔽kamanti atikkamanti etehīti saṅkamanāni, setuādīni. Setukaraṇayuttaṭṭhāne setuṃ,🔽caṅkamanakaraṇayuttaṭṭhāne caṅkamanaṃ, maggakaraṇayuttaṭṭhāne maggaṃ kareyyāti ayamettha
analyzed: jala āsayaḥ yam kiñci pānīya ṭṭhānan ti āha catur assa pokkharaṇī ādīni iti udaka vikūla ādīsu  kamanti atikkamanti etehi iti saṅkamanāni setu ādīni setu karaṇa yutta ṭṭhāne setum  caṅkamana karaṇa yutta ṭṭhāne caṅkamanam magga karaṇa yutta ṭṭhāne maggam kareyya ati ayam ettha
translated: A drinking place is any water-storage place, any place for drinking. He said, “A tank with four steps, etc.,” because a tank is a place for drinking.🔽They go, they cross, by means of these, thus they are fords, namely, bridges, etc. In a place suitable for making a bridge one should make a bridge,

original: adhippāyo. Tenāha “paṇṇāsā”tiādi.
analyzed: adhippāyaḥ tena āha paṇṇāsā ati ādi
translated: in a place suitable for making a walk one should make a walk, in a place suitable for making a road one should make a road. This is the intention here. Therefore he said “fifty,” etc.🔽The practice of going on alms round is the practice of the noble one’s proper conduct for one’s welfare.

original: Bhikkhācāravattanti ariyānaṃ hitaṃ vattapaṭipattiṃ. Dentopīti pi-saddena akhīṇāsavassa
analyzed: bhikkhā cāra vattanti ariyānam hitam vatta paṭipattim dentaḥ api iti pi saddena akhīṇāsavassa
translated: By the word “also” in the text, the meaning is that it is also for one whose cankers are not yet exhausted.

original: dentopīti imamatthaṃ dasseti yassa kassacipi dentenapi kammaphalaṃ saddahitvā vippasannacitteneva
analyzed: dento api iti imam attham dasseti yassa kassaci pi dentena api kamma phalam saddahitvā vippasanna cittena iva
translated: For it is because of the faith in the fruit of kamma that one gives with confidence in one’s heart.

original: dātabbattā. Thanayanti idaṃ tassa mahāmeghabhāvadassanaṃ, yo hi mahāvassaṃ vassati,🔽so gajjanto vijjummālaṃ vissajjento pavassati. Abhisaṅkharitvā samodhānetvāti khādanīyassa
analyzed: dātabba ttā thanayanti idam tassa mahā megha bhāva dassanam yaḥ hi mahā vassam vassati  saḥ gajjantaḥ vijjummālam vissajjentaḥ pavassati abhisaṅkharitvā samodhānetvā ati khādanīyassa
translated: “He thunders” : this shows the state of being a great cloud, for one who rains a great downpour thunders and rains with lightning and with a network of rain-drops.🔽“Having prepared and collected” : having combined the various kinds of food.

original: vividhajātiyāni sampiṇḍetvā. Tenāha “rāsiṃ katvā”ti.
analyzed: vividha jātiyāni sampiṇḍetvā tena āha rāsim katvā iti
translated: Therefore it is said, “having made a heap” .🔽“Scattering” : it is also a scattering because of the many kinds of elements .

original: Pakiraṇaṃ nāma vikiraṇampi hoti anekatthattā dhātūnanti āha “vikiratī”ti. Pakiranto
analyzed: pakiraṇam nāma vikiraṇam pi hoti anekattha ttā dhātūnam ti āha vikirati iti pakirantaḥ
translated: Therefore it is said, “he scatters” .

original: viya vā dānaṃ detīti iminā guṇakhettameva apariyesitvā karuṇākhettepi mahādānaṃ pavattetīti
analyzed: viya vā dānam deti iti iminā guṇa khettam eva a pariyesitvā karuṇā khette pi mahā dānam pavatteti iti
translated: By “scattering” he shows that one gives a great gift in a field of merit of compassion without seeking a field of merit of virtue.

original: dasseti. Tena “pakiretī”ti vadantena bhagavatā aṭṭhuppattiyaṃ āgatatitthiyavādena
analyzed: dasseti tena pakireti iti vadantena bhagavatā aṭṭhuppattiyam āgata titthiya vādena
translated: Therefore by the Blessed One’s saying “he scatters” it is also shown that he has not refuted the doctrine of the sectarians as recorded in the Atthupatti .

original: appaṭisedhitatāpi dīpitā hoti. Puññadhārāti puññamayadhārā puññābhisandā. Sinehayantīti
analyzed: a paṭisedhita tā api dīpitā hoti puñña dhārā ati puñña maya dhārā puñña abhisandā sinehayantī iti
translated: “Stream of merit” : a stream of merit, a flow of merit, a flood of merit.

original: thūladhārenapi sinehena siniddhaṃ karontī. Kiledayantīti allabhāvaṃ pāpayantī. Yathāyaṃ🔽puññadhārā dātāraṃ anto sineheti pūreti abhisandeti, evaṃ paṭiggāhakānampi anto sineheti
analyzed: sinehena siniddham karontī kiledayantī iti alla bhāvam pāpayantī yathā ayam  puñña dhārā dātāram antar sineheti pūreti abhisandeti evam paṭiggāhakānam pi antar sineheti
translated: and with the stream of the gift’s merit it makes them sleek. It makes them sleek means it makes them fresh. Just as

original: pūreti abhisandeti. Tenevāha “dadaṃ piyo hoti bhajanti naṃ bahū”tiādi evaṃ santepi🔽“dātāraṃ abhivassatī”ti vuttattā aṭṭhakathāyaṃ dāyakavaseneva “sinehetī”ti vuttaṃ,
analyzed: pūra iti abhisanda iti tena iva āha bhajanti nam evam santaḥ api  dātāram abhivassati iti vutta ttā aṭṭhakathā ayam dāyaka vasena iva sineheti iti vuttam
translated: this stream of merit makes the giver sleek, full, and satisfied, so too it makes the recipients sleek, full, and satisfied. Hence it is said: “He is dear and becomes more so, many resort to him” .🔽But although this is so, since it is said “it rains down on the giver” , in the commentary it is said “it makes the giver sleek” .

original: yasmā vā paṭiggāhakassa sinehuppatti āmisanissitāti dāyakavaseneva vuttaṃ.
analyzed: yasmā vā paṭiggāhakassa sineha uppatti āmisa nissitā ti dāyaka vasena iva vuttam
translated: Or it is said only of the giver because the recipients’ sleekness arises dependent on the material things.

original: Issattasuttavaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: issatta sutta vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: The commentary on the Issasutta is finished.

original: 5. Pabbatūpamasuttavaṇṇanā🔽136. Khattiyāti abhisekappattā. Issariyamado kāmagedho. Pathavimaṇḍalassa mahantatā
analyzed: pabbatūpama sutta vaṇṇanā  khattiyā ati abhiseka ppattāḥ issariya madaḥ kāma gedhaḥ pathavi maṇḍalassa mahanta tā
translated: The Simile of the Mountain Sutta

original: taṃnivāsinaṃ anuyantatāti sabbamidaṃ yathicchitassa rājakiccassa sukhena samijjhanassa
analyzed: taṃnivāsinam sabbam idam yathā icchitassa rāja kiccassa sukhena
translated: “Khattiya” : one who has received anointment. “Drunkenness with sovereignty” : infatuation with sovereignty. “The vast extent of the earth” : the vast extent of the earth and the vast extent of the people living on it. “The success of his royal tasks” : the success of his royal tasks as he wishes.

original: kāraṇakittanaṃ. Yādise rājakicce ussukkaṃ āpanno, taṃ vitthārato dassetuṃ “esa kirā”tiādi
analyzed: kāraṇa kittanam yādise rāja kicce ussukkam āpannaḥ tam vitthārataḥ dassetum esa kira iti ādi
translated: The praise of the reason. In order to show in detail the king’s business for which he was occupied, it is said: “It is said that … ”

original: vuttaṃ. Antaragamanānīti tiṇṇaṃ nirantaragamanānaṃ antarantarā gamanāni. Corā cintayiṃsūti
analyzed: vuttam antara gamanāni iti tiṇṇam nirantara gamanānam antar antarā gamanāni corā cintayiṃsū ti
translated: The “interim goings” are the goings between the three uninterrupted goings. The thieves thought:

original: eko antarabhogiko rājāparādhiko pañcasatamanussaparivāro coriyaṃ karonto vicarati, te sandhāya vuttaṃ.
analyzed: ekaḥ antarabhogikaḥ rājā aparādhiko pañca sata manussa parivāro coriyam karontaḥ vicarati te sandhāya vuttam
translated: A certain king’s minister who had offended the king was wandering about committing robberies with a retinue of five hundred men. Referring to them, it is said.

original: “Ayuttaṃ te kata”nti sacāhaṃ vakkhāmīti yojanā. Dhuravihāreti rathassa dhuraṃ viya
analyzed: ayuttam te katanti sacā aham vakkhāmi iti yojanā dhura vihāra iti rathassa dhuram viya
translated: “If I say ‘It is not proper for you to do this,’ ” the construction is:

original: nagarassa dhurabhūte vihāre. Santhambhitunti vissāsabhāvena upaṭṭhātuṃ. Saddhāyikoti
analyzed: nagarassa dhura bhūte vihāre santhambhitunti vissāsa bhāvena upaṭṭhātum saddhāyikā ti
translated: In the “chariot-shed,” in the monastery which was like the chariot of the city. “To support” means to attend with confidence. “Trustworthy”

original: saddhāya ayitabbo, saddheyyoti attho. Tenāha “saddhātabbo”ti. Paccayikoti pattiyāyitabbo.
analyzed: saddhāya saddheyyaḥ iti attho tena āha saddhātabbaḥ iti paccayikaḥ ti pattiyā ayitabbaḥ
translated: means to be trusted; the meaning is, “to be trusted.” Therefore it is said: “to be trusted.” “To be relied on” means to be depended on.

original: Abbhasamaṃ puthulabhāvena. Nippothentoti nimmaddento. Saṇhakaraṇīyaṃ atisaṇhaṃ pisanto
analyzed: abbha samam puthula bhāvena nippothentaḥ iti nimmaddentaḥ saṇha karaṇīyam ati saṇham pisantaḥ
translated: Like the sun, because of its vastness. “To rub” means to wipe. Rubbing what is to be rubbed very hard,

original: nisadapoto viya pisanto.
analyzed: nisada poto viya pisantaḥ
translated: rubbing like a ball of cotton.

original: Dhammacariyātiādittampi sīsaṃ celañca ajjhupekkhitvā sammāpaṭipatti eva kātabbā tassā🔽eva paraloke patiṭṭhābhāvato. Ācikkhāmīti kathemi, kathento ca yathā tamatthaṃ sammadeva🔽rājā jānāti, evaṃ jānāpemīti. Nipphatti yuddhena kātabbaatthasiddhi. Visinoti bandhati🔽yathādhippetaṃ cittaṃ etenāti visayo, samatthabhāvo. Mantasampannāti sampannarājamantā.
analyzed: sīsam celam ca ajjhupekkhitvā sammā paṭipatti eva kātabbā tassā  eva para loke patiṭṭhā bhāvataḥ ācikkhāmi iti kathemi kathento ca yathā tam attham sammad eva  rājā jānāti evam nipphatti yuddhena kātabba attha siddhi visinoti bandhati  yathā adhippetam cittam etena ati visayaḥ samattha bhāvaḥ manta sampannā ati sampanna rāja mantā
translated: The right practice is the only thing to be done, after disregarding the head and the skin,🔽because it alone is the support in the next world. I tell is I say. And when I say, I make the king understand the meaning correctly as it is.🔽The success is the accomplishment of the purpose to be achieved by fighting. The object is the province. The state of being able is the ability. Endowed with counsel is endowed with good royal counsel.

original: Mahāamaccāti mahosadhādisadisā nītisatthachekā amaccapurisā. Upalāpetunti paresaṃ🔽antare virodhatthaṃ saṅgaṇhituṃ.🔽Dveyeva pabbatāti pabbatasadisā dveyeva gahitā. Rājovādeti rājovādasutte. Āgatāva🔽tattantiyā anurūpatthaṃ. Vilumpamānāti iti-saddo ādiattho. Vipattīti bhogaparihānādivināso.
analyzed: mahā amaccā ati mahosadha ādi sadisāḥ nīti sattha chekāḥ amacca purisāḥ paresam 🔽antare virodha ttham saṅgaṇhitum 🔽dveye iva pabbatā ati pabbata sadisā dveye iva gahitā rājovāde iti rājovāda sutte āgatā ava 🔽tad tantiyā anurūpa attham vilumpamānā ti iti saddaḥ ādi atthaḥ vipatti iti bhoga parihāna ādi vināsaḥ
translated: The head and the skin are to be looked on with equanimity and the right practice is to be undertaken because that is the support in the next world. I shall tell you : I shall speak. And while speaking I shall cause you to know that matter as the king knows it. Success : the accomplishment of the purpose to be achieved by fighting. The object : the object is that by which the mind is bound as intended. The state of being able : the state of being successful. Endowed with counsel : endowed with the king’s counsel. Great ministers : ministers who are experts in the science of government, like the great medicine-man and others. To win over : to win over others in order to create dissension among them. Two only : two only are taken as being like mountains. In the King’s Speech : in the King’s Speech Discourse . The meaning that is appropriate : the meaning that is appropriate to the words. They are plundering : the word iti has the meaning of beginning. Disaster : loss of wealth, etc.

original: Hatthiyuddhādīhi jarāmaraṇaṃ jinituṃ na sakkā sattassa avisayabhāvato. Yena pana🔽jinituṃ sakkā, taṃ dassento bhagavā “buddhe…pe… nivesaye”ti āha. Ratanattaye hi saddhā
analyzed: hatthi yuddha ādīhi jarā maraṇam jinitum na sakkā sattassa avisaya bhāvataḥ yena pana  jinitum sakkā tam dassentaḥ bhagavā buddha īpe nivesaya iti āha rata nattaye hi saddhā
translated: and it is not possible to conquer aging and death by elephant fights and so on, because they are beyond the power of living beings. But the Blessed One, showing what is possible to conquer, said: “In the Buddha … etc.” For it is possible to conquer aging and death by faith in the Triple Gem.

original: niviṭṭhā mūlajātā patiṭṭhitā ekantato jarāmaraṇavijayāya hoti. Tenāha “tasmā saddha”nti.
analyzed: niviṭṭhā mūla jātā patiṭṭhitā ekantataḥ jarā maraṇa vijayāya hoti tena āha tasmai sat hanti
translated: and the like, because the living being is not in a position to do so. But the Blessed One, showing what can be conquered, said: “In the Buddha … and so on up to … he should establish confidence.” For when confidence is established in the Triple Gem, rooted and grounded, it is entirely for the conquest of aging and death. Hence he said: “Therefore, in confidence.”

original: Pabbatūpamasuttavaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: pabbatūpama sutta vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: The commentary on the Uruvelakassapa Sutta is finished.

original: Tatiyavaggavaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.🔽Sāratthappakāsiniyā saṃyuttanikāya-aṭṭhakathāya
analyzed: tatiya vagga vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā  sārattha ppakāsiniyā saṃyutta nikāya aṭṭhakathāya
translated: The commentary on the third section is finished.🔽The commentary on the Kosala Samyutta🔽is finished.

original: Kosalasaṃyuttavaṇṇanāya līnatthappakāsanā samattā.🔽4. Mārasaṃyuttaṃ
translated: The Kosala Samyutta

original: 1. Paṭhamavaggo
analyzed: paṭhama vaggo
translated: The First Chapter

original: 1. Tapokammasuttavaṇṇanā
analyzed: tapokamma sutta vaṇṇanā
translated: The Commentary on the Tapokamma Sutta

original: 137. Uruvelāya samīpe gāmo uruvelagāmo, taṃ uruvelagāmaṃ abhimukhabhāvena sammadeva
analyzed: samīpe gāmaḥ uruvelagāmaḥ tam uruvelagāmam abhimukha bhāvena
translated: The village of Uruvela is the village of Uruvela near the river Neranjara. The Blessed One, having gone to the village of Uruvela,

original: sabbadhamme bujjhatīti abhisambodhi, sabbaññutaññāṇaṃ, tena samannāgatattā ca bhagavā
analyzed: sabba dhamme bujjhati iti abhisambodhi sabbaññuta ññāṇam tena samannāgata ttā ca bhagavā
translated: is the supreme enlightenment, the knowledge of omniscience, and the Blessed One is so called because he possesses that knowledge.

original: abhisambuddhoti vuccati. Tassa pañcacattālīsāya vassesu ādito pannarasa vassāni paṭhamabodhi,
analyzed: abhisambuddhaḥ ti vuccati tassa pañcacattālīsāya vassesu āditas pannarasa vassāni paṭhama bodhi
translated: He is called “fully enlightened.” For fifteen years from the time of his enlightenment he was a “newly enlightened one.”

original: idha pana sattāhabbhantarameva adhippetanti āha “abhisambuddho hutvā antosattāhasmiṃ
analyzed: idha pana satta aha bbhantaram eva adhippetanti āha abhisambuddhaḥ hutvā anto sattāhasmin
translated: But here the seven days immediately following the enlightenment are intended.

original: yevā”ti. Asukhabhāvena aññehi kātuṃ asakkuṇeyyattā dukkaraṃ karotīti dukkarakāro,🔽so eva itthiliṅgavasena dukkarakārikā. Tāya mutto vatamhīti cintesi. Yadi evaṃ kasmā
analyzed: yeva ati asukha bhāvena aññehi kātum dukkaram karoti iti dukkara kāro  sā u eva itthi liṅga vasena dukkara kārikā tāya muttaḥ vatamhi iti cintesi yadi evam kasmā
translated: He is called “one who does what is hard to do” because he does what is hard to do by virtue of his lack of pleasure.🔽The feminine form of the word is “one who does what is hard to do for a woman.”

original: taṃ lokanātho chabbassāni samanuyuñjati? Kammapīḷitavasena. Vuttañhetaṃ apadāne –
analyzed: tam lokanātho cha bassāni samanuyuñjati kamma pīḍita vasena vuttam ha etam apadāne
translated: He thought, “I am freed by her.” If that is so, why did the Lord of the World pursue her for six years? Because of the oppression of kamma. For this is said in the Apadana:

original: “Avacāhaṃ jotipālo, sugataṃ kassapaṃ tadā;
analyzed: avaca aham joti pālaḥ sugatam kassapam tadā
translated: “I, Jotipala, then spoke to the Sugata Kassapa:

original: Kuto nu bodhi muṇḍassa, bodhi paramadullabhā.
analyzed: kutas nu bodhi muṇḍassa bodhi parama dullabhā
translated: ‘How can a shaveling monk like you attain enlightenment, which is so hard to attain?’

original: “Tena kammavipākena, acariṃ dukkaraṃ bahuṃ;
analyzed: tena kamma vipākena acarim dukkaram bahum
translated: “By the result of that kamma I did much that is hard to do;

original: Chabbassānuruvelāyaṃ, tato bodhimapāpuṇiṃ.
analyzed: tatas bodhim apāpuṇim
translated: For six years at Uruvela, then I attained enlightenment.

original: “Nāhaṃ etena maggena, pāpuṇiṃ bodhimuttamaṃ;
analyzed: na aham etena maggena pāpuṇim bodhim uttamam
translated: “I did not attain the supreme enlightenment by that path;

original: Kummaggena gavesissaṃ, pubbakammena vārito”ti.
analyzed: kummaggena gavesissam pubba kammena vārito ti
translated: I was obstructed by my previous kamma as I sought it by the wrong path.”

original: Māretīti vibādheti. Vipattiādisaṃyojanañhi sādhūnaṃ paramatthato maraṇaṃ saccapaṭivedhamāraṇattā,
analyzed: māra iti iti vibādha iti vipatti ādi saṃyojanam hi sādhūnam paramatthataḥ maraṇam sacca paṭivedha māraṇa ttā
translated: “He kills” : he obstructs. For the fetter of disaster, etc., is a “killing” of the good in the ultimate sense, since it kills the penetration of the truth,

original: pāpatarattā pāpatamoti pāpimā. Sā cassa pāpatamatā pāpavuttitāyāti āha “pāpe niyutto”ti.
analyzed: pāpatara ttā pāpatamaḥ ti pāpimā sā ca ssa pāpatama tā pāpa vutti tāya ati āha pāpe niyuttaḥ ti
translated: and he is “the most sinful” because of his extreme sinfulness. His extreme sinfulness is his sinful conduct. Thus it is said, “he is devoted to sin.”

original: Adhipatīti kāmādhipati. Appahīnakāmarāge attano vase vattetīti vasavattī. Tesaṃyeva
analyzed: adhipati iti kāma adhipati appahīna kāma rāge attanaḥ vase vatteti iti vasa vattī tesam yeva
translated: “Lord” : lord of sense desires. “He rules” : he makes those who have not abandoned sense desire come under his control.

original: kusalakammānaṃ antaṃ karotīti antako. Vaṭṭadukkhato aparimuttapaccayattā namuci.
analyzed: kusala kammānam antam karoti iti antakaḥ vaṭṭa dukkhataḥ a parimutta paccaya ttā namuci
translated: “He makes an end” : he makes an end of those very wholesome kamma-formations. He is “Namuci” because he is a condition for non-escape from the suffering of the round.

original: Mattānaṃ pamattānaṃ bandhūti pamattabandhu.🔽Tapokammāti attakilamathānuyogato. Aparaddhoti virajjhasi. “Aparādho”tipi atthi,
analyzed: mattānam pamattānam bandhu uti pamatta bandhu  tapokammā ati atta kilamatha anuyogataḥ aparaddho ti virajjhasi aparādho tipi atthi
translated: “He is the kinsman of the heedless” : he is the kinsman of those who are heedless.🔽“He is a tormentor” : because of his pursuit of self-mortification. “He is a transgressor” : he is one who has fallen away from non-greed, etc. “Transgressor” is also a term for one who has fallen away from the path.

original: soyeva attho. Kāyakilamathaṃ anuyuñjanto yebhuyyena amaratthāya anuyuñjati, so ca🔽kammavādīhi anuyuñjiyamāno devatthāya siyāti āha “amarabhāvatthāyā”ti. Sabbaṃ tapanti
analyzed: kāya kilamatham anuyuñjantaḥ yebhuyyena amara tthāya anuyuñjati saḥ ca 🔽kamma vādīhi anuyuñjiyamānaḥ deva atthāya siyā ti āha amara bhāva tthāya ati sabbam tapanti
translated: “He is a tormentor” : because of his pursuit of self-mortification. “He is a transgressor” : he is one who has fallen away from non-greed, etc. “Transgressor” is also a term for one who has fallen away from the path.🔽“He is a tormentor” : because of his pursuit of self-mortification. “He is a transgressor” : he is one who has fallen away from non-greed, etc. “Transgressor” is also a term for one who has fallen away from the path.🔽“He is a tormentor” : because of his pursuit of self-mortification. “He is a transgressor” : he is one who has fallen away from non-greed, etc. “Transgressor” is also a term for one who has fallen away from the path.

original: sabbaṃ attaparitāpanaṃ. Atthāvahaṃ na bhavati bodhiyā anupāyattā. Kiñcassāti kiñci🔽siyāti attho. Phiyārittaṃva dhammanīti dhammaṃ vuccati vaṇṇu, so idha “dhamma”nti
analyzed: sabbam atta paritāpanam attha āvaham na bhavati bodhiyā an upāyattā kiñcassa ati kiñci  siyā ti attho dhammani iti dhammam vuccati saḥ idha dhammanti
translated: all is torment of self. It does not lead to what is profitable for enlightenment because it is not the right way. What, then, is it?

original: vutto, dhammani vaṇṇupadeseti attho. Tenāha “araññe”ti. Ubhosu passesu phiyāhi ākaḍḍheyya🔽ceva arittehi uppīḷeyya ca.🔽Sammāvācākammantājīvā gahitā maggasīlassa adhippetattā. Samādhino hi gahaṇena sammāvāyāmasatisamādhayo
analyzed: vuttaḥ dhammani vaṇṇa upadese ti attho tena āha araññā iti ubhosu passesu phiyāhi ākaḍḍheyya  ca iva arittehi uppīḍeyya ca  sammā vācā kammanta ājīvāḥ gahitāḥ magga sīlassa adhippeta ttā samādhinaḥ hi gahaṇena sammā vāyāma sati samādhayaḥ
translated: What is it? is the meaning. The Dhamma is called “the right way” because it is the way to be gone by . Herein, “the right way” is said to be “the Dhamma” . The meaning is that it is the teaching of the Dhamma. Hence he said “in the forest” . He would pull them with ropes on both sides and torment them with goads.🔽Right speech, right action, and right livelihood are included because the virtue of the path is intended. For when concentration is included, right effort, right mindfulness, and right concentration are included too because they are helpful. The same method applies to understanding.

original: gahitā upakārabhāvato. Paññāyāti etthāpi eseva nayo. Bujjhati etenāti bodho. Maggoti🔽āha “bodhāyāti maggatthāyā”ti. Kathaṃ pana maggaṃ maggatthāya bhāvetīti āha “yathā
analyzed: gahitāḥ upakāra bhāvato paññāya ati ettha api esā iva nayaḥ bujjhati etena ati bodhaḥ maggo ti  āha bodhāya ati magga tthāya ati katham pana maggam magga tthāya bhāveti iti āha yathā
translated: Enlightenment is what enlightens, thus it is enlightenment . The path is what is gone by , thus it is a path .

original: hī”tiādi. Tena yathā yāgupacanārambho yāvadeva yāguattho, evaṃ maggabhāvanārambho
analyzed: hi itiādi tena yathā yāgu pacana ārambhaḥ yāvat eva yāgu atthaḥ evam magga bhāvanā ārambhaḥ
translated: “For the sake of enlightenment” means for the sake of the path. But how does he develop the path for the sake of the path? He said “Just as” , etc. For just as the beginning of the cooking of the rice is only for the sake of the cooked rice, so too the beginning of the development of the path is only for the sake of the path.

original: maggādhigamatthāyāti dasseti. Ārambhoti ca ariyamaggabhāvanāya bandhāpanaṃ daṭṭhabbaṃ.🔽Keci pana “magganti ariyamaggaṃ, bodhāyāti arahattasambodhāya, evañca katvā ‘pattosmi
analyzed: magga adhigama atthāya ati dasseti ca ariya magga bhāvanāya bandhāpanam daṭṭhabbaṃ  keci pana magganti ariya maggam bodhāya ati arahatta sambodhāya evam ca katvā pattaḥ smi
translated: He shows that it is for the purpose of attaining the path. And the “beginning” should be regarded as the binding of the development of the noble path.🔽But some say that “path” is the noble path, and “for the sake of enlightenment” is for the sake of the enlightenment of arahantship. And so the statement “I have attained the supreme security from bondage” is also established.

original: paramasuddhi’nti idampi vacanaṃ samatthita”nti vadanti, apare pana “sabbaññutaññāṇasambodhāyāti.
analyzed: parama suddhin ti idam pi vacanam samatthitan ti vadanti apare pana sabbaññu taññāṇa sambodhāya ati
translated: Others say that it is for the sake of the enlightenment of omniscient knowledge.🔽For that is higher than all enlightenment.

original: So hi sabbasmāpi bodhito uttaritaro”ti. Nihato nibbisevanabhāvaṃ pāpito. Tenāha “parājito”ti.
analyzed: so hi sabbasmā api bodhitaḥ uttaritaro ti nihataḥ nibbisevana bhāvam tena āha parājitaḥ iti
translated: “Vanquished” means brought to the state of being destroyed. Hence he said “defeated.”

original: Tapokammasuttavaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: tapokamma sutta vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: The commentary on the Tapokammasutta is finished.

original: 2. Hatthirājavaṇṇasuttavaṇṇanā
translated: The commentary on the Hatthirājavaṇṇasutta is finished.

original: 138. Andhabhāvakāraketi pacurajanassa cakkhuviññāṇuppattinivāraṇena andhabhāvakārake.
analyzed: andha bhāva kārake ti pacura janassa cakkhu viññāṇa uppatti nivāraṇena andha bhāva kārake
translated: Causing blindness: causing blindness by preventing the arising of eye-consciousness in ordinary people.

original: Mahātameti mahati tamasi. Pāsāṇaphalake mahācīvaraṃ sīse ṭhapetvāti etena taṃ phalakaṃ
analyzed: mahātamā iti mahati tamasi pāsāṇa phalake mahā cīvaram sīse etena tam phalakam
translated: Great darkness: great darkness. Having placed the great robe on a stone slab on his head: this shows that he was sitting without seeing that slab.

original: apassāya nisinnoti dasseti. Padhānanti bhāvanaṃ. Pariggaṇhamānoti sabbaso gaṇhanto
analyzed: a passāya nisinnaḥ ti dasseti padhānam ti bhāvanam pariggaṇhamāno ti sabbasas gaṇhantaḥ
translated: Practice: development. Examining: taking hold of entirely.

original: avissajjento, bhāvanaṃ anuyuñjanto anupubbasamāpattiyo phalasamāpattiñca manasikarontoti
analyzed: a vissajjentaḥ bhāvanam anuyuñjantaḥ anupubba samāpattiyaḥ phala samāpattiñca manasikarontaḥ ti
translated: He is not giving them away, but is devoted to development, giving attention to the jhānas and the fruition attainment.

original: attho. Tenāha “nanu cā”tiādi. Ariṭṭhakoti ariṭṭhakavaṇṇo. Tenāha “kāḷako”ti.
analyzed: attho tena āha nanu ca atiādi ariṭṭhakaḥ ti ariṭṭhaka vaṇṇo tena āha kāḷakaḥ iti
translated: The meaning is that. Hence he says, “But is not …?” Ariṭṭhaka is the colour of an ariṭṭhaka bean. Hence he says “black.”

original: Dīghamaddhānanti cirataraṃ kālaṃ. Saṃsaranti āsādanādhippāyena sañcaranto, alaṃ tuyhaṃ etena nippayojananti adhippāyo. Na hi tena mārassa kāci atthasiddhīti.
analyzed: cirataram kālam saṃsaranti āsādana adhippāyena sañcarantaḥ alam etena nippayojananti adhippāyaḥ na hi tena mārassa kāci attha siddhi iti
translated: For a long time: for a very long time. They wander on: they go on transmigrating with the aim of finding satisfaction. The meaning is that it is enough for you, it is useless. For no purpose of Mara’s is thereby served.

original: Hatthirājavaṇṇasuttavaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: hatthirājavaṇṇa sutta vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: The commentary on the Elephant-foot Plant Jātaka is finished.

original: 3. Subhasuttavaṇṇanā
analyzed: subha sutta vaṇṇanā
translated: The Good

original: 139. Susaṃvutāti maggasaṃvarena suṭṭhu saṃvutā. Supihitāti suṭṭhu pihitā. Vasānugāti kāyādidvāravasānugā vasavattino na honti. Baddhacarāti paṭibaddhacariyāti.
analyzed: su saṃvutā ati magga saṃvarena suṭṭhu saṃvutā su pihitā ati suṭṭhu pihitā vasa anugā ati kāya ādi dvāra vasa anugāḥ vasa vattinaḥ na honti baddha carā ati paṭibaddha cariyā ati
translated: Well-restrained: well restrained by the restraint of the path. Well-covered: well covered up. Not following after the will: not following after the will in the sense of the faculties of body, etc., they do not act according to the will. Bound to the course: bound to the course of conduct.

original: Subhasuttavaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: subha sutta vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: The commentary on the Good Jātaka is finished.

original: 4. Paṭhamamārapāsasuttavaṇṇanā
translated: The first Mara-Snare Jātaka

original: 140. Upāyamanasikārenāti aniccādīsu aniccādito manasikaraṇena. Upāyavīriyenāti anuppannākusalānaṃ
analyzed: upāya manasikārena ati anicca ādīsu anicca āditaḥ manasikaraṇena upāya vīriyena ati anuppanna akusalānam
translated: By the right kind of attention: by giving attention to impermanence, etc., in the sense of impermanence, etc. By the right kind of energy: by the energy that abandons unarisen unprofitable things

original: anuppādanāya vidhinā pavattavīriyena. Kāraṇavīriyenāti anuppannānuppādanādiatthassa
analyzed: an uppādanāya vidhinā pavatta vīriyena kāraṇa vīriyena ati anuppanna anuppādana ādi atthassa
translated: with the energy that occurs by way of the method of non-arising. With the energy of the reason: with the energy that is the reason for the

original: kāraṇabhūtena vīriyena. Anuppannapāpakānuppādanādiatthāni hi vīriyāni yadatthaṃ honti,🔽taṃ atthaṃ sādhentiyevāti etassa atthassa dīpako sammā-saddo. Yonisosammāsaddena
analyzed: kāraṇa bhūtena vīriyena anuppanna pāpaka anuppādana ādi atthāni hi vīriyāni yadattham honti  tam attham sādhentiyā iva ati etassa atthassa dīpakaḥ sammāsaddaḥ yoniso sammāsaddena
translated: purpose of non-arising, etc. For the energies that are for the purpose of🔽non-arising, etc., accomplish that purpose. The word “rightly” illuminates🔽this meaning. For the words “with the energy of the method, with the energy of the reason” are said with reference to the illumination of the meaning of

original: hi upāyakāraṇatthadīpakataṃ sandhāya “upāyavīriyena kāraṇavīriyenā”ti vuttaṃ. Arahattaphalavimutti🔽ukkaṭṭhaniddesena. Mārena “mayhaṃ kho, bhikkhave”tiādikaṃ bhagavato vacanaṃ sutvā
analyzed: hi upāya kāraṇa attha dīpaka tam sandhāya upāya vīriyena kāraṇa vīriyena ati vuttam arahatta phala vimutti  ukkaṭṭha niddesena mārena mayham kho bhikkhave iti ādikam bhagavataḥ vacanam sutvā
translated: the reason of the method. With the energy of the liberation of the fruit of arahatship: with the energy of the highest liberation.🔽After hearing the Exalted One’s words beginning with “Monks, I am not

original: vuttaṃ “arahattaṃ patvāpi na tussatī”tiādi.🔽Kilesapāsenāti kilesamārassa upāyabhūtena. Kilesamāro hi satte kāmaguṇapāsehi nibandhati,
analyzed: vuttam arahattam patvā api na tussati itiādi  kilesa pāsena ati kilesa mārassa upāya bhūtena kilesa māraḥ hi satte kāma guṇa pāsehi nibandhati
translated: satisfied even with the attainment of arahatship,” Mara said, “He is not satisfied even with the attainment of arahatship.”🔽With the weapon of defilement: with the energy that is the method of the🔽Mara of defilement. For the Mara of defilement binds beings with the snares of the sense pleasures, but not by himself. Therefore it is said: “The divine🔽sense pleasures that are called … “

original: na pana sayameva. Tenāha “ye dibbā kāmaguṇasaṅkhātā”tiādi. Mārabandhaneti kilesamārassa
analyzed: na pana sayam eva tena āha ye dibbā kāma guṇa saṅkhātā atiādi māra bandhanā iti kilesa mārassa
translated: With the bondage of Mara: with the energy that is the method of the Mara of🔽death.

original: bandhanaṭṭhāne, bhavacāraketi attho. Na me samaṇa mokkhasīti idaṃ māro “anuttarā
analyzed: bandhana ṭṭhāne bhava cāraka iti atthaḥ na me samaṇa mokkhasi iti idam māraḥ anuttarā
translated: In the place of bondage, meaning in the prison of existence.🔽He says, “You will not escape from me,” not believing the Blessed One’s words, “I have attained the supreme

original: vimutti anuppattā, vimuttā sabbapāsehī”ti ca bhagavato vacanaṃ asaddahanto vadati🔽saddahantopi vā “evamayaṃ paresaṃ sattānaṃ mokkhāya ussāhaṃ na kareyyā”ti attano
analyzed: vimutti anuppattā vimuttā sabba pāsehi iti ca bhagavataḥ vacanam a saddahantaḥ vadati  saddahantaḥ api vā evam ayam paresam sattānam mokkhāya ussāham na kareyyāti attano
translated: liberation; I am liberated from all suffering.”🔽Or, even if he believes them, he says this, standing in his own

original: kohaññe ṭhatvā vadati.
analyzed: kohaññe vadati
translated: conceit, “In this way you will not make an effort to liberate other beings.”

original: Paṭhamamārapāsasuttavaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: paṭhama mārapāsa sutta vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: The commentary on the first Māra-thread is finished.

original: 5. Dutiyamārapāsasuttavaṇṇanā
analyzed: dutiya mārapāsa sutta vaṇṇanā
translated: The commentary on the second Māra-thread

original: 141. Anupubbagamanacārikanti gāmanigamarājadhānīsu anukkamena gamanasaṅkhātaṃ cārikaṃ. Evaṃ hi gatesūti evaṃ tumhesu bahūsu ekajjhaṃ gatesu.
analyzed: anupubba gamana cārikanti gāma nigama rājadhānīsu anukkamena gamana saṅkhātam cārikam evam hi gatesu iti evam tumhesu bahūsu ekajjham gatesu
translated: A journey in stages: a journey consisting of going in stages through villages, towns, and royal cities. Thus gone: thus you, many, have gone together.

original: Ādimhi kalyāṇaṃ etassāti ādikalyāṇaṃ, tathā sesesu. Sāsanassa ādi sīlaṃ mūlakattā.
analyzed: ādimhi kalyāṇam etassa ati ādikalyāṇam tathā sesesu sāsanassa ādi sīlam mūla kattā
translated: It is good in the beginning: it has a good beginning. So too with the rest. Virtue is the beginning of the dispensation because it is the foundation.

original: Tassa samathādayo majjhaṃ sāsanasampattiyā vemajjhabhāvato. Phalanibbānāni pariyosānaṃ
analyzed: tassa samatha ādayaḥ majjham sāsana sampattiyāḥ vemajjha bhāvataḥ phala nibbānāni pariyosānam
translated: Its calm, etc., are the middle because they are the middle of the dispensation’s excellence. Its fruit, Nibbāna, is the end.

original: tadadhigamato uttari karaṇīyābhāvato. Sāsane sammāpaṭipatti nāma paññāya hoti, tassā
analyzed: tad adhigamataḥ uttari karaṇīya abhāvato sāsane sammāpaṭipatti nāma paññāya hoti tassā
translated: because there is nothing further to be done after the discovery of that. Right practice in the Dispensation is understanding, and its root is virtue and concentration.

original: ca sīlaṃ samādhi ca mūlanti āha “sīlasamādhayo vā ādī”ti. Yasmā paññā anubodhapaṭivedhavasena
analyzed: ca sīlam samādhi ca mūlan ti āha sīla samādhayaḥ vā ādi iti yasmai paññā anubodha paṭivedha vasena
translated: So he said: “The beginning is virtue and concentration” .🔽Since understanding is twofold as direct-knowledge and penetration ,

original: duvidhā, tasmā tadubhayaṃ gaṇhanto “vipassanāmaggā majjha”nti āha. Paññānipphatti
analyzed: duvidhā tasmā tat ubhayam gaṇhantaḥ vipassanā maggāḥ majjhanti āha paññā nipphatti
translated: he said: “Insight and path are the middle” , including both of them.

original: phalakiccaṃ, nibbānasacchikiriyā pana sammāpaṭipattiyā pariyosānaṃ tato paraṃ kattabbābhāvatoti
analyzed: phala kiccam nibbāna sacchikiriyā pana sammāpaṭipattiyā pariyosānam tatas param kattabba abhāvato ti
translated: The fruit and the function of the path are the fruition and the cessation of suffering. The realization of Nibbāna is the end of right practice because there is nothing further to be done after that.

original: āha “phalanibbānāni pariyosāna”nti. Phalaggahaṇena hi saupādisesanibbānaṃ gayhati,
analyzed: āha phala nibbānāni pariyosānanti phala ggahaṇena hi saupādisesa nibbānam gayhati
translated: So he said: “The end is fruition and Nibbāna” . For by the mention of the fruit the Nibbāna with substrate is included,

original: itarena itaraṃ, tadubhayavasena paṭipattiyā osānanti āha “phalanibbānāni pariyosāna”nti.
analyzed: itarena itaram tad ubhaya vasena paṭipattiyāḥ osānam ti āha phala nibbānāni pariyosānam ti
translated: and by the mention of Nibbāna the Nibbāna without substrate is included. The practice has its end in both of these. That is why he said: “The end is fruition and Nibbāna” .

original: “Tasmātiha tvaṃ, bhikkhu, ādimeva visodhehi kusalesu dhammesu. Ko cādi kusalānaṃ
analyzed: tasmāt iha tvam bhikkhu ādim eva visodhehi kusalesu dhammesu kaḥ ca ādi kusalānam
translated: “Therefore, bhikkhu, purify the beginning, purify the middle, and purify the end in profitable states.

original: dhammānaṃ? Sīlañca suvisuddhaṃ, diṭṭhi ca ujukā”ti vacanato sīladiṭṭhujukatāya matthakabhūtā
analyzed: dhammānam sīlam ca su visuddham diṭṭhi ca ujukā ati vacanataḥ sīla diṭṭha ujuka tāya matthaka bhūtā
translated: “And what is the root of states? Virtue well purified, and right view” , insight is the culmination of virtue and right view;

original: vipassanā, tadadhiṭṭhānā sīlasamādhīti ime tassa sāsanassa mūlanti āha “sīlasamādhivipassanā
analyzed: vipassanā tad adhiṭṭhānā sīla samādhi iti ime tassa sāsanassa mūlan ti āha sīla samādhi vipassanā
translated: and virtue and concentration are based on that. So he said “The beginning is virtue, concentration, and insight,”

original: vā ādī”ti. Sesaṃ vuttanayameva.
analyzed: vā ādi iti sesam vutta nayam eva
translated: The rest is as already stated.

original: Kiñcāpi avayavavinimutto samudāyo natthi, yesu pana avayavesu samudāyarūpena apekkhitesu
analyzed: kiñca api avayava vinimuttaḥ samudāyaḥ natthi yesu pana avayavesu samudāya rūpena apekkhitesu
translated: Although there is no assemblage apart from the components, still🔽the verse is called a “stanza” when the components are regarded as a whole.

original: gāthāti samaññā, taṃ tato bhinnaṃ viya katvā dassento “catuppadikagāthāya tāva paṭhamapādo”tiādimāha.🔽Pañcapadachappadānaṃ gāthānaṃ ādipariyosānaggahaṇena itare dutiyādayo tayo cattāro
analyzed: gāthā ati samaññā tam tatas bhinnam viya katvā dassento catuppadika gāthāya tāva paṭhama pāda iti ādim āha  gāthānam ādi pariyosāna ggahaṇena itare dutiya ādayo tayo cattāro
translated: And so, as if showing it as if it were separate from that, he said, “The first quarter of a four-quarter stanza.”🔽The first and last quarters of a five-quarter or a seven-quarter stanza are included by the inclusion of the first and last quarters of a four-quarter stanza.🔽So the other three or four quarters are the middle.🔽The middle of a sutta with a single sequence is included by the inclusion of the first and last quarters of a four-quarter stanza.

original: vā majjhanti avuttasiddhamevāti na vuttaṃ. Ekānusandhikasuttassāti idaṃ bahuvibhāgaṃ
analyzed: vā majjhanti avutta siddham eva ati na vuttam eka anusandhika suttassa ti idam bahu vibhāgam
translated: So the middle of a sutta with a single sequence is included by the inclusion of the first and last quarters of a four-quarter stanza.🔽So the middle of a sutta with a single sequence is included by the inclusion of the first and last quarters of a four-quarter stanza.🔽So the middle of a sutta with a single sequence is included by the inclusion of the first and last quarters of a four-quarter stanza.🔽So the middle of a sutta with a single sequence is included by the inclusion of the first and last quarters of a four-quarter stanza.🔽So the middle of a sutta with a single sequence is included by the inclusion of the first and last quarters of a four-quarter stanza.🔽So the middle of a sutta with a single sequence is included by the inclusion of the first and last quarters of a four-quarter stanza.🔽So the middle of a sutta with a single sequence is included by the inclusion of the first and last quarters of a four-quarter stanza.🔽So the middle of a sutta with a single sequence is included by the inclusion of the first and last quarters of a four-quarter stanza.🔽So the middle of a sutta with a single sequence is included by the inclusion of the first and last quarters of a four-quarter stanza.🔽So the middle of a sutta with a single sequence is included by the inclusion of the first and last quarters of a four-quarter stanza.

original: yathānusandhinā ekānusandhikaṃ suttaṃ sandhāya vuttaṃ, itarassa pana teyeva desetabbadhammavibhāgena
analyzed: yathā anusandhinā eka anusandhikam suttam sandhāya vuttam itarassa pana te eva desetabba dhamma vibhāgena
translated: So the middle of a sutta with a single sequence is included by the

original: ādimajjhapariyosānabhāgā labbhanti. Nidānanti kāladesakaparisādi-apadisanalakkhaṇādiko
analyzed: ādi majjha pariyosāna bhāgāḥ labbhanti nidāna nti kāla desaka parisā ādi apadisana lakkhaṇa ādiko
translated: The beginning, middle, and end are the parts. The meaning of the nidāna is the indication of time, place, persons, and so on.

original: attho. Idamavocāti iti-saddo ādiattho. Tena tadavasesanigamanapāḷiṃ saṅgaṇhāti. Anekānusandhīkassa
analyzed: atthaḥ idam avoca iti iti saddo ādi attho tena tad avasesa nigamana pāḷim saṅgaṇhāti aneka anusandhīkassa
translated: The word “thus” has the meaning of “in the beginning.” It includes the rest of the text, the concluding section.

original: saha nidānena paṭhamo anusandhi ādi. Saha nigamanena pacchimo pariyosānaṃ, itarena
analyzed: saha nidānena paṭhamaḥ anusandhi ādi saha nigamanena pacchimaḥ pariyosānaṃ itarena
translated: The first section, together with the nidāna, is the beginning of the text, which has many sections. The last section, together with the conclusion, is the end. The rest is the middle.

original: majjhimantiādimajjhapariyosānāni veditabbāni.
analyzed: majjhima ti ādi majjha pariyosānāni veditabbāni
translated: Thus the beginning, middle, and end should be understood.

original: Sātthakanti atthasampattiyā sātthakaṃ katvā. Sabyañjananti byañjanasampattiyā sabyañjanaṃ.
analyzed: sātthakam ti attha sampattiyā sātthakam katvā sa byañjanam ti byañjana sampattiyā sa byañjanam
translated: “With its meaning”: with the perfection of meaning. “With its phrasing”: with the perfection of phrasing.

original: Sampatti ca nāma paripuṇṇabyañjanatāti āha “byañjanehi…pe… desetā”ti. Sakalaparipuṇṇanti
analyzed: ca nāma paripuṇṇa byañjana tā iti āha sakala paripuṇṇa nti
translated: Perfection is the completeness of the phrasing. Therefore it is said: “The Teacher taught it with the phrasing complete.”

original: sabbaso paripuṇṇaṃ sīlādipañcadhammakkhandhapāripūriyā. Nirupakkilesaṃ diṭṭhimānādiupakkilesābhāvato.
analyzed: sabbaso paripuṇṇam sīla ādi pañca dhamma kkhandha pāripūriyā nirupakkilesam diṭṭhi māna ādi upakkilesa abhāvato
translated: “With its details”: with all the details complete. The five aggregates of virtue and so on are complete in every way. It is without corruption, because it is free from the corruptions of conceit and so on.

original: Avisesato tisso sikkhā sakale sāsane bhavanti. Dhammoti pana brahmacariyaṃ vā sandhāya
analyzed: avisesato tissaḥ sikkhāḥ sakale sāsane bhavanti dhammaḥ ti pana brahmacariyam vā sandhāya
translated: In general, the three trainings are found in the whole of the Dispensation. But the word “Dhamma” may refer to the holy life.

original: vuttaṃ “katamesānaṃ kho, bhante, buddhānaṃ bhagavantānaṃ brahmacariyaṃ ciraṭṭhitikaṃ🔽ahosī”tiādīsu viya. Dukūlasāṇiyā paṭicchannā viya, na tu pākāraselādipaṭicchannā
analyzed: vuttam katamesānam kho bhante buddhānam bhagavantānam brahmacariyam cira ṭṭhitikam  ahosi itiādīsu viya dukūla sāṇiyā paṭicchannā viya na tu pākāra selā ādi paṭicchannā
translated: as in the passage beginning, “Which Enlightened Ones, Lord, have had their Brahma-faring last long? ”🔽as if covered by a fine cloth, not as if covered by a wall, a rampart, etc.

original: viya. Tena dhammaniruttiyā sakalakilesānaṃ pahānānubhāvaṃ vadati. Alābhaparihāniyā,
analyzed: viya tena dhamma niruttiyā sakala kilesānam pahāna anubhāvam vadati alābha parihāniyā
translated: “Which Buddhas’ Brahmacariyas lasted long?” and so on. It is as if they were covered by a fine cloth, not as if they were covered by a wall or a fence. He thus speaks of the power of the destruction of all defilements by the knowledge of the True Idea. By non-gain and non-loss,

original: na laddhaparihāniyā. Aḍḍhuḍḍhānīti pañcasatādhikāni tīṇi pāṭihāriyasahassāni. Sātanti sukhaṃ.
analyzed: na laddha parihāniyāḥ aḍḍhuḍḍhāni iti pañca sata adhikāni tīṇi pāṭihāriya sahassāni sātanti sukham
translated: not by gain and loss. By the three thousand and five hundred wonders: three thousand and five hundred wonders. Happiness: pleasure.

original: Dutiyamārapāsasuttavaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: dutiya mārapāsa sutta vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: The commentary on the second Mara-tie sutta is finished.

original: 6. Sappasuttavaṇṇanā🔽142. Surākārakānanti piṭṭhasurāyojanakānaṃ. Kosalānaṃ issaroti kosalo, kosalarājassa🔽ayanti kosalikā. Paribhogapātīti bhattaparibhojanatthāya pāti paribhogapāti. Kammāruddhanapaṇāḷiyāti
analyzed: sappa sutta vaṇṇanā  surā kārakānam ti piṭṭha surā yojanakānam kosalānam issaraḥ ti kosalaḥ kosala rājassa  ayanti kosalikā paribhoga pātī iti bhatta paribhojana tthāya pāti paribhoga pāti
translated: The Snake-Jewel Sutta🔽The makers of Surā: the makers of Surā-liquor. The lord of the Kosalans: the Kosalan, the king of the Kosalans.🔽The Kosalans: the people of the Kosala country. The bowl for use: the bowl for use in eating the meal. The smith’s bellows-pipe:

original: kammāruddhanapaṇāḷimukhe. Dhamamānāyāti dhamiyamānāya. Taṃ pana yasmā bhastavātehi
analyzed: dhamamānāya ati dhamiyamānāya tam pana yasmai
translated: the mouth of the smith’s bellows-pipe. As it was being blown: as it was being blown. But that, since it was being blown

original: pūritaṃ nāma hoti, tasmā “bhastavātena pūriyamānāyā”ti vuttaṃ. Niyāmabhūmiyanti bhagavato
analyzed: pūritam nāma hoti tasmai bhasta vātena pūriyamānāya ati vuttam bhagavato
translated: “Filled” means filled up. That is why it is said, “as it is being filled by the wind of the bellows.” “The plane of no-rebirth” :

original: paṭisallānaṭṭhāne sañcarantaṃ māraṃ maṃsacakkhunāva disvā. Tenāha “vijjulatālokenā”ti.
analyzed: paṭisallāna ṭṭhāne sañcarantam māram maṃsa cakkhunā ava disvā tena āha vijju latā ālokena ati
translated: having seen Mara wandering about in the place of the Blessed One’s seclusion with his own eyes. Therefore it is said, “with the lightning flash.”

original: Seyyatthāyāti seyyānisaṃsāya. Tenāha “ṭhassāmī”tiādi. Attasaññatoti attabhāvena saṃyato.
analyzed: seyyatthāya ati seyyā nisaṃsāya tena āha atta saññatā ti atta bhāvena saṃyataḥ
translated: “For the sake of”: for the sake of the good, the beneficial. Therefore it is said, “I will stand.” “Self-controlled”: controlled by the self, by the body.

original: Tenāha “saṃyatattabhāvo”ti. Taṃsaṇṭhitassāti tasmiṃ hatthapādakukkuccarahite buddhamunismiṃ
analyzed: tena āha tad saṇṭhitassa ati tasmin hattha pāda kukkucca rahite buddha munismiṃ
translated: Therefore it is said, “with self-controlled body.” “Standing firm in him”: standing firm in the Buddha, the Sage, who is free from the anxiety of hands and feet.

original: avaṭṭhitassa. Vossajja careyya tattha soti iminā bhagavā taṃ byākaramāno vibhiṃsitā
analyzed: avaṭṭhitassa vā ussajja careyya tattha saḥ ti iminā bhagavā tam byākaramānaḥ vibhiṃsitā
translated: “He would go forth, giving up”: by this the Blessed One, in his reply, shows that Mara,

original: buddhānaṃ kiṃ karissati bhayābhāvato? Kevalaṃ pana anaṭṭhavalikaṃ uppīḷento viya🔽tvameva āyāsaṃ āpajjissasīti māraṃ santajjeti.
analyzed: buddhānam kim karissati bhaya abhāvato kevalam pana an aṭṭhavalikam uppīḍentaḥ viya  tvam eva āyāsam āpajjissasi iti mā aram santajja iti
translated: being frightened, what can he do to the Buddhas, since they are free from fear? But he is like one who is being tormented by a non-venomous snake.

original: Bheravāti avītarāgānaṃ bhayajanakā. Tatthāti taṃnimittaṃ. Phaleyyāti bhijjeyya. Sattisallanti
analyzed: bheravā ati avīta rāgānam bhaya janakā tattha ati taṃnimittam phaleyya ati bhijjeyya satti sallanti
translated: “You alone will come to grief.” “Terrible”: frightening to those who are not free from lust. “There”: in that place. “Would split”: would break.

original: sattisaṅkhātaṃ puthusallaṃ. Urasmiṃ cārayeyyunti phāsuṃ vijjhituṃ ṭhapeyyuṃ uggireyyuṃ.🔽Khandhupadhīsūti khandhasaṅkhātesu upadhīsu. Tāṇaṃ karonti nāmāti tato bhayanimittato
analyzed: satti saṅkhātam puthusallam urasmim cārayeyyunti phāsum vijjhitum ṭhapeyyuṃ uggireyyuṃ  khandha upadhīsu iti khandha saṅkhātesu upadhīsu tāṇam karonti nāma ati tatas bhaya nimittataḥ
translated: A sharp sword-blade: a sword-blade with a sharp edge. They would rub it on his breast: they would place it there to cut through his chest.🔽In the aggregates as clinging: in the clingings called the aggregates. They would make a refuge: they would make a protection for him from the danger.

original: attano tāṇaṃ karonti nāma.
analyzed: attanaḥ tāṇam karonti nāma
translated: They would make a shelter: they would make a shelter for him from the danger.

original: Sappasuttavaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: sappa sutta vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: The commentary on the Snake Thread is finished.

original: 7. Supatisuttavaṇṇanā
analyzed: supati sutta vaṇṇanā
translated: The Thread on Sleeping

original: 143. Utugāhāpanatthaṃ dhovitvā, na rajojallavikkhālanatthaṃ. Tenāha “buddhānaṃ panā”tiādi.
analyzed: utu gāhāpana attham dhovitvā na rajaḥ jalla vikkhālana attham tena āha buddhānam pana atiādi
translated: after washing it for the purpose of removing the sweat, not for the purpose of removing dust and dirt. Hence he said “But in the case of Buddhas” .

original: Dhotapādake geheti dhotapādehi akkamitabbake. Vattabhedo nāma natthi dhammassāmibhāvato.
analyzed: dhota pādake gehe iti dhota pādehi akkamitabbake vatta bhedaḥ nāma natthi dhamma ssāmibhāvato
translated: In a house with washed feet: in one that is to be trodden on with washed feet. There is no difference in the matter of the duty, because of the ownership of the Dhamma.

original: Vattasīse ṭhatvā dhovanti aññesaṃ diṭṭhānugatiāpajjanatthaṃ. Soppapariggāhakenāti🔽ettha soppaṃ nāma niddāya antarantarā pavattakiriyamayacittappavattirahitā nirantarabhavaṅgasantatīti
analyzed: vatta sīse ṭhatvā dhovanti aññesam diṭṭha anugati āpajjana ttham soppa pariggāhakena ati  ettha soppam nāma niddāya antarantarā pavatta kiriya maya citta ppavatti rahitā nirantara bhavaṅga santatī iti
translated: They wash it, standing at the head of the rule, for the purpose of conformity with the seen order of the world. With a thorough investigation:

original: taṃ sabhāvato payojanato kālaparicchedato pariggāhakaṃ upariniddesasatisampajaññaṃ
analyzed: tam sabhāvataḥ payojanataḥ kāla paricchedato pariggāhakam upari niddesa sati sampajaññam
translated: herein, the thorough investigation is the higher-than-human-consciousness-as-investigation-of-the-matter-in-hand, which is the uninterrupted continuity of the life-continuum devoid of the occurrence of any cognizance consisting in the kinds of consciousness that occur in the intervals of the kinds of consciousness called ‘ sleep ’ .

original: sandhāya vuttaṃ “soppapariggāhakena satisampajaññenā”ti. Keci pana “niddāsoppanā”ti
analyzed: sandhāya vuttam soppa pariggāhakena sati sampajaññena ati keci pana niddā soppanā ti
translated: But some say “lying down is lying down”

original: vadanti, taṃ bhagavato soppaṃ hīḷento vadati.
analyzed: vadanti tam bhagavataḥ soppam vadati
translated: and he said that despising the Blessed One’s lying down.

original: Kiṃ nūti etthaṃ kinti hetunissakke paccattavacananti āha “kasmā nu supasī”ti? Dubbhago🔽vuccati nissiriko bhinnabhago, so pana matasadiso visaññisadiso ca hotīti āha “mato
analyzed: kim nu iti ettham kim ti hetu nissakke paccatta vacananti āha kasmai nu supasi iti dubbhagaḥ  vuccati nissirikaḥ bhinna bhago so pana mata sadisaḥ visaññi sadisaḥ ca hoti iti āha mataḥ
translated: “Why, Supasi?” Herein, why is a question in the sense of cause, and it is in apposition to “Supasi.” That is why he said “Why, Supasi?”

original: viya visaññī viya cā”ti.
analyzed: viya visaññī viya ca ati
translated: Unfortunate is said of one who is not prosperous, who is divided from prosperity, and he is like one dead and like one unconscious, that is why he said “like one dead, like one unconscious.”

original: Ādināti ādi-saddena “bāhirassa upādāya aṭṭhārasā”tiādinā āgataṃ taṇhākoṭṭhāsaṃ saṅgaṇhāti.
analyzed: ādinā iti ādi saddena bāhirassa upādāya aṭṭhārasa ati ādinā āgatam taṇhā koṭṭhāsam saṅgaṇhāti
translated: Beginning with: with reference to the beginning of craving, he includes the section on craving stated thus “Externally, eighteen by assuming” .

original: Tattha tattha visattatāyāti tammiṃ tasmiṃ ārammaṇe visesato āsattabhāvena. Visassa🔽dukkhanibbattakakammassa hetubhāvato visamūlatā visaṃ vā dukkhadukkhādibhūtavedanā
analyzed: tattha tattha visatta tāya ati tammin tasmin ārammaṇe visesataḥ āsatta bhāvena  dukkha nibbattaka kammassa hetu bhāvataḥ visa mūla tā visam vā dukkha dukkha ādi bhūta vedanā
translated: There, in each case, in the sense of being especially attached: in the sense of being especially attached to that and that object.🔽It has poison as its root: it has the action that generates suffering as its root, or else suffering is the feeling of pain, etc., and that is the root of this, thus it has poison as its root, that is, craving.

original: mūlaṃ etassāti visamūlā, taṇhā. Tassa rūpādikassa dukkhassa paribhogo, na amatassāti
analyzed: mūlam etassa ati visa mūlā taṇhā tassa rūpa ādikassa dukkhassa paribhogaḥ na amatassa ati
translated: It is the enjoyment of that suffering consisting in materiality, etc., not of the deathless.

original: visaparibhogatā. Katthaci netunti katthaci bhave sabbathā netuṃ? Parikkhayāti sabbaso
analyzed: visa paribhoga tā katthaci netum ti katthaci bhave sabbathā netum parikkhayā ati sabbaso
translated: The state of being a consumer of poison. In some places: in some existences, should he lead everywhere? Having destroyed: having completely destroyed.

original: khīṇattā. Tuyhaṃ kiṃ etthāti sabbupadhiparikkhayā suddhassa mama paṭipattiyaṃ tuyhaṃ
analyzed: khīṇa ttā tuyham kim ettha ati sabba upadhi parikkhayā suddhassa mama paṭipattiyam tuyham
translated: The use of poison. In some places: in some kinds of becoming. To lead away: to lead away completely? To exhaustion: because of complete exhaustion. What is there for you in this? What is there for you in my practice, which is pure because of the exhaustion of all clinging?

original: kiṃ ujjhāyanaṃ? Kevalaṃ vighātoyeva teti dasseti.
analyzed: kim ujjhāyanam kevalam vighātoyā iva tā iti dasseti
translated: You have only vexation, he shows.

original: Supatisuttavaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: supati sutta vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: The commentary on the Supatisutta is finished.

original: 8. Nandatisuttavaṇṇanā
analyzed: nandati sutta vaṇṇanā
translated: The commentary on the Nandatisutta

original: 144. Aṭṭhamaṃ uttānatthameva.
analyzed: aṭṭhamam uttānattham eva
translated: The eighth is plain in meaning.

original: Nandatisuttavaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: nandati sutta vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: The commentary on the Nandatisutta is finished.

original: 9. Paṭhamaāyusuttavaṇṇanā
translated: The commentary on the first Āyusutta

original: 145. Paṇṇāsaṃ vā vassāni jīvati vassasatato upari seyyathāpi thero anuruddho. Saṭṭhi🔽vā vassāni seyyathāpi thero bākulo. Paṭiharitvā paccanīkabhāve sātaṃ sukhaṃ etassāti
analyzed: paṇṇāsam vā vassāni jīvati vassa satataḥ upari sā iyyathā api theraḥ anuruddhaḥ  vā vassāni seyyathā api theraḥ bākulaḥ paṭiharitvā paccanīka bhāve sātam sukham etassa ati
translated: He lives for fifty years or more than a hundred years, like the elder Anuruddha. Or for sixty years, like the elder Bākula.🔽Having restrained, he has pleasure and happiness in the opposite state, thus he is one who has pleasure in the opposite state . The state of that is the state of having pleasure in the opposite state . By that,

original: paccanīkasāto, tabbhāvo paccanīkasātatā, tāya. Abhibhavitvā abhāsi paṭivacanaṃ jānamānova.
analyzed: paccanīka sātaḥ tad bhāvaḥ paccanīka sāta tā tāya abhibhavitvā abhāsi paṭivacanam jānamānaḥ iva
translated: having overcome, he spoke the reply, though knowing.

original: Na hīḷeyya na jiguccheyya. Evanti so dārako viya kiñci acintento sappuriso careyya,
analyzed: na hīḷeyya na jiguccheyya evanti saḥ dārakaḥ viya kiñci a cintento sa puriso careyya
translated: He would not despise, he would not be disgusted. Thus, like the boy, the good person would conduct himself without thinking about anything,

original: evaṃ hissa cittadukkhaṃ na hotīti adhippāyo. Pajjalitasīso viya careyyāti yathā pajjalitasīso
analyzed: evam hi ssa citta dukkham na hoti iti adhippāyaḥ pajjalita sīsaḥ viya careyya ati yathā pajjalita sīsaḥ
translated: The intention is that his mind will not be unhappy.

original: puriso aññaṃ kiñci akatvā tasseva vūpasamāya vāyameyya, evaṃ sappuriso āyuṃ parittanti🔽ñatvā teneva nayena sabbasaṅkhāragataṃ aniccaṃ, aniccattā eva dukkhaṃ, anattāti vipassanampi
analyzed: purisaḥ aññam kiñci a katvā tassa iva vūpasamāya vāyameyya evam sappurisaḥ āyum parittanti  ñatvā tena iva nayena sabba saṅkhāra gatam aniccam anicca ttā eva dukkham anattā ati vipassanam pi
translated: He should live as if his head were on fire: just as a man whose head were on fire would make an effort to put out the fire, not bothering about anything else, so too this good man, knowing that his life is short, should live intent on developing insight in the way described above.

original: otaritvā taṃ ussukkāpentopi saṅkhāravigamāya careyya paṭipajjeyya.
analyzed: otaritvā tam ussukkāpentaḥ api saṅkhāra vigamāya careyya paṭipajjeyya
translated: And he should live intent on the destruction of all suffering, having entered upon the insight that all formations are impermanent, and that what is impermanent is suffering, and that what is suffering is non-self.

original: Paṭhamaāyusuttavaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: paṭhama āyu sutta vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: The commentary on the first Āyuṇa sutta is ended.

original: 10. Dutiyaāyusuttavaṇṇanā
analyzed: dutiya āyu sutta vaṇṇanā
translated: . Commentary on the Second Āyuṇa Sutta

original: 146. Nemīvāti nemisīsena cakkaṃ vadati. Kubbaraṃ anupariyāyatīti kubbaraṃ anuparivattati.
analyzed: nemī iva ati nemi sīsena cakkam vadati kubbaram anupariyāyati iti kubbaram anuparivattati
translated: . The rim: the wheel is called the rim. It goes round the hub: it revolves round the hub.

original: Tathābhūto pana so taṃ ajahantovāti āha “na vijahatī”ti. Āyu anupariyāyatīti maccānaṃ
analyzed: tathābhūtaḥ pana saḥ tam āha na vijahati iti āyu anupariyāyati iti
translated: But he does not abandon it: he does not give it up.🔽Life goes round: the life of mortals

original: āyu gatampi paccāgacchatīti bhagavato paṭāṇi hutvā vadati, bhagavā pana taṃ abhibhavitvā
analyzed: āyu gatam pi paccāgacchati iti bhagavato paṭāṇi hutvā vadati bhagavā pana tam abhibhavitvā
translated: goes round, comes back again. The Blessed One said this, referring to himself as the spokes, and the wheel as the life of mortals. But the Blessed One, having overcome it,🔽.

original: “accayanti ahorattā”tiādinā āyuno accayagamanamaraṇataṃyeva pavedesi.
analyzed: accayanti ahoratta ati ādinā āyunaḥ accaya gamana maraṇa taṃyā iva
translated: “The days and nights go by” — he announced the passing away of the life span, death.

original: Dutiyaāyusuttavaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: dutiya āyu sutta vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: The commentary on the second sutta on life span is finished.

original: Paṭhamavaggavaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: paṭhama vagga vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: The commentary on the first section is finished.

original: 2. Dutiyavaggo
analyzed: dutiya vaggo
translated: The second section

original: 1. Pāsāṇasuttavaṇṇanā
analyzed: pāsāṇa sutta vaṇṇanā
translated: The rock sutta

original: 147. Pavijjhīti pabbataṃ sabbato pavattento tato tato nissajji. Sakalanti sabbabhāgavantaṃ, nissesanti attho.
analyzed: pavijjhi iti pabbatam sabbatas pavattentaḥ tatas tatas nissajji sakalam ti sabba bhāgavantam nissesam ti attho
translated: He split: he penetrated the mountain, sending it out from here and there. Entire: possessing all parts; the meaning is, it was not left out.

original: Pāsāṇasuttavaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: pāsāṇa sutta vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: The commentary on the rock sutta is finished.

original: 2. Kiṃnusīhasuttavaṇṇanā🔽148. Vicakkhukammāyāti vicakkhubhāvakāmatāya. Yathā sā bhagavato desiyamānaṃ dhammaṃ
analyzed: kiṃnusīha sutta vaṇṇanā  vicakkhu kammāya ati vicakkhu bhāva kāmatāya yathā sā bhagavataḥ desiyamānam dhammaṃ
translated: The lion’s roar sutta

original: attano paññācakkhunā na passituṃ sakkoti, evaṃ kātuṃ kāmatāya. Tenāha “parisāyā”tiādi.
analyzed: attanaḥ paññā cakkhunā na passitum sakkoti evam kātum kāmatāya tena āha parisāya atiādi
translated: For the sake of the eye’s work: for the sake of the eye’s function. Just as she was unable to see the Dhamma taught by the Blessed One with her own eye of wisdom, so she wanted to do. Therefore he said, “in the assembly” and so on.

original: Vināsetuṃ na sakkoti bheravārammaṇe bhāyanasseva abhāvato. Dasabalappattāti dasahi balehi samannāgatā.🔽Kiṃnusīhasuttavaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.🔽3. Sakalikasuttavaṇṇanā
analyzed: vināsetum na sakkoti bherava ārammaṇe bhāyanassa iva abhāvataḥ dasa bala ppattā ati dasahi balehi samannāgatā 🔽kiṃnusīha sutta vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā 🔽sakalika sutta vaṇṇanā
translated: She was unable to destroy it because she was not afraid of the terrible object. Possessed of the ten powers: endowed with the ten powers.

original: 149. Mandabhāvenāti jaḷabhāvena momūhabhāvenāti mahāmūḷhatāya. Kabbakaraṇena mattoti🔽kabbakiriyāpasutatādivasena matto kabbaṃ katvā. Kimidaṃ soppasevāti idaṃ tava soppaṃ🔽kimatthaṃ, purisena nāma purisattakarena bhavitabbaṃ, na soppatiyeva. Atthaṃ samāgantvāti
analyzed: manda bhāvena ati jaḷa bhāvena momūha bhāvena ati mahā mūḷha tāya kabba karaṇena  kabba kiriyā apasuta tā ādi vasena matto kabbam katvā kim idam soppa sevā ati idam tava soppam  kimattham purisena nāma purisatta karena bhavitabbam na attham samāgantvā ati
translated: ‘With a dull mind’ means with a sluggish mind, with a very sluggish mind. ‘Drunk with work’ means drunk with the intoxication of work, etc. ‘What is this “good work”?’ means ‘What is this good work of yours?🔽What is the point of it? A man should be a man, not a good worker.’ ‘Having come to the point’ means

original: paramatthaṃ nibbānaṃ sammā āgantvā adhigantvā. Asaṅga…pe… natthi sabbaso siddhatthabhāvato.🔽Jaggantoti jāgaranto puriso viya, na bhāyāmi bhayahetūnaṃ abhāvā. Nānutapanti sabbattha
analyzed: paramattham nibbānam sammā āgantvā adhigantvā asaṅgape natthi sabbasas siddhattha bhāvato  jaggantaḥ ti jāgarantaḥ purisaḥ viya na bhāyāmi bhaya hetūnam abhāvāḥ na anutapanti sabbattha
translated: With sluggishness : with dullness, with stupidity, with great delusion. Drunk with work : drunk with the work of ploughing, etc., having done the work of ploughing. What is this good fortune ? What is the purpose of this good fortune of yours ? A man should be a man, not a good-for-nothing. Having come to the goal : having come to, having attained, the ultimate goal, Nibbāna. Unattached … no more than a mere name : there is no more than a mere name for me, no more than a mere name for my existence.

original: sabbadāpi vissaṭṭhabhāvato, māmanti mamaṃ. Gāthāsukhatthañhi dīghaṃ katvā vuttaṃ.
analyzed: sabbadā api vissaṭṭha bhāvataḥ gāthā sukha attham hi dīgham katvā vuttam
translated: Looking : like a man who is awake, I am not afraid, because there is no cause for fear. They do not torment : they do not torment me anywhere and at any time, because I am completely detached.

original: Ṭhitattāti uddesaparipucchāya paricchijjattā. Hāninti kassaci jāniṃ.
analyzed: ṭhita ttā ati uddesa paripucchāya paricchijja tā hānim ti kassaci
translated: Standing : having discerned by way of the recitation and questioning. Loss : the loss of anyone’s property.

original: Sakalikasuttavaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: sakalika sutta vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: The commentary on the Sakalikasutta is finished.

original: 4. Patirūpasuttavaṇṇanā
analyzed: pati rūpa sutta vaṇṇanā
translated: The Patirūpasutta is finished.

original: 150. Anurujjhati etenāti anurodho, rāgo. Virujjhati etenāti virodho, paṭigho. Tesu
analyzed: anurujjhati etena ati anurodhaḥ rāgaḥ virujjhati etena ati virodhaḥ paṭighaḥ tesu
translated: “It is because of this that one is in agreement” is approval, lust. “It is because of this that one is in disagreement” is disapproval, aversion.🔽As to these approval and disapproval, one “sticks to the cause” for them, that is, one makes a bond for them.

original: anurodhavirodhesu tannimittaṃ sajjati nāma saṅgaṃ karoti nāma, anurodhavirodhuppādanameva
analyzed: anurodha virodhesu tad nimittam sajjati nāma saṅgam karoti nāma anurodha virodha uppādanam eva
translated: The “sticking” here is just the arousing of approval and disapproval.

original: cettha sajjanaṃ. Yadaññamanusāsatīti yaṃ aññesaṃ anusāsanaṃ, taṃ tesaṃ hitesanaṃ
analyzed: ca ittha sat janam yat aññam anusāsati iti yam aññesam anusāsanam tam tesam hita īsanam
translated: “When you advise another” : the advising of others is the seeking of their welfare,

original: anukampanaṃ, tasmā anukampake hitesake sammāsambuddhe anurodhavirodhe āropetvā vikampanatthaṃ micchā vadasīti.
analyzed: anukampanam tasmai anukampake hitesake sammāsambuddhe anurodha virodhe āropetvā vikampana attham micchā vadasi iti
translated: the taking pity on them. Therefore, “you advise the Fully Enlightened One, who is compassionate and seeks the welfare of others, in order to shake him by imputing to him approval and disapproval.”

original: Patirūpasuttavaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: patirūpa sutta vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: The commentary on the Patirūpa Sutta is ended.

original: 5. Mānasasuttavaṇṇanā
translated: The Mind-made Sutta

original: 151. Ākāse caranteti pañcābhiññe sandhāya vadati. Antalikkhe carantepi kiccasādhanato
analyzed: ākāse carantā iti pañca abhiññe sandhāya vadati antalikkhe carantā api kicca sādhanato
translated: “Roaming in the sky” : he says this with reference to the five abhinnas. “Roaming in the sky” also means that, because of the accomplishment of his task, he is “roaming in the sky.”

original: antalikkhacaro. Manasi jātoti mānaso. Taṃ pana manasantānasampayuttatāyāti āha “manasampayutto”ti.
analyzed: antalikkha caraḥ manasi jāto ti mānaso tam pana mana santāna sampayutta tāya ati āha mana sampayuttaḥ ti
translated: “Born in the mind” is mind-made. But that is because of its association with the mind-continuum. Therefore, he says, “associated with the mind.”

original: Mānasasuttavaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: mānasa sutta vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: The commentary on the Mānasasutta is ended.

original: 6. Pattasuttavaṇṇanā
translated: The Bowl Sutta

original: 152. Pañcannaṃ upādānakkhandhānaṃ lakkhaṇādīni ceva samudayañca assādādīnavanissaraṇāni
analyzed: pañcannam upādānakkhandhānam lakkhaṇa ādīni ca iva samudayam ca assāda ādīnava nissaraṇāni
translated: The characteristics, etc., of the five aggregates as objects of clinging,🔽their origin, their satisfaction, their danger, and the escape from them,

original: ca gahetvā sammā tesaṃ lakkhaṇādīnaṃ gahaṇaṃ hotīti āha “pañca upādānakkhandhe ādiyitvā”ti.🔽Ruppanavediyanasañjānanaabhisaṅkharaṇavijānanāni khandhānaṃ sabhāvalakkhaṇāni. Ādi-saddena
analyzed: ca gahetvā sammā tesam lakkhaṇa ādīnam gahaṇam hoti iti āha pañca upādānakkhandhe ādiyitvā ati  ruppana vedi yana sañjānana abhisaṅkharaṇa vijānanāni khandhānam sabhāva lakkhaṇāni ādi saddena
translated: The right way of apprehending the characteristics, etc., of the five aggregates is by apprehending the characteristics, etc., of the five aggregates.🔽The characteristic of the materiality aggregate is “deformability,” of the feeling aggregate “experience,” of the perception aggregate “notifying,” of the formations aggregate “forming,” and of the consciousness aggregate “cognizing.”

original: rasapaccupaṭṭhānapadaṭṭhānāni ceva samudayādīni ca saṅgaṇhāti. Dassetīti paccakkhato🔽dasseti, hatthāmalakaṃ viya pākaṭe vibhūte katvā vibhāveti. Gaṇhāpetīti te dhamme
analyzed: rasa paccupaṭṭhāna padaṭṭhānāni ca iva samudaya ādīni ca saṅgaṇhāti dasseti iti paccakkhataḥ  dasseti hattha āmalakam viya pākaṭe vibhūte katvā vibhāveti gaṇhāpeti iti te dhamme
translated: The word “etc.” includes the manifestation, the proximate cause, and the origination, etc., of the aggregates.🔽“Shows” : he shows them as though they were a fruit in the palm of the hand, making them evident and manifest.

original: manasā anupekkhite diṭṭhiyā suppaṭividdhe karonto uggaṇhāpeti. Samādānamhīti tattha
analyzed: manasā an upekkhite diṭṭhiyā su paṭividdhe karontaḥ uggaṇhāpeti samādānam hi iti tattha
translated: “Causes to be grasped” : he causes them to be taken up by one who has looked on at those dhammas with insight and has well penetrated them with understanding.

original: atthassa sammadeva ādiyane khandhānañca sammasanavasena aññadhammavasena samādiyane.
analyzed: atthassa sammad eva ādiyane khandhānaṃ ca sammasana vasena añña dhamma vasena samādiyane
translated: “Grasping” : in the right apprehension of their meaning and in the undertaking of the dhammas by way of the aggregates, etc., and not by way of any other dhammas.

original: Paṭividdhaguṇenāti tāya desanāya, taṃ nissāya paccattapurisakārena ca tesaṃ paṭividdhaguṇena.
analyzed: paṭividdha guṇena ati tāya desanāya tam nissāya paccatta purisakārena ca tesam paṭividdha guṇena
translated: By the qualities penetrated: by the qualities penetrated by them through the teaching and through the individual effort based on it.

original: Jotāpetīti tesaṃ cittasantānaṃ assaddhiyādikilesamalavidhamanena pabhassaraṃ karoti.🔽Aṭṭhiṃ katvāti tāya desanāya pāpetabbaṃ atthaṃ payojanaṃ daḷhaṃ katvā. Tenāha “ayaṃ🔽no”tiādi. Kammakārakacittaṃ nāma otaraṇacittaṃ. “Yonisomanasikārapubbakaṃ vipassanācitta”nti
analyzed: jotāpeti iti tesam citta santānam pabhassaram karoti  aṭṭhim katvā iti tāya desanāya pāpetabbam attham payojanam daḷham katvā tena āha ayaṃ  no ti ādi kamma kāraka cittam nāma otaraṇa cittam yoni somanasikāra pubbakam vipassanā cittam ti
translated: He illuminates: he makes their mental continuity bright by removing the defilements of non-faith, etc., and the stains of the defilements.🔽Having made the essence firm: having made the meaning, the purpose, of the teaching firm. Hence he said: “This is not mine” , etc. The “mind that does the work” is the mind of entry.🔽Some say that it is the insight mind preceded by right reflection.

original: keci. Ohitasotāti anaññavihitatāya dhammassavanāya appitasotā, tato eva tadatthaṃ ṭhapitasotā.🔽Ete rūpādayo khandhe yañca saṅkhataṃ samiddhapaccayehi kataṃ, tañca “eso ahaṃ na
analyzed: keci ohita sotā ati anañña vihita tāya dhamma ssavanāya appita sotā tatas eva tad attham ṭhapita sotā  ete rūpa ādayaḥ khandhe yat ca saṅkhatam samiddha paccayehi katam tat ca esaḥ aham na
translated: With ears intent: with ears that are intent by not being distracted to anything else in listening to the Dhamma. Hence he said: “with ears intent on that meaning.”🔽These material form, etc., and the formed that is made by the conditions of arising, he sees thus: “This is not mine, this is not I, this is not my self.”

original: homi, etaṃ mayhaṃ na hotī”ti passantoti yojanā. Khemo attāti khemattā, taṃ khemattaṃ.
analyzed: homi etam mayham na hoti iti passanto ti yojanā khemaḥ attā ati khema ttā tam khema ttam
translated: The “self” is the state of security. That state of security is the “security of self.”🔽Hence he said: “the self that is a state of security.”

original: Tenāha “khemibhūtaṃ attabhāva”nti. Pariyesamānā mārasenā.
analyzed: tena āha khemi bhūtam atta bhāvanti pariyesamānā māra senā
translated: The army of Mara, searching.

original: Pattasuttavaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: patta sutta vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: The commentary on the Pattasutta is ended.

original: 7. Chaphassāyatanasuttavaṇṇanā🔽153. Sañjāyati etasmāti sañjāti, so eva sampayuttadhammo samosarati etthāti samosaraṇaṃ,
analyzed: cha phassa āyatana sutta vaṇṇanā  sañjāyati etasmā ati sañjāti saḥ eva sampayutta dhammo samosarati ettha ati samosaraṇam
translated: The Commentary on the Chaphassāyatanasutta🔽is born from this, thus it is a birth. That same associated state is a coming together here, thus it is a coming together.

original: so eva attho, tena sañjātisamosaraṇaṭṭhena. Bhayabheravaṃ saddanti bhāyati etasmāti🔽bhayaṃ, tadeva yassa kassaci bheravāvahattā bheravaṃ, devādisaddanti attho. Vigatavalāhake
