original: Pakkamissantīti āghātaṃ uppādesi attano icchāvighātanato. Therā bhikkhusaṅghassa
analyzed: pakkamissanti iti āghātam uppādesi attanaḥ icchā vighātanataḥ therāḥ bhikkhu saṅghassa
translated: He aroused his anger because he was frustrated at his own wish not being fulfilled. The Elders

original: niyyādayiṃsu payuttavācāya akatattā therehi ca adīpitattā. Pubbepi…pe… maññeti iminā
analyzed: niyyādayiṃsu payutta vācāya a kata ttā therehi ca a dīpita ttā maññeti iminā
translated: handed them over to the Order of monks. Because the Elders had not spoken the proper words, and because they had not been urged by the Elders, they thought, “They will go forth.”

original: therānaṃ kohaññe ṭhitabhāvaṃ āsaṅkati avaṇe vaṇaṃ passanto viya, suddhe ādāsatale🔽lekhaṃ uṭṭhāpento viya ca.
analyzed: therānam kohaññe ṭhita bhāvam āsaṅkati avaṇe vaṇam passantaḥ viya suddhe ādāsa tale  lekham uṭṭhāpentaḥ viya ca
translated: By this he suspects that the Elders were still angry, as if seeing a wound in a healthy place, or as if raising a line on a pure piece of cloth.

original: Aparajjhitvāti bhagavato sammukhā “pāpabhikkhū jātā”ti vatvā. Āha “saddhāya ākaro pasādāvaho”ti. Pavattasaddhāyiko vāti atthoti āha “saddhātabbavacano”ti.
analyzed: aparajjhitvā ti bhagavataḥ sammukhā pāpa bhikkhū jātā ati vatvā āha saddhāya ākaro pasāda āvahaḥ ti pavatta saddhāyikaḥ vā ti atthaḥ ti āha saddhātabba vacanaḥ iti
translated: “Without having been reproved” means without having been told in the presence of the Blessed One, “The wicked monks have arisen.” He said, “Faith is the forerunner of the Law, born of confidence.” He said, “The one who has faith is one who should be trusted.”

original: Pīḷakā nāma bāhirato paṭṭhāya aṭṭhiṃ bhindati, imā pana paṭhamaṃyeva aṭṭhiṃ bhinditvā
analyzed: pīḍakā nāma bāhiratas paṭṭhāya aṭṭhim bhindati imā pana aṭṭhim bhinditvā
translated: A pīḷaka is a boil that breaks through the bone from the outside. But these broke through the bone first and then

original: uggatā. Taruṇabeluvamattiyoti taruṇabillaphalamattiyo. Visagilitoti khittapaharaṇo.
analyzed: taruṇa beluva mattiyaḥ ti taruṇa billa phala mattiyaḥ khitta paharaṇo
translated: came out. The size of a young beluva leaf: the size of a young bilva fruit. “Pointed with poison” means “sharpened with poison.”

original: Tañca baḷisaṃ visasamaññā loke. “Ārakkhadevatānaṃ sutvā”ti padaṃ ānetvā sambandho.
analyzed: tat ca baḷisam visa samaññā loke ārakkha devatānam sutvā iti padam ānetvā sambandhaḥ
translated: The world calls the hook “poison.” The construction is: having heard the deities who are the guardians of the Law.

original: Magadharaṭṭhe saṃvohārato māgadhako patto, tena. Tilasakaṭaṃ tilavāhāeti vutto. Paccitabbaṭṭhānassāti nirayadukkhena paccitabbapadesassa. Etaṃ “abbudo”ti nāmaṃ.
analyzed: magadha raṭṭhe saṃvohārataḥ māgadhako patto tena tila sakaṭam tila vāhāe ti vutto paccitabba ṭṭhānassa ati niraya dukkhena paccitabba padesassa etam abbudo ti nāmam
translated: In the Magadha country, the Magadhan pot is called a “magadha pot” in common usage. A cartload of sesame is called a “sesame cart” and so on. The place of burning is the place to be burned by the suffering of hell. This is the name “abbuda”.

original: Vassagaṇanāti ekato paṭṭhāya dasaguṇitaṃ abbudaāyumhi, tato paraṃ vīsatiguṇaṃ nirabbudādīsu
analyzed: vassa gaṇanā ti ekatas paṭṭhāya dasa guṇitam abbuda āyumhi tato param vīsatiguṇam nirabbuda ādīsu
translated: The reckoning of years is to be understood as follows: from one to ten, the life span of the abbuda hell is multiplied by ten. After that, the life span of the rest, beginning with the nirabbuda, is multiplied by twenty.

original: vassagaṇanā veditabbā. Sabbatthāti ababādīsu padumapariyosānesu sabbesu nirayesu.
analyzed: vassa gaṇanā veditabbā sabbattha ati ab ap ādīsu paduma pariyosānesu sabbesu nirayesu
translated: Everywhere means in all the hells beginning with the ababa and ending with the paduma.

original: Eseva nayoti heṭṭhimato uparimassa uparimassa vīsatiguṇataṃ atidisati.
analyzed: esa iva nayo ti heṭṭhimataḥ uparimassa uparimassa atidisati
translated: This is the method: the life span of the higher hell is twenty times that of the lower.

original: Kokālikasuttavaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: kokālika sutta vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: The commentary on the Kokālika Sutta is finished.

original: Paṭhamavaggavaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: paṭhama vagga vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: The commentary on the first chapter is finished.

original: 2. Dutiyavaggo
analyzed: dutiya vaggo
translated: The second chapter

original: 1. Sanaṅkumārasuttavaṇṇanā
analyzed: sanaṅkumāra sutta vaṇṇanā
translated: The commentary on the Sanaṅkumāra Sutta

original: 182. Porāṇakattāti nibbattitvā cirakālattā. Jātattā jano, taṃ ito janeto, tasmiṃ.
analyzed: porāṇaka ttā ati nibbattitvā cira kāla ttā jāta ttā jano tam itas tasmin
translated: The ancientness means being born a long time ago. The people are born, and from this people, in that.

original: Khattiyo seṭṭho lokamariyādaparipālanādinā sammāpaṭipattiyaṃ sattānaṃ niyojanena
analyzed: khattiyaḥ seṭṭhaḥ loka mariyāda paripālana ādinā sammā paṭipattiyam sattānam niyojanena
translated: The khattiya is the best in the world through the protection of the noble ones and so on, by engaging beings in right practice.

original: bahukārattā. So hi pare tathā paṭipādento sayampi tattha patiṭṭhitoyeva hotīti seṭṭho
analyzed: so hi pare tathā paṭipādento sayam pi tattha patiṭṭhitaḥ yā iva hoti iti seṭṭhaḥ
translated: because of its abundance. For when it trains others in this way, it itself is established in it too, and so it is called the best.

original: vutto. Paṭipakkhavijjhanaṭṭhena pubbenivāsādīnaṃ viditakaraṇaṭṭhena vijjāti. Saddhāhirottappabāhusaccavīriyasatipaññāti
analyzed: vuttaḥ paṭipakkha vijjhana ṭhena pubbenivāsa ādīnam vidita karaṇa ṭṭhena vijjāti saddhā hirottappa bāhu sacca vīriya sati paññā ati
translated: It is knowledge in the sense of penetrating the opposite , and it is knowledge in the sense of making known the past lives, etc. Faith, conscience, shame, learning, energy, mindfulness, and understanding—

original: ime satta saddhammā. Caranti agatapubbaṃ disaṃ etehīti caraṇāni, sīlādayo pannarasa dhammā.
analyzed: ime satta saddhammā caranti agata pubbam disam etehi iti caraṇāni sīla ādayaḥ pannarasa dhammā
translated: these are the seven good dhammas. They are the feet because they go where they have not gone before by means of them. The fifteen dhammas beginning with virtue are the feet.

original: Sanaṅkumārasuttavaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: sanaṅkumāra sutta vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: The commentary on the Sanaṅkumāra Sutta is finished.

original: 2. Devadattasuttavaṇṇanā
translated: The Devadatta Sutta

original: 183. Appaññatte eva sikkhāpade chejjagāmikammassa katattā saliṅgeneva ca ṭhitattā🔽“devadatto sāsanato pakkanto”ti na vattabboti acirapakkanteti ettha “sāsanato pakkante”ti
analyzed: a paññatte eva sikkhāpade chejja gāmi kammassa kata ttā sa liṅgena iva ca ṭhita ttā  devadatto sāsanataḥ pakkantoti na vattabbaḥ uti acira pakkantā iti ettha sāsanataḥ pakkantā iti
translated: Because he had committed an offence entailing expulsion even though the training rule had not yet been laid down, and because he was still possessed of the characteristics of a bhikkhu,

original: avatvā “veḷuvanato gayāsīsaṃ gate”ti vuttaṃ. Pakatatto hi bhikkhusaṅghaṃ bhindeyya,
analyzed: a vatvā veḷuvanataḥ gayā sīsam gatā iti vuttam pakatattaḥ hi bhikkhu saṅgham bhindeyya
translated: it cannot be said that Devadatta had “gone forth from the Dispensation.” So in the passage beginning “Not long after he had gone forth” the Master did not say that he had “gone forth from the Dispensation” but that he had “gone from the Bamboo Grove to Gayā’s Head.” For only one who is fully admitted can cause a schism in the Sangha of bhikkhus,

original: na apakatattoti. Vaḷavāyāti vaḷavāya kucchiyaṃ jātaṃ.🔽Devadattasuttavaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: na vaḷavāya ati vaḷavāya kucchiyam jātam 🔽devadatta sutta vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: not one who is not fully admitted. “Born in a cowpen”: born in the belly of a cow.

original: 3. Andhakavindasuttavaṇṇanā
analyzed: andhakavinda sutta vaṇṇanā
translated: 3. The explanation of the Andhakavinda Sutta

original: 184. Janatanti janānaṃ samūhaṃ, janasañcaraṇaṭṭhānanti attho. Manussānaṃ anupacāreti
analyzed: janatanti janānam samūham jana sañcaraṇa ṭhānam ti atthaḥ manussānam an upacāre ti
translated: “People” : a multitude of people; the meaning is, a place where people congregate. “Not frequented by people” :

original: yattake kasanādikiccaṃ karontānaṃ sañcāro hoti, ettakaṃ atikkamitvā anupacāre. Saṃyojanavippamokkhāti
analyzed: yattake kasana ādi kiccam karontānam sañcāraḥ hoti ettakam atikkamitvā an upacāre saṃyojana vippamokkhā ti
translated: as far as the range of people’s activities such as ploughing, etc. extends, beyond that. “For the sake of release from the fetters” :

original: saṃyojanavimokkhahetu. Vivekaratiṃ pavivekasukhajjhānaṃ alabhanto. Cittānurakkhaṇatthanti
analyzed: saṃyojana vimokkha hetu viveka ratim pa viveka sukha jjhānam a labhantaḥ citta anurakkhaṇa tthan ti
translated: for the sake of the release from the fetters. “Not finding delight in the delight of seclusion” : not finding delight in the happiness of jhana which is the delight of seclusion. “For the sake of guarding the mind” :

original: pubbe maṃ manussā “araññavāsena pavivitto asaṃsaṭṭho āraddhavīriyo”ti maññiṃsu, idāni
analyzed: pubbe mamam manussāḥ arañña vāsena pavivittaḥ asaṃsaṭṭhaḥ āraddha vīriyaḥ ti maññiṃsu idāni
translated: formerly people thought of me as secluded and unsociable, as one who has aroused energy, because I lived in the forest. Now,

original: gāmante vasantaṃ disvā gaṇasaṅgaṇikāya nivuṭṭhoti appasādaṃ āpajjissanti. Yadipi🔽me idha abhirati natthi, evaṃ santepi idheva vasissāmīti vikkhittacittena hutvā na
analyzed: gāmante vasantam disvā gaṇa saṅgaṇikāya nivuṭṭhaḥ ti appasādam āpajjissanti yadi pi  me idha abhirati natthi evam sante pi idha iva vasissāmi iti vikkhitta cittena hutvā na
translated: seeing me living in the village, they will lose their confidence, thinking that I have become entangled in society. Even though

original: vasitabbaṃ, ko attho cittavasaṃ gantvāti adhippāyo. Satipaṭṭhānaparāyaṇoti satipaṭṭhānabhāvanārato.
analyzed: vasitabbam kaḥ attho citta vasam gantvā iti adhippāyaḥ sati paṭṭhāna parāyaṇaḥ ti sati paṭṭhāna bhāvanā rataḥ
translated: I have no delight in this place, still I will live here, not living with a distracted mind. The intention is: what is the use of going along with the mind? “Devoted to the foundations of mindfulness” : delighting in the development of the foundations of mindfulness.

original: Evaṃ hissa gaṇavāsopi pāsaṃso vivekavāsena vinā samaṇakiccassa asijjhanato.
analyzed: evam hi ssa gaṇa vāsaḥ api pāsaṃsaḥ viveka vāsena vinā samaṇa kiccassa
translated: For his living in a community is praiseworthy only so long as it does not interfere with his living in solitude, which is the essential business of an ascetic.

original: Vaṭṭabhayato pamutto ajjhāsayavasenāti adhippāyo.
analyzed: vaṭṭa bhayataḥ pamuttaḥ ajjhāsaya vasena āti adhippāyaḥ
translated: The meaning is: he is freed from the fear of the round of rebirths.

original: Nisīdi tattha bhikkhūti iminā sattūpaladdhiyā anissitattā yathāruciyā tesaṃ nisajjaṃ dasseti. Tenāha “iminā”tiādi.🔽Iminā ca iminā ca ākārena jātanti na anussavadassanametaṃ, na anussavaggahaṇaṃ. Takkahetu
analyzed: tattha bhikkhū ti iminā sattu upaladdhiyāḥ anissita ttā yathāruciyā tesam nisajjam dasseti tena āha iminā atiādi  iminā ca iminā ca ākārena na anussava dassanam etam na anussava ggahaṇam takka hetu
translated: “Satthaharo” : he shows that they sat down as they liked, without depending on any invitation. Therefore he says, “by this and that means.”

original: nayahetu vā na vadāmīti yojanā. Piṭakaṃ gantho sampadīyati etassāti piṭakasampadānaṃ,
analyzed: naya hetu vā na vadāmi iti yojanā piṭakam gantho sampadīyati etassa ati piṭaka sampadānam
translated: “I do not say that they were born in this or that way because of hearsay, because of accepting mere tradition, because of rumour, because of what is generally accepted, because of the authority of the scriptures, because of logical reasoning, because of weighing evidence, because of seeing the advantages of a doctrine, or because of another’s statement.”🔽“Piṭakasampadāna” : the collection of the texts is called piṭaka.

original: ganthassa uggaṇhanato tena piṭakassa uggaṇhanakabhāvena, kenaci ganthānusārena evaṃ
analyzed: ganthassa uggaṇhanataḥ tena piṭakassa uggaṇhanaka bhāvena kenaci gantha anusārena evam
translated: “Piṭakasampadāna” is the act of collecting the texts. By that, by the act of collecting the texts, I do not say that they were born in this or that way because of following any collection of texts.🔽“Brahmacariya” : the practice of the best doctrine of Brahmā is the practice of the life of purity.

original: na vadāmīti attho. Brahmassa seṭṭhassa dhammassa cariyaṃ vācasikaṃ pavattatīti brahmacariyaṃ,
analyzed: na vadāmi iti atthaḥ brahmassa seṭṭhassa dhammassa cariyam vācasikam pavattati iti brahmacariyam
translated: “Brahmacariya” is the teaching of the doctrine.

original: dhammadesanā. Bhāvitena maraṇassa sabbaso bhāgena vippahānena maraṇapariccāgīnaṃ.
analyzed: dhamma desanā bhāvitena maraṇassa sabbasas bhāgena vippahānena maraṇa pariccāgīnam
translated: “By the development of the relinquishing of death” : by the complete relinquishing of death.

original: Te ca khīṇajātikāti āha “khīṇāsavāna”nti.
analyzed: te ca khīṇa jātikā ati āha
translated: and they were all of them of destroyed birth, thus he said “of destroyed cankers” .

original: Dasadhā dasāti dasakkhattuṃ dasa. Aññanti pañcasatādhikasahassato aññaṃ. Puññabhāginoti
analyzed: dasadhā dasa ati dasa kkhattum dasa aññanti pañca sata adhika sahassataḥ aññam puñña bhāgino ti
translated: Ten times ten : ten times ten. Another : more than five hundred.

original: vivaṭṭanissitapuññassa bhāgino tassā desanāya ettakā sattā jātāti gaṇetuṃ ahaṃ na
analyzed: vivaṭṭa nissita puññassa bhāginaḥ tassā desanāya ettakā sattā jātā ati gaṇetum aham na
translated: I am not able to count the number of beings who were born in that Dispensation who were sharers in the merit dependent on the Reversal of the Wheel of the Dhamma.

original: sakkomīti dasseti. Brahmadhammadesananti brahmunā vuttaṃ āha.
analyzed: sakkomi iti dasseti brahma dhamma desanam ti brahmunā vuttam āha
translated: Brahma’s Dhamma-teaching : what was said by Brahma.

original: Andhakavindasuttavaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: andhakavinda sutta vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: The Commentary on the Andhakavinda Sutta is finished.

original: 4. Aruṇavatīsuttavaṇṇanā
analyzed: aruṇavatī sutta vaṇṇanā
translated: The Commentary on the Aruṇavatī Sutta

original: 185. Abhibhū sambhavoti tesaṃ dvinnaṃ mahātherānaṃ nāmāni. Tesaṃ vibhāgaṃ dassetuṃ
analyzed: tesam dvinnam mahātherānam nāmāni tesam vibhāgam dassetuṃ
translated: Abhibhū and Sambhava are the names of those two great Elders. In order to show their distinction

original: “tesū”tiādi vuttaṃ. Ete dve tassa bhagavato aggasāvakāti dasseti. Avajjhāyantīti
analyzed: tesu itiādi vuttam ete dve tassa bhagavataḥ aggasāvakā ati dasseti avajjhāyanti iti
translated: “Among them” , etc., is said. He shows that these two were the Chief Disciples of that Blessed One.🔽They were thinking:

original: heṭṭhā katvā cintenti. Khiyyanti taṃ lāmakato cintetabbataṃ pāpenti pāpakataṃ karonti.
analyzed: heṭṭhā katvā cintenti khiyyanti tam lāmakato cintetabba tam pāpenti pāpa katam karonti
translated: they were thinking of it as inferior. They were disparaging it: they were making it seem inferior.

original: Vitthārayantāti tameva lāmakato cintetabbataṃ vepullaṃ pāpentā. Sabbe pāsaṇḍā attano
analyzed: vitthārayantā iti tam eva lāmakataḥ cintetabba tam vepullam pāpentā sabbe pāsaṇḍāḥ attano
translated: They were spreading it about: they were making that same inferior thinking of it grow. All the sectarians

original: attano samaye siddhante sabbe devamanussā attano attano samaye paṭilābhe paṭiladdhaatthe
analyzed: attano samaye siddhante sabbe deva manussāḥ attano attano samaye paṭilābhe paṭiladdha atthe
translated: All gods and men, in their own time, in their own attainment, in their own achievement,

original: purisakāraṃ vaṇṇayantīti yojanā.🔽Ārambhavīriyanti maccusenāsaṅkhātakilesadhunane ārambhavīriyaṃ, yā “ārambhadhātū”ti
analyzed: purisakāram vaṇṇayanti iti yojanā  ārambha vīriyanti maccu senā saṅkhāta kilesa dhunane ārambha vīriyam yāḥ ārambha dhātu uti
translated: extol the man’s effort.🔽The effort of beginning is the effort of beginning the destruction of the defilements called the army of Mara, which is called the “factor of beginning.”

original: vuccati. Nikkamavīriyanti kosajjapaṭipakkhabhūtaṃ vīriyaṃ, yā “nikkamadhātū”ti vuccati.
analyzed: vuccati nikkama vīriyanti kosajja paṭipakkha bhūtam vīriyam yā nikkama dhātu uti vuccati
translated: The effort of exertion is the effort that is the opposite of laziness, which is called the “factor of exertion.”

original: Payogaṃ karothāti paraṃ paraṃ ṭhānaṃ akkamanato tatopi balavataraṃ bhāvanābhiyogaṃ
analyzed: payogam karotha ati param param ṭhānam tatas api balavataram bhāvanā abhiyogam
translated: Make an effort means: make an effort in the development of the meditation subject, which is more powerful than the previous one, by going from one stage to the next.

original: pavattethāti attho. Tenāha “parakkamathā”ti. Kilesasenā nāma rāgādikilesasamūho,
analyzed: pavattetha ati atthaḥ tena āha parakkamatha iti kilesa senā nāma rāga ādi kilesa samūhaḥ
translated: The meaning is: make it occur. Therefore it is said: “Strive.” The army of Mara is the collection of defilements such as lust, etc.

original: so maraṇapaccayabhāvato “maccuno senā”ti vuccati. Tañhi sandhāya vuttaṃ “mahāsenena
analyzed: so maraṇa paccaya bhāvataḥ maccuno senā ati vuccati tat hi sandhāya vuttam mahāsenena
translated: It is called the “army of Mara” because it is a condition for death. Therefore it is said: “By the great army of Mara.”

original: maccunā”ti. Khandhānaṃ paṭhamābhinibbatti jāti, tadaññaṃ pana tesaṃ paṭipāṭi pavattaṃ
analyzed: maccunā ati khandhānam paṭhama abhinibbatti jāti tad aññam pana tesam paṭipāṭi pavattam
translated: The first manifestation of the aggregates is birth. But what occurs in succession to that is the process of aging.

original: saṃsāroti adhippāyenāha “jātiñca saṃsārañcā”ti. Yasmā “ekampi jātiṃ dvepi jātiyo”tiādīsu
analyzed: saṃsāraḥ iti adhippāyena āha jātim ca saṃsāram ca ati yasmai ekam pi jātim dve pi
translated: and by “saṃsāra” he means the round of rebirths. For in such passages as “One birth, two births … ”

original: tasmiṃ tasmiṃ bhave ādānanikkhepaparicchinnakhandhappavatti “jātī”ti vuccati, sā
analyzed: tasmin tasmin bhave ādāna nikkhepa paricchinna khandha ppavatti jātī iti vuccati sā
translated: the occurrence of the aggregates delimited by the taking up of rebirth in this or that becoming is called “birth.”

original: eva yāva parinibbānā aparāparaṃ pavattamāno saṃsāro “ito cito saṃsaraṇa”nti katvā,
analyzed: eva yāva parinibbānāḥ apara aparam pavattamāno saṃsāraḥ itas citaḥ saṃsaraṇanti katvā
translated: That same birth, occurring in succession until final Nibbāna, is called “saṃsāra” in the sense of “wandering from here to there.”

original: tasmā āha “jātisaṅkhātaṃ vā saṃsāra”nti. Paricchedanti pariyosānaṃ. Obhāsaṃ pharīti
analyzed: tasmai āha jāti saṅkhātam vā
translated: That is why he said “saṃsāra, which is called birth.” The end: the end, the conclusion. He sent forth light:

original: sambandho. Ālokaṭṭhāneti attanā kataālokaṭṭhāne. Ālokakiccaṃ natthīti andhakāraṭṭhāne
analyzed: sambandhaḥ āloka ṭṭhāne ti attanā kata āloka ṭṭhāne āloka kiccam na atthi iti andhakāra ṭṭhāne
translated: the connection is this. In a place of light: in a place where he himself had made light. There is no function of seeing light: in a place of darkness,

original: ālokadassanaṃ viya ālokaṭṭhāne ālokadassanakiccaṃ natthi. Tasmā tesaṃ sattānaṃ “kiṃ
analyzed: āloka dassanam viya āloka ṭṭhāne āloka dassana kiccam na atthi tasmā tesam sattānam kim
translated: as if there were seeing of light, there is no function of seeing light in a place of light. Therefore, as they were discerning, thinking:

original: āloko ayaṃ, kassa nu kho ayaṃ āloko”ti? Vicinantānaṃ cintentānaṃ. Sabbeti sahassilokadhātuyaṃ
analyzed: ālokaḥ ayam kassa nu kho ayam āloko ti vicinantānam cintentānam sabbe iti sahassi lokadhātuyam
translated: “What is this light? Whose is this light?”

original: sabbe devamanussā. Osaṭāya parisāyāti dhammassavanatthaṃ sabbosaṭāya paricitaparicchinnāya
analyzed: sabbe deva manussāḥ osaṭāya parisāya ati dhamma ssavana ttham sabba usaṭāya paricita paricchinnāya
translated: all the gods and men: all the gods and men in the entire universe of a thousand worlds. In the assembled multitude: in the assembled multitude that had gathered together to listen to the Dhamma.

original: parisāya. Saddaṃ suṇiṃsūti na kevalaṃ saddameva suṇiṃsu, atha kho atthopīti yathādhippeto
analyzed: parisāya saddam suṇiṃsu iti na kevalam saddam eva suṇiṃsu atha kho atthaḥ api iti yathā adhippeto
translated: In the assembly: not only did they hear the sound, but they also heard the meaning, as it were, since the meaning was as well known to them as the sound.

original: tesaṃ pakatisavanupacāre viya pākaṭo ahosi, tisahassilokadhātuṃ viññāpesīti.
analyzed: tesam pakati savana upacāre viya pākaṭaḥ ahosi ti sahassi lokadhātum viññāpesi iti
translated: He made the three-thousandfold world-system known.

original: Aruṇavatīsuttavaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: aruṇavatī sutta vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: The Commentary on the Āruṇavatī Sutta is finished.

original: 5. Parinibbānasuttavaṇṇanā
analyzed: parinibbāna sutta vaṇṇanā
translated: The Parinibbāna Sutta

original: 186. Evaṃ taṃ kusinārāya hotīti yathā anurodhapurassa thūpārāmo dakkhiṇapacchimadisāyaṃ,
analyzed: evam tam kusinārāya hoti iti yathā anurodha purassa thūpa ārāmaḥ dakkhiṇa pacchima disā ayam
translated: Thus it was for Kusinārā: just as the Thūpārāma was for Anurādha- pura in the south-east,

original: evaṃ taṃ uyyānaṃ kusinārāya dakkhiṇapacchimadisāyaṃ hoti. Tasmāti yasmā nagaraṃ pavisitukāmā
analyzed: evam tam uyyānam kusinārāya dakkhiṇa pacchima disāyam hoti tasmā ati yasmā nagaram pavisitu kāmā
translated: so this park was for Kusinārā in the south-east. Therefore: since those who wanted to enter the city

original: uyyānato upecca vattanti gacchanti etenāti upavattananti vuccati, tasmā. Tanti sālapantibhāvena
analyzed: uyyānataḥ upecca vattanti gacchanti etena ati upavattananti vuccati tasmā sāla panti bhāvena
translated: went out from the park and turned back, it is called the “turning-back” . Thus: because of the presence of the Sāla-tree grove,

original: ṭhitaṃ sālavanaṃ. Antarenāti vemajjhe. Appamajjanaṃ appamādo, so pana atthato ñāṇūpasaṃhitā
analyzed: ṭhitam sāla vanam antarena ati vemajjhe appamajjanam appamādaḥ saḥ pana atthataḥ ñāṇa upasaṃhitā
translated: in the middle, in the centre. Carefulness is heedfulness. But that is in fact mindfulness associated with knowledge.

original: sati. Yasmā tattha satiyā byāpāro sātisayo, tasmā “satiavippavāsenā”ti vuttaṃ. Appamādapadeyeva
analyzed: sati yasmā tattha satiyāḥ byāpāro sa atisayo tasmā sati a vippavāsena ati vuttam appamāda padeyā iva
translated: Since there is an excess of mindfulness there, it is said “by the non-abandoning of mindfulness” . In the phrase “by heedfulness”

original: pakkhipitvā abhāsi atthato tassa sakalassa buddhavacanassa saṅgaṇhanato.
analyzed: pakkhipitvā abhāsi atthataḥ tassa sakalassa buddha vacanassa saṅgaṇhanato
translated: and he spoke of it as the “collection” because it collects together the whole of the Buddha’s word in its meaning.

original: Jhānādīsu citte ca paramukkaṃsagatavasībhāvatāya “ettake kāle ettakā samāpattiyo
analyzed: jhāna ādīsu citte ca ettake kāle ettakā samāpattiyaḥ
translated: The Elder Anuruddha, having attained the highest mastery over the mind in the jhānas, etc.,

original: samāpajjitvā parinibbāyissāmī”ti kālaparicchedaṃ katvā samāpattisamāpajjanaṃ parinibbānaparikammanti
analyzed: samāpajjitvā parinibbāyissāmi iti kāla paricchedam katvā samāpatti samāpajjanam parinibbāna parikamman ti
translated: determined the time, thinking, “In such and such a time I shall attain such and such an attainment and then attain Nibbāna,” and his attainment of the attainments was the act of preparation for his Nibbāna.

original: adhippetaṃ. Theroti anuruddhatthero.
analyzed: adhippetam thero ti anuruddha thero
translated: This is the purport. The Elder: the Elder Anuruddha.

original: Ayampi cāti yathāvuttapañcasaṭṭhiyā jhānānaṃ samāpannakathāpi saṅkhepakathā eva.
analyzed: ayam pi ca ati yathā vutta pañca saṭṭhiyā jhānānam samāpanna kathā api saṅkhepa kathā eva
translated: This too is a brief account: the account of the attainment of the fifty-six jhānas stated in the way already given is also a brief account.

original: Kasmā? Yasmā bhagavā tadā devasikaṃ vaḷañjanasamāpattiyo sabbāpi aparihāpetvā samāpajji
analyzed: kasmai yasmai bhagavā tadā devasikam vaḷañjana samāpattiyaḥ sabbā api a parihāpetvā samāpajji
translated: Why? Because on that occasion the Blessed One attained all the vaḍḍha-jhānas without omitting any, day after day,🔽showing that he was entering the city of Nibbāna.

original: evāti dassento “nibbānapuraṃ pavisanto”tiādimāha. Catuvīsati…pe… pavisitvāti ettha
analyzed: eva ati dassentaḥ nibbāna puram pavisantaḥ iti ādim āha catuvīsati pe pavisitvā iti ettha
translated: As regards the words “twenty-four times a hundred thousand koṭis of times” , etc.,

original: keci tāva āhu “bhagavā devasikaṃ dvādasakoṭisatasahassakkhattuṃ mahākaruṇāsamāpattiṃ
analyzed: keci tāva āhu bhagavā devasikam dvādasa koṭi sata sahassa kkhattum mahā karuṇā samāpattim
translated: some say this: “The Blessed One attained the great compassion twelve hundred thousand koṭis of times a day,

original: samāpajjati, dvādasakoṭisatasahassakkhattumeva phalasamāpattiṃ samāpajjati, tasmā
analyzed: samāpajjati dvādasa koṭi sata sahassa kkhattum eva phala samāpattim samāpajjati tasmā
translated: and he enters upon the fruition attainment twelve hundred thousand times, then

original: tadāpi catuvīsatikoṭisatasahassasaṅkhā samāpattiyo samāpajjati. Vuttañhetaṃ bhagavatā
analyzed: tadā api catuvīsati koṭi sata sahassa saṅkhā samāpattiyaḥ samāpajjati vuttam ha etam bhagavatā
translated: he enters upon attainment twenty-four hundred thousand times. For this is said by the Blessed One:

original: ‘tathāgataṃ, bhikkhave, arahantaṃ sammāsambuddhaṃ dve vitakkā bahulaṃ samudācaranti
analyzed: tathāgatam bhikkhave arahantam sammāsambuddham dve vitakkāḥ bahulam samudācaranti
translated: “Bhikkhus, two ideas frequently occur to a Tathāgata, Arahant, Perfectly Enlightened One:

original: khemo ca vitakko paviveko ca vitakko’ti. Khemo hi vitakko bhagavato mahākaruṇāsamāpattiṃ🔽pūretvā ṭhito, pavivekavitakko arahattaphalasamāpattiṃ. Buddhānaṃ hi bhavaṅgaparivāso
analyzed: khemaḥ ca vitakko pavivekaḥ ca vitakko ti khemaḥ hi vitakkaḥ bhagavataḥ mahā karuṇā samāpattim  pūretvā ṭhitaḥ pa viveka vitakkaḥ arahatta phala samāpattim buddhānam hi bhavaṅga parivāsaḥ
translated: the idea of safety and the idea of seclusion” . For the idea of safety is the Blessed One’s Great Compassion, which is fulfilled in the attainment of the Tathāgata’s state of composure,🔽and the idea of seclusion is the Arahant’s fruition attainment. For Buddhas have a light

original: lahuko matthakappatto samāpattīsu vasībhāvo, tasmā samāpajjanavuṭṭhānāni katipayacittakkhaṇeheva
analyzed: lahukaḥ matthaka ppatto samāpattīsu vasībhāvo tasmā samāpajjana vuṭṭhānāni katipaya citta kkhaṇehi iva
translated: bhavanga , and they have mastery in attainment that is fully developed at the summit. So their entry into attainment and emergence from it are effected in a mere few conscious moments.

original: ijjhanti. Pañca rūpāvacarasamāpattiyo catasso arūpasamāpattiyo appamaññāsamāpattiyā
analyzed: ijjhanti pañca rūpāvacara samāpattiyaḥ catasso arūpa samāpattiyaḥ appamaññā samāpattiyā
translated: The five fine-material-sphere attainments, the four immaterial-sphere attainments, the four measureless states,

original: saddhiṃ nirodhasamāpatti arahattaphalasamāpatti cāti dvādasetā samāpattiyo bhagavā
analyzed: saddhim nirodha samāpatti arahatta phala samāpatti ca ati dvādasa itāḥ samāpattiyaḥ bhagavā
translated: and the Arahant’s fruition attainment together with the attainment of cessation—these twelve attainments

original: paccekaṃ divase divase koṭisatasahassakkhattuṃ purebhattaṃ samāpajjati, tathā pacchābhattanti
analyzed: paccekam divase divase koṭi sata sahassa khattum purebhattam samāpajjati tathā pacchābhattam ti
translated: and he entered upon it a hundred thousand koṭis of times each day, both before and after his meal.

original: evaṃ catuvīsatikoṭisatasahassasaṅkhā devasikaṃ vaḷañjanakakasiṇasamāpattiyo”ti.🔽Apare panāhu “yaṃ taṃ bhagavatā abhisambodhidivase pacchimayāme paṭiccasamuppādaṅgamukhena
analyzed: evam catuvīsati koṭi sata sahassa saṅkhā devasikam vaḷañjanaka kasiṇa samāpattiyāḥ ti  apare pana āhu yam tam bhagavatā abhisambodhi divase pacchima yāme paṭiccasamuppāda aṅga mukhena
translated: Thus he entered upon the kasiṇa attainment of the blue water lily twenty-four hundred thousand koṭis of times.”🔽But others say that it was the knowledge that the Blessed One directed upon the dependent origination in forward and reverse order, beginning from aging-and-death, on the night of his enlightenment,

original: paṭilomanayena jarāmaraṇato paṭṭhāya ñāṇaṃ otāretvā anupadadhammavipassanaṃ ārabhantena
analyzed: paṭiloma nayena jarā maraṇataḥ paṭṭhāya ñāṇam otāretvā anupada dhamma vipassanam ārabhantena
translated: when he began the insight that penetrates the dhammas without remainder.

original: yathā nāma puriso suviduggaṃ mahāgahanaṃ mahāvanaṃ chindanto antarantarā nisānasilāyaṃ
analyzed: yathā nāma purisaḥ suviduggam mahā gahanam mahā vanam chindantaḥ antar antarā nisāna silāyam
translated: Just as a man who is cutting down a great tree in a deep wood sharpens his axe from time to time on a stone,

original: pharasuṃ nisitaṃ karoti, evamevaṃ nisānasilāsadisiyo samāpattiyo antarantarā samāpajjitvā
analyzed: pharasum nisitam karoti evam evam nisāna silāsa disiyaḥ samāpattiyaḥ antar antarā samāpajjitvā
translated: so the Blessed One, entering upon the attainment of the kasiṇas from time to time,

original: ñāṇassa tikkhavisadabhāvaṃ sampādetuṃ anulomapaṭilomato paccekaṃ paṭiccasamuppādaṅgesu
analyzed: ñāṇassa tikkha visada bhāvam sampādetum anuloma paṭilomato paccekam paṭiccasamuppāda aṅgesu
translated: made his knowledge sharp and clear by means of the forward and reverse order of the dependent origination in its twelve factors.

original: lakkhakoṭisamāpattisamāpajjanavasena sammasanañāṇaṃ pavatteti, tadanusārena bhagavā🔽buddhabhūtopi anulomapaṭilomato paṭiccasamuppādaṅgamukhena vipassanāvasena divase🔽divase lakkhakoṭiphalasamāpattiyo samāpajjati, taṃ sandhāya vuttaṃ, ‘catuvīsatikoṭisatasahassasaṅkhā
analyzed: lakkha koṭi samāpatti samāpajjana vasena sammasana ñāṇam pavatteti tad anusārena bhagavā  buddha bhūtaḥ api anuloma paṭilomato paṭiccasamuppāda aṅga mukhena vipassanā vasena divase  divase lakkha koṭi phala samāpattiyaḥ samāpajjati tam sandhāya vuttam catuvīsati koṭi sata sahassa saṅkhā
translated: He does so by means of the attainment of the hundred thousand myriads of characteristics. In conformity with that, the Blessed One,

original: samāpattiyo pavisitvā”’ti.
analyzed: samāpattiyaḥ pavisitvā ati
translated: even when he had become a Buddha, entered upon the attainment of the hundred thousand myriads of fruits by means of insight in the forward and reverse order by way of the factors of the dependent origination day by day. It was with reference to this that it was said above, ‘after entering upon the attainment of the hundred thousand myriads of characteristics and fruits’ .

original: Imāni dvepi samanantarāneva paccavekkhaṇāyapi yebhuyyena nānantariyakatāya jhānapakkhikabhāvato.
analyzed: imāni dve pi yebhuyyena na ānantariyaka tāya jhāna pakkhika bhāvato
translated: These two are only immediately followed by the reviewing of the knowledge of comprehension, because they are mostly not interrupted by others and because they are of the jhāna type.

original: Yasmā sabbapacchimaṃ bhavaṅgacittaṃ tato tato cavanato “cutī”ti vuccati, tasmā na🔽kevalaṃ ayameva bhagavā, atha kho sabbepi sattā bhavaṅgacitteneva cavantīti dassetuṃ
analyzed: sabba pacchimam bhavaṅga cittam tato tato cavanato cuti iti vuccati tasmā na  kevalam ayam eva bhagavā atha kho sabbe pi sattāḥ bhavaṅga cittena iva cavanti iti dassetuṃ
translated: Since the last consciousness of the life-continuum is called death because of its falling away from here and there, it is not

original: “ye hi kecī”tiādi vuttaṃ. Dukkhasaccenāti dukkhasaccapariyāpannena cuticittena kālaṃ
analyzed: ye hi keci itiādi vuttam dukkha saccena ati dukkha sacca pariyāpannena cuti cittena kālam
translated: only the Blessed One who does so, but all beings fall away with the life-continuum consciousness. In order to show this, it was said, ‘Whatever beings die’ . With the death consciousness that is included in the truth of suffering,

original: kālakiriyaṃ karonti pāpuṇanti, kālagamanato vā karonti peccāti.
analyzed: kālakiriyam karonti pāpuṇanti kāla gamanataḥ vā karonti
translated: they make an end of it, or they make it and then pass away.

original: Paṭibhāgapuggalavirahito sīlādiguṇehi asadisatāya sadisapuggalarahito. Saṅkhārā vūpasammanti
analyzed: paṭibhāga puggala virahitaḥ sīla ādi guṇehi asadisa tāya sadisa puggala rahitaḥ saṅkhārāḥ vūpasammanti
translated: Free from a counterpart: free from a person similar to him in being unequalled for the special qualities of virtue, etc. Formations subside here:

original: etthāti vūpasamoti evaṃ saṅkhātaṃ ñātaṃ kathitaṃ nibbānameva sukhanti. Lomahaṃsanakoti
analyzed: ettha ati vūpasamaḥ ti evam saṅkhātam ñātam kathitam nibbānam eva sukhanti lomahaṃsanako ti
translated: Nibbana, which is called “subsidence” in this way, is known, spoken of, as bliss.🔽The hair on the body stood on end: it caused the hair to bristle.

original: lomānaṃ haṭṭhabhāvāpādano. Bhiṃsanakoti avītarāgānaṃ bhayajanako āsi ahosi. Sabbākāravaraguṇūpeteti
analyzed: lomānam haṭṭha bhāva āpādanaḥ bhiṃsanako ti avīta rāgānam bhaya janakaḥ āsi ahosi sabba ākāra vara guṇa upeta iti
translated: It was terrifying: it caused fear in those not free from lust.

original: sabbehi ākāravarehi uttamakāraṇehi sīlādiguṇehi samannāgate. Asaṅkuṭitenāti akuṭitena
analyzed: sabbehi ākāra varehi uttama kāraṇehi sīla ādi guṇehi samannāgate asaṅkuṭitena ati akuṭitena
translated: Endowed with the special qualities of every aspect: endowed with the special qualities of virtue, etc., in every aspect, in every mode, in the highest way.🔽With his mind uncovered: with his mind unconfined,🔽with his mind fully expanded.

original: vipphārikābhāvato. Suvikasitenevāti pītisomanassayogato suṭṭhu vikasitena. Vedanaṃ🔽adhivāsesi sabhāvasamudayādito suṭṭhu paññātattā. Anāvaraṇavimokkho sabbaso nibbidabhāvo.
analyzed: vipphārikā bhāvato su vikasitena iva ati pīti somanassa yogato suṭṭhu vikasitena vedanam  adhivāsesi sabhāva samudaya āditaḥ suṭṭhu paññāta ttā anāvaraṇa vimokkho sabbasas nibbida bhāvo
translated: He endured the feeling: he fully understood the feeling by way of its specific nature, origin, etc.🔽The unhampered deliverance: the complete absence of dispassion.

original: Tenāha “apaññattibhāvūpagamo”ti. Pajjotanibbānasadisoti padīpassa nibbānasadiso tattha
analyzed: tena āha a paññatti bhāva upagamo ti pajjota nibbāna sadiso ti padīpassa nibbāna sadiso tattha
translated: Hence it is said: “The attainment of the state of non-definition.”🔽Like the flame of a lamp: like the flame of a lamp that is going out.

original: vilīyitvā avaṭṭhānābhāvato.
analyzed: vilīyitvā avaṭṭhāna abhāvato
translated: because they have no fixed location, having dissolved away.

original: Parinibbānasuttavaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: parinibbāna sutta vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: The Commentary on the Parinibbāna Sutta is finished.

original: Dutiyavaggavaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: dutiya vagga vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: The commentary on the second section is finished.

original: Sāratthappakāsiniyā saṃyuttanikāya-aṭṭhakathāya
analyzed: sārattha ppakāsiniyā saṃyutta nikāya aṭṭhakathāya
translated: The commentary on the Connected Discourses on Brahmā🔽is finished.🔽The exposition of the meaning of the word “Brahmā”

original: Brahmasaṃyuttavaṇṇanāya līnatthappakāsanā samattā.
translated: is finished.

original: 7. Brāhmaṇasaṃyuttaṃ
analyzed: brāhmaṇa saṃyuttam
translated: The Connected Discourses with Brahmins

original: 1. Arahantavaggo
analyzed: arahanta vaggo
translated: The Chapter with Arahats

original: 1. Dhanañjānīsuttavaṇṇanā🔽187. Dhanañjānigottāti ettha pubbapurisato āgatassa kulavaṃsassa nāmābhidhānasaṅkhātaṃ🔽gaṃ tāyatīti gottaṃ. (Kiṃ pana tanti? Aññakulaparamparāsādhāraṇaṃ tassa kulassa ādipurisasamudāgataṃ
analyzed: dhanañjānī sutta vaṇṇanā  dhanañjāni gottā ti ettha pubba purisataḥ āgatassa kula vaṃsassa nāma abhidhāna saṅkhātam  gaṃ tāyati iti gottam kim pana añña kula paramparā sādhāraṇam tassa kulassa ādi purisa samudāgatam
translated: The explanation of the Dhanañjāni Sutta🔽Herein, the meaning of the term “Dhanañjāni clan” is this. A clan is what goes on (gati) by means of a name, which is the designation for the line of ancestors coming down in succession from the first ancestor.🔽But what is that? It is the form of the clan’s identity consisting in the first ancestor’s attainment of a particular state of welfare that is not shared by other clans.

original: taṃkulapariyāpannasādhāraṇaṃ sāmaññarūpanti daṭṭhabbaṃ.) Dhanañjānigottaṃ etissanti
analyzed: taṃ kula pariyāpanna sādhāraṇam sāmañña rūpanti daṭṭhabbam dhanañjāni gottam etissanti
translated: The clan of Dhanañjāni is what belongs to that clan.

original: dhanañjānigottā. Tassā udānassa kāraṇaṃ pucchitvā ādito paṭṭhāya vibhāvetuṃ “so kirā”tiādi
analyzed: dhanañjāni gottā tassāḥ udānassa kāraṇam pucchitvā āditaḥ paṭṭhāya vibhāvetum so kirāti ādi
translated: After asking the reason for his utterance, the commentator begins to explain it from the beginning with the words “He is said.”

original: vuttaṃ. Nānārasabhojanaṃ detīti yojanā. Pañcagorasasampāditaṃ sālibhattaṃ sūpasākabyañjanaṃ
analyzed: vuttam nānā rasa bhojanam deti iti yojanā pañca gorasa sampāditam sālibhattam sūpa sāka byañjanam
translated: The construction is: “He gives various-flavoured food.” Cooked rice, curry, and condiments, prepared with the five flavours,

original: nānārasaṃ brāhmaṇabhojanaṃ. Maṇḍalaggakhagganti maṇḍalaggasaṅkhātaṃ khaggaṃ. Duvidho
analyzed: nānā rasam brāhmaṇa bhojanam maṇḍa lagga khagganti maṇḍa lagga saṅkhātam khaggam duvidhaḥ
translated: are “various-flavoured brahmin’s food.” A sword with a hilt is a sword with a handle. For a sword is of two kinds:

original: hi khaggo maṇḍalaggo dīghaggoti. Tattha yassa aggo maṇḍalākārena ṭhito, so maṇḍalaggo.
analyzed: hi khaggaḥ maṇḍalaggaḥ dīghaggo ti tattha yassa aggaḥ maṇḍala ākārena ṭhito saḥ maṇḍalaggo
translated: with a hilt and long. Herein, the one whose tip is set in the form of a circle is with a hilt.

original: Yassa pana asiputtikā viya dīgho, so dīghaggo.
analyzed: yassa pana asiputtikā viya dīghaḥ saḥ dīghaggo
translated: But the one that is long like a razor is long.

original: Sāsanāti anusāsanā. “Namo…pe… sambuddhassā”ti evaṃ vuttā pañcapadikagāthā. Satthusāsane
analyzed: sāsanā ati anusāsanā namope sambuddhassa ati evam vuttā pañca padika gāthā satthu sāsane
translated: The Teacher’s Dispensation is the instruction. The five-line stanza beginning, “Homage to the Buddha, the Best of men …” .

original: hi lokiyacchandaṃ anapekkhitvā esā pañcapadikagāthāti daṭṭhabbā. Okkāvaradharāti
analyzed: hi lokiya chandam an apekkhitvā esā pañca padika gāthā ati daṭṭhabbā okkāvaradharā ti
translated: For in the Dispensation of the Master this five-line stanza should be regarded as the five-line stanza, without regard to mundane desire.

original: pubbapurisasaṅkhātaukkākavaṃsavaradhārikā. Sakkāti sakkuṇeyyaṃ.
analyzed: pubba purisa saṅkhātā okkāka vaṃsa vara dhārikā sakkā ati sakkuṇeyyam
translated: The descendants of Okkāka are the upholders of the clan of Okkāka, which is called the clan of the ancient men. The Sakyan is the Sakyan who is able.

original: Evanti “sace me aṅgamaṅgānī”tiādinā iminā pakārena. “Pañca gāthāsatāni pana aṭṭhakathaṃ
analyzed: sace me aṅgam aṅgāni iti ādinā iminā pakārena pañca gāthā satāni
translated: Thus: in this way, “If my limbs …” . The five hundred stanzas are the five hundred stanzas of the commentary.

original: āruḷhāni, idha pana dve eva uddhaṭā”ti vadanti. Paharituṃ vāti ekavārampi hatthena
analyzed: āruḷhāni idha pana dve eva vadanti paharitum vāti eka vāram pi hatthena
translated: “Here, however, only two are mentioned.”

original: vā pādena vā paharitumpi parāmasitumpi asakkontoti attho. So hi tassā ariyasāvikāya🔽ānubhāvena attano sāmatthiyena vase vattāpanatthaṃ santajjitvāpi tadanuvattanto nibbiso
analyzed: vā pādena vā paharitum pi parāmasitum pi a sakkontā iti attho saḥ hi tassa ariya sāvikāya  ānubhāvena attanaḥ sāmatthiyena vase vattāpana tham santajjitvā api tad anuvattantaḥ nibbisaḥ
translated: To strike: the meaning is, unable to strike even once with his hand or foot or to touch her. For he was unable to do so through the power of that noble disciple and through his own inability.

original: ahosi. Tenāha “bhotī”tiādi.
analyzed: tena āha bhoti itiādi
translated: Though he was enraged for the purpose of bringing her under his control, he became disgusted by following her. Therefore he said, “Lady,” etc.🔽To his brahmin: to his brahmin husband.

original: Tassa brāhmaṇassāti attano sāmikabrāhmaṇassa. Upasaṃharantīti upanentī. Tasmiṃ samayeti🔽tasmiṃ dukkhuppattikāle “sabbe saṅkhārā dukkhā”ti bhagavato vacanaṃ anussaritvā “dasabalassa
analyzed: tassa brāhmaṇassa ati attanaḥ sāmika brāhmaṇassa upasaṃharantī iti upanentī tasmin samaye iti  tasmin dukkha uppatti kāle sabbe saṅkhārāḥ dukkhā ati bhagavataḥ vacanam anussaritvā dasabalassa
translated: To bring: to bring near.

original: bhagavato”tiādīsu yathāparicitaṃ guṇapadaṃ anussari. Tenāha “dasabalaṃ sarī”ti.
analyzed: bhagavatā iti ādīsu yathā paricitam guṇa padam tena āha dasa balam sari iti
translated: At that time: at the time of the arising of that suffering, recollecting the Blessed One’s words, “All formations are suffering,” she recollected the qualities of the Blessed One, the One of Ten Powers, as she had learned them. Therefore she said, “The One of Ten Powers.”🔽Because of his lack of patience and straightforwardness, he became angry.

original: Khantisoraccarahitatāya kujjhitvā. Bhijjitvāti saṃyatābhāvato tassa brāhmaṇassa antare
analyzed: khanti soracca rahita tāya kujjhitvā bhijjitvā ati saṃyata abhāvataḥ tassa brāhmaṇassa antare
translated: Because of his lack of self-control, he split.

original: mettibhedena bhijjitvā. Evamevāti yathā etarahi akāraṇena, evameva aññadāpi akāraṇenāti🔽attho. Nikkāraṇatādīpane evaṃ-saddo, eva-saddo pana avadhāraṇattho. Nikkāraṇatā ca🔽nāma niratthakatā, niratthakavippalāpabhāvenettha evaṃ-saddassa gahaṇe pavatti gavesitabbā.
analyzed: metti bhedena bhijjitvā evam eva ati yathā etarahi akāraṇena evam eva aññadā api akāraṇena ati  atthaḥ nikkāraṇa tā dīpane evaṃsaddaḥ evasaddaḥ pana avadhāraṇa atthaḥ nikkāraṇa tā ca  nāma niratthaka tā niratthaka vippalāpa bhāvena ittha evaṃsaddassa gahaṇe pavatti gavesitabbā
translated: Just as now, so also in the past, and so also in the future, without reason,

original: Garahattho vāyaṃ evaṃ-saddo anekatthattā nipātānaṃ. Garahatthatā cassa vasalisaddasannidhānato pākaṭā eva.🔽Gāmanigamaraṭṭhapūjitoti iminā gāmanigamaraṭṭhasāmikehi pūjitabhāvo dīpito gāmādīnaṃ🔽tesaṃ vase vattanato. Asukassa nāma puggalassa. Sesanti abhikkantantiādi, yampi caññaṃ🔽idhāgataṃ heṭṭhā vaṇṇitañca.🔽Dhanañjānīsuttavaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.🔽2. Akkosasuttavaṇṇanā
analyzed: gara hatthaḥ vā ayam evaṃsaddaḥ aneka attha ttā nipātānam gara hattha tā cassa vasali sadda sannidhānataḥ pākaṭā eva 🔽gāma nigama raṭṭha pūjito ti iminā gāma nigama raṭṭha sāmikehi pūjita bhāvaḥ dīpitaḥ gāma ādīnam 🔽tesam vase vattanataḥ asukassa nāma puggalassa sesa nti abhikkanta nti ādi yam pi caññam 🔽idha āgatam heṭṭhā vaṇṇitam ca 🔽dhanañjānī sutta vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā 🔽akkosa sutta vaṇṇanā

original: 188. Bhāradvājova soti bhāradvājo nāma eva so brāhmaṇo. Gottavasena hi tayidaṃ nāmaṃ,
analyzed: bhāradvājaḥ uva saḥ iti bhāradvājaḥ nāma eva saḥ brāhmaṇaḥ hi tayā idam nāmam
translated: He was a Bharadvaja: he was a brahmin named Bharadvaja. For this is a name by clan.

original: visesena panetaṃ jātanti dassetuṃ “pañcamattehī”tiādi vuttaṃ. Jānikatāti ñātivaggahānikatā.
analyzed: visesena pana etam jātanti dassetum pañca mattehi itiādi vuttam jānika tā ati ñāti vagga hānika tā
translated: But in order to show that he was a particular one, it is said, “With five hundred” and so on. He was a kinsman: he was a relative.🔽His kinsmen’s faction was destroyed: his kinsmen’s faction was destroyed because of that. As it is said:

original: Pakkho bhinnoti tato eva ñātipakkho naṭṭho. Yathā domanassito anattamanoti vattabbaṃ
analyzed: pakkhaḥ bhinnaḥ ti tatas eva ñāti pakkhaḥ naṭṭhaḥ yathā domanassitaḥ anattamano ti vattabbam
translated: “When a man is angry, his kinsmen are displeased;🔽when he is angry, his friends are displeased” .🔽He was displeased: he was unhappy.

original: labhati, evaṃ kupitoti āha “domanassena cā”ti. Dasahīti anavasesapariyādānavasena
analyzed: labhati evam kupitaḥ iti āha domanassena ca ati dasahi iti anavasesa pariyādāna vasena
translated: He was angry: therefore it is said, “and with displeasure” .🔽He abused him with five hundred stanzas: this is said by way of complete enumeration.

original: vuttaṃ pañcahi gāthāsatehi akkosanto tathā akkoseyyāti katvā. Tattha pana yena kenaci
analyzed: vuttam pañcahi gāthā satehi akkosanto tathā akkoseyya iti katvā tattha pana yena kenacid
translated: For even if he abused him with any one of them, still he would have abused him.

original: akkosantopi akkosatiyeva nāma. Karosi mama bhātikassa pabbajjaṃ.🔽Sambhuñjatīti sambhogaṃ karoti. Akkosādīhi ekato bhuñjati. Vītiharatīti byatihāraṃ
analyzed: akkosantaḥ api akkosatiyā iva nāma karosi mama bhātikassa pabbajjam  sambhuñjati iti sambhogam karoti akkosa ādīhi ekatas bhuñjati vītiharati iti byatihāram
translated: You have given my brother the going forth.

original: karoti, akkosato paccakkosanādinā vinimayaṃ karotīti attho. Tenāha “katassa paṭikāraṃ
analyzed: karoti akkosataḥ paccakkosana ādinā vinimayam karoti iti attho tena āha katassa paṭikāram
translated: He enjoyed: he had intercourse with. He ate together with by means of abuse, etc. He exchanged: he made a counter-abuse, etc., in return for the abuse, etc. The meaning is, he made a counter-exchange. Therefore it is said, “in return for what was done” .

original: karotī”ti. Assa anussavavasena sutvā “sapati ma”nti saññino bhayaṃ uppajjīti yojanā.
analyzed: karoti iti assa anussava vasena sutvā sapati manti saññinaḥ bhayam uppajji iti yojanā
translated: “He is cursing me” .

original: Assāti brāhmaṇassa. Sutvāti padaṃ ubhayatthāpi yojetabbaṃ “tavevetaṃ brāhmaṇāti sutvā,🔽anussavavasena sutvā”ti ca. Kāmaṃ kisavacchādayo sapanaṃ nādaṃsu, devatānaṃyeva hi🔽so attho, sattānaṃ pana tathā saññā uppannā, sopi tathāsaññī ahosi. Tenāha “anussavavasenā”ti.
analyzed: assa ati brāhmaṇassa sutvā iti padam ubhayattha api yojetabbam tava iva etam brāhmaṇa ati sutvā  anussava vasena ca kāmam hi  so attho sattānam pana tathā saññā uppannā saḥ api tathāsaññī ahosi tena āha anussava vasena ati
translated: “The brahmin” : the brahmin who heard the neighing. “Having heard” : this should be construed with both “having heard ‘This is yours, brahmin’ ” and “having heard by hearsay.”🔽The horses, the calves, etc., did not actually neigh, but the meaning was conveyed to the gods by the horses, etc., and the perception of the meaning arose in the beings in that way. The brahmin also perceived it in that way.

original: Dantassa sabbaso damathaṃ upagatattā. Nibbisevanassāti rāgadosādihetukavipphandanarahitassa.🔽Tassevāti paṭikujjhantasseva puggalassa tena kodhena pāpaṃ hoti pāpassa santānantarasaṅkantiyā
analyzed: dantassa sabbasas damatham upagata ttā nibbisevanassa ati rāga dosa ādi hetuka vipphandana rahitassa  tassa iva ati paṭikujjhantassa iva puggalassa tena kodhena pāpam hoti pāpassa santa anantara saṅkantiyā
translated: “By hearsay” means by the report of others. “Well-tamed” : completely subdued. “Not given to running wild” : free from the running wild caused by lust, hatred, etc.🔽“To him alone” : to the person who is angry. The evil is his because of the immediate continuity of the evil.

original: abhāvato. Keci pana “tassevāti tasseva paṭikujjhantapurisassa tena paṭikujjhanena.
analyzed: abhāvato keci pana tassa iva ati tassa iva paṭikujjhanta purisassa tena paṭikujjhanena
translated: Some, however, say that “to him alone” refers to the person who is angry, and that the evil is his because of the anger.

original: Pāpiyoti paṭikujjhantapuggalassa lāmakataro”ti evamettha atthaṃ vadanti. Satiyā samannāgato
analyzed: pāpiyaḥ ti paṭikujjhanta puggalassa lāmakataraḥ ti evam ettha attham vadanti satiyā samannāgato
translated: “Evil” is the person who is angry. “Better” is the person who is not angry. “The worst” is the person who is angry and contemptuous. This is how they explain the meaning here.

original: hutvā paṭisaṅkhāne ṭhito adhivāseti, na saho mūḷho hutvāti adhippāyo. Ubhinnaṃ tikicchantanti
analyzed: hutvā paṭisaṅkhāne ṭhitaḥ adhivāseti na sahaḥ mūḷhaḥ hutvā iti adhippāyaḥ ubhinnam tikicchantam ti
translated: The intention is that he endures it after reflecting on it with mindfulness, not after becoming confused.

original: ubhinnaṃ uppannakodhasaṅkhātaṃ kilesabyādhiṃ tikicchantaṃ vūpasamentaṃ taṃ puggalaṃ.
analyzed: ubhinnam uppanna kodha saṅkhātam kilesa byādhim tikicchantam vūpasamentam tam puggalam
translated: “Both”: the person who is curing, who is pacifying, the disease of defilement called anger that has arisen in both.

original: Yo puggalotiādinā purimāsu gāthāsu pavattitāni padāni sambandhitvā dasseti. Pañcasu
analyzed: yaḥ puggalaḥ iti ādinā purimāsu gāthāsu pavattitāni padāni sambandhitvā dasseti pañcasu
translated: “The person” and so on: he shows the words that occur in the previous verses by connecting them.

original: khandhesu yāthāvato vinītā ariyadhammassa kovidā nāma hontīti āha “dhammassāti pañcakkhandhadhammassā”ti.
analyzed: khandhesu yāthāvataḥ vinītāḥ ariya dhammassa kovidāḥ nāma honti iti āha dhammassa ati pañca kkhandha dhammassa ati
translated: They are called “skilled in the noble Dhamma” because they are trained in the five aggregates as they actually are.

original: Idāni tamatthaṃ paripuṇṇaṃ katvā dassento āha “catusaccadhammassa vā”ti.🔽Akkosasuttavaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: idāni tam attham paripuṇṇam katvā dassentaḥ āha catu sacca dhammassa vā ati  akkosa sutta vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: Now, making the meaning complete, he says “or in the Dhamma of the four truths.”🔽The commentary on the Sutta on Abuse is finished.

original: 3. Asurindakasuttavaṇṇanā
translated: The commentary on the Sutta on the Asura’s Son is finished.

original: 189. Tenevāti bhātupabbajiteneva. Assevāti titikkhassa. “Taṃ jayaṃ hotī”ti liṅgavipallāsavasena
analyzed: tena iva āti bhātu pabbajitena iva assa iva āti titikkhassa tam jayam hoti iti liṅga vipallāsa vasena
translated: “Therefore”: because of the brother’s going forth. “The patient one”: the one who is patient. “That victory is his”: the change of gender is

original: vuttanti āha “so jayo hotī”ti, dujjayaṃ kodhaṃ titikkhāya jinantassāti adhippāyo.
analyzed: vuttanti āha saḥ jayaḥ hoti iti dujjayam kodham titikkhāya jinantassa ati adhippāyaḥ
translated: “That is victory” : the intention is that it is victory by enduring the anger that is hard to endure.

original: Yasmā titikkhādayo na kodhavasikaṃ dhuraṃ, taṃ pana bālānaṃ maññanāmattanti idha
analyzed: yasmā titikkha ādayaḥ na kodha vasikam dhuram tam pana bālānam idha
translated: Because patience, etc., are not the burden of anger, but that is the burden of the fools’ infatuation,

original: imamatthaṃ vibhāvetuṃ “katamassā”tiādi vuttaṃ. Vijānatova jayo na avijānato titikkhāya
analyzed: imam attham vibhāvetum katamassa atiādi vuttam vijānataḥ iva jayaḥ na avijānataḥ titikkhāya
translated: here he says “What is his?” in order to elucidate this meaning. Victory is only for one who knows, not for one who does not know, because of the absence of patience, etc.

original: abhāvato. Na hi avijānanto andhabālo kodhaṃ vijetuṃ sakkoti. Kevalaṃ jayaṃ maññati
analyzed: abhāvataḥ na hi a vijānantaḥ andha bālaḥ kodham vijetum sakkoti kevalam jayam maññati
translated: For one who does not know, who is blind and foolish, cannot conquer anger. He only thinks

original: kilesehi parājito samānopīti adhippāyo.
analyzed: kilesehi parājitaḥ samānaḥ api iti adhippāyo
translated: that he has won, although he is really defeated by the defilements.

original: Asurindakasuttavaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: asurindaka sutta vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: The commentary on the Asura Lord’s Thread is finished.

original: 4. Bilaṅgikasuttavaṇṇanā
analyzed: bilaṅgika sutta vaṇṇanā
translated: The Thread about the Vinegar Tasters

original: 190. Suddhanti kevalaṃ sambhāravirahitaṃ. Sambhārayuttanti kaṭukabhaṇḍādisambhārasahitaṃ.
analyzed: kevalam sambhāra virahitam kaṭuka bhaṇḍa ādi sambhāra sahitam
translated: “Pure” : consisting only of the requisites. “With requisites” : together with the requisites of bitter goods, etc.

original: Kañjito nibbattattā kañjikaṃ, āranālaṃ, bilaṅganti attho. Nāmaṃ gahitaṃ saṅgītikāle
analyzed: kañjitaḥ nibbatta ttā kañjikam āranālam bilaṅganti atthaḥ nāmam gahitam saṅgīti kāle
translated: “Vinegar” : because it is produced from the flower of the kañjika tree. The meaning is: “a sour fruit.” The name was taken at the time of the recitation

original: “bilaṅgikabhāradvājo”ti visesanavasena. Tayoti dhanañjāniyā sāmiko bhāradvājo, akkosakabhāradvājo,
analyzed: bilaṅgika bhāradvājaḥ iti visesana vasena tayoḥ ti dhanañjāniyā sāmikaḥ bhāradvājaḥ akkosaka bhāradvājaḥ
translated: as “Bhāradvāja the Vinegar Taster” by way of a distinguishing particular. “Three” : the husband of Dhanañjānī, Bhāradvāja the abuser,

original: asundarikabhāradvājoti ādito tīsu suttesu āgatā tayo. Meti mayhaṃ.
analyzed: āditas tīsu suttesu āgatā tayaḥ mā iti mayham
translated: The three that occur in the first three suttas are the Sundarikabhāradvāja, the Bilaṅgika, and the Ahiṃsakasutta. Me means my.

original: Bilaṅgikasuttavaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: bilaṅgika sutta vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: The commentary on the Bilaṅgikasutta is ended.

original: 5. Ahiṃsakasuttavaṇṇanā
analyzed: ahiṃsaka sutta vaṇṇanā
translated: The Ahiṃsakasutta

original: 191. Esāti brāhmaṇo. “Ahiṃsako aha”nti tadatthaṃ sādhetuṃ icchāya kathesīti vuttaṃ
analyzed: brāhmaṇaḥ ahiṃsakaḥ aham ti tad attham sādhetum icchāya kathesi iti vuttam
translated: Esā ti brāhmaṇo. “Ahiṃsako aha”nti tadatthaṃ sādhetuṃ icchāya kathesīti vuttaṃ

original: “ahiṃsakapañhaṃ pucchī”ti. Tathā ce assāti yathā te nāmassa attho, tathā cetaṃ bhaveyyāsi
analyzed: ahiṃsaka pañham pucchi iti tathā ce assa ati yathā te nāmassa attho tathā ca itam bhaveyyāsi
translated: “ahiṃsakapañhaṃ pucchī”ti. Tathā ce assāti yathā te nāmassa attho, tathā cetaṃ bhaveyyāsi

original: anvatthanāmako bhaveyyāsi ahiṃsako eva siyāti. Na dukkhāpeti dukkhamattampi na uppādeti,
analyzed: anvattha nāmakaḥ bhaveyyāsi ahiṃsakaḥ eva siyāti na dukkhāpeti dukkhamattam pi na uppādeti
translated: anvatthanāmako bhaveyyāsi ahiṃsako eva siyāti. Na dukkhāpeti dukkhamattampi na uppādeti,

original: dukkhato apanetīti attho.
analyzed: dukkhataḥ apaneti iti attho
translated: dukkhato apanetīti attho.

original: Ahiṃsakasuttavaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: ahiṃsaka sutta vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: The commentary on the Ahiṃsakasutta is ended.

original: 6. Jaṭāsuttavaṇṇanā
translated: The Jaṭāsutta

original: 192. Jaṭāpañhassāti “antojaṭā bahijaṭā”ti evaṃ jaṭāpariyāyassa pañhassa.
analyzed: jaṭā pañhassa ati antojaṭā bahijaṭā ati evam jaṭā pariyāyassa pañhassa
translated: Jaṭāpañhassa means the question about the “knots,” in the way beginning, “The inner knots and the outer knots.”

original: Jaṭāsuttavaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: jaṭā sutta vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: The commentary on the Jaṭāsutta is ended.

original: 7. Suddhikasuttavaṇṇanā
analyzed: suddhika sutta vaṇṇanā
translated: The Suddhikasutta

original: 193. Suddhikapañhassāti “nābrāhmaṇo sujjhatī”ti evaṃ suddhasannissitassa pañhassa.
analyzed: suddhika pañhassa ati na abrāhmaṇaḥ sujjhati iti evam suddha sannissitassa pañhassa
translated: Sudhikapañhassa means the question about purity, in the way beginning, “A brahmin is not purified by birth.”

original: Sīlasampannoti pañcavidhaniyamalakkhaṇena sīlena samannāgato. Tapokammanti anasanapañcātapatappanādiparibhedanatapokammaṃ
analyzed: sīla sampannaḥ ti pañcavidha niyama lakkhaṇena sīlena samannāgataḥ tapo kammanti anasana pañca ātapa tappana ādi paribhedana tapo kammaṃ
translated: “Endowed with virtue”: possessing virtue characterized by the five deter-minations. “Ascetic practice”: the ascetic practice classified as fasting, the five heats, the four postures, etc.

original: karontopi. Vijjāti tayo vedāti vadanti “tāya idhalokatthaṃ paralokatthaṃ ñāyantī”ti
analyzed: karontaḥ api vijjā ti tayaḥ veda ati vadanti tāyaḥ idha loka ttham para loka ttham ñāyanti iti
translated: “Knowledge”: the three Vedas, they say, because by them the benefit of this world and the next is known.

original: katvā. Gottacaraṇanti gottasaṅkhātaṃ caraṇaṃ. Brāhmaṇo sujjhati jeṭṭhajātikattā.
analyzed: katvā gotta caraṇanti gotta saṅkhātam caraṇam brāhmaṇaḥ sujjhati jeṭṭhajāti kattā
translated: “Lineage and conduct”: the conduct called “lineage.” The brahmin is purified by birth, because he is the eldest of the castes.

original: Tathā hi so eva tapaṃ ācarituṃ labhati, na itaro. Aññā lāmikā pajāti itaravaṇṇaṃ
analyzed: tathā hi saḥ eva tapam ācaritum labhati na itaraḥ aññā lāmikā pajāti itara vaṇṇam
translated: For only he is fit to practice the ascetic practices, not the others. The other castes are called “mixed births.”

original: vadati. Vacanasahassampīti gāthānekasahassampi. Anto kilesehi pūtiko sabhāvena pūtiko.
analyzed: vadati vacana sahassam pi iti gāthā aneka sahassam pi antar kilesehi pūtikaḥ sabhāvena pūtikaḥ
translated: “Even a thousand words”: even a thousand verses. “Rotten within”: rotten by nature, rotten with defilements.

original: Kiliṭṭhehi kāyakammādīhi kāyaduccaritādīhi.
analyzed: kiliṭṭhehi kāya kamma ādīhi kāya duccarita ādīhi
translated: “Soiled”: soiled by bodily misconduct, etc., i.e., by the three kinds of misconduct.

original: Suddhikasuttavaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: suddhika sutta vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: The commentary on the Sutta on the Purified One is finished.

original: 8. Aggikasuttavaṇṇanā
analyzed: aggika sutta vaṇṇanā
translated: The Aggika Sutta and its Commentary

original: 194. Aggiparicaraṇavasenāti aggihuttajuhanavasena. Sannihitoti missībhāvaṃ sampāpito.
analyzed: aggi paricaraṇa vasena ati aggi hutta juhana vasena sannihitaḥ ti missībhāvam sampāpitaḥ
translated: “By tending the sacred flame”: by tending the sacred fire. “Present”: made to be in a state of mixture.

original: Tathābhūto ca so sappinā saddhiṃ yojito nāma hotīti āha “saṃyojito”ti. Apāyamaggaṃ
analyzed: tathābhūtaḥ ca so sappinā saddhim yojitaḥ nāma hoti iti āha saṃyojitaḥ iti apāya maggam
translated: And when he is so, he is called “united with the oil” .

original: okkamati micchādiṭṭhimicchāsaṅkappādīnaṃ attano santāne samuppādanato. Tenāha “imaṃ laddhi”ntiādi.
analyzed: okkamati micchādiṭṭhi micchāsaṅkappa ādīnam attano santāne samuppādanataḥ tena āha imam laddhi ntiādi
translated: He enters the path to the states of deprivation because of the arising of wrong view, wrong thinking, etc., in his own continuity. Hence he said “This is the theory” , etc.

original: Jātiyāti sadosakiriyāparādhassa asambhavena parisuddhāya jātiyā. Nānappakāre aṭṭhārasavijjāṭṭhānasaññite ganthe. Sutavāti sutvā niṭṭhaṃ patto aggadakkhiṇeyyattāti adhippāyo.🔽Pubbenivāsañāṇenāti idaṃ loke sāsane ca niruḷhatāvasena vuttaṃ. Aññe hi pubbenivāsaṃ
analyzed: jātiyā ti sa dosa kiriyā aparādhassa asambhavena parisuddhāya jātiyā nānappakāre aṭṭhārasa vijjāṭṭhāna saññite ganthe sutavā ti sutvā niṭṭham pattaḥ agga dakkhiṇā iyyattā ti adhippāyaḥ  pubbenivāsa ñāṇena āti idam loke sāsane ca niruḷha tā vasena vuttam aññe hi pubbenivāsam
translated: In a good birth: in a birth that is pure because of the absence of the offense of having done what should not be done. In the various kinds of literature consisting of the eighteen branches of the science of linguistics. Learned: the intention is: having learned, he has reached the state of being worthy of the highest offerings.

original: jānantā pubbenivāsañāṇeneva jānanti, bhagavā pana sabbaññutaññāṇenapi jānāti. Dibbena🔽cakkhunāti etthāpi eseva nayo. Sabbaso jāti khīyati etenāti jātikkhayo, aggamaggo,
analyzed: jānantā pubbenivāsa ñāṇena iva jānanti bhagavā pana sabbaññuta ññāṇena api jānāti dibbena  cakkhunā ti ettha api esā iva nayaḥ sabbasas jāti khīyati etena ati jāti kkhayaḥ aggamaggo
translated: By knowledge of past lives: this is said with reference to his being well known in the world and in the Dispensation. For others know their past lives only by the knowledge of past lives, but the Blessed One knows them also by his knowledge of omniscience.

original: tena pattabbattā āpannattā ca jātikkhayo arahattaṃ. Jānitvā vositavosānoti vijānitabbaṃ
analyzed: tena pattabba ttā āpanna ttā ca jāti kkhayaḥ arahattam jānitvā vosita vosānaḥ ti vijānitabbam
translated: By the divine eye: the same method applies here. The destruction of birth is the supreme path because birth is completely destroyed by it, and it is the destruction of birth because it is attained and reached by it.🔽Having known, he has lived the life: what is to be known is the four noble truths.

original: catusaccadhammaṃ maggañāṇena jānitvā soḷasannampi kiccānaṃ vositavosāno.
analyzed: catu sacca dhammam magga ñāṇena jānitvā
translated: and having known the Four Noble Truths by means of the knowledge of the path, he was one who had fulfilled the sixteen duties.🔽Having shown the origination: having made known the coming of the milk-rice.

original: Uppattiṃ dīpetvāti pāyasadānassa āgamanaṃ pakāsetvā. Gāthāhi abhigītanti dvīhi gāthāhi
analyzed: uppattim dīpetvā ti pāyasa dānassa āgamanam pakāsetvā gāthāhi abhigītanti dvīhi gāthāhi
translated: With verses: with two verses.🔽I sang: I sang out.🔽It should not be eaten: it is not suitable to be eaten.

original: mayā abhigītaṃ. Abhuñjitabbanti bhuñjituṃ na yuttaṃ. “Abhojaneyya”nti kasmā vuttaṃ,
analyzed: mayā abhigītam a bhuñjitabbam ti bhuñjitum na yuttam a bhojaneyyam ti kasmai vuttam
translated: Why is it said: “It is not to be eaten”?🔽Is it not the case that the Blessed One’s intention was utterly pure?

original: nanu bhagavato ajjhāsayo accantameva suddhoti? Saccametaṃ, brāhmaṇo pana pubbe adātukāmo
analyzed: nanu bhagavataḥ ajjhāsayaḥ accantam eva suddhaḥ ti saccam etam brāhmaṇaḥ pana pubbe a dātu kāmo
translated: This is true, but the brahmin, who previously was unwilling to give,

original: pacchā gāthā sutvā dhammadesanāya muduhadayo hutvā dātukāmo ahosi, tasmā taṃ bhikkhūnaṃ
analyzed: pacchā gāthāḥ sutvā dhamma desanāya mudu hadayaḥ hutvā dātu kāmo ahosi tasmā tam bhikkhūnam
translated: after hearing the verses, became soft-hearted through the teaching of the Dhamma and was willing to give. Therefore the Blessed One,🔽in order that in the future people might follow his example, refused it.

original: anāgate diṭṭhānugatiāpajjanatthaṃ paṭikkhipi. Tathā hi anantarasutte kasibhāradvājasutte
analyzed: anāgate diṭṭhānugati āpajjana attham tathā hi anantara sutte kasibhāradvājasutte
translated: For in the next sutta, the Kasibharadvaja Sutta,

original: ca evameva paṭipajji. Tenāha “tvaṃ brāhmaṇā”tiādi. Kilañjamhi…pe… pakāsitāti etena
analyzed: ca evam eva tena āha tvam brāhmaṇa ati ādi etena
translated: he acted in the same way. Therefore it is said: “You, brahmin,” and so on.

original: gāthaṃ uddesaṭṭhāneva ṭhapetvā bhagavā brāhmaṇassa vitthārena dhammaṃ desesīti dasseti.
analyzed: gātham uddesa ṭṭhāne iva ṭhapetvā bhagavā brāhmaṇassa vitthārena dhammam desesi iti dasseti
translated: In the sickness … made known: by this he shows that the Blessed One, having left the verse in the place of recitation, taught the Dhamma in detail to the brahmin.

original: Gāyanenāti gāyanakena, gānena vā. Atthañca dhammañcāti sadevakassa lokassa hitañceva
analyzed: gāyanena ati gāyanakena gānena vā atthañca dhammañca ati sa devakassa lokassa hitañca ca iva
translated: ‘By singing’ means by singing, or by song. ‘Meaning and Dhamma’ means the good of the world with its deities,

original: tassa kāraṇañca. Sampassantānanti sammadeva passantānaṃ. Dhammoti paveṇiāgato cārittadhammo
analyzed: tassa kāraṇam ca sampassantānam ti sammat eva passantānam dhammo ti paveṇi āgataḥ cāritta dhammo
translated: and the reason for that. ‘Seeing rightly’ means seeing correctly. ‘Dhamma’ means the Dhamma of conduct that has come down in the tradition.

original: na hoti. Bhojanesu ukkaṃsagataṃ dassetuṃ “sudhābhojana”nti āha. Dhamme satīti ariyānaṃ
analyzed: na hoti bhojanesu ukkaṃsa gatam dassetum sudhā bhojanam ti āha dhamme sati iti ariyānam
translated: is not. ‘Sudhā food’ is said to show what is outstanding among foods. ‘When there is Dhamma’ means

original: ācāradhamme sati taṃ ālambitvā jīvantānaṃ etadeva seṭṭhanti “somaṃ bhuñjeyya pāyasa”nti
analyzed: ācāra dhamme sati tam ālambitvā jīvantānam etat eva seṭṭhanti somam bhuñjeyya pāyasanti
translated: when there is the Dhamma of conduct of the Noble Ones. ‘Soma’ is said with reference to the talk that arose

original: taṃ ārabbha kathāya uppannattā.
analyzed: tam ārabbha kathāya uppannattā
translated: because of that.

original: Sallakkheti ayaṃ brāhmaṇo. Sesā paccayā niddosā te ārabbha kathāya appavattitattā.🔽Kukkuccavūpasantanti aggiāhitapadassa viya saddasiddhi veditabbā. Annena pānenāti
analyzed: sallakkhā iti ayam brāhmaṇaḥ sesā paccayā niddosā te ārabbha kathāya  aggi āhita padassa viya sadda siddhi veditabbā annena pānena ati
translated: Brahmin. The other conditions are faultless because talk does not occur with reference to them.🔽‘Cessation of worry’ should be understood as a verbal formation like the word ‘fire- seized’. ‘With food and drink’

original: lakkhaṇavacanametaṃ yathā “kākehi sappi rakkhitabba”nti. Tenāha “desanāmattameta”nti.
analyzed: lakkhaṇa vacanam etam yathā kākehi sappi rakkhitabbanti tena āha desanā mattam etat ti
translated: is a characteristic statement, like ‘Ghee should be guarded against crows’. Therefore he says, ‘This is merely a teaching’.

original: Bahusassaphaladāyakaṃ sukhettaṃ viya paṭiyattanti sammā kasanabījanaudakānayanāpanayanādinā
analyzed: bahu sassa phala dāyakam su khettam viya paṭiyattanti sammā kasana bījana audaka ānayana apanayana ādinā
translated: It is prepared as a field of merit, like a well-prepared field that gives a rich harvest of grain.

original: susajjitaṃ khettaṃ viya sīlādiguṇavisesasampādanena paṭiyattaṃ puññakkhettaṃ etaṃ.
analyzed: su sajjitam khettam viya sīla ādi guṇa visesa sampādanena paṭiyattam puñña khettam etam
translated: The field of merit is prepared by the acquisition of the special qualities of virtue, etc., like a field that is well prepared by proper ploughing, sowing of seed, application of water and removal of weeds, etc.

original: Aggikasuttavaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: aggika sutta vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: The Commentary on the Aggika Sutta is finished.

original: 9. Sundarikasuttavaṇṇanā
analyzed: sundarika sutta vaṇṇanā
translated: The Commentary on the Sundarikabhakkha Sutta

original: 195. Ānetvā hunitabbato āhuti. Sappimadhupāyasādīhi aggiṃ juhoti etthāti aggihuttaṃ,
analyzed: ānetvā hunitabbataḥ āhuti sappi madhu pāyasa ādīhi aggim juhoti ettha ati aggi huttam
translated: An offering is what is to be brought and offered. The fire-altar is where one offers oblations of ghee, honey, milk-rice, etc., into the fire.

original: sādhiṭṭhānaṃ veditabbaṃ. Tenāha “agyāyatana”ntiādi. Suvisodhito cassāti nihīnajātikānaṃ
analyzed: sa adhiṭṭhānam veditabbam tena āha cassa āti nihīna jātikānam
translated: The meaning should be understood as stated in the Commentary. Therefore it is said: “The fire-element” and so forth. If it is well purified,🔽it will be well purified by one of low birth.

original: anena suṭṭhu visodhito ca bhaveyya. “Me”ti padaṃ ānetvā sambandho.
analyzed: anena suṭṭhu visodhito ca bhaveyya mā iti padam ānetvā sambandhaḥ
translated: The word “me” is to be brought in and connected.🔽It makes the fruit fruitless,

original: Aphalaṃ karotīti ito paṭṭhāya yāva demīti padaṃ. Tāva anantarasuttavaṇṇanāya āgatasadisamevāti
analyzed: aphalam karoti iti itas paṭṭhāya yāva demi iti padam tāva anantara sutta vaṇṇanāya āgata sadisam eva ati
translated: from here up to the word “give.” Since the rest is similar to what is given in the Commentary on the preceding sutta,

original: peyyālavasena ṭhapesi, na sappisaṅkhāraṭṭhapanaṃ. Himapātassa ca sītavātassa ca paṭibāhanatthanti
analyzed: peyyāla vasena ṭhapesi na sappi saṅkhāra ṭṭhapanam hima pātassa ca sīta vātassa ca paṭibāhana tthan ti
translated: he set it forth by way of the refrain, not by way of the preparation of ghee, etc. For the purpose of warding off the cold season and cold winds,

original: akāraṇametanti taṃ anādiyitvā aññameva sukāraṇaṃ dassetuṃ “paṭibalovā”tiādi vuttaṃ.
analyzed: akāraṇam etat ti tam an ādiyitvā aññam eva su kāraṇam dassetum paṭibalaḥ uvā itiādi vuttaṃ
translated: “No reason” : without taking account of that, he said “one who is fit” , etc., in order to point out another reason.

original: Sañjānitvāti “nāyaṃ brāhmaṇo”ti sañjānitvā.
analyzed: sañjānitvā iti na ayam brāhmaṇa uti sañjānitvā
translated: “Having recognized” : having recognized “This is not a brahmin.”🔽“The tip of the tail” : the tip of the short tail.

original: Nīcakesantanti rassakesantaṃ. Brāhmaṇānaṃ suddhiatthā sikhāti āha “pavattamattampi, sikhaṃ adisvā”ti, “paramahaṃsaparikkhādinā”ti keci.
analyzed: nīca kesantam ti rassa kesantam brāhmaṇānam suddhi atthā sikhā iti āha pavatta mattam pi sikham a disvā iti paramahaṃsa parikkhādinā ati keci
translated: “Without seeing even the tip of the tail” : he said this because the brahmins’ purity is for the sake of the tail.

original: Akāraṇaṃ dakkhiṇeyyabhāvassa jāti adakkhiṇeyyabhāvahetūnaṃ pāpadhammānaṃ apaṭikkhepabhāvato.
analyzed: akāraṇam dakkhiṇeyya bhāvassa jāti adakkhiṇeyya bhāva hetūnam pāpa dhammānam a paṭikkhepa bhāvato
translated: “The reason” : birth is not a reason for being worthy of offerings because it does not exclude the unwholesome states that are the reason for being unworthy of offerings.🔽“That” : the conduct consisting of virtue, etc.

original: Etanti sīlādibhedaṃ caraṇaṃ. Dakkhiṇeyyabhāvassa kāraṇaṃ adakkhiṇeyyabhāvakārakapāpadhammānaṃ
analyzed: etat ti sīla ādi bhedam caraṇam dakkhiṇeyya bhāvassa kāraṇam adakkhiṇeyya bhāva kāraka pāpa dhammānam
translated: “The reason for being worthy of offerings” : the reason for being worthy of offerings is the unwholesome states that are the reason for being unworthy of offerings.🔽“By abandoning” : by abandoning them by way of the factors of abandoning, etc.🔽“The brahmin” : the brahmin.

original: tadaṅgādivasena pajahanato. Assāti brāhmaṇassa. Tamatthanti taṃ dakkhiṇeyyabhāvassa
analyzed: tad aṅga ādi vasena pajahanataḥ brāhmaṇassa tam atthanti tam dakkhiṇeyya bhāvassa
translated: “That meaning” : that meaning called the reason for being worthy of offerings.🔽“By way of a simile” : by way of a simile, distinguishing that meaning.

original: kāraṇatāsaṅkhātamatthaṃ upamāya vibhāvento. Sālādikaṭṭhā jātovāti sālādivisuddhakaṭṭhāva
analyzed: kāraṇa tā saṅkhātam attham upamāya vibhāvento sāla ādi kaṭṭhā jātaḥ uvāti
translated: “The wood of the sala tree, etc.” : the wood of the pure sala tree, etc.

original: jāto. Sāpānadoṇiādiavisuddhakaṭṭhā jāto aggikiccaṃ na ca na karoti. Evanti yathā
analyzed: jātaḥ sa apāna doṇi ādi a visuddha kaṭṭhā jātaḥ aggi kiccam na ca na karoti evam ti yathā
translated: He is born, and though he is born in a place that is not purified, such as a dog’s trough, he does not fail to perform the function of fire. Just as fire,

original: aggi yato kutoci jātopi aggikiccaṃ karotiyeva, evaṃ caṇḍālakulādīsu jātopi dakkhiṇeyyo🔽na na hoti guṇasampadāvasena ariyānaṃ vaṃse pajātattāti āha “guṇasampattiyā jātimā”ti.🔽Dhitiyā guṇasampattiyā pamukhabhāvaṃ dassetuṃ “so hī”tiādi vuttaṃ. Tattha dhitiyāti
analyzed: aggi yatas kutoci jātaḥ api aggi kiccam evam caṇḍāla kula ādīsu jātaḥ api dakkhiṇeyyaḥ  na na hoti guṇa sampadā vasena ariyānam vaṃse pajāta ttā iti āha guṇa sampattiyā jātimā iti  dhitiyā guṇa sampattiyā pamukha bhāvam dassetum saḥ hi itiādi vuttam tattha dhitiyā ati
translated: however it is born, performs the function of fire, so too, though born in a family of outcastes, etc., he is not unfit to receive gifts,🔽because of his excellence in special qualities, since he is born in the family of noble ones. Thus it is said: “He is born of the best family, the noble family of those who possess special qualities.”

original: vīriyena. Tañhi anuppannānaṃ kusaladhammānaṃ uppādanaparibrūhanehi te dhāreti. Hiriyā
analyzed: vīriyena tat hi an uppannānam kusala dhammānam uppādana paribrūhanehi te dhāreti hiriyā
translated: In order to show that he is foremost in the special quality of energy, etc., it is said: “He is restrained by virtue,” etc. Herein, by energy means by virtue. For that restrains unwholesome states that have arisen and prevents others from arising.

original: dose nisedheti, sammadeva pāpānaṃ jigucchane sati tesaṃ pavattiyā avasaro eva natthi.🔽Monadhammena ñāṇasaṅkhātena ottappadhammena. Kāraṇākāraṇajānanakoti tesaṃ tesaṃ dhammānaṃ
analyzed: dose nisedha iti sammat eva pāpānam jigucchane sati tesam pavattiyā avasaraḥ eva natthi  mona dhammena ñāṇa saṅkhātena ottappa dhammena tesam tesam dhammānam
translated: By shame he restrains faults, for when there is a proper sense of shame, there is no opportunity for them to occur.

original: yathābhūtaṃ ṭhānaṃ, pāpadhammānaṃ vā vippakārasabhāvaṭṭhānaṃ jānanako.
analyzed: yathābhūtam ṭhānam pāpa dhammānam vā vippakāra sabhāva ṭhānam jānanako
translated: By the state of conscience, which is a kind of knowledge. By the state of knowing the reason and the non-reason means by knowing the proper occasion for this or that state, or the unseemly nature of evil states.

original: Paramatthasaccena nibbānena ārammaṇapaccayabhūtena ariyamaggena danto. Indriyadamenāti
analyzed: paramattha saccena nibbānena ārammaṇa paccaya bhūtena ariya maggena dantaḥ indriya damena ati
translated: “Tamed by the noble path, which is the object condition for the Nibbāna that is the ultimate truth,”🔽“Approached by the noble restraint of the faculties,”

original: tato eva ariyena indriyasaṃvarena upagato. Vidanti tehi saccānīti vedā. Maggavedānaṃ
analyzed: tatas eva ariyena indriya saṃvarena upagataḥ vidanti tehi saccāni iti vedāḥ magga vedānam
translated: “The Vedas are known by them,”🔽“The end of the noble fruit,”

original: antanti ariyaphalaṃ. Kilesānaṃ antanti tesaṃ anuppādanirodhaṭṭhānaṃ. Yaññoti aggaphalaṃ.
analyzed: antam ti ariya phalam kilesānam antam ti tesam anuppāda nirodha ṭhānam yañño ti agga phalam
translated: “The end of defilements,” the place of their non-arising and cessation,🔽“The sacrifice,” the supreme fruit,

original: Niratthakanti aphalaṃ tesaṃ anāgamanato, āgatānampi aggadakkhiṇeyyābhāvato. Juhati deti.
analyzed: niratthakam ti aphalam tesam an āgamanataḥ āgatānam pi aggadakkhiṇeyya abhāvataḥ juhati deti
translated: “Without purpose,” fruitless, because they do not return, and because those who have come are not worthy of the foremost offering. “He gives”

original: Suyiṭṭhanti sudānaṃ aggadakkhiṇeyyalābhena. Suhutanti tasseva vevacanaṃ. Atha vā
analyzed: suyiṭṭhanti sudānam agga dakkhiṇeyya lābhena su hutanti tassa iva vevacanam atha vā
translated: “Well-given,” because of receiving the foremost offering. “Well-offered” is a synonym for that. Or

original: suyiṭṭhanti suṭṭhu sammadeva yiṭṭhaṃ sāre upanītaṃ mama idaṃ deyyavatthu. Suhutanti etthāpi eseva nayo.
analyzed: suyiṭṭhanti suṭṭhu sammadeva yiṭṭham sāre upanītam mama idam deyya vatthu su hutanti ettha api esā iva nayo
translated: “Well-given” means well and truly given, brought to the essence. “This is my gift.” “Well-offered” has the same method.

original: Upahaṭamatteti brāhmaṇena “bhuñjatu bhava”nti upanītamatte. Nibbattitojamevāti savatthukaṃ
analyzed: upahaṭa matta iti brāhmaṇena bhuñjatu bhavanti upanīta matte nibbatti tojam eva ati sa vatthukam
translated: “As soon as it is brought,” as soon as it is brought by the brahmin, saying “Eat, sir.” “Only the fire born” means with a basis.

original: aggahetvā vatthuto vivecitaojameva. Tena taṃ sukhumattaṃ gatanti taṃ habyasesaṃ sabbaso🔽sukhumabhāvaṃ gatanti ojāya anoḷārikatāya purimākāreneva paññāyamānataṃ sandhāya
analyzed: aggahetvā vatthutaḥ vivecita ojam eva tena tam sukhuma ttam gatanti tam sabbaso  sukhuma bhāvam gatanti ojāya anoḷārika tāya purima ākārena iva paññāyamāna tam sandhāya
translated: So it is said that it has become subtle.🔽But this is said with reference to its being known in the same way as before, that is, with reference to its not being gross with essence.

original: vuttaṃ, na pana ojāya eva kevalāya gahaṇaṃ sandhāya. Sā hi avinibbhogavuttitāya visuṃ
analyzed: vuttam na pana ojāya eva kevalāya gahaṇam sandhāya sā hi avinibbhoga vutti tāya visum
translated: For it cannot be apprehended separately because it has no individual existence apart from the materiality.🔽That is why it is apprehended together with the source by deities.

original: gaṇhituṃ na sakkā, tasmā devatāhipi savatthukā gayhati. Manussānaṃ vatthūti karajakāyamāha.
analyzed: gaṇhitum na sakkā tasmai sa vatthukā gayhati manussānam karaja kāyam āha
translated: The “human source” is the physical body.🔽It is not as keen as that of deities because it is gross.

original: Oḷārikavatthutāya devānaṃ viya gahaṇī na tikkhāti dibbojasammissatāya sammā pariṇāmaṃ🔽na gacchati. Sukhumāpi samānā dibbojā tena pāyasena missitā oḷārikasammissatāya sukhumavatthukānaṃ
analyzed: oḷārika vatthu tāya devānam viya gahaṇī na tikkhāti dibba oja sammissa tāya sammā pariṇāmam  na gacchati sukhumā api samānā dibba ujā tena pāyasena missitā oḷārika sammissa tāya sukhuma vatthukānam
translated: It does not properly ripen because it is mixed with divine essence.

original: devānaṃ sukhadā na hotīti imamatthaṃ dasseti “goyūse panā”tiādinā. Paribhogavatthuno
analyzed: devānam sukha dā na hoti iti imam attham dasseti goyūse pana ati ādinā paribhoga vatthunaḥ
translated: And although it is subtle, it is mixed with the gross essence, and so it does not give pleasure to deities whose source is subtle. This is the meaning shown by the words “But when it is mixed with cow’s milk” and so on.

original: oḷārikatāya vā devānaṃ dukkaraṃ sammā pariṇāmetuṃ, dibbojāya garutarabhāvena manussānaṃ.
