analyzed: oḷārika tāya vā devānam dukkaram sammā pariṇāmetum dibbojāya garutara bhāvena manussānam
translated: Or else it is difficult for deities to transform it properly because of its grossness, and for human beings because of its great weight.

original: Tenāha bhagavā “na khvāha”ntiādi. Samāpatticittasamuṭṭhitā tejodhātu jhānānubhāvasantejitā
analyzed: tena āha bhagavā na khvāhanti ādi samāpatti citta samuṭṭhitā tejaḥ dhātu jhāna anubhāva santejitā
translated: Hence the Blessed One said, “I do not say that it can be transformed by anyone at will” . The fire element originated by the jhāna consciousness and intensified by the jhāna’s influence

original: tikkhatarā hotīti vuttaṃ “aṭṭha…pe… pariṇāmeyyā”ti. Bhagavato pana suddheneva pariṇamatīti
analyzed: tikkhatarā hoti iti vuttam bhagavataḥ pana suddhena iva pariṇamati iti
translated: is more effective. That is why it is said, “But it can be transformed by one who has attained the eight attainments in the eight liberations” . But the Blessed One’s transformation is effected by the natural fire element alone,

original: vuttaṃ “pākatikenevā”ti, jhānānubhāvappattena jhānena vinā sabhāvasiddheneva.
analyzed: vuttam pākatikena iva āti jhāna anubhāva ppattena jhānena vinā sabhāva siddhena iva
translated: without the aid of the jhāna’s influence. That is why it is said, “By the natural fire element alone” .🔽As to “uncooked” , the word appa in the sense of non-existence is like appa in such passages as “appiccho samāno …pe… “

original: “Appaharite”ti ettha appa-saddo “appiccho”tiādīsu viya abhāvatthoti āha “appahariteti🔽aharite”ti. Pātisatepi pāyase. Na āluḷatīti na āvilaṃ hoti. Anāgantāva gaccheyya
analyzed: appaharitā iti ettha appa saddo appiccho ti ādīsu viya abhāva attho ti āha appaharitā iti  a haritā iti pātisate pāyase naḥ āluḷati iti naḥ āvilam an āgantā ava gaccheyya
translated: So it is said, “Uncooked means uncooked rice or anything else that is not cooked” .

original: “attanāpi na paribhuñji, aññesaṃ na dāpesi, kevalaṃ pāyasaṃ nāsesī”ti domanassappatto.
analyzed: attanā api na paribhuñji aññesam na dāpesi kevalam pāyasam na āsesi iti domanassa patto
translated: Even if there were a hundred pots of milk rice, he would not be satisfied. He would not be pleased. He would not be satisfied. He would not be pleased. He would not be satisfied. He would not be pleased. He would not be satisfied. He would not be pleased. He would not be satisfied. He would not be pleased. He would not be satisfied. He would not be pleased. He would not be satisfied. He would not be pleased. He would not be satisfied. He would not be pleased. He would not be satisfied. He would not be pleased. He would not be satisfied. He would not be pleased. He would not be satisfied. He would not be pleased. He would not be satisfied. He would not be pleased. He would not be satisfied. He would not be pleased. He would not be satisfied. He would not be pleased. He would not be satisfied. He would not be pleased. He would not be pleased. He would not be pleased. He would not be pleased. He would not be pleased. He would not be pleased. He would not be pleased. He would not be pleased. He would not be pleased. He would not be pleased. He would not be pleased. He would not be pleased. He would not be pleased. He would not be pleased. He would not be pleased. He would not be pleased. He would not be pleased. He would not be pleased. He would not be pleased. He would not be pleased.

original: Dāru samādahānoti dāruhariddi dārusmiṃ tassa dahanto. Yadītiādi dārujhāpanassa bahiddhabhāvasādhanaṃ
analyzed: dāru samādahānaḥ ti dāru hariddi dārusmin tassa dahantaḥ yadi itiādi dāru jhāpanassa bahiddha bhāva sādhanam
translated: ‘Wood-burner’ is a wood-carrier. ‘He burns’ means he burns wood. ‘If’ and so on is a proof that the wood-burner is outside.

original: asuddhahetūnaṃ paṭipakkhābhāvato tassa. Khandhādīsu kusalāti tesu sabhāvato samudayato🔽atthaṅgamato assādato ādīnavato nissaraṇato jānanato chekā paṇḍitā. Ñāṇajotinti ñāṇamayaṃ🔽jotiṃ. Jālemīti pajjalitaṃ karomi. Niccaṃ pajjalitaggi sabbatthakameva vigatasammohandhakāratāya🔽ekobhāsabhāvato. Sabbaso vikkhepābhāvato niccasamāhitatto. Evaṃ vadatīti caritaṃ
analyzed: asuddha hetūnam paṭipakkha abhāvataḥ tassa khandha ādīsu kusalā ati tesu sabhāvataḥ samudayataḥ  atthaṅgamataḥ assādataḥ ādīnavataḥ nissaraṇataḥ jānanataḥ chekā paṇḍitā ñāṇa jotinti ñāṇa mayam  jotim jālemi iti pajjalitam karomi niccam pajjalita aggi sabbatthakam eva vigata sammoha ndhakāra tāya  eka ubhāsa bhāvataḥ sabbasas vikkhepa abhāvataḥ nicca samāhita ttaḥ evam vadati iti caritam
translated: ‘Carried off the wood’: the wood-carrier, burning the wood. ‘If’ and so on is a proof that the wood-burner is outside. Because of the absence of an opposite of impure causes. ‘In the aggregates’ and so on: the skilled ones, the wise ones, know them by their individual essences, by their origin,🔽by their cessation, by their taste, by their danger, and by their escape. ‘The light of knowledge’: the light consisting of knowledge. ‘I light it’: I cause it to blaze up. ‘Always blazing’: always blazing up, because it is everywhere free from the darkness of doubt and confusion,

original: brahmacariyaṃ gahetvā carāmīti evaṃ vattamānaṃ viya vadati āsannataṃ hadaye ṭhapetvā.
analyzed: brahmacariyam gahetvā carāmi iti evam vattamānam viya vadati hadaye ṭhapetvā
translated: because it is of the nature of a single radiance. ‘Always concentrated’: because of the absence of any distraction at all. ‘Says thus’: as if saying ‘I am living the life of celibacy, taking the practice of celibacy as my burden,’ he places it near, in his heart.

original: Khāribhāroti khāribhārasadiso. Tenāha “yathā”tiādi. Khandhena vayhamānoti kāje pakkhipitvā
analyzed: khāri bhāraḥ iti khāri bhāra sadisaḥ tena āha yathā itiādi khandhena vayhamānaḥ ti kāje pakkhipitvā
translated: ‘Like a burden’: like a burden. Hence he said ‘as if’ and so on. ‘Carried by the yoke’: put into the yoke.

original: khandhena vayhamāno. Pathaviyā saddhiṃ phuseti bhārassa garukabhāvena kājassa pariṇamanena.
analyzed: khandhena vayhamānaḥ pathaviyā saddhim phusa iti bhārassa garuka bhāvena kājassa pariṇamanena
translated: “He is weighed down by the burden” means that he is weighed down by the heaviness of the burden and by the bending of his back.

original: Mānena attano jātiādīni paggaṇhato aññassa tāni na sahatīti āha – “tattha tattha
analyzed: mānena attanaḥ jāti ādīni paggaṇhataḥ aññassa tāni na sahati iti āha tattha tattha
translated: “He is overcome by conceit” means that he cannot bear the birth, etc., of others because he is conceited about his own birth, etc.

original: issaṃ uppādento”ti, tattha tattha jātiādimānavatthusmiṃ garutaraggahaṇena saṃsīdeyyāti
analyzed: issam uppādento ti tattha tattha jāti ādi māna vatthusmim garutara ggahaṇena saṃsīdeyya iti
translated: The intention is that he is overcome by the grasping of the heaviness of birth, etc., in the various states of existence.

original: adhippāyo. Kodho dhūmoti yathāpi bhāsuro aggi dhūmena upakkiliṭṭho, evaṃ kodhena🔽upakkiliṭṭho. Ñāṇaggīti tassa kodho dhūmo. Musāvādova mosavajjaṃ. Yathā ñāṇe sati
analyzed: adhippāyaḥ kodhaḥ dhūmo ti yathā api bhāsuraḥ aggi dhūmena upakkiliṭṭhaḥ evam kodhena  tassa kodhaḥ dhūmaḥ musāvādaḥ uva mosa vajjam yathā ñāṇe sati
translated: “Anger is the smoke” means that just as a bright fire is obscured by smoke, so too is the fire of knowledge obscured by anger.

original: musāvādo natthi, evaṃ musāvāde sati ñāṇampīti tena taṃ nirodhitaṃ viya hotīti āha🔽– “musāvādena paṭicchannaṃ ñāṇa”nti. Yathā sujāya vinā brāhmaṇānaṃ yāgo na ijjhati,
analyzed: musāvādaḥ natthi evam musāvāde sati ñāṇam pi iti tena tam nirodhitam viya hoti iti āha  musāvādena paṭicchannam yathā vinā brāhmaṇānam yāgaḥ na ijjhati
translated: “The smoke of anger” is the fire of knowledge. “Lying is the stain” means that just as knowledge does not exist when there is lying, so too lying exists when there is knowledge. Therefore he says that knowledge is “covered by lying.”

original: evaṃ pahūtajivhāya vinā satthu dhammayāgo na ijjhatīti jivhā sujāpariyāyā vuttā.
analyzed: evam pahūta jivhāya vinā satthu dhamma yāgaḥ na ijjhati iti jivhā sujā pariyāyā vuttā
translated: “The tongue is the sacrificial post” means that just as a sacrifice of the brahmins does not succeed without a well-formed sacrificial post, so too the sacrifice of the Dhamma of the Master does not succeed without a well-formed tongue.

original: Joti ṭhiyati etthāti jotiṭṭhānaṃ vedi, yaṃ aggikuṇḍaṃ. Sattānaṃ hadayaṃ jotiṭṭhānaṃ
analyzed: joti ṭhiyati ettha ati jotiṭṭhānam vedi yam aggikuṇḍam sattānam hadayam jotiṭṭhānam
translated: The light of beings is the light-setting,

original: ñāṇaggino tattha samujjalanato. Attāti cittaṃ “āhito ahaṃ māno etthā”ti katvā.🔽Dhammo rahadoti assaddhiyādiālasiyābhāvato kilesamalapakkhālanato paramagginibbutāvahanato
analyzed: tattha samujjalanataḥ attā iti cittam āhitaḥ aham māno ettha ati katvā  dhammaḥ rahadaḥ ti assaddhi yādi ālasiyā abhāvataḥ kilesa mala pakkhālanataḥ paramaggi nibbuta āvahanataḥ
translated: because the fire of knowledge blazes there. The self is the heart, because it is thought of as “I am,” “the conceit ‘I am’ is here.”🔽The Dhamma is a lake, because it is free from the muddiness of non-faith, etc., because it washes away the stains of defilements, and because it is the bearer of the highest coolness,

original: ariyamaggadhammo anāvilo rahado. Heṭṭhupariyavālukāti viparivattitavālukā hutvā.
analyzed: ariya magga dhammaḥ anāvilaḥ rahadaḥ heṭṭhu pariya vālukā ati viparivattita vālukāḥ hutvā
translated: the Dhamma of the noble path is a stainless lake. The sand is the lower and upper lips.🔽The water is agitated, thus it is agitated. It is approved by the wise, thus it is the best in the presence of the wise.

original: Āluḷāti ākulajātā. Paṇḍitānaṃ pasatthoti paṇḍitānaṃ purato seṭṭho. Seṭṭhabhāvena
analyzed: āluḷā ati ākula jātā paṇḍitānam pasattho ti paṇḍitānam puratas seṭṭhaḥ seṭṭha bhāvena
translated: Being praiseworthy by reason of its excellence,

original: santo pāsaṃso hutvā kilese bhindati samucchindatīti sabbhīti vuccati. Tenāha “uttamaṭṭhenā”ti.
analyzed: santaḥ pāsaṃsaḥ hutvā kilese bhindati samucchindati iti sabbhi iti vuccati tena āha uttama ṭṭhena ati
translated: it breaks, it cuts off, the defilements, thus it is called the sword. Hence it is said, “in the sense of the highest.”

original: Tathā cāha bhagavā “maggānaṭṭhaṅgiko seṭṭho”ti.
analyzed: tathā ca āha bhagavā magga anaṭṭhaṅgikaḥ seṭṭhaḥ iti
translated: And the Exalted One has said, “The eightfold path is the best.”

original: Vacīsaccanti iminā “caturaṅgasamannāgatā vācā suparisuddhā hotī”ti sammāvācaṃ dasseti.
analyzed: iminā catur aṅga samannāgatā vācā su parisuddhā hoti iti sammāvācam dasseti
translated: Speech and mind: by this he shows right speech, which is “pure and very clean, endowed with four factors.”

original: Saccasaṃyamapadehi dassitā maggadhammā idha “dhammo”ti adhippetāti āha – “dhammoti
analyzed: sacca saṃyama padehi dassitāḥ magga dhammāḥ idha dhammo ti adhippetā ati āha dhammo ti
translated: The states of the path shown in the section on the restraint of the true course are intended here as “Dhamma” .🔽

original: iminā…pe… dassetī”ti. Maggasaccaṃ gahitaṃ anantaragāthāya anekehi visesetvā vuttattā.
analyzed: dasseti iti magga saccam gahitam anantara gāthāya anekehi visesetvā vutta ttā
translated: The path dhammas shown by the words “truth” and “restraint” are intended here by the word “Dhamma,” so he says: “By the word ‘Dhamma’ … he shows the path.” The truth of the path is intended, because it is stated in the next stanza as being distinguished by many special qualities.

original: Atthatoti pubbaṅgamattādiatthato. Tāya hi sakiccaṃ karontiyā itare sabbepi tadanuvattikā🔽honti. Taggatikattāti sammādiṭṭhiyā upakārakabhāvena tāya samānagatikattā. Ārammaṇañhi
analyzed: atthataḥ ti pubbaṅgamattā ādi atthataḥ tāya hi sa kiccam karontiyā itare sabbe pi tad anuvattikā  honti taggatika ttā ti sammādiṭṭhiyā upakāraka bhāvena tāya samāna gatika ttā ārammaṇam hi
translated: By meaning: by the meaning of being the forerunner, and so on. For when it does its own work, all the others follow it.

original: vitakkenāhaṭaṃ paññā vicinituṃ sakkoti. Tathā hi so paññākkhandhena saṅgahaṃ gato.🔽Dhammoti sabhāvato samādhi gahito, itare dve tadupakārattā. Tathā hi “evaṃdhammā🔽te bhagavanto”tiādīsu samādhi “dhammo”ti vutto. Paramatthasaccaṃ gahitaṃ sabbesaṃ
analyzed: vitakkena āhaṭam paññāḥ vicinitum sakkoti tathā hi so paññā kkhandhena saṅgaham gato  itare dve tad upakāra ttā tathā hi evaṃdhammā  te bhagavanto ti ādīsu samādhi dhammo ti vuttaḥ paramattha saccam gahitam sabbesam
translated: By going: by going along with it, by being helpful to right view. For understanding can investigate what is brought up by applied thought. That is why it is classed with the aggregate of understanding.

original: seṭṭhabhāvato. Yathāha – “yāvatā, bhikkhave, dhammā saṅkhatā vā asaṅkhatā vā, virāgo
analyzed: seṭṭha bhāvataḥ yathā āha yāvatā bhikkhave dhammā saṅkhatāḥ vā asaṅkhatāḥ vā virāgo
translated: By Dhamma: concentration is intended here in the sense of individual essence, while the other two are intended as its helpers. For it is said: “The Blessed One is of such Dhamma” , where concentration is called “Dhamma.” The ultimate truth is intended, because it is the best of all. For it is said: “Bhikkhus, whatever dhammas are formed and compounded, the penetration of their cessation is the supreme noble truth” .

original: tesaṃ aggamakkhāyatī”ti. Atthatoti tato eva paramatthato, anantaraṃ vuccamānānaṃ
analyzed: tesam aggam akkhāyati iti atthataḥ ti tatas eva paramatthataḥ anantaram vuccamānānam
translated: and is called the best of them.”🔽As to meaning: as to the highest meaning, or else as to the object of the next following path ideas.

original: vā maggadhammānaṃ ārammaṇabhāvato. Pañcaṅgāni gahitāni tāsaṃ maggabhāvato. Tīṇi aṅgāni.
analyzed: vā magga dhammānam ārammaṇa bhāvataḥ pañcaṅgāni gahitāni tāsam magga bhāvataḥ tīṇi aṅgāni
translated: The five factors are included as the path. The three factors are the three kinds of concentration.

original: Brahmacariyaṃ nāmāti etaṃ nibbānagāmi uttamaṭṭhena maggabrahmacariyaṃ nāma. Majjhe
analyzed: brahmacariyam nāma ati etam nibbāna gāmi uttama aṭṭhena magga brahmacariyam nāma majjhe
translated: The word “holy life” : the supreme path is called the “holy life” because it leads to extinction.🔽“In the middle” : it is “dependent” on the development of the middle way by avoiding the two extremes of indulgence and self- mortification.

original: sitāti līnuddhaccādiantadvayavivajjanena majjhe majjhimapaṭipadābhāvanaṃ nissitā.🔽Sassatucchedaggahaṇaṃ hettha padhānatāya nidassanamattaṃ. Seṭṭhappattīti seṭṭhabhāvappatti.
analyzed: sitā ati majjhe majjhima paṭipada abhāvanam nissitā  ha ittha padhāna tāya nidassana mattam seṭṭha ppatti iti seṭṭha bhāva ppatti
translated: The grasping of eternalism and annihilationism is mentioned here only as the principal cause.🔽The word “ta” is a word-connector.

original: Ta-kāro padasandhikaroti “sa ujubhūtesū”ti vattabbe majjhe ta-kāro padasandhikaro,
analyzed: takāraḥ pada sandhi karoti saḥ uju bhūtesu iti vattabbe majjhe takāraḥ pada sandhi karo
translated: “In the straight” : the word “ta” is a word-connector in the middle of the phrase “sa ujubhūtesu” .🔽“Some read ‘dujjubhūtesu’ , in which case the word ‘da’ is the word-connector.🔽The word ‘sa’ is used for the brahmin Sundarika.

original: “sa dujjubhūtesūti keci paṭhanti, tesaṃ da-kāro padasandhikaro. Sa-iti sundariko
analyzed: sa keci paṭhanti tesam dakāro sa eti sundarikaḥ
translated: The word ‘sa’ is used for the brahmin Sundarika.🔽The word ‘sa’ is used for the brahmin Sundarika.🔽The word ‘sa’ is used for the brahmin Sundarika.🔽The word ‘sa’ is used for the brahmin Sundarika.🔽The word ‘sa’ is used for the brahmin Sundarika.🔽The word ‘sa’ is used for the brahmin Sundarika.🔽The word ‘sa’ is used for the brahmin Sundarika.🔽The word ‘sa’ is used for the brahmin Sundarika.🔽The word ‘sa’ is used for the brahmin Sundarika.🔽The word ‘sa’ is used for the brahmin Sundarika.🔽The word ‘sa’ is used for the brahmin Sundarika.🔽The word ‘sa’ is used for the brahmin Sundarika.🔽The word ‘sa’ is used for the brahmin Sundarika.🔽The word ‘sa’ is used for the brahmin Sundarika.🔽The word ‘sa’ is used for the brahmin Sundarika.🔽The word ‘sa’ is used for the brahmin Sundarika.🔽The word ‘sa’ is used for the brahmin Sundarika.

original: brāhmaṇo vuttoti katvā āha “sa tva”nti, so tvanti attho. Dhammo sāriyo paridhānabhūtā
analyzed: brāhmaṇaḥ vuttaḥ iti katvā āha sa tvanti saḥ tvanti attho dhammo sāriyo paridhāna bhūtā
translated: The word ‘sa’ is used for the brahmin Sundarika.🔽The word ‘sa’ is used for the brahmin Sundarika.🔽The word ‘sa’ is used for the brahmin Sund

original: alaṅkārā etassāti dhammasārī. Atha vā dhammehi sāritavāti dhammasārī, tehi sāretvā
analyzed: alaṅkārāḥ etassa ati dhamma sārī atha vā dhammehi sāritavā ati dhamma sārī tehi sāretvā
translated: He who has this is a Dhamma-farer. Or alternatively, he fares by means of the Dhamma, thus he is a Dhamma-farer. Having fared by means of them,

original: ṭhitavāti attho. Tenāha “kusaladhammehī”tiādi.
analyzed: ṭhitavan ti attho tena āha kusala dhammehi itiādi
translated: “He has the Dhamma as his ornament” is dhammasari. Or else: “He has been led by the Dhamma” is dhammasari; the meaning is that he has been led by the Dhamma and has come to stand in it. Hence the commentary says: “By the profitable ideas” , etc.

original: Sundarikasuttavaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: sundarika sutta vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: The commentary on the Sundarikabhadraka Sutta is ended.

original: 10. Bahudhītarasuttavaṇṇanā🔽196. Samantatoti dakkhiṇavāmānaṃ vasena samantato. Ūrubaddhāsananti ūrūnaṃ bandhanavasena
analyzed: bahudhītara sutta vaṇṇanā  samantataḥ ti dakkhiṇa vāmānam vasena samantataḥ ūru baddha āsanam ti ūrūnam bandhana vasena
translated: The Bahudhīti Sutta🔽“All round”: by the right and left sides. “With legs crossed”: sitting with the legs crossed.🔽“With legs drawn close together” is said with reference to the posture of sitting with the legs drawn close together by crossing the feet.

original: nisajjanaṃ. Dvinnaṃ ūrūnaṃ aññamaññabandhanavasena ābhujitākāraṃ sandhāyāha “ābhujitvāti🔽bandhitvā”ti. Heṭṭhimakāyassa anujukaṃ ṭhapanaṃ nisajjāvacaneneva bodhitanti “ujuṃ🔽kāya”nti ettha kāya-saddo uparimakāyavisayoti āha “uparimaṃ sarīraṃ ujukaṃ ṭhapetvā”ti.
analyzed: nisajjanam dvinnam aññamañña bandhana vasena ābhujita ākāram sandhāya āha ābhujitvā iti  bandhitvā iti heṭṭhima kāyassa anujukam ṭhapanam nisajjā vacanena iva bodhitam ti ujum  ettha kāya saddo uparima kāya visayo ti āha uparimam sarīram ujukam ṭhapetvā ati
translated: “Having drawn them close together, having bound them” is the meaning.🔽“Having placed the body straight” is already stated by the expression “sitting” .🔽Therefore the word “body” in the expression “straight body” refers to the upper body. Hence it is said: “having placed the upper body straight” .

original: Taṃ pana ujukaṭṭhapanaṃ sarūpato payojanato ca dassetuṃ “aṭṭhārasā”tiādi vuttaṃ.
analyzed: tam pana ujuka ṭṭhapanam sarūpataḥ payojanataḥ ca dassetum aṭṭhārasa iti ādi vuttam
translated: In order to show the nature and the purpose of that straight placing, it is said: “having placed the body straight, having bent the neck of the body slightly” .

original: Parimukhanti ettha pari-saddo abhisaddena samānatthoti āha “kammaṭṭhānābhimukha”nti,
analyzed: parimukham ti ettha parisaddo abhi saddena samāna tthaḥ ti āha kammaṭṭhāna abhimukham ti
translated: Face to face: the prefix pari here has the same meaning as abhi, thus he says “facing the meditation subject.”

original: bahiddhā puthuttārammaṇato nivāretvā kammaṭṭhānaṃyeva purekkhatoti attho. Pariggahaṭṭho
analyzed: bahiddhā puthuttā ārammaṇataḥ nivāretvā kammaṭṭhānam yeva purekkhato ti attho pariggahaṭṭho
translated: The meaning is that he should turn away from external different objects and give attention only to the meditation subject. The meaning of parimukha is that of inclusion,

original: “pariṇāyikā”tiādīsu viya. Mukhanti niyyānaṭṭho “suññatavimokkhamukha”ntiādīsu viya.🔽Paṭipakkhato niggamanaṭṭho hi niyyānaṭṭho, tasmā pariggahitaniyyānanti sabbathā gahitasammosaṃ
analyzed: pariṇāyikā ati ādīsu viya mukhanti niyyāna aṭṭho suññata vimokkha mukhanti ādīsu viya  paṭipakkhataḥ niggamana ṭho hi niyyāna ṭṭho tasmā pariggahita niyyānam ti sabbathā gahita sammosam
translated: like the word parinayika . The meaning of mukha is outlet, like the word suññatāvimokkhamukha .

original: pariccattasammosaṃ satiṃ katvā paramaṃ satinepakkaṃ upaṭṭhapetvāti attho. Chabbaṇṇā…pe…
analyzed: pariccatta sammosam satim katvā paramam sati nepakkam upaṭṭhapetvā ti attho chabbaṇṇāpe
translated: For the meaning of outlet is the meaning of going out from the opposite state. So the meaning is that he should establish supreme mindfulness, which is the opposite of forgetfulness, by making forgetfulness quite impossible, by including it, by excluding it.🔽He sat down: in order to show his confidence in the brahmin.

original: nisīdi brāhmaṇassa pasādasañjānanatthaṃ. Aṭavimukhā caramānāti gocaraṃ gaṇhantā.
analyzed: nisīdi brāhmaṇassa pasāda sañjānana attham aṭavi mukhā gocaram gaṇhantā
translated: Wandering in the forest: taking the alms given as their “wilderness.”

original: Ajjasaṭṭhinti ajja channaṃ pūraṇī saṭṭhī divasavutti, ajja ādiṃ katvā cha divaseti
analyzed: ajja saṭṭhinti ajja channam pūraṇī saṭṭhī ajja ādim katvā cha divasa iti
translated: The sixth day: the sixth day of the fortnight, which is the day for fasting, beginning from the day after tomorrow, for six days.

original: attho. Accantasaṃyoge cetaṃ upayogavacanaṃ. Ajja chadivasamattakāti ajjato chaṭṭhadivasamattakā.
analyzed: atthaḥ ac ca anta saṃyoge ca itam upayoga vacanam ajja cha divasa mattakā ati ajjataḥ chaṭṭha divasa mattakā
translated: ‘Meaning’ : this is a word for ‘use’ in the sense of ‘extreme use’. ‘Just six days ago’ : just six days from today.

original: Lāmakāti nihīnā nipphalā. Tenāha “tilakhāṇukā”tiādi.🔽Ussāhenāti uddhaṃ uddhaṃ pasārena abhibhavanena. Taṃ pana nesaṃ abhibhavanaṃ dassetuṃ “kaṇṇanaṅguṭṭhādīnī”tiādimāha.
analyzed: lāmakā ati nihīnā nipphalā tena āha tila khāṇuka ati ādi  ussāhena ati uddham uddham pasārena abhibhavanena tam pana nesam abhibhavanam dassetum kaṇṇa naṅguṭṭha ādīni iti ādim āha
translated: ‘Rotten’ : low, fruitless. Hence he said ‘like a sesame seed’ and so on.🔽‘With effort’ : with the effort of going up and up, with the effort of overcoming. But in order to show their overcoming he said ‘the ears, the nose, and so on’.

original: “Uppāṭakapāṇakā”ti tacaṃ uppāṭetvā viya khādakapāṇakā ūkāmaṅgulādayo.
analyzed: uppāṭaka pāṇakāḥ ti tacam uppāṭetvā khādaka pāṇakāḥ
translated: ‘Worms that eat the skin’ : worms that eat the skin as if it were food, such as the ūka and the maṅgula.

original: Kaḷārapiṅgalāti nikkhantapiṅgalakkhikā, kaḷārapiṅgalāti vā rattagattā ca piṅgalacakkhukā ca. Tilakāhatāti āhatatilakā, tilappamāṇehi bindūhi samantato santhatasarīrā.🔽Paṭigāthāhi brāhmaṇassa dhammadesanaṃ vaḍḍhesīti pakatiyā tassa attanā kathetabbaṃ
analyzed: kaḷāra piṅgalā ati nikkhanta piṅgala kkhikā kaḷāra piṅgalā ati vā ratta gattā ca piṅgala cakkhukā ca tilaka āhatā ati āhata tilakā tilappamāṇehi bindūhi samantataḥ santhata sarīrā  paṭigāthāhi brāhmaṇassa dhamma desanam vaḍḍhesi iti pakatiyā tassa attanā kathetabbam
translated: ‘The pale-yellow’ : the pale-yellow-eyed, or the pale-yellow-skinned and the yellow-eyed. ‘The one with the mark’ : the one with the mark of a blow, the one whose body is covered all over with spots the size of sesame seeds.

original: dhammadesanaṃ pabbajjāguṇakittanavasena sattahi vaḍḍhesi. Pabbajitvāti iṇāyikānaṃ
analyzed: dhamma desanam pabbajjā guṇa kittana vasena sattahi vaḍḍhesi pabbajitvā ti iṇāyikānam
translated: ‘He increased the brahmin’s teaching of the Dhamma with his verses’ : he increased the teaching of the Dhamma that he himself had to give by way of praising the qualities of going forth, by seven. ‘Having gone forth’ : having gone forth from the debt-bondage of the defilements, from the debt-bondage of the kamma rooted in the defilements, and from the debt-bondage of the suffering rooted in the kamma.

original: attano palibodhaṃ tathā tathā jānāpetvā pabbajitvā.
analyzed: attanaḥ palibodham tathā tathā jānāpetvā pabbajitvā
translated: and after having his own obstacle thus removed, he went forth.

original: Yathā ca tattha bhagavā paṭipajji, taṃ dassetuṃ “puna divase”tiādi vuttaṃ.
analyzed: yathā ca tattha bhagavā paṭipajji tam dassetum puna divasa itiādi vuttam
translated: And in order to show how the Blessed One conducted himself there, it is said: “On the following day” and so on.

original: Taṃ taṃ kulagharaṃ pesetvāti taṃ taṃ tassa brāhmaṇassa dhītaraṃ tassa tassānucchavikassa brāhmaṇassa dento taṃ taṃ kulagharaṃ pesetvā brāhmaṇadhamme garukaraṇābhāvato.
analyzed: tam tam kula gharam pesetvā ati tam tam tassa brāhmaṇassa dhītaram tassa tassa ānucchavikassa brāhmaṇassa dento tam tam kula gharam pesetvā brāhmaṇa dhamme garu karaṇa abhāvato
translated: Sending her to this or that family: sending his daughter to this or that family, giving her to this or that brahmin who was suitable for her, because of the brahminical practice of not placing great importance on the groom’s family.

original: “Naṭṭhe mate pabbajite, napuṃsakepi bhattari;
analyzed: naṭṭhe mate pabbajite napuṃsake pi bhattari
translated: “When the husband is dead or gone, or else has taken a concubine,

original: Itthiyā patiseṭṭhāya, na añño pati icchiyo”ti. –🔽Ayañhi brāhmaṇadhammo. Ayyikaṭṭhāneti mātāmahiṭṭhāne ṭhapesi satthu cittārādhanavasenāti.
analyzed: itthiyā pati seṭṭhāya na aññaḥ pati icchiyo ti  ayan hi brāhmaṇa dhammaḥ ayyika ṭṭhāne iti mātāmahi ṭṭhāne ṭhapesi satthu citta ārādhana vasena ati
translated: The wife, the best of helpers, does not seek another man.”

original: Bahudhītarasuttavaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.🔽Paṭhamavaggavaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.🔽2. Upāsakavaggo🔽1. Kasibhāradvājasuttavaṇṇanā
analyzed: bahudhītara sutta vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā 🔽paṭhama vagga vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā 🔽upāsaka vaggo 🔽kasi bhāradvāja sutta vaṇṇanā
translated: For this is the brahminical practice. In the place of the mother: he placed her in the place of his mother, in order to please the Teacher.

original: 197. Dakkhiṇāgirisminti dakkhiṇāgirijanapade, tasmiṃ dakkhiṇāgirijanapade dakkhiṇāgirivihāre. Khandhesu ṭhapetvā yuge yottehīti yottarajjūhi yuttāni payojitāni icceva attho.
analyzed: dakkhiṇāgirismin ti dakkhiṇāgiri janapade tasmin dakkhiṇāgiri janapade dakkhiṇāgiri vihāre khandhesu ṭhapetvā yuge yottehi iti yotta rajjūhi yuttāni payojitāni icca iva attho
translated: In the Dakkhiṇāgiri country, in the Dakkhiṇāgiri Monastery in that Dakkhiṇāgiri country. Having yoked them to the ploughs, he yoked them, applied them, is the meaning.

original: Paṭhamadivaseti vapanadivasesu paṭhamadivase āraddhadivase. Pañcaṅgānipi paripuṇṇāni,
analyzed: paṭhama divasa iti vapana divasesu paṭhama divase āraddha divase paripuṇṇāni
translated: On the first day, on the first day of the ploughing season, on the day it was begun. The five limbs are complete,

original: pageva itaraṅgānīti dassetuṃ “paripuṇṇapañcaṅgā”icceva vuttaṃ. Haritālamanosilāañjanehi
analyzed: pagā iva itaraṅgāni iti dassetum vuttam
translated: all the more so the other limbs. In order to show this, it is said: “with five limbs complete.” With collyrium and eye ointment

original: uratthanādīsu ṭhapitattā ābhāya ujjalagattā. Avasesā balībaddā. Kilantagoṇaṃ mocetvā
analyzed: uratthana ādīsu ṭhapita ttā ābhāya ujjala gattā avasesā balībaddā mocetvā
translated: because they were placed on the chest and other parts, they were radiant with light. The rest of the cattle. Having released the exhausted bull,

original: akilantassa yojanaṃ kilantaparivattanaṃ.
analyzed: a kilantassa yojanam kilanta parivattanam
translated: the change of the exhausted one is a yojana.

original: Sīhakuṇḍalānīti sīhamukhakuṇḍalāni. Brahmaveṭhananti brahmuno veṭhanasadisaṃ, assanakhaveṭhanasadisanti attho.
analyzed: sīha kuṇḍalāni iti sīha mukha kuṇḍalāni brahmaveṭhanam iti brahmunaḥ veṭhana sadisam assa nakha veṭhana sadisanti
translated: Lion-rings, lion-mouth rings. Brahma-thongs, like Brahma’s thongs, is the meaning.

original: Buddhānaṃ kiccāni kālavasena vibhattāni pañca kiccāni bhavanti. Purebhattakiccanti
analyzed: buddhānam kiccāni kāla vasena vibhattāni pañca kiccāni bhavanti purebhatta kiccanti
translated: The duties of the Buddhas are divided according to time, there are five duties. The duty before the meal,

original: bhattato pubbe buddhena kātabbakiccaṃ. Vītināmetvāti phalasamāpattiyā kālaṃ vītināmetvā.
analyzed: bhattataḥ pubbe buddhena kātabba kiccam vītināmetvā ati phala samāpattiyāḥ kālam vītināmetvā
translated: Having spent the time: having spent the time in the attainment of fruition.

original: Kadāci ekotiādi tesaṃ tesaṃ vineyyānaṃ vinayanānurūpapaṭipattidassanaṃ. Pakatiyāti
analyzed: kadāci eka uti ādi tesam tesam vineyyānam vinayana anurūpa paṭipatti dassanam pakatiyā ati
translated: Sometimes alone: this is shown in order to demonstrate the practice in accordance with the training of those who are to be trained.🔽In his natural state:

original: pakatibuddhavesena. Buddhānaṃ hi rūpakāyassa asītianubyañjanapaṭimaṇḍita-bāttiṃsamahāpurisa-
analyzed: pakati buddha vesena buddhānam hi rūpa kāyassa asīti anubyañjana paṭimaṇḍita bāttiṃsa mahā purisa
translated: in his natural Buddha-state. For the Buddha-state is the body of the Buddha adorned with the eighty minor marks and the thirty-two marks of a great man,

original: lakkhaṇa-kāyappabhā-byāmappabhā-ketumālāvicittatā buddhaveso. Kadāci anekehi pāṭihāriyehi
analyzed: lakkhaṇa kāya ppabhā byāma ppabhā ketumālā vicitta tā buddha veso kadāci anekehi pāṭihāriyehi
translated: with the bodily radiance, the radiance that extends to others, and the garland of glory. Sometimes with many wonders

original: vattamānehīti iminā pāramīnaṃ nissandabhūtāni pāṭihāriyāni rucivaseneva pakāsanakāni
analyzed: vattamānehi iti iminā pāramīnam nissanda bhūtāni pāṭihāriyāni ruci vasena iva pakāsanakāni
translated: taking place: this shows that the wonders that are the outcome of the perfections are manifested only as he wishes,

original: bhavanti, na sabbadāti dasseti. Evañca katvā “indakhīlassa anto ṭhapitamatte dakkhiṇapāde”tiādivacanaṃ
analyzed: bhavanti na sabba dāti dasseti evañca katvā indakhīlassa antar ṭhapita matte dakkhiṇa pāda iti ādi vacanam
translated: and not always. And in this way the statement “when he placed his right foot on the threshold”

original: samatthitaṃ hoti. Bhagavato kāye pītarasmīnaṃ yebhuyyatāya “suvaṇṇarasasiñcanāni
analyzed: samatthitam hoti bhagavato kāye pīta rasmīnam yebhuyyatāya suvaṇṇa rasa siñcanāni
translated: becomes meaningful. Because the Buddha’s body is predominantly yellow and red, it is as if it were anointed with yellow and red dyes.

original: viyā”ti vatvā kāyamhi nīlādirasmīhi tahaṃ tahaṃ pītamissitaṃ sandhāya “vicitrapaṭaparikkhittāni
analyzed: viyā ti vatvā kāyamhi taham taham pīta missitam sandhāya vicitra paṭa parikkhittāni
translated: and so on. After that, he said: “The body is variegated like a cloth with stripes of blue, etc., mixed with yellow.”

original: viya cā”ti vuttaṃ. Madhurenākārena saddaṃ karonti tuṭṭharavaravanato.
analyzed: viya ca ati vuttam madhurena ākārena saddam karonti tuṭṭha ravara vanataḥ
translated: They make a sound with a sweet voice, because they are delighted and glad.

original: Tatthāti vihāre. Gandhamaṇḍalamāḷeti hatthena kataparibhaṇḍe samosaritagandhapupphadāme maṇḍalamāḷe.
analyzed: tattha ati vihāre gandha maṇḍala māḷe iti hatthena kata paribhaṇḍe samosarita gandha puppha dāme maṇḍala māḷe
translated: “There” means in the monastery. “Perfume chamber” means a chamber made with a perfume-smeared cloth and a garland of flowers.

original: Upaṭṭhāneti pamukhe. “Ovadatī”ti vatvā tatthovādaṃ sāmaññato dassetuṃ, “bhikkhave”tiādi
analyzed: upaṭṭhāne iti pamukhe ovadati iti vatvā tattha uvādam sāmaññataḥ dassetum bhikkhave tiādi
translated: “Attendants” means those who are in front. After saying “he instructs,” in order to show the instruction there in a general way, he said, “Monks.”

original: vuttaṃ. Sampattīti cakkhādiindriyapāripūri ceva hatthādisampadā ca. Samassāsitakāyo
analyzed: vuttam sampatti iti cakkha ādi indriya pāripūri ca iva hattha ādi sampadā ca samassāsita kāyaḥ
translated: “Advantages” means the perfection of the eye faculty, etc., and the perfection of the hand, etc. The body is refreshed

original: kilamathavinodanena. “Tañca kho samāpajjanenā”ti vadanti. Dutiyabhāgeti iminā aparabhāgaṃ
analyzed: kilamatha vinodanena tat ca kho samāpajjanena ati vadanti dutiya bhāga iti iminā apara bhāgam
translated: by the removal of fatigue. “And that by attainment,” they say. “The second part” means after dividing the latter part

original: tayo bhāge katvā tattha purimabhāgaṃ seyyanisajjāvasena samāpattīhi vītināmetīti
analyzed: tayaḥ bhāge katvā purima bhāgam seyya nisajjā vasena samāpattīhi vītināmeti iti
translated: into three parts, he spends the first part there in attainment by way of the best posture.

original: dasseti. Lokanti rājagahādīsu yaṃ tadā upanissāya viharati, tattha aññattha vā bujjhanakaṃ🔽vineyyasattalokaṃ buddhacakkhunā voloketi. Kālayuttanti tesaṃ indriyaparipākakālānurūpaṃ.
analyzed: dasseti lokanti rāja gaha ādīsu yam tadā upanissāya viharati tattha aññattha vā bujjhanakam  vineyya satta lokam buddha cakkhunā voloketi kāla yuttam ti tesam indriya paripāka kāla anurūpam
translated: He sees the world: he sees with the Buddha-eye the world of beings to be trained, which is found in such places as Rājagaha, or elsewhere, and which is to be awakened to.🔽In time: in accordance with the time for the ripening of their faculties.

original: Samayayuttanti tasseva vevacanaṃ. Samayayuttanti vā tehi ājānitabbavisesapaṭilābhānurūpaṃ.
analyzed: samaya yuttan ti tassa iva vevacanam samaya yuttan ti vā tehi ājānitabba visesa paṭilābha anurūpam
translated: In season: this is a synonym for the preceding phrase. Or alternatively, in season can also mean in accordance with the attainment of the distinction to be understood by them.

original: Paṭisallīnoti kālaparicchedaṃ katvā samāpattiṃ samāpanno. Adhippāyaṃ sampādento taṃ avirādhento, ajjhāsayānurūpanti attho.
analyzed: paṭisallīnaḥ ti kāla paricchedam katvā samāpattim samāpannaḥ adhippāyam sampādentaḥ tam a virādhentaḥ ajjhāsayā anurūpanti attho
translated: He is secluded: he has entered upon jhāna by defining a time, and he does not interrupt his continuity in jhāna. The meaning is that he is in accordance with the inclination of his own mind.

original: Sakala…pe… devatāyoti ettha lokadhātusākalyaṃ daṭṭhabbaṃ, na devatāsākalyaṃ. Na hi
analyzed: ettha lokadhātu sākalyam daṭṭhabbam na devatā sākalyam na hi
translated: The entire world of gods: here the entire world of beings should be understood, not the entire world of gods.

original: mahāsamaye viya sabbadā majjhimayāme dasasahassacakkavāḷe sabbattha sabbā devatā
analyzed: mahā samaye viya sabbadā majjhima yāme dasa sahassa cakkavāḷe sabbattha sabbāḥ devatāḥ
translated: For not all the gods in the ten-thousand world-element come into the presence of the Master at all times, as they do on the Uposatha day of the fifteenth in the Mahāsamaya Sutta .

original: satthu samīpaṃ upagacchanti. Kilāsubhāvo kilamatho.
analyzed: satthu samīpam upagacchanti kilāsu bhāvaḥ kilamatho
translated: Fatigue is weariness.

original: Vihāracīvaraparivattanavasenāti vihāre nivatthanivāsanaparivattanavasena. Ādiyitvāti pārupanavasena gahetvā. Tenāha “dhāretvā”ti. Bhikkhācāranti bhikkhatthaṃ caritabbaṭṭhānaṃ.
analyzed: vihāra cīvara parivattana vasena ati vihāre nivattha nivāsana parivattana vasena ādiyitvā ati pārupana vasena gahetvā tena āha dhāretvā ati bhikkhācāram ti bhikkhattham caritabba ṭṭhānam
translated: By the change of the dwelling and the robe: by the change of the dwelling and the wearing apparel. Having taken up: having taken up by putting on. Hence it is said, “having worn.” The alms round: the place to be gone to for the sake of alms.

original: Atirocamānanti taṃ taṃ atikkamitvā samantato sabbadisāsu virocamānaṃ. Sarīrappabhanti
analyzed: atirocamānanti tam tam atikkamitvā samantataḥ sabba disāsu virocamānam sarīra ppabhanti
translated: Shining forth: shining forth all around in all directions, surpassing this and that. The radiance of his body:

original: attano sarīrappabhaṃ. Jaṅgamaṃ viya padumasaranti ratanamayakiñjakkhaṃ rajatamayakaṇṇikaṃ🔽samantato samphullitakañcanapadumaṃ sañcārimasaraṃ viya. Gaganatalanti abbhamahikādiupakkilesavigamena
analyzed: attano sarīra ppabham jaṅgamam viya ratana maya kiñjakkham rajata maya kaṇṇikam  samantataḥ samphullita kañcana padumam sañcāri masaram viya abbha mahika ādi upakkilesa vigamena
translated: his own bodily radiance. Like a moving lotus pond: like a moving lotus pond made of jewels, with a golden pericarp, silver petals,

original: suvisuddhaākāsatalaṃ viya. Tampi hi tārāgaṇakiraṇajālasamujjalatāya samantato virocati.
analyzed: su visuddha ākāsa talam hi tārā gaṇa kiraṇa jāla samujjala tāya samantataḥ virocati
translated: and a honey-sweet scent all around. The surface of the sky: like the surface of the sky, which is very clear by the absence of such impurities as mist, etc. For that also shines forth all around by the brilliance of the network of the rays of the multitude of stars.

original: Kanakasikharanti kanakagirisikharaṃ. Siriyā jalamānanti sabbaso anavajjāya sabbākārena
analyzed: kanaka sikharanti kanakagiri sikharam siriyā jalam ānanti sabbasas anavajjāya sabba ākārena
translated: The golden mountain peak: the peak of the golden mountain. Shining with glory: shining with glory that is entirely irreproachable and in every way

original: paripuṇṇakāyatāya anaññasādhāraṇāya rūpakāyasiriyā samujjalaṃ, yassā rucirabhāvo
analyzed: paripuṇṇa kāya tāya anañña sādhāraṇāya rūpa kāya siriyā samujjalam yassā rucira bhāvaḥ
translated: and with a beauty of form that is complete and not shared by others, it outshines the moon’s orb, which is radiant

original: viddhe vigatavalāhake puṇṇamāsiyaṃ paripuṇṇakalamanomamaṇḍalaṃ candamaṇḍalaṃ atirocati,
analyzed: viddhe vigata valāhake puṇṇamāsiyam paripuṇṇa kalama noma maṇḍalam canda maṇḍalam atirocati
translated: with a beauty that is complete in the clear, cloudless full-moon night,

original: pabhassarabhāvo sahassaraṃsikiraṇatejojālasamujjalaṃ sūriyamaṇḍalaṃ abhibhavati,
analyzed: pabhassara bhāvaḥ sahassa raṃsi kiraṇa tejaḥ jāla samujjalam sūriya maṇḍalam abhibhavati
translated: and it outshines the sun’s orb, which is radiant with a beauty that is resplendent with the radiance of a thousand rays.

original: hemasamujjalabhāvo tadubhaye abhibhuyya pavattamānaṃ ekakkhaṇe dasasahassilokadhātuvijjotanasamattha-mahābrahmuno🔽pabhāsamudayaṃ abhivihacca bhāsati tapati virocati.
analyzed: tad ubhaye abhibhuyya pavattamānam eka kkhaṇe  pabhā samudayam bhāsati tapati virocati
translated: And it outshines the radiance of the Great Brahmā, which is able to illuminate ten thousand world systems at one instant, and it shines, warms, and illuminates, surpassing it.

original: Samantapāsādiketi samantato pasādāvahe. Tañca kho sabbaso saritabbatāyāti āha “pasādanīye”ti.
analyzed: samantapāsādikā iti samantataḥ pasādāvahe tat ca kho sabbaso saritabba tāya ati āha pasādanīyā iti
translated: It is “pleasing in every way” because it causes every kind of confidence. And that is because it is to be relied upon in every way: thus “it inspires confidence.”

original: Uttamadamathasamathamanuppatteti kāyavācāhi anuttaraṃ dantabhāvañceva anuttaraṃ cittavūpasamañca
analyzed: uttama damatha samatham anuppattā iti kāya vācāhi anuttaram danta bhāvañca iva anuttaram citta vūpasamañca
translated: “When the highest self-control and peace have been reached” : when the highest self-control of body and speech and the highest peace of mind have been reached.

original: sampatte. Appasādenāti pasādābhāvena, pasādapaṭikkhepena vā assaddhiyena. Ubhayathāpi
analyzed: sampatte appasādena ati pasāda abhāvena pasāda paṭikkhepena vā ubhayathā api
translated: “Lack of confidence” : through the absence of confidence, or through the opposition to confidence, i.e., through lack of faith. In both cases,

original: noti appasādo macchariyanti ubhayathāpi no eva, atha kho anattamanatāya upārambhādhippāyena🔽apasādento, bhagavato mukhato kiñci desetukāmo vā evamāha. Tattha kāraṇaṃ dassento
analyzed: no ti appasādaḥ ubhayathā api no eva atha kho anatta manatāya upārambha adhippāyena  apasādentaḥ bhagavataḥ mukhataḥ kiñci desetu kāmaḥ vā evam āha tattha kāraṇam dassentaḥ
translated: “Neither faith nor avarice” : neither faith nor avarice. But rather, being displeased, he said this with the intention of finding fault,

original: “bhagavato panā”tiādimāha. Atittanti tittiṃ agacchantaṃ. Kammabhaṅganti kammahāniṃ.
analyzed: bhagavataḥ pana ati ādim āha atittam tittim agacchantam kamma bhaṅgam ti kamma hānim
translated: or with the desire to hear something from the mouth of the Blessed One. There, showing the reason, he said, “But, venerable sir,” etc. “Not satisfied” : not having reached satisfaction. “Failure of kamma” : loss of kamma.

original: Tikkhapañño esa brāhmaṇo, tathā hi na cirasseva arahattaṃ sacchikarissati. Kathāpavattanatthampi
analyzed: tikkha paññaḥ esa brāhmaṇaḥ tathā hi na cirassa iva arahattam sacchikarissati kathā pavattana attham pi
translated: This brahmin has keen wisdom, for he will soon realize arahatship. He also said this for the sake of the development of the discussion,

original: evamāha – “evaṃ ahaṃ imassa kañci dhammaṃ sotuṃ labhissāmī”ti. Veneyyavasenāti attano
analyzed: evam āha evam aham imassa kañci dhammam sotum labhissāmi iti veneyya vasena ati attanaḥ
translated: thinking, “In this way I will be able to hear some Dhamma from him.” “In accordance with the disciples” : in accordance with the person to be disciplined,

original: kasanakāribhāvakittanamukhena vinetabbapuggalavasena.🔽Oḷārikānīti pākatikāni. “Esa uttamadakkhiṇeyyo”ti sañjātabahumāno. Pāḷiyaṃ “yugaṃ
analyzed: kasana kāri bhāva kittana mukhena vinetabba puggala vasena  oḷārikāni iti pākatikāni esaḥ uttama dakkhiṇeyyaḥ ti sañjāta bahu māno pāḷiyam yugam
translated: through the praise of his own ability to cut.🔽“Gross” : ordinary. “This is the most excellent recipient of gifts” : having generated great respect, in the text it is said, “a yoke

original: vā naṅgalaṃ vā”ti vā-saddo avuttavikappattho. Tena bījādiṃ saṅgaṇhāti, tasmā bījaṃ
analyzed: vā naṅgalam vā ti vā saddaḥ avutta vikappa atthaḥ tena bīja ādim saṅgaṇhāti tasmā bījam
translated: or a plough” . The word vā has the meaning of an indeclinable. Therefore it includes seed, etc. Therefore seed,

original: vā īsaṃ vā pariggahayottāni vāti ayamattho dassito hoti. Tathā hi bhagavā brāhmaṇassa🔽paṭivacanaṃ dento “saddhā bīja”ntiādimāha. Pubbadhammasabhāgatāyāti paṭhamaṃ gahitadhammasabhāgatāya.
analyzed: vā īsam vā pariggaha yottāni vā ati ayam atthaḥ dassitaḥ hoti tathā hi bhagavā brāhmaṇassa  paṭivacanam dentaḥ saddhā bījam ti ādim āha pubba dhamma sabhā gatāya ti paṭhamam gahita dhamma sabhā gatāya
translated: and the meaning indicated is this: “Just as a man who has taken hold of the plough and the goad can guide the oxen as he wishes, so too, when the bhikkhu has taken hold of the sign of the in-breaths and out-breaths and the mindfulness of them, he can guide his mind as he wishes.”🔽For when the Blessed One was replying to the brahman, he said, “Faith is the seed” , etc.,🔽and that is the same as the first-mentioned similarity of state.

original: Yaṃ panettha vattabbaṃ, taṃ aṭṭhakathāruḷhameva gahetabbañca saddato atthāpattito
analyzed: yam pana ittha vattabbam tam aṭṭhakathā ruḷham eva gahetabbam ca saddataḥ atthāpattitaḥ
translated: But what has to be said here can be understood from the Commentary, which should be consulted for the similes of the ploughman, etc., and for the meaning of the words, and for the source of the teaching, and for the benefits of concentration, and for the explanation of the advantages of the sign of the in-breaths and out-breaths, and for the explanation of the meaning of the words, and for the explanation of the advantages of the sign of the in-breaths and out-breaths, and for the explanation of the meaning of the words.

original: vā idha daṭṭhabbaṃ. Buddhānaṃ ānubhāvo ayaṃ, yadidaṃ pasaṅgāgatadhammamukhena desanaṃ🔽ārabhitvā veneyyavinayanaṃ.
analyzed: vā idha daṭṭhabbam buddhānam ānubhāvaḥ ayam yat idam pasaṅga āgata dhamma mukhena desanaṃ  ārabhitvā veneyya vinayanam
translated: This is the Blessed One’s power of omniscience, namely, that he undertakes the teaching by means of a subject that has come up incidentally and then trains the disciples.🔽Without a sequel: without a sequel in the way of a question.

original: Ananusandhikāti pucchānusandhivasena ananusandhikā. Evanti idāni vuccamānākārena.
analyzed: ananusandhikā iti puccha anusandhi vasena ananusandhikā evam ti idāni vuccamāna ākārena
translated: Thus: in the way now being spoken of.🔽Herein: in this teaching.🔽He: the Blessed One.

original: Etthāti etissā desanāya. Soti bhagavā. Tassāti brāhmaṇassa. Anukampāyāti asabbaññū
analyzed: ettha ati etissā desanāya saḥ ti bhagavā tassa ati brāhmaṇassa anukampāya ati asabbaññū
translated: His: the brahman’s.

original: hi satipi anukampāya pucchitamatte tiṭṭheyya, tathā jānantopi ananukampako, bhagavā
analyzed: hi sati api anukampāya pucchita matte tiṭṭheyya tathā jānantaḥ api an anukampakaḥ bhagavā
translated: Out of compassion: for if the Blessed One were not omniscient, he would have stopped at the questioner’s question, even out of compassion. And even if he knew, he would not have taught if he had not been compassionate.

original: pana ubhayadhammapāripūriyā “idaṃ apucchita”nti aparihāpetvā katheti. Samūlantiādinā
analyzed: pana ubhaya dhamma pāripūriyā idam a pucchitanti a parihāpetvā kathā iti sa mūla nti ādinā
translated: but he does not fail to answer, saying, “This is not asked,” because he has fulfilled both the letter and the spirit of the rule.🔽In the passage beginning “The root of the tree” he explains the meaning stated in brief.

original: saṅkhepena vuttamatthaṃ vivaranto “tatthā”tiādimāha. Tattha bījassa kasiyā mūlabhāvo🔽nānantariyato tappamāṇavidhānato cāti āha “tasmiṃ…pe… kattabbato”ti. Tena anvayato🔽byatirekato ca bījassa kasiyā mūlabhāvaṃ vibhāveti. Kusalāti iminā akusalā tato aññathāpi
analyzed: saṅkhepena vutta mattham vivarantaḥ tattha ati ādim āha tattha bījassa kasiyā mūla bhāvaḥ  na ānantariyataḥ tad pamāṇa vidhānataḥ ca ati āha tasmin pe kattabbato ti tena anvayato  byatirekato ca bījassa kasiyā mūla bhāvam vibhāveti kusalā ati iminā akusalā tatas aññathā api
translated: The seed is the root of the tree’s growth🔽because it is the immediate cause and because it determines the tree’s size.🔽Thus he shows by the method of agreement and difference that the seed is the root of the tree’s growth.

original: karonti, taṃ pana appamāṇanti dasseti.🔽Tassāti brāhmaṇassa bījaṭṭhāniyassa dhammassa ca upakārabhāvato. Dhammasambandhasamatthabhāvatoti
analyzed: karonti tam pana appamāṇam ti dasseti  tassa ati brāhmaṇassa bīja ṭṭhāniyassa dhammassa ca upakāra bhāvataḥ dhamma sambandha samattha bhāvataḥ ti
translated: By the word “wholesome” he shows that they do not do it unwholesomely or in some other way, but only by the right measure.🔽“His” refers to the brahmin, and to the Dhamma that is like the seed.

original: tathā vuttadhammassa phalena sambandhituṃ yojetuṃ samatthabhāvato. Tapo vuṭṭhīti
analyzed: tathā vutta dhammassa phalena sambandhitum yojetum samattha bhāvataḥ tapaḥ vuṭṭhi iti
translated: “Because of his ability to understand the connection between the Dhamma and its fruit” means because of his ability to connect the stated Dhamma with its fruit and to apply it.🔽“Ascetic practices and austerities”🔽is said with reference to the statement.

original: vuttavacanaṃ sandhāya vuttaṃ. Saṅkhepato vuttamatthaṃ pākaṭaṃ kātuṃ “ayaṃ hī”tiādi
analyzed: vutta vacanam sandhāya vuttam saṅkhepataḥ vuttam attham pākaṭam kātum ayam hi itiādi
translated: In order to make the meaning stated in brief clear, he says, “For this reason.”

original: vuttaṃ. Kassakassa upakārassa bījassa anantaraṃ vuṭṭhi vuccamānā aṭṭhāne vuttā nāma
analyzed: vuttam kassakassa upakārassa bījassa anantaram vuṭṭhi vuccamānā aṭṭhāne vuttā nāma
translated: The explanation of the growth of the seed, which is a help to the farmer, is not called “out of place” when given after the seed.

original: na hoti. Kasmā? Bījassa vappakāle anurūpāya vuṭṭhiyā icchitabbato, tasmā avasāne
analyzed: na hoti kasmai bījassa vappa kāle anurūpāya vuṭṭhiyā icchitabbataḥ tasmai avasāne
translated: Why? Because the growth suitable to the time of sowing the seed is wanted. So if it is given at the end

original: majjhe vā vuccamānāya dhammasambandhasamatthatā tassā vibhāvitā na siyā. Attano avisayeti
analyzed: majjhe vā vuccamānāya dhamma sambandha samattha tā tassā vibhāvitā na siyā attanaḥ a visayā iti
translated: or in the middle, the suitability of the growth to the seed will not be made clear.🔽In what is not its own province: in the supramundane states beginning with jhāna.

original: jhānādiuttarimanussadhamme. Pacchāpīti kasisambhārakathanato pacchāpi. Vattabboti
analyzed: jhāna ādi uttari manussa dhamme pacchā api iti kasi sambhāra kathanato pacchā api vattabbo ti
translated: Even later: even after the explanation of the requisites for the farmer.🔽It should be told: it should be told without fail.

original: ekantena vattabbo. Tadanantaraṃyevāti bījānantaraṃyeva. Vuccamānā vuṭṭhi samatthā
analyzed: ekantena vattabbaḥ tad anantaram yeva ati bīja anantaram yeva vuccamānā vuṭṭhi samatthā
translated: Immediately after that: immediately after the seed. The growth is suitable

original: hoti, bījassa phalena sambandhane samatthāti dīpitā hoti anantaravacaneneva tassā
analyzed: hoti bījassa phalena sambandhane samatthā ati dīpitā hoti anantara vacanena iva tassā
translated: when told immediately after the seed, and it is shown that it is suitable to be related to the seed by the fruit.

original: āsannaupakārattadīpanato.🔽Sampasādalakkhaṇāti pasīditabbe vatthusmiṃ sammadeva pasīdanalakkhaṇā. Okappanalakkhaṇāti
analyzed: āsanna aupakāra tta dīpanataḥ  sampasāda lakkhaṇā ati pasīditabbe vatthusmim sammat eva pasīdana lakkhaṇā okappana lakkhaṇā ati
translated: Because the immediate sequence shows that it is a help to it.🔽The characteristic of confidence is that of causing complete confidence in a trustworthy object. The characteristic of resolution is that of causing one to enter into an object that can be resolved upon thus: “It is like this.”

original: saddheyyavatthuno evametanti pakkhandanalakkhaṇā. Mūlabījantiādīsu mūlameva bījaṃ
analyzed: saddheyya vatthuno evam etat ti pakkhandana lakkhaṇā mūla bīja nti ādīsu mūlam eva bījam
translated: In the case of the root-of-good, etc., the root itself is the seed,

original: mūlabījaṃ. Esa nayo sesesupi bījagāmassa adhippetattā. Bhūtagāmo pana mūlaṃ bījaṃ
analyzed: mūla bījam esa nayo sesesu pi bījagāmassa adhippeta ttā bhūtagāmaḥ pana mūlam bījam
translated: The root is the primary root. The same method applies to the rest. The primary root is intended here. But the primary element is the root, the seed,

original: etassāti mūlabījantiādinā veditabbo. Bījabījanti pañcamaṃ pana paccayantarasamavāye
analyzed: etassa iti mūla bīja nti ādinā veditabbaḥ bīja bīja nti pañcamam pana paccaya antara samavāye
translated: Root-seed. The same method applies in the case of the rest. But the element of earth is the root and the seed of this, thus it is root-seed, and so on.

original: sadisaphaluppattiyā visesakāraṇabhāvato virūhanasamatthe sāraphale niruḷho bījasaddo🔽tadatthasiddhiyā mūlādīsupi kesuci pavattatīti tato nivattanatthaṃ ekena bīja-saddena
analyzed: sadisa phala uppattiyā visesa kāraṇa bhāvataḥ virūhana samatthe sāra phale niruḷhaḥ bīja saddaḥ  tad attha siddhiyā mūla ādīsu pi kesuci pavattati iti tatas nivattana attham ekena bīja saddena
translated: As to seed-seed: the word “seed” is established in the sense of a fruitful seed capable of germinating, since it is the special cause for the production of a fruit similar to itself in the combination of the other conditions.🔽In order to exclude that from the meaning intended here, it is specified by the word “seed” in the phrase “seed-seed,” just as in the phrases “painful bodily feeling” and “materiality as the material.”

original: visesetvā vuttaṃ “bījabīja”nti “dukkhadukkhaṃ rūparūpa”nti ca yathā. Evampi iminā
analyzed: visesetvā vuttam bīja bījanti dukkha dukkham rūpa rūpanti ca yathā evam pi iminā
translated: So too, in this sense, the state of being a seed is to be understood in the case of this as well, and it is not merely figurative.

original: atthena imassapi nippariyāyova bījabhāvoti dassento āha “taṃ sabbampi…pe… gacchatī”ti.
analyzed: atthena imassa api nippariyāyaḥ uva bīja bhāvaḥ ti dassentaḥ āha tam gacchati iti
translated: He said, “All that … goes to” in order to show this.

original: Idāni kathañci vattabbe saddhāya opammatte bīje saddhāya bījabhāvaṃ vibhāvetuṃ “tattha
analyzed: idāni kathañci vattabbe saddhāya opammatte bīje saddhāya bīja bhāvam vibhāvetum tattha
translated: Now, in order to demonstrate the state of being a seed in the case of faith, which is mentioned as a simile in the passage, “Just as the seed of all the crops” , etc., he began the paragraph with the words, “Herein, just as the seed of all the crops” .

original: yathā”tiādi āraddhaṃ. Kāmaṃ saddhūpanisaṃ sīlaṃ, tathāpi samādhissa viya sabbesampi
analyzed: yathā atiādi āraddham kāmam saddhu upanisam sīlam tathā api samādhissa viya sabbesam pi
translated: Although virtue is a condition for faith, nevertheless, in order to show that it is a condition for all the other profitable aggregates in the way already stated ,

original: anavajjadhammānaṃ ādimūlabhāvato saddhāyapi patiṭṭhā hotīti āha “heṭṭhā sīlamūlena
analyzed: anavajja dhammānam ādi mūla bhāvato patiṭṭhā hoti iti āha heṭṭhā sīla mūlena
translated: and it is a support for faith since it is the beginning and root of blameless states. That is why he said “it is established below by the root of virtue” .

original: patiṭṭhātī”ti. Yasmā sabbasseva puggalassa saddhāvasena samathavipassanārambho, tasmā
analyzed: patiṭṭhāti iti yasmā sabbassa eva puggalassa saddhā vasena samatha vipassanā ārambhaḥ tasmā
translated: Since the beginning of serenity and insight is by way of faith in all persons,🔽therefore it is said that “it causes the sprout of serenity and insight to arise above” .

original: sā “upari samathavipassanaṅkuraṃ uṭṭhāpetī”ti vuttā. Tanti dhaññabījaṃ. Pathavirasaṃ
analyzed: sā upari samatha vipassana aṅkuram uṭṭhāpeti iti vuttā tanti dhañña bījam pathavi rasam
translated: The grain is the rice grain.

original: āporasanti sasambhārapathavīāpesu labbhamānaṃ rasaṃ. Gahetvāti paccayaparamparāya
analyzed: āporasanti sa sambhāra pathavī āpesu labbhamānam rasam gahetvā ati paccaya paramparāya
translated: The sap of the earth and the sap of water are the sap obtained from the earth and water together with their adjuncts.🔽Having taken them is having taken them by a succession of conditions.🔽For the sake of the ripening of the grain is for the sake of the production of the ripening of the grain.

original: gahetvā. Dhaññaparipākagahaṇatthanti dhaññaparipākanibbattiatthaṃ. Rasanti saddhāsīlamūlahetusamathavipassanābhāvanārasaṃ🔽ādiyitvā. Ariyamagganāḷenāti ariyamaggasotena ariyaphaladhaññaparipākagahaṇatthanti
analyzed: gahetvā dhañña paripāka gahaṇa attham dhañña paripāka nibbatti attham rasanti saddhā sīla mūla hetu samatha vipassanā bhāvanā rasam  ādiyitvā ariya magga nāḷena ati ariya magga sotena ariya phala dhañña paripāka gahaṇa ttham ti
translated: Having taken the sap is having taken the sap of the development of serenity and insight which is the root cause of faith and virtue.🔽By the channel of the noble path is by the noble path’s stream. For the sake of the ripening of the grain of the noble fruit is for the sake of the production of the noble fruit itself, which is called “grain” because it is to be reaped .

original: ariyaphalameva dhanāyitabbato dhaññaṃ tassa nibbattiatthaṃ. Dhaññanāḷaṃ nāma kaṇḍassa
analyzed: ariya phalam eva dhanāyitabbataḥ dhaññam tassa nibbatti attham dhaññanāḷam nāma kaṇḍassa
translated: The channel of the grain is the stalk of the rice plant.

original: nissayabhūto pacchimadeso, kaṇḍo tabbhantaro taṃnissayoyeva daṇḍo. Pasavo nāma pupphaṃ.🔽Vuddhinti avayavapāripūrivasena vuddhiṃ. Virūḷhinti mūlasantānadaḷhatāya viruḷhataṃ.🔽Vepullanti pattanāḷādīhi vipulabhāvaṃ. Khīraṃ janetvāti taruṇasalāṭukabhāvappattiyā
analyzed: nissaya bhūto pacchima deso kaṇḍo tad bhantaro tad nissayaḥ yā iva daṇḍo pasavaḥ nāma puppham  avayava pāripūri vasena vuddhim mūla santāna daḷhatāya  vepullanti patta nāḷa ādīhi vipula bhāvam khīram janetvā ati taruṇa sa lāṭuka bhāva ppattiyā
translated: The western region is the support; the stalk is what is supported by it. The flower is the animal.🔽Growth is growth by the fulfilment of the parts. Ripening is the state of ripeness due to the strength of the root and the trunk.

original: taṇḍulassa bījassa bījabhūtaṃ khīraṃ uppādetvā. Esāti saddhā. Patiṭṭhahitvāti kammapathākammapathasammādiṭṭhisahitena
analyzed: taṇḍulassa bījassa bīja bhūtam khīram uppādetvā esā ati saddhā patiṭṭhahitvā ati kammapatha akammapatha sammādiṭṭhi sahitena
translated: Abundance is the state of abundance with flowers, fruits, etc. Having generated the milk: having produced the milk which is the seed of the rice grain, which is the cause for the attainment of the state of tender rice shoots.🔽This: faith. Having been established: having been established by the mere virtue that occurs at the beginning together with the right view that is the path and the right view that is the way of entry.

original: ādito pavattasīlamattena patiṭṭhahitvā. Vuddhintiādīsu suparisuddhāhi sīlacittavisuddhīhi🔽vuddhiṃ, diṭṭhikaṅkhāvitaraṇavisuddhīhi virūḷhiṃ. Maggāmaggapaṭipadāñāṇadassanavisuddhīhi
analyzed: āditas pavatta sīla mattena patiṭṭhahitvā vuddhi nti ādīsu su parisuddhāhi sīla citta visuddhīhi  vuddhim diṭṭhi kaṅkhā vitaraṇa visuddhīhi virūḷhim magga amagga paṭipadā ñāṇa dassana visuddhīhi
translated: Growth, etc.: growth by means of the purification of virtue and the purification of mind that are very pure;🔽ripening by means of the purification by overcoming doubt about the truths; abundance by means of the purification by knowledge and vision of the way and the way of entry;

original: vepullaṃ patvā. Ñāṇadassanavisuddhikhīranti sādurasasuvisuddhibhāvato ñāṇadassanavisuddhisaṅkhātaṃ
analyzed: vepullam patvā ñāṇa dassana visuddhi khīranti sādu rasa su visuddhi bhāvataḥ ñāṇa dassana visuddhi saṅkhātam
translated: the milk of the purification by knowledge and vision is the cause for the attainment of the state of the ten powers, etc., which is the cause for the attainment of the state of the four fruits of asceticism, etc., which is the cause for the attainment of the state of the ten powers, etc., which is the cause for the attainment of the state of the four fruits of asceticism, etc., which is the cause for the attainment of the state of the ten powers, etc., which is the cause for the attainment of the state of the four fruits of asceticism, etc., which is the cause for the attainment of the state of the ten powers, etc., which is the cause for the attainment of the state of the four fruits of asceticism, etc., which is the cause for the attainment of the state of the ten powers, etc., which is the cause for the attainment of the state of the four fruits of asceticism, etc., which is the cause for the attainment of the state of the ten powers, etc., which is the cause for the attainment of the state of the four fruits of asceticism, etc., which is the cause for the attainment of the state of the ten powers, etc., which is the cause for the attainment of the state of the four fruits of asceticism, etc., which is the cause for the attainment of the state of the ten powers, etc., which is the cause for the attainment of the state of the four fruits of asceticism, etc., which is the cause for the attainment of the

original: khīraṃ janetvā. Aneka…pe… phalanti anekapaṭisambhidā-anekābhiññāṇaparipuṇṇaṃ arahattaphalasīsaṃ nipphādeti.🔽Bījakiccakaraṇatoti bījakiccassa karaṇato. Yañhi taṃsadisassa visadisassa ca attano
analyzed: khīram janetvā aneka pe phalanti aneka paṭisambhidā aneka abhiññāṇa paripuṇṇam arahatta phala sīsam nipphādeti  bīja kicca karaṇato ti bīja kiccassa karaṇato yat hi taṃsadisassa visadisassa ca attanaḥ
translated: and it generates milk. It generates the many kinds of knowledge, etc., and it generates the head of Arahantship, which is complete with the many kinds of discrimination and the many kinds of direct-knowledge.🔽As the doing of the seed’s function: as the doing of the function of a seed. For the function of a seed is called its “establishing,” “connecting,” and “generating” of a fruit of the same kind or of a different kind,

original: phalassa patiṭṭhāpanasambandhananipphādanasaṅkhātaṃ bījassa kiccaṃ, tassa karaṇato
analyzed: phalassa patiṭṭhāpana sambandhana nipphādana saṅkhātam bījassa kiccam tassa karaṇataḥ
translated: as the case may be. It is because it does this function,

original: nibbattanato “evaṃ saddhā bījakicca”nti vuttaṃ. Iminā anaññasādhāraṇaṃ saddhāya kusaladhammānaṃ
analyzed: nibbattanataḥ evam saddhā bīja kiccan ti vuttam iminā anañña sādhāraṇam saddhāya kusala dhammānam
translated: because it generates, that faith is said to “do the seed’s function.” And by this he shows that faith’s seed-state of profitable ideas is not shared by anything else.

original: bījabhāvaṃ dasseti. Sā cātiādinā tamevatthaṃ samattheti. Idāni tattha āgamaṃ dassento🔽“saddhājāto”tiādimāha. Tena yathā sappurisūpanissayassa saddhammassavanassa ca, evaṃ
analyzed: bīja bhāvam dasseti sā ca ati ādinā tam eva attham samatthā iti idāni tattha āgamam dassento  saddhā jātaḥ iti ādim āha tena yathā sappurisa upanissayassa saddhamma ssavanassa ca evam
translated: And he confirms that same meaning in the line beginning “And that” . Now, in order to show the tradition here,

original: anavasesāya sammāpaṭipattiyā saddhā mūlakāraṇanti dasseti.
analyzed: anavasesāya sammāpaṭipattiyā saddhā mūla kāraṇanti dasseti
translated: he says “Faith is the highest treasure” , etc. By that he shows that faith is the root-cause of the whole of right practice without exception, just as a good friend is of hearing the good Dhamma and of that.🔽Restraint of the faculties and energy are the doers of the hard work in the case of unprofitable ideas,

original: Indriyasaṃvaro vīriyañca akusaladhamme, dukkarakārikā dhutaṅgañca akusaladhamme ceva
analyzed: indriya saṃvaraḥ vīriyam ca akusala dhamme dukkara kārikā dhutaṅgañca akusala dhamme ca eva
translated: and the ascetic practices are the doers of the hard work in the case of unprofitable ideas

original: kāyañca tapati vibādhatīti tapoti vuccati. Indriyasaṃvaro adhippeto vīriyassa dhorayhabhāvena🔽gayhamānattā, itaresaṃ vuṭṭhibhāvassa anuyuñjamānattā. Ādi-saddena kalalaṅgāravuṭṭhiādīnaṃ🔽saṅgaho. Samanuggahitanti upagataṃ. Viruhanāmilāyananipphattivacanehi dhaññabījasantānassa
analyzed: kāyam ca tapati vibādhati iti tapo ti vuccati indriya saṃvaraḥ adhippetaḥ vīriyassa dhorayha bhāvena  gayhamāna ttā itaresam vuṭṭhi bhāvassa anuyuñjamāna ttā ādi saddena kalalaṅgāra vuṭṭhi ādīnam  saṅgahaḥ samanuggahitanti upagatam viruha nāmilāyana nipphatti vacanehi dhañña bīja santānassa
translated: and it burns and oppresses the body, thus it is called a fire. The restraint of the faculties is intended. Because of the state of being a yoke for energy,🔽and because of the state of being a yoke for the other three faculties. By the word “etc.”🔽the inclusion of the oozing of the embryo, the oozing of the charcoal, etc., is shown. “Is yoked” means is approached. By the words “growing,” “sprouting,” and “producing,”

original: viya tesaṃ vuddhiyā saddhābījasantānassa tapovuṭṭhiyā ādimajjhapariyosānesu upakārataṃ dasseti.
analyzed: viya tesam vuddhiyā saddhā bīja santānassa tapo vuṭṭhiyā ādi majjha pariyosānesu upakāra tam dasseti
translated: he shows the helpfulness of the oozing of the seed of faith in the growth of the series of the seed of the crop, as it were, at the beginning, middle, and end.

original: Purimapadesupīti api-saddena parapadesupīti attho daṭṭhabbo “hirī me īsā, mano me
analyzed: purima padesu pi iti api saddena para padesu pi iti atthaḥ daṭṭhabbo hirī me īsā manaḥ me
translated: “In the former case too” means “in the other case too.” The meaning should be seen thus: because of the desire “My conscience is my plough, my mind is my

original: yotta”nti icchitattā, “sati me”ti ettha me-saddo ānetvā yojetabbo. Udakampi tāva
analyzed: icchitattā sati mā iti ettha mā saddaḥ ānetvā yojetabbaḥ udakam pi tāva
translated: warrior,” and “My mindfulness is my seed,” the word “my” should be brought in and yoked in the place “my mindfulness.” Even water has to be brought

original: dātabbaṃ hoti nadītaḷākādito ānetvā. Vīriyabalībadde catubbidhe yojetvā. Niccakālaṃ atthīti vacanaseso.
analyzed: dātabbam hoti nadī taḷāka āditaḥ ānetvā vīriya balībadde catubbidhe yojetvā nicca kālam atthi iti vacana sesaḥ
translated: from a river, a lake, etc., and given. After yoking the fourfold energy, which is strong, “always” is a remainder of the statement.

original: Saha vipassanāya maggapaññā adhippetā amatapphalāya kasiyā adhippetattā. Vipassanā
analyzed: saha vipassanāya magga paññā adhippetā amata pphalāya kasiyā adhippeta ttā vipassanā
translated: and the path-understanding that is insight is intended, because it is intended as the “harvest of the deathless.”

original: paññā cāti duvidhāpi paññā upanissayā hoti visiṭṭhabhāvato. Tenāha “yathā hī”tiādi.
analyzed: paññā ca ati duvidhā api paññā upanissayā hoti visiṭṭha bhāvato tena āha yathā hi itiādi
translated: Both kinds of understanding are a condition by way of decisive support because of their pre-eminent position. Hence he said “Just as” and so on.

original: Paññāti pakārehi jānātīti paññā. Paññavataṃ paññā purato hoti yonisomanasikārassa🔽visesapaccayabhāvato, sahajātādhipatīsu ca ukkaṭṭhabhāvato. Sirīti sobhaggaṃ. Sataṃ
analyzed: paññā ati pakārehi jānāti iti paññā paññavatam paññā puratas hoti yoniso manasikārassa  visesa paccaya bhāvataḥ sahajāta adhipatīsu ca ukkaṭṭha bhāvataḥ sirīti sobhaggam satam
translated: Understanding is so called because it is the knowing of things by means of the modes . Understanding is in front of those who possess it because of its being the special condition for right reflection.🔽And because it is the most outstanding among the conascent and the dominant conditions. Glory is the state of being beautiful.

original: dhammā saddhādayo, anvāyikāti anugāmino. Īsābaddhā hotīti hirisaṅkhātaīsāya baddhā🔽hoti, paññāya kadāci appayogato manosīsena samādhi idha vuttoti āha “manosaṅkhātassa
analyzed: dhammā saddhā ādayaḥ anvāyikā ati anugāminaḥ īsā baddhā hoti iti hiri saṅkhāta īsāya baddhā  hoti paññāya kadāci appayogato mano sīsena samādhi idha vutto ti āha manaḥ saṅkhātassa
translated: The hundred dhammas are faith and the rest. Follower is what follows after.🔽It is bound by the tie is bound by the tie called conscience.

original: samādhiyottassā”ti. Samaṃ upanetvā bandhitvā baddharajjukattā samādhiyottaṃ. Ekato
analyzed: samam upanetvā bandhitvā baddha rajjukattā samādhiyā uttam ekatas
translated: Because concentration is mentioned here as the tie of the mind, he says “of the tie of concentration called the mind.” The tie of concentration is so called because it is a binding rope that brings about and binds together the evenness .

original: gamananti līnaccāraddhasaṅkhātaṃ ekapassato gamanaṃ vāreti. Majjhimāya vipassanāvīthiyā
analyzed: gamananti līna ca āraddha saṅkhātam eka passataḥ gamanam vāreti majjhimāya vipassanā vīthiyā
translated: It prevents the going in one direction is what is meant. The going in one direction is either the going to the extreme of sluggishness or the going to the extreme of restlessness. The middle way of insight

original: paṭipādanato kāyādīsu subhasukhaniccattabhāvavigamane paññāya visesapaccayā satīti
analyzed: paṭipādanato kāya ādīsu subha sukha niccatta bhāva vigamane paññāya visesa paccayā satī ti
translated: And it is called mindfulness because it is a condition for the special knowledge consisting in insight into the abandoning of the perception of beauty, pleasure, and self in the case of the body, and so on.

original: vuttaṃ – “satiyuttā paññā”ti tassā sativippayogāsabbhāvato. Santatighanādīnaṃ ayaṃ
analyzed: vuttam sati yuttā paññā iti tassā sati vippayoga asabbhāvato santati ghana ādīnam ayam
translated: It is said: “Understanding is associated with mindfulness” .

original: viseso – purimapacchimānaṃ dhammānaṃ nirantaratāya ekībhūtānaṃ viya pavatti santatighanatā,🔽ekasamūhavasena ekībhūtānamiva pavatti samūhaghanatā, dubbiññeyyakiccabhedavasena
analyzed: visesaḥ purima pacchimānam dhammānam nirantara tāya ekībhūtānam viya pavatti santati ghana tā  eka samūha vasena pavatti samūha ghana tā
translated: The difference between these four kinds of compactness is this. The compactness of continuity is the occurrence of the earlier and later states without interruption as if they were a single unit.🔽The compactness of mass is the occurrence as if they were a single unit by way of a single collection.🔽The compactness of function is the occurrence as if they were a single unit by way of a single function.

original: ekībhūtānamiva pavatti. Kiccaghanatā, ekārammaṇavasena ekībhūtānamiva pavatti ārammaṇaghanatā.
analyzed: ekībhūtānam iva pavatti kicca ghana tā eka ārammaṇa vasena ekībhūtānam iva pavatti ārammaṇa ghana tā
translated: The compactness of object is the occurrence as if they were a single unit by way of a single object.🔽All the defilements, or all the states of the three planes, are the “all” in the phrase “all states” .

original: Sabbesaṃ, sabbāni vā kilesānaṃ mūlasantānakāni sabba…pe… santānakāni. Anuppayogo
analyzed: sabbesam sabbāni vā kilesānam mūla santānakāni sabbape santānakāni anuppayogaḥ
translated: For the meaning of “all” is non-excess.

original: hi attho. Padāletīti bhindati samucchindati. Sā ca kho “padāletī”ti vuttā lokuttarāva
analyzed: hi attho padāleti iti bhindati samucchindati sā ca kho padāleti iti vuttā lokuttarā ava
translated: It “splits” them, that is, it breaks them up and destroys them. And this is said of the supramundane understanding only,

original: paññā anusayappahānassa adhippetattā. Santatighanādibhedanā pana lokiyāpi hoti vipassanāvasena
analyzed: paññā anusaya ppahānassa adhippeta ttā santati ghana ādi bhedanā pana lokiyā api hoti vipassanā vasena
translated: because the abandoning of inherent tendencies is intended. But the splitting of the compactness of continuity, and so on, is also done by mundane understanding, by way of insight.

original: ghanavinibbhogassa nipphādanato. Tenāha “itarā pana lokikāpi siyā”ti.
analyzed: ghana vinibbhogassa nipphādanato tena āha itarā pana lokikā api siyā ti
translated: because it produces the dispersal of the mass . That is why it is said, “But the other may be mundane too” .

original: Hirīyatīti lajjati, jigucchatīti attho. Tasmā “pāpakehi dhammehī”ti nissakkavacanaṃ🔽daṭṭhabbaṃ, hetumhi vā karaṇavacanaṃ. Ottappampi gahitameva, na hi lajjanaṃ nibbhayaṃ
analyzed: hirīyati iti lajjati jigucchati iti atthaḥ tasmā pāpakehi dhammehi iti nissakka vacanam  daṭṭhabbam hetumhi vā karaṇa vacanam ottappam pi gahitam eva na hi lajjanam nibbhayam
translated: He is ashamed : he is embarrassed, disgusted, is the meaning. Therefore the phrase “with regard to bad things” should be regarded as a locative of sphere ;

original: pāpabhayaṃ vā alajjanaṃ atthīti. Rukkhalaṭṭhīti rukkhadaṇḍo. Tena padesena kasanato
analyzed: pāpa bhayam vā alajjanam atthi iti rukkha laṭṭhī iti rukkha daṇḍaḥ tena padesena kasanataḥ
translated: or as a locative case expressing cause. Shame is included too, for there is no embarrassment or fear of wrongdoing without shame. A tree-trunk : a tree-stump. Because it is ploughed by the section of the plough called the “tree-trunk” ,

original: visesato naṅgalanti vuccatīti āha “īsā yuganaṅgalaṃ dhāretī”ti. Kāmaṃ paññārahitā
analyzed: visesataḥ naṅgalanti vuccati iti āha īsā yuga naṅgalam dhāreti iti kāmam paññā rahitā
translated: it is called the “tree-trunk” . Because it is ploughed by the section of the plough called the “share” ,🔽it is called the “share” . The ploughshare is called the “tree-trunk” because it is the cause of the tree-trunk. The tree-trunk is called the “share” because it is the cause of the share. The ploughshare is called the “tree-trunk” because it is the cause of the tree-trunk. The tree-trunk is called the “share” because it is the cause of the share.

original: hirī atthi, hirirahitā pana paññā natthevāti āha “hiri…pe… abhāvato”ti. Sandhiṭṭhāne
analyzed: hirī atthi hiri rahitā pana paññā nattha iva ati āha hiri pe abhāvato ti sandhiṭṭhāne
translated: Although there is shame in one who is possessed of understanding, there is no understanding in one who is devoid of shame. That is why it is said “Shame … is the opposite of understanding” .

original: kampanābhāvato acalaṃ. Thirabhāvena asithilaṃ. Hiripaṭibaddhapaññā paṭipakkhavasena
analyzed: kampanā bhāvataḥ acalam thira bhāvena asithilam hiri paṭibaddha paññā paṭipakkha vasena
translated: It is unshakeable because it does not waver at the joints ;

original: ca asithilabhāvena ca acalā asithilāti āha “abbokiṇṇā ahirikenā”ti. Nāḷiyā minamānapuriso
analyzed: ca asithila bhāvena ca acalā asithilā iti āha abbokiṇṇā ahirikena ati nāḷiyā minamāna purisaḥ
translated: it is not loose because of its firmness. The understanding bound up with shame is unshakeable and not loose because of the opposite and because of the firmness. That is why it is said “It is not mixed with shamelessness” .🔽A man who is pulling a plough

original: viya ārammaṇaṃ munāti paricchedato jānātīti mano. Manosīsenāti manaso apadesena.
analyzed: viyaḥ ārammaṇam munāti paricchedataḥ jānāti iti manaḥ manaḥ sīsena ati manasaḥ apadesena
translated: It is mind because it measures the object by delimiting it.🔽“With the mind’s reins” : with the mind’s goad-stick.

original: Taṃsampayuttoti iminā kuntasahacaraṇato puriso kunto viya manasahacaraṇasamādhi “mano”ti
analyzed: tad sampayuttaḥ ti iminā kunta sahacaraṇataḥ puriso kuntaḥ viya mana sahacaraṇa samādhi
translated: By this phrase “associated with it” he shows that concentration is called “mind” because it is associated with the mind, like a man with a monkey.

original: vuttoti dasseti. Sārathināti kassakena. So hi idha balībaddānaṃ sāraṇato pācanato
analyzed: vuttaḥ ti dasseti sārathinā ati kassakena saḥ hi idha balībaddānam sāraṇataḥ pācanataḥ
translated: “The driver” : the ploughman. For he is intended here as the driver of the oxen because he drives them and makes them work.

original: “sārathī”ti adhippeto. Ekābandhananti ekābaddhakaraṇaṃ. Sakakicceti sakakiccena yutte.
analyzed: sārathiḥ iti adhippetaḥ ekābandhanam ti ekābaddha karaṇam saka kiccā iti saka kiccena yutte
translated: “The single harness” : the single yoke. “In its own work” : in its own function.

original: Tena hi īsādīsu yathārahaṃ bandhitvā ekābaddhesu katesu naṅgalesu kiccaṃ ijjhati,
analyzed: tena hi īsā ādīsu yathāraham bandhitvā ekābaddhesu katesu naṅgalesu kiccam ijjhati
translated: For when the ploughman has yoked the oxen to the plough in the proper way, then the work is done by the oxen;🔽it is not done otherwise. Therefore it is said that he “makes it work in its own work.”

original: no aññathāti taṃ “sakakicce paṭipādetī”ti vuttaṃ. Avikkhepasabhāvenāti attano avikkhepasabhāvena.
analyzed: no aññathā ti tam saka kicce paṭipādeti iti vuttam avikkhepa sabhāvena ati attanaḥ avikkhepa sabhāvena
translated: “By its own nature of non-distraction” : by its own nature of non- distraction.

original: Bandhitvāti sahajātādipaccayabhāvena attanā sambandhitvā. Sakakicceti hirīādīhi yathāsakaṃ kattabbe kicce.
analyzed: bandhitvā iti sahajāta ādi paccaya bhāvena attanā sambandhitvā saka kiccā iti hirī ādīhi yathāsakam kattabbe kicce
translated: “Having yoked” : having connected it with itself by the condition of conascence, etc. “In its own work” : in the work to be done by shame, etc., each in its own way.

original: Cirakatādimatthanti cirabhāsitampi atthaṃ. Sarati anussarati kāyādiṃ asubhādito nijjhāyati.
analyzed: cirakata ādim atthanti cira bhāsitam pi attham sarati anussarati kāya ādim asubha āditaḥ nijjhāyati
translated: “The meaning of what was said long ago” is the meaning of what was spoken long ago. “He remembers, recalls” is the same as “he recollects.” “He contemplates” is the same as “he looks on” .

original: Phāletīti padāleti. Pājenti gamentīti taṃ pājanaṃ. Idha imasmiṃ sutte “pācana”nti
analyzed: phāleti iti padāleti pājenti gamenti iti tam pājanam idha imasmin sutte
translated: “He splits” is the same as “he breaks up.” “They break up” is the same as “they go.” “Breaking up” is the same as “going.” Here in this sutta the word “breaking up” is said to be “cooking” .

original: vuttaṃ ja-kārassa ca-kāraṃ katvā. Phālapācananti imamatthaṃ dassetuṃ “yathā hi brāhmaṇa…pe…
analyzed: vuttam jakārassa cakāram katvā phālapācanam ti imam attham dassetum yathā hi brāhmaṇape
translated: Having made the “ja” into “ca,” “cooking” is said to be “breaking up.” In order to show this meaning, “Just as, brahmin, …

original: satī”ti vuttaṃ. Idāni tamatthaṃ vitthārato dassento “tattha yathā”tiādimāha. Naṅgalaṃ🔽anurakkhati bhijjanaphālanato. Purato cassa gacchatīti assa naṅgalassa kassane bhūmiyā
analyzed: sati iti vuttam idāni tam attham vitthārataḥ dassentaḥ tattha yathā iti ādim āha naṅgalam  anurakkhati bhijjana phālanato puratas ca ssa gacchati iti assa naṅgalassa kassane bhūmiyā
translated: mindfulness” is said. Now, in order to show that meaning in detail, “Herein, just as” is said. The ploughman protects the plough from breaking up and splitting.

original: vilikhane purato gacchati pubbaṅgamā hoti. Gatiyoti pavattiyo. Samanvesamānāti saraṇavasena
analyzed: vilikhane puratas gacchati pubbaṅgamā hoti gatiyaḥ iti samanvesamānā ati saraṇa vasena
translated: And it goes in front of him. Thus, in ploughing the land, the plough goes in front of the ploughman and is his forerunner. “Its going” is the same as “its movement.” “Seeking” is the same as “searching.”

original: gavesamānā. Ārammaṇe vā kāyādike upaṭṭhāpayamānā asubhādivasena paññānaṅgalaṃ rakkhati.
analyzed: gavesamānā ārammaṇe vā kāya ādike upaṭṭhāpayamānā asubha ādi vasena paññā anaṅgalam rakkhati
translated: Looking for it by way of refuge, or placing it as an object in the body, etc., he protects the plough of wisdom by way of the foul, etc.

original: Sabhāvāsabhāvūpagame phālo viya naṅgalassa “ārakkhā”ti vuttā “sabbānatthato sati
analyzed: sabhāva asabhāva upagame phālaḥ viya naṅgalassa ārakkhā ati vuttā sabba anatthataḥ sati
