translated: “Protection” is said to be like the plough’s “share” in the sense of the plough’s “share” in the sense of the plough’s “share” in the sense of the plough’s “share” in the sense of the plough’s “share” in the sense of the plough’s “share” in the sense of the plough’s “share” in the sense of the plough’s “share” in the sense of the plough’s “share” in the sense of the plough’s “share” in the sense of the plough’s “share” in the sense of the plough’s “share” in the sense of the plough’s “share” in the sense of the plough’s “share” in the sense of the plough’s “share” in the sense of the plough’s “share” in the sense of the plough’s “share” in the sense of the plough’s “share” in the sense of the plough’s “share” in the sense of the plough’s “share” in the sense of the plough’s “share” in the sense of the plough

original: rakkhatī”ti katvā. Tathā hesā ārakkhapaccupaṭṭhānā. Cirakatacirabhāsitānaṃ asammussanavasena
analyzed: rakkhati iti katvā tathā ha isā ārakkha paccupaṭṭhānā cirakata cira bhāsitānam a sammussana vasena
translated: And it is so because it is the non-forgetting of what was done long ago and said long ago.🔽It is in front of the ploughshare of understanding, is what is said.🔽To show its being in front he said,

original: sati paññānaṅgalassa purato hotīti vatvā tassa puratobhāvaṃ dassetuṃ “sati…pe… no
analyzed: sati paññānaṅgalassa puratas hoti iti vatvā tassa puratobhāvam dassetum satipe no
translated: “When mindfulness is present …🔽it is not confused.”

original: pamuṭṭhe”ti āha. Satipariciteti satiyā paṭṭhāpite. “Upaṭṭhāpite”tipi pāṭho, ayamevattho.
analyzed: pamuṭṭhā iti āha sati paricitā iti satiyā paṭṭhāpite upaṭṭhāpitā iti pi pāṭhaḥ ayam eva atthaḥ
translated: “Established by mindfulness”: set up by mindfulness. The reading “established” is the same in meaning as “set up.”

original: Saṃsīdituṃ na detīti sakiccakiriyāya saṃsīdanaṃ kātuṃ na deti. Kosajjasaṅkhātaṃ saṃsīdanaṃ kosajjasaṃsīdanaṃ.
analyzed: saṃsīditum na deti iti sa kicca kiriyāya saṃsīdanam kātum na deti kosajja saṅkhātam saṃsīdanam kosajja saṃsīdanam
translated: “Does not give it scope to lie down”: it does not give it scope to lie down in its own function. The lying down called “lying down in idleness” is “lying down in idleness.”

original: Pātimokkhasaṃvarasīlaṃ vuttaṃ kāyikavācasikasaṃyamassa kathitattā. Āhāre udare yatoti
analyzed: pātimokkha saṃvara sīlam vuttam kāyika vācasika saṃyamassa kathita ttā āhāre udare yatas ti
translated: The virtue of restraint by the Pāṭimokkha has already been stated because the restraint of body and speech has already been stated.🔽“In food and in the belly he is moderate”

original: paribhuñjitabbaāhāre saṃyatabhāvadassanena paribhuñjitabbatāya catūsupi paccayesu
analyzed: paribhuñjitabba āhāre saṃyata bhāva dassanena paribhuñjitabba tāya catūsu pi paccayesu
translated: . By showing moderation in the food that should be eaten, moderation in the four requisite-conditions is shown.

original: saṃyatabhāvo dīpitoti āha “āhāramukhenā”tiādi. Saṃyatabhāvo cettha paccayahetu anesanābhāvoti
analyzed: saṃyata bhāvaḥ dīpitaḥ iti āha āhāra mukhena atiādi saṃyata bhāvo ca ittha paccaya hetu anesanābhāvo ti
translated: So he said “By the means of food” and so on. And here moderation is the cause of the requisite-condition and the absence of seeking.

original: vuttaṃ “nirupakkilesoti attho”ti. Bhojanasaddo āhāraparibhoge niruḷhoti katvā vuttaṃ
analyzed: vuttam nirupakkilesaḥ ti attho ti bhojana saddo āhāra paribhoge niruḷho ti katvā vuttam
translated: The meaning is “without defilement.” The word “food” is well known as a term for the enjoyment of nutriment, thus it is said:

original: “bhojane mattaññutāmukhenā”ti. Paribhuñjanaṭṭhena pana bhojanasaddamukhenāti vutte🔽adhippetattho labbhateva. Tenāti kāyaguttātiādivacanena. Na vilumpantīti “dīpetī”ti
analyzed: bhojane mattaññu tā mukhena ati paribhuñjana aṭṭhena pana bhojana sadda mukhena ati vutte  adhippeta tthaḥ labbhate iva tena ati kāyaguttā ati ādi vacanena na vilumpanti iti dīpeti iti
translated: “By the means of moderation in food.” But if it is said by the means of the word “food” in the sense of enjoyment,

original: padaṃ ānetvā sambandho.
analyzed: padam ānetvā sambandhaḥ
translated: then the intended meaning is still obtained. “By that” means by the words “guarding of the body,” etc. “They do not plunder” is connected with the word “show.”

original: Dvīhākārehīti adiṭṭhādīnaṃ adiṭṭhādivasena diṭṭhādīnañca diṭṭhādivasenāti evaṃ dvippakārehi.🔽Avisaṃvādanaṃ avitathakathanaṃ. Chedanaṃ mūlappadese nikantanaṃ. Lunanaṃ yattha katthaci🔽chedanaṃ. Uppāṭanaṃ ummūlanaṃ. Asitenāti dattena, lāyitenāti attho. Visaṃvādanasaṅkhātānaṃ
analyzed: dvīhā ākārehi iti adiṭṭha ādīnam adiṭṭha ādi vasena diṭṭha ādīnam ca diṭṭha ādi vasena ati evam dvippakārehi  avisaṃvādanam avitatha kathanam chedanam mūla ppadese nikantanam lunanam yattha katthaci  chedanam uppāṭanam ummūlanam asitena ati dattena lāyitena ati atthaḥ visaṃvādana saṅkhātānam
translated: “By the two modes” means by the two modes of the unperceived, etc., as unperceived, etc., and of the perceived, etc., as perceived, etc.

original: tiṇānaṃ, aṭṭhannaṃ anariyavohārānanti attho. Yathābhūtañāṇanti nāma rūpaparicchedakañāṇaṃ.
analyzed: tiṇānam aṭṭhannam anariya vohārānam ti atthaḥ yathā bhūta ñāṇam ti nāma rūpa paricchedaka ñāṇam
translated: “Non-deception” is the speaking of truth. “Cutting” is cutting at the root. “Stripping” is cutting anywhere. “Uprooting” is pulling out. “With the unsharp” means with the blunt, the meaning is with the dull. “The deceptive” means the deceptive grasses, the meaning is the eight worldly conditions. “Knowledge of actuality” is the knowledge that defines mentality and materiality.

original: Saccanti veditabbaṃ aviparītavuttikattā “chedakaṃ” chindanakaṃ. Niddānanti niddāyakaṃ.
analyzed: saccanti veditabbam aviparīta vuttikattā chedakam chindanakam niddānanti niddāyakam
translated: “Truth” is to be understood as the correct way of speaking. “Cutting off” is cutting away. “Source” is that which causes to flow.🔽This very truth is the truth of view, called “the truth of view” .

original: Idameva saccaṃ moghamaññanti diṭṭhi “diṭṭhisacca”nti vuccati. Dvīsu vikappesūti bhāvakattusādhanavasena🔽dvīsu vikappesu. “Niddāna”nti upayogavaseneva attho.
analyzed: idam eva saccam mogha maññanti diṭṭhi diṭṭhi saccanti vuccati dvīsu vikappesu iti bhāva kattu sādhana vasena  dvīsu vikappesu niddānam ti upayoga vasena iva attho
translated: In the two kinds of speculation, in the two kinds of speculation by way of establishing the state of being.🔽“Source” is the meaning by way of utilization.

original: Sīlameva “soracca”nti vuttaṃ “pāṇātipātādīhi suṭṭhu oratassa kamma”nti katvā. Saṅkhāradukkhādīnaṃ🔽abhāvato sundarabhāvato sundare nibbāne ārammaṇakaraṇavasena ratattā surato, arahā.
analyzed: sīlam eva soraccanti vuttam pāṇa atipāta ādīhi suṭṭhu oratassa kammanti katvā saṅkhāra dukkha ādīnam  abhāvataḥ sundara bhāvataḥ sundare nibbāne ārammaṇa karaṇa vasena rata ttā su rataḥ arahā
translated: Morality is called “gentleness” because it is the action of one who is well-tamed by refraining from killing living beings, etc.🔽Because of the absence of the suffering of formations, etc., and because of the beautiful state, the beautiful Nibbāna is “delight” because of the making of it an object. The Arahant is “one who delights in” that Nibbāna.

original: Tassa bhāvo soraccaṃ, arahattaṃ. Appamocanameva accantāya pamocanaṃ na hoti.🔽Yadaggena vipassanāya paññāya taṃsahagatavīriyassa ca naṅgaladhorayhatā, tathāpavattakusalabhāvanāya
analyzed: tassa bhāvaḥ soraccam arahattam appamocanam eva accantāya pamocanam na hoti  yad aggena vipassanāya paññāya tad sahagata vīriyassa ca naṅgala dhorayha tā tathā pavatta kusala bhāvanāya
translated: His state is “gentleness,” Arahantship. “Liberation” is not the highest kind of liberation.🔽The ploughshare of the plough of wisdom and the energy associated with it is the cause of the plough of the development of profitable states that occurs in that way.

original: ca kasibhāvo ca, tadaggena tato puretaraṃ pavattapaññāvīriyapāramīnaṃ naṅgaladhorayhatā,
analyzed: ca kasi bhāvo ca tad aggena tatas puretaram pavatta paññā vīriya pāramīnam
translated: The state of being a ploughman is the ploughshare of the perfection of wisdom and energy that occurred earlier than that.

original: tathāpavattakusalabhāvanāya ca kasibhāvo veditabboti dassento “yathā hī”tiādimāha.
analyzed: tathā apavatta kusala bhāvanāya ca kasi bhāvaḥ veditabbaḥ ti dassentaḥ yathā hi itiādim āha
translated: and the state of a ploughman should be understood as the development of profitable action occurring in that way. Showing this, he said “As a ploughman” ,

original: Dhuraṃ vahatīti dhorayhaṃ. Yathāvuttaṃ ghananti asmimānādibhedaṃ ghanaṃ. Vahitabbā
analyzed: dhuram vahati iti dhorayham yathāvuttam ghananti asmimāna ādi bhedam ghanam vahitabbā
translated: “Bearing the yoke” : the yoke is what is borne. The “yoke” is the burden that is borne.

original: ādibhūtā dhurā etesaṃ atthīti dhurā, purimadhuravāhakā. Taṃmūlakā aparaṃ dhuraṃ vahantā
analyzed: ādi bhūtāḥ dhurāḥ etesam atthi iti dhurā aparam dhuram vahantā
translated: They have a burden that is the beginning of what is to be borne, thus they are “burden-bearers” . They are the ploughmen who bear the yoke previously. Bearing a further yoke rooted in that,

original: dhorayhā. Dhurā ca dhorayhā ca dhuradhorayhaṃ ekattavasena. Vahantanti kasanena pavattantaṃ.
analyzed: dhorayhā dhurā ca dhorayhā ca dhura dhorayham ekatta vasena vahantanti kasanena pavattantam
translated: they are “yoke-bearers” . The yoke and the yoke-bearer are the yoke-bearer and the yoke as a unity. “Bearing” is occurring by ploughing.

original: Kāmayogādīhi yogehi khemattā anupaddavattā. Taṃ nibbānaṃ adhikicca uddissa. Vāhīyati🔽vipassanāya sahagataṃ. Abhimukhaṃ vāhīyati maggapariyāpannaṃ. Khettakoṭinti khettamariyādaṃ.🔽Diṭṭhekaṭṭheti diṭṭhiyā sahajātekaṭṭhe pahānekaṭṭhe ca. Oḷāriketi uparimaggavajjhe
analyzed: kāmayoga ādīhi yogehi khema ttā anupaddava ttā tam nibbānam adhikicca uddissa vāhīyati  vipassanāya sahagatam abhimukham vāhīyati magga pariyāpannam khetta koṭinti khetta mariyādam  diṭṭhekaṭṭhā iti diṭṭhiyā sahajāta ekaṭṭhe pahāna ekaṭṭhe ca oḷārikā iti upari magga vajjhe
translated: Because of the safety from the yokes of sense desire, etc., and because of the absence of danger, that Nibbāna is what is borne,🔽is borne in association with insight. Or it is borne in the face of , that is, it is borne by what is included in the path. “The boundary of the field” is the limit of the field.🔽“The gross” is said with reference to what is abandoned by seeing and what is abandoned by development, otherwise those abandonable by seeing would be gross in comparison with those abandonable by the second path. “The subtle” is said

original: upādāya vuttaṃ, aññathā dassanapahātabbāpi dutiyamaggavajjhehi oḷārikāti. Aṇusahagateti
analyzed: upādāya vuttam aññathā dassana pahātabbā api dutiya magga vajjhehi oḷārikā ati aṇu sahagatā iti
translated: with reference to what is abandonable by the second path and what is abandonable by the third path.

original: aṇubhūte. Idaṃ heṭṭhimamaggavajjhe upādāya vuttaṃ. Sabbakilese avasiṭṭhasabbakilese
analyzed: aṇu bhūte idam heṭṭhima magga vajjhe upādāya vuttam sabba kilese avasiṭṭha sabba kilese
translated: In the destruction of all defilements, in the abandoning of all that remains of the defilements,🔽it goes on without turning back, because there is no more to be abandoned.

original: pajahantaṃ anivattantaṃ gacchati puna pahātabbatāya abhāvato. Anivattantanti na nivattantaṃ,
analyzed: pajahantam a nivattantam gacchati puna pahātabba tāya abhāvataḥ na nivattantam
translated: “Without turning back” means not turning back;

original: yathā nivattanaṃ na hoti, evaṃ gacchatīti attho. Tenāha “nivattanarahita”ntiādi.
analyzed: yathā nivattanam na hoti evam gacchati iti tena āha nivattana rahita ntiādi
translated: the meaning is that it goes on in such a way that there is no turning back. Therefore it is said, “without turning back” and so on.

original: Etaṃ pana tava dhuradhorayhaṃ.
analyzed: etam pana tava dhuradhorayham
translated: This is your ploughshare,

original: Evamesā kasīti yathāvuttassa paccāmasanaṃ. Tenāha “nigamanaṃ karonto”ti. Vuttasseva
analyzed: evam esā kasī iti yathā vuttassa paccāmasanam tena āha nigamanam karonto ti vuttassa eva
translated: Thus this is the ploughing. This is the conclusion of what was said above. Therefore it is said, “he concludes.”🔽For the statement of a meaning already stated is a conclusion.🔽Having struck the ploughshare of mindfulness with the goad of wisdom,

original: hi atthassa puna vacanaṃ. Paññānaṅgalena satiphālaṃ ākoṭetvāti paññāsaṅkhātena naṅgalena🔽saddhiṃ satiphālassa ekābaddhabhāvakaraṇena ākoṭetvā. Kaṭṭhāti ettha “kasī”ti padaṃ
analyzed: hi atthassa puna vacanam paññā anaṅgalena sati phālam ākoṭetvā ti paññā saṅkhātena naṅgalena  saddhim sati phālassa ekābaddha bhāva karaṇena ākoṭetvā ettha padam
translated: having struck the ploughshare of mindfulness together with the goad of wisdom,🔽having made them one,🔽The ploughing is the wood. Here the word “ploughing” should be brought in and connected with the word “wood” to make the compound “ploughing-wood.”

original: ānetvā sambandhitabbaṃ “kaṭṭhā kasī”ti. Kammapariyosānanti yathāvuttakasikammassa
analyzed: ānetvā sambandhitabbam kaṭṭhā kasī iti kamma pariyosānam ti yathāvutta kasi kammassa
translated: The end of the work is the end of the ploughing described above.

original: pariyosānabhūtaṃ. Yadipi pubbe “paññā me yuganaṅgala”ntiādinā attuddesikavasenāyaṃ🔽amatapphalā kasi dassitā, mahākāruṇikassa pana bhagavato desanā sabbassapi sattanikāyassa
analyzed: pariyosāna bhūtam yadi pi pubbe paññā me yuga naṅga lanti ādinā attuddesika vasena ayam  amata phalā kasi dassitā mahā kāruṇikassa pana bhagavataḥ desanā sabbassa api satta nikāyassa
translated: Although the Blessed One has previously shown the ploughing of the Deathless Fruit as a ploughing of his own self by the words “Wisdom is my plough and goad” ,

original: sādhāraṇā evāti dassento “sā kho panesā”tiādimāha.
analyzed: sādhāraṇā eva ati dassento sā kho pana isā iti ādim āha
translated: nevertheless, in order to show that the Blessed One’s teaching is common to all beings, he says “But this ploughing” , etc.🔽On that very day: on that very day.

original: Divaseyevāti taṃdivase eva. Ādimāhāti ettha ādi-saddena kathāpariyosāne pāṭhapadeso gahitoti tadaññaṃ “evaṃ vutte”tiādipāṭhaṃ sandhāya “tato parañcā”ti āha.
analyzed: divase iya iva ati taṃ divase eva ādim āha ati ettha ādi saddena kathā pariyosāne pāṭha padeso gahito ti tad aññam evam vutta iti ādi pāṭham sandhāya tatas param ca iti āha
translated: The words “and so on” should be understood to refer to the words “When this was said” , etc., which are other than the words included in the phrase “and so on” in the words “and so on beginning with ‘on that very day’” .

original: Kasibhāradvājasuttavaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: kasi bhāradvāja sutta vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: The commentary on the Kasibharadvaja Sutta is finished.

original: 2. Udayasuttavaṇṇanā
analyzed: udaya sutta vaṇṇanā
translated: The Udaya Sutta is finished.

original: 198. Etaṃ vuttanti “odanena pūresī”ti etaṃ vacanaṃ vuttaṃ. “Gahetuṃ samattho nāma🔽nāhosīti bhagavato adhiṭṭhānabalenā”ti vadanti. Taṃ brāhmaṇaṃ vinetukāmatāya kira
analyzed: etam vuttanti odanena pūresi iti etam vacanam vuttam gahetum samatthaḥ nāma  bhagavataḥ adhiṭṭhāna balena ati vadanti tam brāhmaṇam vinetu kāma tāya kira
translated: This was said: this statement “You have filled it with rice” was said.🔽They say that he was not able to take it because of the Blessed One’s power of resolve.

original: bhagavā tathā akāsi.
analyzed: bhagavā tathā akāsi
translated: It was, they say, in order to discipline that brahmin that the Blessed One did so.

original: Upārambhabhayenāti parūpavādabhayena. Avatvāva nivatto “abbhāgatopi pāsaṇḍo vācāmattenapi🔽na pūjetabbo”ti brāhmaṇadhamme vuttattā. Pakkantoti brāhmaṇassa dhammaṃ avatvā pakkanto🔽brāhmaṇassa na tāva ñāṇaṃ paripakkanti. Etaṃ vacanaṃ…pe… magamāsi “punappunañceva
analyzed: upārambha bhayena ati parūpavāda bhayena avatvā ava nivattaḥ abbhāgataḥ pi pāsaṇḍaḥ vācāmattena api  na pūjetabbaḥ iti brāhmaṇa dhamme vutta ttā pakkanto ti brāhmaṇassa dhammaṃ avatvā pakkanto  brāhmaṇassa na tāva ñāṇam paripakkam ti etam vacanam pe punappunar ca eva
translated: Out of fear of censure: out of fear of dispraise. And he turned back without having taught him, thinking: “Even though he has come, a heretic should not be honoured even by a mere word, since it is said in the brahminical doctrine that a brahmin should not eat the food given by a heretic.” He went away: he went away without having taught the brahmin.

original: vapanti bīja”ntiādinā dhammaṃ kathetuṃ avassaṃ ākaṅkhanto. Pakārato kassatīti pakaṭṭhako,
analyzed: vapanti bījanti ādinā dhammam kathetum avassam ākaṅkhanto pakārato kassati iti pakaṭṭhakaḥ
translated: The brahmin’s knowledge is not yet ripe: the brahmin’s understanding is not yet mature. This statement … he went away: he went away thinking: “I will have to teach the Dhamma to the brahmin beginning with the words ‘Again and again they sow the seed’ and so on.”

original: rasataṇhāya pakaṭṭhoti attho. Tenāha “rasagiddho”ti.
analyzed: rasa taṇhāya pakaṭṭhaḥ ti attho tena āha rasa giddhaḥ iti
translated: He is a farmer because he ploughs : he is a ploughman. The meaning is: he is devoted to craving for tastes. Hence it is said: “he was greedy for tastes.”

original: “Punappunañceva vapanti bīja”nti imaṃ desanaṃ ārabhīti sambandho. Bījanti ca iti-saddo
analyzed: punappunam ca iva vapanti bījanti imam desanam ārabhi iti sambandhaḥ bījanti ca iti saddaḥ
translated: The connection is this: he began this teaching beginning with the words “Again and again they sow the seed.” And the word “seed”

original: nidassanattho vā. Tena avayavena samudāyaṃ nidasseti. Osakkasīti saṅkocasi. Vuttanti
analyzed: nidassana atthaḥ vā tena avayavena samudāyam nidasseti osakkasi iti vuttam ti
translated: is a demonstrative word. By it he demonstrates the whole by a part. You are contracting: you are shrinking. Sown: planted.

original: vapanaṃ kataṃ. Tasmā vuttaṃ “alamettāvatā”ti. “Vassitvā”ti vuṭṭhiṃ pavattetvā.
analyzed: vapanam katam tasmā vuttam alam ettāvatā ati vassitvā iti vuṭṭhim pavattetvā
translated: Therefore it is said: “That is enough.” Having rained: having caused the rain to fall.

original: Desanā…pe… dasseti brāhmaṇena vuttaṃ ayuttavacanaṃ parivaṭṭentopi divase divase bhikkhācariyā
analyzed: desanāpe dasseti brāhmaṇena vuttam ayutta vacanam parivaṭṭentaḥ api divase divase bhikkhā cariyā
translated: The Teaching … He shows that the statement made by the brahmin is an improper statement. Even though he turns it back, he goes out for alms every day.🔽The going out for alms is the bhikkhus’ way of life.

original: nāma bhikkhūnaṃ kāyagatā vuttīti. Khīraṃ hatthena nayantīti vā khīranikā. Kilamatīti
analyzed: nāma bhikkhūnam kāya gatā vutti iti khīram hatthena nayanti iti vā khīranikā kilamati iti
translated: The milk-drinkers are those who suck milk from the breast with their hands.🔽He is exhausted by the performance of this and that task.🔽He is agitated by the association with what is unprofitable.

original: taṃtaṃkiccakaraṇavasena khijjati. Phandatīti anatthasamāyogavasena vipphandati. Apunabbhavāyāti
analyzed: taṃ taṃ kicca karaṇa vasena khijjati phandati iti anattha samāyoga vasena vipphandati apunabbhavāya ati
translated: For the non-arising of renewed existence.

original: āyatiṃ anuppattiyā. Maggo nāmāti upāyo nāma nibbānaṃ, tasmiṃ laddhe punabbhavābhāvato.🔽“Punappuna”nti vacanaṃ upādāya bījavapanādayo punappunadhammā nāma jātāti āha “soḷasa
analyzed: āyatim anuppattiyāḥ maggaḥ nāma ati upāyaḥ nāma nibbānam tasmin laddhe punabbhava abhāvato  punappunanti vacanam upādāya bīja vapana ādayaḥ punappuna dhammāḥ nāma jātā ati āha soḷasa
translated: The path is the means to Nibbāna. When that is obtained, there is no renewed existence.🔽“Again and again” is a term for the sixteen steps in the dependent origination, which are the things that occur again and again, beginning with the sowing of the seed.

original: punappunadhamme desentenā”ti.
analyzed: punappuna dhamme desentena ati
translated: Therefore it is said: “while teaching the sixteen things that occur again and again.”

original: Udayasuttavaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: udaya sutta vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: The explanation of the Udaya Sutta is ended.

original: 3. Devahitasuttavaṇṇanā
analyzed: deva hita sutta vaṇṇanā
translated: The Devahita Sutta

original: 199. Udaravātehīti vātakatavijjhanatodanādivasena aparāparaṃ vattamānehi udaravātehi,
analyzed: udara vātehi iti vāta kata vijjhana todana ādi vasena apara aparam vattamānehi udara vātehi
translated: By the stomach winds: by the stomach winds that occur now here, now there, by the pricking and piercing, etc.,🔽or by the changes in them. But at the time of the regular preaching of the Dhamma he is like the Dhamma treasurer.

original: tassa vā vikārehi. Nibaddhupaṭṭhākakāle pana dhammabhaṇḍāgārikova. Araññanti bhagavato
analyzed: tassa vā vikārehi nibaddha upaṭṭhāka kāle pana dhammabhaṇḍāgārikā uva araññanti bhagavataḥ
translated: In the forest: in the Blessed One’s forest.

original: bhikkhūnañca vasanaṭṭhānabhūtaṃ tapovanaṃ. Taṃ niddhūmaṃ hoti udakatāpanassapi akaraṇato.
analyzed: bhikkhūnam ca vasana ṭṭhāna bhūtam tapovanam tam niddhūmam hoti udaka tāpanassa api a karaṇato
translated: and the forest was his dwelling place as a bhikkhu. It was smoke-free because he did not even make a fire for heating water.

original: Tasmāti yasmā tassa uṇhodakavikkiṇanacariyāya jīvikākappanaṃ hoti, tasmā.🔽Vattametaṃ tassa patikāratthaṃ parikathādīnampi kātuṃ labbhanato. Idāni tattha kāraṇampi
analyzed: tasmā iti yasmā tassa uṇha udaka vikkiṇana cariyāya jīvikā kappanam hoti tasmā  vattam etam tassa patikāra attham parikathā ādīnam pi kātum labbhanataḥ idāni tattha kāraṇam pi
translated: Therefore: since his livelihood was dependent on his practice of pouring hot water over himself,

original: savisayaṃ dassetuṃ “vaṇṇaṃ hī”tiādi vuttaṃ. Bhagavā hi āyasmato upavāṇassa devahitabrāhmaṇassa
analyzed: sa visayam dassetum vaṇṇam hi itiādi vuttam bhagavā hi āyasmataḥ upavāṇassa deva hita brāhmaṇassa
translated: this is the proper course for him to follow. It is permissible for him to make a roundabout speech, etc., in order to repay the other’s kindness. Now, in order to show the reason for this, it is said: “He would be praised” , etc. For the Blessed One knew that the brahmin would be honoured by the young deity,

original: taṃ sambhāvitaṃ bhavissati tikicchāpaṭiyattaṃ, tāya ca attano rogassa vūpasamanaṃ,
analyzed: tam sambhāvitam bhavissati tikicchā paṭiyattam tāya ca attanaḥ rogassa vūpasamanam
translated: that he would be attended upon by him, that his own illness would be cured by that,

original: tappasaṅgena ca devahitabrāhmaṇo mama santikaṃ āgantvā dhammassavanena saraṇesu sīlesu
analyzed: tad pasaṅgena ca deva hita brāhmaṇaḥ mama santikam āgantvā dhammassavanena saraṇesu sīlesu
translated: and that the brahmin would come to him because of his austerities, and that by listening to the Dhamma he would find refuge in the Triple Gem and establish himself in virtue.

original: ca patiṭṭhahissatīti sabbamidaṃ ñatvā evaṃ “iṅgha me tvaṃ, upavāṇa, uṇhodakaṃ jānāhī”ti
analyzed: ca patiṭṭhahissati iti sabbam idam ñatvā evam me tvam upavāṇa uṇha udakam jānāhi iti
translated: Knowing all this, he said: “Come, Upavana, get me some hot water.”

original: avoca. Āgamanīyappaṭipadaṃ pubbabhāgappaṭipadaṃ pubbabhāgappaṭipattiṃ kathetuṃ vaṭṭati
analyzed: avoca āgamanīya ppaṭipadam pubbabhāga ppaṭipadam pubbabhāga ppaṭipattim kathetum vaṭṭati
translated: It is proper to speak of the way of coming, the way of the past, the practice of the past,

original: anuttarimanussadhammattā. Sadevakena lokenāti anavasesato lokassa gahaṇaṃ. Phalavisesākaṅkhāya
analyzed: anuttari manussa dhamma ttā sa devakena lokena ati anavasesataḥ lokassa gahaṇam phala visesa ākaṅkhāya
translated: because of its being the unsurpassed state of a human being. ‘By the world with its gods’: this is a comprehensive expression for the world.

original: pūjetabbāti pūjanīyā, te eva idha “pūjaneyyā”ti vuttā. Tathā ādarena pūjetabbatāya🔽sakkāriyā, ā-kārassa rassattaṃ, ri-saddassa ca re-ādesaṃ katvā “sakkareyyā”ti vuttaṃ.
analyzed: pūjetabbā ati pūjanīyā te eva idha pūjaneyyā iti vuttā tathā ādarena pūjetabba tāya  sakkāriyā ākārassa rassa ttam ri saddassa ca re ādesam katvā sakkareyyā ti vuttam
translated: ‘To be worshipped’: ‘worthy of worship’ is what is meant. ‘To be revered’: ‘worthy of reverence’ is what is meant. ‘To be honoured’: ‘worthy of honour’ is what is meant.🔽‘To be worshipped’ is said with the elision of the ya of the gerundive and the substitution of re for ā in the verbal root.🔽‘To be revered’ is said with the elision of the ya of the gerundive and the substitution of ka for ā in the verbal root.

original: “Apacayeyyā”ti vattabbe ya-kāralopaṃ katvā “apaceyyā”ti vuttaṃ. Tesanti sadevakena
analyzed: apacayeyya iti vattabbe yakāra lopam katvā apaceyya iti vuttam tesanti sa devakena
translated: ‘To be honoured’ is said with the elision of the ya of the gerundive and the substitution of ce for ā in the verbal root.

original: pūjaneyyādīnaṃ. Haritunti netuṃ.
analyzed: pūjaneyyā ādīnam haritunti netum
translated: ‘Them’: the ‘worthy of worship’ and so on. ‘To lead’: to lead away.

original: Ettakenapīti upasaṅkamanādinā ettakena appamattakenapi katavattena ayaṃ kitti…pe… somanassajāto.
analyzed: ettakena api iti upasaṅkamana ādinā ettakena appamattakena api katavattena ayam kittipe somanassa jāto
translated: ‘Even by this much’: even by this little, namely, by the act of approaching and so on. ‘He has done what is to be done’: he has done what is to be done by way of the act of approaching and so on. ‘He has made an end of rebirth’: he has made an end of the round of rebirths.

original: Yajamānassāti deyyadhammaṃ dentassa. Dakkhiṇāya ijjhanaṃ nāma vipulaphalabhāvoti
analyzed: yajamānassa ati deyya dhammam dentassa dakkhiṇāya ijjhanam nāma vipula phala bhāvo ti
translated: ‘The giver of gifts’: the one who gives the gift. ‘The success of the offering’: the great fruitfulness of the offering.

original: āha “mahapphalo hotī”ti. Viditanti paṭividdhapaccakkhakataṃ. Ājānātīti vutthabhavādiṃ
analyzed: āha mahapphalaḥ hoti iti viditanti paṭividdha paccakkha katam ājānāti iti vuttha bhava ādiṃ
translated: ‘He has great fruit’: he has great fruitfulness. ‘He knows’: he has known by direct experience. ‘He understands’: he understands the state of having arisen and so on.

original: pariyādāya jānāti paṭivijjhati. Jānitvāti cattāri saccāni maggapaṭipāṭiyā paṭivijjhitvā.
analyzed: pariyādāya jānāti paṭivijjhati jānitvā ati cattāri saccāni magga paṭipāṭiyā paṭivijjhitvā
translated: He knows and penetrates by way of the four Truths in the order in which they are discovered.

original: Aggappattatāya katakiccataṃ patto. Brāhmaṇena attanā kato kāro ca bhagavato eva paccupaṭṭhātīti
analyzed: agga ppatta tāya pattaḥ brāhmaṇena attanā kato kāro ca bhagavataḥ eva paccupaṭṭhāti iti
translated: He has reached the state of having done what was to be done by having reached the peak. The sacrifice which the brahmin himself has made is established in the Blessed One.

original: taṃ dassento “iminā khīṇāsave yajanākārena yajantassā”ti vuttaṃ.
analyzed: tam dassentaḥ iminā khīṇāsave yajana ākārena yajantassa iti vuttam
translated: Showing that, it is said: “By this sacrifice of one who has no more craving, one who sacrifices.”

original: Devahitasuttavaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: deva hita sutta vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: The explanation of the Devahita Sutta is finished.

original: 4. Mahāsālasuttavaṇṇanā
analyzed: mahāsāla sutta vaṇṇanā
translated: The Great Hall of Dhamma Sutta

original: 200. Yasmā tassa brāhmaṇassa anissayassa jiṇṇabhāvena visesato kāyo lūkho jāto, jiṇṇapilotikakhaṇḍehi
analyzed: yasmā tassa brāhmaṇassa anissayassa jiṇṇa bhāvena visesataḥ kāyaḥ lūkhaḥ jātaḥ jiṇṇa pilotika khaṇḍehi
translated: Because that brahmin’s body had become emaciated through old age and lack of support,

original: saṅghaṭitaṃ pāvuraṇaṃ, tasmā “lūkhapāvuraṇo”ti padassa “jiṇṇapāvuraṇo”ti attho vutto.
analyzed: saṅghaṭitam pāvuraṇam tasmā lūkha pāvuraṇaḥ ti padassa jiṇṇa pāvuraṇaḥ ti attho vutto
translated: the covering was made of old rags sewn together. Therefore the meaning of the word “lūkhapāvuraṇo” is said to be “jiṇṇapāvuraṇo.”

original: Pāṭiyekkanti puttesu ekameko ekamekāya vācāya visuṃ visuṃ.
analyzed: pāṭiyekkanti puttesu ekam ekaḥ ekam ekāya vācāya visum visum
translated: Pāṭiyekkan ti puttesu ekameko ekamekāya vācāya visuṃ visuṃ.

original: Sampucchanaṃ nāma idha sammantananti āha “saddhiṃ mantayitvā”ti. Nandissanti abhinandiṃ.
analyzed: sampucchanam nāma idha sammantananti āha saddhim mantayitvā ati nandissanti abhinandim
translated: Sampucchanaṃ nāma idha sammantananti āha “saddhiṃ mantayitvā”ti. Nandissanti abhinandiṃ.

original: Atītatthe hi idaṃ anāgatavacanaṃ. Tenāha “nandijāto…pe… ahosi”nti. Bhussantāti nibbhussanavasena ravantā.
analyzed: atīta atthe hi idam anāgata vacanam tena āha nandijāta upe ahosinti bhussantā ati nibbhussana vasena ravantā
translated: They neighed, etc.: they neighed by way of neighing out of exhaustion.🔽Having reached the last stage: having reached the last stage of life.

original: Vayogatanti pacchimavayaṃ upagataṃ. So pana yasmā purime dve vaye atikkamavasena
analyzed: vayogatanti pacchima vayam upagatam saḥ pana yasmā purime dve vaye atikkama vasena
translated: But since he had gone by way of surmounting the first two stages of life🔽and by way of surmounting a part of the last stage,

original: gato. Pacchimaṃ ekadesato atikkamanavasena, tasmā vuttaṃ – “tayo vaye gataṃ atikkantaṃ
analyzed: pacchimam eka desataḥ atikkamana vasena tasmā vuttam tayaḥ vaye gatam atikkantam
translated: it is said: “Having gone beyond the three stages of life, having surmounted the three stages of life,

original: pacchimavaye ṭhita”nti.
analyzed: pacchima vaye ṭhita nti
translated: he stood in the last stage of life” .🔽No longer serviceable: not serviceable because of old age; not to be fed.🔽They removed the fodder: they took it away from him.

original: Nipparibhogoti jiṇṇabhāvena javaparakkamahāniyā aparibhogo na bhuñjitabbo. Khādanā apanīyatīti yavasaṃ adadantā tato nīharanti nāma. Theroti vuḍḍho.
analyzed: nipparibhogaḥ ti jiṇṇa bhāvena java parakkama hāniyā a paribhogaḥ na bhuñjitabbo khādanā apanīyati iti yavasam tatas nīharanti nāma thero ti vuḍḍho
translated: The elder: the aged one.🔽Not obedient: not doing what they were told.🔽Not respectful: lacking in respect.🔽Not under control: not acting under his control.

original: Anassavāti na vacanakarā. Appatissāti patissayarahitā. Avasavattinoti na mayhaṃ vasena vattanakā. Sundarataroti upatthambhakāribhāvena sundarataro.
analyzed: anassavā ati na vacana karā appatissā ati patissaya rahitā avasavattinaḥ na mayham vasena vattanakā sundarataraḥ iti upatthambha kāri bhāvena sundarataraḥ
translated: More lovely: more lovely by reason of his being a support.

original: Puratoti upatthambhakabhāvena purato katvā. Udake patiṭṭhaṃ labhati tattha patiṭṭhato thirapatiṭṭhabhāvato. Addhapatiṭṭho hi daṇḍo daṇḍadharapurisassa patiṭṭhaṃ labhāpeti.
analyzed: puratas ti upatthambhaka bhāvena puratas katvā udake patiṭṭham labhati tattha patiṭṭhataḥ thira patiṭṭha bhāvataḥ addha patiṭṭhaḥ hi daṇḍaḥ daṇḍa dhara purisassa patiṭṭham labhāpeti
translated: “In front” : having made it in front as a support. “He finds support in the water” : because of the firmness of the support. For a stick finds support through the man who holds the stick.🔽“My brahmin women” : his own brahmin wives.

original: Brāhmaṇiyoti attano brāhmaṇiyo. Pāṭiyekkanti “asukassa gehe asukassa gehe”ti evaṃ
analyzed: brāhmaṇiyo ti attanaḥ brāhmaṇiyaḥ pāṭiyekkanti asukassa gehe asukassa gehe iti evam
translated: “In separate places” : having designated them thus: “In such and such a house, in such and such a house.”

original: uddesikaṃ katvā visuṃ visuṃ. Mā niyyādehi, amhākaṃ ruccanaṭṭhānamevāti tava puttānaṃ🔽gehesu yaṃ amhākaṃ ruccanaṭṭhānaṃ. Tatthameva gamissāmāti sabbesampi etesaṃ anuggahaṃ
analyzed: uddesikam katvā visum visum mā niyyādehi amhākam ruccana ṭṭhānam eva ati tava puttānam  gehesu yam amhākam ruccana ṭṭhānam tattham eva gamissāma ati sabbesam pi etesam anuggaham
translated: “Do not send them” : to the houses of your sons, which are agreeable to us.

original: kātukāmo bhagavā evamāha.
analyzed: kātu kāmaḥ bhagavān evam āha
translated: “We will go there” : the Blessed One said this desiring to help all of them.

original: Tato paṭṭhāyāti sotāpattiphalapaṭilābhato paṭṭhāya. Yadatthaṃ mayaṃ imassa brāhmaṇassa
analyzed: tatas paṭṭhāya ati sotāpatti phala paṭilābhataḥ paṭṭhāya yadattham mayam imassa brāhmaṇassa
translated: “From that time on” : from the time of attaining the fruit of stream-entry. “The purpose for which we have helped this brahmin

original: mahāsampattidānādinā anuggaho kato, so cassa puttaparijanassapi attho siddhoti satthā
analyzed: mahā sampatti dāna ādinā anuggahaḥ kato saḥ ca ssa putta parijanassa api attho siddhaḥ ti satthā
translated: by giving him great wealth, etc., has been accomplished for him, as well as for his sons and retinue” .

original: na sabbakālaṃ tassa brāhmaṇassa puttānaṃ gehaṃ agamāsi, te eva pana kālena kālaṃ
analyzed: na sabbakālam tassa brāhmaṇassa puttānam geham agamāsi te eva pana kālena kālam
translated: He did not always go to the house of the brahmin’s sons, but they went from time to time

original: satthu santikaṃ gantvā yathāvibhavaṃ sakkārasammānaṃ akaṃsūti adhippāyo.
analyzed: satthu santikam gantvā yathāvibhavam sakkāra sammānam akaṃsu iti adhippāyaḥ
translated: to the Teacher and paid homage to him according to their means. This is the purport.

original: Mahāsālasuttavaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: mahāsāla sutta vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: The commentary on the Mahāsāla Sutta is finished.

original: 5. Mānatthaddhasuttavaṇṇanā
translated: The Sutta on the One Stiff with Pride

original: 201. Mānena thaddhoti “ayaṃ kho”tiādinā paggahitena mānena thaddho bajjhitacitto thaddhaayosalāko viya kassacipi anonato. Na kiñci jānāti loke paṭisanthāramattassapi ajānanato.
analyzed: mānena thaddhaḥ ti ayam kho ti ādinā paggahitena mānena thaddhaḥ bajjhita citto thaddha ayosalākaḥ viya kassaci pi an onataḥ na kiñci jānāti loke paṭisanthāra mattassa api a jānanato
translated: Stiff with pride: stiff with the pride of self-conceit expressed in the words “This is mine,” his mind stiff like a stiff bamboo, he knows nothing at all in the world, not even the mere courtesy of greeting another.

original: Abbhutavittajātāti sañjātaabbhutavittā. Vittaṃ vittīti ca tuṭṭhipariyāyā. Abhūtapubbāyāti
analyzed: abbhuta vitta jātā ati sañjāta abbhuta vittā vittam vitti iti ca tuṭṭhi pariyāyā a bhūta pubbāya ati
translated: They were filled with wonder: they were filled with wonderment. “Wonder” is a synonym for “delight.” Never before:

original: yā tassā parisāya vitti tadā bhūtā, sā ito pubbe abhūtā. Tenāha “abhūta…pe… samannāgatā”ti.
analyzed: yā tassā parisāya vitti tadā bhūtā sā itas pubbe abhūtā tena āha abhūtape samannāgatā ti
translated: the wonderment of that assembly was such as it had never been before. Therefore it is said: “They were filled with wonderment, never before … possessed of” .

original: Assa puggalassāti anena puggalena. Apacitāti paramanipaccena pūjanīyasāmaññato tattha🔽attano pakkhipanaṃ idha desanākosallaṃ.
analyzed: assa puggalassa ati anena puggalena apacitā iti parama nipaccena pūjanīya sāmaññato tattha 🔽attano pakkhipanam idha desanākosallam
translated: Of that person: of that person. To honour: to honour with the highest honour, by regarding him as worthy of worship. To include himself in that: to include himself in that assembly by skill in teaching.

original: Mānatthaddhasuttavaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: mānatthaddha sutta vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: The commentary on the Mānatthaddha Sutta is finished.

original: 6. Paccanīkasuttavaṇṇanā
analyzed: paccanīka sutta vaṇṇanā
translated: The Sutta on the Opposite

original: 202. “Sabbaṃ seta”nti kenaci vutte tassa paccanīkaṃ karontasseva assa brāhmaṇassa.
analyzed: sabbam setanti kenacid vutte tassa paccanīkam karontassa iva assa brāhmaṇassa
translated: When someone says “All is white,” the brahmin is taking the opposite of that.

original: Vinetvāti vināsetvā. Suṇātīti atthoti “suṇātī”ti kiriyāpadaṃ āharitvā gāthāya attho
analyzed: vinetvā iti vināsetvā suṇāti iti suṇāti iti kiriyā padam āharitvā gāthāya
translated: Having destroyed: having annihilated. The meaning of the word “hears” is to be understood by taking the verb “hears” from the phrase “hears the meaning” and bringing it in.

original: veditabbo “jaññā subhāsita”nti vuttattā. Na hi asutvā desitaṃ jānituṃ sakkonti.
analyzed: veditabbaḥ jaññā su bhāsitanti vutta ttā na hi a sutvā desitam jānitum sakkonti
translated: For it is said “knows what is well spoken.” For they cannot know what is taught without hearing it.

original: Paccanīkasuttavaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: paccanīka sutta vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: The commentary on the Paccanīka Sutta is finished.

original: 7. Vanakammikasuttavaṇṇanā
analyzed: vanakammika sutta vaṇṇanā
translated: The Sutta on the Woodman

original: 203. Vanakamme niyutto, kiriyamānena vanakammaṃ etassa atthīti vanakammiko. Imasmiṃ
analyzed: vana kamme niyuttaḥ kiriyamānena vana kammam etassa atthi iti vanakammikaḥ imasmin
translated: He is engaged in wood-cutting work; he has wood-cutting work to do.

original: vanasaṇḍeti imasmiṃ evaṃmahante vanasaṇḍe. Na me vanasmiṃ karaṇīyamatthi yathā, “brāhmaṇa,
analyzed: vana saṇḍa iti imasmin evaṃmahante vana saṇḍe na me vanasmin karaṇīyam atthi yathā brāhmaṇa
translated: In this wood-grove: in this such a great wood-grove. The meaning is not that “I have no work to do in the wood-grove as you have, brahmin,”

original: tuyha”nti adhippāyo. Itaraṃ pana yaṃ mahākilesavanaṃ, taṃ maggañāṇapharasunā samādhimayasilāyaṃ
analyzed: adhippāyaḥ itaram pana yam mahā kilesa vanam tam magga ñāṇa pharasunā samādhi maya silāyam
translated: but rather that the great wood-grove of defilements is to be cut down with the axe of concentration consisting of the knowledge of the path.

original: sunisitena sabbaso ucchinnamūlaṃ, tato eva nibbanatho nikkilesagahano. Vivekābhiratiyā
analyzed: su nisitena sabbasas ucchinna mūlam tatas eva nibbanatho nikkilesa gahanaḥ viveka abhiratiyā
translated: well-tamed, all cut down at the root, and so free from the tangle, the thicket of defilements. Delighting in seclusion,

original: ekako abhirato paṭipakkhavigamena. Tenāha “aratiṃ…pe… jahitvā”ti.
analyzed: ekakaḥ abhirataḥ paṭipakkha vigamena tena āha aratiṃpe jahitvā iti
translated: he delights in being alone, by avoiding opposites. Hence he said: “Having abandoned discontent … ”

original: Vanakammikasuttavaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: vanakammika sutta vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: The commentary on the Vanakammika Sutta is finished.

original: 8. Kaṭṭhahārasuttavaṇṇanā
analyzed: kaṭṭhahāra sutta vaṇṇanā
translated: The commentary on the Katthahāra Sutta

original: 204. Dhammantevāsikāti kiñcipi dhanaṃ adatvā kevalaṃ antevāsikā. Tenāha “veyyāvaccaṃ
analyzed: dhamma antevāsikā ati kiñcipi dhanam a datvā kevalam antevāsikā tena āha veyyāvaccam
translated: Dhamma-pupils: pupils who give no money at all, only service. Hence it is said: “who learn a craft by doing services”

original: katvā sippuggaṇhanakā”ti. Gambhīrasabhāveti samantato dūrato gahanasacchannavipulatararukkhagacchalatāya
analyzed: katvā gambhīra sabhāvā iti samantataḥ dūratas gahana sacchanna vipulatara rukkhaga chalatāya
translated: Deeply shaded: deep in the sense of being hard to enter, because of the thick, dense, and extensive trees and creepers all around,

original: ca, tadā himapiṇḍasinnabhāvena mayūrayānehi patiṭṭhātuṃ asakkuṇeyyatāya ca gambhīrabhāve.
analyzed: ca tadā hima piṇḍa sinna bhāvena mayūra yānehi patiṭṭhātum a sakkuṇeyya tāya ca gambhīra bhāve
translated: and because of the impossibility of the peacocks alighting on it, as if it were covered with snow.

original: Bahubheraveti bahubhayānake. Aniñjamānenāti itthambhūtatthe karaṇavacanaṃ. Atisundaraṃ
analyzed: bahu bheravā iti bahu bhayānake an iñjamānena ati karaṇa vacanam ati sundaram
translated: Full of fear: full of dangers. Without trembling: the instrumental case is used in the sense of “in this way.”

original: vatāti evaṃ sante nāma araññe evaṃ niccalakāyo nisinno jhāyanto ativiya sundarañca
analyzed: vata ati evam sante nāma araññe evam niccala kāyaḥ nisinnaḥ jhāyantaḥ ativiya sundaram ca
translated: Very beautiful: if it is so, then, sitting in the forest with the body motionless, meditating, you meditate on very beautiful

original: jhānaṃ jhāyasīti vadati.
analyzed: jhānam jhāyasi iti vadati
translated: jhāna.

original: Accherarūpanti acchariyabhāvaṃ. Seṭṭhappattiyāti seṭṭhabhāvappattiyā.
analyzed: accherarūpanti acchariya bhāvam seṭṭha ppattiyā ti seṭṭha bhāva ppattiyā
translated: “The state of wonder” : the state of being wonderful. “The attainment of the best” : the attainment of the state of being the best.

original: “Lokādhipatisahabyataṃ ākaṅkhamāno”ti iminā brāhmaṇo lokādhipatisahayogaṃ pucchati, “kasmā bhava”ntiādinā pana tadaññavisesākaṅkhaṃ pucchatīti āha “aparenapi ākārena pucchatī”ti.
analyzed: loka adhipati sahabyatam ākaṅkhamānaḥ iti iminā brāhmaṇaḥ loka adhipati sahayogam pucchati kasmai bhavanti ādinā pana tad añña visesa ākaṅkham pucchati iti āha aparena api ākārena pucchati iti
translated: “Desiring to be a companion of the Lord of the World” : by this the brahmin asks about the companionship of the Lord of the World. “For what reason” , etc., is the question about the other special qualities. Therefore it is said: “He asks in another way.”

original: Kaṅkhāti taṇhā abhikkhaṇavasena pavattā. Anekasabhāvesūti rūpādivasena ajjhattikādivasena
analyzed: kaṅkhā ati taṇhā abhikkhaṇa vasena pavattā aneka sabhāvesu iti rūpa ādi vasena ajjhattika ādi vasena
translated: “Doubt” : craving that occurs by way of repeated questioning. “In regard to the various kinds of things” : in regard to the various kinds of objects such as visible forms, etc., and internal and external objects, etc.

original: evaṃ nānāsabhāvesu ārammaṇesu. Assādarāgo lobho abhijjhāti nānappakārā. Sesakilesā🔽vā diṭṭhimānadosādayo. Niccakālaṃ avassitā sattānaṃ avassayabhāvattā. Pajappāpanavasenāti
analyzed: evam nānā sabhāvesu ārammaṇesu assāda rāgaḥ lobhaḥ abhijjhāti nānappakārā sesa kilesā  vā diṭṭhi māna dosa ādayaḥ nicca kālam avassitā sattānam avassaya bhāva ttā paja ppāpana vasena ati
translated: Thus, in regard to the various kinds of objects. “Delight in sensual pleasure” : greed, which is of many kinds. The other defilements

original: pakārehi taṇhāyanavasena. Nirantāti antarahitā niravasesā.
analyzed: pakārehi taṇhāyana vasena anta rahitā niravasesā
translated: are the defilements of views, conceit, etc. “Always” : constantly. “The state of being a slave of beings” : the state of being a slave of beings by way of being addicted to them. “By way of the state of being addicted” : by way of the state of being addicted through craving. “Without remainder” : without exception, without remainder.

original: Anupagamanoti anupādāno. Sabbaññutaññāṇaṃ dīpeti, tassa hi vasena eva nānāsabhāvesu
analyzed: anupagamanaḥ ti anupādāno sabbaññu ta ññāṇam dīpeti tassa hi vasena eva nānā sabhāvesu
translated: “Non-clinging” : non-attachment. He illustrates the knowledge of omniscience, for it is by means of that that one does not cling to the various kinds of objects.

original: bhagavā samantacakkhunā passatīti “sabbe…pe… dassano”ti vuccati. Arahattaṃ sandhāyāha,
analyzed: bhagavā samanta cakkhunā passati iti dassano ti vuccati arahattam sandhāya āha
translated: The Blessed One sees with the eye of omniscience, thus it is said that he “sees all” .

original: tañhi nippariyāyato “anuttara”nti vuccati.
analyzed: tat hi nippariyāyataḥ anuttaran ti vuccati
translated: For that is called “unsurpassed” in the ultimate sense.

original: Kaṭṭhahārasuttavaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: kaṭṭhahāra sutta vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: The commentary on the Katthahāra Sutta is finished.

original: 9. Mātuposakasuttavaṇṇanā
analyzed: mātuposaka sutta vaṇṇanā
translated: The Mother’s Brother Sutta

original: 205. Itoti manussattabhāvato. Paṭigantvāti abhigantvā. Sagge hi nibbattanto kammaphalena dhammatāvasena paṭisandhikālato paṭṭhāya abhirativasena abhiramati eva nāmāti.
analyzed: itas ti manussatta bhāvataḥ paṭigantvā ati abhigantvā sagge hi nibbattantaḥ kamma phalena dhamma tā vasena paṭisandhi kālataḥ paṭṭhāya abhirati vasena abhiramati eva nāma ati
translated: “From here”: from the human state. “Having gone”: having approached. For one who is reborn in heaven delights in it by the nature of things, through the result of his kamma, from the moment of rebirth-linking onwards.

original: Mātuposakasuttavaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: mātuposaka sutta vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: The commentary on the Mātāputta Sutta is finished.

original: 10. Bhikkhakasuttavaṇṇanā
analyzed: bhikkhaka sutta vaṇṇanā
translated: The Alms-Food Eater Sutta

original: 206. Virūpaṃ gandhaṃ pasavatīti visso, duggandho. Bāhitvāti attano santānato bahikatvā
analyzed: virūpam gandham pasavati iti vissaḥ duggandhaḥ bāhitvā ati attanaḥ santānataḥ bahikatvā
translated: “A foul smell”: a bad smell. “Having expelled”: having taken out, having removed from his own continuity.

original: nīharitvā. Taṃ pana anavasesato pajahananti āha “aggamaggena jahitvā”ti. Saṅkhāyati
analyzed: nīharitvā tam pana anavasesataḥ āha agga maggena jahitvā iti saṅkhāyati
translated: But “having abandoned without remainder” is said because of the abandoning by the path of arahatship.

original: sammadeva paricchindati etāyāti saṅkhā, ñāṇanti āha “saṅkhāyāti ñāṇenā”ti. Bhinnakilesattāti
analyzed: sammat eva paricchindati etāya ati saṅkhā ñāṇanti āha saṅkhāya ati ñāṇena ati bhinna kilesa ttā iti
translated: “It is reckoned”: it is discerned well. “Understanding”: knowledge. Thus it is said: “Having reckoned, by understanding.” “With defilements destroyed”:

original: niruttinayena bhikkhusaddasiddhimāha.
translated: He says that the word bhikkhu is established by the method of derivation.

original: Bhikkhakasuttavaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: bhikkhaka sutta vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: The commentary on the Bhikkhu Sutta is finished.

original: 11. Saṅgāravasuttavaṇṇanā
analyzed: saṅgārava sutta vaṇṇanā
translated: The Sangarava Sutta🔽He desires, hopes for, believes in, and is intent on that object.

original: 207. Paccetīti pattiyāyati saddahati. Tathābhūto ca tamatthaṃ nikāmento nāma hotīti
analyzed: pacceti iti pattiyāyati saddahati tathābhūtaḥ ca tam attham nikāmentaḥ nāma hoti iti
translated: “He desires, he hopes for” is said because he is of that nature.

original: vuttaṃ “icchati patthetī”ti. Sādhu, bhanteti ettha sādhu-saddo āyācanattho, na abhinandanatthoti
analyzed: vuttam icchati pattheti iti sādhu bhante ti ettha sādhu saddaḥ āyācana atthaḥ na abhinandana atthaḥ ti
translated: The word “good” here is in the sense of entreaty, not in the sense of approval.🔽Having said “he entreats,” he shows the reason for the entreaty, saying “the Elder.”

original: “āyācamāno āhā”ti vatvā āyācane kāraṇaṃ dassento “therassa kirā”tiādimāha. Udakasuddhiko
analyzed: āyācamānaḥ āha ati vatvā āyācane kāraṇam dassentaḥ therassa kirāti ādim āha udaka suddhikaḥ
translated: The water-purifier🔽is not necessarily bound for an unhappy destination, but he entreats because of the sinfulness and defilement of his belief.

original: na ekaṃsena apāyūpago, laddhiyā pana sāvajjakilesabhūtabhāvato āyācati. Aññaṃ kāraṇaṃ🔽apadisanto “apicā”tiādimāha. Phalabhūto attho etassāti atthavasaṃ, kāraṇanti āha
analyzed: na eka aṃsena apāyu upagaḥ laddhiyā pana sāvajja kilesa bhūta bhāvataḥ āyācati aññam kāraṇam  apadisantaḥ api ca iti ādim āha phala bhūtaḥ atthaḥ etassa ti atthavasam kāraṇam ti āha
translated: Pointing out another reason,🔽he says “besides.” The meaning that is the fruit of this is the reason, he says.

original: “atthānisaṃsaṃ atthakāraṇa”nti. Papañcasūdaniyaṃ pana phaleneva araṇīyato attho,
analyzed: attha anisaṃsam attha kāraṇam ti papañca sūdaniyam pana phalena iva araṇīyataḥ attho
translated: “The benefit of the meaning, the reason for the meaning.” But in the Papañcasūdani the meaning is the reason because it is to be sought after by means of the fruit.

original: kāraṇanti katvā “attho eva atthavaso, tasmā dve atthavaseti dve atthe dve kāraṇānī”ti vuttaṃ.
analyzed: kāraṇanti katvā atthaḥ eva attha vaso tasmā dve attha vasā iti dve atthe dve kāraṇāni iti vuttam
translated: “Reason” is the reason for the two truths.

original: Saṅgāravasuttavaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: saṅgārava sutta vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: The Commentary on the Saṅgāravasutta is finished.

original: 12. Khomadussasuttavaṇṇanā
analyzed: khomadussa sutta vaṇṇanā
translated: The Commentary on the Khomadussa Sutta

original: 208. Evaṃladdhanāmaṃ piṇḍāya pāvisīti yojanā. Evamevanti kenaci animantitena sayameva🔽upasaṅkamante. Aphāsukadhātukanti ayuttarūpaṃ. Sabhādhammanti sabhāya caritabbaṃ🔽cārittadhammaṃ. Asañcāletvāti āsanato avuṭṭhāpetvā. Ujukameva āgacchati lokagganāyako
analyzed: evaṃladdha nāmam piṇḍāya yojanā a nimantitena sayam eva  upasaṅkamante a phāsuka dhātukanti ayutta rūpam sabhā dhammanti sabhāya caritabbam  cāritta dhammam a sañcāletvā ati āsanataḥ a vuṭṭhāpetvā ujukam eva āgacchati lokagga nāyako
translated: “The one who had gone forth thus” : the one who had gone forth in this way. “Thus” : by someone who has not invited him, he himself

original: bhagavā sabbasattuttamo attano uttaritarassa abhāvato lokassa apacitiṃ na dasseti.
analyzed: bhagavā sabba sattu uttamaḥ attanaḥ uttaritarassa abhāvataḥ lokassa apacitim na dasseti
translated: approaches. “The state of discomfort” : the state of unsuitability. “The rules of the assembly” : the rules of conduct to be observed in the assembly. “Without moving” : without rising from his seat. “Straightway” : the Leader of the world, the Blessed One, the most excellent of all beings, does not show disrespect for the world because there is no one superior to him.

original: Ye sabbaso saṃkilese pajahanti, teva paṇḍite “santo”ti dasseti “ete”tiādinā.
analyzed: ye sabbaso saṃkilese pajahanti te iva paṇḍite santo ti dasseti ete iti ādinā
translated: He shows that only those who abandon all defilements are wise and peaceful, with the words “These” and so on.

original: Khomadussasuttavaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: khomadussa sutta vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: The Commentary on the Khomadussa Sutta is finished.

original: Dutiyavaggavaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: dutiya vagga vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: The Commentary on the Second Chapter is finished.

original: Sāratthappakāsiniyā saṃyuttanikāya-aṭṭhakathāya
analyzed: sārattha ppakāsiniyā saṃyutta nikāya aṭṭhakathāya
translated: The Commentary on the Saṃyutta Nikāya,

original: Brāhmaṇasaṃyuttavaṇṇanāya līnatthappakāsanā samattā.
analyzed: brāhmaṇa saṃyutta vaṇṇanāya līnattha pakāsanā samattā
translated: The explanation of the meaning of the brief account in the Connected Discourses with Brahmins is finished.

original: 8. Vaṅgīsasaṃyuttaṃ
analyzed: vaṅgīsa saṃyuttam
translated: The Connected Discourses with Vangiisa

original: 1. Nikkhantasuttavaṇṇanā
analyzed: nikkhanta sutta vaṇṇanā
translated: The Explanation of the Discourse on Going Forth

original: 209. Āḷaviyanti āḷavinagarasamīpe. Aggacetiyeti gotamakacetiyādīhi uttamacetiye.
analyzed: āḷaviyanti āḷavi nagara samīpe agga cetiya iti gotamaka cetiya ādīhi uttama cetiye
translated: In Āḷavi: near the town of Āḷavi. In the foremost shrine: in the best shrine, such as the Gotamaka Shrine, etc.

original: Taṃ kira bhūmirāmaṇeyyakabhāvena manuññatāya padhānayuttatādisampattiyā ca itaracetiyehi
analyzed: tam kira bhūmi rāmaṇeyyaka bhāvena manuñña tāya padhāna yutta tā ādi sampattiyā ca itara cetiyehi
translated: It is said that this shrine was considered the best of the other shrines because of the beauty of the land, its pleasantness, and its suitability for meditation, etc.

original: seṭṭhasammataṃ. Kappattherenāti “kappo”ti gottato āgatanāmo thero, sahassapurāṇajaṭilānaṃ🔽abbhantare ayaṃ mahāthero. Ohīnakoti theresu gāmaṃ piṇḍāya paviṭṭhesu vihāre eva
analyzed: seṭṭha sammatam kappa ttherena ati kappo ti gottataḥ āgata nāmo thero  abbhantare ayam mahā theraḥ ohīnakaḥ ti theresu gāmam piṇḍāya paviṭṭhesu vihāre eva
translated: The Elder Kapp: the elder whose name was derived from the clan name “Kapp” was a great elder among the one thousand ancient matted-hair ascetics.🔽He was left behind in the monastery🔽while the other elders entered the village for alms. The reason for this is given: “as the guardian of the monastery.”

original: avahīnako ṭhito. Tattha kāraṇamāha “vihārapālo”tiādi. Samalaṅkaritvāti samaṃ alaṅkārena
analyzed: avahīnakaḥ tattha kāraṇam āha vihāra pālaḥ iti ādi samalaṅkaritvā iti samam alaṅkārena
translated: Having adorned: having adorned evenly with adornment.

original: alaṅkaritvā. Kusalacittaṃ viddhaṃseti pavattituṃ appadānavasena. Etasminti etasmiṃ
analyzed: alaṅkaritvā kusala cittam pavattitum appadāna vasena etasmin ti etasmin
translated: He broke his wholesome thought: he did not continue it. In this: in the arising of this

original: rāge uppanne. “Ekasmi”nti vā pāṭho, ekasmiṃ visabhāgavatthuke rāge uppanne. Dhammo
analyzed: rāge uppanne ekasmin ti vā pāṭhaḥ ekasmin visa bhāga vatthuke rāge uppanne dhammaḥ
translated: passion. “In one” is also a reading; in the arising of passion for an unsuitable object. The Dhamma

original: vāti mama citte uppajjanakato añño dhammo vā. Yena kāraṇena paro anabhiratiṃ vinodetvā
analyzed: vā ati mama citte uppajjana kataḥ aññaḥ dhammaḥ vā yena kāraṇena paraḥ anabhiratim vinodetvā
translated: “There is no other idea in my mind than the arising of this thought. For what reason should I now dispel discontent and

original: idāneva abhiratiṃ uppādeyya, taṃ kāraṇaṃ kuto labbhāti yojanā, taṃ kāraṇaṃ natthīti🔽attho, tassa abhāvakāraṇavacanaṃ.🔽Anagāriyanti agāravirahato anagāraṃ pabbajjā. Tattha niyuttattā anagāriyaṃ ka-kārassa🔽ya-kāraṃ katvā, pabbajitanti attho. Ādhāvantīti hadayaṃ abhibhavitvā dhāvanti. Uggatānanti
analyzed: idānā iva abhiratim uppādeyya tam kāraṇam kutas yojanā tam kāraṇam na atthi iti  atthaḥ tassa abhāva kāraṇa vacanam  anagāriyam ti agāra virahataḥ anagāram pabbajjā tattha niyutta ttā anagāriyam kakārassa  yakāram katvā pabbajitanti atthaḥ ādhāvanti iti hadayam abhibhavitvā dhāvanti uggata ananti
translated: arouse delight? The construction is: “That reason is not to be found.” The meaning is: “It does not exist.” The words “for that reason” are a reason for the non-existence of that .

original: uḷārānaṃ puttā. Tenāha “mahesakkhā rājaññabhūtā”ti. Uttamappamāṇanti sahassapalaṃ
analyzed: uḷārānam puttā tena āha mahesakkhā rājaññabhūtā ti uttama ppamāṇam ti sahassa palam
translated: “Homelessness” : the homeless state is the going forth by renunciation of the home life. The word “homeless” is derived by adding the suffix -iya to the negative particle na and the noun grāma, “village” . The meaning is: “gone forth” . “They run” : they run, having overcome the heart . “Great” : they are the sons of great men. Therefore it is said: “powerful, of great influence” . “The highest measure” : a thousand palas .

original: samantāti samantato. Parikireyyunti vijjheyyuṃ. Etasmā sahassāti yathāvuttā dhanuggahasahassato.
analyzed: samantā iti samantataḥ parikireyyunti vijjheyyum etasmai sahassā ati yathā vuttāḥ dhanuggaha sahassato
translated: “All around” : all around. “Would scatter” : would shoot. “From that thousand” : from the thousand archers mentioned above.

original: Atirekatarā anekasahassā. Itthiyo olokanasitalapitaroditasare khipantiyo. Neva maṃ
analyzed: atirekatarāḥ aneka sahassāḥ itthiyaḥ khipantiyaḥ na iva mama
translated: “More than that” : more than that thousand, many thousands. “Women” : women. “Looking on” : looking on with eyes dilated with fear. “Would scatter” : would shoot. “Not even me” : not even me, who am a great man, a powerful, mighty, and courageous warrior. “Would they scatter” : would they shoot?

original: byādhayissanti neva maṃ nijjhāyissanti. “Byādhayissatī”ti pāṭhoti vuttaṃ “cāletuṃ
analyzed: byādhayissanti na iva mama nijjhāyissanti byādhayissati iti pāṭhaḥ ti vuttam cāletum
translated: will not afflict me, will not obsess me. The reading “byādhayissati” is said to mean “will not be able to disturb.”

original: na sakkhissatīti attho”ti. Dhamme samhīti sake santike patiṭṭhite sāsanadhamme. Tenāha🔽“anabhiratiṃ vinodetvā”tiādi.
analyzed: na sakkhissati iti atthaḥ ti dhamme samhi iti sake santike patiṭṭhite sāsana dhamme tena āha  anabhiratim
translated: In the Dhamma, in the Dispensation’s Dhamma established near at hand. Hence he said: “having dispelled dissatisfaction.”

original: Magganti “maggo”ti vattabbe liṅgavipallāsena vuttaṃ. Tenāha “so hi nibbānassa pubbabhāgamagggo”ti.
analyzed: magganti maggaḥ iti vattabbe liṅga vipallāsena vuttam tena āha so hi nibbānassa pubbabhāga maggo ti
translated: The path: though it should be said “maggo,” it is said with a reversal of the noun-declension. Hence he said: “for that is the path to Nibbāna.”

original: Nikkhantasuttavaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: nikkhanta sutta vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: The commentary on the Nikkhasutta is finished.

original: 2. Aratisuttavaṇṇanā
analyzed: arati sutta vaṇṇanā
translated: The commentary on the Aratisutta

original: 210. Vihāragaruko kiresa theroti etena thero attano saddhivihārikaṃ vaṅgīsaṃ ovadituṃ
analyzed: vihāra garukaḥ kiresa thero ti etena theraḥ attano saddhivihārikam vaṅgīsam ovadituṃ
translated: This elder, who was devoted to the monastery, was unable to advise his pupil Vangīsa.

original: anavasaro. Tena antarantarā tassa cittaṃ rāgo anuddhaṃsetīti dasseti. Sāsane aratinti
analyzed: anavasaraḥ tena antar antarā tassa cittam rāgaḥ anuddhaṃseti iti dasseti sāsane
translated: Therefore he shows that lust sometimes disturbs his mind. Dissatisfaction with the Dispensation means

original: sīlaparipūraṇe samathavipassanābhāvanāya ca anabhiratiṃ. Kāmaguṇesu ca ratinti pañcasu
analyzed: sīla paripūraṇe samatha vipassanā bhāvanāya ca anabhiratim kāma guṇesu ca pañcasu
translated: dissatisfaction with the fulfilment of virtue and with the development of serenity and insight. And delight in the strands of sensual pleasure means delight in the five strands of sensual pleasure.

original: kāmakoṭṭhāsesu assādaṃ. Pāpavitakkanti kāmasaṅkappaṃ. Sabbākārenāti sabbe tadaṅgavikkhambhanasamucchindanākārena.
analyzed: kāma koṭṭhāsesu assādam pāpa vitakkam ti kāma saṅkappam sabba ākārena ati sabbe tad aṅga vikkhambhana samucchindana ākārena
translated: In the case of the sense desires, the “taste” is the pleasure and joy that arise through the experience of the object’s desirable qualities. “Evil thoughts” are thoughts of sense desire. “In every way” means by way of the abandoning of all the factors of the sense desires and by way of their complete destruction.

original: Yathā mahantaṃ araññaṃ vanathanti, evaṃ mahantaṃ kilesavanaṃ “vanatha”nti vuttaṃ.🔽Pathaviñca vehāsanti bhummatthe paccattavacanaṃ, tasmā pathaviyaṃ ākāse cāti attho.
analyzed: yathā mahantam araññam vanathanti evam mahantam kilesa vanam vanathanti vuttam  pathaviñca vehāsanti bhumma atthe paccatta vacanam tasmā pathaviyam ākāse ca ati attho
translated: “The forest of craving” is so called because it is a great forest of defilements.🔽“On the earth and in the sky” is a locative of place. Therefore the meaning is: “on the earth and in the sky.”

original: Tenāha “pathaviṭṭhita”ntiādi. Jagatīti ca pathaviyā vevacanaṃ. Tenāha “antopathaviya”nti.
analyzed: tena āha jagatī iti ca pathaviyā vevacanam tena āha antopathaviyanti
translated: Hence the commentary says: “on the earth and in the sky.” “The earth” is a synonym for the world. Therefore the commentary says: “within the world.”

original: Parijīratīti sabbbaso jaraṃ pāpuṇāti. Samāgantvāti ñāṇena samāgantvāti attho. Tenāha
analyzed: parijīrati iti sabbasas jaram pāpuṇāti samāgantvā iti ñāṇena samāgantvā iti attho tena āha
translated: “It decays” means it reaches decay in every way. “Having come together” means having come together with knowledge. Therefore the commentary says:

original: “mutattāti viññātattabhāvā”ti.
analyzed: muta ttā ati viññāta tta bhāvā ati
translated: “having been understood.”

original: Paṭighapadena gandharasā gahitā ghānajivhānaṃ paṭihananavasena pavattanato. Mutapadena phoṭṭhabbārammaṇaṃ gahitaṃ mutvā gahetabbato. Na lippatīti na makkhīyati.
analyzed: paṭigha padena gandha rasāḥ gahitāḥ ghāna jivhānam paṭihanana vasena pavattanataḥ muta padena phoṭṭhabba ārammaṇam gahitam mutvā gahetabbataḥ na lippati iti na makkhīyati
translated: The word “smelling” includes odors and tastes, because they occur by way of the nose and tongue’s obstruction of them. The word “tactile” includes the tangible object, because it is grasped by touching. “It does not stick” means it does not adhere.

original: Saṭṭhi-saddo cha-saddena samānatthoti “saṭṭhinissitā”ti padassa “chaārammaṇanissitā”ti
analyzed: saṭṭhi saddo cha saddena samāna tthaḥ ti saṭṭhi nissitā ati padassa cha ārammaṇa nissitā ati
translated: The word “sixty” has the same meaning as the word “six.” So the meaning of the expression “sixty-based” is given as “six-object-based.”

original: attho vutto. Puthū adhammavitakkāti rūpavitakkādivasena bahū nānāvitakkā micchāsaṅkappā.
analyzed: attho vutto puthū adhamma vitakkā ati rūpa vitakka ādi vasena bahū nānā vitakkā micchā saṅkappā
translated: “Many thoughts of non-Dhamma”: many different thoughts, many wrong thoughts, such as thoughts about visible forms, etc.

original: Janatāya niviṭṭhāti mahājane patiṭṭhitā. Tesaṃ vasenāti tesampi micchāvitakkānaṃ
analyzed: janatāya niviṭṭhā ati mahājane patiṭṭhitā tesam vasena ati tesam pi micchā vitakkānam
translated: “Set in the people”: established in the multitude. “By their influence”: by the influence of those wrong thoughts.

original: vasena. Na katthaci ārammaṇe. Kilesavaggagatoti kilesasaṅgaṇikaṃ upagato na bhaveyya,
analyzed: vasena na katthaci ārammaṇe kilesa vagga gataḥ ti kilesa saṅgaṇikam upagataḥ na bhaveyya
translated: “Nowhere”: in no object. “Would not be included in the category of defilements”: would not be included in the collection of defilements.

original: kilesavitakkā na uppādetabbāti attho. Duṭṭhullavacanaṃ kāmapaṭisaṃyuttakathā.
analyzed: kilesa vitakkā na uppādetabbā ti atthaḥ duṭṭhulla vacanam kāma paṭisaṃyutta kathā
translated: The meaning is: the thoughts of defilement should not be aroused. “Coarse speech”: talk connected with sensuality.

original: Dabbajātikoti dabbarūpo. Nepakkenāti kosallena. Nibbānaṃ paṭiccāti asaṅkhatadhātuṃ ārammaṇavasena paṭicca. Parinibbānakālanti anupādisesanibbānakālaṃ.🔽Aratisuttavaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.🔽3. Pesalasuttavaṇṇanā
analyzed: dabba jātikaḥ ti dabba rūpaḥ nepakkena ati kosallena nibbānam paṭicca ati asaṅkhata dhātum ārammaṇa vasena paṭicca parinibbāna kālam ti anupādisesa nibbāna kālam 🔽arati sutta vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā 🔽pesala sutta vaṇṇanā
translated: “A man of evil character”: a man of evil nature. “By skill”: by cleverness. “With reference to Nibbāna”: with reference to the element of the unconditioned by way of object. “At the time of parinibbāna”: at the time of parinibbāna without remainder.

original: 211. Etesanti etesaṃ mahallakānaṃ. Na pāḷi āgacchati appaguṇabhāvato. Na ca pāḷi🔽upaṭṭhāti, ekāya pāḷiyā sati pāḷigatiyā tathā tathā upaṭṭhānampi nesaṃ natthīti vadati.
analyzed: etesanti etesam mahallakānam na pāḷi āgacchati appaguṇa bhāvataḥ na ca pāḷi  upaṭṭhāti ekāya pāḷiyā sati pāḷi gatiyā tathā tathā upaṭṭhānam pi na īsam natthi iti vadati
translated: ‘These’: these elders. ‘It does not come to the text’ because of the absence of excellence. ‘The text does not appear’ means that even though there is a text, the appearance of it does not appear to them in that way because of the way the text is recited.

original: Na aṭṭhakathāti etthāpi eseva nayo. Sithiladhanitāditaṃtaṃbyañjanabuddhiṃ ahāpetvā
analyzed: na aṭṭhakathā ati ettha api esā iva nayo sithila dhanitā ādi tam tam byañjana buddhim
translated: ‘The commentary’ : here also the same method applies. Without taking away the letter-by-letter understanding of the slack and taut etc.

original: uccāraṇaṃ padabyañjanamadhuratā. Atikkamitvā maññati aññe bhikkhū. Hīḷanavasena abhibhavitvā
analyzed: uccāraṇam pada byañjana madhura tā atikkamitvā maññati aññe bhikkhū hīḷana vasena abhibhavitvā
translated: the recitation is sweet with words and letters. ‘He thinks’ that he surpasses other bhikkhus. By way of contempt he dominates

original: paṭibhānasutena attānaṃ pasaṃsati sambhāveti. Mānassa pavattitāya sahajātanissayādipaccayadhammā🔽taṃsahabhudhammā. Mānavasena vippaṭisārī ahuvā. Mā ahosīti yojanā. Vaṇṇabhaṇananti
analyzed: paṭibhāna sutena attānam pasaṃsati sambhāveti mānassa pavatti tāya sahajāta nissaya ādi paccaya dhammā  māna vasena vippaṭisārī yojanā vaṇṇa bhaṇananti
translated: and praises and esteems himself with the ‘eloquence-thread’ . The states that are conascent, support, etc., conditions🔽to the conceit that occurs are the states co-existent with it. ‘He was sorry because of the conceit’ means that he should not have been. ‘Praise’

original: parehi kiriyamānaṃ guṇābhitthavaṃ. Akhiloti pañcacetokhilarahito. Nissesaṃ navavidhanti
analyzed: parehi kiriyamānam pañca cetaḥ khila rahitaḥ nissesam navavidhanti
translated: means the proclamation of special qualities done by others. ‘Faultless’ means free from the five mental hindrances. ‘The rest is of nine kinds’🔽means that the rest of the text is of nine kinds.

original: navavidhampi mānaṃ kassaci ekadesassapi asesato. Vijjāyāti aggamaggavijjāya. Accantameva
analyzed: navavidham pi mānam kassaci eka desassa api asesataḥ vijjāya ati agga magga vijjāya accantam eva
translated: and the nine kinds of conceit, in part or in their entirety,

original: samitatāya vūpasamitatāya samitāvī.
analyzed: samitatāya vūpasamitatāya samitāvī
translated: he is a “master of the self” because he has completely mastered and stilled his mind by means of the supreme knowledge of the supramundane paths and fruits.🔽“The wise one” is the Blessed One, the Master of the self.

original: Pesalasuttavaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: pesala sutta vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: The commentary on the Pesala sutta is finished.

original: 4. Ānandasuttavaṇṇanā🔽212. Rāgoti ettha āyasmato vaṅgīsassa rāgassa uppattiyā kāraṇaṃ vibhāvetuṃ “āyasmā🔽ānando”tiādi vuttaṃ. Tanti ānandattheraṃ. Ārammaṇaṃ pariggahetunti kāyavedanādibhedaṃ🔽ārammaṇaṃ satigocaraṃ. Asubhadukkhādito, rūpādiekekameva vā chaḷārammaṇaṃ aniccadukkhādito
analyzed: ānanda sutta vaṇṇanā  rāgaḥ ti ettha āyasmataḥ vaṅgīsassa rāgassa uppattiyāḥ kāraṇam vibhāvetum  ānandaḥ tiādi vuttam tat ti ānanda theram ārammaṇam pariggahetum ti kāya vedanā ādi bhedam  ārammaṇam sati gocaram asubha dukkha āditaḥ rūpa ādi eka ekam eva vā chaṭ ārammaṇam anicca dukkha āditaḥ
translated: The Ānanda sutta

original: pariggaṇhituṃ paricchijja jānituṃ. Itthirūpārammaṇeti itthisantāne rūpasabhāve ārammaṇe.
analyzed: pariggaṇhitum paricchijja jānitum itthi rūpa ārammaṇe ti itthi santāne rūpa sabhāve ārammaṇe
translated: Here, in order to show the reason for the arising of the Venerable Vaṅgīsa’s lust, it is said: “The Venerable Ānanda” and so forth. “He” refers to the Elder Ānanda. “To apprehend the object” means to apprehend, to determine, to know the object, which is the domain of mindfulness, as foul, painful, impermanent, and non-self, or as one of the six objects such as form, by way of impermanence, pain, and non-self. “The object of a woman’s form” means the object that has the nature of form in the continuity of a woman.

original: Nibbāpananti nibbāpayati etenāti nibbāpanaṃ. Vipallāsenāti asubhe “subha”nti vipallāsabhāvahetu.
analyzed: nibbāpanam ti nibbāpayati etena ati nibbāpanam vipallāsena ati asubhe vipallāsa bhāva hetu
translated: “To extinguish” means that which extinguishes is the means of extinguishing. “By perversion” means by the cause of perversion, by the cause of regarding the foul as beautiful.

original: Rāgaṭṭhāniyanti rāguppattihetu. Iṭṭhārammaṇanti subhārammaṇaṃ. Ettha ca iṭṭhārammaṇasīsena
analyzed: rāgaṭṭhāniyanti rāga uppatti hetu iṭṭha ārammaṇanti subha ārammaṇam ettha ca iṭṭha ārammaṇa sīsena
translated: The words “a state that is a basis for lust” mean a cause for the arising of lust. “A desirable object” is a beautiful object.🔽Herein, he declares the apprehending of the aspect of the desirable as the sign of formations.

original: tattha iṭṭhākāraggahaṇaṃ vadati. Tañhi vajjanīyaṃ. Paratoti avasavattanatthena aññato.
analyzed: tattha iṭṭhākāra ggahaṇam vadati tat hi vajjanīyam paratas ti avasavattana atthena aññatas
translated: “From the external” means from what is not under one’s own control.

original: Saṅkhārā hi “mā bhijjantū”ti icchitāpi bhijjanteva, tasmā te avasavattittā paro nāma,
analyzed: saṅkhārāḥ hi mā bhijjantu iti icchitā api bhijjantā iva tasmāt te paraḥ nāma
translated: For although formations are wished for, “Let them not break up,” still they break up. Therefore they are called “external” because they are not under one’s own control.

original: sā ca nesaṃ paratā aniccadassanena pākaṭā hotīti vuttaṃ “parato passāti aniccato
analyzed: sā ca nesam paratā anicca dassanena pākaṭā hoti iti vuttam paratas passāti aniccato
translated: And that externality of theirs becomes evident through seeing their impermanence. That is why it is said: “He sees as external by seeing as impermanent.”🔽Although insight does not abandon the sign of formations, still it is said that it abandons the sign of formations because it occurs in relation to formations.

original: passā”ti. Kāmaṃ vipassanā saṅkhāranimittaṃ na pariccajati saṅkhāre ārabbha vattanato,🔽yesaṃ pana nimittānaṃ aggahaṇena animittāti gahituṃ arahati, taṃ dassetuṃ “niccādīnaṃ
analyzed: passāti kāmam vipassanā saṅkhāra nimittam na pariccajati saṅkhāre ārabbha vattanato  yesam pana nimittānam aggahaṇena animittā ati gahitum arahati tam dassetum nicca ādīnam
translated: But the sign of formations is not abandoned by the mere seeing of formations.🔽The words “the sign of permanence, etc.,” are stated in order to show the sign of formations that should be apprehended as signless by the non-apprehending of certain signs.

original: nimittāna”ntiādi vuttaṃ. Salakkhaṇa-sāmaññalakkhaṇa-dassanavasena mānassa dassanābhisamayo,
analyzed: nimitta ananti ādi vuttam salakkhaṇa sāmañña lakkhaṇa dassana vasena mānassa dassana abhisamayaḥ
translated: The penetration of conceit is through the seeing of the specific and general characteristics.

original: vipassanāya pahānābhisamayo. “Maggenā”ti vadanti, maggeneva pana asammohato pariññāpaṭivedhavasena
analyzed: vipassanāya pahāna abhisamayaḥ maggena ati vadanti maggena iva pana asammohato pariññā paṭivedha vasena
translated: They say: “By the path.” But it is through non-delusion by the path that there is penetration of full understanding, and through penetration of abandoning there is penetration of abandoning.🔽The meaning is: by the path of seeing and the path of development respectively.🔽The meaning is: by the path of seeing and the path of development respectively.🔽The meaning is: by the path of seeing and the path of development respectively.

original: dassanābhisamayo, pahānapaṭivedhavasena pahānābhisamayo. Rāgādisantatāyāti rāgādīnaṃ
analyzed: dassana abhisamayaḥ pahāna paṭivedha vasena pahāna abhisamayaḥ rāga ādi santatāya ati rāga ādīnam
translated: The meaning is: by the path of seeing and the path of development respectively.🔽The meaning is: by the path of seeing and the path of development respectively.

original: samucchedavasena paṭippassaddhivasena vūpasametabbato santabhāvena.🔽Ānandasuttavaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.🔽5. Subhāsitasuttavaṇṇanā
analyzed: samuccheda vasena paṭippassaddhi vasena vūpasametabbataḥ santa bhāvena  ānanda sutta vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: The meaning is: by the path of seeing and the path of development respectively.🔽The meaning is: by the path of seeing and the path of development respectively.🔽The meaning is: by the path of seeing and the path of development respectively.🔽The meaning is: by the path of seeing and the path of development respectively.🔽The meaning is: by the path of seeing and the path of development respectively.🔽The meaning is: by the path of seeing and the path of development respectively.🔽The meaning is: by the path of seeing and the path of development respectively.🔽The meaning is: by the path of seeing and the path of development respectively.🔽The meaning is: by the path of seeing and the path of development respectively.🔽The meaning is: by the path of seeing and the path of development respectively.🔽The meaning is: by the path of seeing and the path of development respectively.

original: 213. Aṅgīyanti hetubhāvena āgamabhāvena avayavabhāvena vā ñāyantīti aṅgāni, kāraṇāni,
analyzed: hetu bhāvena āgama bhāvena avayava bhāvena vā aṅgāni kāraṇāni
translated: The meaning is: by the path of seeing and the path of development respectively.

original: avayavā vāti āha “aṅgehīti kāraṇehi, avayavehi vā”ti. Viratiyo subhāsitavācāya pubbaṃ
analyzed: avayavāḥ vā iti āha aṅgehi iti kāraṇehi avayavehi vā ati viratiyaḥ subhāsita vācāya pubbam
translated: The meaning is: by the path of seeing and the path of development respectively.🔽The meaning is: by the path of seeing and the path of development respectively.

original: patiṭṭhitā hontīti musāvādāveramaṇiādayo tassā visesahetūti āha “musāvādā…pe… kāraṇānī”ti.
analyzed: patiṭṭhitāḥ honti iti tassā visesa hetū ti āha musāvāda āpe kāraṇāni iti
translated: The meaning is: by the path of seeing and the path of development respectively.🔽The meaning is: by the path of seeing and the path of development respectively.🔽The meaning is: by the path of seeing and the path of development respectively.🔽The meaning is: by the path of seeing and the path of development respectively.🔽The meaning is: by the path of seeing and the path of development respectively.🔽The meaning is: by the path of seeing and the path of development respectively.🔽The meaning is: by the path of seeing and the path of development respectively.🔽The meaning is: by the path of seeing and the path of development respectively.

original: Yasmā ariyavohārā visesato cetanāsabhāvā, tasmā vacīsucaritasamudāyassa saccavācādayo
analyzed: yasmai ariya vohārāḥ visesataḥ cetanā sabhāvā tasmai vacī su carita samudāyassa sacca vācā ādayo
translated: The meaning is: by

original: aṅgabhūtāti āha “saccavacanādayo cattāro avayavā”ti. Nissakkavacananti hetumhi nissakkavacanaṃ.🔽Tenāha “samanuāgatā pavattā”ti. Vācā hi tāya viratiyā sammā anurūpato āgatā pavattāti
analyzed: aṅga bhūtā iti āha saccavacana ādayo cattāro avayavā ti nissakkavacananti hetumhi nissakkavacanaṃ  tena āha samanuāgatā pavattā ati vācā hi tāya viratiyā sammā anurūpatas āgatā pavattā ati
translated: The words of the reason are the words of the reason in the reason clause.🔽Hence he said “occur in conformity with” . For speech is said to “occur in conformity with” that abstention because it occurs in accordance with it.

original: “samannāgatā”ti vuccati. Karaṇavacananti sahayoge karaṇavacanaṃ. Tenāha “yuttā”ti.
analyzed: samannāgatā iti vuccati karaṇa vacanam ti saha yoge karaṇa vacanam tena āha yuttā iti
translated: The words of the instrument are the words of the instrument in the instrumental clause. Hence he said “associated with” .

original: Sahajātāpi hi cetanā yathāsamādinnāya viratiyā sammā anurūpato yuttāti vattuṃ arahati.
analyzed: sahajātā api hi cetanā yathā samādinnāya viratiyā anurūpataḥ yuttā iti vattum arahati
translated: For volition, though conascent with it, is rightly described as “associated with” the abstention that has been undertaken in accordance with it.

original: Samullapanavācāti saddavācā, sā vuccatīti vācā nāma. Viññatti pana vuccati etāyāti
analyzed: samullapana vācā ati sadda vācā sā vuccati iti vācā nāma viññatti pana vuccati etāya ati
translated: The words of the expression are the words of the expression in the expression clause. That is called “speech” .🔽But “speech” is called that by which one expresses oneself.

original: vācā nāma, tathā virati cetanāvācā. Na sā idha adhippetāti sā cetanāvācā viññattivācā
analyzed: vācā nāma tathā virati cetanā vācā na sā idha adhippetā ati sā cetanā vācā viññatti vācā
translated: And abstention is called “speech” because it is expressed by speech.🔽But that volition is not intended here in this Thread, because of the words “is well spoken” .

original: viya idha imasmiṃ sutte na adhippetā “subhāsitā hotī”ti vacanato. Tenāha “abhāsitabbato”ti.
analyzed: viya idha imasmin sutte na adhippetā su bhāsitā hoti iti vacanato tena āha a bhāsitabbato ti
translated: Hence he said “because of the non-utterance” .

original: Suṭṭhu bhāsitāti sammā ñāyena bhāsitā vacīsucaritabhāvato. Atthāvahatanti hitāvahakālaṃ
analyzed: suṭṭhu bhāsitā ati sammā ñāyena bhāsitā vacī su carita bhāvataḥ hita āvaha kālam
translated: “Well spoken”: spoken rightly, in accordance with truth, because it is good verbal conduct. “Conducive to welfare”: conducive to welfare for a long time.

original: pati āha. Kāraṇasuddhinti yonisomanasikārena kāraṇavisuddhiṃ. Dosābhāvanti agatigamanādidosābhāvaṃ.
analyzed: āha kāraṇa suddhim ti yonisaḥ manasikārena kāraṇa visuddhim dosa abhāvam ti agati gamana ādi dosa abhāvam
translated: The Master said this. “Purity of reason”: purity of reason by right reflection. “Absence of hate”: absence of hate consisting in going to an extreme.

original: Rāgadosādivinimuttañhi taṃ bhāsato anurodhavirodhavivajjanato agatigamanaṃ dūrasamugghāṭitamevāti.
analyzed: rāga dosa ādi vinimuttam hi tam bhāsataḥ anurodha virodha vivajjanataḥ agati gamanam dūra samugghāṭitam eva ati
translated: For that speech is free from hate, since it is free from conformity and opposition, and since it does not go to an extreme, since it is far removed from the extreme of annihilation.

original: Anuvādavimuttāti apavādavirahitā. Sabbākārasampattiṃ dīpeti, asati hi sabbākārasampatiyaṃ anuvajjatāpi.
analyzed: anuvāda vimuttā ati apavāda virahitā sabba ākāra sampattim dīpeti asati hi sabba ākāra sampatiyam anuvajjatā api
translated: “Free from blame”: free from censure. It shows the perfection of all aspects, for if there were no perfection of all aspects, there would be blame.

original: Kiñcāpi pubbe dhammādhiṭṭhānā desanā āraddhā, puggalajjhāsayato pana puggalādhiṭṭhānāya…pe…🔽vacanametaṃ. Kāmañcettha “aññataraniddosavacana”nti avisesato vuttaṃ, “dhammaṃyeva
analyzed: kiñcā api pubbe dhamma adhiṭṭhānā desanā āraddhā puggala jjhāsayato pana  vacanam etam kāmam ca ittha aññatara niddosa vacanan ti avisesataḥ vuttam dhammam yeva
translated: Although the teaching was begun with reference to the Dhamma, still, because of the inclination of the person, it was continued with reference to the person.

original: bhāsatī”tiādinā pana adhammadosādirahitāya vācāya vuccamānattā idhāpi subhāsitā vācā
analyzed: bhāsati iti ādinā pana adhamma dosa ādi rahitāya vācāya idha api su bhāsitā vācā
