translated: This statement, although it was made without distinction, is nevertheless a statement of the absence of a certain fault. “He speaks only of the Dhamma” shows that the speech is well spoken because it is spoken with speech that is free from the faults of the Dhamma, etc.

original: adhippetāti. “Subhāsitaṃyevā”ti avadhāraṇena nivattitaṃ sarūpato dasseti “no dubbhāsita”nti
analyzed: adhippetā ti subhāsitam yeva āti avadhāraṇena nivattitam sarūpataḥ dasseti no dubbhāsitam ti
translated: “What is spoken well” is shown by the word “only” in the first line. “What is not spoken badly” is shown by the second line.🔽Therefore it is said: “The prevention of the utterance of the opposite of the speech in question.”

original: iminā. Tenāha “tasseva vācaṅgassa paṭipakkhabhāsananivāraṇa”nti. Paṭiyogīnivattanattho🔽hi eva-saddo, tena pisuṇavācāpaṭikkhepo dassito. “Subhāsita”nti vā iminā catubbidhaṃ
analyzed: iminā tena āha tassa iva vācaṅgassa paṭipakkha bhāsana nivāraṇan ti paṭiyogī nivattana atthaḥ  hi eva saddo tena pisuṇa vācā paṭikkhepaḥ dassito su bhāsitanti vā iminā catubbidham
translated: The word eva has the meaning of preventing the opponent. Therefore the prohibition of malicious speech is shown.

original: vacīsucaritaṃ gahitanti “no dubbhāsitanti iminā micchāvācappahānaṃ dīpetī”ti vuttaṃ.🔽Sabbavacīsucaritasādhāraṇavacanañhi subhāsitanti. Tena parabhedanādikaṃ asabbhādikañca
analyzed: vacī su caritam gahitan ti no dubbhāsitan ti iminā micchā vāca pahānam dīpeti iti vuttam  sabbavacī su carita sādhāraṇa vacanam hi su bhāsitam ti tena para bhedana ādikam asabbha ādikam ca
translated: Or else, by the word “what is spoken well” the four kinds of verbal good conduct are included. Therefore it is said that by the words “what is not spoken badly” the abandoning of wrong speech is shown.🔽For the word “what is spoken well” is a general term for all verbal good conduct. Therefore the speech of the Bodhisattas, which is not divisive, etc., and which is not unbeneficial, etc., should be regarded as not included in malicious speech, etc.

original: bodhisattānaṃ vacanaṃ apisuṇādivisayanti daṭṭhabbaṃ. Bhāsitabbavacanalakkhaṇanti
analyzed: bodhisattānam vacanam apisuṇa ādi visayanti daṭṭhabbam bhāsitabba vacana lakkhaṇanti
translated: The characteristic of speech that should be spoken is shown by the words “what should be spoken.”

original: bhāsitabbassa vacanassa sabhāvalakkhaṇaṃ dīpetīti ānetvā sambandho. Yadi evaṃ nanu
analyzed: bhāsitabbassa vacanassa sabhāva lakkhaṇam dīpeti iti ānetvā sambandhaḥ yadi evam nanu
translated: The connection is to be understood thus: “He shows the individual characteristic of the speech that should be spoken.” If that is so,

original: abhāsitabbaṃ paṭhamaṃ vatvā bhāsitabbaṃ pacchā vattabbaṃ yathā “vāmaṃ muñca, dakkhiṇaṃ
analyzed: a bhāsitabbam paṭhamam vatvā bhāsitabbam pacchā vattabbam yathā vāmam muñca dakkhiṇam
translated: shouldn’t the speech that should not be spoken be mentioned first and the speech that should be spoken afterwards, as in the passage: “Let go the left, take hold of the right,

original: gaṇhā”ti āha “aṅgaparidīpanatthaṃ panā”tiādi.🔽Paṭhamenāti “subhāsita”nti padena. Dhammato anapetanti attano paresañca hitasukhāvahadhammato
analyzed: gaṇhāti āha aṅga paridīpana attham pana atiādi  paṭhamena ati su bhāsitanti padena dhammataḥ an apetanti attanaḥ paresaṃ ca hita sukha āvaha dhammato
translated: He says, “But in order to illustrate the parts” .

original: anapetaṃ. Mantāvacananti mantāya pavattetabbavacanaṃ. Paññavā avikiṇṇavāco hi na
analyzed: an apetam mantāvacananti mantāya pavattetabba vacanam paññavā a vikiṇṇa vācaḥ hi na
translated: “By the first” : by the word “well-spoken” . “Not to be taken away by Dhamma” : not to be taken away from oneself and others by the Dhamma that brings about their welfare and happiness.

original: ca anatthāvahaṃ vācaṃ bhāsati. Itarehi dvīhīti tatiyacatutthapadehi. “Imehi khotiādīnīti
analyzed: ca anattha āvaham vācam bhāsati itarehi dvīhi iti tatiya catuttha padehi imehi kho ti ādīni iti
translated: “By the other two” : by the third and fourth terms. “By these” , etc.

original: karaṇe etaṃ upayogavacana”nti keci. Taṃ vācanti yathāvuttaṃ caturaṅgikaṃ. Yañca vācaṃ
analyzed: karaṇe etam upayoga vacananti keci tam vācam iti yathāvuttam caturaṅgikam yat ca vācam
translated: Some say that this is a statement of the function of the terms. They say that the terms are those four terms just mentioned. And the terms

original: maññantīti sambandho. Aññeti ito bāhirakā ñāyavādino akkharacintakā ca. “Paṭiññāhetuudāharaṇūpanayanigamanāni🔽avayavā vākyassā”ti vadanti. Nāmādīhīti nāmākhyātapadehi. Liṅgaṃ itthiliṅgādi vacanaṃ
analyzed: maññanti iti sambandhaḥ aññe ti itas bāhirakāḥ ñāya vādinaḥ ca paṭiññā hetu udāharaṇa upanaya nigamanāni  avayavāḥ vākyaḥ ati vadanti nāma ādīhi iti nāma ākhyāta padehi liṅgam itthi liṅga ādi vacanam
translated: are connected with the words “they think” . “Others” : outsiders, proponents of reason, and grammarians. They say that a sentence consists of🔽an assertion, a reason, an example, and a conclusion.

original: ekavacanādi. Paṭhamādi vibhatti atītādi kālaṃ. Kattā sampadānaṃ apādānaṃ karaṇaṃ
analyzed: ekavacana ādi paṭhama ādi vibhatti atīta ādi kālam kattā sampadānam apādānam karaṇam
translated: “By name, etc.” : by the words that express a name and a description. Gender is the feminine gender, etc. Number is the singular number, etc. Case is the nominative case, etc. Tense is the past tense, etc. Agent is the instrument, the object, and the cause.

original: adhikaraṇaṃ kammañca kārakaṃ. Sampattīhi samannāgatanti ete avayavādike sampādetvā
analyzed: adhikaraṇam kammañca kārakam sampattīhi ete avayava ādike sampādetvā
translated: and the legal question, the action, and the doer. “Endowed with the requisites” : having completed these parts and so on,

original: vuttaṃ. Taṃ paṭisedhetīti taṃ yathāvuttavisesampi vācaṃ “imehi kho”ti vadanto bhagavā🔽paṭisedheti. Kho-saddo hettha avadhāraṇattho. Tenāha “avayavādī”tiādi. Yā kāci asabhāvaniruttilakkhaṇā.
analyzed: vuttam tam paṭisedheti iti tam yathā vutta visesam pi vācam imehi khalu iti vadantaḥ bhagavā  paṭisedha iti kho saddaḥ ha ittha avadhāraṇa atthaḥ tena āha avayava ādi itiādi yā kāci asabhāva nirutti lakkhaṇā
translated: the Blessed One, saying “These, bhikkhus,” rejects that speech, which is described above.🔽The word kho here has the meaning of “only.” Therefore he says “a sectarian,” and so on.🔽Any speech that is not in accordance with the true nature of things is a barbarian language.

original: Sā milakkhubhāsā. Sīhaḷakenevāti sīhaḷabhāsāya pariyāpannena vacanena. Arahattaṃ
analyzed: sā milakkhu bhāsā sīhaḷakena iva ati sīhaḷa bhāsāya pariyāpannena vacanena arahattam
translated: “In the Sinhalese language” : in the language included in the Sinhalese language.

original: pāpuṇiṃsūti saṃsāre ativiya sañjātasaṃvegā tannissaraṇe ninnapoṇamānasā hutvā vipassanaṃ
analyzed: pāpuṇiṃsu iti saṃsāre sañjāta saṃvegā tad nissaraṇe ninna poṇa mānasā hutvā vipassanam
translated: They attained arahatship : they became extremely disgusted with saṃsāra, and with their minds inclined to escape from it, they aroused insight and

original: ussukkāpetvā maggapaṭipāṭiyā arahattaṃ pāpuṇiṃsu.
analyzed: ussukkāpetvā magga paṭipāṭiyā arahattam pāpuṇiṃsu
translated: attained arahatship by the order of the paths.

original: Pātova phullitakokanadanti pātova saṃphullapadumaṃ. Bhijjiyateti nibbhijjiyati nibbhiggo jāyati. Manussattaṃ gatāti manussattabhāvaṃ upagatā.
analyzed: pātaḥ uva phullita kokanadanti pātaḥ uva saṃphulla padumam bhijjiyateti nibbhijjiyati nibbhiggaḥ jāyati manussattam gatā ati manussatta bhāvam upagatā
translated: “Like a full-blown lotus in the morning” : like a fully opened lotus in the morning. “It bursts” : it bursts open, it bursts asunder. “Having become human” : having attained the state of being human.

original: Buddhantareti buddhuppādantare dvinnaṃ buddhuppādānaṃ antarā. Tadā hi paccekabuddhānaṃ sāsane, na buddhasāsane dippamāne.
analyzed: buddha antarā iti buddha uppāda antare dvinnam buddha uppādānam antarā tadā hi paccekabuddhānam sāsane na buddha sāsane dippamāne
translated: In the interval between Buddhas: in the interval between the arising of Buddhas, between two Buddhas. For at that time the Dispensation of the Paccekabuddhas is not shining, not the Dispensation of the Buddha.

original: Jarāya parimadditanti yathā hatthacaraṇādiaṅgāni sithilāni honti, cakkhādīni indriyāni
analyzed: yathā hattha caraṇa ādi aṅgāni sithilāni honti cakkha ādīni indriyāni
translated: Crushed by old age: just as the limbs such as the hands and feet become flabby, and the faculties such as the eyes

original: savisayaggahaṇe asamatthāni honti, yobbanaṃ sabbaso vigataṃ, kāyabalaṃ apagataṃ,
analyzed: sa visaya ggahaṇe asamatthāni honti yobbanam sabbasas vigatam kāya balam apagatam
translated: become incapable of grasping their objects, youth is completely gone, the strength of the body is lost,

original: satimatidhitiādayo vippayuttā, pubbe attano ovādapaṭikarā puttadārādayopi apasādakā,🔽parehi vuṭṭhāpanīyasaṃvesanīyatā punadeva bālabhāvappatti ca honti, evaṃ jarāya sabbaso
analyzed: vippayuttā pubbe attano ovāda paṭikarā putta dāra ādayaḥ api apasādakā  parehi vuṭṭhāpanīya saṃvesanīya tā puna deva bāla bhāva ppatti ca honti evam jarāya sabbaso
translated: the memory, understanding, etc., are disconnected, and even one’s own children, wife, etc., who formerly obeyed one’s instructions become disobedient,

original: vimadditaṃ. Etanti sarīraṃ vadati. Milātachavicammanissitanti jiṇṇabhāvena appamaṃsalohitattā
analyzed: vimadditam etat ti sarīram vadati milāta chavi camma nissitam ti jiṇṇa bhāvena appa maṃsa lohita ttā
translated: and one becomes dependent on others for support and clothing, and regresses to a state of foolishness again—in this way one is completely crushed by old age. The word etan refers to the body. Supported by skin and hide that is withered: because of the state of decay, there is little flesh and blood,

original: milātehi gatayobbanehi dhammehi sannissitaṃ. Ghāsamāmisanti ghāsabhūtaṃ āmisaṃ maccunā
analyzed: milātehi gata yobbanehi dhammehi sannissitam ghāsam āmisanti ghāsa bhūtam āmisam maccunā
translated: and it is supported by the properties of youth that have disappeared through the passing of time. The flesh of the food-eater: the flesh that is the food of death,

original: gilitvā viya patiṭṭhapetabbato. Kesalomādinānākuṇapapūritaṃ. Tato eva asucibhājanaṃ
analyzed: gilitvā viya kesa loma ādi nānā kuṇapa pūritam tatas eva asuci bhājanam
translated: because it is to be placed as if swallowed. It is filled with various kinds of ordure, head hairs, body hairs, and so on.🔽Therefore it is a vessel of impurity.

original: etaṃ. Sabbathāpi nissāratāya kadalikkhandhasamaṃ.
analyzed: etam sabbathā api nissāra tāya kadali kkhandha samam
translated: It is like a plantain trunk because it has no core at all.

original: Anucchavikāhīti sammāsambuddhassa anurūpāhi. Na tāpeyyāti cittañca kāyañca na tāpeyya.
analyzed: anucchavikāhi iti sammāsambuddhassa anurūpāhi na tāpeyya ati cittam ca kāyam ca na tāpeyya
translated: “Suitable” : suitable for the Fully Enlightened One. “Would not burn” : would not burn the mind and body.

original: Tāpanā cettha sampati āyati ca visādanā. Na bādheyyāti “nābhibhaveyyā”ti padassa
analyzed: tāpanā ca ittha sampati āyati ca visādanā na bādheyyāti na abhibhaveyyāti padassa
translated: Here burning is the state of being heated and the state of being made to drip. “Would not afflict” : this shows the meaning of the word “would not overcome.”

original: atthadassanaṃ. Apisuṇavācāvasenāti sabbaso pahīnapisuṇavācatāvasena. Pāpānīti lāmakāni
analyzed: attha dassanam a pisuṇa vācā vasena ati sabbaso pahīna pisuṇa vācā tā vasena pāpāni iti lāmakāni
translated: “Through speech that is not malicious” : through the complete absence of malicious speech. “Evil” : bad,

original: nikiṭṭhakāni. Tenāha “appiyānī”tiādi. Anādāyāti aggahetvā.
analyzed: nikiṭṭhakāni tena āha appiyāni itiādi an ādāya ati aggahetvā
translated: low. Therefore he said “unpleasant” and so on. “Without taking” : without grasping.

original: Sādhubhāvenāti niddosamadhurabhāvena. Amatasadisāti sadise tabbohāroti, kāraṇe vāyaṃ
analyzed: sādhu bhāvena ati niddosa madhura bhāvena amata sadisā ati sadise kāraṇe vā ayam
translated: “With a good nature” : with a harmless and sweet nature. “Like the deathless” : like what is similar to the deathless. “As a cause” : this is a designation for a cause.

original: kāriyavohāroti āha “nibbānāmatapaccayattā vā”ti. Paccayavasena hi sā tadā dassanappavatti.
analyzed: kāriya vohāraḥ ti āha nibbāna amata paccaya ttā vā ti paccaya vasena hi sā tadā dassana ppavatti
translated: “As an effect” : this is a designation for an effect. For it is seen as the deathless through a cause.

original: Cariyāti cārittaṃ. Porāṇā nāma paṭhamakappikā, buddhādayo vā ariyā.
analyzed: cariyā ati cārittam porāṇāḥ nāma paṭhama kappikāḥ buddha ādayaḥ vā ariyā
translated: “Practice” : conduct. “Ancient” : those of the first period, or the Noble Ones such as the Buddhas.

original: Patiṭṭhitāti niccalabhāvena aṭṭhiṃ katvā paccayāyattabhāvato avisaṃvādanakā. Ubhayathā
analyzed: patiṭṭhitā ati niccala bhāvena aṭṭhim katvā paccaya āyatta bhāvataḥ avisaṃvādanakā ubhayathā
translated: “Established” : they are established by being made firm through the state of immobility, and they are non-deceptive in the sense of being conditions.

original: paṭipattiṃ āha “attano ca paresañca atthe patiṭṭhitā”ti. Atthe diṭṭhadhammikasamparāyikādihite
analyzed: paṭipattim āha attano ca paresam ca atthe patiṭṭhitā ati atthe diṭṭhadhammika samparāyika ādihite
translated: In both cases he speaks of the practice: “established in the welfare of both oneself and others.”

original: patiṭṭhitattā eva dhamme avihiṃsādidhamme patiṭṭhitā. Anuparodhakaranti etena hitapariyāyoyaṃ
analyzed: patiṭṭhita ttāḥ eva dhamme avihiṃsā ādi dhamme patiṭṭhitāḥ etena hita pariyāyaḥ yaṃ
translated: Because they are established in the welfare of oneself and others in this life, in the life to come, and in both, they are established in the Dhamma of non-violence, etc.🔽By “not causing harm” he shows that the word attha here is synonymous with hita .

original: attha-saddoti dasseti. Dhammikanti dhammato anapetaṃ, atthadhammūpasaṃhitaṃ vā.
analyzed: attha saddo ti dasseti dhammikam ti dhammataḥ an apetam attha dhamma upasaṃhitam vā
translated: “Dhammika” means not deviating from the Dhamma, or connected with the Dhamma and welfare.🔽“For the attainment of Nibbāna” : for the purpose of attaining Nibbāna.

original: Nibbānappattiyāti nibbānappattiyatthaṃ. Dukkhassa antakiriyāya antakaraṇatthaṃ. Yasmā
analyzed: nibbāna pattiyā ti nibbāna ppattiya ttham dukkhassa anta kiriyāya anta karaṇa ttham yasmā
translated: For the purpose of making an end of suffering, for the purpose of bringing suffering to an end.

original: buddho khemāya bhāsati, tasmā khemuppattihetuyā khemā, tasmā sā sabbavācānaṃ uttamāti
analyzed: buddhaḥ khemāya bhāsati tasmā khema uppatti hetuyā khemā tasmā sā sabba vācānam uttamā ati
translated: Because the Buddha speaks for the sake of safety, therefore it is safe by being the cause for safety. Therefore it is the best of all speech.🔽Thus the meaning should be seen here in this way.

original: evampettha attho daṭṭhabbo. Mantāvacanavasenāti sabbadosarahitavasena.
analyzed: evam pi ittha atthaḥ daṭṭhabbo mantā vacana vasena ati sabba dosa rahita vasena
translated: By the method of the recitation of the mantras: by the method of being free from all faults.

original: Subhāsitasuttavaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: subhāsita sutta vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: The commentary on the Subhāsita Sutta is finished.

original: 6. Sāriputtasuttavaṇṇanā
analyzed: sāriputta sutta vaṇṇanā
translated: Sāriputta Sutta

original: 214. Vākkaraṇacāturiyato vacanaguṇahetūnaṃ pūriyā pūre bhavāti porī, tāya poriyā.
analyzed: vacana guṇa hetūnam pūriyā pūre bhavāti porī tāya
translated: Poriyā means that it is fulfilled by the fulfilment of the conditions for the qualities of speech, namely, the four kinds of analytical knowledge.🔽Hence it is said, “in one complete with syllables, etc.”

original: Tenāha “akkharādiparipuṇṇāyā”ti. Avibaddhāyāti pittādīhi na vibaddhāya anupaddutāya.
analyzed: tena āha akkhara ādi paripuṇṇāya ati avibaddhāya ati pitta ādīhi na vibaddhāya anupaddutāya
translated: Unimpededly: not impeded by bile, etc., not afflicted.🔽Hence it is said, “unobstructedly,” and so on.

original: Tenāha “apalibuddhāyā”tiādi. Niddosāyāti atthato byañjanato vigatadosāya. Akkhalitapadabyañjanāyāti
analyzed: tena āha apalibuddhāya atiādi niddosāya ati atthataḥ byañjanataḥ vigata dosāya akkhalita pada byañjanāya ati
translated: Faultless: free from faults of meaning and of phrasing.🔽Without slips of the tongue or stammering: without slips of the tongue or stammering.

original: agalitapadabyañjanāya, atthassa viññāpaniyāti diṭṭhadhammikādiatthassa bodhane pariyattāya.
analyzed: a galita pada byañjanāya atthassa viññāpaniyā ati diṭṭhadhammika ādi atthassa bodhane pariyattāya
translated: Capable of arousing: capable of arousing the meaning that is evident in this very life, etc.

original: Bhikkhunanti gāthāsukhatthaṃ rassaṃ katvā vuttaṃ.🔽“Saṃkhittenapi deseti, vitthārenapi bhāsatī”ti nayidaṃ paṭhamaṃ uddisitvā tassa atthassa
analyzed: bhikkhunan ti gāthā sukha attham rassam katvā vuttam  saṃkhittena api deseti vitthārena api bhāsati iti na yidam paṭhamam uddisitvā tassa atthassa
translated: Bhikkhunī: the short form is used for the sake of the metre.🔽“He teaches in brief and speaks in detail” . This is not said with reference to speech that occurs in the way of praising the meaning of what was first recited.

original: kittanavasena pavattitaṃ vacanaṃ sandhāya vuttaṃ. Sā hi vitthāradesanā eva hoti.
analyzed: kittana vasena pavattitam vacanam sandhāya vuttam sā hi vitthāra desanā eva hoti
translated: For that is only a detailed teaching.

original: Yā pana desanā kadāci dhammapaṭiggāhakānaṃ ajjhāsayavasena saṃkhitteneva dassetvā
analyzed: yā pana desanā kadāci dhamma paṭiggāhakānam ajjhāsaya vasena saṃkhittena iva dassetvā
translated: But a teaching that sometimes shows by means of a brief statement in accordance with the inclinations of those who are recipients of the teaching,

original: nikkhipati, yā ca kadāci vitthārena, tadubhayaṃ sandhāya vuttaṃ. Tenāha “cattārimānī”tiādi.🔽Sabhāvamadhuro paccayavasena madhurataro hotīti dassetuṃ “yathā”tiādi vuttaṃ. Vividhākāraṃ
analyzed: nikkhipati yā ca kadāci vitthārena tat ubhayam sandhāya vuttam tena āha cattāri imāni itiādi  sabhāva madhuraḥ paccaya vasena madhurataraḥ hoti iti dassetum yathā itiādi vuttam vividha ākāram
translated: and sometimes in detail. Both are referred to here. Hence he said “There are these four kinds of persons.”🔽In order to show that what is naturally sweet becomes sweeter still by conditions, he said “Just as” and so on.

original: katvā dhammaṃ kathetuṃ paṭibhātīti paṭibhānaṃ, desanāpakārañāṇaṃ. Tenāha “samuddato”tiādi.
analyzed: katvā dhammam kathetum paṭibhāti iti paṭibhānam desanā pakāra ñāṇam tena āha samuddato tiādi
translated: The “inspiration” is the knowledge of the means of teaching, by which one is inspired to teach the Dhamma in various ways. Hence he said “from the ocean” and so on.

original: Odahantīti avajānanavasena gamenti.
analyzed: odahanti iti avajānana vasena
translated: “They go by way of contempt” means they go by way of despising.

original: Sāriputtasuttavaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: sāriputta sutta vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: The commentary on the Sāriputta Sutta is finished.

original: 7. Pavāraṇāsuttavaṇṇanā🔽215. Tasmiṃ ahūti tasmiṃ ahanīti āha “tasmiṃ divase”ti. Anasanenāti sabbaso āhārassa
analyzed: pavāraṇā sutta vaṇṇanā  tasmin ahu uti tasmim ahani iti āha tasmin divase iti anasanena ati sabbaso āhārassa
translated: The Invitation Sutta

original: abhuñjanena. Sāsanikasīlena bāhirakaanasanena vā upetā hutvāti yojanā. Vā-saddena
analyzed: abhuñjanena sāsanika sīlena vā upetāḥ hutvā ati yojanāḥ
translated: “On that day” means “on that day.” “By fasting” means by not eating any food at all. The construction is: “having become endowed with the virtue of the Dispensation and with fasting outside the Dispensation.” The word “or”

original: khīrapānamadhusāyanādīnipi saṅgaṇhāti. Pakārehi diṭṭhādīhi vāreti kāyakammādike sarāpeti
analyzed: saṅgaṇhāti pakārehi diṭṭha ādīhi kāya kamma ādike
translated: includes drinking milk, eating honey, and so on. “By the parts” means by the seen and so on. “He restrains” means he restrains bodily action and so on.

original: gārayhe karoti etāyāti pavāraṇā, paṭipattivisodhanāya attano attano vajjasodhanāya🔽okāsadānaṃ. Yasmā yebhuyyena vassaṃvuṭṭhehi kātabbā esā visuddhidesanā, tasmā vuttaṃ
analyzed: gārayhe karoti etāya ati pavāraṇā paṭipatti visodhanāya attanaḥ attanaḥ vajja sodhanāya  okāsa dānam yasmā yebhuyyena vassaṃvuṭṭhehi kātabbā esā visuddhi desanā tasmā vuttam
translated: It is the giving of an opportunity.🔽Since this announcement of purity is to be made by those who have completed the rains,

original: “vassaṃvuṭṭhapavāraṇāya. Visuddhipavāraṇātipi etissāva nāma”nti. Tadā tassa bhikkhusaṅghassa
analyzed: vassaṃvuṭṭha pavāraṇāya tadā tassa bhikkhu saṅghassa
translated: it is said that it is called the Invitation of those who have completed the rains.

original: tuṇhībhāvassa anavasesatāyapi vaṇṇaṃ dassetuṃ pāḷiyaṃ “tuṇhībhūta”nti vuttanti āha
analyzed: tuṇhībhāvassa anavasesa tāya api vaṇṇam dassetum pāḷiyam tuṇhībhūtanti vuttanti āha
translated: The words “when they were silent” are said in the text in order to show the excellence of the entire Sangha’s silence.

original: “yato yato…pe… natthī”ti. Hatthassa kukkuccatā asaṃyamo asampajaññakiriyā hatthakukkuccaṃ.
analyzed: yatas yatas upe natthi iti hatthassa kukkucca tā asaṃyamaḥ asampajañña kiriyā hattha kukkuccam
translated: “From whatever direction there is no danger, there is no fear.” Lack of restraint, lack of clear comprehension in the use of the hand is “fear of the hand.”

original: Tathā pādakukkuccaṃ veditabbaṃ, vā-saddo avuttavikappattho, tena tadaññesamabhāvo🔽vibhāvitoti daṭṭhabbaṃ.
analyzed: tathā pāda kukkuccam veditabbam vā saddaḥ avutta vikappa atthaḥ tena tad aññesamabhāvaḥ  vibhāvito ti daṭṭhabbam
translated: Fear of the foot should be understood in the same way. The word “or” has the meaning of “or else.” Therefore it should be regarded as excluding the other.

original: Pañcapasādehīti pañcavaṇṇehi pasādehi. Vossaggattho yathāruci kiriyāya vossajjanaṃ.
analyzed: pañca pasādehi iti pañca vaṇṇehi pasādehi vossagga atthaḥ yathāruci kiriyāya vossajjanam
translated: “With the five kinds of confidence”: with the five kinds of confidence in color. “Giving up” is the giving up of action according to one’s wish.

original: Pucchanattheti paṭikkhepamukheneva pucchanatthe nakāro, me kiñci kiriyaṃ vā vācasikaṃ
analyzed: pucchana tthe ti paṭikkhepa mukhena iva pucchana tthe nakāraḥ me kiñci kiriyam vā vācasikam
translated: The letter na in the sense of asking is the letter na in the sense of asking by way of a prohibition. “Do you not find fault with me for any action or for any verbal act?

original: vā na garahatha, kiṃ nu garahatha kāyavācāhīti attho. Keci “dvārānevā”ti dvārasīsena
analyzed: vā na garahatha kim nu garahatha kāya vācāhi iti keci dvārān eva ati dvāra sīsena
translated: What is it that you find fault with, whether bodily or verbal?” Some say that the word dvārāni is the door-sill,

original: dvārappavattacariyaṃ vadanti. Visuddhipavāraṇāya adhippetattā yena pavāritaṃ, teneva🔽visuddhīti ñāyati, yena na pavāritaṃ. Kiṃ nu taṃ avisuddhanti siyā kassaci puthujjanassa
analyzed: dvāra ppavatta cariyam vadanti visuddhi pavāraṇāya adhippeta ttā yena pavāritam tena iva  visuddhi iti ñāyati yena na pavāritam kim nu tam a visuddham ti siyā kassaci puthujjanassa
translated: and that the word vā is the conduct that occurs at the door. Since the purification by means of the invitation is intended, it is known that by whom the invitation is made, by him there is purification.

original: āsaṅkā? Tannivāraṇatthamāha “no aparisuddhattā”ti. Manodvāraṃ parisuddhaṃ asucikārakaupakkilesānaṃ
analyzed: āsaṅkā tad nivāraṇa attham āha manaḥ dvāram parisuddham
translated: By whom the invitation is not made, what is it that is not purified? It may be that some ordinary person has a doubt. For the purpose of preventing that, he says, “Not because of impurity.” The mind-door is purified because the defilements that cause impurity are removed.

original: dūrīkatattā. Idāni etarahi buddhakāle. Etthāti manodvāraparisuddhiyaṃ.
analyzed: dūrīkata ttā idāni etarahi buddha kāle ettha ati
translated: Now, at this time, at the time of the Buddha. Here, in the purification of the mind-door.

original: Kāyavacīsamācāraparisuddhiyā paveditāya manosamācāraparisuddhi atthato paveditāva
analyzed: kāya vacī samācāra parisuddhiyā paveditāya manaḥ samācāra parisuddhi atthato
translated: When the purification of bodily and verbal conduct is announced, the purification of mental conduct is announced in meaning.

original: hotīti “kāyikaṃ vā vācasikaṃ vā”iccevāha. Tathā hi vuttaṃ “kāyikaṃ vā vācasikaṃ vāti
analyzed: hoti iti kāyikam vā vācasikam vā icca iva āha tathā hi vuttam kāyikam vā vācasikam vā ati
translated: Therefore, he says, “whether bodily or verbal.” Thus it is said, “whether bodily or verbal.”

original: idaṃ catunnaṃ arakkhiyataṃ sandhāya thero āhā”ti. “Bhikkhave, pavāremi vo”ti bhikkhusaṅghavisayattā🔽pavāraṇāya tattha bhikkhusaṅghena vattabbaṃ paṭivacanaṃ dento dhammasenāpati “bhikkhusaṅghassa🔽bhāraṃ vahanto”ti vutto. Tenāha “na kho mayaṃ, bhante”tiādi. Arakkhiyānīti parānuvādato
analyzed: idam catunnam arakkhiya tam sandhāya theraḥ āha ati bhikkhave pavāremi vaḥ ti bhikkhu saṅgha visaya ttā  pavāraṇāya tattha bhikkhu saṅghena vattabbam paṭivacanam dentaḥ dhammasenāpati bhikkhu saṅghassa  bhāram vahanto ti vuttaḥ tena āha na kho mayam bhante tiādi arakkhiyāni iti para anuvādato
translated: “Bhikkhus, I invite your criticism.”

original: na bhāyitabbāni suparisuddhabhāvato.🔽“Anuppannassā”ti idaṃ adhippāyikavacananti tadadhippāyaṃ vivaranto “kassapasammāsambuddhato🔽paṭṭhāyā”tiādimāha. Kassapasammāsambuddhatoti vibhatte nissakkaṃ, tasmā kassapasammāsambuddhato🔽oranti atthoti. Aññenāti ito bhagavato aññena. Anuppāditapubbassāti parasantāne na
analyzed: na bhāyitabbāni su parisuddha bhāvataḥ  anuppannassa ati idam adhippāyika vacanan ti tad adhippāyam vivarantaḥ kassapa sammāsambuddhato  paṭṭhāya ati ādim āha kassapa sammāsambuddhato ti vibhatte nissakkam tasmā kassapa sammāsambuddhato  oḥ anti atthaḥ ti aññena ati itas bhagavataḥ aññena an uppādita pubbassa ati para santāne na
translated: The Lord of the Dhamma, the General of the Dhamma,

original: uppāditapubbassa. Sasantāne pana paccekabuddhānaṃ vasena na uppāditoti na sakkā vattuṃ.
analyzed: uppādita pubbassa sa santāne pana paccekabuddhānam vasena na uppādito ti na sakkā vattum
translated: the Leader of the Dhamma, the Teacher of the Dhamma, the Proclaimer of the Dhamma, the Expounder of the Dhamma, the Bearer of the Dhamma, the Bearer of the Burden of the Dhamma, the One who has attained the Dhamma, the One who has attained the Burden of the Dhamma, the One who has attained the Burden of the Dhamma, the One who has attained the Burden of the Dhamma, the One who has attained the Burden of the Dhamma, the One who has attained the Burden of the Dhamma, the One who has attained the Burden of the Dhamma, the One who has attained the Burden of the Dhamma, the One who has attained the Burden of the Dhamma, the One who has attained the Burden of the Dhamma, the One who has attained the Burden of the Dhamma, the One who has attained the Burden of the Dhamma, the One who has attained the Burden of the Dhamma, the One who has attained the Burden of the Dhamma, the One who has attained the Burden of the Dhamma, the One who has attained the Burden of the Dhamma, the One who has attained the Burden of the Dhamma, the One who has attained the Burden of the Dhamma, the One who has attained the Burden of the Dhamma, the One who has attained the Burden of the Dhamma, the One who has attained the Burden of the Dhamma, the One who has attained the Burden of the Dhamma, the One who has attained the Burden of the Dhamma, the One who has attained the Burden of the Dhamma, the One who has attained the Burden of the Dhamma, the One who has attained the Burden of the Dhamma, the One who has attained the Burden of the Dhamma, the One who has attained the Burden of the Dhamma, the One who has attained the Burden of the Dhamma, the One who has attained the Burden of the Dhamma, the One who has attained the Burden of the Dhamma, the One who has attained the Burden of the Dhamma, the One who has attained the Burden of the Dhamma, the One who has attained the Burden of the Dhamma, the One who has attained the Burden of the Dhamma, the One who

original: Samanuāgatāti sammā anu upagatā. Bhagavato sīlādayo guṇāti buddhabhūtassa guṇā adhippetāti
analyzed: samanuāgatā iti sammā anu upagatā bhagavataḥ sīla ādayaḥ guṇā ati buddha bhūtassa guṇā adhippetā ati
translated: ‘They have come to the Blessed One’: they have come to the Blessed One rightly. ‘The Blessed One’s virtue and so on’: the qualities of the Enlightened One are intended.

original: āha “arahattamaggameva nissāya āgatā”ti. Sabbaguṇāti dasabalañāṇādayo sabbe buddhaguṇā.🔽Bhanteti ettha itisaddo ādiattho. Tena “imesaṃ pana…pe… vācasikaṃ vā”ti yāvāyaṃ pāḷipadeso,
analyzed: āha arahatta maggam eva nissāya āgatā iti sabba guṇā iti dasa bala ñāṇa ādayo sabbe buddha guṇā  bhante iti ettha iti saddo ādi attho tena imesam vācasikam vāti yāvā ayam pāḷi padesaḥ
translated: So it is said: ‘They have come depending on the Arahant path alone.’ ‘All the qualities’: all the Enlightened One’s qualities, that is to say, the ten powers of knowledge and so on.🔽‘Bhante’: the word iti has the meaning of ‘and so on.’ Therefore it includes all this text beginning with ‘These, venerable sir, are the four kinds of persons found existing in the world’ and ending with ‘verbal or mental action.’

original: taṃ sabbaṃ gaṇhāti. Tenāha “idaṃ thero…pe… pavārento āhā”ti.🔽Yaṃ attano puññānubhāvasiddhaṃ cakkaratanaṃ nippariyāyato tena pavattitaṃ nāma, na
analyzed: tam sabbam gaṇhāti tena āha idam pavārentaḥ āha ati  yam puñña anubhāva siddham cakka ratanam tena pavattitam nāma na
translated: So it is said: ‘The Elder, when he was inviting, said this.’🔽The wheel treasure that is established by the Elder’s own merit is called ‘turned by him’ in the absolute sense,

original: itaranti paṭhamanayo vutto. Yasmā pavattitasseva anupavattanaṃ, paṭhamanayo ca taṃsadise
analyzed: itarat ti paṭhama nayaḥ vuttaḥ yasmā anupavattanam paṭhama nayaḥ ca tad sadise
translated: but not the other. So the first method is stated. Because it is the non-turning of what has been turned, and because the first method is stated by way of that and of the expression of it,

original: tabbohāravasena vuttoti taṃ anādiyitvā dutiyanayo vutto. Dasavidhanti antojanasmiṃ,
analyzed: tad bohāra vasena vuttaḥ ti tam an ādiyitvā dutiya nayaḥ vuttaḥ dasavidhanti antojanasmin
translated: the second method is stated without taking that into account. ‘Tenfold’: in the case of the people inside,

original: balakāye rakkhāvaraṇaguttiyā saṃvidhānaṃ, khattiyesu anuyuttesu, brāhmaṇagahapatikesu,
analyzed: balakāye rakkhā āvaraṇa guttiyā saṃvidhānam khattiyesu anuyuttesu brāhmaṇa gahapatikesu
translated: the making of a plan for protection, preservation, and defense in the army, in the case of the nobles, the princes, the brahmans and householders,

original: negamajānapadesu, samaṇabrāhmaṇesu, migapakkhīsu adhammacārapaṭikkhepo, adhanānaṃ🔽dhanānuppadānaṃ, samaṇabrāhmaṇe upasaṅkamitvā pañhapucchananti evaṃ dasavidhaṃ. Tattha
analyzed: negama jānapadesu samaṇa brāhmaṇesu miga pakkhīsu adhamma cāra paṭikkhepaḥ a dhanānam  dhana anuppadānam samaṇa brāhmaṇe upasaṅkamitvā pañha pucchanam ti evam dasavidham tattha
translated: In the case of the people of the town and countryside, ascetics and brahmans, and animals and birds, it is the prohibition of unrighteous conduct. In the case of the poor, it is the provision of wealth. In the case of ascetics and brahmans, it is the asking of questions after approaching them. Thus it is tenfold. Herein,

original: gahapatike pakkhijāte ca visuṃ katvā gahaṇavasena dvādasavidhaṃ. Cakkavattivattanti🔽cakkavattibhāvāvahaṃ vattaṃ. Yasmā yāthāvato pavattitaṃ, tadanurūpakaṃ pana ñāyena
analyzed: gahapatike pakkhi jāte ca visum katvā gahaṇa vasena dvādasavidham cakkavatti vattanti  cakkavatti bhāva āvaham vattam yasmā yāthāvato tad anurūpakam pana ñāyena
translated: by taking the householders and the birds separately, it is twelvefold. The practice of a Wheel-turning Monarch is

original: yuttakena pavattitaṃ nāma hotīti āha “sammā nayena hetunā kāraṇenā”ti. Ubhatobhāgavimuttāti
analyzed: yuttakena pavattitam nāma hoti iti āha sammā nayena hetunā kāraṇena ati ubhatobhāga vimuttā ati
translated: the practice that brings about the state of a Wheel-turning Monarch. Since it is rightly carried out, it is called “carried out by a right means”

original: ubhayabhāgehi ubhayabhāgato vimuttāti ayamettha atthoti dasseti “dvīhi bhāgehi vimuttā,
analyzed: ubhaya bhāgehi ubhaya bhāgataḥ vimuttā ati ayam ettha atthaḥ ti dasseti dvīhi bhāgehi vimuttā
translated: in accordance with it. “Freed in both ways” : he shows that the meaning here is “freed in both ways from both kinds” . “ Freed in two ways”

original: arūpā…pe… nāmakāyato”ti iminā. Tevijjādibhāvanti tevijjachaḷabhiññacatuppaṭisambhidabhāvaṃ.
analyzed: arūpa ape iminā tevijja ādi bhāvanti tevijja chaḷabhiñña catuppaṭisambhida bhāvam
translated: means freed from both kinds. “From the form … and the mental body” : this is shown by this. The state of one possessing the three knowledges, etc., is the state of one possessing the three knowledges, the six direct knowledges, the four discriminations,

original: Paññāvimuttā hi taṃ tividhaṃ appattā kevalaṃ paññāya eva vimuttā.
analyzed: paññā vimuttā hi tam tividham a pattā kevalam paññāya eva vimuttā
translated: for those who are freed by understanding have not attained that threefold state. They are only freed by understanding.

original: Visuddhatthāyāti visuddhipavāraṇatthāya. Saṃyojanaṭṭhena saṃyojanasaṅkhāte ceva bandhanaṭṭhena🔽bandhanasaṅkhāte ca. Vijitasaṅgāmanti yathā rāgādayo puna na sīsaṃ ukkhipanti, evaṃ
analyzed: visuddha tthāya ati visuddhi pavāraṇa tthāya saṃyojana ṭṭhena saṃyojana saṅkhāte ca iva bandhana ṭṭhena  bandhana saṅkhāte ca yathā rāga ādayaḥ puna na sīsam ukkhipanti evam
translated: For the sake of purification: for the purpose of the invitation ceremony, which is purification. In the sense of fetters: in the sense of the fetters called “bonds” and “chains.”

original: ariyamaggasenāya vasena vijitasaṅgāmaṃ. Tenāha “vijitarāgadosamohasaṅgāma”nti. Mārabalassāti
analyzed: ariya magga senāya vasena vijita saṅgāmam tena āha vijita rāga dosa moha saṅgāmanti māra balassa ati
translated: The battle has been won: just as passion, etc., do not raise their heads again, so the battle with passion, etc., has been won by the army of the noble path. Thus it is said: “The battle with passion, hatred, and delusion has been won.”🔽The power of Mara: the army of Mara, or the ability of Mara.🔽The assembly of disciples: the group of those to be trained.

original: mārasenāya, mārassa vā sāmatthiyassa. Veneyyasatthanti vinetabbajanasamūhaṃ. Sakaṭādisatthasabhāgato
analyzed: māra senāya mārassa vā sāmatthiyassa veneyya sattham ti vinetabba jana samūham sakaṭa ādi sattha sabhāgataḥ
translated: The assembly of disciples is like a cart, etc.,

original: vineyyova satthoti taṃ veneyyasatthaṃ. Sīlasārādiabhāvato antotuccho.
analyzed: vineyyaḥ uva sattho ti tam veneyya sattham sīla sāra ādi abhāvataḥ antotucchaḥ
translated: and the disciples are the assembly of disciples. He is empty within because he lacks the essence of virtue, etc.

original: Pavāraṇāsuttavaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: pavāraṇā sutta vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: The commentary on the Invitation Sutta is finished.

original: 8. Parosahassasuttavaṇṇanā
analyzed: parosahassa sutta vaṇṇanā
translated: The commentary on the Discourse on More Than a Thousand

original: 216. Sahassato paraṃ aḍḍhateyyabhikkhusataṃ tadā bhagavantaṃ payirupāsatīti āha “parosahassanti
analyzed: sahassataḥ param aḍḍhateyya bhikkhu satam tadā bhagavantam payirupāsati iti āha parosahassam ti
translated: “More than a thousand” means “more than one thousand.”

original: atirekasahassa”nti. Nibbāne kutoci bhayaṃ natthīti kutocipi kāraṇato nibbāne bhayaṃ
analyzed: atireka sahassanti nibbāne kutoci bhayam natthi iti kutocipi kāraṇataḥ nibbāne bhayam
translated: There is no danger in Nibbāna from anywhere: there is no danger in Nibbāna from any cause.

original: natthi asaṅkhatabhāvena sabbaso khemattā. Tenāha bhagavā – “khemañca vo, bhikkhave,🔽dhammaṃ desessāmi khemagāminiñca paṭipada”ntiādi. Na kutoci bhayaṃ etasmiṃ adhigateti🔽akutobhayaṃ, nibbānaṃ. Tenāha “nibbānappattassā”tiādi. Vipassito paṭṭhāyāti amhākaṃ🔽bhagavato nāmavasena isīnaṃ sattamabhāvadassanatthaṃ vuttaṃ. Te hi tattha tattha🔽sutte bahuso kittitā. Isīnanti vā paccekabuddhasāvakabāhirakaisīnaṃ sattamo uttaro seṭṭhoti attho.🔽Aṭṭhuppattivasenāti kāraṇasamuṭṭhānavasena. Tadassa aṭṭhuppattiṃ vibhāvetuṃ “saṅghamajjhe”tiādi
analyzed: natthi asaṅkhata bhāvena sabbaso khema ttā tena āha bhagavā khemam ca vaḥ bhikkhave  dhammam desessāmi khema gāminim ca paṭipad anti ādi na kutoci bhayam etasmin adhigatā iti  akutobhayam nibbānam tena āha nibbāna ppattassa atiādi vipassito paṭṭhāya ati amhākam  bhagavataḥ nāma vasena isīnam sattama bhāva dassana attham vuttam te hi tattha tattha  sutte bahuso kittitā isīnam ti vā paccekabuddha sāvaka bāhiraka esīnam sattamaḥ uttaraḥ seṭṭhaḥ ti attho  aṭṭhuppatti vasena āti kāraṇa samuṭṭhāna vasena tat assa aṭṭhuppattim vibhāvetum saṅgha majjhe tiādi
translated: there is no safety in the sense of complete security by way of the unconditioned. Hence the Blessed One said: “Bhikkhus, I shall teach you the Dhamma that is wholesome… and the way that leads to safety” .  Nibbana is “free from fear” because no fear comes from any quarter when it is attained. Hence it is said: “When nibbana is attained” .🔽“Starting with Vipassi” : this is said in order to show that our Blessed One was the seventh in succession. For they are all extolled in many places in the suttas.🔽“The seventh of the seers” : the meaning is that he was the best, the highest, among the seers, both the paccekabuddhas and the ordinary seers outside the Dispensation.🔽“By way of the origin of the Thread” : by way of the reason for the Thread. In order to illustrate that reason, he said: “In the midst of the Sangha” .🔽🔽

original: vuttaṃ. Paṭibhānasampannavācāya aññe īsati abhibhavatīti vaṅgīso. Tenāha “paṭibhānasampatti”ntiādi.
analyzed: vuttam paṭibhāna sampanna vācāya aññe īsati abhibhavati iti vaṅgīso tena āha paṭibhāna sampatti ntiādi
translated: because there is no complete safety through the unformed element. Hence the Blessed One said: “Bhikkhus, I shall teach you a Dhamma that is auspicious … ” . It is free from fear from any quarter because no fear comes from it when it is attained. Hence it is said: “When he has reached Nibbāna” . Beginning with Vipassī: this is said in order to show that he was the seventh of our Blessed Ones. For they are extolled in many places in the suttas. The seventh, best, highest of seers: the meaning is that he was the seventh, best, highest of the seers, both the Paccekabuddhas and the disciples, and of those outside the Dispensation. By way of the origin of the Thread: by way of the origin of the Thread’s occurrence. In order to demonstrate that origin he said “in the midst of the Order” . He is a seer who overpowers others with speech endowed with inspired insight. Hence he said “inspired insight” .

original: Kilesummujjanasatānīti rāgādikilesānaṃ rajjanadussanādinayehi savisaye ayoniso uṭṭhānāni.
analyzed: kilesa ummujjana satāni iti rāga ādi kilesānam rajjana dussana ādi nayehi sa visaye ayonisas uṭṭhānāni
translated: “Hundreds of thoughts of defilement”: thoughts of lust, etc., that arise in the relevant object by way of lust, hatred, etc.

original: Yadi anekāni satāni, atha kasmā “ummaggapatha”nti? Vuttanti āha “vaṭṭapathattā pana
analyzed: yadi anekāni satāni atha kasmai ummagga pathanti vuttanti āha vaṭṭa patha ttā pana
translated: If there are many hundreds, why is it called “the path to the further shore”?

original: patha”nti. Rāgadosamohamānadiṭṭhivasena rāgakhilādīni pañcakhilāni. Vibhajantanti
analyzed: rāga dosa moha māna diṭṭhi vasena rāga khila ādīni pañca khilāni
translated: The five hindrances of sensual desire, ill will, dullness and drowsiness, restlessness and remorse, and doubt.🔽“Explaining”: teaching by way of analysis.

original: vibhajanavasena kathentaṃ. Vibhajitvāti ñāṇena vivecetvā.
analyzed: vibhajana vasena kathentam vibhajitvā ati ñāṇena vivecetvā
translated: “Having analyzed”: having discerned by means of knowledge.🔽“The deathless has been declared”: the Dhamma that leads to the deathless has been taught.🔽“The seers of the Dhamma”: those who have seen the Dhamma by penetrating the truths.

original: Amate akkhāteti amatāvahe dhamme desite. Dhammassa passitāro saccasampaṭivedhena. Asaṃhīrā diṭṭhivātehi.
analyzed: amate akkhāteti amata āvahe dhamme desite dhammassa passitāro sacca sampaṭivedhena asaṃhīrāḥ diṭṭhi vātehi
translated: “Undaunted”: unmoved by the winds of views.🔽“Having pierced through”: having penetrated.🔽“The further shore”: the further shore in the sense of going beyond.🔽“The ten and a half”: the ten and a half higher fetters.

original: Ativijjhitvāti paṭivijjhitvā. Atikkamabhūtanti atikkamanaṭṭhena bhūtaṃ. Dasaddhānanti dasannaṃ upaḍḍhānaṃ. Tenāha “pañcanna”nti. Jānantenāti dhammassa sudullabhataṃ jānantena.🔽Parosahassasuttavaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.🔽9. Koṇḍaññasuttavaṇṇanā
analyzed: ativijjhitvā iti paṭivijjhitvā atikkama bhūtanti atikkamana aṭṭhena bhūtam dasaddhānam iti dasannam upaḍḍhānam tena āha pañcannam nti jānantena ati dhammassa su dullabha tam jānantena 🔽parosahassa sutta vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā 🔽koṇḍañña sutta vaṇṇanā
translated: “Knowing”: knowing the difficulty of finding the Dhamma.

original: 217. Evaṃgahitanāmoti “aññāsi vata, bho, koṇḍañño”ti satthu vacanaṃ nissāya bhikkhūhi
analyzed: evaṃgahita nāmo ti aññāsi vata bho koṇḍañño ti satthu vacanam nissāya bhikkhūhi
translated: “One who has grasped the name thus”: because of the words of the Teacher, “Koṇḍañña has understood,” the bhikkhus called him “Aññāsi Koṇḍañña” in order to distinguish him from other Koṇḍaññas.

original: aññehi koṇḍaññanāmakehi visesanatthaṃ evaṃgahitanāmo. Dvādasannaṃ saṃvaccharānaṃ
analyzed: aññehi koṇḍañña nāmakehi visesa nattham evaṃgahita nāmaḥ
translated: “For a long time”: for twelve years.🔽“In the abode of the Six-tusked One”: in the place where the Six-tusked King of Elephants lived.

original: vasena cirassaṃ. Chaddantabhavaneti chaddantanāgarājabhavanaṭṭhāne. Paññavā mahāsāvako
analyzed: vasena cirassam chaddanta bhavane ti chaddanta nāga rāja bhavana ṭṭhāne paññavā mahāsāvako
translated: “The wise great disciple”: because of his seniority.

original: rattaññutāya. “Dasasahassacakkavāḷe devamanussānanti dasasahassacakkavāḷe devānaṃ,🔽imasmiṃ cakkavāḷe devamanussānañcāti evaṃ dasasahassacakkavāḷe devamanussāna”nti
analyzed: rattaññu tāya dasa sahassa cakkavāḷe deva manussānam ti dasa sahassa cakkavāḷe devānam  imasmin cakkavāḷe deva manussānam ca ati evam dasa sahassa cakkavāḷe deva manussānam ti
translated: “In the ten-thousandfold world-element”: in the ten-thousand world-element, among the gods and men of this world-element,🔽they say.🔽“The beginning”: the first.

original: vadanti. Aggantiādito. Tatthāti mandākinitīre.
analyzed: vadanti tattha ati mandākini tīre
translated: “There”: on the banks of the Mandākini River.🔽“For a Rains”: for a Rains-residence.🔽“Him”: the Elder Aññāsi Koṇḍañña.

original: Vassaggenāti vassapaṭipāṭiyā. Tanti aññāsikoṇḍaññattheraṃ. Mahābrahmānaṃ viya lokiyamanussā
analyzed: vassaggena ati vassa paṭipāṭiyā mahābrahmānam viya lokiya manussā
translated: “As men do the Great Brahma”: as men do the Great Brahma.🔽“The foremost”: the chief.

original: harāyanti. Pāmokkhabhūto āyasmā thero antarantarā tattha tattha janapade vasitvā
analyzed: āyasmā theraḥ antar antarā tattha tattha janapade vasitvā
translated: “The Elder, dwelling here and there”: the Elder, dwelling here and there in the various countries.

original: tadanukkamena mandākinitīraṃ upagato, tasmā vuttaṃ – “icchāmahaṃ, bhante, janapade vasitu”nti.
analyzed: tad anukkamena mandākini tīram upagataḥ tasmā vuttam icchāmaham bhante janapade vasitun ti
translated: and in due course he came to the bank of the Mandākini River. That is why he said: “I wish, venerable sir, to live in the countryside.”

original: Ānubhāvasampannā dibbāyukā te hatthināgāti vuttaṃ “pubbe paccekabuddhānaṃ pāricariyāya🔽kataparicayā”ti. Therassa sañcaraṇaṭṭhāne āvaraṇasākhā haritvā apanetvā. Mukhodakañceva🔽dantakaṭṭhañca ṭhapetīti saḷaladevadārukaṭṭhādīni aññamaññaṃ ghaṃsitvā aggiṃ nibbattetvā
analyzed: ānubhāva sampannāḥ dibba āyukā te hatthi nāgā ti vuttam pubbe paccekabuddhānam pāricariyāya  kata paricayā ti therassa sañcaraṇa ṭṭhāne āvaraṇa sākhāḥ haritvā apanetvā mukha udakam ca iva  danta kaṭṭham ca ṭhapeti iti saḷala devadāru kaṭṭha ādīni aññam aññam ghaṃsitvā aggim nibbattetvā
translated: They were divine elephants, endowed with the thirty-two marks, and they had been his companions in previous births when he was a Paccekabuddha.🔽He cut away the obstructing branches and removed them. He set out water for drinking and a tooth-stick.🔽He rubbed together two pieces of wood from the sala-tree, etc., and produced fire.

original: jāletvā tattha pāsāṇakhaṇḍāni tāpetvā tāni daṇḍakehi vaṭṭetvā taḷākāsu udakasoṇḍīsu🔽khipitvā udakassa tattabhāvaṃ ñatvā nāgalatādantakaṭṭhaṃ upanento mukhodakañca ṭhapeti.
analyzed: jāletvā tattha pāsāṇa khaṇḍāni tāpetvā tāni daṇḍakehi vaṭṭetvā taḷākāsu udaka soṇḍīsu  khipitvā udakassa tatta bhāvam ñatvā nāga latā danta kaṭṭham upanentaḥ mukha udakam ca ṭhapeti
translated: He heated some stones and churned them with a stick.🔽He threw them into the ponds and knew that the water was warm. Then he brought the tooth-stick of the nāgalatā-tree and set out the water for drinking.

original: Vattaṃ karotīti antokuṭiyā bahi ca pamukhepi aṅgaṇepi sākhābhaṅgehi sammajjanto vakkhamānanayena
analyzed: vattam karoti iti antar kuṭiyā bahi ca pamukhe api aṅgaṇe api sa ākhābhaṅgehi sammajjantaḥ vakkhamāna nayena
translated: He performed his duties. He swept the interior of the hut and the courtyard with branches of trees.

original: āhāraṃ upanento vattaṃ karoti.
analyzed: āhāram upanentaḥ vattam karoti
translated: He brought food in the manner of a beggar and performed his duties.

original: Patiṭṭhappamāṇeti kaṭippamāṇe, ayameva vā pāṭho tāva mahantamevāti yāva mahantaṃ
analyzed: patiṭṭhappamāṇe iti kaṭippamāṇe ayam eva vā pāṭhaḥ tāva mahantam eva ati yāva mahantam
translated: ‘The size of the buttocks’: the size of the buttocks. Or this is the reading: ‘as big as the buttocks’. ‘As big as’: as much as.

original: setapadumavanaṃ, tāva mahantameva. Eseva nayo rattakumudavanādīsu. Khādantā manussā.
analyzed: setapadumavanam tāva mahantam eva esā iva ratta kumuda vana ādīsu khādantā manussā
translated: ‘A bed of white lotuses’: a bed of white lotuses as big as that. So too with the red lotuses, etc. ‘People eating’:

original: Pakkapayoghanikā viyāti supakkapayoghanaṃ viya. Ghanabhāvena pana pakkhittakhuddamadhu
analyzed: pakka payaḥ ghanikā viya ati su pakka payaḥ ghanam viya ghana bhāvena pana pakkhitta khudda madhu
translated: ‘Like a lump of boiled rice’: like a lump of well-cooked rice. But by its density it is like a small lump of honey pressed together.

original: viya hoti. Tenāha “etaṃ pokkharamadhu nāmā”ti. Muḷālanti setapadumānaṃ mūlaṃ. Bhisanti
analyzed: viya hoti tena āha etam pokkhara madhu nāma ati muḷālanti seta padumānam mūlam bhisanti
translated: Hence it is called ‘pokkhara-honey’. ‘Roots’: the roots of the white lotuses. ‘Bulbs’:

original: tesaṃyeva kandaṃ. Ekasmiṃ pabbeti ekekasmiṃ pabbantare. Pādaghaṭakanti doṇassa catubhāgo
analyzed: tesam yeva kandam ekasmim pabbeti ekekasmim pabbantare pāda ghaṭakam ti doṇassa catubhāgaḥ
translated: the bulbs of the same. ‘In each interstice’: in each space between the lotuses. ‘The size of a doṇa’: a doṇa is a quarter of a bushel,

original: saṇṭhānato khuddako, tasmā pādaghaṭakappamāṇanti tumbamattaṃ. Soṇḍiāvāṭeti khuddakasoṇḍiyo
analyzed: saṇṭhānato khuddako tasmā tumba mattam khuddaka soṇḍiyo
translated: and it is small in shape. Therefore ‘the size of a doṇa’ means the size of a tumbler. ‘Small stalks and small interstices’:

original: ceva khuddakaāvāṭe ca.
analyzed: ca iva khuddaka āvāṭe ca
translated: small stalks and small spaces between the lotuses.

original: Etaṃ bhojananti yathāvuttaṃ nirudakapāyasabhojanaṃ. Keci sañjānanti ye therā vuḍḍhatarā. Keci na sañjānanti ye navā acirapabbajitā.
analyzed: etam bhojanam ti yathā vuttam nirudaka pāyasa bhojanam keci sañjānanti ye therāḥ vuḍḍhatarāḥ keci na sañjānanti ye navāḥ acira pabbajitā
translated: ‘This food’: the food consisting of the above-mentioned rice-gruel without curry. ‘Some of the elders who were senior to him knew it’: some of the elders who were senior to him knew it. ‘Some of the younger monks who had recently gone forth did not know it’: some of the younger monks who had recently gone forth did not know it.

original: Buddhānubuddhoti buddhassa anubuddho. Bāḷhavīriyoti catunnaṃ sammappadhānānaṃ vasena
analyzed: buddha anubuddhaḥ ti buddhassa anubuddhaḥ bāḷha vīriyaḥ ti catunnam sammappadhānānam vasena
translated: “Enlightened after the Enlightened One”: enlightened after the Enlightened One. “Of great energy”: he was one who had accumulated energy over a long period by means of the four right strivings.

original: ciranicitavīriyo. Tiṇṇaṃ vivekānanti kāyacittaupadhivivekānaṃ lābhīti yojanā. Catasso
analyzed: cira nicita vīriyaḥ kāya citta aupadhi vivekānam lābhī iti yojanā catasso
translated: “The three kinds of seclusion”: he was one who had attained the three kinds of seclusion, that is, seclusion of body, mind, and cognizance.

original: vadati vaṅgīsatthero sayaṃpaṭibhānaṃ, na sesābhiññānaṃ abhāvatoti āha “itarā”tiādi.🔽Parisā sannisīdi nissaddabhāvena tuṇhī ahosīti attho. Anujānāpesīti paṭhamaṃ attanā
analyzed: vadati vaṅgīsa theraḥ sayaṃpaṭibhānam na sesa abhiññānam abhāvato ti āha itara atiādi  parisā sannisīdi nissadda bhāvena tuṇhī ahosi iti attho anujānāpesi iti paṭhamam attanā
translated: The Elder Vaṅgīsa himself composed this verse, which is called a “self-inspired utterance,” not because he had no other kinds of direct-knowledge, but because he had attained the highest kind.🔽The assembly sat down in silence.

original: ñātaṃ upaṭṭhitaṃ attano parinibbānakālaṃ anu pacchā satthāraṃ jānāpesīti evaṃ ettha attho daṭṭhabbo.
analyzed: ñātam upaṭṭhitam attanaḥ parinibbāna kālam anu pacchā satthāram jānāpesi iti evam ettha atthaḥ daṭṭhabbo
translated: He asked the Teacher to allow him to do so. The meaning should be regarded here as follows: first he himself knew and remembered the time of his own final extinction, and afterwards he asked the Teacher to allow him to do so.

original: Tanti āsāḷhipuṇṇamāya isipatane yaṃ dassanaṃ, yaṃ vā dukkaracariyāyaṃ tumhākaṃ upaṭṭhānaṃ
analyzed: tanti āsāḷhipuṇṇamāye isipatane yam dassanam yam vā dukkara cariyāyam tumhākam upaṭṭhānam
translated: “The first sight” was the sight of the Blessed One on the night of his enlightenment or the sight of him when he came to Uruvelā and performed the Twin Miracle.🔽“The first sound” was the sound of the Blessed One’s voice when he first saw him.

original: ādito dassanaṃ, taṃ, bhante, paṭhamadassanaṃ. Onatavinatāti heṭṭhā upari ca onatā🔽vinatā. Kampetvāti thokaṃ cāletvā dassanatthaṃ ekaninnādo tesaṃ hatthināgānañceva
analyzed: āditas dassanam tam bhante paṭhama dassanam onata vinatā ati heṭṭhā upari ca onatā 🔽vinatā kampetvā ti thokam cāletvā dassana attham eka ninnādaḥ tesam hatthi nāgānam ca eva
translated: “The first tremor” was the tremor of the earth when the Blessed One first saw him.

original: nāgayakkhakumbhaṇḍānaṃ devatānañca saddena. Brahmāno devānaṃ adaṃsūti sambandho.
analyzed: nāga yakkha kumbhaṇḍānam devatānam ca saddena brahmānaḥ devānam adaṃsu iti sambandhaḥ
translated: And by the sound of nāgas, yakkhas, and kumbhaṇḍas, and of deities. The brahmins gave to the deities.

original: Sajjhāyamakaṃsu pasādanīyesu pasādavasena sannipatitaparisāya pasādajananatthaṃ bhagavati
analyzed: pasādanīyesu pasāda vasena sannipatita parisāya pasāda janana attham bhagavati
translated: They rehearsed the Dhamma for the sake of generating confidence in the assembly that had gathered there, by way of confidence in the Blessed One.

original: nikkhamitvāti bhagavati gandhakuṭito nikkhamitvā. Dharatiyevāti aduṭṭhataṃ patvā tiṭṭhateva.
analyzed: nikkhamitvā ti bhagavati gandhakuṭitaḥ nikkhamitvā dharatiyā iva ati patvā tiṭṭhatā iva
translated: Having gone forth: having gone forth from the Fragrant Cottage. It remains: it remains without hatred.

original: Koṇḍaññasuttavaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: koṇḍañña sutta vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: The Commentary on the Koṇḍañña Sutta is finished.

original: 10. Moggallānasuttavaṇṇanā
analyzed: moggallāna sutta vaṇṇanā
translated: The Moggallāna Sutta

original: 218. Paccavekkhatīti tesaṃ ariyānaṃ cittaṃ attano ñāṇacakkhunā pati avekkhati paccavekkhati.
analyzed: paccavekkhati iti tesam ariyānam cittam attanaḥ ñāṇa cakkhunā pati avekkhati paccavekkhati
translated: He looks on: he looks on at, he reviews, their minds with his knowledge-eye.

original: Pabbatassāti isigilipabbatassa. Dukkhapāraṃ gatanti vaṭṭadukkhassa pāraṃ pariyantaṃ
analyzed: pabbatassa ati isigili pabbatassa dukkha pāram gatam ti vaṭṭa dukkhassa pāram pariyantam
translated: Of the mountain: of the Isigili mountain. Reached the further shore of suffering: reached the further shore, the end, of the suffering of the round.

original: gataṃ. Sabbaguṇasampannanti sabbehi buddhaguṇehi ca sāvakaguṇehi ca paripuṇṇaṃ. Anekākārasampannanti
analyzed: gatam sabba guṇa sampannanti sabbehi buddha guṇehi ca sāvaka guṇehi ca paripuṇṇam aneka ākāra sampannanti
translated: Endowed with all good qualities: endowed with all the qualities of a Buddha and the qualities of a disciple. Endowed with many a mode:

original: rūpaghosalūkhadhammappamāṇikānaṃ sattānaṃ tehi tehi ākārehi sabbesañca anekehi anantāparimeyyehi
analyzed: rūpa ghosa lūkha dhamma ppamāṇikānam sattānam tehi tehi ākārehi sabbesam ca anekehi ananta aparimeyyehi
translated: with the modes of beings of the four types, namely, those of form, sound, smell, taste, and touch, and with the many infinite and immeasurable modes of all.

original: pasīditabbākārehi samannāgataṃ. Te pana ākārā yasmā anaññasādhāraṇā buddhaguṇā eva,
analyzed: pasīditabba ākārehi samannāgatam te pana ākārāḥ yasmai anañña sādhāraṇāḥ buddha guṇāḥ eva
translated: and he is endowed with the aspects of being inspiring. But since these aspects are not shared by others, they are the Buddha’s qualities alone.

original: tasmā āha “anekehi guṇehi samannāgata”nti.
analyzed: tasmai āha anekehi guṇehi
translated: Therefore it is said: “endowed with many qualities.”

original: Moggallānasuttavaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: moggallāna sutta vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: The commentary on the Moggallāna Sutta is finished.

original: 11. Gaggarāsuttavaṇṇanā
analyzed: gaggarā sutta vaṇṇanā
translated: The Gaggarā Sutta

original: 219. Teti te devamanusse. “Sarīravaṇṇenāti sarīre chavivaṇṇenā”ti vadanti. Sarīravaṇṇenāti🔽vā dhammarūpakāyaguṇena. “Yasasā”tipi pāṭho, so evattho. Vigatamaloti abbhāmahikādīhi
analyzed: te iti te deva manusse sarīra vaṇṇena ati sarīre chavi vaṇṇena ati vadanti sarīra vaṇṇena ati  vā dhamma rūpa kāya guṇena pāṭhaḥ saḥ evatthaḥ vigata malaḥ ti abbhā mahikā ādīhi
translated: “They” : those gods and men. “By his bodily appearance” : by the bodily colour, they say. “By his bodily appearance”🔽means by the qualities of the physical body and the body of the Dhamma. The reading is also “by his fame” , which has the same meaning. “Free from stain” : free from the defilements of conceit, etc.

original: vigatūpakkileso. Bhāṇu vuccati pabhā, sātisayo bhāṇu etassa atthīti bhāṇumā. Sūriyoti
analyzed: vigata upakkilesaḥ bhāṇu vuccati pabhā sa atisayaḥ bhāṇu etassa atthi iti bhāṇumā sūriyo ti
translated: “Light” is radiance. He has that in excess, therefore he is “radiant.” “Sun” :

original: āha “ādicco viyā”ti.
analyzed: āha ādiccaḥ viyāti
translated: he says: “like the sun.”

original: Gaggarāsuttavaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: gaggarā sutta vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: The commentary on the Gaggarā Sutta is finished.

original: 12. Vaṅgīsasuttavaṇṇanā🔽220. So kira vicaratīti sambandho. “Yathāyaṃ dīpo jambudīpoti jambunā paññāto, evāhampi
analyzed: vaṅgīsa sutta vaṇṇanā  saḥ kira vicarati iti sambandhaḥ yathā ayam dīpaḥ jambu dīpo ti jambunā paññātaḥ eva aham pi
translated: The Vaṅgīsa Sutta🔽“He roams about” : this is the connection. “Just as this island is known as the Rose-Apple Island because of the rose-apple ,

original: tena jambunā paññāyissa”nti jambusākhaṃ pariharitvā. Vādaṃ katvāti “imasmiṃ vāde
analyzed: tena jambunā paññāyissanti jambu sākham pariharitvā vādam katvā ati imasmin vāde
translated: so I will be known by that rose-apple.” After carrying off a branch of the rose-apple tree, he made a wager: “In this wager

original: sace te parājayo hoti, tvaṃ me dāso hohi. Sace me parājayo, ahaṃ te bhariyā”ti evaṃ
analyzed: sace te parājayaḥ tvam me dāsaḥ hohi sace me parājayaḥ aham te evam
translated: If you are defeated, you will be my slave. If I am defeated, I will be your wife.”

original: katikaṃ katvā. Vāde jayaparājayānubhāvenāti tathāpavattite vāde paribbājakassa jayānubhāvena
analyzed: katikam katvā vāde jaya parājaya anubhāvena ati tathā apavattite vāde paribbājakassa jaya anubhāvena
translated: Thus they made a wager. “By the power of victory or defeat in the debate”: by the power of the wanderer’s victory

original: ceva attano parājayena ca. Vayaṃ āgammāti sippuggahaṇavayaṃ āgamma. Vijjanti mantaṃ.
analyzed: ca iva attanaḥ parājayena ca vayam āgamma ati sippu gahaṇa vayam āgamma vijjanti mantam
translated: and his own defeat in the debate that ensued. “Having reached the age”: having reached the age of learning the craft. “They know the spell”: they know the spell.

original: Nibbattagativibhāvanavasena chavasīsabhāvaṃ dūseti vināsetīti chavadūsakaṃ sippaṃ,🔽tathāpavattaṃ mantapadaṃ. Attano ānubhāvenāti niraye nibbattasattassa sīsaṃ yattha🔽katthaci ṭhitaṃ buddhānubhāvena ānetvā dassetvā. Khīṇāsavassa sīsanti paramappicchatāya
analyzed: nibbatta gati vibhāvana vasena chava sīsa bhāvam dūseti vināseti iti chava dūsakam sippam  tathā apavattam manta padam attanaḥ ānubhāvena ati niraye nibbatta sattassa sīsam yattha  katthaci ṭhitam buddha anubhāvena ānetvā dassetvā khīṇāsavassa sīsanti parama ppiccha tāya
translated: The craft of the corpse-polluter is a craft that defiles the state of a corpse-seer by the distinction of rebirth and destiny.

original: kañcipi ajānāpetvā araññaṃ pavisitvā parinibbutassa khīṇāsavassa chaḍḍitaṃ sīsakaṭāhaṃ.
analyzed: kañcipi a jānāpetvā araññam pavisitvā parinibbutassa khīṇāsavassa chaḍḍitam sīsa kaṭāhaṃ
translated: The spell that is recited in that way. “By his own power”: by the power of the Buddha, he brought the head of a being reborn in hell, wherever it was, and showed it. “The head of one free from cankers”: the skull of one free from cankers, abandoned in the forest, without anyone knowing, by one who had attained final Nibbana out of supreme desire for solitude.

original: Dassesīti attano ānubhāvena ānetvā dassesi.
analyzed: dassesi iti attanaḥ ānubhāvena ānetvā dassesi
translated: “He showed”: he brought it by his own power and showed it.

original: “Tumhe, bho gotama, jānāthā”ti kāmaṃ vaṅgīso nibbattaṭṭhānaṃ sandhāya pucchati, bhagavā
analyzed: tumhe bho gotama jānātha ati kāmam vaṅgīsaḥ nibbatta ṭṭhānam sandhāya pucchati bhagavā
translated: “You know, Master Gotama?” He asks this referring to the place of his rebirth.

original: pana anupādisesanibbānaṃ sandhāya “āma, vaṅgīsa…pe… gatiṃ jānāmī”ti āha. Vuttañhetaṃ
analyzed: pana anupādisesa nibbānam sandhāya āma vaṅgīsape gatim jānāmi iti āha vuttam ha etam
translated: The Blessed One replies, “Yes, Vangasena, I know where you have come from … I know your destiny,” referring to the Nibbna without residue left. For this is said:

original: “nibbānaṃ arahato gatī”ti. Vaṅgīso sayaṃ mantabalena gatipariyāpannassa gatiṃ jānanto🔽bhagavantampi “ayampi tathā”ti maññamāno “mantena jānāsi, bho gotamā”ti āha. Bhagavā
analyzed: nibbānam arahataḥ gatī iti vaṅgīsaḥ sayam manta balena gati pariyāpannassa gatim jānantaḥ  bhagavantam pi ayam pi tathā ati maññamānaḥ mantena jānāsi bho gotama iti āha bhagavā
translated: “Nibbana is the destiny of the Arahant.”🔽Thinking that the Blessed One must know the destiny of one who has attained the supramundane, Vangasena says, “You know by means of a formula, Master Gotama.”🔽The Blessed One replies, “Yes, Vangasena, I know by means of a single formula,”

original: attano buddhañāṇameva mantaṃ katvā dīpento “āma, vaṅgīsa, ekena manteneva jānāmī”ti
analyzed: attanaḥ buddha ñāṇam eva mantam katvā dīpentaḥ ekena mantena iva jānāmi iti
translated: showing that his knowledge as a Buddha is the formula.

original: āha. Mudhā eva dātabbanti amūliko. Anantarahitāya bhūmiyā sayanaṃ thaṇḍilaseyyā.
analyzed: āha mudhā eva dātabbanti amūlikaḥ anantara hitāya bhūmiyā sayanam thaṇḍila seyyā
translated: “Without reason” means without ground. “Sleeping on the bare ground” means sleeping on a bed of straw.

original: Ādi-saddena sāyatatiyaṃ udakorohaṇabhūmiharaṇādiṃ saṅgaṇhāti. So taṃ…pe… arahattaṃ
analyzed: ādi saddena udakorohaṇa bhūmi haraṇa ādim saṅgaṇhāti saḥ arahattam
translated: The word “etc.” includes bathing in water three times a day, carrying away the earth, and so on.🔽He attained Arahatship together with the analytical knowledges.

original: pāpuṇīti iminā vaṅgīsatthero pabbajitvā na cirasseva sukhāya paṭipadāya arahattaṃ
analyzed: pāpuṇi iti iminā vaṅgīsa thero pabbajitvā na cirassa eva sukhāya paṭipadāya arahattam
translated: By this it is shown that not long after his going forth the Elder Vangasena attained Arahatship by the pleasant way.

original: patto viya dissati, na kho panetaṃ evaṃ daṭṭhabbaṃ, āyatiṃ thero pabbajitvā samathavipassanāsu
analyzed: pattaḥ viya dissati na kho pana etam evam daṭṭhabbam āyatim theraḥ pabbajitvā samatha vipassanāsu
translated: It is as if he had a bowl, but this should not be regarded thus. In the future the elder, after going forth,🔽and after beginning the task of developing serenity and insight,

original: kammaṃ ārabhitvāpi dukkhāya paṭipadāya tādisaṃ kālaṃ vītināmetvā arahattaṃ pāpuṇi. Tenāha –
analyzed: kammam ārabhitvā api dukkhāya paṭipadāya tādisam kālam vītināmetvā arahattam pāpuṇi tena āha
translated: and after spending such a time as this on the painful way, attained Arahantship. Therefore it is said:🔽“I have gone forth, I am peaceful,

original: “Nikkhantaṃ vata maṃ santaṃ, agārasmānagāriyaṃ;
analyzed: nikkhantam vata mam santam agārasmā anagāriyam
translated: From the house life into homelessness,🔽But thoughts, gross and dark,

original: Vitakkā upadhāvanti, pagabbhā kaṇhato ime”. ;
analyzed: vitakkāḥ upadhāvanti pagabbhāḥ kaṇhataḥ ime
translated: Rush in upon me.”

original: Āyasmato vaṅgīsassa anabhirati uppannā hoti, rāgo cittaṃ anuddhaṃseti, “kāmarāgena ḍayhāmi, cittaṃ me pariḍayhatī”tiādi.
analyzed: āyasmataḥ vaṅgīsassa anabhirati uppannā hoti rāgaḥ cittam kāma rāgena ḍayhāmi cittam me pariḍayhati itiādi
translated: and lust assailed the venerable Vaṅgīsa’s mind. “I am burning, my mind is burning, with the fire of lust” , and so on.

original: Vimuttisukhanti sabbaso kilesavimuttiyaṃ nibbāne ca uppannaṃ sampatiarahattaphalasukhaṃ🔽paṭisaṃvedentoti yathāparicchinnaṃ kālaṃ pati sammadeva vedento anubhavanto. Kavinā
analyzed: vimutti sukham ti sabbaso kilesa vimuttiyam nibbāne ca uppannam sampati arahatta phala sukham  paṭisaṃvedento ti yathā paricchinnam kālam sammad eva vedentaḥ anubhavantaḥ kavinā
translated: The bliss of deliverance: the bliss of the Arahant path and fruition that arose in the complete deliverance from defilements and in Nibbāna.🔽Experiencing: experiencing, enjoying, what has been delimited in time.

original: kataṃ, tato vā āgataṃ, tassa vā idanti kāveyaṃ, tadevettha “kāveyya”nti vuttaṃ. Ye
analyzed: katam tatas vā āgatam tassa vai idam ti kāveyam tat eva ittha kāveyyam ti vuttam ye
translated: is poetry. Or else it is what is made by a poet, or what comes from a poet, or what belongs to a poet. Herein, “poetry” is what is meant.

original: niyāmagataddasāti ye bhikkhū ariyā buddhānaṃ sāvakā phalaṭṭhabhāvena niyāmagatā ceva
analyzed: ye bhikkhū ariyāḥ buddhānam sāvakā phalaṭṭha bhāvena niyāma gatā ca iva
translated: ‘The path’ is intended here as the path of stream-entry, etc., and ‘the fruit’ as the fruit of stream-entry, etc.🔽‘The path’ is the right path, the path of purity.🔽‘The fruit’ is the fruit of stream-entry, etc.🔽‘The path’ is the path of stream-entry, etc., and ‘the fruit’ is the fruit of stream-entry, etc.

original: maggaṭṭhabhāvena niyāmadasā ca. Niyāmoti hi sammattaniyāmo adhippeto. Suāgamananti
analyzed: maggaṭṭha bhāvena niyāma dasā ca niyāmo ti hi sammatta niyāmaḥ adhippeto su āgamanan ti
translated: ‘The path’ is the right path, the path of purity.🔽‘The fruit’ is the fruit of stream-entry, etc.🔽‘The path’ is the path of stream-entry, etc., and ‘the fruit’ is the fruit of stream-entry, etc.

original: mama imassa satthuno santike āgamanaṃ upagamanaṃ, imasmiñca dhammavinaye āgamanaṃ
analyzed: mama imassa satthuno santike āgamanam upagamanam imasmin ca dhamma vinaye āgamanam
translated: ‘The path’ is the right path, the path of purity.🔽‘The fruit’ is the fruit of stream-entry, etc.

original: pabbajanaṃ upasampadā sundaraṃ āgamanaṃ. Tattha kāraṇamāha “tisso vijjā”tiādi. Avuttampi🔽gāthāya atthato gahitameva therassa chaḷabhiññabhāvato.
analyzed: pabbajanam upasampadā sundaram āgamanam tattha kāraṇam āha tissaḥ vijja āti ādi a vuttam pi  gāthāya atthataḥ gahitam eva therassa chaḷabhiñña bhāvato
translated: ‘The path’ is the path of stream-entry, etc., and ‘the fruit’ is the fruit of stream-entry, etc.🔽‘The path’ is the right path, the path of purity.

original: Vaṅgīsasuttavaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.🔽Sāratthappakāsiniyā saṃyuttanikāya-aṭṭhakathāya
analyzed: vaṅgīsa sutta vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā  sārattha ppakāsiniyā saṃyutta nikāya aṭṭhakathāya
translated: ‘The fruit’ is the fruit of stream-entry, etc.🔽‘The path’ is the path of stream-entry, etc., and ‘the fruit’ is the fruit of stream-entry, etc.🔽‘The path’ is the right path, the path of purity.🔽‘The fruit’ is the fruit of stream-entry, etc.

original: Vaṅgīsasaṃyuttavaṇṇanāya līnatthappakāsanā samattā.🔽9. Vanasaṃyuttaṃ
analyzed: vana saṃyuttam
translated: ‘The path’ is the path of stream-entry, etc., and ‘the fruit’ is the fruit of stream-entry, etc.🔽‘The path’ is the right path, the path of purity.

original: 1. Vivekasuttavaṇṇanā
analyzed: viveka sutta vaṇṇanā
translated: ‘The fruit’ is the fruit of stream-entry, etc.🔽‘The path’ is the path of stream-entry, etc., and ‘the fruit’ is the fruit of stream-entry, etc.🔽‘The path’ is the right path, the path of purity.🔽‘The fruit’ is the fruit of stream-entry, etc.🔽‘The path’ is the path of stream-entry, etc., and ‘the fruit’ is the fruit of stream-entry, etc.🔽‘The path’ is the right path, the path of purity.

original: 221. Saṃvejetukāmāti atthato saṃvegaṃ uppādetukāmā. Tathābhūtā naṃ kilesasaṅgaṇikādito
analyzed: saṃvejetu kāmā ati atthataḥ saṃvegam uppādetu kāmā tathābhūtā naṃ kilesa saṅgaṇikā āditaḥ
translated: ‘The fruit’ is the fruit of stream-entry

original: vivecetukāmā nāma hotīti vuttaṃ “vivekaṃ paṭipajjāpetukāmā”ti. Bāhiresūti gocarajjhattato🔽bahibhūtesu. Puthuttārammaṇesūti rūpādinānārammaṇesu. Caratīti pavattati. Tvaṃ janoti🔽tvaṃ attano kilesehi jananato visuṃ jāto tādise eva aññasmiṃ jane imaṃ ayonisomanasikāravasena
analyzed: vivecetu kāmā nāma hoti iti vuttam vivekam paṭipajjā apetu kāmā ati bāhiresu iti gocara jjhattato  bahibhūtesu puthutta ārammaṇesu iti rūpa ādi nānā ārammaṇesu carati iti pavattati tvam janoti  tvam attano kilesehi jananataḥ visum jātaḥ tādise eva aññasmin jane imam a yoniso manasikāra vasena
translated: “One who wishes to investigate” is said to be “one who wishes to make him enter into seclusion.” “In external objects” means in objects that are external to the sense faculties.

original: pavattamānaṃ chandarāgaṃ vinayassu vinodehi. Sataṃ taṃ sārayāmaseti niyyānikasāsane
analyzed: pavattamānam chanda rāgam vinayassu vinodehi satam tam sārayāmasa iti niyyānika sāsane
translated: “In various objects” means in the various objects such as visible forms. “Wandering” means occurring. “You, sir” means you, who are born apart from the people who are defiled by their own defilements. In such people as you, “subdue” this desire and lust that occur by way of improper attention. “We urge you” means we urge you to subdue it.

original: pabbajitvā satthu santike kammaṭṭhānaṃ gahetvā araññavāsena ca satimantaṃ paṇḍitaṃ🔽taṃ mayampi yathāuppannaṃ vitakkaṃ vinodanāya sārayāma, sataṃ vā sappurisānaṃ kilesavigamanadhammaṃ
analyzed: pabbajitvā satthu santike kammaṭṭhānam gahetvā arañña vāsena ca satimantam paṇḍitam  tam mayam pi yathā uppannam vitakkam vinodanāya sārayāma satam vā sappurisānam kilesa vigamana dhammam
translated: Having gone forth in the Dispensation that leads out , having received a meditation subject in the presence of the Teacher, and having gone to live in the forest, we urge you, who are wise and mindful,

original: paṭipajjitvā vasantaṃ taṃ sārayāma vaṭṭadukkhaṃ. Pātālanti mohapātālaṃ kilesarajo,
analyzed: paṭipajjitvā vasantam tam sārayāma vaṭṭa dukkham pātālanti moha pātālam kilesa rajaḥ
translated: to subdue any thoughts that have arisen. Or we urge you, who are living by practicing the way that leads to the removal of defilements, to subdue the suffering of the round. “The mire of delusion” is the mire of defilements, the mire of ignorance.

original: tadeva “pātāla”nti vuttaṃ. Mā avaharīti heṭṭhā duggatisotaṃ mā upanesi. Sitanti sambandhaṃ.
analyzed: tat eva pātālanti vuttam mā avahari iti heṭṭhā duggati sotam mā upanesi sitam ti sambandham
translated: That is what is called the “abyss.” Do not lead down: do not lead down to the stream of the lower realms. Sit: make a connection.

original: Tenāha “sarīralagga”nti. Vivekamāpannoti kilesavivekaṃ samathavipassanābhāvanamāpanno.
analyzed: tena āha sarīra lagganti vivekam āpannaḥ ti kilesa vivekam samatha vipassanā bhāvanam āpannaḥ
translated: Hence he said, “clinging to the body.” Lead to solitude: lead to the solitude of the defilements, to the development of serenity and insight.

original: Uttamavīriyanti ussoḷhilakkhaṇappattaṃ vīriyaṃ, catubbidhaṃ samappadhānavīriyaṃ vā
analyzed: uttama vīriyanti ussoḷhi lakkhaṇa ppattam vīriyam catubbidham sama ppadhāna vīriyam vā
translated: Supreme effort: effort that has reached the characteristic of being unflagging, or the fourfold right effort.

original: sampattaṃ. Paggayhāti āropetvā. Paramavivekanti paramaṃ samucchedavivekaṃ.
analyzed: sampattam paggayha ati āropetvā parama vivekam ti paramam samuccheda vivekam
translated: Having mounted: having mounted it. Supreme solitude: supreme solitude by way of complete eradication.

original: Vivekasuttavaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: viveka sutta vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: The explanation of the Discourse on Solitude is finished.

original: 2. Upaṭṭhānasuttavaṇṇanā
analyzed: upaṭṭhāna sutta vaṇṇanā
translated: The explanation of the Discourse on Attendance

original: 222. Kāyadaratho hotiyeva niyamena, na cittadaratho tassa maggeneva samugghāṭitattā.
analyzed: kāya da rathaḥ niyamena na citta da rathaḥ tassa maggena iva samugghāṭita ttā
translated: bodily pain is certain, but not mental pain, because that has already been eradicated by the path.

original: Jarāturoti jarābhibhavanena āturoyeva. Padadvayepi eseva nayo. Upariṭṭhatāya parito🔽dīghaputhulatāya ativiya vijjhatīti sattisallaggahaṇaṃ. Evaṃ hissa taṇhāsallassa
analyzed: jarā āturaḥ iti jarā abhibhavanena pada dvaye pi esa iva nayo paritas 🔽dīgha puthula tāya vijjhati iti satti salla ggahaṇam evam hissa taṇhā sallassa
translated: He is afflicted by old age: he is afflicted by being overcome by old age. The same method applies to the other two pairs of terms. Because of the upper part, the upper part is cut off.🔽Because of the lower part, the lower part is cut off. Because of the front, the front is cut off. Because of the back, the back is cut off. Because of the sides, the sides are cut off. Because of the middle, the middle is cut off. Because of the top, the top is cut off. Because of the bottom, the bottom is cut off. Because of the long, the long is cut off. Because of the short, the short is cut off. Because of the thick, the thick is cut off. Because of the thin, the thin is cut off. Because of the far, the far is cut off. Because of the near, the near is cut off. Because of the inside, the inside is cut off. Because of the outside, the outside is cut off. Because of the head, the head is cut off. Because of the feet, the feet are cut off. Because of the hands, the hands are cut off. Because of the flesh, the flesh is cut off. Because of the skin, the skin is cut off. Because of the sinews, the sinews are cut off. Because of the bones, the bones are cut off. Because of the marrow, the marrow is cut off. Because of the head hairs, the head hairs are cut off. Because of the body hairs, the body hairs are cut off. Because of the nails, the nails are cut off. Because of the teeth, the teeth are cut off. Because of the skin, the skin is cut off. Because of the

original: sadisatā. Avijjāya pana sammohāpādanena dukkhāpādanena ca visasadisatā. Ruppatoti
analyzed: sadisa tā avijjāya pana sammoha āpādanena dukkha āpādanena ca visa sadisa tā ruppatoti
translated: and the opposite of that is the opposite of similarity. But the opposite of similarity to ignorance is the opposite of its causing delusion and suffering. “As to being rubbed”:

original: vikāraṃ āpādiyamānassa pīḷiyamānassāti atthoti āha “ghaṭṭiyamānassā”ti.
analyzed: vikāram āpādiyamānassa pīḷiyamānassa ati atthaḥ ti āha ghaṭṭiyamānassa ati
translated: it is what is rubbed, what is afflicted, is the meaning. So he said “as to being rubbed.”

original: Pabbajitanti sasantānato pabbajitaṃ vā rāgādimalato pabbajitaṃ vā. Tasmāti yasmā🔽therassevetaṃ vacanaṃ, tasmā ayaṃ idāni vuccamāno ettha gāthāya attho. Devatāya hītiādi
analyzed: pabbajitam ti sa santānataḥ pabbajitam vā rāga ādi malataḥ pabbajitam vā tasmā iti yasmā  therassa iva etam vacanam tasmai ayam idāni vuccamānaḥ ettha gāthāya atthaḥ devatāya hi itiādi
translated: “Gone forth”: gone forth from his own continuity or gone forth from the defilements of lust, etc. “Therefore”: because

original: vuttasseva atthassa pākaṭakaraṇaṃ. Etthāti sesagāthāsu. Atthassa vuttanayattā “anuttānapadavaṇṇanā”ti
analyzed: vuttassa iva atthassa pākaṭa karaṇam ettha ati sesa gāthāsu atthassa vutta naya ttā anuttāna pada vaṇṇanā ti
translated: this is the Elder’s statement, therefore the meaning of the verse being now stated is this. “The deity’s” is a clarification of the meaning already stated. “Here” is in the remaining verses. Because the meaning is already stated, he says “The commentary on the words not already commented upon.”

original: āha. Vinayāti hetumhi nissakkavacananti tassa hetumhi karaṇavacanena atthamāha “vinayenā”ti.
analyzed: āha vinaya ati hetumhi nissakka vacananti tassa hetumhi karaṇa vacanena attham āha vinayena ati
translated: “Vinaya” is a locative of cause. He explains the meaning by a locative of instrument: “by means of the Vinaya.”

original: Tathā “samatikkamā”ti etthāpi. Paramaparisuddhaṃ saṃkilesasamucchindanato. Āraddhavīriyanti
analyzed: tathā ettha api parama parisuddham saṃkilesa samucchindanataḥ āraddha vīriyanti
translated: Likewise in the passage “having overcome” . “Most pure” because it cuts off defilement. “Vigour” is

original: sambhāvitavīriyaṃ. Sambhāvanañcassa paggaṇhanaṃ paripūraṇañcāti āha “paggahitavīriyaṃ
analyzed: sambhāvita vīriyam sambhāvanam ca assa paggaṇhanam paripūraṇam ca ati āha paggahita vīriyam
translated: regarded as vigour. And its regard is its exertion and its fulfilment. So he said “exerted vigour” .

original: paripuṇṇavīriya”nti.
analyzed: paripuṇṇa vīriyanti
translated: and his energy is complete.”

original: Upaṭṭhānasuttavaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: upaṭṭhāna sutta vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: The commentary on the Upaṭṭhāna Sutta is finished.

original: 3. Kassapagottasuttavaṇṇanā
analyzed: kassapagotta sutta vaṇṇanā
translated: The Kassapa-gotta Sutta

original: 223. Chetanti migānaṃ jīvitaṃ chetaṃ. Tenāha “migaluddaka”nti. Rohitamiganti lohitavaṇṇaṃ🔽khuddakamigaṃ, “mahārohitamiga”nti keci. Satthu santike kammaṭṭhānaṃ gahetvā tassa
analyzed: chetanti migānam jīvitam chetam tena āha migaluddakam ti rohitamiganti lohita vaṇṇam  khuddaka migam mahārohita migam ti keci satthu santike kammaṭṭhānam gahetvā tassa
translated: Cheti: he cuts off the life of deer. Thus it is said: “a deer-hunter.” Rohita-migam: a small deer of a reddish color.🔽Some say: “a large deer of a reddish color.” Having received a meditation subject from the Teacher, he went to that country and lived there because alms were easily obtained there.

original: janapadassa sulabhabhikkhatāya tattha gantvā viharatīti imamatthaṃ sandhāya “paṭhamasutte
analyzed: janapadassa sulabha bhikkha tāya tattha gantvā viharati iti imam attham sandhāya paṭhama sutte
translated: With this meaning in mind it is said: “in the way stated in the first sutta.”

original: vuttanayenevā”ti vuttaṃ. Ayaṃ pana thero pañcābhiñño vipassanākammiko. Ṭhatvāti padānubandhanavasena
analyzed: vutta nayena iva ati vuttam ayam pana thero pañca abhiññaḥ vipassanā kammiko ṭhatvā āti pada anubandhana vasena
translated: But this Elder was one who had attained the five super-knowledges and was a practitioner of insight. Ṭhatvā means having stopped going by following the words of the Elder.

original: gamanaṃ upacchinditvā therassa āsannaṭṭhāne ṭhatvā. Tassa vacanaṃ sotuṃ āraddho.
analyzed: gamanam upacchinditvā therassa āsanna ṭhāne ṭhatvā tassa vacanam sotuṃ āraddhaḥ
translated: He stood near the Elder in order to listen to his words.

original: Aṅguṭṭhakaṃ jālāpesīti adhiṭṭhānabalena daṇḍadīpikaṃ viya attano aṅguṭṭhakaṃ jālāpesi.
analyzed: aṅguṭṭhakam jālāpesi iti adhiṭṭhāna balena daṇḍadīpikam viya attanaḥ aṅguṭṭhakam jālāpesi
translated: Aṅguṭṭhakaṃ jālāpesīti: by the power of his resolve he caused his thumb to blaze like a torch.

original: Akkhīhipi passati aṅguṭṭhakaṃ jālamānaṃ. Kaṇṇehipi suṇāti tena vuccamānaṃ dhammaṃ
analyzed: akkhīhi pi passati aṅguṭṭhakam jālamānam kaṇṇehi pi suṇāti tena vuccamānam dhammaṃ
translated: He saw the thumb blazing with his eyes and heard the Dhamma being spoken by it with his ears.

original: ekadesena. Cittaṃ panassa dhāvatīti sambandho. Etassapīti luddakassapi.
analyzed: eka desena cittam panassa dhāvati iti sambandhaḥ etassa api iti luddakassa api
translated: And in his case too: in the case of the hunter.

original: Appapaññanti ettha appa-saddo “appaharite”tiādīsu viya abhāvatthoti āha “nippañña”nti.
