analyzed: ettha appa saddaḥ appaharita iti ādīsu viya abhāva atthaḥ iti āha nippaññanti
translated: In the absence of elaboration: the word appa here means “non-existence,” like appa in such passages as “appaharite” .🔽That is why he says “in the absence of elaboration.”

original: Kāraṇajānanasamatthenāti iminā kāraṇena sattānaṃ sukhaṃ, iminā dukkhanti evaṃ samācaramānena
analyzed: kāraṇa jānana samatthena ati iminā kāraṇena sattānam sukham iminā dukkham ti evam samācaramānena
translated: Capable of knowing the reason: by this reason he is capable of knowing the reason in this way: “Through this reason there is pleasure for beings, through this reason there is pain.”

original: kāraṇaṃ jānituṃ samatthena kammassakatañāṇasampayuttacittenāti attho. Suṇātīti kevalaṃ
analyzed: kāraṇam jānitum samatthena kammassa kata ñāṇa sampayutta cittena ati atthaḥ suṇāti iti kevalam
translated: The meaning is: with consciousness associated with the knowledge of the ownership of kamma.🔽He hears: he hears merely by way of hearing, not by way of the meaning of that .

original: savanamattavasena suṇāti, na tadatthavasena. Tenāha “atthamassa na jānātī”ti. Kāraṇarūpānīti🔽sabhāvakāraṇāni. Kiṃ me imināti? “Idaṃ papañca”nti pahāya. Vīriyaṃ paggayhāti catubbidhaṃ
analyzed: savana matta vasena suṇāti na tad attha vasena tena āha attham assa na jānāti iti kāraṇa rūpāni iti  sabhāva kāraṇāni kim me iminā ati idam papañcanti pahāya vīriyam paggayha ati catubbidham
translated: That is why he says “he does not know the meaning of that.”🔽Reasons: primary reasons.🔽What is the use of this to me? Having abandoned “this elaboration.”

original: sammappadhānaṃ vīriyaṃ paggaṇhitvā.🔽Kassapagottasuttavaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.🔽4. Sambahulasuttavaṇṇanā
analyzed: sammappadhānam vīriyam paggaṇhitvā 🔽kassapagotta sutta vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā 🔽sambahula sutta vaṇṇanā
translated: Having exerted energy: having exerted the energy of the fourfold right endeavour.

original: 224. Sambahulāti suttantanayena sambahulā. Suttante sajjhāyiṃsūti suttantikā. Vinayaṃ🔽dhārentīti vinayadharā. Yuñjantīti vāsadhure yogaṃ karonti. Ghaṭentīti tattha vāyāmaṃ
analyzed: sambahulā ati suttanta nayena sambahulā suttante sajjhāyiṃsu iti suttantikā vinayam  dhārenti iti vinaya dharāḥ yuñjanti iti vāsa dhure yogam karonti ghaṭenti iti
translated: “Many” : according to the method of the sutta, many. “They recite the sutta” : they are suttanta-reciters. “They bear the Vinaya” : they are Vinaya-bearers. “They apply themselves” : they make an effort in the yoke of the burden. “They strive” : they make an effort there.

original: karonti. Karontānaṃyeva aruṇo uggacchatīti sambandho.
analyzed: karonti aruṇaḥ uggacchati iti sambandhaḥ
translated: “Many” : according to the method of the sutta, many. “Suttantika” : they recited the sutta. “Vinayadhara” : they remembered the Vinaya. “They applied themselves” : they made an effort in the yoke of the burden of dwelling. “They exerted themselves” : they made an effort there. “The dawn broke while they were exerting themselves” : this is the connection.

original: Kometi kiṃ ime? Tenāha “kahaṃ ime”ti? Vajjibhūmiṃ vajjiraṭṭhaṃ gatāti vajjibhūmiyā.
analyzed: koma iti kim ime tena āha kaham ime iti vajji bhūmim vajji raṭṭham gatā ati vajji bhūmiyā
translated: “Where?” : what? Therefore he said “where are they?” “They went to the Vajjian country” : to the land of the Vajjians.

original: Tenāha “vajjiraṭṭhābhimukhā gatā”ti. Natthi etesaṃ nikebhaṃ nibaddhanivāsaṭṭhānanti
analyzed: tena āha vajji raṭṭha abhimukhā gatā ati natthi etesam nikebham nibaddha nivāsa ṭṭhānam ti
translated: Therefore he said “they went to the Vajjian country.” “They had no fixed abode” : they had no fixed place of residence.

original: aniketā tenāha “agehā”ti. Utu eva sappāyaṃ, utuvasena vā kāyacittānaṃ kallattā sappāyaṃ. Esa nayo sesesupi.
analyzed: tena āha agehā ti utu eva sappāyam utu vasena vā kāya cittānam kalla ttā sappāyam esa nayo sesesu pi
translated: Therefore he said “no home.” “The climate was suitable” : the climate was suitable by itself, or the climate was suitable because of the fitness of body and mind according to the climate. The same method applies to the rest.

original: Sambahulasuttavaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: sambahula sutta vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: The commentary on the Sambahula Sutta is finished.

original: 5. Ānandasuttavaṇṇanā
analyzed: ānanda sutta vaṇṇanā
translated: The commentary on the Ananda Sutta

original: 225. Ativelanti atibahukālaṃ. Bhikkhunā nāma upagatānaṃ upanisinnakathāmattaṃ vatvā
analyzed: ativelam ti ati bahu kālam bhikkhunā nāma upagatānam upanisinna kathā mattam vatvā
translated: “Too long” : for too long a time. “A bhikkhu” : having approached and sat down, he should speak just enough to tell a story.

original: ganthadhurehi vāsadhurehi vā yuttapayuttacittena bhavitabbaṃ, nātivelaṃ tesaṃ saññattibahulena.🔽Thero pana tadā kenaci kāraṇena bahuvelaṃ gihisaññattibahulo ahosi, taṃ sandhāya
analyzed: gantha dhurehi vāsa dhurehi vā yutta payutta cittena bhavitabbam na ativelam tesam saññatti bahulena  theraḥ pana tadā kenacid kāraṇena bahuvelam gihi saññatti bahulaḥ ahosi tam sandhāya
translated: He should be intent on the duties of a meditator and on the duties of a monk, and he should not be too often occupied with the duties of a lay follower.

original: vuttaṃ “ativela”ntiādi. Idāni tamatthaṃ vibhāvetuṃ “bhagavatī”tiādi vuttaṃ. Tanti
analyzed: vuttam ativela ntiādi idāni tam attham vibhāvetum bhagavatī itiādi vuttam
translated: But the elder was too often occupied with the duties of a lay follower because of some reason at that time. With reference to that it was said: “Too often” and so on. Now, in order to elucidate that meaning, it was said: “The Blessed One” and so on. He: with reference to that kind of occupation.

original: taṃ tādisaṃ saññāpanaṃ sandhāya etaṃ “ativelaṃ gihisaññattibahulo”ti vacanaṃ vuttaṃ.
analyzed: tam tādisam saññāpanam sandhāya etam ativelam gihi saññatti bahulaḥ ti vacanam vuttam
translated: This statement: “Too often occupied with the duties of a lay follower” was made with reference to that.

original: Bhikkhusaṅghassa kathaṃ sutvāti saṅghassa majjhe nisīditvā therena kathitattā vuttaṃ.
analyzed: bhikkhu saṅghassa katham sutvā iti saṅghassa majjhe nisīditvā therena kathita ttā vuttam
translated: Having heard the talk of the bhikkhu community: this was said because the elder sat in the midst of the community and spoke.

original: Satthusāsananti piṭakattayaṃ vadati.
analyzed: satthu sāsanam ti piṭakattayam vadati
translated: The Teacher’s Dispensation: he calls the three Piṭakas the Dispensation.

original: Pasakkiyāti upasakkitvā gantvā. Taṃ pana tattha ajjhogāhanaṃ hotīti āha “pavisitvā”ti.
analyzed: pasakkiyā ti upasakkitvā gantvā tam pana tattha ajjhogāhanam hoti iti āha pavisitvā iti
translated: Having gone to the lay follower’s house: having gone to the lay follower’s house after going there. But that is the going into the water, he said: “having entered.”

original: Saṅkhāradukkhato nibbinnahadayassa sabbasaṅkhāravinissaṭaṃ nibbānaṃ yāthāvato paccavekkhantassa
analyzed: saṅkhāra dukkhataḥ nibbinna hadayassa sabba saṅkhāra vinissaṭam nibbānam yāthāvataḥ paccavekkhantassa
translated: For one whose heart is dispassionate towards formations, who is contemplating Nibbāna, which is the escape from all formations, as it really is,

original: sammadeva samassāsakaraṃ hutvā upaṭṭhahantaṃ taṃ upari adhigamāya ussukkaṃ karonto
analyzed: sammat eva samassāsa karam hutvā upaṭṭhahantam tam upari adhigamāya ussukkam karontaḥ
translated: He places Nibbāna in his heart, he is said to do, by making effort for the attainment of the higher path in the one who attends on him rightly and is to be exhorted.

original: nibbānaṃ hadaye nikkhipati nāmāti āha – “nibbānaṃ…pe… opeti nāmā”ti. Nibbānaṃ…pe…
analyzed: nibbānam hadaye nikkhipati nāma ati āha nibbānam pe opeti nāma ati nibbānam pe
translated: He places Nibbāna in his heart, he is said to do, by making effort for the attainment of the higher path in the one who attends on him rightly and is to be exhorted.

original: ārammaṇato opeti nāmāti ānetvā sambandho. Atthavirahitā “biḷibiḷī”ti pavattakiriyā🔽biḷikā, ayaṃ pana gihisaññattikathā therassa attano sāmaññatthaasādhanato devatāya
analyzed: ārammaṇato opeti nāma ati ānetvā sambandhaḥ attha virahitā biḷibiḷī iti pavatta kiriyā  biḷikā ayam pana gihi saññatti kathā therassa attano sāmañña ttha asādhanataḥ devatāya
translated: He places Nibbāna in his heart, he is said to do, by making effort for the attainment of the higher path in the one who attends on him rightly and is to be exhorted.🔽He places Nibbāna in his heart, he is said to do, by making effort for the attainment of the higher path in the one who attends on him rightly and is to be exhorted.

original: biḷikā viyāti biḷibiḷikāti vuttā.🔽Ānandasuttavaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: biḷikā viyā ti biḷibiḷikā ati vuttā  ānanda sutta vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: He places Nibbāna in his heart, he is said to do, by making effort for the attainment of the higher path in the one who attends on him rightly and is to be exhorted.🔽He places Nibbāna in his heart, he is said to do, by making effort for the attainment of the higher path in the one who attends on him rightly and is to be exhorted.🔽He places Nibbāna in his heart, he is said to do, by making effort for the attainment of the higher path in the one who attends on him rightly and is to be exhorted.

original: 6. Anuruddhasuttavaṇṇanā🔽226. Anantare attabhāveti atītānantare devattabhāve. Thero hi tāvatiṃsadevalokā cavitvā
analyzed: anuruddha sutta vaṇṇanā  anantare attabhāva iti atīta anantare theraḥ hi cavitvā
translated: He places Nibbāna in his heart, he is said to do, by making effort for the attainment of the higher path in the one who attends on him rightly and is to be exhorted.🔽He places Nibbāna in his heart, he is said to do, by making effort for the attainment of the higher path in the one who attends on him rightly and is to be exhorted.🔽He places Nibbāna in his heart, he is said to do, by making effort for the attainment of the higher path in the one who attends on him rightly and is to be exhorted.

original: idhūpapanno. Aggamahesīti kāci paricārikā devadhītā cittapaṇidhānamattena idānipi
analyzed: idhūpapannaḥ agga mahesī iti kāci paricārikā deva dhītā citta paṇidhāna mattena idāni pi
translated: He places Nibbāna in his heart, he is said to do, by making effort for the attainment of the higher path in the one who attends on him rightly and is to be exhorted.🔽He places Nibbāna in his heart, he is said to do, by making effort for the attainment of the higher path in the one who attends on him rightly and is to be exhorted.

original: devakāye bhavissati upacitakusaladhammattāti maññamānā tasmiṃ vattamānaṃ viya kathentī
analyzed: deva kāye bhavissati upacita kusala dhamma ttā ti maññamānā tasmin vattamānam viya kathentī
translated: He places Nibbāna in his heart, he is said to do, by making effort for the

original: “sobhasī”ti āha. Evaṃ atītampissa dibbasotaṃ paccuppannaṃ viya maññeyya nāticirakālattāti
analyzed: āha evam atītam pissa dibba sotam paccuppannam viya maññeyya na ati cira kālattā ti
translated: “You are beautiful,” he said. Thus he would think of his past divine ear as if it were present, not as too long ago.🔽Showing this, the Exalted One said, “You were beautiful in the past as well.” The meaning is that she was in a bad state by reason of the bad destinations such as the animal realm, etc.,

original: dassento “pubbepi sobhasī”ti āha. Sugatinirayādiduggatiyā vasena duggatā etarahīti
analyzed: dassento pubbe pi sobhasi iti āha sugati niraya ādi duggatiyā vasena duggatāḥ etarahi iti
translated: but now she is in a good state by reason of the good destinations such as the human realm, etc.

original: adhippāyo. Paṭipattiduggatiyā kāmesu sammucchitabhāvato.🔽Patiṭṭhahantoti nivisanto. Aṭṭhahi kāraṇehīti cirakālaparibhāvanāya viruḷhamūlehi
analyzed: adhippāyaḥ paṭipatti duggatiyā kāmesu sammucchita bhāvato  patiṭṭhahantaḥ ti nivisantaḥ aṭṭhahi kāraṇehi iti cira kāla paribhāvanāya viruḍha mūlehi
translated: The meaning is that she was in a bad state by reason of the practice of the bad destinations, by reason of her being addicted to sensual pleasures.🔽“Entrenched” means “settled down.” “For eight reasons” means for eight reasons that are stated, which have as their root condition the wrong attention, etc., and which have grown by being nourished for a long time.

original: ayonisomanasikārādipaccayamūlakehi vuccamānehi aṭṭhahi kāraṇehi. Ratto rāgavasenāti🔽sabhāvato saṅkappato ca yathāsamīhite iṭṭhākāre sakkāye sañjātarāgavasā ratto giddho🔽gadhito. Patiṭṭhātīti oruyha tiṭṭhati. Duṭṭho dosavasenāti sabhāvato saṅkappato ca
analyzed: a yoni soma nasikāra ādi paccaya mūlakehi vuccamānehi aṭṭhahi kāraṇehi rattaḥ rāga vasena ati  sabhāvataḥ saṅkappataḥ ca yathā samīhite iṭṭhākāre sa kāye sañjāta rāga vasā rattaḥ giddho  gadhitaḥ patiṭṭhāti iti oruyha tiṭṭhati duṭṭhaḥ dosa vasena ati sabhāvato saṅkappato ca
translated: “Entranced by lust” means that he is entranced, infatuated, and attached by the influence of lust that has arisen in regard to an object that is desirable in terms of its nature and in terms of its appearance.🔽“Entrenched” means “settled down.” “Corrupted by hatred” means that he is corrupted, his mind is corrupted, by the influence of hatred that has arisen in regard to an object that is undesirable in terms of its nature and in terms of its appearance.

original: yathāsamīhite aniṭṭhākāre sakkāye sañjātadosavasena duṭṭho rupitacitto. Mūḷho mohavasenāti
analyzed: yathā samīhite aniṭṭhākāre sa kkāye sañjāta dosa vasena duṭṭhaḥ rupita cittaḥ mūḷhaḥ moha vasena ati
translated: “Deluded by delusion” means that he is deluded by the influence of delusion that has arisen in regard to an object that is undesirable in terms of its nature and in terms of its appearance.

original: asamapekkhanena mūḷho muyhanavasena. Vinibaddhoti ahaṃkārena visesato nibandhanato
analyzed: a samapekkhanena mūḷhaḥ muyhana vasena vinibaddhaḥ ti ahaṃkārena visesataḥ nibandhanataḥ
translated: and by the delusion of not looking for the escape from them. “Bound” means bound by the conceit “I am” in the sense of a special bond.

original: mānavatthusmiṃ bandhito. Mānavasenāti tena tena maññanākārena. Parāmaṭṭhoti dhammasabhāvaṃ🔽niccādivasena parato āmaṭṭho. Diṭṭhivasenāti micchādassanavasena. Thāmagatoti rāgādikilesavasena🔽thāmaṃ thirabhāvaṃ upagato. Anusayavasenāti maggena appahīnatāya anu anu santāne
analyzed: māna vatthusmim bandhitaḥ māna vasena ati tena tena maññana ākārena parāmaṭṭhaḥ ti dhamma sabhāvam  nicca ādi vasena paratas āmaṭṭhaḥ diṭṭhi vasena ati micchādassana vasena thāma gataḥ ti rāga ādi kilesa vasena  thāmam thira bhāvam upagataḥ anusaya vasena ati maggena appahīna tāya anu anu santāne
translated: “In the basis for conceit” means in the conceit “I am.” “By the conceiving” means by the conceiving of each kind. “Clinging” means clinging to the individual essences of phenomena as permanent, etc.🔽“By the view” means by the false view. “Steadfast” means steadfast, firm, by the defilements such as lust. “By the underlying tendency” means by the underlying tendency that occurs in the continuum of aggregates,

original: sayanavasena. Appahīnaṭṭho hi tesaṃ anusayaṭṭho. Aniṭṭhaṅgatoti saṃsayito. Vikkhepagatoti🔽vikkhittabhāvaṃ upagato. Uddhaccavasenāti cittassa uddhatabhāvavasena. Tāpīti tāpi
analyzed: sayana vasena appahīna ṭṭho hi tesam anusayaṭṭhaḥ a niṭṭhaṅga to ti saṃsayitaḥ vikkhepa gato ti  vikkhitta bhāvam upagataḥ uddhacca vasena ati cittassa uddhata bhāva vasena tāpī iti tāpi
translated: since it has not been abandoned by the path. For the meaning of “underlying tendency” is the meaning of “not abandoned.” “Not penetrated” means doubtful. “Gone astray” means gone astray by the straying of the mind.

original: devakaññāyo. Evaṃ patiṭṭhitāvāti yathāvuttanayena rattabhāvādinā sakkāyasmiṃ patiṭṭhitā
analyzed: evam patiṭṭhitā avāti yathā vutta nayena ratta bhāva ādinā sakkāyasmim patiṭṭhitā
translated: “By distraction” means by the distracted state of mind. “The celestial nymphs” are the celestial nymphs of the Tāvatiṃsa heaven. “Thus established” means established in the personal entity in the way described, by the state of lust, etc.

original: eva. Naradevānanti purisabhūtadevānaṃ.
analyzed: eva purisa bhūtadevānam
translated: “Men and gods” are gods who have been men.

original: Paṭigantunti apekkhāvasena tato apagantuṃ apekkhaṃ vissajjetuṃ. Dussantanti dasantaṃ,
analyzed: paṭigantum ti apekkhā vasena tatas apagantum apekkham vissajjetum dussantam ti dasantam
translated: ‘Go back’: he said this to give up his hope of going back out of longing for them. ‘Ten-threaded’: ten-threaded cloth.

original: “vattha”nti keci. Sūciṃ yojetvāti sibbanasuttena sūciṃ yojetvā pāse ca pavesetvā.
analyzed: vatthanti keci sūcim yojetvā iti sibbana suttena sūcim yojetvā pāse ca pavesetvā
translated: ‘Cloth’, some say. ‘Having threaded the needle’: having threaded the needle with the needle-thread and having put it in the loop.

original: Manāpakāye devanikāye jātā manāpakāyikā. Tesaṃ pabhāvaṃ dassetuṃ “manasā”tiādi vuttaṃ.
analyzed: manāpa kāye devanikāye jātāḥ manāpakāyikā tesam pabhāvam dassetum manasā atiādi vuttaṃ
translated: ‘Born in the class of gods called the Pleasing’: they are called the Pleasing because they are pleasing. ‘With the mind’: this was said to show their power.

original: Samajjanti saṃhitaṃ. Gamanabhāvanti gamanajjhāsayaṃ. Vikkhīṇoti vicchindanavasena
analyzed: samajjanti saṃhitam gamana bhāvanti gamana ajjhāsayam vikkhīṇā ti vicchindana vasena
translated: ‘Assembly’: a gathering. ‘Desire to go’: desire to go. ‘Cut off’: cut off by way of cutting off.

original: khīṇo. Devatānaṃ uttarimanussadhammārocane doso natthīti tāsaṃ puna anāgamanatthaṃ arahattaṃ byākāsi.
analyzed: khīṇaḥ devatānam uttari manussa dhamma ārocane doso natthi iti tāsam puna an āgamana attham arahattam byākāsi
translated: ‘The fault’: there is no fault in the gods’ announcing a superhuman state. Therefore he declared his arahatship in order that they might not come again.

original: Anuruddhasuttavaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: anuruddha sutta vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: The Commentary on the Anuruddha Sutta is finished.

original: 7. Nāgadattasuttavaṇṇanā
analyzed: nāgadatta sutta vaṇṇanā
translated: The Commentary on the Nāgadatta Sutta

original: 227. Atikālenāti ativiya pubbaṇhakālena, kālassevāti attho. Koṭisammuñjaniyāti sammuñjanikoṭiyā,
analyzed: atikālena ati ativiya pubbaṇha kālena kālassa iva ati attho koṭi sammuñjaniyā ti sammuñjani koṭiyā
translated: ‘Too early’: too early in the morning; the meaning is, ‘too early in the day.’ ‘Worth a hundred thousand’: worth a hundred thousand rubs;

original: sammuñjaniyā ekadesenevāti attho. Iminā sammajjane amanāpakāritaṃ dasseti. Majjhanhike
analyzed: sammuñjaniyāḥ eka desena iva ati atthaḥ iminā sammajjane dasseti majjhanhike
translated: the meaning is, ‘worth a hundred thousand rubs in one place.’ This shows that he was not pleased with the rubbing. ‘At midday’

original: vītivatteti gihisaṃsaggavasena kālaṃ vītināmento majjhanhe bahuvītivatte. Aññehi🔽bhikkhūhīti nātikālaṃ paviṭṭhehi. Nissakkavacanañcetaṃ. Bhāyāmi nāgadattanti tassa🔽paṭipattiṃ bhāyitabbaṃ katvā devatā vadantī paṭipattiyaṃ niyojeti. Suppagabbhanti
analyzed: vītivatta iti gihi saṃsagga vasena kālam majjhanhe bahu vītivatte aññehi  bhikkhūhi iti na atikālam paviṭṭhehi nissakka vacanam ca itam bhāyāmi nāgadattam ti tassa  paṭipattim bhāyitabbam katvā devatā vadantī paṭipattiyam niyojeti suppagabbhanti
translated: ‘When the time has passed’: when the time has passed for the midday meal by socializing with householders. ‘By other monks’: by those who have not entered too late. This is a deprecatory expression. ‘I fear, Nāgadatta’: the deities, making his practice one to be feared, speak thus, and so he is urged to practice. ‘Well-disposed’:

original: kāyapāgabbiyādīhi ativiya samannāgataṃ.
analyzed: samannāgatam
translated: When the time has passed: when the time has passed for the most part by his staying with the lay people in the middle of the day. Other bhikkhus: those who have not entered too late. This is a statement of the reason. I fear, Nāgadatta: the deities speak thus, making his practice one to be feared, and they urge him to practice. Well-endowed: endowed with the best of bodily beauty, etc.

original: Nāgadattasuttavaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: nāgadatta sutta vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: The commentary on the Nāgadatta Sutta is finished.

original: 8. Kulagharaṇīsuttavaṇṇanā🔽228. Ogāhappattoti vissāsavasena anuppavesaṃ patto. Aññataraṃ kulanti tasmiṃ kule
analyzed: kulagharaṇī sutta vaṇṇanā  ogāha ppatto ti vissāsa vasena anuppavesam pattaḥ aññataram kulanti tasmim kule
translated: The Sutta on the Householder’s Sprout

original: jāyampatiṃ sandhāya vadati. “Bahūpakāraṃ me etaṃ kulaṃ ciraṃ sappāyāhāradānādinā;
analyzed: jāyampatim sandhāya vadati bahu upakāram me etam kulam ciram sappāya āhāra dāna ādinā
translated: Has come to trust: has come to enter into confidence. A certain family: he speaks with reference to the husband and wife in that family. “This family has been very helpful to me for a long time by giving me suitable food, etc.;

original: tasmā idhāhaṃ aggadakkhiṇeyyo jāto; imesaṃyeva deyyadhammapaṭiggaṇhanena puññaṃ vaḍḍhessāmī”ti
analyzed: tasmai idha aham aggadakkhiṇeyyaḥ jātaḥ imesam yeva deyya dhamma paṭiggaṇhanena puññam vaḍḍhessāmi iti
translated: therefore I have become their chief recipient of offerings; by receiving their gifts I shall increase their merit.”

original: cintesi. Tenāha “aññattha gantvā kiṃ karissāmī”tiādi. Sāti devatā. Ubhopeteti taṃ
analyzed: cintesi tena āha aññattha gantvā kim karissāmi itiādi sā ati devatā ubhā upetā iti tam
translated: He thought thus. Therefore he said, “What can I do by going elsewhere?” Sāti: a deity. Both of them: both of them, the husband and wife.

original: bhikkhuñca gharaṇiñca sandhāya vadati. Paṭigādhappattāti paṭigādhaṃ pattā aññamaññasmiṃ🔽patiṭṭhitavissāsena.🔽Vissamappattivasena santiṭṭhanti etthāti saṇṭhānaṃ, vissamanaṭṭhānaṃ. Samāgantvāti
analyzed: bhikkhuñca gharaṇiñca sandhāya vadati paṭigādha pattā ati paṭigādham pattā aññam aññasmin  patiṭṭhita vissāsena  vissama ppatti vasena santiṭṭhanti ettha ati saṇṭhānam vissamana ṭṭhānam samāgantvā iti
translated: They have reached the point of intimacy: they have reached the point of intimacy with each other, having established confidence in each other.🔽They stand by it through the attainment of intimacy: they stand by it through the attainment of intimacy.🔽They meet together: they assemble together.

original: sannipatitvā. Paṭiññūdāharaṇehi mantayatīti mantanaṃ, ñāpakaṃ kāraṇaṃ. Paṭilomasaddāti
analyzed: sannipatitvā paṭiññu udāharaṇehi mantayati iti mantanam ñāpakam kāraṇam
translated: They consult by means of agreements and examples: consultation is the means of making known, the reason.🔽They are contrary sounds: they are contrary sounds because of the contrary state, the state of contrariness.

original: paṭilomabhāvena patitattā asaccavibhāvanā paṭikūlasaddā. Tena kāraṇenāti tena kāraṇapaṭirūpakena
analyzed: paṭiloma bhāvena patita ttā asacca vibhāvanā paṭikūla saddā tena kāraṇena ati tena kāraṇa paṭirūpakena
translated: By that reason: by that reason which is a semblance of a reason.🔽He should not be abashed: because he is not the doer.

original: micchāvacanena. Na maṅkuhotabbaṃ akārakabhāvato. Saddena paritassatīti parehi attani🔽payuttamicchāsaddamattena paritassanasīlo. Vataṃ na sampajjatīti yathāsamādinnavataṃ
analyzed: micchā vacanena na akāraka bhāvato saddena paritassati iti parehi attani  payuttam icchā sadda mattena paritassana sīlaḥ vatam na sampajjati iti yathā samādinna vatam
translated: He is afraid of sounds: he is of a nature to be afraid because of mere wrong sounds uttered by others about himself.🔽The wind does not blow: the wind does not reach fulfilment because of the lightness of mind, as it does when it is begun properly.

original: lahucittatāya na pāripūriṃ gacchati. Sampannavatoti paripuṇṇasīlādivataguṇo
analyzed: lahu citta tāya na pāripūrim gacchati paripuṇṇa sīla ādi vata guṇaḥ
translated: One who is endowed: one who is endowed with the qualities of virtue, etc., that are fulfilled.

original: Kulagharaṇīsuttavaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: kulagharaṇī sutta vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: The commentary on the Kulagharaṇi sutta is finished.

original: 9. Vajjiputtasuttavaṇṇanā
analyzed: vajjiputta sutta vaṇṇanā
translated: The Vajjiputta sutta

original: 229. Vajjiraṭṭhe rājaputtoti vajjiraṭṭhe jātasaṃvaddho vajjirājaputto. Sabbaratticāroti🔽chaṇasampattiyā ito cito carantehi anubhavitabbanakkhattamaho. Tenāha “kattikanakkhattaṃ
analyzed: vajjiraṭṭhe rāja putto ti vajjiraṭṭhe jāta saṃvaddhaḥ vajjirāja putto sabba ratti cāro ti  chaṇa sampattiyā itas citas carantehi anubhavitabba nakkhatta mahaḥ tena āha kattika nakkhattam
translated: The prince of Vajji: the prince of Vajji, born and brought up in Vajji. The festival of the stars:

original: ghosetvā” tiādi. Ekābaddhaṃ hotīti yasmā cātumahārājikadevā tasmiṃ divase nakkhattaṃ🔽ghosetvā attano puññānubhāvasiddhāya dibbasampattiyā mahantaṃ nakkhattakīḷāsukhaṃ
analyzed: ghosetvā ti ādi eka ābaddham hoti iti cātumahārājika devā tasmin divase nakkhattaṃ  ghosetvā attano puñña anubhāva siddhāya dibba sampattiyā mahantam nakkhatta kīḷā sukham
translated: the great festival of the stars, to be experienced by those who move about here and there by the excellence of the moon’s and sun’s power. Therefore it is said: “Having proclaimed the Kattika star” and so forth. It is as if it were one: because on that day the gods of the Four Great Kings,

original: anubhavanti, tasmā taṃ tehi ekābaddhaṃ viya hoti. Bheriāditūriyānanti bherimudiṅgasaṅkhapaṇavavīṇāditūriyānaṃ.
analyzed: anubhavanti tasmā tam tehi eka ābaddham viya hoti bheri ādi tūriyānam bheri mudiṅga saṅkha paṇava vīṇā ādi tūriyānam
translated: having proclaimed the star, experience the great pleasure of the star festival by the excellence of the divine fortune established by their own merit, therefore it is as if it were one with them. The sound of drums and so forth: the sound of drums, small drums, conches, cymbals, lutes, and so forth.

original: Tāḷitānanti āraddhalayānurūpaṃ pahaṭānaṃ. Vīṇādīnanti vīṇāveṇugomukhīādīnaṃ. Vāditānanti
analyzed: tāḷita ananti āraddha laya anurūpam vīṇā dīnanti vīṇā veṇu gomukhī ādīnam vādita ananti
translated: The sound of lutes and so forth: the sound of lutes, flutes, mouth organs, and so forth. The sound of musical instruments:

original: yathāraddhamucchanānurūpaṃ saṅghaṭṭitānaṃ. Abhāsīti tena saddena ākaḍḍhiyamānahadayo
analyzed: yathā āraddha mucchana anurūpam abhāsi iti tena saddena ākaḍḍhiyamāna hadayaḥ
translated: the sound of musical instruments that are struck in accordance with the rhythm. It resounded: with a heart drawn by that sound,

original: ayoniso ummujjitvā “mahatī vata me jānī”ti anutthunanto abhāsi. Chaḍḍitadārukaṃ viyāti🔽vane chaḍḍitaniratthakakaḷiṅgaraṃ viya. Lāmakataroti nihīnataro. Devatā paṭhamappitaṃ
analyzed: ayonisaḥ ummujjitvā mahatī vata me jānī iti an utthunantaḥ abhāsi chaḍḍita dārukam viyāti  vane chaḍḍita niratthaka kaḷiṅgaram viya nihīnataraḥ devatā paṭhama appitam
translated: and he emerged from his trance unprofitably. And saying, “I have gained a great deal,” he boasted. Like a discarded log:

original: āṇiṃ paṭāṇiyā nīharantī viya tena bhikkhunā vuttamatthaṃ apanentī “tassa te bahukā
analyzed: āṇim paṭāṇiyā nīharantī viya tena bhikkhunā vuttam attham apanentī tassa te bahukā
translated: like a useless log discarded in the forest. More contemptible: more lowly. The devatā, as if removing the first statement of the bhikkhu, said, “Many envy you,”

original: pihayantī”ti avocāti vuttanti dassento “thero”tiādimāha. Saggaṃ gacchantānaṃ yathā🔽nerayikā pihayanti, evaṃ sammāpaṭipannassa tuyhaṃ bahū pihayanti, tasmā tvaṃ “pāpiyo”ti
analyzed: pihayanti iti avoca iti vuttanti dassentaḥ theraḥ iti ādim āha saggam gacchantānam yathā  nerayikā pihayanti evam sammāpaṭipannassa tuyham bahū pihayanti tasmā tvam pāpiyā iti
translated: showing that what he said was wrong. The meaning is: “The elder said this.” Just as those going to heaven🔽are envied by those in hell, so many envy you who are practicing rightly. Therefore do not think that you are worse than they.

original: attānaṃ mā maññitthāti adhippāyo.
analyzed: attānam mā maññittha ati adhippāyaḥ
translated: This is the purport.

original: Vajjiputtasuttavaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: vajjiputta sutta vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: The commentary on the Vajjiputta Sutta is finished.

original: 10. Sajjhāyasuttavaṇṇanā🔽230. Nissaraṇapariyattivasenāti addhā imaṃ pariyattiṃ nissāya vaṭṭadukkhato nissarituṃ
analyzed: sajjhāya sutta vaṇṇanā  nissaraṇa pariyatti vasena ati addhā imam pariyattim nissāya vaṭṭa dukkhataḥ nissaritum
translated: The commentary on the Sajjhaya Sutta🔽By way of the doctrine of escape: thinking, “By means of this doctrine it is possible to escape from the suffering of the round of rebirths,”

original: labbhāti evaṃ nissaraṇapariyattivasena. Sajjhāyanatoti vimuttāyatanasīse ṭhatvā sajjhāyanato.
analyzed: evam nissaraṇa pariyatti vasena sajjhāyanato ti vimutta āyatana sīse ṭhatvā sajjhāyanato
translated: by way of the doctrine of escape. By recitation: by recitation with the base of nothingness as the chief .

original: Idāni tassa nissaraṇapariyattivasena sajjhāyanakaraṇaṃ, paṭipattivasena vattapaṭivattakaraṇaṃ,
analyzed: idāni tassa nissaraṇa pariyatti vasena sajjhāyana karaṇam paṭipatti vasena vatta paṭivatta karaṇam
translated: Now, the recitation of the texts is the way of escape by way of the doctrine, and the practice of the right and the wrong is the way of escape by way of the practice.

original: vipassanābhāvanañca dassetuṃ “so kirā”tiādi vuttaṃ. Arahattaṃ pattadivase paṭipattikittanāya
analyzed: vipassanā bhāvanañca dassetum so kirā ti ādi vuttam arahattam patta divase paṭipatti kittanāya
translated: Now, in order to show the recitation of the text as the escape from that, the performance of the duties of the practice, and the development of insight, it is said, “So it is said” , etc. On the day he attained arahantship he praised the practice.

original: purimadivasesupi tathā paṭipajji, vipassanaṃ pana ussukkāpetuṃ nāsakkhīti dasseti.
analyzed: purima divasesu pi tathā paṭipajji vipassanam pana ussukkāpetum na asakkhi iti dasseti
translated: But he also practiced in the same way on the previous days, but he was unable to hasten the development of insight.

original: Kālaṃ ativattetīti idaṃ “saṅkasāyatī”ti padassa atthavacanaṃ. Therassāti sajjhāyakattherassa.
analyzed: kālam ativatteti iti idam saṅkasāyati iti padassa attha vacanam therassa ati sajjhāyaka therassa
translated: “He exceeded the time” : this is the meaning of the word “he delayed” . “The elder” : the elder who was reciting the text.

original: Dhammapadānīti sīlādidhammakkhandhadīpakāni padāni. Tenāha “sabbampi buddhavacanaṃ
analyzed: dhamma padāni iti sīla ādi dhamma kkhandha dīpakāni padāni tena āha sabbam pi buddha vacanam
translated: “The Dhammapada” : the words illuminating the aggregates of states such as virtue, etc. Therefore it is said, “all the Buddha’s word” .

original: adhippeta”nti. Na gaṇhāsi uddesanti adhippāyo. Pāḷiyaṃ “bhikkhūhi saṃvasanto”ti iminā
analyzed: adhippetanti na gaṇhāsi uddesam ti adhippāyaḥ pāḷiyam bhikkhūhi saṃvasanto ti iminā
translated: “You do not grasp the recitation” : this is the meaning. In the text it is said, “living together with the bhikkhus” .

original: tesaṃ dhammassavanatthāyapi dhammo pariyāpuṇitabboti dasseti. Virajjati etenāti virāgo,
analyzed: tesam dhamma ssavana tthāya api dhammo pariyāpuṇitabbaḥ ti dasseti virajjati etena ati virāgaḥ
translated: By this he shows that the Dhamma should be learned even for the purpose of listening to the Dhamma of those bhikkhus. “By this one becomes free from passion” : thus it is “dispassion” .

original: ariyamaggo. Jānitvāti pariññābhisamayavasena diṭṭhasutādiṃ yāthāvato jānitvā paṭivijjhitvā.
analyzed: ariya maggaḥ jānitvā ti pariññā abhisamaya vasena diṭṭha suta ādim yāthāvataḥ jānitvā paṭivijjhitvā
translated: The Noble Path. Having known: having known, having penetrated, by way of the full understanding of the known, as it really is, what has been seen, heard, etc.

original: Vissajjananti pahānaṃ. Na buddhavacanassa vissajjanaṃ. Bhaṇḍāgārikapariyattiyāpi
analyzed: vissajjanam ti pahānam na buddha vacanassa vissajjanam bhaṇḍāgārika pariyattiyā api
translated: Having given up: having abandoned. Not having given up the Buddha’s word.

original: anuññātattā pageva nissaraṇatthāya, tattha pana mattā jānitabbāti dassento “ettāvatā”tiādimāha.
analyzed: anuññāta ttā pagā iva nissaraṇa atthāya tattha pana mattā jānitabbā ti dassentaḥ ettāvatā atiādim āha
translated: Because it is permitted even by the recitation of the storehouse , how much more so for the purpose of deliverance. Showing that just that much should be known there, he said “To this extent … should be known.”

original: Sajjhāyasuttavaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: sajjhāya sutta vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: The commentary on the Discourse on Recitation is finished.

original: 11. Akusalavitakkasuttavaṇṇanā🔽231. Akusale vitakketi akosallasambhūtaṭṭhena akusale micchāvitakke. Yoni vuccati
analyzed: akusala vitakka sutta vaṇṇanā  akusale vitakke iti akosalla sambhūta ṭṭhena akusale micchā vitakke vuccati
translated: The commentary on the Discourse on Unwholesome Thoughts🔽Unwholesome thoughts: thoughts that are unwholesome in the sense of being produced by unskillfulness, i.e., wrong thoughts.

original: upāyo, tasmā asubhādike subhādivasena manasikāro ayonisomanasikāroti āha “anupāyamanasikārenā”ti.🔽Pāsādikakammaṭṭhānanti pasādāvahaṃ buddhānussatiādikammaṭṭhānaṃ. Balavapītiñca sukhañcāti
analyzed: tasmai asubha ādike subha ādi vasena manasikāraḥ āha anupāya manasikārena ati  pāsādika kammaṭṭhānan ti pasāda āvaham buddha anussati ādi kammaṭṭhānam balava pītiñca sukham ca ati
translated: A method is called a source. Therefore he said “By a wrong method of attention” for the attention to foulness, etc., as beauty, etc.🔽A pleasing meditation subject: a meditation subject that inspires confidence, such as the recollection of the Buddha. Strong happiness and bliss

original: nīvaraṇavikkhambhanato balavantaṃ upacārajjhānasahagataṃ pītiñca sukhañca.
analyzed: nīvaraṇa vikkhambhanataḥ balavantam upacāra jhāna sahagatam pītiñca sukhañca
translated: The happiness and bliss associated with access concentration, which are strong because they suppress the hindrances.

original: Akusalavitakkasuttavaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: akusala vitakka sutta vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: Commentary on the Unprofitable Thoughts Thread is finished.

original: 12. Majjhanhikasuttavaṇṇanā
analyzed: majjhanhika sutta vaṇṇanā
translated: . The Midday Thread

original: 232. Nandanavaggeti nandanavaggavaṇṇanāyaṃ tattha idhāpi gāthāya visesābhāvato. Yadi🔽evaṃ kasmā tattha saṅgītaṃ idha gahitanti? Devatāpaṭisaṃyuttataṃ upādāya devatāsaṃyutte
analyzed: nandana vagga iti nandana vagga vaṇṇanā ayam tattha idha api gāthāya visesa abhāvataḥ yadi  evam kasmā tattha saṅgītam idha gahitanti devatā paṭisaṃyuttatam upādāya devatā saṃyutte
translated: . The Joyful Group: in the commentary on the Joyful Group, there, since there is no difference in the verse here too, if🔽it is so, why is it included there? Because of its connection with deities, it is included here because of its connection with the origin of the Thread, although it is included in the

original: saṅgahitampi aṭṭhuppattiyā paṭisaṃyuttattā idha gahitaṃ.
analyzed: saṅgahitam pi aṭṭhuppattiyā paṭisaṃyutta ttā idha gahitam
translated: Deities Group.

original: Majjhanhikasuttavaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: majjhanhika sutta vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: Commentary on the Midday Thread is finished.

original: 13. Pākatindriyasuttavaṇṇanā
translated: . The Open-Bodied Thread

original: 233. Terasame yaṃ vattabbaṃ, taṃ vitthāritamevāti yojanā. Jantudevaputtasutteti jantudevaputtasuttasaṃvaṇṇanāya.
analyzed: terasame yat vattabbam tam vitthāritam eva ati yojanā jantudeva putta sutta iti jantudeva putta sutta saṃvaṇṇanāya
translated: . In the thirteenth, what is to be said is explained in detail. In the Jantu-Deva-Putta Thread: in the commentary on the Jantu-Deva-Putta Thread.

original: “Tattha saṅgītaṃ idhāpī”tiādi anantarasuttavaṇṇanāyaṃ vuttanayameva.
analyzed: tattha saṅgītam idha api itiādi anantara sutta vaṇṇanāyam vutta nayam eva
translated: “There it is included here too” and so on is the method of explanation in the immediately following Thread.

original: Pākatindriyasuttavaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: pākatindriya sutta vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: Commentary on the Open-Bodied Thread is finished.

original: 14. Gandhatthenasuttavaṇṇanā
analyzed: gandhatthenasutta vaṇṇanā
translated: . The Scent-Eaters’ Thread

original: 234. Gandhārammaṇaṃ upanijjhāyatīti gandhasaṅkhātaṃ ārammaṇaṃ upecca nijjhāyati,
analyzed: gandha ārammaṇam upanijjhāyati iti gandha saṅkhātam ārammaṇam upecca nijjhāyati
translated: . He takes delight in scents as object: he takes delight in scents as object, having approached them,

original: rūpārammaṇena viya viññāṇena rūpaṃ, gandhārammaṇena taṃ upecca nijjhāyati paccakkhato,
analyzed: rūpa ārammaṇena viya viññāṇena rūpam gandha ārammaṇena tam upecca nijjhāyati paccakkhataḥ
translated: He will sniff at it, as if at a visible object, with consciousness having that visible object as its object. He will sniff at it by going up to it, by means of craving.

original: yāthāvato sabhāvato paṭivijjhatīti attho. Upasiṅghissatīti taṇhāvasena upagantvā siṅghissati.
analyzed: yāthāvataḥ sabhāvataḥ paṭivijjhati iti attho upasiṅghissati iti taṇhā vasena upagantvā siṅghissati
translated: The meaning is that he will penetrate it by way of its individual essence, as it really is.

original: Ekaṅgametaṃ theyyānanti ārammaṇavasena theyyavatthūsu vibhajiyamānesu ekamaṅgametaṃ🔽gandhārammaṇanti āha “thenitabbāna”ntiādi. Ojāpekkhāya theyyāya pavattamānāya dhammārammaṇatāpi
analyzed: ekaṅgam etam ārammaṇa vasena theyya vatthūsu vibhajiyamānesu ekam aṅgam etam  gandha ārammaṇanti āha thenitabba anantiādi ojā apekkhāya theyyāya pavattamānāya dhamma ārammaṇa tā api
translated: This is one part of the theft: when the objects of theft are distributed according to their objects, this is one part of the theft.🔽The object of the smell: he said “to be smelt” and so on. When the theft is being carried out in the expectation of nourishment, the object of the state of consciousness may be that,

original: tassā siyā, sā pana na madhurā theyyakatā cāti “pañcakoṭṭhāsāna”nti vuttaṃ. Kāmañca
analyzed: tassā siyā sā pana na madhurā theyyaka tā ca ati pañca koṭṭhāsānam ti vuttam kāmañca
translated: but that is not a sweet theft. Therefore he said “of the five parts.”

original: taṃ gandhārammaṇaṃ kenaci pariggahitaṃ na hotīti ādiyituṃ sakkā, satthārā pana ananuññātattā
analyzed: tam gandha ārammaṇam kenacid pariggahitam na hoti iti ādiyitum sakkā satthārā pana an anuññāta ttā
translated: And it may be that that object of smell is not owned by anyone, and so it could be taken. But because it has not been allowed by the Teacher,

original: na yutto tassa paribhogo. Yaṃ pana tena bhikkhunā vuttaṃ “na harāmi na bhañjāmī”ti,
analyzed: na yuttaḥ tassa paribhogaḥ yam pana tena bhikkhunā vuttam na harāmi na bhañjāmi iti
translated: its use is not proper. But what that bhikkhu said, “I do not carry off, I do not break,”

original: tassapi ayameva parihāro. Vaṇṇīyati phalaṃ etenāti vaṇṇaṃ, kāraṇanti vuttaṃ “vaṇṇenāti kāraṇenā”ti.
analyzed: tassa api ayam eva parihāraḥ vaṇṇīyati phalam etena ati vaṇṇam kāraṇam ti vuttam vaṇṇena ati kāraṇena ati
translated: It is described by means of the fruit: thus it is a description. The reason is what is meant by “by means of the description.”🔽In him: in that bhikkhu.

original: Tasminti tasmiṃ bhikkhusmiṃ. Ākiṇṇakammantoti taṇhādiṭṭhiādivasena akusalakammanto🔽diṭṭhimohataṇhādivasena ādito paṭṭhāya kusalakammānaṃ paṭikkhepanato. Diṭṭhivasena
analyzed: tasmin ti tasmin bhikkhusmin ākiṇṇa kammanto ti taṇhā diṭṭhi ādi vasena akusala kammanto  diṭṭhi moha taṇhā ādi vasena āditaḥ paṭṭhāya kusala kammānam paṭikkhepanato diṭṭhi vasena
translated: His evil deeds are not exhausted: his unprofitable deeds are not exhausted through craving, view, etc.,🔽because he has rejected profitable deeds from the beginning through delusion of view and craving, etc.

original: ca kathinakakkhaḷakharigatattā “akhīṇakammanto kakkhaḷakammanto”ti vuttaṃ.
analyzed: ca kathina kakkhaḷa khari gata ttā akhīṇa kammanto kakkhaḷa kammanto ti vuttam
translated: Because of the view, he is said to have “evil deeds” and “hard deeds” because of the hardness of the robe-making ceremony and the difficulty of the practice.

original: Ākiṇṇaluddoti ākiṇṇo hutvā kakkhaḷo. Tenāha “bahupāpo”tiādi. Makkhitoti litto. Tanti devatācodanaṃ. Tasmāti atikkamma ṭhitattā“tvañcārahāmi vattave”ti evamāha.
analyzed: ākiṇṇa luddo ti ākiṇṇaḥ hutvā kakkhaḷaḥ tena āha bahu pāpa itiādi makkhito ti litto tanti devatā codanam tasmā iti atikkamma vattave iti evam āha
translated: He is a hard man who is full of evil: thus he is a full-of-evil hard man. Hence he said “full of evil” and so on. He is smeared: he is besmeared. That: the urging of the deities. Because: because he has gone beyond and stood.🔽He is seeking: he is seeking to arouse it in his own continuity.

original: Gavesantassa attano santāne uppādanavasena pariyesantassa. Anekayojanāyāmavitthāraṃ
analyzed: gavesantassa attano santāne uppādana vasena pariyesantassa aneka yojana āyāma vitthāram
translated: It is as extensive as the sky’s expanse,🔽which is the measure of the top of the cloud that has arisen pervading the sky’s expanse.

original: gaganatalaṃ byāpetvā uppannavalāhakakūṭappamāṇaṃ viya. Suddhoti sīlena parisuddho
analyzed: gagana talam byāpetvā uppanna valāhaka kūṭa ppamāṇam viya suddhaḥ ti sīlena parisuddhaḥ
translated: He is pure: he is purified by virtue.

original: ayanti jānāsi. Sugatinti sundaranibbattiṃ. Tena nibbānassapi saṅgaho siddho.
analyzed: ayanti jānāsi sugatim ti sundara nibbattim tena nibbānassa api saṅgahaḥ siddho
translated: “You know” means you know. “A good destination” means a good rebirth. Thus the inclusion of Nibbāna is established.

original: Gandhatthenasuttavaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: gandhatthenasutta vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: The commentary on the Gandhatthena Sutta is finished.

original: Sāratthappakāsiniyā saṃyuttanikāya-aṭṭhakathāya
analyzed: sārattha ppakāsiniyā saṃyutta nikāya aṭṭhakathāya
translated: In the commentary on the Saṃyutta Nikāya,

original: Vanasaṃyuttavaṇṇanāya līnatthappakāsanā samattā.
analyzed: vana saṃyutta vaṇṇanāya līnattha pakāsanā samattā
translated: The explanation of the meaning of the Vanasaṃyutta is finished.

original: 10. Yakkhasaṃyuttaṃ
analyzed: yakkha saṃyuttam
translated: The Yakkha Saṃyutta

original: 1. Indakasuttavaṇṇanā
analyzed: indaka sutta vaṇṇanā
translated: The Indaka Sutta

original: 235. Attano pariṇāyakattena indo nāma mahesakkho, indoti samaññā assāti katvā “indako”tipi
analyzed: attano pariṇāyaka ttena indo nāma mahesakkhaḥ indo ti samaññā assa ati katvā indako tipi
translated: He is called “Indaka” because he is a great spirit named Indra, who is known as Indra.

original: vuccati, tassa indakassa. Indakūṭe pabbate nivasatīti indakūṭanivāsī, tassa indakūṭanivāsino.
analyzed: vuccati tassa indakassa indakūṭe pabbate nivasati iti indakūṭa nivāsī tassa indakūṭa nivāsinaḥ
translated: He lives on Inda’s Peak, thus he is “Indaka’s Peak Dweller,” of that Indaka’s Peak Dweller.

original: Balikammehi yajitabbato pūjitabbato yakkho, tassa yakkhassa. Indassa nivāsaṭṭhānabhūtaṃ
analyzed: bali kammehi yajitabbataḥ pūjitabbataḥ yakkhaḥ tassa yakkhassa indassa nivāsa ṭṭhāna bhūtam
translated: He is a spirit because he is to be worshipped with offerings. Of that spirit.🔽The peak that is the dwelling place of Indra

original: kūṭaṃ indakūṭanti yakkhato kūṭena nāmaṃ laddhaṃ. Indakūṭo indo uttarapadalopena yathā
analyzed: kūṭam inda kūṭanti yakkhato kūṭena nāmam laddham inda kūṭaḥ indo uttara pada lopena yathā
translated: is called “Indaka’s Peak” because of the spirit. Indra’s Peak is called “Indaka”

original: “kelāsakūṭo kelāso”ti. Indo yakkhoti kūṭato yakkhena nāmaṃ laddhaṃ. Na cettha itarītaranissayadoso
analyzed: kelāsakūṭaḥ kelāso ti indo yakkho ti kūṭataḥ yakkhena nāmam laddham na ca ittha itarītara nissaya doso
translated: “Kelasa-kūṭa” is “Kelasa’s Peak” . The spirit was called “Indo” because he got his name from the peak . Here there is no fault of mutual dependence,

original: aññamaññūpalakkhaṇabhāvato yathā taṃ “kāyakammaṭṭhāna”nti. Rūpanti sakalaṃ rūpakkhandhamāha,
analyzed: aññamaññu upalakkhaṇa bhāvataḥ yathā tam kāya kammaṭṭhāna nti rūpa nti sakalam rūpakkhandham āha
translated: because they are characteristics of each other, as in the case of “meditation subject of the body” . “Form” : he refers to the whole materiality aggregate,

original: na rūpāyatananti. Imaṃ sarīraṃ pecca ayaṃ kinti paṭilabhatīti codeti.
analyzed: na imam sarīram ayam kinti paṭilabhati iti ca udeti
translated: not to the base of materiality . He asks “What does this body get after death?”

original: Kuto āgacchatīti parādhārarūpe jīve attani mātukucchimokkante rūpassa sambhavoti
analyzed: kutas āgacchati iti para ādhāra rūpe jīve attani mātukucchi mokkante rūpassa
translated: “Where does it come from?” : when the materiality of the being who is the support of the other kinds of materiality comes into the mother’s womb,

original: kuto nāma ṭhānato āgacchati. Tenāha “imāni ca aṭṭhīni imā ca maṃsapesiyo”tiādi. Kathaṃ🔽nvayanti ayaṃ kucchisaṅkhāte gabbhare kathaṃ sajjatīti pucchati. “Sīhānaṃva nadantānaṃ,🔽dāṭhīnaṃ girigabbhare”tiādinā gabbharo ca kucchivācako āgato. Tenāha “gabbharasminti
analyzed: kutas nāma ṭhānataḥ āgacchati tena āha imāni ca aṭṭhīni imā ca katham  nu ayanti ayam kucchi saṅkhāte gabbhare katham sajjati iti pucchati sīhānam va nadantānam  dāṭhīnam giri gabbhara iti ādinā gabbharaḥ ca kucchi vācakaḥ tena āha gabbharasmin iti
translated: from what place does it come? Hence he said “These bones and these lumps of flesh” . He asks “How does it come to be in the womb?”

original: mātukucchismi”nti. Puggalavādīti attavādupādāno. Yathā hi macchamaṃsaṃ bhuttaṃ pheṇaṃ
analyzed: mātukucchismin ti puggala vādī iti attavāda upādānaḥ yathā hi maccha maṃsam bhuttam pheṇam
translated: “As lions roar in mountain caves” . The word “womb” is a synonym for “belly” . Hence he said “In the womb” means in the mother’s belly” . “The theorist” is one who has taken up the view of a self . For just as fish-flesh when eaten causes the mouth to reek,

original: viya hutvā vilīyati, na ca paññāyati sattabhāvena appavattanato, evamevaṃ yadi mātukucchismiṃ
analyzed: viya hutvā vilīyati na ca paññāyati satta bhāvena a pavattanato evam evam yadi mātukucchismiṃ
translated: and it is not known where it has gone, because it does not reappear in the form of a living being, so too, if the embryo🔽

original: gabbhabhāvena uppannaṃ rūpaṃ satto na bhaveyya no vaḍḍheyya, vilīyitvā gaccheyya,
analyzed: gabbha bhāvena uppannam rūpam satto na bhaveyya no vaḍḍheyya vilīyitvā gaccheyya
translated: and it is not known to be occurring as a living being, so too, if the materiality arisen in the womb as the embryo were not a living being, it would not grow, it would vanish.🔽But that materiality is known, therefore by the assumption that it is a living being.

original: paññāyati ca taṃ rūpaṃ, tasmā jīvoti imāya laddhiyā. Evamāhāti “rūpaṃ…pe… gabbharasmi”nti
analyzed: paññāyati ca tam rūpam tasmai jīvaḥ iti imāya laddhiyai evam āha ati gabbharasmin ti
translated: Thus he said: “Materiality … in the womb” .

original: evamavoca. Paṭhamanti etesaṃ pañcannaṃ paṭhamaṃ. Tenāha “paṭhamena paṭisandhiviññāṇena🔽saddhi”nti. “Jātiuṇṇaṃsūhīti jātieḷakāya uṇṇaṃsūhī”ti vadanti. “Gabbhaṃ phāletvā
analyzed: evam avoca paṭhamanti etesam pañcannam paṭhamam tena āha paṭhamena paṭisandhi viññāṇena  saddhinti jāti uṇṇaṃsūhi iti jāti eḷakāya uṇṇaṃsūhi iti vadanti gabbham phāletvā
translated: First: first of the five. Hence it was said: “With the first rebirth-linking consciousness” .🔽“The three-ribbed one”: they say “the three-ribbed one of birth” .

original: gahitauṇṇā jātiuṇṇā. Tassā aṃsūhi tīhi katasuttagge”ti saṃyuttabhāṇakānaṃ adhippāyo.🔽Anāviloti accho, suppasannoti attho. Evaṃvaṇṇappaṭibhāganti vuttappamāṇasaṇṭhānasamparicchinnaṃ.
analyzed: gahita oṇṇā jāti uṇṇā tassāḥ aṃsūhi tīhi kata sutta ggā iti saṃyutta bhāṇakānam adhippāyaḥ  anāvilaḥ ti acchas su pasannaḥ ti attho evaṃvaṇṇa paṭibhāgam ti vutta ppamāṇa saṇṭhāna samparicchinnam
translated: “The three-ribbed one is the one with three ribs taken out after the womb has burst open” is the intention of the Saṃyutta reciters.🔽Clear: pure, stainless, is the meaning.🔽Such-and-such a colour and shape: delimited by such-and-such a measure and shape.

original: Kalalaṃ sampavuccatīti attabhāvo bhūtupādārūpasaṅkhāto santānavasena pavattamāno
analyzed: kalalam sampavuccati iti atta bhāvaḥ santāna vasena pavattamānaḥ
translated: Is called the “blob”: the continuity of the aggregates called “self” that occurs in the mode of a continuum.

original: kalalaṃ nāmāti kathīyati.
analyzed: kalalam nāma ati kathīyati
translated: It is called “morsel” .

original: Kalalāti yathāvuttakalalarūpahetu taṃ nissāya paccayaṃ katvā. Maṃsadhovanaudakavaṇṇanti vaṇṇato maṃsadhovanaudakavaṇṇaṃ, saṇṭhānato pana vilīnatipusadisaṃ.
analyzed: kalalā ti yathāvutta kalala rūpa hetu tam nissāya paccayam katvā maṃsa dhovana odaka vaṇṇam ti vaṇṇataḥ maṃsa dhovana odaka vaṇṇam saṇṭhānataḥ pana vilīna tipu sadisam
translated: “Morsel” : because of the morsel-material-form already stated, it is dependent on that, it is a condition for that. As to colour, it is the colour of water used for washing rice; but as to shape, it is like a jelly-blob.

original: Paripakkanti paripākakalalabhāvato paripākaṃ gataṃ suparipākaṃ gataṃ. Samūhatanti
analyzed: paripakkanti paripāka kalala bhāvataḥ paripākam gatam su paripākam gatam
translated: “Ripe” : it has reached the state of ripeness, it has reached full ripeness, through the state of ripeness of the morsel. “Congealed” :

original: samūhabhūtaṃ saṅgataṃ. Vivaṭṭamānanti pariṇamantaṃ. Tabbhāvanti karaṇe etaṃ upayogavacanaṃ,
analyzed: samūha bhūtam saṅgatam vivaṭṭamānanti pariṇamantam tad bhāvanti karaṇe etam upayoga vacanam
translated: it is congealed, it is collected together. “Turning” : changing. “By that” : this is a word expressing instrumentality.

original: tabbhāvena pariṇamantanti attho. Nissakke vā upayogavacanaṃ, tabbhāvato kalalabhāvato
analyzed: tad bhāvena pariṇamantanti atthaḥ nissakke vā upayoga vacanam tad bhāvataḥ kalala bhāvataḥ
translated: The meaning is: “by that state” . Or alternatively, it is a word expressing purpose. “By that” : because of the state of morsel,

original: kalalaṃ vipariṇamantaṃ. Abbudaṃ nāma jāyati, abbudaṃ nāma sampajjatīti attho.
analyzed: kalalam vipariṇamantam abbudam nāma jāyati abbudam nāma sampajjati iti attho
translated: the morsel is changing, and “the bud-stage is born” , the bud-stage comes to be.

original: Vilīnatipusadisā saṇṭhānavasena, vaṇṇavasena pana sitā arattāva hotīti vadanti. Maṇḍanti🔽dārikānaṃ tathā pīḷanato nibbattamaricapakkassa sārabhūtaṃ rasaṃ. Sabbabhāgehi muccatīti
analyzed: vilīna tipu sadisā saṇṭhāna vasena vaṇṇa vasena pana sitā arattā ava hoti iti vadanti maṇḍanti 🔽dārikānam tathā pīḷanataḥ nibbatta marica pakkassa sāra bhūtam rasam sabba bhāgehi muccati iti
translated: As to shape, it is like a jelly-blob. But as to colour, they say it is white, not red. “Juice” :🔽the essence produced by the pressure of the female womb. “It is released” :

original: so maṇḍo kapāle alaggo hutvā tassa sabbabhāgehi mucchitvā piṇḍito hutvā tiṭṭhati.🔽Evarūpā pesi hotīti sā pesi gabbhāsaye katthaci alaggā yathāvuttamaṇḍo viya piṇḍito
analyzed: saḥ maṇḍaḥ kapāle a laggaḥ hutvā tassa sabba bhāgehi mucchitvā piṇḍitaḥ hutvā tiṭṭhati  evarūpā pesī hoti iti sā pesī gabbha āsaye katthaci a laggā yathā vutta maṇḍaḥ viya piṇḍito
translated: It is like a lump of curd that has been put in a bowl and has stuck to it all over, and is held together by it.

original: hutvā tiṭṭhati. Tenāha “vilīnatipusadisā”ti.
analyzed: hutvā tiṭṭhati tena āha vilīna tipu sadisā iti
translated: Such is the embryo: it is like the lump of curd, not sticking anywhere in the womb, but held together by itself. Hence it is said, “like a lump of butter or curd.”

original: Pesi nibbattatīti ettha pesīti nissakke paccattavacananti āha “tato pesito”ti.
analyzed: pesi nibbattati iti ettha pesi iti nissakke paccatta vacananti āha tatas pesitaḥ ti
translated: “The embryo develops”: here “embryo” is a collective term for the individual. Therefore it is said, “from it the embryo develops.”

original: Ghanassa saṇṭhānaṃ. Nibbattaṃ kammapaccayāti taṃsaṇṭhānaṃ rūpadhammanibbattiyā jāyati. “Jarāmaraṇaṃ aniccaṃ saṅkhataṃ paṭiccasamuppanna”nti hi vuttaṃ.
analyzed: ghanassa saṇṭhānam nibbattam kamma paccayā ti tad saṇṭhānam rūpa dhamma nibbattiyā jāyati jarā maraṇam aniccam saṅkhatam paṭicca samuppannanti hi vuttam
translated: The shape of the lump. It is produced by kamma as a condition: that shape is born for the production of material phenomena. For it is said, “Aging and death are impermanent, conditioned, dependently arisen.”

original: Pīḷakāti pīḷakasadisā maṃsapiṇḍā jāyanti.🔽Sattamādīnīti ādi-saddena aṭṭhamasattāhato paṭṭhāya yāva ekacattālīsā catuttiṃsa
analyzed: pīḍakā ati pīḷaka sadisāḥ maṃsa piṇḍāḥ jāyanti  sattama ādīni iti ādi saddena aṭṭhama sattāhato paṭṭhāya yāva ekacattālīsā catuttiṃsa
translated: “Blisters”: blisters-like flesh-lumps are born.

original: sattāhāni saṅgaṇhāti. Pariṇatakālanti gabbhassa pariṇatakālaṃ. Navamāsato bahi paripakko
analyzed: satta ahāni saṅgaṇhāti pariṇata kālanti gabbhassa pariṇata kālam nava māsataḥ bahi paripakkaḥ
translated: “From the seventh week”: the word “etc.” includes the thirty-four weeks from the eighth week up to the fortieth week. “The time of development”: the time of the development of the embryo. After nine months, the embryo is fully developed.

original: nāma hoti kesalomādinibbattito. Tenāha “dvācattālīse sattāhe etāni jāyantī”ti.
analyzed: nāma hoti kesa loma ādi nibbattitaḥ tena āha dvācattālīse sattāhe etāni jāyanti iti
translated: and it is called “name” because it is produced as hair of the head, body hair, etc. Hence it is said, “These are produced in the thirty-two weeks” .

original: Tassāti gabbhaseyyakasattassa. Mātuudarapaṭalena ekābaddho hoti yato mātarā paribhuttaāhāro🔽āmāsaye patiṭṭhite gabbhassa nābhināḷānusārena gabbhagatassa sarīraṃ sampatvā āhārakiccaṃ
analyzed: tassa ati gabbhaseyyaka sattassa mātu udara paṭalena ekābaddhaḥ hoti yatas mātarā paribhutta āhāraḥ  āma āsaye patiṭṭhite gabbhassa nābhināḷā anusārena gabbha gatassa sarīram sampatvā āhāra kiccam
translated: “His” : the being in the womb. He is joined to the mother by the navel string, which is attached to his navel. When the mother eats,🔽the food descends into the stomach and then enters the womb by way of the navel string and nourishes the body of the being in the womb.

original: karoti. Āhārasamuṭṭhānarūpaṃ samuṭṭhāpetīti gabbhagatassa kāye ojāya paccayo hoti.🔽Sā ca taṃ paccayaṃ labhitvā ojaṭṭhamakaṃ rūpaṃ samuṭṭhāpeti. Evaṃ mātarā paribhuttaāhārapaccayena
analyzed: karoti āhāra samuṭṭhāna rūpam samuṭṭhāpeti iti gabbha gatassa kāye ojāya paccayaḥ hoti  sā ca tam paccayam labhitvā ojaṭṭhamakam rūpam samuṭṭhāpeti evam mātarā paribhutta āhāra paccayena
translated: It performs the function of food for the being in the womb. It is a condition for the being in the womb’s body by way of nutriment.🔽And that, having obtained that condition, produces the materiality of the nutritive essence as eighth. Thus the being in the womb is sustained for ten months

original: gabbhagato dasa māse yāpeti attano nābhināḷānusāragateneva tena yāva āhārasamuṭṭhānasattāho,
analyzed: gabbha gataḥ dasa māse yāpeti attanaḥ nābhināḷā anusāra gatena iva tena yāva āhāra samuṭṭhāna sattāhaḥ
translated: by the condition of the food eaten by the mother, by that which goes to him by way of the navel string, until the seventh week after conception.

original: tato paṭṭhāya āharaṇato. Keci pana “mātarā paribhuttaāhāro bāhiravaggo viya tassa
analyzed: tatas paṭṭhāya āharaṇato keci pana mātarā paribhutta āhāraḥ bāhira vaggo viya tassa
translated: After that it is by eating. But some say that the food eaten by the mother is like an external wall for the being in the womb,🔽and that it is sustained by the nutritive essence that is produced in its own body by the action of consciousness.

original: kāyaṃ abhisanneti parisanneti, tena so yāpetī”ti vadanti. Kucchigataṃ udarapaṭalena
analyzed: kāyam abhisannā iti parisannā iti tena saḥ yāpeti iti vadanti kucchi gatam udara paṭalena
translated: They say that it is the food that is soaked and boiled in the stomach and then passed on to the intestines that sustains him.

original: tirohitattā bahi ṭhitanti vattabbataṃ na arahatīti “kucchiyā abbhantaragato”ti āha.
analyzed: tirohita ttā bahi ṭhitanti vattabbatam na arahati iti kucchiyā abbhantara gataḥ iti āha
translated: Since it is hidden by the stomach wall, it cannot be said to be “outside.”

original: Mātukucchigato naroti mātu tirokucchigato. Evaṃ khoti iminā yathāvuttākārena ayaṃ
analyzed: mātu kucchi gataḥ tiras kucchi gataḥ evam iminā yathāvutta ākārena ayam
translated: The man in the mother’s womb: the being in the mother’s womb. Thus: by this method.

original: satto…pe… nibbattati, tasmā rūpaṃ na jīvo. Na hi diṭṭhigatassa sattāhakkamena vuḍḍhippatto
analyzed: satta upe nibbattati tasmā rūpam na jīvaḥ na hi diṭṭhigatassa satta aha kkamena vuḍḍhi ppatto
translated: This being … is reborn. Therefore form is not the soul. For the soul is not accepted as growing by the development of a view in seven days.

original: icchito aniccatāpattito.
analyzed: icchitaḥ anicca tā āpattitaḥ
translated: It is not accepted because of the consequence that it would be impermanent.

original: Indakasuttavaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: indaka sutta vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: The Commentary on the Indaka Sutta is finished.

original: 2. Sakkanāmasuttavaṇṇanā🔽236. Sakkanāmakoti baliputto viya sakkassa vasena gahitanāmo. “Eso kirā”ti pāṭho.🔽“Eko kirā”tipi likhanti. Mārassa pakkhe gato mārapakkhiko. Yadaññanti ettha yanti
analyzed: sakka nāma sutta vaṇṇanā  sakka nāmakaḥ ti bali puttaḥ viya sakkassa vasena gahita nāmo eso kira ati pāṭhaḥ  ekaḥ kirāti pi likhanti mārassa pakkhe gataḥ māra pakkhikaḥ ettha yanti
translated: The Sutta on the Name Sakka🔽Sakkanāmako: he has a name taken from Sakka, like the son of a bali-offerer. “Eso kira” is the reading.

original: kiriyāparāmasanaṃ, tasmā yaṃ aññassa anusāsanaṃ, taṃ samaṇassa na sādhūti yojanā.
analyzed: kiriyā parāmasanam tasmai yam aññassa anusāsanam tam samaṇassa na sādhu iti yojanā
translated: Some write “Eko kira.” He has gone over to Mara’s side, he is on Mara’s side. What is not his own: here the suffix -ka in aññassa is a suffix denoting action. Therefore the construction is: “What is the instruction of another is not good for an ascetic.”

original: Kāraṇenāti kāraṇamattena saṃvāso jāyati. Yena kenaci gahaṭṭhena vā pabbajitena vā.
analyzed: kāraṇena ati kāraṇa mattena saṃvāsaḥ jāyati yena kenacid gahaṭṭhena vā pabbajitena vā
translated: “By reason” : by reason alone, the association is born. By any householder or by any one gone forth.

original: Taṃ kāraṇantaraṃ samāgataṃ purisaṃ sappañño sambuddho anukampituṃ nārahati visesādhigamābhāvā,
analyzed: tam kāraṇa antaram samāgatam purisam sappaññaḥ sambuddhaḥ anukampitum na arahati visesa adhigama abhāvā
translated: The wise Sambuddha does not deserve to have compassion on a person who has come for that reason, because there is no attainment of distinction.🔽But when there is that , there is special confidence.

original: sati pana tasmiṃ savisesaṃ pasādo hotīti. Manasā ce…pe… na tena hoti saṃyutto sinehavasena
analyzed: sati pana tasmin sa visesam pasādaḥ hoti iti manasā cepe na tena hoti saṃyuttaḥ sineha vasena
translated: If he has compassion on him with the mind, etc., he is not bound by that, because of affection.

original: anukampā anuddayā tassā asaṃkiliṭṭhasabhāvattā.
analyzed: anukampā anuddayā tassāḥ a saṃkiliṭṭha sabhāvattā
translated: Compassion and sympathy are not defiling by nature.

original: Sakkanāmasuttavaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: sakka nāma sutta vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: The commentary on the Sakkanāma Sutta is finished.

original: 3. Sūcilomasuttavaṇṇanā
translated: The commentary on the Sūciloma Sutta

original: 237. Gayāya avidūre bhavo gāmo “gayā”ti vuttoti āha “gayāya”nti, tenāha “gayāya avidūre🔽niviṭṭhagāmaṃ upanisāyāti attho”ti. Gocaragāmanidassanaṃ hetaṃ. Idaṃ upari idaṃ heṭṭhāti
analyzed: gayāya avidūre bhavaḥ gāmaḥ gayā ati vutto ti āha tena āha gayāya avidūre  niviṭṭha gāmam upanisāya ati gocara gāma nidassanam hetam idam upari idam heṭṭhā ti
translated: “Gayā” is said to be a village not far from Gayā. Therefore it is said: “near Gayā.”🔽The meaning is: “near the village situated.” This is the indication of the village in the domain. There is no order of the legs of the bed in the two directions above and below

original: natthi uppaṭipāṭiyo mañcapādānaṃ dvīsu passesu dīghabhāvena. Balikammatthāya kataṃ
analyzed: natthi uppaṭipāṭiyaḥ mañca pādānam dvīsu passesu dīgha bhāvena bali kamma atthāya katam
translated: because of the length. Made for the purpose of a pillow

original: devatādhiṭṭhānanti adhippāyena devaṭṭhāne ṭhapenti. Aṭṭhapādamañcasadiso kira so🔽heṭṭhupariparivattetabbato. Kathinasibbanasūci kathinasūci. Apaccattharitvāti kiñci🔽saṅghikasenāsanassa upari paṭicchadanaṃ apaccattharitvā. Gavacchivijjhitaṃ viyāti
analyzed: devatā adhiṭṭhānam ti adhippāyena devaṭṭhāne ṭhapenti aṭṭhapāda mañca sadiso kira so  kathina sibbana sūci kathina sūci a paccattharitvā ati kiñci  saṅghika senāsanassa upari paṭicchadanam a paccattharitvā gavacchi vijjhitam viyāti
translated: ‘By divine appointment’: they are placed by divine appointment in a place for gods. It is said that it is like a bed with eight legs,

original: tehi sūcilomehi gavacchijālaṃ viya gataṃ sabbaso samohataṃ.🔽Idhāpi “kharasarīro”ti vatvā kharasarīraṃ kathinasūcisadisatāya lomassāti tassa tathābhāvassa
analyzed: tehi sūci lomehi gavacchi jālam viya gatam sabbaso samohatam  idha api khara sarīrā iti vatvā khara sarīram kathina sūci sadisa tāya lomassa ati tassa tathābhāvassa
translated: because it has to be turned over and over. ‘A needle for sewing a hard surface’: a needle for sewing a hard surface. ‘After removing’: after removing a covering from a dwelling belonging to the Community. ‘Like a cow’s hoofprint’: it is as if a cow’s hoofprint had been made by those needle-hairs. It is completely covered.

original: kāraṇaṃ dassento “so kirā”tiādimāha. Attano hatthehīti saṅghikatelasammakkhitehi
analyzed: kāraṇam dassento saḥ kira ati ādim āha attanaḥ hatthehi iti saṅghika tela sammakkhitehi
translated: Here, after saying ‘with a rough body’, he shows the reason for its being so, saying ‘It is said that …’ ‘With his own hands’: after smearing his body with oil belonging to the Community,

original: attano sarīraṃ makkhesi. Itīti vuttākārena.
analyzed: attanaḥ sarīram makkhesi iti iti vutta ākārena
translated: he smeared his body. ‘In this way’: in the way stated.

original: Samāgamaṭṭhānanti yakkhasannipātaṭṭhānaṃ. Soti sūcilomo yakkho. Manti ca tameva vadati.
analyzed: samāgama ṭṭhānam ti yakkha sannipāta ṭṭhānam saḥ ti sūcilomaḥ yakkhaḥ ca tam eva vadati
translated: ‘Meeting place’: a place for the assembly of spirits. ‘He’: the spirit Needle-hairs. ‘He said’: he said this to him.

original: Uṭṭhāpetvāti uddhaggā katvā. Apanāmesīti yathā so attano kāyaṃ upanetuṃ na sakkoti,
analyzed: uṭṭhāpetvā āti uddhaggā katvā apanāmesi iti yathā saḥ attanaḥ kāyam upanetum na sakkoti
translated: ‘After lifting him up’: after raising him up. ‘He removed him’: he removed him in such a way that he was unable to approach his body.

original: tathā karonto thokaṃ apanāmesi. Amanuññoti pharusatikkhatāya na manuñño. Cittaṃ vā
analyzed: tathā karontaḥ thokam apanāmesi amanuññaḥ ti pharusa tikkha tāya na manuññaḥ cittam vā
translated: and he did so. He was not pleased: he was not pleased because of the harshness.

original: te khipissāmīti mayhaṃ ānubhāvena tava cittavikkhepaṃ vā karissāmi. Yathā pana so
analyzed: te khipissāmi iti mayham ānubhāvena tava citta vikkhepam vā karissāmi yathā pana so
translated: I will drive out your mind: I will cause distraction of your mind by my power.

original: cittavikkhepaṃ kareyya, taṃ dassetuṃ “yesañhī”tiādi vuttaṃ. Bheravaṃ vāti vuttākārena
analyzed: citta vikkhepam kareyya tam dassetum yesam hi itiādi vuttam bheravam vā ati vutta ākārena
translated: But in order to show how he would cause distraction of his mind, it is said: “For those who are afraid of the great abyss” , etc.

original: aññathā vā bhayānakaṃ dassanamatteneva sattānaṃ bhayaṃ chambhitattaṃ lomahaṃsaṃ uppādetuṃ
analyzed: aññathā vā bhayānakam dassana mattena iva sattānam bhayam chambhita ttam loma haṃsam uppādetum
translated: A fearful sight: a sight that is fearful in the way described or otherwise, and capable of causing fear, terror, and the hairs to stand up on end in beings merely by being seen.

original: samatthaṃ. “Kathentānaṃyevā”ti vā pāṭho. Taṃ dvīsu pādesu gahetvā pāraṃ gaṅgāya khipissāmīti yojanā.
analyzed: samattham tam dvīsu pādesu gahetvā pāram gaṅgāya khipissāmi iti yojanā
translated: Or the reading is “kathentānaṃ eva” . The construction is: “I will throw you beyond the Ganges by seizing you by the feet in two places.”🔽What is its source? What is its reason?

original: Kutonidānāti kasmā kāraṇā? Aṭṭhakathāyaṃ pana samāsapadametaṃ, vibhattialopena niddesoti
analyzed: kutonidānā ati kasmā kāraṇā aṭṭhakathā ayam pana samāsa padam etam vibhatti a lopena
translated: But in the commentary this is a compound word; the locative ending has been dropped, and the locative is indicated by the word “nidāna” .🔽In order to show this, the meaning is stated: “What is its source? What is its reason?”

original: dassetuṃ “kiṃnidānā kiṃpaccayā”ti? Attho vutto. Cittaṃ ossajantīti kusalacittaṃ pavattituṃ
analyzed: dassetum kiṃnidānā kiṃpaccayā ti atthaḥ vuttaḥ cittam ossajanti iti kusala cittam pavattitum
translated: Abandoning the mind: giving up the occurrence of wholesome consciousness.

original: appadānavasena purato khipanti. Kuto samuṭṭhāyāti micchāvitakkānaṃ samuṭṭhānaṃ pucchati?
analyzed: appadāna vasena puratas khipanti kuto samuṭṭhāya ati micchā vitakkānam samuṭṭhānam pucchati
translated: and they throw it away in front of them. From what source? He asks about the source of wrong thoughts.

original: Kāmarāgādayo subhanimittādīsu ayonisomanasikārahetū. Kāmo pana ayonisomanasikāro
analyzed: kāma rāga ādayaḥ subha nimitta ādīsu a yonisomanasikāra hetū kāmaḥ pana a yonisomanasikāro
translated: Sensual desire, etc., have as their cause unwise attention to the sign of the beautiful, etc. But sensual desire and unwise attention

original: ca niyakajjhattapariyāpannoti āha “ayaṃ attabhāvo nidānaṃ etesanti itonidānā”tiādi.
analyzed: ca niya kajjhatta pariyāpannaḥ ti āha ayam atta bhāvaḥ nidānam etesan ti itas nidāna ati ādi
translated: are included in one’s own person. Hence he says, “This person is the source of these, thus they are called ‘originated from a source.’ ”

original: Evamevāti aṭṭhakathāyaṃ kīḷāpasutakumārakā viya micchāvitakkā daṭṭhabbā, tesaṃ uppattiṭṭhānabhūto
analyzed: evam evā ti aṭṭhakathā ayam kīḷā pasuta kumārakāḥ viya micchā vitakkā daṭṭhabbā tesam uppatti ṭṭhāna bhūto
translated: Thus in the commentary the wrong thoughts are to be regarded as the boys playing in the dirt,🔽the world that is the source of their origination as this person-world,

original: loko viya ayaṃ attabhāvaloko. Tehi ossajiyamānaṃ dhaṅkaṃ viya cittaṃ, tassa pāde
analyzed: lokaḥ viya ayam atta bhāva loko tehi ossajiyamānam dhaṅkam viya cittam tassa pāde
translated: the mind as the mud they throw away,

original: baddhadīghasuttakaṃ viya taṃ dūrānubandhaṃ saṃyojananti evaṃ upamāya saṃsandanaṃ daṭṭhabbaṃ.
analyzed: baddha dīgha suttakam viya tam dūra anubandham saṃyojananti evam upamāya saṃsandanam daṭṭhabbam
translated: the fetter that follows it as the long thread tied to its foot.

original: Pāpavitakkānaṃ taṃsampayuttakilesānañca taṇhā visesapaccayo tadabhāvena tesaṃ abhāvatoti
analyzed: pāpa vitakkānam tad sampayutta kilesānam ca taṇhā visesa paccayaḥ tad abhāvena tesam abhāvato ti
translated: Craving is a specific condition for the evil thoughts and for the defilements associated with them, since they do not occur when craving is absent.

original: āha “taṇhāsinehato jātā”ti. Attabhāvapariyāpannattā “attani sambhūtā”ti vuttaṃ. Tena
analyzed: āha taṇhā sinehataḥ jātā iti atta bhāva pariyāpanna ttā attani sambhūtā iti vuttam tena
translated: Hence he says, “They are born from the moisture of craving.” They are called “arisen in the self” because they are included in the person.

original: nesaṃ anaññahetukataṃ dasseti, nigrodhasseva khandhajātīti iminā pana puthubhāvañca,
analyzed: na īsam anañña hetuka tam dasseti nigrodhassa iva khandha jātī iti iminā pana puthu bhāvañca
translated: He shows that they are not due to any other cause. But by the words “the tree’s own trunk-born” he shows their separate existence,

original: visattātiādinā dubbinissaṭatañca. Vatthukāmesu rūpārammaṇādīsu puthūsu. Puthū kilesakāmā
analyzed: visatta ati ādinā vatthu kāmesu rūpa ārammaṇa ādīsu puthūsu puthū kilesa kāmā
translated: and by the words “they are hard to shake off” he shows their difficulty in being shaken off. “In the various kinds of sense desires as objects” means in the various kinds of visible data, etc., as objects. “The various kinds of defilement desires”

original: kāmarūpataṇhādayo. Tehi kilesakāmehi karaṇabhūtehi. Attabhāvaṃ khandhapañcakaṃ. Ye
analyzed: kāma rūpa taṇhā ādayaḥ tehi kilesa kāmehi karaṇa bhūtehi atta bhāvam khandha pañcakam ye
translated: means the various kinds of craving for sense desires, etc. “With those defilement desires as his doing” means with those defilement desires as his making. “His being” means the five aggregates as his being. “Those who know”

original: vipassanāya yuttapayuttā yāthāvato jānanti.
analyzed: vipassanāya yutta payuttāḥ yāthāvataḥ jānanti
translated: means those who know as they really are by means of insight.

original: Yatoti paccatte nissakkavacananti āha “yaṃ nidānamassā”ti. “Vinodentī”ti kattuniddesena
analyzed: yatas iti paccatte nissakka vacananti āha yam nidānam assa ati vinodenti iti kattu niddesena
translated: “From which” is a locative of cause. “The source of it” is the cause of it. “They dispel” is a verbal expression.

original: yena na vinodenti, taṃ kāraṇaṃ bādhitamevāti āha “maggasaccena vinodentī”ti. Vinodanañcettha
analyzed: yena na vinodenti tam kāraṇam bādhitam eva ati āha magga saccena vinodenti iti vinodanam ca itthā
translated: Since the agent is expressed, the reason why they do not dispel it is implied. That is why he says “with the truth of the path.” For the dispelling here

original: santānato nīharaṇaṃ bahikaraṇaṃ sabbaso pahānaṃ, pahīne ca tasmiṃ kilese oghaṃ tarantīti
analyzed: santānataḥ nīharaṇam bahikaraṇam sabbaso pahānam pahīne ca tasmin kilese ogham taranti iti
translated: is the removal of it from the continuity, the banishing of it, the complete abandonment of it. And when that defilement is abandoned, they cross the flood.

original: dassento “duttara”ntiādimāha. Etasmiṃ adhigate na puna bhavoti apunabbhavo, nibbānanti
analyzed: dassentaḥ duttara nti ādim āha etasmin adhigate na puna bhavaḥ ti apunabbhavaḥ nibbānam ti
translated: Showing that, he said “The hard-to-cross” , etc. When that is reached, there is no more being, thus it is “no more being” . Nibbāna is the unformed .

original: āha “apunabbhavasaṅkhātassā”tiādi. Yasmā ettha “ye naṃ pajānanti, yatonidāna”nti
analyzed: āha apunabbhava saṅkhātassa atiādi yasmai ettha ye nam pajānanti
translated: Because here the two terms “those who understand it” and “from which source”

original: padadvayena dukkhasamudayasaccāni, vinodanaggahaṇena maggasaccaṃ, apunabbhavaggahaṇena
analyzed: pada dvayena dukkha samudaya saccāni vinodana ggahaṇena magga saccam apunabbhava ggahaṇena
translated: indicate the Truths of Suffering and Origin, the term “removal” indicates the Truth of the Path, and the term “non-rebirth” indicates the Truth of Cessation,

original: nirodhasaccaṃ pakāsitaṃ, tasmā vuttaṃ “cattāri saccāni pakāsento”ti.
analyzed: nirodha saccam pakāsitam tasmā vuttam cattāri saccāni pakāsento ti
translated: therefore it was said: “expounding the four Truths.”

original: Tasmiṃyevāti yattha ṭhito “rāgo ca doso cā”tiādinā pañhaṃ pucchi, tasmiṃyeva padese
analyzed: tasmiṃ yeva ati yattha ṭhitaḥ rāgo ca doso ca ati ādinā pañham tasmiṃ yeva padese
translated: “In that very place” means in that very place where he stood and asked the question beginning “Rāga and dosa,”

original: ṭhito. Desanānusārenāti satthu sāmukkaṃsikadhammadesanāya anussaraṇena. Ñāṇaṃ pesetvāti🔽vipassanāpaṭipāṭiyā nibbānaṃ pati anubodhañāṇaṃ pesetvā pavattetvā. Sotāpattiphale
analyzed: ṭhitaḥ desanā anusārena ati satthu sāmukkaṃsika dhamma desanāya anussaraṇena ñāṇam pesetvā ati  vipassanā paṭipāṭiyā nibbānam pati anubodha ñāṇam pesetvā pavattetvā sotāpatti phale
translated: standing in that very place. “By the instruction” means by the recollection of the Blessed One’s comprehensive teaching of the Dhamma. “Directing his knowledge” means

original: patiṭṭhitoti sahassanayapaṭimaṇḍitassa paṭhamamaggassa adhigamena paṭhamaphale patiṭṭhito
analyzed: patiṭṭhito ti sahassa naya paṭimaṇḍitassa paṭhama maggassa adhigamena paṭhama phale patiṭṭhito
translated: directing his knowledge of penetration to Nibbāna by the method of insight. “Was established in the fruit of stream-entry” means that he was established in the first fruit by the attainment of the first path adorned with a thousand modes.

original: paṭilabhatīti yojanā. Na kiliṭṭhattabhāve tiṭṭhanti mahānubhāvattā ariyadhammassa.
analyzed: paṭilabhati iti yojanā na kiliṭṭha tta bhāve tiṭṭhanti mahā anubhāva ttā ariya dhammassa
translated: The meaning is that he obtained it. “The ariyan Dhamma does not stand in a state of defilement” because of its great potency.

original: Setakaṇḍupīḷakasūciyoti setabhāvaṃ patvā kaṇḍupīḷakā lomasūciyo sabbā anavasesā patitā🔽paribhaṭṭhā apagatā. Bhummadevatāparihāranti bhummadevattabhāvanti.
analyzed: seta kaṇḍu pīḷaka sūciyaḥ ti seta bhāvam patvā kaṇḍu pīḷakāḥ loma sūciyaḥ sabbāḥ anavasesā patitā  paribhaṭṭhāḥ apagatāḥ bhummadevatā parihāranti bhummadevatta bhāvanti
translated: The needle-hairs of the itch-plague, etc., are the needle-like hairs of the itch-plague that have fallen off, all without exception,

original: Sūcilomasuttavaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: sūciloma sutta vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: having become white in colour and having been rubbed off and removed. The earth-deities’ sorrow: the earth-deities’ sorrow. The commentary on the Needle-Hairs Thread is finished.

original: 4. Maṇibhaddasuttavaṇṇanā
translated: The Discussion of the Thread on the Good Gem

original: 238. Sukhaṃ paṭilabhatīti diṭṭhadhammikādibhedaṃ sukhaṃ adhigacchati. Niccameva seyyo
analyzed: sukham paṭilabhati iti diṭṭhadhammika ādi bhedam sukham adhigacchati niccam eva seyyaḥ
translated: He gains happiness: he attains the kind of happiness classed as pertaining to the here and now, etc. He is always better off

original: satimato āyatiṃ hitacaraṇato. Maṇibhaddo “satimāpuggalo satokārī sampati veraṃ nappasavatī”ti
analyzed: satimataḥ āyatim hita caraṇataḥ maṇibhaddaḥ satimā puggalo satokārī sampati veram na ppasavati iti
translated: because of his mindfulness and his doing what is beneficial in the future. Maṇibhadda said “One who is mindful, who acts with mindfulness, does not carry on enmity”

original: adhippāyena “verā ca parimuccatī”ti āha. Bhagavā pana satimantatāsiddhiyā veraparimuccanaṃ
analyzed: adhippāyena verā ca parimuccati iti āha bhagavā pana satimanta tā siddhiyā vera parimuccanam
translated: with the intention that “he is freed from enmity.” But the Blessed One said “He is not freed from enmity”

original: na accantikaṃ, nāpi ekantikaṃ paṭipakkhena parato ca appahīnattāti taṃ nisedhento
analyzed: na accantikam na api ekantikam paṭipakkhena paratas ca a pahīna ttā ati tam nisedhentaḥ
translated: because freedom from enmity is not immediate and not certain by the mere success of mindfulness, since it is not abandoned by the opposite and by another.🔽Then, after saying “He is not freed from enmity,” he said “He is freed from enmity”

original: “verā ca na parimuccatī”ti vatvā, yaṃ accantikaṃ ekantikañca parassa vasena veraparimuccanaṃ,
analyzed: verā ca na parimuccati iti vatvā yam accantikam ekantikam ca parassa vasena vera parimuccanaṃ
translated: in order to show that freedom from enmity is immediate and certain by another’s influence, namely,

original: taṃ dassento “yassā”ti gāthamāha. Karuṇāyāti appanāppattāya karuṇāya. Karuṇāpubbabhāgeti
analyzed: tam dassentaḥ yassa iti gātham āha karuṇāya iti appanā appattāya karuṇāya karuṇā pubbabhāge ti
translated: “Through compassion”: through compassion that has reached absorption.

original: karuṇābhāvanāya vasena uppāditapaṭhamajjhānūpacāre. Soti karuṇābhāvanaṃ bhāvento
analyzed: karuṇā bhāvanāya vasena uppādita paṭhama jhānu upacāre karuṇā bhāvanam bhāvento
translated: “The preliminary stage of compassion”: the access of the first jhāna arisen through the development of compassion.🔽“That person”: the person who is developing compassion.

original: puggalo. Mettaṃsoti mettacittaṃ aṃso eko kusalakoṭṭhāso etassāti mettaṃso. Tassa🔽kenacīti tassa arahato karuṇāya mettābhāvanāya ca sātisayattā tadabhāvena kenaci
analyzed: puggalaḥ mettaṃso ti metta cittam aṃso ekaḥ kusala koṭṭhāsaḥ etassa ati mettaṃso tassa  kenaci iti tassa arahataḥ karuṇāya mettā bhāvanāya ca sā ati sayattā tad abhāvena kenaci
translated: “With loving-kindness as his portion”: loving-kindness is a portion, a single profitable unit, in him, thus he is “with loving-kindness as his portion.”🔽“With no one”: because of the excess of his compassion and his development of loving-kindness, there is no one with whom he has any enmity

original: puggalena saddhiṃ verappasaṅgo nāma natthi. Iminā khīṇāsavepi mettākaruṇābhāvanārahite
analyzed: puggalena saddhim verappasaṅgaḥ nāma natthi iminā khīṇāsave pi mettā karuṇā bhāvanā rahite
translated: through the absence of that. Even with regard to Arahants, if anyone were to have no development of compassion and loving-kindness,

original: koci attano cittadosena veraṃ kareyya, na pana tasmiṃ mettākaruṇācetovimuttisamannāgate
analyzed: koci citta dosena veram kareyya na pana tasmin mettā karuṇā cetaḥ vimutti samannāgate
translated: someone might take offence at him through his own state of mind, but no one would take offence at one who possesses the deliverance of mind through loving-kindness and compassion.

original: koci veraṃ kareyya. Evaṃ mahiddhikā brahmavihārabhāvanāti dasseti.
analyzed: koci veram kareyya evam mahiddhikā brahmavihāra bhāvanā ati dasseti
translated: This shows that the development of the divine abidings is of great fruit.

original: Maṇibhaddasuttavaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: maṇibhadda sutta vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: The commentary on the Maṇibhaddaka Sutta is finished.
