translated: The faculty of faith is the proximate cause of the factors of stream-entry, namely, association with superior persons, hearing the true Dhamma, careful attention,

original: dhammānudhammapaṭipattīti imesaṃ sotāpattimaggādhigamassa aṅgānaṃ āsannakāraṇaṃ saddhindriyanti
analyzed: dhamma anudhamma paṭipattī iti imesam sotāpatti magga adhigamassa aṅgānam āsanna kāraṇam saddhi indriya nti
translated: and practice in accordance with the Dhamma.

original: āha “sotāpattiyaṅgapadaṭṭhānaṃ saddhindriya”nti. Vuttañhetaṃ – “saddhājāto upasaṅkamati,
analyzed: āha sotāpattiyaṅga padaṭṭhānam saddhindriyam ti vuttam ha etam saddhā jātaḥ upasaṅkamati
translated: Thus it is said: “The faculty of faith is the proximate cause of the factors of stream-entry.” For this is said: “One who is possessed of faith approaches,

original: upasaṅkamanto payirupāsati, payirupāsanto sotaṃ odahati, ohitasoto dhammaṃ suṇātī”tiādi.🔽Diṭṭhoghaṃ tarati etenāti diṭṭhoghataraṇaṃ, diṭṭhoghassa taraṇaṃ. Kāmañcettha “tarati
analyzed: upasaṅkamantaḥ payirupāsati payirupāsantaḥ sotam odahati ohita sotaḥ dhammam suṇāti itiādi  diṭṭha ogham tarati etena ati diṭṭha ogha taraṇam diṭṭha oghassa taraṇam kāmañca ittha tarati
translated: approaching, he pays respect, having paid respect he lends an ear, and listening he hears the Dhamma” .🔽“It crosses the flood of views”: the crossing of the flood of views, the crossing of the flood of views. Although it is said here: “it crosses the flood,”

original: ogha”nti vuttaṃ, vattamānasamīpepi pana vattamānaṃ viya voharaṇaṃ yuttaṃ diṭṭhoghassa
analyzed: ogham ti vuttam vattamāna samīpe api pana vattamānam viya voharaṇam yuttam diṭṭha oghassa
translated: it is proper to speak as if it were in the present, in proximity to the present, as if it were: “the crossing of the flood of views.”

original: tiṇṇabhāvassa ekantikattāti “sotāpannañca pakāsetī”ti vuttaṃ. Esa nayo sesesupi.
analyzed: tiṇṇa bhāvassa ekantika ttā ati sotāpannam ca pakāseti iti vuttam esa nayo sesesu pi
translated: Since the state of having crossed the flood of views is absolute, it is said: “it reveals the stream-enterer.” The same method applies to the rest .

original: Diṭṭhivicikicchādipaṭipattantarāyakarānaṃ pāpadhammānaṃ samucchinnattā sotāpanno…pe…🔽appamādena samannāgato. “Sotāpatti…pe… taratī”ti ettake vutte sakideva imassa lokassa🔽āgamanampi gahitaṃ siyāti tannivattanatthaṃ “ārādhetvā…pe… avasesa”nti vuttaṃ. Nanu
analyzed: diṭṭhi vicikicchā ādi paṭipatta antarāya karānam pāpa dhammānam  appamādena samannāgato sotāpatti pe tarati iti ettake vutte sakidevaḥ imassa lokassa  āgamanam pi gahitam siyāti tad nivattana attham ārādhetvā āpe avasesam ti vuttam nanu
translated: He is a stream-enterer because he has cut off the evil states that obstruct the path of stream-entry, etc.🔽He is endowed with diligence. If it were said simply, “He crosses over the flood of sensuality,” it might be thought that he crosses over the flood of sensuality in this world alone.

original: “avasesa”nti vuttattā sotāpattimaggena atiṇṇaṃ anavasesaṃ bhavoghavatthu gahitameva
analyzed: avasesam ti vutta ttā sa utāpatti maggena atiṇṇam anavasesam bhava ogha vatthu gahitam eva
translated: To prevent this, it is said, “Having fulfilled the state of stream-entry, he crosses over the flood of sensuality.” But since it is said, “the flood of sensuality,” is not the remaining flood of becoming included?

original: siyāti? Na, upari dvīhi maggehi taritabbānaṃ tesaṃ parato dvinnaṃ pahānavasena vuccamānattā.
analyzed: siyā ti na upari dvīhi maggehi taritabbānam tesam paratas dvinnam pahāna vasena vuccamāna ttā
translated: No, because the remaining flood is mentioned in terms of the abandoning of the two floods that are to be crossed over by the two higher paths.

original: Apavādavisayampi pariharati – “evaṃ esā codanā attano visaye na patiṭṭhātī”ti. Anādikālabhāvattā
analyzed: apavāda visayam pi pariharati evam esā codanā attanaḥ visaye na patiṭṭhāti iti anādi kāla bhāva ttā
translated: He also avoids the extreme of nihilism, thinking, “Thus this accusation does not stand up in its own place.”

original: kāmasaññāya kāmoghataraṇaṃ mahatā eva vīriyena sādhetabbanti āha “vīriyenā”ti. Tatiyaṃ
analyzed: kāma saññāya kāmogha taraṇam mahatā eva vīriyena sādhetabbanti āha vīriyena ati tatiyam
translated: Since sensual perception has existed since beginningless time, the crossing over of the flood of sensuality can be accomplished only with great effort. Therefore it is said, “with energy.”

original: maggaṃ ārādhetvā. Kāmoghassa vatthu kāmoghavatthu, kāmaguṇehi saddhiṃ sabbo kāmabhavo.
analyzed: maggam ārādhetvā kāmoghassa vatthu kāmogha vatthu kāma guṇehi saddhim sabbaḥ kāma bhavaḥ
translated: and he has attained the path. The “object of the flood of sensuality” is the object of the flood of sensuality, which is the entire sensuality-world together with the strands of sensuality.

original: Kāmoghasaññitanti kāmoghasaṅkhātaṃ. Kāmanaṭṭhena kāmo ca so dukkho cāti kāmadukkhaṃ.🔽Assādanaṭṭhena kāmo eva saññāti kāmasaññā, sabbaso samucchinnattā vigatā kāmasaññā
analyzed: kāma ogha saññitam ti kāma ogha saṅkhātam kāmana ṭṭhena kāmo ca saḥ dukkho ca ati kāma dukkham  assādana ṭṭhena kāmaḥ eva saññā ati kāma saññā sabbaso samucchinna ttā vigatā kāma saññā
translated: “Called the flood of sensuality”: called the flood of sensuality. Sensuality is suffering because of the nature of sensuality.🔽Sensuality is perception because of the nature of sensuality. Perception of sensuality is abandoned because of the complete cutting off of sensuality.

original: etissāti vigatakāmasaññā. Sabbesaṃ rāgādimalānaṃ mūlabhūtattā sattasantānassa visesato
analyzed: etissa ti vigata kāma saññā sabbesam rāga ādi malānam mūla bhūta ttā satta santānassa visesataḥ
translated: “Free from perception of sensuality”: free from perception of sensuality. Because of being the root of all defilements such as lust, etc., the stream of existence is made to have a defiled nature.

original: malīnasabhāvāpādanato paramaṃ ukkaṃsagataṃ malanti paramamalaṃ, avijjā. Tenāha bhagavā
analyzed: malīna sabhāva āpādanataḥ paramam ukkaṃsa gatam malanti parama malam avijjā tena āha bhagavā
translated: Therefore, the supreme stain is the highest stain. Ignorance is the supreme stain. Therefore, the Blessed One said:

original: – “avijjāparamaṃ mala”nti.
analyzed: avijjā paramam malanti
translated: “Ignorance is the supreme stain.”

original: Paññāpadaṃ gahetvāti yathāvuttaṃ paññāpadaṃ hadaye ṭhapetvā. Tappasaṅgena attano
analyzed: paññāpadam gahetvā ti yathā vuttam paññāpadam hadaye ṭhapetvā tad pasaṅgena attano
translated: “Having taken the step of wisdom”: having placed in the heart the step of wisdom as stated. By the connection with that,

original: paṭibhānena sabbehi viya uggahitaniyāmena. Sabbatthevāti pañcasupi ṭhānesu. Atthayuttipucchāti
analyzed: paṭibhānena sabbehi viya uggahita niyāmena sabbattha iva ati pañcasu pi ṭhānesu attha yutti pucchā ati
translated: by his own radiance, as if by all, by the method of taking up. In all five places, he asked about the application of the meaning.

original: paññādiatthasamadhigamassa yuttiyā kāraṇassa pucchā. Tenāha “ayaṃ hī”tiādi. Paññādiatthaṃ🔽ñatvāti paññādhana-kitti-mitta-abhisamparāyasaṅkhātaṃ atthaṃ sarūpato saccapaṭivedhanipphādanena🔽ñāṇena jānitvā. Nanu esa lokuttaraṃ sotāpattimaggaphalapaññaṃ tadadhigamūpāyaṃ lokiyapaññañca🔽abhibhavitvā ṭhito, so kasmā tattha atthayuttiṃ pucchatīti? Saccametaṃ, upari pana
analyzed: paññā ādi attha samadhigamassa yuttiyā kāraṇassa pucchā tena āha ayam hi itiādi paññā ādi attham  ñatvā iti paññā dhana kitti mitta abhisamparāya saṅkhātam attham sarūpataḥ sacca paṭivedha nipphādanena  ñāṇena jānitvā nanu esa lokuttaram sa utāpatti magga phala paññam tad adhigama upāyam lokiya paññañca  abhibhavitvā ṭhitaḥ saḥ kasmā tattha attha yuttim pucchati iti saccam etam upari pana
translated: The question is about the reason for the attainment of the meaning of wisdom, etc. Therefore he said, “This is the reason,” etc.🔽Having known the meaning of wisdom, etc.,🔽having known the meaning called wealth, fame, friends, and the next world by the knowledge that produces the penetration of the truth in its own form.

original: samādhissa yuttiṃ pucchitukāmo paññāya seṭṭhabhāvato, tassa ca ekadeseneva adhigatattā🔽tameva ādiṃ katvā pucchati. “Kāya yuttiyā”tiādi atthavaṇṇanaṃ atidissati “esa nayo
analyzed: samādhissa yuttim pucchitu kāmo paññāya seṭṭha bhāvataḥ tassa ca eka desena iva adhigata ttā  tam eva ādim katvā pucchati kāya yuttiyā atiādi attha vaṇṇanam atidissati esa nayo
translated: Isn’t it that he stands, having overcome the wisdom of the supramundane stream-entry path and fruit, and the wisdom of the world that is the means of attaining it, so why does he ask about the reason for the meaning there? That is true, but he wants to ask about the reason for the higher concentration, and he asks, making wisdom the beginning, because he has attained it by only one part.🔽The explanation of the meaning beginning with “What is the reason?” is too obvious. The same method

original: dhanādīsū”ti. Tatthāpi atthayuttipucchābhāvo pana “sabbatthevā”ti iminā vibhāvitoti.
analyzed: dhana ādīsu iti tattha api attha yutti pucchā bhāvaḥ pana sabbattha iva ati iminā vibhāvito ti
translated: applies to the verses on wealth, etc. But the absence of a question about the reason for the meaning there is distinguished by this: “In all cases.”

original: Saddhāsussūsāappamādauṭṭhānasaṅkhātehi catūhi kāraṇehi. Kāyasucaritādibhedena ājīvaṭṭhamakasīlabhūtena.
analyzed: saddhā sussūsa a appamāda oṭṭhāna saṅkhātehi catūhi kāraṇehi kāya su carita ādi bhedena ājīva ṭhamaka sīla bhūtena
translated: By means of the four reasons called faith, learning, heedfulness, and energy, and by means of the eight kinds of good conduct beginning with bodily good conduct and ending with livelihood, which are the ground for virtue.

original: Samathavipassanābhūtena nippariyāyena bodhipakkhiye eva gaṇhanto “aparabhāge”ti āha.
analyzed: samatha vipassanā bhūtena nippariyāyena bodhi pakkhiye eva gaṇhantaḥ aparabhāge iti āha
translated: And by means of the ground for concentration and insight, he takes the factors of enlightenment themselves in the absolute sense. Therefore he says “later on.”

original: Pariyāyabodhipakkhiyā pana visesato vuṭṭhānagāminivipassanākālepi labbhanti. Pubbabhāgeti
analyzed: pariyāya bodhi pakkhiyā pana visesataḥ vuṭṭhāna gāmini vipassanā kāle pi labbhanti pubba bhāge ti
translated: But the factors of enlightenment in the conventional sense are available even at the time of insight leading to emergence. The words “in the earlier stage”

original: vā taruṇavipassanākālaṃ. Tato pubbasādhanañca sandhāya “aparabhāge”ti punāha, tato
analyzed: vā taruṇa vipassanā kālam tatas pubba sādhanam ca sandhāya aparabhāga iti puna āha tatas
translated: refer to the time of tender insight. And referring to the requisites prior to that, he says “later on” again. The meaning is: “after that.”

original: paranti attho. Dhammanti paṭipattidhammaṃ. Na saddhāmattakeneva paññaṃ labhatīti
analyzed: param ti atthaḥ dhammam ti paṭipatti dhammam na saddhā mattakena iva paññam labhati iti
translated: The word “Dhamma” here means the Dhamma of practice. The construction is: “One does not obtain wisdom merely through faith.”

original: yojanā. Yadi evaṃ kasmā “saddahāno”ti vuttanti āha “yasmā panā”tiādi. Kiṃ vuttaṃ
analyzed: yojanā yadi evam kasmā saddahānaḥ iti vuttanti āha yasmā pana itiādi kim vuttam
translated: If that is so, why is it said “through faith”? He answers: “But since … ”

original: hotītiādinā vuttameva atthaṃ vivarati. Na kevalaṃ sussūsāmattena paññāpaṭilābho,
analyzed: hoti iti ādinā vuttam eva attham vivarati na kevalam sussūsā mattena paññā paṭilābho
translated: He explains the meaning already stated by the words “What is meant?” etc. Wisdom is not obtained merely by being a learner;

original: atha kho appamādena paññaṃ labhatīti dassetuṃ pāḷiyaṃ “appamatto vicakkhaṇo”ti vuttanti
analyzed: atha kho appamādena paññam labhati iti dassetum pāḷiyam appamattaḥ vicakkhaṇo ti vuttan ti
translated: rather, one obtains wisdom through heedfulness. In order to show this, the words “heedful, discerning” are stated in the text.

original: tadatthaṃ dassento “eva”ntiādimāha.
analyzed: tad attham dassentaḥ eva nti ādim āha
translated: He said “thus” in order to show that.

original: Idāni saddhādīnaṃ paññāpaṭilābhassa taṃtaṃvisesapaccayāni nīharitvā dassetuṃ “eva”nti🔽vuttaṃ. Sussūsāyāti sotukāmatāya. Sā atthato upasaṅkamanādi. Paññādhigamūpāyanti
analyzed: idāni saddhā ādīnam paññā paṭilābhassa tat tat visesa paccayāni nīharitvā dassetuṃ evam ti  vuttam sussūsāya ati sotu kāma tāya sā atthataḥ upasaṅkamana ādi paññā adhigama upāyanti
translated: Now, in order to point out the conditions for the acquisition of understanding by faith, etc., by showing each one separately, he said “thus.”🔽“Desire to hear” is the desire to listen. That is, in the sense of the meaning, it is the going to the teacher, etc. “The means to the attainment of understanding”

original: pariyattidhammamāha. Tenāha “suṇātī”ti. Gahitaṃ na pamussati, satiavippavāsalakkhaṇo🔽hi appamādoti. Na kevalaṃ yāthāvato gahaṇakosallameva vicakkhaṇatā, atha kho yāthāvato🔽paññāsampavedhanañcāti āha “vitthārikaṃ karotī”ti. Idāni paññāpaṭilābhahetuṃ matthakaṃ
analyzed: pariyatti dhammam āha tena āha suṇāti iti gahitam na pamussati sati a vippavāsa lakkhaṇo  hi appamādaḥ ti na kevalam yāthāvataḥ gahaṇa kosallam eva vicakkhaṇa tā atha kho yāthāvataḥ  paññā sampavedhanam ca ati āha vitthārikam karoti iti idāni paññā paṭilābha hetum matthakam
translated: is the doctrine of the scriptures. Therefore he said “hears.” “Does not forget what is grasped” means that he does not let what is grasped slip away.🔽For heedfulness is characterized by the non-lapse of mindfulness.🔽Not only is the skill in grasping things as they are called “cleverness,” but also the penetration of things as they are by understanding. Therefore he said “makes it extensive.”

original: pāpetvā dassetuṃ “sussūsāya vā”tiādi vuttaṃ. Atthamupaparikkhatīti sutakatānaṃ dhammānaṃ
analyzed: pāpetvā dassetum sussūsāya vā tiādi vuttam attham upaparikkhati iti suta katānam dhammānam
translated: Now, in order to point out the cause for the acquisition of understanding by bringing it to a head, he said “for the desire to hear,” etc. “Examines the meaning” means that he examines the meaning of the texts that he has learned,

original: pāḷiatthūpaparikkhāpubbakaṃ rūpārūpavibhāgaṃ paramatthaṃ salakkhaṇato sāmaññalakkhaṇato
analyzed: rūpa arūpa vibhāgam paramattham sa lakkhaṇataḥ sāmañña lakkhaṇataḥ
translated: preceded by the examination of the meaning of the texts. The ultimate truth is the analysis of the material and immaterial. It is the specific characteristic and the universal characteristic.

original: ca upaparikkhati vīmaṃsati. Anupubbenāti evaṃ ñātapariññaṃ patvā tīraṇapariññāya
analyzed: ca upaparikkhati vīmaṃsati anupubbena ati evam ñāta pariññam patvā tīraṇa pariññāya
translated: and he examines and investigates them.

original: tato anukkamena tīraṇapariññaṃ pahānapariññañca matthakaṃ pāpento maggappaṭipāṭiyā
analyzed: tatas anukkamena tīraṇa pariññam pahāna pariññañca matthakam pāpentaḥ magga ppaṭipāṭiyā
translated: In due course: after he has thus reached full-understanding as knowledge, he reaches the culmination of the full-understanding of probing and of the full-understanding of abandoning by the successive order of the path.

original: paramatthasaccabhūtaṃ nibbānaṃ sacchikaroti.
analyzed: paramattha sacca bhūtam nibbānam sacchikaroti
translated: He realizes Nibbāna, which is the ultimate truth.

original: Imāni saddhādīni cattāri kāraṇāni matthakaṃ pāpetvā dassento āha “desakālādīni ahāpetvā”ti.🔽Yasmiṃ dese yasmiṃ kāle ye ca sahāyake nissāya yaṃ kiccaṃ tiretabbaṃ, tāni desakālādīni🔽anatikkamitvā attano abhivuḍḍhiṃ icchantena “ayaṃ nāma deso, yatthāhaṃ etarahi vasāmi,
analyzed: imāni saddhā ādīni cattāri kāraṇāni matthakam pāpetvā dassentaḥ āha desa kāla ādīni ahāpetvā iti  yasmin dese yasmin kāle ye ca sahāyake nissāya yam kiccam tiretabbam tāni desa kāla ādīni  an atikkamitvā attanaḥ abhivuḍḍhim icchantena ayam nāma desaḥ yattha aham etarahi vasāmi
translated: Showing that he has reached the culmination by means of these four reasons beginning with faith, he said “without overlooking country, time, etc.”

original: ayaṃ kālo, ime mittā, ime amittā, ime āyavayā, ahañca ediso jāti-kula-padesa-balabhoga-parivārādīhi,🔽taṃ kiccaṃ idāni āraddhabbaṃ, idāni nāraddhabba”nti sabbaṃ upaparikkhitvā paṭipajjitabbaṃ.
analyzed: ayam kālaḥ ime mittāḥ ime amittāḥ ime āyavayāḥ aham ca edisaḥ jāti kula padesa bala bhoga parivāra ādīhi 🔽tat kiccam idāni āraddhabbam idāni na āraddhabbam ti sabbam upaparikkhitvā paṭipajjitabbam

original: Evaṃ paṭipajjanto hi lokiyassa dhanassa paṭirūpādhigamūpāyaṃ karoti nāma. Lokuttarassa
analyzed: evam paṭipajjantaḥ hi lokiyassa dhanassa paṭirūpa adhigama upāyam karoti nāma lokuttarassa
translated: For one who practices thus is said to be making an effort to obtain a suitable reward for worldly wealth.

original: pana sīlavisodhanādivasena veditabbaṃ. Vahitabbabhāvena dhuro viyāti dhuro, bhāro.
analyzed: pana sīla visodhana ādi vasena veditabbam vahitabba bhāvena dhuraḥ viyāti dhuraḥ bhāraḥ
translated: But for supramundane wealth it should be understood as purification of virtue, etc.🔽“Bearing the yoke” : the yoke is the burden .🔽But here the yoke is the undertaking of the yoke, with the omission of the middle term .🔽Energy is the yoke-bearer .🔽He has that in superlative degree,

original: Idha pana dhurasampaggaho uttarapadalopena dhuro, vīriyaṃ. So sātisayo etassa atthīti
analyzed: idha pana dhura sampaggahaḥ uttara pada lopena dhuraḥ vīriyam so sa atisayaḥ etassa atthi iti
translated: therefore he is a great yoke-bearer .

original: dhuravā. “Uṭṭhātā”ti padena kāyikavīriyassa vakkhamānattā “cetasikavīriyavasenā”ti
analyzed: dhuravā uṭṭhātā ti padena kāyika vīriyassa vakkhamāna ttā cetasika vīriya vasena āti
translated: Since the word “energetic” refers to bodily energy, the word “mental” is specified.

original: visesitaṃ. Anikkhittadhuro dhorayhabhāvato. Tiṇā bhiyyo na maññatīti tiṇaṃ viya paribhavanto
analyzed: visesitam a nikkhitta dhuraḥ dhorayha bhāvataḥ tiṇā bhiyyas na maññati iti tiṇam viya paribhavantaḥ
translated: He does not consider himself more distinguished than others,🔽but treats them with contempt, as if they were grass.

original: atibhuyya vattatīti attho. Ādinā nayenāti ettha ādi-saddena –
analyzed: atibhuyya vattati iti atthaḥ ādinā nayena ati ettha ādi saddena
translated: By the word “beginning” is meant🔽“He who performs the duties of a man

original: “Karaṃ purisakiccāni, so sukhā na vihāyati; ;
analyzed: karam purisa kiccāni saḥ sukhā na vihāyati
translated: does not fail to enjoy happiness.🔽“Not by mere lying in bed by day

original: “Na divā soppasīlena, rattimuṭṭhānadessinā;
analyzed: na divā soppa sīlena ratti muṭṭhāna dessinā
translated: and by rising at night to work,

original: Niccaṃ mattena soṇḍena, sakkā āvasituṃ ghara”nti ca. ; –
analyzed: niccam mattena soṇḍena sakkāḥ āvasitum gharanti ca
translated: can one live in a house always drunk with liquor.”

original: Evamādīnaṃ saṅgaho. Asithilaparakkamo analasabhāvato. Ekamūsikāyāti ekāya matamūsikāya.🔽Nacirassevāti catumāsabbhantareyeva. Catusatasahassasaṅkhaṃ cūḷantevāsī viyāti kākaṇikaḍḍhakahāpaṇa-soḷasa-kahāpaṇa-catuvīsati-kahāpaṇa-sataharaṇakkamena
analyzed: evamādīnam saṅgahaḥ asithila parakkamaḥ eka mūsikāya ati ekāya mata mūsikāya  nacirassa iva ati catu māsa abbhantareya iva catusata sahassa saṅkham cūḍa antevāsī viyāti kākaṇi kaḍḍha kahāpaṇa soḷasa kahāpaṇa catuvīsati kahāpaṇa sata haraṇa kkamena
translated: and so on. He is not slack in his efforts, because he is not lazy by nature. “One mouse” means one dead mouse.🔽“In no long time” means within four months. “Like the junior treasurer” means like the junior treasurer who received four hundred thousand.

original: dve satasahassāni, cūḷakamahāseṭṭhino dhītulābhavasena dve satasahassānīti evaṃ catusatasahassasaṅkhaṃ
analyzed: dve sata sahassāni cūḷaka mahā seṭṭhinaḥ dhītu lābha vasena dve sata sahassāni iti evam catusata sahassa saṅkham
translated: Two hundred thousand he received as a dowry from the daughter of the great treasurer, and two hundred thousand he received as a dowry from the daughter of the junior treasurer. Thus he received four hundred thousand.

original: dhanaṃ ekamūlena yathā cūḷantevāsī vindi, evaṃ aññopi patirūpakārī dhuravā uṭṭhātā
analyzed: dhanam eka mūlena yathā cūḷa antevāsī vindi evam aññaḥ api pati rūpa kārī dhuravā uṭṭhātā
translated: Just as the junior treasurer obtained this wealth by means of a single capital, so too can another who is suitable, who is strong, who is energetic,

original: vindate dhanaṃ. Ayañca attho cūḷakaseṭṭhijātakena dīpetabbo. Vuttañhetaṃ –
analyzed: vindate dhanam ayam ca atthaḥ cūḷaka seṭṭhi jātakena dīpetabbaḥ vuttam ha etam
translated: obtain wealth. And this meaning should be illustrated by the Cūḷakaseṭṭhi Jātaka. For this is said:

original: “Appakenapi medhāvī, pābhatena vicakkhaṇo;
analyzed: appakena api medhāvī pābhatena vicakkhaṇaḥ
translated: “Even with a little, the wise man, the man of vision,

original: Samuṭṭhāpeti attānaṃ, aṇuṃ aggiṃva sandhama”nti. ;
analyzed: samuṭṭhāpeti attānam aṇum aggim iva sandhamanti
translated: Sets himself going, like a fire, though it be with a little fuel.”

original: Vattaṃ katvāti adhiṭṭhānavattaṃ katvā. “Saccavādī bhūtavādī”ti kittiṃ pappotīti yojanā.
analyzed: vattam katvā iti adhiṭṭhāna vattam katvā sacca vādī bhūta vādī iti kittim pappoti iti yojanā
translated: “Having done his duty”: having done the duty of resolution. The construction is: he gains the reputation of being a truth-speaker, a fact-speaker.

original: Icchitapatthitanti yehi mittaṃ icchati, tehi itaraṃ patthitaṃ. Mittāni ganthatīti🔽mittabhāvaṃ ghaṭeti. Dānassa piyabhāvakaraṇato “dadaṃ piyo hotī”ti vuttaṃ. Yaṃ dānaṃ
analyzed: icchita patthitanti yehi mittam icchati tehi itaram patthitam mittāni ganthati iti  mitta bhāvam ghaṭeti dānassa piya bhāva karaṇataḥ dadam piyaḥ hoti iti vuttam yam dānam
translated: He desires and seeks friends: he desires those with whom he can make friends, and he seeks the other party. He makes friends:🔽he establishes friendship. He becomes dear by giving: it is said that he becomes dear by making gifts, because giving makes him dear.

original: ekantato mittabhāvāvahaṃ, taṃ dassento “duddadaṃ vā dadaṃ taṃ ganthatī”ti āha. Dadanti
analyzed: ekantataḥ mitta bhāva āvaham tam dassentaḥ duddadam vā dadam tam ganthati iti āha dadanti
translated: The gift that is entirely conducive to making friends is shown by the words “He makes friends by giving what is hard to give.”

original: ca lakkhaṇavacanametanti āha “dānamukhena vā”tiādi.
analyzed: ca lakkhaṇa vacanam etat ti āha dāna mukhena vā ati ādi
translated: And the expression “he gives” is a mere figure of speech.

original: Āḷavakassa ajjhāsayānurūpaṃ gahaṭṭhavasena vissajjento. Saddhā etassa atthīti saddho,
analyzed: āḷavakassa ajjhāsayā anurūpam gaha ṭṭha vasena vissajjento saddhā etassa atthi iti saddho
translated: In accordance with the householder’s inclination, he replies in terms of the householder’s life. He has faith: he has confidence.

original: tassa saddhassa. Gharamesinoti gharāvāsasaṅkhātaṃ gharaṃ esantassa. Gharāvāsasannissitattā
analyzed: tassa saddhassa gharam esinoti ghara āvāsa saṅkhātam gharam esantassa ghara āvāsa sannissita ttā
translated: In him who has faith: in him who has confidence. Who seeks a home: who seeks a home consisting of a household.🔽Because it is dependent on the household life,

original: “ghara”nti kāmaguṇā vuccantīti āha “pañca kāmaguṇe”ti. “Ete caturo dhammā”tiādinā
analyzed: kāmaguṇāḥ vuccanti iti āha pañca kāmaguṇa iti ete caturaḥ dhamma ati ādinā
translated: the five strands of sense pleasure are called “home.” “These four things” are the things stated in the next verse.

original: gahitā anantaragāthāya vuttadhammā evāti dassento “vuttappakāraṃ sacca”ntiādimāha.
analyzed: gahitāḥ anantara gāthāya vutta dhammāḥ evā ti dassentaḥ vutta ppakāram sacca nti ādim āha
translated: He shows this by the words “truth of the kind stated.”

original: Tattha “ime kusalā, ime akusalā”tiādinā te atthe yāthāvato dhāraṇato upadhāraṇato
analyzed: tattha ime kusalāḥ ime akusala ati ādinā te atthe yāthāvataḥ dhāraṇataḥ upadhāraṇataḥ
translated: Herein, the “idea” is the holding, the bearing in mind, of the meanings of the words “these are profitable” and “these are unprofitable” and so on, as they are in fact, by bearing them in mind as borne in mind,

original: dhammo. Saññā cittacetasikānaṃ dhāraṇaṃ, avicchedato sandhāraṇato kusalasantānaṃ
analyzed: dhammo saññā citta cetasikānam dhāraṇam a vicchedataḥ sandhāraṇataḥ kusala santānam
translated: The “steadiness” is the steadying, the non-breaking of the continuity of the cognizance and cognizance-concomitant ideas, by steadying the continuity of the profitable ideas.

original: dhāretīti dhiti, vīriyaṃ. Cajati etenāti cāgo, dānaṃ. Paccayavekallato phaluppādanasamatthatāvasena santi.
analyzed: dhāreti iti vīriyam cajati etena ati cāgaḥ dānam paccaya vekallato phala uppādana samattha tā vasena santi
translated: “Giving” is giving up, giving away, by means of which there is the possibility of producing the fruit.

original: Aññepīti ito yathāvuttadhammasamudāyato aññepi dhammā yadi santi, te dhamme pucchassūti.
analyzed: aññe api iti itas yathā vutta dhamma samudāyataḥ aññe api dhammā yadi santi te dhamme pucchassu iti
translated: “Any other ideas” : if there are any other ideas apart from the profitable ideas stated thus, then ask about those ideas.

original: Kilese, kāyavācādike vā dametīti damo, paññā. Uṭṭhahati ussahati etenāti uṭṭhānaṃ,
analyzed: kilese kāya vācā ādike vā dameti iti damaḥ paññā uṭṭhahati ussahati etena ati uṭṭhānam
translated: “Restraint” is the restraining of defilements or of bodily action, etc.; it is understanding.🔽“Exertion” is the exertion, the effort, by means of which one gets out,🔽Herein, “here” is in this question.

original: vīriyaṃ. Etthāti etissā pucchāya. Saddhinti saṅkhepato bhāvatthapadānaṃ bandhanena🔽saha. Ekamekaṃ padanti paññādikamekekaṃ padaṃ. “Paññā imasmiṃ ṭhāne paññāti dhammoti
analyzed: vīriyam ettha ati etissā pucchāya saddhin ti saṅkhepataḥ bhāva attha padānam bandhanena  saha ekam ekam padam ti paññā ādikam ekekam padam paññā imasmin ṭhāne paññā ati dhammo ti
translated: “Together” is together with the linking of the words in the phrasing of the question.🔽“Each word” is each word beginning with “understanding.” The “extraction of the meaning” is the extraction of the meaning of “understanding” and so on, as follows: “Understanding is the idea here called ‘understanding’ and so on” .

original: ca āgatā”tiādinā paññādiatthassa uddharaṇaṃ atthuddhāro. Tassa tassa atthassa “paññā
analyzed: ca āgata ati ādinā paññā ādi atthassa uddharaṇam atthuddhāraḥ tassa tassa atthassa paññā
translated: The “extraction of the expression” is the extraction of the expression of the meaning of “understanding” and so on, as follows: “Understanding is the idea here called ‘understanding’ and so on” .

original: pajānanā”tiādinā vevacanapadānaṃ uddharaṇaṃ paduddhāro. Pajānātīti paññā, dhāretīti
analyzed: uddharaṇam uddharaṇam
translated: The bringing up of synonyms such as “understanding” , etc., is the bringing up of terms. “He understands” is understanding . “He bears in mind” is mindfulness .

original: dhammo, dametīti damoti evaṃ padassa kathanaṃ padavaṇṇanā.🔽Ajjāti vā etarahi. Yathāvuttena pakārenāti “saddahāno arahata”ntiādinā vuttappakārena.
analyzed: dhammaḥ dama iti iti damaḥ ti evam padassa kathanam pada vaṇṇanā  ajja iti vā etarahi yathā vuttena pakārena ati saddahānaḥ arahata ntiādinā vutta ppakārena
translated: The bringing up of synonyms such as “understanding” is the “bringing up of terms.” “He understands” is “understanding” . “He bears” is “Dhamma” . “He controls” is “control” . The explanation of the term in this way is the “explanation of terms.”🔽“Here” means either “now” or “in the present.” “In the way stated” means in the way stated in the passage beginning, “One who has faith in the arahats” .🔽Or else, the “way stated” is the penetration of the four noble truths. The “way stated” is the knowledge of the meaning of this world and the next world by one who has seen the truths in the way stated.

original: Saccasampaṭivedhāvagahaṇaṃ vā yathāvuttena pakārena diṭṭhasaccatāya idhalokaparalokatthaṃ🔽yāthāvato jānanto. Evañca yakkho satthu desanānubhāvasiddhaṃ pañhaṃ pucchanena attano
analyzed: sacca sampaṭivedha avagahaṇam vā yathā vuttena pakārena diṭṭha sacca tāya idhaloka paraloka ttham  yāthāvataḥ jānantaḥ evañca yakkhaḥ satthu desanā anubhāva siddham pañham pucchanena attano
translated: Thus the ogre, by asking a question that is established by the power of the Teacher’s teaching, shows his own attainment

original: paṭilābhasampattiṃ vibhāvento “kathaṃsu labhate pañña”ntiādimāhāti ācariyā. Samparāyikoti
analyzed: paṭilābha sampattim vibhāvento kathaṃsu labhate ācariyā samparāyikā ti
translated: by saying, “How does one gain understanding?” The teachers explain it in this way.🔽As to “pertaining to the future,” the word “ca” is used in the sense of “also.” Therefore, the meaning of this passage is stated as follows:

original: ettha ca-saddo luttaniddiṭṭho, tena “diṭṭhadhammiko cā”ti ayamattho vutto evāti dassento🔽“yo attho…pe… dassetī”ti āha. Arīyati phalaṃ etasmāti attho, kāraṇaṃ. Vicakkhaṇe sapayojanatāya.
analyzed: ettha ca saddaḥ lutta niddiṭṭhaḥ tena diṭṭhadhammiko ca ati ayam atthaḥ vuttaḥ evā ti dassento 🔽yaḥ dasseti iti āha arīyati phalam etasmā ati attho kāraṇam vicakkhaṇe sa payojana tāya
translated: “The meaning of the word ‘also’ is shown by the word ‘also’ in the passage ‘pertaining to the future and also to the present life.’“🔽The meaning of the word “also” is shown by the word “also” in the passage “pertaining to the future and also to the present life.” The meaning of the word “also” is shown by the word “also” in the passage “pertaining to the future and also to the present life.” The meaning of the word “also” is shown by the word “also” in the passage “pertaining to the future and also to the present life.” The meaning of the word “also” is shown by the word “also” in the passage “pertaining to the future and also to the present life.” The meaning of the word “also” is shown by the word “also” in the passage “pertaining to the future and also to the present life.” The meaning of the word “also” is shown by the word “also” in the passage “pertaining to the future and also to the present life.” The meaning of the word “also” is shown by the word “also” in the passage “pertaining to the future and also to the present life.” The meaning of the word “also” is shown by the word “also” in the passage “

original: Tassa ñāṇassāti tassa atthassa āvibhāvanassa ñāṇassa. Guṇavisesehi ca sadisassapi aññassa abhāvato aggadakkhiṇeyyo buddho bhagavā. Tenāha –
analyzed: tassa ñāṇassa ati tassa atthassa āvibhāvanassa ñāṇassa guṇa visesehi ca sadisassa api aññassa abhāvataḥ aggadakkhiṇeyyaḥ buddhaḥ bhagavā tena āha
translated: ‘Of that knowledge’: of that knowledge which is the illumination of that meaning. And because there is no one else who is equal to the Exalted One in the special qualities, he is the foremost person to be worshipped. Therefore it is said:

original: “Nayimasmiṃ loke parasmiṃ vā pana,
analyzed: nayimasmin loke parasmin vā pana
translated: ‘In this world or in the world beyond,

original: Buddhena seṭṭhova samova vijjati;
analyzed: buddhena seṭṭhaḥ uva samaḥ uva vijjati
translated: There is none equal to the Buddha, much less is there a superior one.

original: Āhuneyyānaṃ paramāhutiṃ gato,
analyzed: āhuneyyānam paramāhutim gataḥ
translated: He is the foremost recipient of offerings,

original: Puññatthikānaṃ vipulaphalesina”nti. ;
analyzed: puññatthikānam vipula phala esinam ti
translated: For those who seek merit and the fruit of great abundance.’

original: Sahitapaṭipattinti paññāsaṅgāhikaṃ attano paṭipattiṃ. Sundarā bodhi subodhi, buddhassa
analyzed: sahita paṭipattim ti paññā saṅgāhikam attanaḥ paṭipattim sundarā bodhi su bodhi buddhassa
translated: ‘Accompanied by his practice’: by his practice which is accompanied by wisdom. Sundarā bodhi subodhi,

original: subodhi buddhasubodhi, sā eva buddhasubodhitā. Dhammassavanatthaṃ sannipatitadevatāhi
analyzed: su bodhi buddha su bodhi sā eva buddha su bodhitā dhamma ssavana attham sannipatita devatāhi
translated: buddhassa subodhi buddhasubodhi, that itself is buddhasubodhitā. By the devatās who had assembled in order to hear the Dhamma,

original: saṅghuṭṭhasādhukārasadduṭṭhānañca.
analyzed: saṅghuṭṭha sādhukāra sadduṭṭhānañca
translated: and by the sound of the exclamation of ‘Sādhu!’ which was uttered by them.

original: Satapuññalakkhaṇanti satasahassakappe puññasambhārassa katattā tesaṃ puññānaṃ vasena
analyzed: sata puñña lakkhaṇanti sata sahassa kappe puñña sambhārassa kata ttā tesam puññānam vasena
translated: ‘The characteristic of a hundred merits’: because the requisites of merit were made for a hundred thousand aeons, by means of those merits,

original: satapuññalakkhaṇaṃ anekapuññanibbattalakkhaṇaṃ. Abhinandiyatāya sabbehi aṅgehi samupetaṃ
analyzed: sata puñña lakkhaṇam aneka puñña nibbatta lakkhaṇam abhinandiyatāya sabbehi aṅgehi samupetam
translated: the characteristic of a hundred merits, the characteristic of the production of many merits, endowed with all the limbs,🔽is to be rejoiced in.

original: samannāgataṃ. Katapuññabhāvaṃ byañjentīti byañjanāni, aṅgapaccaṅgāni. Tesaṃ paripuṇṇattā
analyzed: samannāgatam kata puñña bhāvam byañjenti iti byañjanāni aṅga paccaṅgāni tesam paripuṇṇa ttā
translated: is endowed with. The marks are the limbs and the secondary limbs. Because of their completeness

original: paripuṇṇabyañjanaṃ. Taṃ yakkho…pe… pūresīti gāthāpūraṇatthameva hi bhagavā tathārūpāni
analyzed: paripuṇṇa byañjanam tam yakkha upe pūresi iti gāthā pūraṇa attham eva hi bhagavā tathārūpāni
translated: he is complete in his marks. The Blessed One did this just to fill out the verse.

original: akāsi. Abyādhitāti arogā. “Abyathitā”ti keci paṭhanti, sayasantāsarahitāti attho.
analyzed: a kāsi a byādhitā ati arogā a byathitā ati keci paṭhanti saya santāsa rahitā ati attho
translated: He is healthy: he is free from disease. Some read “abyaṭṭhita” (unconfused), the meaning being: free from the fever of lust, etc.

original: “Hatthayo”ti vattabbe “hatthako”ti vuttaṃ. Āḷavinagaranti āḷavinagaravāsino vadati.
analyzed: hatthayaḥ ti vattabbe hatthakaḥ iti vuttam āḷavi nagaran ti āḷavi nagara vāsinaḥ vadati
translated: Although he should have said “elephants,” he said “an elephant.” The people of Āḷavī: the people who live in Āḷavī.

original: Bhavati hi tatraṭṭhatāya taṃ-saddo yathā “gāmo āgato, mañcā ukkuṭṭhiṃ karontī”ti.
analyzed: bhavati hi tatraṭṭhatāya taṃsaddaḥ yathā gāmaḥ āgataḥ mañcāḥ ukkuṭṭhim karonti iti
translated: For the word “that” is used in the sense of “in that place,” just as in the expressions “the village has come” and “the beds are making a noise.”

original: Ekakolāhalena vattamānena.
analyzed: eka kolāhalena vattamānena
translated: while a single uproar was going on.

original: Sampiṇḍitvāti sannipatitvā. Kāmaṃ sambhāro tena katoti natthi, yuddhatthaṃ pana bahuso
analyzed: sampiṇḍitvā iti sannipatitvā kāmam sambhāro tena kato ti natthi yuddha attham pana bahuso
translated: Having assembled: having gathered together. Although he did not make the preparations, he made a great effort

original: ussāhassa katattā “yuddhamādiṃ katvā”ti vuttaṃ. Tameva āḷavakasuttaṃ kathesi tassā
analyzed: ussāhassa kata ttā yuddham ādim katvā iti vuttam tam eva āḷavaka suttam kathesi tassā
translated: for the sake of the battle, and therefore it is said, “having begun the battle.” He related the Āḷavaka Sutta

original: eva desanāya sannipatitaparisāya sappāyattā. Tenāha “kathāpari…pe… ahosī”ti. Catūhi
analyzed: eva desanāya sannipatita parisāya tena āha catūhi
translated: because the assembly that had gathered for the teaching was suitable. Therefore he said, “The discussion … took place.”

original: vatthūhīti catūhi saṅgahavatthūhi. Parisanti attano parisaṃ. “Itarañcā”tipi vadanti.
analyzed: vatthūhi iti catūhi saṅgaha vatthūhi vadanti
translated: With the four bases of gathering: with the four bases of gathering people. They gathered their own assembly. “And the other” is also said.

original: Āḷavakasuttavaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: āḷavaka sutta vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: The Commentary on the Āḷavaka Sutta is finished.

original: Sāratthappakāsiniyā saṃyuttanikāya-aṭṭhakathāya
analyzed: sārattha ppakāsiniyā saṃyutta nikāya aṭṭhakathāya
translated: The explanation of the meaning of the Sāratthappakāsinī Commentary on the Saṃyutta Nikāya

original: Yakkhasaṃyuttavaṇṇanāya līnatthappakāsanā samattā.
translated: The explanation of the meaning of the Yakkha Saṃyutta is finished.

original: 11. Sakkasaṃyuttaṃ
analyzed: sakka saṃyuttam
translated: The Sakka Saṃyutta

original: 1. Paṭhamavaggo
analyzed: paṭhama vaggo
translated: The First Chapter

original: 1. Suvīrasuttavaṇṇanā
analyzed: suvīra sutta vaṇṇanā
translated: The Commentary on the Suvīra Sutta

original: 247. Abhiyaṃsūti yuddhasajjābhimukhā hutvā gacchiṃsu. Tatrāti tasmiṃ asurānaṃ abhiyāne
analyzed: abhiyaṃsu iti yuddha sajja abhimukhāḥ hutvā gacchiṃsu tatra ati tasmin abhiyāne
translated: They went forth, facing the battle, ready for war. There, in that Asura army🔽this is the story being told in order. Having taken thirty-three men,

original: ayaṃ dāni vuccamānā anupubbato kathā. Tettiṃsa purise gahetvāti tettiṃsa purise puññakiriyāya
analyzed: ayam dāni vuccamānā anupubbataḥ kathā tettiṃsa purise gahetvā ati tettiṃsa purise puñña kiriyāya
translated: having taken thirty-three men as companions for the performance of merit,

original: sahāyabhūte gahetvā. “Yāvajīvaṃ mātāpitubharo assa”ntiādinā samādinnāni satta vatapadāni
analyzed: sahāya bhūte gahetvā yāvajīvam samādinnāni satta
translated: having fulfilled the seven vows beginning with “For as long as he lives, let him be a burden to his mother and father,”

original: pūretvā. Adhigaṇhantaṃ abhibhavantaṃ. Puttahatāyāti hataputtāya. Sā surā na hoti,
analyzed: pūretvā adhigaṇhantam abhibhavantam putta hatāya ati hata puttāya sā surā na hoti
translated: overpowering him who had attained. Puttahatāya, to one whose child was dead. She was not a drunkard,

original: na suraṃ pivimhāti adhippāyo. Tato paṭṭhāyāti “na surā”ti vuttakālato paṭṭhāya. “Na
analyzed: na suram pivimha ati adhippāyaḥ tatas paṭṭhāya āti na surā ati vutta kālataḥ paṭṭhāya na
translated: From then on: from the time when it was said, “No liquor.”🔽Some say: “They are not gods , thus they are asuras .”

original: suranti na dibbantīti asurā”ti keci. Heṭṭhimatale antobhūmiyaṃ āyāmato dasayojanasahassaṃ.
analyzed: suranti na dibbanti iti asurā ti keci heṭṭhima tale antobhūmiyam āyāmataḥ dasa yojana sahassam
translated: In the lower world, in the inner earth, it is ten thousand leagues in breadth.🔽The places where the nāgas, etc., live are the nāgas, etc. Thus he said, “In the five places, the nāgas, etc.”

original: Uragādisahacaritāni ṭhānāni uragādīnīti āha “uragādīsu pañcasu ṭhānesū”ti. Paṭhamālindeti🔽paṭhame paribhaṇḍe. Pañcayojanasahassavitthāraputhubahalāhi sinerussa catūsupi passesu🔽cattāro paribhaṇḍā. Sinerussa hi tasmiṃ tasmiṃ passe yugandharādīsu pañcasataparittadīpaparivāre
analyzed: uraga ādi sahacaritāni ṭhānāni uraga ādīni iti āha uraga ādīsu pañcasu ṭhānesu iti paṭhama alinda iti  paṭhame paribhaṇḍe pañca yojana sahassa vitthāra puthu bahalāhi sinerussa catūsu pi passesu  cattāro sinerussa hi tasmin tasmin passe yugandhara ādīsu pañca sata paritta dīpa parivāre
translated: In the first girdle:🔽in the first outer range. Sineru has four outer ranges, each five thousand leagues in breadth and height, in the four directions.

original: mahādīpe ca labhitabbassa mahato atthassa vasena mahatthā. Kupitāvilacittāti kupitena
analyzed: mahā dīpe ca labhitabbassa mahataḥ atthassa vasena mahatthā kupita āvila cittā ati kupitena
translated: For the sake of the great benefit to be obtained in the great island, surrounded by five hundred lesser islands, in the Yugandhara, etc., in the respective directions of Sineru, it is of great benefit.🔽With agitated minds through anger: with minds agitated through the anger of anger.🔽Seeking battle: seeking to fight.

original: kopena ākulacittā. Yuddhesīti yuddhesino. Sesesūti sesesu paribhaṇḍesu. Sesāti supaṇṇādayo.
analyzed: kopena ākula cittāḥ yuddhesī iti yuddhesino sesesu uti sesesu paribhaṇḍesu sesā ati supaṇṇa ādayaḥ
translated: In the rest: in the remaining outer ranges. The rest are the Supaṇṇas, etc.

original: Vammikamakkhikāti sapakkhikaupacikā. Osakkitvāti piṭṭhibhāgena nivattitvā.
analyzed: vammika makkhikā ati sa pakkhika aupacikā osakkitvā iti piṭṭhi bhāgena nivattitvā
translated: Vammikamakkhikā = sapakkhikaupacikā. Osakkitvā = having turned back by the hind part.

original: Pamādaṃ āpādesīti sakkassa āṇāya pamādaṃ āpajji. Saṭṭhiyojanaṃ vitthārena. Suvaṇṇamahāvīthinti suvaṇṇamayabhūmijagativīthiṃ.🔽Anuṭṭhahantoti uṭṭhānaṃ kāyikavīriyaṃ akaronto. Avāyamantoti vāyāmaṃ cetasikavīriyaṃ🔽akaronto. Kiñci kiccanti kasivāṇijjādibhedaṃ aññataraṃ kiccaṃ kattabbakammaṃ. Varanti
analyzed: pamādam āpādesi iti sakkassa āṇāya pamādam āpajji saṭṭhi yojanam vitthārena suvaṇṇa mahā vīthim ti suvaṇṇa maya bhūmi jagati vīthim  anuṭṭhahanto ti uṭṭhānam kāyika vīriyam a karontaḥ avāyamanto ti vāyāmam cetasika vīriyam  akarontaḥ kiñci kiccanti kasi vāṇijja ādi bhedam aññataram kiccam kattabba kammam varanti
translated: Pamādaṃ āpādesī = he fell into negligence by Sakka’s order. Saṭṭhiyojanaṃ vitthārena = sixty leagues in breadth. Suvaṇṇamahāvīthi = a golden ground-path.

original: pavaraṃ. Tenāha “uttama”nti. Tañca kho kasitabbaṭṭhānaṃ adhippetanti āha “okāsa”nti.🔽Kammaṃ akatvāti kiñcipi jīvitahetubhūtaṃ kammaṃ akatvā. Jīvitaṭṭhānaṃ nāmāti tassa
analyzed: pavaram tena āha uttaman ti tat ca kho kasitabba ṭṭhānam adhippetanti āha okāsan ti  kammam a katvā ti kiñcipi jīvita hetu bhūtam kammam a katvā jīvita ṭṭhānam nāma ati tassa
translated: Anuṭṭhahanto = not doing the bodily effort. Avāyamanto = not doing the mental effort. Kiñci kiccanti = any one of the various kinds of work such as agriculture, trade, etc. Varanti = excellent. Therefore it is said: “uttama” . And that field to be cultivated is intended. Therefore it is said: “okāsa” .

original: jīvitassa hetu nāma. Nibbānassa maggoti nibbānassa adhigamupāyabhūto maggo.
analyzed: jīvitassa hetu nāma nibbānassa maggo ti nibbānassa adhigama upāya bhūtaḥ maggo
translated: Kammaṃ akatvā = without doing any work which is the cause of life. Jīvitaṭṭhānaṃ nāma = the cause of that life is called. Nibbānassa maggoti = the path which is the means of attaining Nibbāna.

original: Suvīrasuttavaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: suvīra sutta vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: The commentary on the Susīma Sutta is finished.

original: 2. Susīmasuttavaṇṇanā
analyzed: susīma sutta vaṇṇanā
translated: . The commentary on the Susīma Sutta

original: 248. Antareti abbhantare. Evaṃnāmakanti “susīmo”ti evaṃnāmakaṃ. Ekaṃ puttameva aññataraṃ attano puttameva.
analyzed: antare ti abbhantare evaṃnāmakam ti susīmo ti evaṃnāmakam ekam puttam eva aññataram attano puttam eva
translated: In the middle : in the middle of the sky. So-and-so : one called “ Susīma ” . One son : one of his own sons.

original: Susīmasuttavaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: susīma sutta vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: The commentary on the Susīma Sutta is ended.

original: 3. Dhajaggasuttavaṇṇanā🔽249. Samupabyūḷhoti ubhinnaṃ saha eva samāgamo, bhusaṃ vā byūḷhoti attho. Bhusā panassa
analyzed: dhajagga sutta vaṇṇanā  samupabyūḍhaḥ iti ubhinnam saha eva samāgamaḥ bhusam vā byūḍhaḥ ti atthaḥ bhusā panassa
translated: The Dhammacakkappavattana Sutta

original: byūḷhatā dvinnaṃ senānaṃ samāgantvā sampiṇḍitabhāvenāti āha “sampiṇḍito rāsibhūto”ti.
analyzed: byūḍhatā dvinnam senānam samāgantvā sampiṇḍita bhāvena ati āha sampiṇḍitaḥ
translated: Samupabyūḷho : the meeting together of both armies at the same time is samupabyūḷho ; the meaning is, “ well-arrayed ” . But the well-arrayedness of the two armies is the fact of their having come together and combined.

original: Pacchimantoti rathapañjarassa paranto pacchimanto pacchimakoṭṭhāso. Rathasandhitoti
analyzed: pacchimantaḥ ti ratha pañjarassa parantaḥ pacchimantaḥ pacchima koṭṭhāsaḥ ratha sandhito ti
translated: The western end : the western end of the chariot-fence is the western end, the western extremity.🔽From the chariot-fence : from the place of connection with the chariot-fence’s cross-bar.

original: rathapañjarassa kubbarena saddhiṃ sambandhanaṭṭhānato. Tadeva pamāṇanti tadeva “diyaḍḍhayojanasatāyāmo”ti
analyzed: ratha pañjarassa kubbarena saddhim sambandhana ṭṭhānataḥ tat eva tat eva
translated: That same measure : that same measure stated as “ a width of two and a half leagues ” .

original: vuttappamāṇameva. Diguṇaṃ katvāti “pacchimanto satayojano”tiādinā diguṇaṃ katvā.
analyzed: vutta ppamāṇam eva diguṇam katvā iti pacchimantaḥ sata yojana uti ādinā diguṇam katvā
translated: Having made it double in breadth : having made it double in breadth by the statement “ the western end is seven leagues ” .🔽Of the rest of the adornment, which is of the kind consisting of the moon’s disk, the sun’s disk, and the network of bells, etc.,

original: Candamaṇḍalasūriyamaṇḍalakiṅkiṇikajālādibhedassa sesālaṅkārassa. Passantānaṃ devānaṃ.
analyzed: canda maṇḍala sūriya maṇḍala kiṅkiṇika jāla ādi bhedassa sesa alaṅkārassa passantānam devānam
translated: of the gods who were looking on.

original: Rājā noti amhākaṃ rājā devaseṭṭho. Dutiyaṃ āsanaṃ labhatīti sakke nisinne tassa anantaraṃ🔽dutiyaṃ āsanaṃ labhati. Tasmā devaseṭṭhatāya sakko viya gāravaṭṭhāniyo, yato sakko🔽“tassa dhajaggaṃ ullokeyyāthā”ti āha. Esa nayo sesesupi. Asurehi parājitoti asurehi🔽parājayaṃ āpādito. Rajadhajaṃ disvāti parasenāya upagacchantiyā uṭṭhitarajamattampi
analyzed: rājā no ti amhākam rājā devaseṭṭhaḥ dutiyam āsanam labhati iti sakke nisinne tassa anantaram  dutiyam āsanam labhati tasmā deva seṭṭha tāya sakkaḥ viya gārava ṭṭhāniyaḥ yatas sakkaḥ  tassa dhajaggam āha esa nayo sesesu pi asurehi parājitaḥ iti asurehi  parājayam āpāditaḥ rajadhajam disvā ati para senāyaḥ upagacchantiyāḥ uṭṭhita raja mattam pi
translated: ‘King’ means our king, the best of gods. ‘He gets the second seat’ means that when Sakka is seated, he gets the second seat next to him. Therefore, he is worthy of respect like Sakka because he is the best of gods. Therefore, Sakka said, “Look at his flag-top.” The same method applies to the rest. ‘Defeated by the asuras’ means he was defeated by the asuras. ‘Seeing the royal flag’ means that even if the royal flag is raised when the enemy army approaches,

original: disvā ṭhitopi taṃ rajadhajaṃ disvā bhīrubhāvena palāyanadhammo.
analyzed: disvā ṭhitaḥ api tam raja dhajam disvā bhīru bhāvena palāyana dhammaḥ
translated: ‘King’ means our king, the best of gods. ‘He gets the second seat’: when Sakka is seated, he gets the second seat next to him. Therefore, as he is the best of gods, he is worthy of respect like Sakka. Therefore Sakka said, ‘Look at his banner-top.’ The same method applies to the rest. ‘Defeated by the asuras’: overcome by the asuras. ‘Seeing the royal banner’: even if he just sees the royal banner raised by the enemy army as it approaches, he is subject to running away in fear.

original: Yassa dhajaggaparittassa. Ānubhāvo vattati asammukhībhūtāhipi devatāhi sirasā sampaṭicchitabbato.
analyzed: yassa dhajagga parittassa ānubhāvaḥ vattati a sammukhībhūtāhi api devatāhi sirasā
translated: ‘The one whose protection’: the one whose protection, which is effective even for invisible deities because they accept it on their heads,

original: Corabhayādīhīti ādi-saddena rogabhayādīnañceva vaṭṭadukkhassa ca saṅgaho daṭṭhabbo
analyzed: cora bhaya ādīhi iti ādi saddena roga bhaya ādīnam ca iva vaṭṭa dukkhassa ca saṅgaho daṭṭhabbo
translated: ‘From the fear of thieves, etc.’: the word ‘etc.’ should be seen as including the fear of sickness, etc., and the suffering of the round of rebirths.

original: vidhinā bhāvite parittassa atthe upacārajjhānādīnampi ijjhanato.
analyzed: vidhinā bhāvite parittassa atthe upacāra jjhāna ādīnam pi
translated: ‘By the method’: because even access concentration, etc., succeeds when the protection is developed by the method.

original: Dīghavāpīnāmake gāme cetiyaṃ dīghavāpicetiyaṃ. Muddhavedikā nāma hammiyaṃ parikkhipitvā
analyzed: dīghavāpī nāmake gāme cetiyam dīghavāpi cetiyam muddhavedikā nāma hammiyam parikkhipitvā
translated: The shrine in the village of Dīghavāpi is the Dīghavāpi shrine. The mud-rampart is a rampart of mud.

original: katavedikā. Buddhagataṃ satiṃ upaṭṭhapetvā parittarakkhaguttiṃ āha. Parittassa ānubhāvena
analyzed: katavedikā buddha gatam satim upaṭṭhapetvā paritta rakkha guttim āha parittassa ānubhāvena
translated: The shrine in the village of Dīghāvu is the Dīghāvu shrine. A platform with a parapet is a platform surrounded by a railing. He established mindfulness of the Buddha and spoke the protective paritta. By the power of the paritta

original: dve iṭṭhakā…pe… aṭṭhaṃsu. Tathā hi tasmiṃ nisseṇiyaṃ ṭhite…pe… aṭṭhaṃsūti.
analyzed: dve iṭṭhakāpe aṭṭhaṃsu tathā hi tasmin nisseṇiyam ṭhita īpe aṭṭhaṃsu iti
translated: two bricks … eight. For when it was placed on the balance … eight.

original: Dhajaggasuttavaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: dhajagga sutta vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: The commentary on the Dhajagga Sutta is finished.

original: 4. Vepacittisuttavaṇṇanā
analyzed: vepacitti sutta vaṇṇanā
translated: The Veḷudvāra Sutta

original: 250. “Mahānubhāvatāya asurānaṃ cittavepanena vepacittī”ti vadanti. Isīhi pana abhayaṃ
analyzed: mahā anubhāva tāya citta vepanena vepacittī iti vadanti isīhi pana abhayam
translated: They say that he is called Vepacitti because he “makes the minds of the asuras tremble” through his great power. But when the seers asked him for

original: yācite “bhayameva dadāmī”ti vatvā tehi “akkhayaṃ hotu te bhaya”nti abhisapavasena
analyzed: yācite bhayam eva dadāmi iti vatvā tehi akkhayam hotu te bhayanti abhisapavasena
translated: protection, he said, “I will give you fear,” and they cursed him, “May your fear be inexhaustible.”

original: vuttakālato paṭṭhāya vepanacittatāya “vepacittī”ti vuccati, yaṃ lokiyā “pulomo”ti
analyzed: vutta kālataḥ paṭṭhāya vepana citta tāya vepacittī iti vuccati yam lokiyā pulomā ti
translated: From that time on he is said to be called Vepacitti because his mind trembles. The worldly people call him “Puloma.”

original: ca vadanti. Nipātapadānipi kānici atthavisesajotakāni hontīti āha “nipātamatta”nti
analyzed: ca vadanti nipāta padāni pi kānici attha visesa jotakāni honti iti āha nipāta mattam ti
translated: Some words in the Nipātas also indicate a particular meaning. Therefore he says “only in the Nipātas.”

original: hetuatthādīnamettha asambhavato. Tanti sakkaṃ devānamindaṃ. Kaṇṭhe pañcamehīti kaṇṭhabandhanapañcamehi,
analyzed: hetu attha ādīnam ettha sakkam devānam indam kaṇṭhe pañcamehi iti kaṇṭha bandhana pañcamehi
translated: because the meanings of ‘cause’ and so on are not applicable here. Tanti: Sakka, the lord of the devas. Kaṇṭhe pañcamehīti kaṇṭhabandhanapañcamehi,

original: vibhattialopena niddeso. Cittenevāti “imaṃ bandhāmi, ayaṃ bajjhatū”ti uppannacitteneva.
analyzed: vibhatti a lopena niddesaḥ cittena iva ati imam bandhāmi ayam bajjhatu uti uppanna cittena iva
translated: the demonstrative pronoun being elided by the case ending. Cittenevāti “imaṃ bandhāmi, ayaṃ bajjhatū”ti uppannacitteneva.

original: Bajjhati baddho hoti, ayaṃ devānubhāvo. Muccatīti etthāpi eseva nayo. Dasahīti “corosī”tiādinā
analyzed: bajjhati baddhaḥ hoti ayam deva anubhāvaḥ muccati iti ettha api esa iva nayaḥ dasahi iti corosi itiādinā
translated: Bajjhati baddho hoti, ayaṃ devānubhāvo. Muccatīti etthāpi eseva nayo. Dasahīti “corosī”tiādinā

original: idha vuttehi dasahi. Tenāha “imehī”ti. Nibbattitvā cirakālataṃ upādāya khuṃsanavasena
analyzed: idha vuttehi dasahi tena āha imehi iti nibbattitvā cira kāla tam upādāya khuṃsana vasena
translated: idha vuttehi dasahi. Tenāha “imehī”ti. Nibbattitvā cirakālataṃ upādāya khuṃsanavasena

original: vadati “jarasakkā”ti. Na taṃ akkosaṃ manasi karoti dīgharattaṃ khantisoraccesu niruḷhaajjhāsayattā.
analyzed: vadati na tam akkosam manasi karoti dīgharattam khanti soraccesu niruḍha ajjhāsaya ttā
translated: vadati “jarasakkā”ti. Na taṃ akkosaṃ manasi karoti dīgharattaṃ khantisoraccesu niruḷhaajjhāsayattā.

original: Mahāpaṭiggahaṇanti mahantaṃ upasamabyañjanaṃ. Assāti vepacittassa.
analyzed: mahā paṭiggahaṇam ti mahantam upasama byañjanam assa ati vepa cittassa
translated: Mahāpaṭiggahaṇanti mahantaṃ upasamabyañjanaṃ. Assāti vepacittassa.

original: Paṭisaṃyujeti paṭisattu hutvā saṃyuddhaṃ kareyya. Tenāha “paṭipphareyyā”ti. Upasamaṃ…pe…

translated: Paṭisaṃyujeti paṭisattu hutvā saṃyuddhaṃ kareyya. Tenāha “paṭipphareyyā”ti. Upasamaṃ…pe…

analyzed: maññe upasamena iva paccatthikassa nāyaka bhūtassa kodhassa paṭisedhanato tādise hi
translated: as if it were the pacification of the enemy, anger, which is the leader. For when🔽anger does not get the opportunity to retaliate, it subsides like a fire without

original: kodho paṭikiriyaṃ alabhanto anupādāno viya jātavedo vūpasammati. Yadā-saddo hetuattho,
analyzed: kodho paṭikiriyam a labhantaḥ anupādānaḥ viya jātavedaḥ
translated: fuel. The word yada is a causal particle.

original: na kālatthoti āha “yasmā taṃ maññatī”ti. Tāvadeva dve gāvo yujjhanteti tasmiṃyeva
analyzed: na kālatthā iti āha yasmai tam maññati iti tāvat eva dve gāvaḥ yujjhanta iti tasmiṃya eva

original: khaṇe dvīsu goṇesu yujjhantesu.
analyzed: khaṇe dvīsu goṇesu yujjhantesu
translated: are fighting.🔽There is no other meaning higher than patience. Immediately after the🔽harm has been done, the harm is averted and the harm is removed. Because

original: Khantito uttaritaro añño attho na vijjati anantareva assa virodhaṃ anatthaṃ paṭibāhitvā🔽diṭṭhadhammikassa ceva samparāyikassa ca saṃvidhānato. Taṃ khantiṃ paramaṃ āhu seṭṭhabalaṃ
analyzed: khantitaḥ uttaritaraḥ aññaḥ atthaḥ na vijjati anantarā iva assa virodham anattham paṭibāhitvā  diṭṭhadhammikassa ca iva samparāyikassa ca saṃvidhānataḥ tam khantim paramam āhu seṭṭha balam

Because of the connection with the fool, the fool’s power is the power of the fool. Ignorance is🔽said to be the power of the fool. That power is the power of the fool. That

analyzed: virodha paccayam abhibhuyya pavattanataḥ bāla yogataḥ bālaḥ tassa balam bāla balam aññāṇam ti

That ignorance is the power of the fool.🔽That ignorance is the power of the fool. That ignorance is the power of the fool.🔽That ignorance is the power of the fool.
