That ignorance is the power of the fool.🔽That ignorance is the power of the fool. That ignorance is the power of the fool.

original: āha “bālabalaṃ nāma aññāṇabala”nti. Taṃ yassa balanti taṃ aññāṇabalaṃ yassa puggalassa
analyzed: āha bāla balam nāma aññāṇa balan ti tam yassa balanti tam aññāṇa balam yassa puggalassa
translated: That ignorance is the power of the fool. That ignorance is the power of the fool.🔽That ignorance is the power of the fool. That

original: balaṃ, abalameva taṃ paññābalena viddhaṃsetabbato. Paṭivattā na vijjatīti dhammaṭṭhaṃ🔽paṭippharitvā abhibhavitvā pavattā natthi. Paṭivacanamattaṃ pana koci vadeyyāpi,
analyzed: balam abalam eva tam paññā balena viddhaṃsetabbataḥ paṭivattā na vijjati iti dhammaṭṭham  paṭippharitvā abhibhavitvā pavattā natthi paṭivacana mattam pana koci vadeyya api
translated: It is weak, because it is broken up by the strength of wisdom.🔽There is no one who can oppose it and turn it back,🔽because there is no one who can overcome it and make it recede. But if anyone should speak a mere word of opposition,🔽he would have no reason to do so. Showing this, the Exalted One says, “Having overcome and made it recede.”

original: taṃ akāraṇanti dassento “paṭippharitvā vā”tiādimāha. Bālabalanti “paṭippharitvā”ti🔽vacanassa kāraṇavacanaṃ. Tasseva puggalassa paṭikujjhanakassa. Nānattāvitakkanato
analyzed: tam akāraṇam ti dassentaḥ paṭippharitvā vāti ādim āha bāla balam ti paṭippharitvā iti  vacanassa kāraṇa vacanam tassa iva puggalassa paṭikujjhanakassa nānatta a vitakkanato
translated: The words “having overcome and made it recede” are the reason for the words “there is no one who can oppose it and turn it back.”🔽The Exalted One says that the reason is the non-occurrence of the thought of diversity in the person who opposes.🔽The Exalted One says that the reason is the non-occurrence of the thought of diversity in the person who opposes.🔽The Exalted One says that the reason is the non-occurrence of the thought of diversity in the person who opposes.🔽The Exalted One says that the reason is the non-occurrence of the thought of diversity in the person who opposes.

original: ubhinnaṃ atthaṃ. Tikicchantanti anatthapaṭibāhanamukhena paṇḍitakiccakaraṇena paṭisedhentaṃ.
analyzed: attham anattha paṭibāhana mukhena paṇḍita kicca karaṇena paṭisedhentam
translated: The Exalted One says that the reason is the non-occurrence of the thought of diversity in the person who opposes.

original: “Bālo aya”nti evaṃ paññapetuṃ hetuphalānaṃ anavabodhato catusaccadhamme achekāti.🔽Vepacittisuttavaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: bālaḥ evam paññapetum hetu phalānam an avabodhataḥ catu sacca dhamme  vepacitti sutta vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: The Exalted One says that the reason is the non-occurrence of the thought of diversity in the person who opposes.🔽The Exalted One says that the reason is the non-occurrence of the thought of diversity in the person who opposes.🔽The Exalted One says that the reason is the non-occurrence of the thought of diversity in the person who opposes.🔽The Exalted One says that the reason is the non-occurrence of the thought of diversity in the person who opposes.

original: 5. Subhāsitajayasuttavaṇṇanā
translated: The Exalted One says that the reason is the non-occurrence of the thought of diversity in the person who opposes.🔽The Exalted One says that the reason is the non-occurrence of the thought of diversity in the person who opposes.🔽The Exalted One says that the reason is the non-occurrence of the thought of diversity in the person who opposes.🔽The Exalted One says that the reason is the non-occurrence of the thought of diversity in the person who opposes.🔽The Exalted One says that the reason is the non-occurrence of the thought of diversity in the person who opposes.

original: 251. “Chekatāyā”ti vatvā tassa vattuṃ chekabhāvaṃ dassetuṃ “evaṃ kirassā”tiādimāha.
analyzed: cheka tāya iti vatvā tassa vattum cheka bhāvam dassetum evam kirassa ati ādim āha
translated: The Exalted One says that the reason is the non-occurrence of the thought of diversity in the person who opposes.🔽The Exalted One says that the reason is the non-occurrence of the thought of diversity in the

original: Gāhanti laddhiṃ. Mocetvāti yassa puna “coro”ti uttari vattuṃ na sakkoti, evaṃ vimocetvāti
analyzed: gāhanti laddhim mocetvā ati yassa puna coro ti uttari vattum na sakkoti evam vimocetvā ati
translated: They will take up the challenge. ‘Having released him’: if he is unable to say anything further about the other, then he is released in this way.

original: paṭhamaṃ vattuṃ na sakkā. Garūti bhāriyaṃ, dukkaranti attho. Pacchāti “parassā”ti🔽vutto so kiñci paṭhamaṃ vadanto attano adhippāyaṃ pavedeti nāma, taṃ yathāsatti viditamano
analyzed: paṭhamam vattum na sakkā bhāriyam dukkaranti attho pacchā ati parassa ati  vutto so kiñci paṭhamam vadantaḥ attanaḥ adhippāyam pavedeti nāma tam yathāsatti vidita manaḥ
translated: It is not possible to say anything first. ‘Heavy’: weighty; difficult to do is the meaning. ‘Afterwards’: the other,🔽having said something first, reveals his own intention. Then, with his mind informed as far as possible,

original: tassa uttari vattuṃ sakkoti. Tenāha “parassa vacanaṃ anugantvā pana pacchā sukhaṃ
analyzed: tassa uttari vattum sakkoti tena āha parassa vacanam anugantvā pana pacchā sukham
translated: he is able to say something further. Therefore it is said: ‘But having followed the other’s statement, it is easy to say afterwards.’

original: vattu”nti. Api ca asurindena “hotu, devānaminda, subhāsitena jayo”ti paṭhamaṃ vuttaṃ,
analyzed: vattunti api ca asurindena hotu devānaminda su bhāsitena jayoti paṭhamam vuttam
translated: Moreover, the Lord of the Asuras said first: ‘Let there be victory, Lord of the Devas, through good speech.’

original: viseso ca pubbaṃ upanentaṃ anuvattati. Vacasi kusalo sakko devarājā taṃ visesaṃ teneva🔽pubbaṃ upanayāpento upalāpanavasena “tumhe khvetthā”tiādimāha. Pubbadevāti sakkapamukhāya
analyzed: visesaḥ ca pubbam upanentam anuvattati vacasi kusalaḥ sakkaḥ devarājā tam visesam tena iva  pubbam upalāpana vasena tumhe khu ettha atiādim āha pubbadeva iti sakka pamukhāya
translated: And a distinction is followed by what precedes it. Sakka, the King of the Devas, who is skilled in speech, having made that distinction,🔽made the other bring it forward by saying: ‘You are here,’ etc., in the way of a taunt. ‘The ancient gods’: this is a term of praise, meaning ‘the gods who arose in the world before.’

original: devaparisāya loke pubbeva uppannattā “pubbadevā”ti pasaṃsavacanaṃ. Vepacittiṃ sandhāya
analyzed: deva parisāya loke pubbā iva uppanna ttā pubbadevā ti pasaṃsa vacanam vepa cittim sandhāya
translated: With reference to Vepacitti,

original: “tumhe”ti “pubbadevā”ti ca vuttattā “tumhākaṃ tāva paveṇiāgataṃ bhaṇathā”ti vuttaṃ.🔽Gāravaṭṭhāniyattā vepacittino bahuvacanapayogo. Daṇḍena avacāro avacaraṇaṃ daṇḍāvacaro,
analyzed: tumhā iti pubbadeva ati ca vutta ttā tumhākam tāva paveṇi āgatam bhaṇatha ati vuttam  gārava ṭṭhā niyattāḥ vepa cittinaḥ bahuvacana payogaḥ daṇḍena avacāraḥ avacaraṇam daṇḍāvacaro
translated: “You” and “you gods of old” are mentioned, so it is as if he said: “Tell me your own lineage.”🔽The plural is used because Vepacitti is worthy of respect. “Without a track for a staff” : there is no track here for a staff to be placed down.

original: natthi ettha vutto daṇḍāvacaroti adaṇḍāvacarā, sakkena vuttā gāthāyo.
analyzed: na atthi ettha vuttaḥ daṇḍa avacaro ti adaṇḍa avacarā sakkena vuttāḥ gāthāyaḥ
translated: The verses spoken by Sakka are “without a track for a staff.”

original: Subhāsitajayasuttavaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: subhāsita jaya sutta vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: The commentary on the Subhāsita-jayam is finished.

original: 6. Kulāvakasuttavaṇṇanā
analyzed: kulāvaka sutta vaṇṇanā
translated: The commentary on the Kulavaka Sutta

original: 252. Rathasaddoti rathālaṅkārabhūtānaṃ kiṅkiṇikajālādīnaṃ saddo. Tathā dhajasaddo.🔽Ājānīyasaddoti ājānīyānaṃ hasitasaddo ca. Karuṇāsamāvajjitahadayoti pāṇānaṃ anuparodhena
analyzed: ratha saddo ti ratha alaṅkāra bhūtānam kiṅkiṇika jāla ādīnam saddaḥ tathā dhaja saddaḥ  ājānīya saddo ti ājānīyānam hasita saddo ca karuṇā samāvajjita hadayo ti an uparodhena
translated: The sound of a chariot is the sound of the tinkling ornaments such as the net of bells, etc., attached to a chariot. Likewise, the sound of a banner.🔽The sound of a thoroughbred is the sound of the neighing of a thoroughbred. “With a heart that has given attention to compassion” : with a mind that has sent forth

original: paṇāmitacitto. Īsāmukhenāti rathakapparamukhena. Puññapaccayanibbattoti uḷāraṃ suvipulaṃ
analyzed: paṇāmita cittaḥ īsā mukhena ati rathakappara mukhena puñña paccaya nibbatto ti uḷāram su vipulam
translated: a thought of non-harming. “With the yoke-pole in front” : with the pole of the chariot in front. “Born with merit as a condition” : born with a great and very vast

original: puññaṃ paccayaṃ katvā nibbatto. Na sajjati katthaci appaṭighaṭṭanena gacchanto. Simbalivanenāti
analyzed: puññam paccayam katvā nibbattaḥ na sajjati katthaci a paṭighaṭṭanena gacchantaḥ simbalivanena ati
translated: accumulation of merit as a condition. “Does not stick anywhere” : going without striking anything. “In the Simbali grove” :

original: simbalivanamajjhena. Vibhaggaṃ nimmathitanti ito cito vibhaggañceva niravasesato mathitañca hoti.
analyzed: vibhaggam nimmathitanti itas citas vibhaggam ca iva niravasesataḥ mathitam ca hoti
translated: In the middle of the Simbali wood. Divided and churned: divided here and there and churned without remainder.

original: Kulāvakasuttavaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: kulāvaka sutta vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: The commentary on the Kulaṅka Sutta is finished.

original: 7. Nadubbhiyasuttavaṇṇanā
analyzed: nadubbhiya sutta vaṇṇanā
translated: The commentary on the Nadubbhiya Sutta is finished.

original: 253. Supaccatthikoti suṭṭhu ativiya paccatthiko paṭisattu. Gahitosīti devapāsena🔽bandhitvā gahito asi. Baddhova ahosi sakkassa puññānubhāvena. Cetiyarājā kira imasmiṃ🔽kappe tato pubbe kenaci avuttapubbaṃ kharamusāvādaṃ abhāsi, tāvadeva virajjhitvā
analyzed: su paccatthiko ti suṭṭhu ativiya paccatthiko paṭisattu gahito asi iti devapāsena  bandhitvā gahitaḥ asi baddhaḥ iva ahosi sakkassa puñña anubhāvena cetiya rājā kira imasmin  kappe tatas pubbe kenaci a vutta pubbam khara musāvādam abhāsi tāvat eva virajjhitvā
translated: A very great enemy: a very great adversary. You are caught: you are caught by the noose of the gods.

original: mahāpathaviyā vivare dine nipatitvā avīciaggijālānamindanamahosi. Taṃ sandhāya vuttaṃ
analyzed: mahā pathaviyāḥ vivare dine nipatitvā tam sandhāya vuttam
translated: He was bound, as it were, by the power of Sakka’s merit. The King of the Cetiya Shrine, it seems, spoke a harsh lie that had never been spoken before in this aeon. Immediately he was disfigured and fell into a chasm in the earth and became the chief of the flames of Avīci. With reference to him it is said:

original: “cetiyarañño pāpaṃ sandhāyā”ti. Mahāpāpānīti mahantāni garutarāni pāpāni. Tathā hi
analyzed: cetiya raññaḥ pāpam sandhāya ati mahā pāpāni iti mahantāni garutarāni pāpāni tathā hi
translated: “With reference to the evil of the King of the Cetiya Shrine.” Great evil: great, heavy evil. For thus

original: vepacittino sapathakaraṇe nidassanabhāvena etāni aṭṭhakathāyaṃ āgatānīti.
analyzed: vepacittino sapatha karaṇe nidassana bhāvena etāni aṭṭhakathāyam āgatāni iti
translated: they are given in the commentary as an illustration in the case of Vepacitti’s attempt at treachery.

original: Nadubbhiyasuttavaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: nadubbhiya sutta vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: The commentary on the Nadubbhiya Sutta is finished.

original: 8. Verocanaasurindasuttavaṇṇanā
analyzed: verocana asurinda sutta vaṇṇanā
translated: 8. The explanation of the sutta on the asura king Vepacitti

original: 254. Dvārapālarūpakāni viyāti dvārapālākārena katapaṭimāyo viya. Vāyametheva, na
analyzed: dvārapāla rūpakāni viyāti dvārapāla ākārena na
translated: As if they were door guardians: as if they were statues made in the form of door guardians. The meaning is that he should strive and not give up in the middle.

original: antarā saṃkocaṃ āpajjeyyāti adhippāyo. Nipphannasobhanesūti nipphannabhāvena sundaresu.
analyzed: antarā saṃkocam āpajjeyya ati adhippāyaḥ nipphanna sobhanesu iti nipphanna bhāvena sundaresu
translated: Beautiful in their completion: lovely by virtue of their completion.🔽For all things that are not completed are not beautiful.

original: Sabbe hi anipphannā atthā na sobhanti. Kiccajātāti vippakatabhāvena sañjātakiccā.🔽Akiccajātoti asañjātakicco kiccarahito nāma natthi gamanaṭṭhitasayananisajjādivasena🔽uppajjanakadukkhavinodanabhāvato. Saṃyogaparamātveva sambhogāti imesaṃ sattānaṃ saṃbhuñjitabbavatthūni
analyzed: sabbe hi anipphannāḥ atthāḥ na sobhanti kicca jātā ati vippakata bhāvena sañjāta kiccā  a kicca jātaḥ ti a sañjāta kiccaḥ kicca rahitaḥ nāma natthi gamana ṭṭhita sayana nisajja ādi vasena  uppajjanaka dukkha vinodana bhāvataḥ saṃyoga paramā tu eva sambhogā imesam sattānam saṃbhuñjitabba vatthūni
translated: Having work: having work arisen by virtue of their being done.🔽Having no work: there is nothing that is without work, without having work arisen, by virtue of its not having been done. For there is the removal of the suffering that arises by virtue of the act of going, standing, sitting, lying down, etc.

original: nāma pakatiyā virodhasīlānipi asaṃyogena vā asundarānipi, tāni abhisaṅkharaṇapacanasaṃyojanaparamāni
analyzed: nāma asaṃyogena vā tāni abhisaṅkharaṇa pacana saṃyojana paramāni
translated: The highest point of union is enjoyment: the things that are to be enjoyed by these beings are by nature inimical to one another and are not beautiful without union. But they should be understood as having the highest point of union in the act of preparation, cooking, and combining,

original: veditabbāni tathā sati sambhogārahabhāvūpagamanato. Tenāha “pārivāsikaodanādīnī”tiādi.
analyzed: veditabbāni tathā sati tena āha pārivāsika odana ādīni itiādi
translated: because they then become fit to be enjoyed. Hence he said “rice gruel for probationers, etc.”

original: Uṇhāpetvā paribhuñjitabbayutte paribhajjitvāti adhippāyo.🔽Verocanaasurindasuttavaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: uṇhāpetvā paribhuñjitabba yutte paribhajjitvā ati adhippāyaḥ  verocana asurinda sutta vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: The meaning is: he partook of it after having heated it up and then cooled it down.🔽The Commentary on the Verocana Sutta is finished.

original: 9. Araññāyatanaisisuttavaṇṇanā🔽255. Jāmātikā vuccati dhītupati, sasuro bhariyāya pitā, tasmā ime antaravattino dve
analyzed: jāmātikā vuccati dhītu pati sa suraḥ bhariyāya pitā tasmai ime antaravattinaḥ dve
translated: The Sutta on the Forest-dwelling Elder

original: janā sakkavepacittino sujāya vasena jāmātikasasurā. “Ciradikkhitāna”nti dikkhitvā
analyzed: janā sakka vepacittino sujāya vasena jāmātika sasurā dikkhitvā
translated: The two people who are “in-between” are the father-in-law and the mother-in-law. The father-in-law is the mother’s husband, and the mother-in-law is the wife’s father. Therefore these two people, Sakka and Vepacitti, are the father-in-law and the mother-in-law in relation to Sujā.🔽“Long-aimed” means that they have gone forth after aiming at the directions.

original: pabbajitvā cirakālānaṃ vatasamādānavasena ito bāhirakānaṃ pabbajitānanti āha “cirasamādinnavatāna”nti.
analyzed: pabbajitvā cira kālānam vata samādāna vasena itas bāhirakānam pabbajitānam ti āha cira samādinna vatānam ti
translated: “Long-practiced” means that they have gone forth from here, from the world, and have taken up the practice of austerities for a long time.🔽“Go back from here” means: go away from this place where you are standing.

original: Ito paṭikkamāti ito yathāṭhitaṭṭhānato apehi apakkama. Na paṭikkūlasaññino guṇe gāravayogato.
analyzed: itas paṭikkama ati itas yathā ṭhita ṭhānataḥ apehi apakkama na paṭikkūla saññinaḥ guṇe gārava yogataḥ
translated: They do not have the perception of what is unpleasant, because they lack respect for the qualities.

original: Devā hi yebhuyyena “mayaṃ pubbe guṇavante payirupāsitvā tesaṃ ovāde ṭhatvā puññāni
analyzed: devāḥ hi yebhuyyena mayam pubbe guṇavante payirupāsitvā tesam ovāde ṭhatvā puññāni
translated: For the gods mostly think: “We have attended on those who have qualities in the past, and by abiding in their advice we have accumulated merit.

original: upacinitvā idhūpapannā”ti guṇavantesu ādarabhāvaṃ upaṭṭhapenti.🔽Araññāyatanaisisuttavaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.🔽10. Samuddakasuttavaṇṇanā
analyzed: upacinitvā idhūpapannā ati guṇavantesu ādara bhāvam upaṭṭhapenti 🔽araññāyatanaisi sutta vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā 🔽samuddaka sutta vaṇṇanā
translated: We have been reborn here.” They show respect for those who have qualities.

original: 256. Cakkavāḷamahāsamuddapiṭṭhiyanti cakkavāḷapabbatapādasamantā mahāsamuddatīrapiṭṭhiyaṃ.
analyzed: cakkavāḷa mahā samudda piṭṭhiyanti cakkavāḷa pabbata pāda samantā mahā samudda tīra piṭṭhiyam
translated: In the hinterland of the great ocean that girdles the earth: in the hinterland of the great ocean all round the base of the world-sphere mountains.

original: Yatheva sinerusamīpe mahāsamuddo anupubbaninno anupubbapoṇo anupubbapabbhāro, evaṃ
analyzed: yathā iva sineru samīpe mahā samuddaḥ anupubba ninnaḥ anupubba poṇaḥ anupubba pabbhāraḥ evam
translated: Just as the great ocean slopes gradually, inclines gradually, slants gradually, so too🔽the great ocean all round the base of the world-sphere mountains slopes gradually, inclines gradually, slants gradually.🔽In the manner stated there:🔽in the manner stated in the immediately following sutta .

original: yebhuyyena cakkavāḷapādasamīpepi. Tenāha “rajatapaṭṭavaṇṇe vālukapuline”ti. Vuttappakārāsūti🔽anantarasutte vuttappakārāsu. Assamapadenāti assamapadavemajjhena. Evaṃ cintayiṃsūti
analyzed: yebhuyyena cakkavāḷa pāda samīpe pi tena āha rajata paṭṭa vaṇṇe vāluka pulinā iti vutta ppakārāsu iti  anantara sutte vutta ppakārāsu assama padena ati assama pada vemajjhena evam cintayiṃsu iti
translated: In the middle of the forest grove: in the middle of the forest grove.🔽They thought thus:

original: “yaṃ nūna maya”ntiādinā yathā pāḷiyaṃ āgataṃ, evaṃ mantayiṃsu.
analyzed: yam nūna mayanti ādinā yathā pāḷiyam āgatam evam mantayiṃsu
translated: they thought as stated in the text beginning, “What now if we were to … ” .🔽Doer of what is wished for: fulfiller of what is wished for.

original: Icchitakaroti yadicchitakaraṇaṃ. Duṭṭhānanti durāsayānaṃ. Te pana duṭṭhajjhāsayā
analyzed: icchita karoti yat icchita karaṇam te pana
translated: Of the wicked: of those who have wicked intentions.🔽But those who have wicked intentions are opposed to the good,🔽so he said “of the wicked, the opposed” .

original: viruddhā hontīti āha “duṭṭhānaṃ viruddhāna”nti. Pavuttanti bījaṃ sandhāya vapitaṃ.
analyzed: viruddhāḥ honti iti āha duṭṭhānam viruddhānam ti pavuttam ti bījam sandhāya vapitam
translated: Sown: sown with seed.

original: Tenāha “khette patiṭṭhāpita”nti.
analyzed: tena āha khette patiṭṭhāpitanti
translated: Hence he said “planted in the field” .🔽Evening meal: food eaten in the evening.

original: Sāyamāsabhattanti sāyaṃ asitabbabhojanaṃ. Yathāvāraṃ bhakkhitametaṃ devānaṃ viya
analyzed: sāya māsa bhattam ti sāyam a sitabba bhojanam yathāvāram bhakkhitam etam devānam viya
translated: This is eaten by the gods in turn.

original: sukhumaṃ guruvāsañca na hotīti “bhatta”nti vuttaṃ. Gelaññajātanti sañjātagelaññaṃ.
analyzed: sukhumam guru vāsam ca na hoti iti bhattam ti vuttam gelañña jātam ti sañjāta gelaññam
translated: and it is not heavy and hard to wear, so it is called “food.”

original: Vepatīti kampati pavedhati.
analyzed: vepati iti kampati pavedhati
translated: “Has become stiff”: has become stiff with stiffness.🔽“Trembles”: shakes, quivers.

original: Samuddakasuttavaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: samuddaka sutta vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: The Commentary on the Samudda Sutta is finished.

original: Paṭhamavaggavaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: paṭhama vagga vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: The Commentary on the First Chapter is finished.

original: 2. Dutiyavaggo
analyzed: dutiya vaggo
translated: THE SECOND CHAPTER

original: 1. Vatapadasuttavaṇṇanā
translated: THE FOOTPRINTS OF THE ELEPHANT OF VIRTUE

original: 257. Samādātabbato vatāni, aññamaññaṃ asaṅkarasabhāvena pabbajitabbato padāni, tato
analyzed: samādātabbataḥ vatāni aññamaññam asaṅkara sabhāvena pabbajitabbataḥ padāni tatas
translated: Virtue is a “footprint” because it is what is to be gone by in the sense of being gone by repeatedly, or because it is what is to be trodden owing to its being trodden by the noble person himself, or because it is what is to be resorted to in the sense of being resorted to by the noble person himself.🔽It is “a place for the elephant” because it is a place for the elephant of virtue.

original: eva asaṃkiṇṇabhāgāti katvā “vatakoṭṭhāsānī”ti vuttaṃ. Samattānīti puññavisesatāya
analyzed: eva a saṃkiṇṇa bhāgā ati katvā vata koṭṭhāsāni iti vuttam samattāni iti puñña visesa tāya
translated: It is called “the place for the elephant of virtue” because it is the place for the elephant of virtue, taking the parts of virtue as not mixed up with each other because of their individual characters.

original: pujjabhavaphalanibbattanena kittisaññānena ca samaṃ attāni samattāni. Paripuṇṇānīti
analyzed: pujja bhava phala nibbattanena kitti saññānena ca samam attāni samattāni paripuṇṇāni iti
translated: “Complete”: with themselves complete, with themselves fulfilled, by the fulfilment of the distinction of merit and by the production of the fruit of rebirth in the happy destinies and of the name and fame of being virtuous.🔽“Perfect”: fully complete in every way by being without gaps and so on.

original: akhaṇḍādibhāvena sabbaso puṇṇāni. Samādinnānīti tattha sakkaccakāritāya sammā ādinnāni.
analyzed: akhaṇḍa ādi bhāvena sabbasas puṇṇāni samādinnāni iti tattha sakkacca kāritāya sammā ādinnāni
translated: “Well undertaken”: well taken up by being done with care.

original: Mātulānīti pitubhaginī, na yā kāci mātulassa bhariyā kulajeṭṭhakānaṃ adhippetattā,
analyzed: mātulānī iti pitu bhaginī na yā kāci mātulassa bhariyā kula jeṭṭhakānam adhippeta ttā
translated: “Sister-in-law” is the husband’s sister, not just any sister-in-law. The “elders” are the elders of the family.

original: bhariyāpi vā mātulasambandhato gahetabbā, tathā sati mahāpitubhariyādīnampi saṅgaho daṭṭhabbo.🔽Ādi-saddena jeṭṭhabhaginīnaṃ saṅgaho. Apacitikārakoti tesaṃ paccuṭṭhānakaro. Yo koci
analyzed: bhariyā api vā mātula sambandhataḥ gahetabbā tathā sati mahā pitu bhariyā ādīnam pi saṅgahaḥ daṭṭhabbo  ādi saddena jeṭṭha bhaginīnam saṅgahaḥ tesam paccuṭṭhāna karaḥ yaḥ koci
translated: Or a wife can be taken from the mother’s side. If so, then the mother’s brother’s wife and so on should be included.🔽The word “and so on” includes the elder sister.🔽He is a doer of services to them.

original: dadantopi sāpekkho deti, so muttacāgo na hoti, ayaṃ pana na evanti “muttacāgo hotī”ti🔽vuttaṃ. Vissaṭṭhacāgoti nirapekkhapariccāgoti attho. Yathā pāṇātipātabahulo “lohitapāṇī”ti
analyzed: dadantaḥ api sa apekkhaḥ deti saḥ mutta cāgaḥ na hoti ayam pana na mutta cāgaḥ hoti iti  vuttam vissaṭṭha cāgaḥ ti nirapekkha pariccāgaḥ ti atthaḥ yathā pāṇātipāta bahulaḥ lohita pāṇī iti
translated: Even though he gives, if he gives with expectation, he is not a free giver. But this one is not like that. So it is said: “He is a free giver.”🔽He is a generous giver: the meaning is, he gives without expectation.🔽Just as one who kills much living beings is called “blood-handed,” so one who gives much is called “open-handed.”

original: vuccati, tathā dānabahulo “payatapāṇī”ti vuttoti āha “deyyadhammadānatthāya sadā
analyzed: vuccati tathā dāna bahulaḥ payata pāṇī iti vuttaḥ iti āha deyya dhamma dāna atthāya sadā
translated: So it is said: “His hand is ever open,🔽for the sake of giving gifts.”

original: dhotahattho”ti. Vossaggaratoti deyyadhammassa pariccajane abhirato. Parehi yācitabbārahoti
analyzed: dhotahatthaḥ ti vossagga rataḥ ati deyya dhammassa pariccajane abhirataḥ parehi yācitabbā raho ti
translated: He delights in relinquishing: he delights in giving up what should be given.

original: parehi yācituṃ yutto icchitassa atthassa tāvadeva vissajjanato. Dāneneva yuttoti
analyzed: parehi yācitum yuttaḥ icchitassa atthassa tāvat eva vissajjanataḥ dānena iva yuttaḥ ti
translated: He is worthy to be asked by others: he is fit to be asked by others, because he immediately gives what is wanted.🔽He is devoted to giving:🔽he is devoted to giving at all times, because he gives great gifts frequently.

original: sabbakālaṃ dāneneva yutto abhiṇhaṃ pavattamahādānattā. Dāne ca saṃvibhāge cāti parassa
analyzed: sabbakālam dānena iva yuttaḥ abhiṇham pavatta mahā dāna ttā dāne ca saṃvibhāge ca ati parassa
translated: In giving and in sharing:

original: sampuṇṇaṃ katvā pariccajanasaṅkhāte dāne ca attanā paribhuñjitabbato saṃvibhajanasaṅkhāte
analyzed: sampuṇṇam katvā pariccajana saṅkhāte dāne ca attanā paribhuñjitabbato saṃvibhajana saṅkhāte
translated: and in giving and in sharing, which is called “giving away” and “using oneself” and “sharing with others” respectively.

original: saṃvibhāge ca rato abhirato.
analyzed: saṃvibhāge ca rataḥ abhirataḥ
translated: He is devoted, he is intent, on these.

original: Vatapadasuttavaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: vatapada sutta vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: The commentary on the Vatapada Sutta is finished.

original: 2. Sakkanāmasuttavaṇṇanā
analyzed: sakka nāma sutta vaṇṇanā
translated: The commentary on the Sakkanāma Sutta

original: 258. Manussabhūtoti manussesu bhūto, manussattaṃ vā patto. Āvasathanti nivāsaṭṭhānaṃ
analyzed: manussa bhūtaḥ ti manussesu bhūtaḥ manussa ttam vā pattaḥ āvasatham ti nivāsa ṭṭhānam
translated: As a human being: as one who has become a human being, or as one who has attained human status. Dwelling: a place of residence.

original: kāretvā adāsi, tasmā vāsaṃ adāsīti vāsavo. Attha-saddo idha kāraṇapariyāyoti āha
analyzed: kāretvā adāsi tasmai vāsam adāsi iti vāsavaḥ attha saddaḥ idha kāraṇa pariyāyaḥ ti āha
translated: he gave a dwelling, thus he is Vāsava. The word attha here is a reason, he said

original: “sahassampi kāraṇāna”nti. Svāyamattho heṭṭhā vibhāvitova. Vinicchinati, tasmā sahassaṃ🔽paññāakkhīni etassāti sahassakkho. Maghaṃ vuccati dhanaṃ, taṃ pana saddhāsaṅkhātaṃ
analyzed: sahassam pi svāyamatthaḥ heṭṭhā vibhāvitaḥ uva vinicchinati tasmā sahassam  paññā akkhīni etassa ati sahassakkhaḥ magham vuccati dhanam tam pana saddhā saṅkhātam
translated: “a thousand reasons.” The meaning of this is analyzed below. He decides, thus he is Sahassakkha.🔽Wealth is called magha. He has that wealth called faith, thus he is Maghavā.

original: maghaṃ assa atthīti maghavā. Pure dānaṃ dadātīti purindado anunāsikalopaṃ akatvā.
analyzed: magham assa atthi iti maghavā pure dānam dadāti iti purindadaḥ anunāsika lopam a katvā
translated: He gives gifts in the past, thus he is Purindada.

original: Puññāni kātuṃ sakkotīti sakko.
analyzed: puññāni kātum sakkoti iti sakko
translated: He is able to make merit, thus he is Sakka.

original: Sakkanāmasuttavaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: sakka nāma sutta vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: The commentary on the Sakkanāma Sutta is finished.

original: 3. Mahālisuttavaṇṇanā
analyzed: mahāli sutta vaṇṇanā
translated: The commentary on the Mahāli Sutta

original: 259. Soti sakko devarājā. Bahuvacane vattabbe ekavacanaṃ vuttaṃ. Vuccatīti vacanaṃ,
analyzed: saḥ iti sakkaḥ devarājā bahuvacane vattabbe ekavacanam vuttam vuccati iti vacanam
translated: Sakka is the king of the gods. The singular is used for the plural. “Is said” is the speech,

original: attho. Tasmā bahuvacaneti bahumhi attheti attho. Yathā paṭipajjanto anukkamena te
analyzed: tasmai bahuvacanā iti bahumhi atthe iti atthaḥ yathā paṭipajjantaḥ anukkamena te
translated: the meaning. Therefore the meaning of “in the plural” is “in the many meanings.”🔽As he practiced, he gradually undertook those

original: dhamme samādiyitvā sakko sakkattaṃ ajjhagā, taṃ paṭipattiṃ dassetuṃ “sakko kirā”tiādi
analyzed: dhamme samādiyitvā sakkaḥ sakka ttam ajjhagā tam paṭipattim dassetum sakko kirāti ādi
translated: dhammas and attained the state of Sakka. In order to show that practice, “Sakka, it seems” is said.

original: vuttaṃ. Anantareti sakkabhāvassa atītānantare attabhāve. Taṃ sabbanti sakkassa maghamāṇavakāle🔽sammāpaṭipattiṃ, tāya sakkabhāvūpagamanañcāti taṃ sabbaṃ. Vutto, tasmā tattha vuttanayeneva
analyzed: vuttam anantare iti sakka bhāvassa atīta anantare atta bhāve tam sabban ti sakkassa magha māṇava kāle  sammā paṭipattim tāya sakka bhāva upagamanam ca ati tat sabbam vuttaḥ tasmā tattha vutta nayena iva
translated: In the next life: in the life next to the life of Sakka. That all: Sakka’s right practice🔽as a young brahmin, and his attainment of the state of Sakka. All that is said. Therefore it should be understood

original: veditabboti adhippāyo.
analyzed: veditabbaḥ iti adhippāyaḥ
translated: in the way stated there. This is the intention.

original: Mahālisuttavaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: mahāli sutta vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: The commentary on the Mahali Sutta is finished.

original: 4. Daliddasuttavaṇṇanā
analyzed: dalidda sutta vaṇṇanā
translated: The poor man sutta

original: 260. Manussadaliddoti manussesu duggato. Manussakāruññatanti manussesu paramanihīnataṃ.
analyzed: manussa daliddaḥ ti manussesu duggataḥ manussa kāruñña tat ti manussesu parama nihīna taṃ
translated: A poor man among men: a wretched man among men. The most wretched among men: the most lowly among men.

original: Manussakapaṇoti manussesu vā paramanihīno. Tasmiṃ ṭhāneti tassa devaputtassa tasmiṃ
analyzed: manussa kapaṇaḥ ti manussesu vā parama nihīnaḥ tasmim ṭhāne ti tassa devaputtassa tasmim
translated: The most lowly among men: the most lowly among men. In that place: in that place of that god.

original: uppajjanaṭṭhāne. Lāmakato cintentīti tassa purimavatthuṃ nissāya hīnato cintenti.
analyzed: uppajjana ṭṭhāne lāmakataḥ cintenti iti tassa purima vatthuṃ nissāya hīnataḥ cintenti
translated: In the place where they arose. Thinking of them as inferior: thinking of them as low, on the basis of their previous state.

original: Kathentīti tameva paresaṃ kathenti. Vitthārentīti vuttamatthaṃ vitthārikaṃ karonti.
analyzed: kathenti iti tam eva paresam kathenti vitthārenti iti vuttam attham vitthārikam karonti
translated: Telling: telling that very thing to others. Spreading: making the meaning stated more extensive.🔽at all times, surrounded by a retinue of attendants,

original: Sabbadā paricchijja parivārasampanno hutvā aḍḍhaṭṭharatane hatthikkhandhe mahaccarājānubhāvena
analyzed: sabbadā paricchijja parivāra sampannaḥ hutvā aḍḍhaṭṭha ratane hatthi kkhandhe mahacca rāja anubhāvena
translated: sitting on the back of an elephant, with the great majesty of a king,

original: nisinnattā janakāyena samullokiyamāno. Avalambantīti olambanti. Vandanamattaṃ vā
analyzed: nisinnattā jana kāyena samullokiyamānaḥ avalambanti iti olambanti vandana mattam vā
translated: was being looked at by the people. Hanging down: hanging.

original: nāhosi, aññadatthu paccekabuddhato attano samānādarakiriyaṃ paccāsīsati. Tena vuttaṃ
analyzed: na ahosi aññadatthu paccekabuddhataḥ attano samāna ādara kiriyam tena vuttam
translated: There was not even the mere act of paying homage; rather, he was expecting the same degree of respect from them as he had from Paccekabuddhas. Therefore it was said:

original: “so”tiādi. Kvāyanti ko ayanti byāpannavasena vadati. Kāḷarattehi suttehi sibbitattā
analyzed: saḥ ti ādi kva āyanti kaḥ ayanti byāpanna vasena vadati kāḷarattehi suttehi
translated: “He” and so on. Who is coming? By means of the state of being spread out, he speaks. Because he was covered with black blankets,

original: vaṇṇavikāraṃ disvā “kuṭṭhicīvarāni pāruto”ti āha. Mahāniraye nibbattitvā mahādukkhaṃ
analyzed: vaṇṇa vikāram disvā kuṭṭhi cīvarāni āha mahāniraye nibbattitvā mahā dukkham
translated: seeing a change in his complexion, he said, “He is wearing blankets made of human skin.” He was reborn in the Great Hell and experienced great suffering.

original: paccanubhoti. Tadanurūpapāpakammassa vipākāvasesena laddhokāsena rājagahe…pe… paṭisandhiṃ
analyzed: paccanubhoti tad anurūpa pāpa kammassa vipāka avasesena laddha ukāsena rājagahe pe paṭisandhim
translated: By the remainder of the result of the evil action that was in accordance with that, he obtained a place and was reborn in Rājagaha … and took rebirth-linking.

original: gaṇhi. Kāmañca ettha paṭisandhiggahaṇaṃ kusalakammeneva, tassa pana akusalakammassa🔽vipākino balavabhāvato vuttaṃ “vipākāvasesenā”ti. Tenāha “gahitakālato…pe… nikkhanto”ti.
analyzed: kāmam ca ettha paṭisandhi ggahaṇam kusala kammena iva tassa pana akusala kammassa  vipākinaḥ balava bhāvataḥ vuttam vipāka avasesena ati tena āha gahita kāla tope nikkhanto ti
translated: He took it. And here the taking of rebirth-linking was due to the profitable kamma only. But it is said that “by the remainder of the result of unprofitable kamma” because of the strength of that result of unprofitable kamma. Hence it was said above, “From the time of taking rebirth-linking … he emerged” .

original: Bhikkhāya carituṃ samatthakālato paṭṭhāya rogassa balavatāya maṃsāni…pe… patanti.
analyzed: bhikkhāya caritum samattha kālataḥ paṭṭhāya rogassa balavatāya maṃsānipe patanti
translated: From the time when he was able to go on his alms round, his flesh … fell off because of the strength of the disease.

original: Ñāṇaṃ pesetvāti vipassanāpaṭipāṭiyā bhāvanāñāṇaṃ nibbānaṃ paṭipesetvā pavattetvā.
analyzed: ñāṇam pesetvā ti vipassanā paṭipāṭiyā bhāvanā ñāṇam nibbānam paṭipesetvā pavattetvā
translated: He sent his knowledge: he sent his knowledge of development, that is, insight knowledge, to Nibbāna, he directed it to Nibbāna.

original: Indriyānaṃ paripakkattā satthu desanāvilāsena sotāpattiphale patiṭṭhito. Cumbaṭanti
analyzed: indriyānam paripakka ttā satthu desanā vilāsena sotāpatti phale patiṭṭhitaḥ cumbaṭanti
translated: He was established in the fruit of stream-entry by the teacher’s skill in teaching and by the disciples’ fitness to receive the teaching. A foot-pumice stone:

original: pādacumbaṭaṃ. Kuṭṭhino hi sakalapādatalaṃ mā rujīti cumbaṭaṃ katvā taṃ pādatale bandhitvā
analyzed: pāda cumbaṭam kuṭṭhinaḥ hi sakala pāda talam mā ruji iti cumbaṭam katvā tam pāda tale bandhitvā
translated: for the leper did not want his whole sole to be rubbed away, so he made a pumice stone by cutting off a piece of the stone, and he bound it to his foot.

original: gacchanti, mattikapātiṃ bhinditvā viya tathā nihīnamanussattabhāvato cavitvā suvaṇṇapātiṃ
analyzed: gacchanti mattika pātim bhinditvā viya tathā nihīna manussatta bhāvataḥ cavitvā suvaṇṇa pātim
translated: He fell away from the state of a man of low social rank, as if he had broken a clay bowl, and he was reborn in a golden bowl,

original: paṭilabhanto viya devattabhāvaṃ gaṇhanto cuticittato dutiyacittavāre ādānacittakkhaṇe devaloke nibbatto.
analyzed: paṭilabhantaḥ viya devatta bhāvam gaṇhantaḥ cuti cittataḥ dutiya citta vāre ādāna citta khaṇe deva loke nibbatto
translated: He is reborn in the deva world at the moment of the rebirth-linking consciousness, which is the second consciousness in the cognitive series that begins with the death consciousness.

original: Maggenāgatāti maggādhigamanena āgatā uppannā. Ariyakantasīlanti ariyānaṃ kantaṃ manāpaṃ
analyzed: maggena āgatā ati magga adhigamanena āgatā uppannā ariya kanta sīlam ariyānam kantam manāpam
translated: “Come by the path”: come by the attainment of the path. The “virtue dear to the noble ones” is the virtue of the noble path, which is dear to the noble ones.

original: manoramaṃ sīladhammaṃ. Ariyānaṃ adhicittaadhipaññāsikkhā viya adhisīlasikkhāpi sabbā🔽ativiya kantā evāti āha “kiñcāpī”tiādi. Imasmiṃ panattheti imasmiṃ sotāpannassa bhavasaṅkhāte
analyzed: manoramam sīla dhammam ariyānam adhicitta adhipaññā sikkhā viya adhisīla sikkhā api sabbā  ativiya kantāḥ eva ati āha kiñcā api itiādi imasmin pana atthe ti imasmin sotāpannassa bhava saṅkhāte
translated: Just as the training in higher consciousness and the training in higher wisdom are dear to the noble ones, so too is the training in higher virtue.🔽“Although this is so”: although this is so, although the five precepts are not abandoned even in the next existence, as is the case with the view of self,

original: atthe niddhāretvā vuccamāne. Pañcasīlampi yasmā diṭṭhi viya bhavantarepi appahīnaṃ.
analyzed: atthe niddhāretvā vuccamāne pañcasīlam pi yasmā bhavantare pi appahīnam
translated: “in this case”: in this case of the stream-enterer, when it is said that he is “freed from hell, the animal realm, and the sphere of afflicted spirits.”

original: Daliddasuttavaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: dalidda sutta vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: The commentary on the Dāliddiya Sutta is finished.

original: 5. Rāmaṇeyyakasuttavaṇṇanā🔽261. Āramanti ettha sattāti ārāmā, manoramā upavanādayo. Te eva cetenti ettha saddhāya
analyzed: rāmaṇeyyaka sutta vaṇṇanā  āramanti ettha ārāmāḥ manoramāḥ upavana ādayaḥ te eva cetenti ettha saddhāya
translated: The Rāmaṇeyyaka Sutta

original: attano pītisomanassaṃ sandhahantīti cetiyāti ca vuccanti. Manussaramaṇīyabhāvassāti
analyzed: attanaḥ pīti somanassam sandhahanti iti cetiyā ati ca vuccanti manussa ramaṇīya bhāvassa ati
translated: Gardens are called “resorts” because beings resort to them, because they delight in them. They are called “shrines” because they attract the faith of people, because they draw to themselves the faith of people by means of their own beauty.

original: manussānaṃ āramaṇīyabhāvassa. Tassa pana sīlādiguṇavasena acinteyyāparimeyyānubhāvatāpi🔽hotīti bhagavā “nāgghanti soḷasi”nti avoca. Acetanāya bhūmiyā ramaṇīyatā nāma guṇavisiṭṭhānaṃ
analyzed: manussānam āramaṇīya bhāvassa tassa pana sīla ādi guṇa vasena acinteyya aparimeyya anubhāva tā api  bhagavā avoca acetanāya bhūmiyāḥ ramaṇīya tā nāma guṇa visiṭṭhānam
translated: and for the delight of human beings. But his virtue and other qualities have an influence that is inconceivable and immeasurable.🔽Therefore the Blessed One said, “They are not worth a sixteenth part.” The delightfulness of the earth, which is insentient, should be understood as due to the use of it by the noble ones, who are distinguished by their special qualities.

original: ariyānaṃ sevanavasena veditabbāti vuttaṃ “idāni…pe… gāme vātiādimāhā”ti.
analyzed: ariyānam sevana vasena veditabbā ti vuttam idānipe gāme vā ti ādim āha ati
translated: Thus it was said, “Now, the Blessed One … in the village of Nadika” .

original: Rāmaṇeyyakasuttavaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: rāmaṇeyyaka sutta vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: The commentary on the Ramaññakasutta is finished.

original: 6. Yajamānasuttavaṇṇanā
analyzed: yajamāna sutta vaṇṇanā
translated: The Yajamāna Sutta

original: 262. Yajantānanti dakkhiṇeyyaṃ uddissa dentānaṃ. Aṭṭhuppattiko suttanikkhepoti dassetvā
analyzed: yajantānam ti dakkhiṇeyyam uddissa dentānam aṭṭhuppattikaḥ sutta nikkhepaḥ ti dassetvā
translated: Yajamānānanti = to those who give gifts to those worthy of gifts. The sutta is introduced by the story of the origin of the eight.

original: atthavaṇṇanaṃ kātuṃ “tadā kirā”tiādi vuttaṃ. Agganti seṭṭhaṃ. Tehi tehi vā yathāladdhasappiādayo
analyzed: attha vaṇṇanam kātum tadā kirāti ādi vuttam aggam ti seṭṭham tehi tehi vā yathā laddha sappi ādayaḥ
translated: To explain the meaning, it is said, “At that time” and so on. Agganti = the best. Or, let the ghee, etc., which have been obtained in one way or another,

original: mā nassantu, aggabhāvena gahitāni sappiādīni kevalaṃ aggimhi jhāpanena, devā manussā
analyzed: mā nassantu agga bhāvena gahitāni sappi ādīni kevalam aggimhi jhāpanena devāḥ manussā
translated: not be lost. The ghee, etc., which have been taken as the best, are merely burned in the fire. Let the gods and men

original: micchāgāhena mā nassantu. Takkenāti takkamattena. “Kathemā”ti amhe maññatha, idāni
analyzed: micchāgāhena mā nassantu takkena ati takka mattena kathema ati amhe maññatha idāni
translated: not be lost through wrong conduct. Takkenāti = by mere calculation. “Kathemā”ti = how do you think? Now,

original: passatha, paccakkhato ayaṃ vo…pe… āgacchatīti āhaṃsūti yojanā.
analyzed: passatha paccakkhataḥ ayam vope āgacchati iti āhaṃsu iti yojanā
translated: They said: “You see, this is coming to you face to face. ” The construction is as stated.

original: Upadhivipākanti upadhīsu vā vipaccati, upadhayo vā vipākā etassāti upadhivipākaṃ.
analyzed: upadhi vipākam ti upadhīsu vā vipaccati upadhayaḥ vā vipākāḥ etassa ati upadhi vipākam
translated: The result of clinging: it ripens in the case of clinging or it is a result of clinging.

original: Vipphāravantaṃ hoti vipulapakkhatāya. Bhikkhusaṅghassa adaṃsu “sammāsambuddhena mahābrahmunā
analyzed: vipphāravantam hoti vipula pakkha tāya bhikkhu saṅghassa sammāsambuddhena mahābrahmunā
translated: It is extensive because of its wide wings. They gave it to the Community of Bhikkhus, saying: “The Fully Enlightened One and Great Brahma

original: ca evaṃ ovādo dinno”ti.
analyzed: ca evam ovādaḥ
translated: have given this advice.”

original: Yajamānasuttavaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: yajamāna sutta vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: The commentary on the Yajamāna Sutta is ended.

original: 7. Buddhavandanāsuttavaṇṇanā
analyzed: buddha vandanā sutta vaṇṇanā
translated: The Buddha-vandana Sutta

original: 263. Uṭṭhahāti uṭṭhānaṃ kāyikavīriyaṃ karohi. Tenāha “vicara, loke”ti. Cetasikavīriyaṃ
analyzed: uṭṭhaha ati uṭṭhānam kāyika vīriyam karohi tena āha vicara loka iti cetasika vīriyam
translated: “Rise up” means: make effort, bodily energy. Therefore it is said: “Move about in the world.” But mental energy🔽has already been brought to the fore by the Blessed One. Therefore it is said: “Having won the battle.”

original: pana bhagavatā matthakaṃ pāpitameva. Tenāha “vijitasaṅgāmā”ti. Dvādasayojanikassa
analyzed: pana bhagavatā matthakam pāpitam eva tena āha vijita saṅgāmā ati dvādasa yojanikassa
translated: The world-sphere stands above twelve leagues. But it extends

original: uccabhāvena. Vitthārato pana āyāmato ca anekayojanasatasahassaparimāṇacakkavāḷaṃ
analyzed: ucca bhāvena vitthārato pana āyāmato ca aneka yojana sata sahassa parimāṇa cakkavāḷam
translated: beyond the world-sphere, which is many hundreds of thousands of leagues in breadth and length.

original: atibyāpetvā ṭhitassa. Pannabhārāti pātitabhāra. Nikkhepitabbato bhārāti āha “oropitakhandhā”tiādi.
analyzed: ati byāpetvā ṭhitassa panna bhāra ati pātita bhāra nikkhepitabbataḥ bhāra ati āha oropita khandha atiādi
translated: “Having laid down the burden” means: having put down the burden. The burden is what should be put down. Therefore it is said: “Having lowered the aggregates” and so on.

original: Te hi taṃsamaṅgino puggalassa sampātanaṭṭhena bhārā nāma. Vuttañhetaṃ “bhārā have
analyzed: te hi tad samaṅginaḥ puggalassa sampātana ṭṭhena bhārāḥ nāma vuttam ha etam bhārāḥ have
translated: for they are a burden in the sense of being a burden to the person who possesses them. It is said, “The five aggregates are a burden indeed” . And the defilements and the formations are a part of that burden.

original: pañcakkhandhā”ti. Tadekadesā ca kilesābhisaṅkhārā. Pannarasāya puṇṇamāya rattinti
analyzed: pañca kkhandhā ati tad eka desā ca kilesa abhisaṅkhārā pannarasāya puṇṇamāya
translated: On the night of the full moon of the fifteenth:

original: yathā pannarasapuṇṇamāya rattiyaṃ paripuṇṇakāle upakkilesavimutto cando sobhati,
analyzed: yathā rattiyam paripuṇṇa kāle upakkilesa vimuttaḥ cando sobhati
translated: the intention is that just as the moon shines forth on the night of the full moon of the fifteenth when it is free from obscurations,

original: evaṃ tava cittaṃ sabbaso upakkilesavimuttaṃ sobhatīti adhippāyo.
analyzed: evam tava cittam sabbasas upakkilesa vimuttam sobhati iti adhippāyaḥ
translated: so your mind shines forth when it is completely free from obscurations.

original: Buddhavandanāsuttavaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: buddha vandanā sutta vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: The commentary on the “Discourse on the Worship of the Buddha” is finished.

original: 8. Gahaṭṭhavandanāsuttavaṇṇanā
analyzed: gahaṭṭhavandanā sutta vaṇṇanā
translated: The commentary on the “Discourse on the Worship of the Householder”🔽Many directions: the four cardinal directions and the four intermediate directions.

original: 264. Puthuddisāti bahudisā. Kā pana tāti āha “catasso disā catasso anudisā cā”ti.
analyzed: puthuddisā ati bahu disā kā pana tā ti āha catasso disā catasso anudisā ca ati
translated: But what are they? He says, “The four cardinal directions and the four intermediate directions.”🔽By mentioning the intermediate directions, he shows that the upward and downward directions are also included.

original: Anudisāgahaṇena cettha uddhaṃ adhopi gayhatīti ca dasseti. Bhūmivāsinoti bhūmipaṭibaddhavuttino.
analyzed: anudisā gahaṇena ca ittha uddham adhas pi gayhati iti ca dasseti bhūmi vāsinaḥ ti bhūmi paṭibaddha vuttinaḥ
translated: Dwelling on the earth: living in connection with the earth.🔽By this he also includes those who live in trees and on mountains.

original: Etena rukkhapabbatanivāsinopi gahitā honti. Cirarattasamāhitacitteti upacārappanājhānāni
analyzed: etena rukkha pabbata nivāsinaḥ api gahitāḥ honti cira ratta samāhita citta iti upacāra ppanā jhānāni
translated: With their minds long composed in meditation: with their minds long composed in access and absorption concentration.

original: uppādetvā aparihīnajjhānatāya cirakālaṃ samāhitacitte. Āpāṇakoṭikanti jīvitapariyantaṃ🔽yāvajīvaṃ. Evamādīti ādi-saddena avasesapuññakiriyavatthūni saṅgaṇhāti. Niccasīlavasena
analyzed: uppādetvā a parihīna jhāna tāya cira kālam samāhita citte āpāṇa koṭikanti jīvita pariyantam  yāvajīvam evamādi iti ādi saddena avasesa puñña kiriya vatthūni saṅgaṇhāti nicca sīla vasena
translated: To the end of his life: for as long as he lives.🔽With such: the word such includes the remaining bases for making merit.🔽With the five: with the five precepts of virtue.🔽With the ten: with the ten precepts of virtue.

original: pañcahi, niyamasīlavasena dasahi. Pi-saddena tato katipayehi uposathasīlavasena aṭṭhahipīti
analyzed: pañcahi niyama sīla vasena dasahi pisaddena tato katipayehi uposatha sīla vasena aṭṭhahi pi iti
translated: With the word and so on he shows that he also means with the eight precepts of virtue, which are a few more than the ten.🔽With those that are proper: with those that are not contrary to the Dhamma.

original: dasseti. Dhammikehīti dhammato anapetehi. Pamukhoti pamokkho.
analyzed: dasseti dhammikehi iti dhammataḥ an apetehi pamukhaḥ ti pamokkhaḥ
translated: With the head: with his head.

original: Gahaṭṭhavandanāsuttavaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: gahaṭṭhavandanā sutta vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: The explanation of the Discourse on Paying Respect to Householders is finished.

original: 9. Satthāravandanāsuttavaṇṇanā
translated: The explanation of the Discourse on Paying Respect to the Teacher

original: 265. Brahmajāṇukoti dakkhiṇajāṇumaṇḍalaṃ pathaviyaṃ ṭhapetvā vandamāno brahmajāṇuko
analyzed: brahmajāṇukaḥ ti dakkhiṇa jāṇu maṇḍalam pathaviyam ṭhapetvā vandamānaḥ brahmajāṇukaḥ
translated: With his right knee-cap on the ground: paying respect by placing his right knee-cap on the ground, he became one who is called “one with his right knee-cap on the ground.”🔽Worthy of sacrifice: a yakkha because he is worthy of sacrifice, worthy of worship.

original: nāma tathābhūto hutvā. Yajitabbato yakkho, pūjanīyo. Evaṃ pūjāvisesayogato sakkoti
analyzed: nāma tathābhūtaḥ hutvā yajitabbataḥ yakkhaḥ pūjanīyo evam pūjā visesa yogataḥ sakkoti
translated: Thus, because of his connection with this special kind of worship, Sakka🔽said, “That yakkha is Sakka.”

original: āha “so yakkhoti so sakko”ti. Sakkassa namakkārabhājanabhūtañhi pucchanto mātali
analyzed: āha saḥ yakkhaḥ iti saḥ sakko iti sakkassa namakkāra bhājana bhūtam hi pucchantaḥ mātali
translated: For Sakka is the one who is worthy of the homage of the questioner, Matali,

original: “ko nāma so yakkho”ti āha. Guṇanemittakehīti guṇahetukehi anantāni hi buddhānaṃ nāmāni,
analyzed: kaḥ nāma saḥ yakkhaḥ ti āha guṇa nemittakehi iti guṇa hetukehi anantāni hi buddhānam nāmāni
translated: Guṇanemittakehi: because of the reasons of his special qualities. For the names of Buddhas are infinite,

original: tāni ca kho sabbānipi guṇanemittakāneva. Anantaguṇattā. Vuttañhetaṃ –
analyzed: tāni ca kho sabbāni api guṇa nemittakāni iva ananta guṇa ttā vuttam ha etam
translated: and all of them are reasons for the special qualities, because of the infinity of his special qualities. For this is said:

original: “Asaṅkhyeyyāni nāmāni, saguṇena mahesino;
analyzed: asaṅkhyeyyāni nāmāni saguṇena mahesino
translated: “The names of the Great Seer are innumerable, because of his special qualities;

original: Guṇena nāmamuddheyyaṃ, api nāmasahassato”ti. –
analyzed: guṇena nāmam uddheyyam api
translated: Because of his special qualities, his name is to be understood, even though it be a thousand names.”🔽Therefore, anomanāma means “the name of one with fulfilled special qualities.”

original: Tasmā anomanāmanti paripuṇṇaguṇanāmanti attho. Samatikkamenāti sammā samucchindanavasena🔽atikkamanena. Kilesārīnaṃ apetacayoti apacayo, so āramitabbaṭṭhena ārāmo etesanti
analyzed: tasmai anoma nāmanti paripuṇṇa guṇa nāmanti attho samatikkamena ati sammā samucchindana vasena  atikkamanena kilesa arīnam apeta cayo ti apacayo saḥ āramitabba ṭṭhena ārāmaḥ etesan ti
translated: Samatikkamenāti: by the transcending, by the complete cutting off.🔽Pacayārāmā: they delight in destruction. Pacayo means destruction. They delight in that, in the sense of being gone to, therefore they delight in destruction.

original: apacayārāmā. Tenāha “vaṭṭaviddhaṃsane ratā”ti.
analyzed: apacaya ārāmā tena āha ratā ati
translated: Therefore it is said: “they delight in the destruction of the round.”

original: Satthāravandanāsuttavaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: satthāra vandanā sutta vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: The commentary on the Sutta on the Worship of the Teacher is finished.

original: 10. Saṅghavandanāsuttavaṇṇanā
analyzed: saṅgha vandanā sutta vaṇṇanā
translated: The commentary on the Sutta on the Worship of the Community

original: 266. Pūtimhi dehe mātu sarīre sayanato, attano eva vā pūtidehaṃ sarīraṃ tasmiṃ ṭhitatāya
analyzed: pūtimhi dehe mātu sarīre eva vā pūti deham sarīram tasmin ṭhitatāya
translated: Pūtideha: because of lying in the mother’s body which is rotten, or because of standing in one’s own rotten body.

original: avattharitvā sayanato pūtidehasayāti yojanā. Kuṇapamheteti ete manussā asuciduggandhajegucchapaṭikkūle
analyzed: avattharitvā sayanataḥ yojanā ete manussāḥ asuci duggandha jeguccha paṭikkūle
translated: and having done so, he interprets the meaning of the words “from the bed” as “from the putrid body.”🔽“These are corpses”: these people are corpses, impure, stinking, disgusting, repulsive,

original: mātukucchisaṅkhāte kuṇapasmiṃ dasa māse nimuggā. Tesaṃ kinnāma tvaṃ pihayasīti yojanā.🔽Etesaṃ etaṃ vihayāmīti etesaṃ isīnaṃ etaṃ sammāpaṭipattiṃ vihayāmi. Idāni taṃ paṭipattiṃ🔽dassetuṃ “na te saṃ koṭṭhe opentī”ti vuttaṃ. Dhaññaṃ koṭṭhe na pakkhipanti pakkhipitabbassa🔽ca abhāvato. Tenāha “na hi etesaṃ dhañña”nti. Paresaṃ niṭṭhitanti paresaṃ gahitaṃ🔽santakaṃ tesaṃ pākāya niṭṭhitaṃ. Bhikkhācāravattenāti piṇḍācariyāya. Esamānā pariyesantā.
analyzed: mātukucchi saṅkhāte kuṇapasmim dasa māse nimuggā tesam kinnāma tvam pihayasi iti yojanā  etesam etam vihayāmi iti etesam isīnam etam sammāpaṭipattim vihayāmi idāni tam paṭipattim  dassetum na te sam koṭṭhe openti iti vuttam dhaññam koṭṭhe na pakkhipanti pakkhipitabbassa  ca abhāvato tena āha na hi etesam dhaññanti paresam niṭṭhitanti paresam gahitam  santakam tesam pākāya niṭṭhitam bhikkhā ācāra vattena ati piṇḍa ācariyāya esamānā pariyesantā
translated: and having done so, he interprets the words of the verse as follows: “In the womb, which is a corpse, that is, a putrid body, these men, that is, human beings, are submerged for ten months in a corpse, that is, in a womb, which is impure, malodorous, disgusting, and repulsive.” He interprets the words of the verse as follows: “What do you desire of them?”

original: Evaṃ pariyiṭṭhena. Yāpenti, na esanti anesanaṃ. Susamādinnasundaravatāti suṭṭhu samādinnasobhanavatā.
analyzed: evam pariyiṭṭhena yāpenti na esanti an esanam su samādinna sundaravatā ati suṭṭhu samādinna sobhanavatā
translated: “I avoid their way,” he says: I avoid the right practice of these seers. Now, in order to show that right practice, it is said: “They do not store grain in bins.” They do not store grain in bins, because there is nothing to be stored. Therefore it is said: “For they have no grain.” “What is taken by others” is what is taken by others, what is appropriated by others. “For their use” is for their enjoyment. “Wandering for alms” is going for alms. “Seeking” is seeking in this way. “Having obtained” is having obtained in this way. “They live” is they do not seek non-seeking. “With what is well-taken and beautiful” is with what is well-taken and lovely.

original: Evaṃ subhāsitabhāsinoti ganthadhuravipassanādhurānaṃ vasena guṇaparimāṇasubhāsitasseva
analyzed: evam su bhāsita bhāsino ti gantha dhura vipassanā dhurānam vasena guṇa parimāṇa su bhāsitassa iva
translated: “Thus speaking well”: they are in the habit of speaking only what is well spoken, that is, of the measure of their own virtue, according to the division into those who bear the burden of texts and those who bear the burden of insight.

original: bhāsanasīlā. Ariyena tuṇhībhūtena tuṇhībhūtā. Tato eva manassa sātisayaṃ samañcarā.
analyzed: bhāsana sīlā ariyena tuṇhībhūtena tuṇhībhūtā tatas eva manassa sa atisayam samañcarā
translated: “With the noble silence”: with the noble silence of the noble ones. “With the mind well-composed”: with the mind well-composed beyond measure.

original: Gahitadaṇḍesu parāmāsādipayuttesu daṇḍādānādihetu uppajjanakakilesapariḷāhābhāvato🔽nibbutā. Tenāha “vissaṭṭhadaṇḍā”ti. Sādānesūti sabhavādānesu. Anādānāti tabbirahitā.
analyzed: gahita daṇḍesu parāmāsa ādi payuttesu daṇḍa ādāna ādi hetu uppajjanaka kilesa pariḷāha abhāvato  nibbutā tena āha vissaṭṭha daṇḍā iti sa ādānesu uti sabhava ādānesu anādānā iti tad virahitā
translated: “With the rod laid down”: with the laying down of the rod, that is, with the absence of the defilements and the fevers that arise on account of the taking up of the rod, such as grasping, etc.🔽“With the fetter destroyed”: with the destruction of the fetter, that is, with the absence of the fetter of the various kinds of views.

original: Tenāha “bhavayonī”tiādi.
analyzed: tena āha bhavayoni itiādi
translated: “With the burden laid down”: with the laying down of the burden, that is, with the absence of the burden of the various kinds of defilements.

original: Saṅghavandanāsuttavaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: saṅgha vandanā sutta vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: The explanation of the Discourse on the Salutation to the Community is finished.

original: Dutiyavaggavaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: dutiya vagga vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: The commentary on the second chapter is finished.

original: 3. Tatiyavaggo
analyzed: tatiya vaggaḥ
translated: The third chapter

original: 1. Chetvāsuttavaṇṇanā
analyzed: chetvā sutta vaṇṇanā
translated: The explanation of the verse “Having cut off”

original: 267. Vuttatthameva heṭṭhā devaputtasaṃyuttavaṇṇanāyaṃ.
analyzed: vutta ttham eva heṭṭhā devaputta saṃyutta vaṇṇanāyam
translated: The meaning has already been stated in the commentary on the Discourse on the Divine Messengers.

original: Chetvāsuttavaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.🔽3. Dubbaṇṇiyasuttavaṇṇanā
analyzed: chetvā sutta vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā  dubbaṇṇiya sutta vaṇṇanā
translated: The explanation of the verse “Having cut off” is finished.🔽The explanation of the verse “The ugly one”🔽Ugly: ugly, unsightly, deformed.

original: 268. Dubbaṇṇo duddasiko virūpavaṇṇo. Okoṭimakoti rassabhāvena avarakoṭimako. Sakkena
analyzed: dubbaṇṇaḥ duddasikaḥ virūpa vaṇṇaḥ okoṭimako ti rassa bhāvena avara koṭimako sakkena
translated: With a flat nose: with a flat tip of the nose, that is, with a nose that is not prominent.

original: gahitanāmamevetaṃ, na pana so tathārūpo koci yakkho. Tenāha “eko rūpāvacarabrahmā”ti.
analyzed: gahita nāmam eva etam na pana saḥ tathārūpaḥ koci yakkho tena āha ekaḥ rūpāvacara brahmā ati
translated: This is the name of a being who had taken rebirth in the Brahmā-world of the fine-material sphere.🔽If that is so, why did he come in such a form?

original: Yadi evaṃ kasmā so tathārūpo hutvā āgatoti āha “sakko kirā”ti. Kathaṃ panettha ñāyati
analyzed: yadi evam kasmai saḥ tathārūpaḥ hutvā āgataḥ iti āha sakko kirāti katham pana ittha ñāyati
translated: “Sakka, it seems,🔽“How is it known that he was a Brahmā and not a yakkha?”

original: “so eko rūpāvacarabrahmā, na paneso avaruddhakayakkho”ti yuttiṃ dassento “avaruddhakayakkhā
analyzed: saḥ ekaḥ rūpāvacara brahmā na pana iso avaruddhaka yakkho ti yuttim dassento avaruddhaka yakkhā
translated: “Yaksas, however,

original: panā”tiādimāha. Devānaṃ vacanaṃ sutvā. Pharusenāti pharusasamācārena. “Ko nāma mayhaṃ
analyzed: devānam vacanam sutvā pharusena ati pharusa samācārena kaḥ nāma mayham
translated: “Having heard the words of the devas, Sakka, thinking, ‘Who is sitting on my seat?’

original: āsane sannisinno”ti akkhantiṃ anuppādento khantiyaṃ ṭhatvā. Balavacittīkāranti garutaraṃ
analyzed: āsane sannisinnaḥ ti akkhantim an uppādento khantiyam ṭhatvā garutaram
translated: without giving rise to anger, remained patient.🔽“Having seen the great honour and respect shown to him,

original: sakkārabahumānaṃ. Nīcavuttiyāti paramanipaccakāre suvūpasamane ca dassiyamāne. Sakkassa
analyzed: sakkāra bahu mānam nīca vuttiyā ati parama nipacca kāre su vūpasamane ca dassiyamāne sakkassa
translated: and the extreme courtesy and humility displayed by Sakka,

original: tāya eva ācārasampattiyā sakkāsane ṭhātuṃ, attano ca āvikātuṃ asakkonto antaradhāyi.
analyzed: tāya eva ācāra sampattiyā sakka āsane ṭhātum attanaḥ ca a sakkontaḥ antaradhāyi
translated: he disappeared, unable to remain on Sakka’s seat and unable to reveal himself.

original: Upahatacittomhīti khantimettānuddayāsabbhāvato parasmiṃ upahatacittomhīti sakko attano
analyzed: upahata cittaḥ aham iti khanti mettā anuddaya asabbhāvataḥ parasmin upahata cittaḥ aham iti sakko attanaḥ
translated: “My mind is disturbed,” said Sakka,

original: sabhāvaṃ vadati. Kodhavase vattetunti kodhena attano vase nibbattetuṃ na sukaromhi,🔽atha kho kodhaṃ mayhaṃ vase na vattemīti adhippāyo. Ciraṃ na kujjhāmīti yadi me kadāci🔽kodho uppajjeyya, taṃ kodhaṃ anuvattento cirakālaṃ na kujjhāmi. Na upanayhāmīti anto
analyzed: sabhāvam vadati kodha vase vattetunti kodhena attanaḥ vase nibbattetum na su karomhi  atha kho kodham mayham vase na vattemi iti adhippāyaḥ ciram na kujjhāmi iti yadi me kadāci  kodhaḥ uppajjeyya tam kodham anuvattento cira kālam na kujjhāmi na upanayhāmi iti antaḥ
translated: He speaks of his own nature. As to “I am not easily angered”: I am not easy to bring under the control of anger.🔽The meaning is that I do not come under the control of anger. As to “I do not keep anger long”: if anger should arise in me,🔽I would not keep it long by following it. As to “I do not admit it”: if anger should arise in me,

original: sace me kodho uppajjeyya, khippameva ca naṃ paṭivineyyanti taṃ me pubbeva vataṃ paripūritaṃ.
analyzed: sace me kodhaḥ uppajjeyya khippam eva ca nam paṭivineyyanti tam me pubbā iva vatam paripūritam
translated: I would quickly dispel it. I have fulfilled that vow of mine.

original: Dubbaṇṇiyasuttavaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: dubbaṇṇiya sutta vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: The commentary on the Dubbaṇṇiya Sutta is finished.

original: 3. Sambarimāyāsuttavaṇṇanā🔽269. Ābādhikoti ābādho assa atthīti ābādhiko. Vācesīti sikkhāpesi. Sambaro nāma asuramāyāya
analyzed: ābādhikaḥ ti ābādhaḥ assa atthi iti ābādhikaḥ vācesi iti sikkhāpesi sambaraḥ nāma asura māyāya
translated: The Sambarimāyā Sutta

original: ādipuriso purātano asurindo. Taṃ sandhāyāha “yathā sambaro”tiādi. Evaṃ paccati aññopi
analyzed: ādipurisaḥ purātanaḥ asurindo tam sandhāya āha yathā sambara uti ādi evam aññaḥ api
translated: “Is ill”: has illness. “Taught”: instructed. Sāmbara was the first and foremost of the asura-māyā-practitioners, an ancient asura king. Referring to him, it is said, “As Sāmbara.” So too, another māyā-practitioner,

original: māyāvī māyaṃ payojetvā. Upavādantarāyo nāma khamāpane sati vigacchati, pākatikameva
analyzed: māyāvī mā ayam upavāda antarāyaḥ nāma khamāpane sati vigacchati pākatikam eva
translated: having employed māyā, deceives. As to “obstruction by slander”: when one confesses, it disappears, and one is as before.

original: hotīti āha “evamassa phāsu bhaveyyā”ti. Tenāti vepacittinā sambaravijjāya adānena
analyzed: hoti iti āha evam assa phāsu bhaveyya iti tena ati vepa cittinā sambara vijjāya a dānena
translated: “May he be comfortable” means “May he be happy.” “By that” means by the deception of Vepacitti through not giving the Sambari knowledge.

original: vañcitattā. Tathā akatvāti isīnaṃ santikaṃ netvā khamāpanavasena kātabbaṃ akatvā.
analyzed: vañcita ttā tathā a katvā iti isīnam santikam netvā khamāpana vasena kātabbam a katvā
translated: “Without doing so” means without doing what should be done by taking them to the seers and getting them to forgive.

original: Sambarimāyāsuttavaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: sambari māyā sutta vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: The commentary on the Sambarimāyā Sutta is finished.

original: 4. Accayasuttavaṇṇanā🔽270. Sampayojesunti aññamaññaṃ vācasikaṃ pharusaṃ payojesuṃ. Tenāha “kalahaṃ akaṃsū”ti,
analyzed: accaya sutta vaṇṇanā  sampayojesunti aññam aññam vācasikam pharusam payojesun tena āha kalaham akaṃsu iti
translated: The Sutta on the Accusation🔽“They accused one another” means they accused one another verbally and harshly. Therefore it is said, “They quarreled.”

original: vivādaṃ akaṃsūti attho. Atikkammavacananti vacīsaṃvaraṃ atikkamitvā vacanaṃ. Yasmā
analyzed: vivādam akaṃsu iti atthaḥ atikkamma vacananti vacī saṃvaram atikkamitvā vacanam yasmai
translated: The meaning is, they argued. “Transgression of speech” means speech that transgresses the restraint of speech.

original: accaye desiyamāne taṃ khīṇayati aññamaññassa khamamānassa khamanaṃ paṭiggaṇhato,
analyzed: accaye desiyamāne tam khīṇayati aññamaññassa khamamānassa khamanam paṭiggaṇhataḥ
translated: Because when the accusation is made, it destroys the forgiveness of one who is forgiving and the acceptance of one who accepts,

original: tasmā vuttaṃ “nappaṭigaṇhātīti na khamatī”ti. Tumhākaṃ vase vattatu, visevitaṃ akatvā
analyzed: tasmai vuttam na paṭigaṇhāti iti na khamati iti tumhākam vase vattatu visevitam a katvā
translated: therefore it is said, “He does not accept” means “He does not forgive.” “May it be in your power” means “May it be in your control, without being disturbed,

original: yathākāmakaraṇīyo hotu. Mittadhammo idha uttarapadalopena “mitto”ti vuttoti āha “mittadhamme”ti.
analyzed: yathākāma karaṇīyaḥ hotu mitta dhammaḥ idha uttara pada lopena mittaḥ iti vuttaḥ iti āha mitta dhamma iti
translated: may you do as you wish.” “The duty of a friend” is said here with the omission of the second part of the compound as “friend.” Therefore it is said, “in the duty of a friend.”

original: Karaṇavacananti “mittehī”ti karaṇavacanaṃ bhummatthe. Tenāha “mittesū”ti. Yathā nibbattasabhāvassa
analyzed: karaṇa vacanam ti mittehi iti karaṇa vacanam bhumma tthe tena āha mittesu iti yathā nibbatta sabhāvassa
translated: The instrumental case is the instrumental case in the meaning of the locative in “with friends” . Therefore he said “in friends” .🔽Just as aging is a change in the individual’s nature as it has arisen,

original: bhāvato aññathattaṃ jarā, evaṃ mittabhāvato vuttavipariyāyo amittadhammo jarāpariyāyena
analyzed: bhāvataḥ aññathattam jarā evam mitta bhāvataḥ vutta vipariyāyaḥ amitta dhammaḥ jarā pariyāyena
translated: so the state of being an enemy, which is the opposite of the state of being a friend, is stated by the word “aging” .

original: vutto. Agārayhaṃ anavajjaṃ sabbaso pahīnakilesaṃ. Tenāha “khīṇāsavapuggala”nti.
analyzed: vuttaḥ anavajjam sabbaso pahīna kilesam tena āha khīṇāsava puggalam ti
translated: blameless, with all defilements abandoned. Therefore he said “a person with cankers destroyed” .

original: Accayasuttavaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: accaya sutta vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: The commentary on the Accusing Sutta is finished.

original: 5. Akkodhasuttavaṇṇanā
analyzed: akkodha sutta vaṇṇanā
translated: The Commentary on the Anger Sutta

original: 271. Kodho tumhe mā abhibhavīti ettha kodhena anabhibhavanīyattaṃ khantimettākaruṇāditappaṭipakkhadhammaparibrūhanena.
analyzed: kodho tumhe mā abhibhavīti ettha kodhena khanti mettā karuṇā ādi tad paṭipakkha dhamma paribrūhanena
translated: Herein, the state of being unassailable by anger is due to the development of the qualities that are the opposites of anger, such as patience, loving-kindness, and compassion.

original: Tathā hi taṃsamaṅgino kodho abhibhuyyatīti āha “tumheva kodhaṃ abhibhavatha. Kujjhantānaṃ🔽mā paṭikujjhitthā”ti. Paṭipadāti esā paṭipatti. Mettāti appanāppattā mettā. Tadupacāro
analyzed: tathā hi kodhaḥ abhibhuyyati iti āha tumhā iva kodham abhibhavatha kujjhantānam  mā paṭikujjhittha ati paṭipadā ati esā paṭipatti mettā ati appanā appattā mettā tad upacāraḥ
translated: For it is those who possess these qualities that anger cannot assail. Therefore it is said: “You must overpower anger. Do not let anger overpower you.🔽Do not return abuse for abuse” .🔽The practice is this practice. Loving-kindness is loving-kindness that has reached absorption. The preliminary stage of that is the loving-kindness that is its proximate cause.

original: mettāpubbabhāgo. Na vihiṃsati kiñci etāyāti avihiṃsā. Karuṇāti appanāppattakaruṇā
analyzed: mettā pubba bhāgaḥ na vihiṃsati kiñci etāya ati avihiṃsā karuṇā ati appanā appatta karuṇā
translated: Non-violence is that by which one does not harm anyone.

original: veditabbā. Tadupacāro karuṇāpubbabhāgo. Lāmakajananti khantiādīsu yonisomanasikārābhāvena🔽gārayhasamācārasamāyogena ca nihīnaṃ janaṃ. Paccayaparisuddhiyā kodho abhimaddamāno
analyzed: veditabbā tad upacāraḥ karuṇā pubbabhāgaḥ lāmaka jana nti khanti ādīsu yoniso manasikāra abhāvena  gārayha samācāra samāyogena ca nihīnam janam paccaya parisuddhiyā kodhaḥ abhimaddamānaḥ
translated: should be known. Its proximate cause is the prior stage of compassion. “Low-born people”: people who are low-born because of their lack of proper attention to patience, etc.,

original: puggalaṃ abhimaddati, tassa so paṭisaṅkhānabhāvanābalehi sammadeva pahātabboti.
analyzed: puggalam abhimaddati tassa so paṭisaṅkhāna bhāvanā balehi sammat eva pahātabbaḥ ti
translated: and because of their association with contemptible conduct. When anger is purified by conditions, it crushes a person; it should be properly abandoned by means of the power of reflection and development.

original: Akkodhasuttavaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: akkodha sutta vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: The commentary on the Akodha Sutta is finished.

original: Tatiyavaggavaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: tatiya vagga vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: The commentary on the third section is finished.

original: Sāratthappakāsiniyā saṃyuttanikāya-aṭṭhakathāya
analyzed: sārattha ppakāsiniyā saṃyutta nikāya aṭṭhakathāya
translated: The commentary on the Saṃyutta Nikāya,

original: Sakkasaṃyuttavaṇṇanāya līnatthappakāsanā samattā.🔽Niṭṭhitā ca sāratthappakāsiniyā
analyzed: sakka saṃyutta vaṇṇanāya līnattha ppakāsanā samattā  niṭṭhitā ca sārattha ppakāsiniyā
translated: which elucidates the meaning of the Saṃyutta Nikāya, is finished.🔽And the commentary on the Sagāthāvagga

original: Saṃyuttanikāya-aṭṭhakathāya sagāthāvaggavaṇṇanā.
analyzed: saṃyutta nikāya aṭṭhakathāya sa gāthā vagga vaṇṇanā
translated: of the Saṃyutta Nikāya, which elucidates the meaning,

original: Paṭhamo bhāgo niṭṭhito.
analyzed: paṭhamaḥ bhāgaḥ niṭṭhitaḥ
translated: is finished. The first part is finished.
